The O
standard O
deviation O
of O
scores O
in O
the O
top O
< O
i O
> O
k</i O
> O
documents O
of O
a O

to O

with O
average O
precision O

has O

Information O
Retrieval O
calls O
for O
accurate O
web O
page O
data O
extraction O
. O

To O
enhance O
retrieval O
precision O
, O
irrelevant O
data O
such O
as O
navigational O
bar O
and O
advertisement O
should O
be O
identified O

prior O
to O

. O

a O
novel O

that O
identifies O
the O
web O
page O
templates O
and O
extracts O
the O
unstructured O
data O
. O

Our O
experimental O
results O
on O
several O
different O
web O
sites O
demonstrate O
the O
feasibility O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
most O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
applications O
, O
Euclidean O
distance O
is O
used O
for O
similarity O
measurement O
. O

It O
is O
adequate O
in O
many O
cases O
but O
this O
distance O
metric O
is O
not O
very O
accurate O
when O
there O
exist O
some O
different O
local O
data O
distributions O
in O
the O
database O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
for O
performing O
accurate O
nearest O
- O
neighbor O
search O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O

Under O
an O
established O
Gaussian O
finite O
mixture O
model O
for O
the O
distribution O
of O
the O
data O
in O
the O
database O
, O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
is O
formulated O
based O
on O
minimizing O
the O
Kullback O
- O
Leibler O
( O
KL O
) O
divergence O
between O
the O
distribution O
of O
the O
retrieval O
data O
and O
the O
data O
in O
database O
. O

We O
compared O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
with O
the O
well O
- O
known O
Euclidean O
and O
Mahalanobis O
distance O
based O
on O
a O
precision O
performance O
measurement O
. O

Experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
function O
is O
superior O
in O
the O
others O
for O
different O
types O
of O
testing O
data O
. O

Extracting O
the O
users O
expected O
information O
from O

collection O

some O

of O
a O

( O

) O

. O

Now O
a O

. O

- O

to O

’s O

. O

of O

. O

that O

equals O
SVM O

but O
, O

to O
SVM O
, O
is O
parameter O
free O

faster O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
introduces O
mass O
estimation O
— O
a O
base O
modelling O
mechanism O
that O
can O
be O
employed O
to O
solve O
various O
tasks O
in O
machine O
learning O
. O

We O
present O
the O
theoretical O
basis O
of O
mass O
and O
efficient O
methods O
to O
estimate O
mass O
. O

We O
show O
that O
mass O
estimation O
solves O
problems O
effectively O
in O
tasks O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
, O
regression O
and O
anomaly O
detection O
. O

The O
models O
, O
which O
use O
mass O
in O
these O
three O
tasks O
, O
perform O
at O
least O
as O
well O
as O
and O
often O
better O
than O
eight O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
in O
terms O
of O
task O
- O
specific O
performance O
measures O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
mass O
estimation O
has O
constant O
time O
and O
space O
complexities O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
response O
generation O
system O
that O
can O
be O
trained O
end O
to O
end O
on O
large O
quantities O
of O
unstructured O
Twitter O
conversations O
. O

A O
neural O
network O
architecture O
is O
used O
to O
address O
sparsity O
issues O
that O
arise O
when O

into O

models O
, O
allowing O
the O
system O
to O
take O
into O
account O
previous O
dialog O
utterances O
. O

Our O
dynamic O
- O
context O
generative O
models O
show O
consistent O
gains O
over O
both O
context O
- O
sensitive O
and O
non O
- O
context O
- O
sensitive O
Machine O
Translation O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
baselines O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Public O
Sector O
produces O
and O
disseminates O
huge O
amounts O
of O
government O
information O
considered O
to O
be O
essential O
not O
only O
for O
its O
proper O
inner O
function O
( O
i.e. O
decision O
making O
processes O
but O
also O
for O
citizen O
transactions O
and O
the O
internal O
market O
. O

However O
, O
the O
access O
to O
government O
information O
is O
limited O
and O
complicated O
due O
to O
the O
lack O
of O
advanced O
information O
systems O
based O
on O
international O
standards O
and O
formats O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
knowledge O
management O
framework O
for O
the O
functional O
improvement O
of O
Government O
Information O
Centres O
, O
which O
efficiently O
controls O
the O
flow O
and O
disposal O
of O
all O
types O
of O
government O
information O
in O
Regional O
Administration O
. O

In O
particular O
the O
implemented O
system O
: O
a O
) O
facilitates O
the O
flow O
of O
information O
within O
multifaceted O
administrative O
channels O
, O
b O
) O
ensures O
thematic O
homogeneity O
and O
interoperability O
for O
accurate O
and O
quality O
data O
/ O
metadata O
exchange O
, O
and O
c O
) O
secures O
efficient O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

the O
paper O
proposes O
RecoProd O
a O
recommender O
system O
which O
uses O
sentiment O
analysis O
techniques O
to O
provide O
the O
best O
products O
for O
the O
customers O
. O

The O
system O
uses O
the O
existing O
product O
reviews O
upon O
which O
sentiment O
classification O
is O
carried O
out O
. O

RecoProd O
consists O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
component O
which O
extracts O
the O
reviews O
from O
the O
ecommerce O
websites O
using O
the O
product O
names O
as O
queries O
. O

Sentiment O
Analysis O
algorithms O
like O
Naive O
Bayes O
and O
SVM O
are O
used O
to O
categorize O
the O
reviews O
and O
opinion O
scores O
are O
assigned O
to O
the O
reviews O
. O

A O
comparative O
study O
on O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
sentiment O
analysis O
algorithms O
used O
is O
also O
carried O
out O
. O

Aspect O
based O
summary O
of O
opinions O
for O
each O
product O
is O
carried O
out O
and O
visually O
compared O
. O

The O
products O
are O
then O
clustered O
and O
the O
optimal O
product O
along O
with O
the O
recommended O
products O
is O
displayed O
to O
the O
user O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
problem O
of O
asymmetric O
information O
in O
electricity O
market O
is O
due O
to O
uncertainty O
in O
determining O
individual O
cost O
functions O
in O
assessing O
the O
participants O
' O
bids O
. O

Individual O
loads O
or O
demand O
functions O
are O
assumed O
to O
be O
known O
to O
all O
participants O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
information O
asymmetry O
, O
it O
is O
proposed O
that O
individual O
generators O
may O
attempt O
to O
optimize O
their O
operating O
profits O
by O
making O
assumptions O
about O
the O
uncertain O
information O
. O

Each O
generator O
selects O
a O
supply O
bid O
curve O
as O
the O
best O
response O
to O
all O
simulated O
bidding O
scenarios O
. O

After O
observing O
the O
actual O
outcomes O
and O
performing O
sensitivity O
analysis O
from O
the O
most O
similar O
bidding O
scenario O
, O
the O
bids O
are O
adjusted O
for O
subsequent O
use O
. O

The O
optimality O
of O
the O
decisions O
may O
need O
to O
be O
altered O
by O
the O
power O
system O
constraints O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
the O
paper O
is O
to O
provide O
a O
possible O
way O
of O
extracting O
information O
from O
the O
bidding O
process O
rather O
than O
analyzing O
the O
strategic O
behavior O
of O
the O
generators O
. O

Information O
about O
the O
social O
networks O
of O
people O
is O
now O
becoming O
available O
through O
APIs O
offered O
by O
websites O
such O
as O

and O

that O

network O
information O

to O

in O

in O

, O

that O

in O

. O

on O

such O
as O

and O

the O

of O

and O

. O

responses O
with O

on O
a O

of O

website O
. O

by O

This O
study O
explores O
the O
benefits O
of O
integrating O
knowledge O
representations O
in O
prior O
art O
patent O
retrieval O
. O

Key O
to O
the O
introduced O
approach O
is O
the O
utilization O
of O
human O
judgment O
available O
in O
the O
form O
of O
classifications O
assigned O
to O
patent O
documents O
. O

The O
paper O
first O
outlines O
in O
detail O
how O
a O
methodology O
for O
the O
extraction O
of O
knowledge O
from O
such O
an O
hierarchical O
classification O
system O
can O
be O
established O
. O

Further O
potential O
ways O
of O
integrating O
this O
knowledge O
with O
existing O
Information O
Retrieval O
paradigms O
in O
a O
scalable O
and O
flexible O
manner O
are O
investigated O
. O

Finally O
based O
on O
these O
integration O
strategies O
the O
effectiveness O
in O
terms O
of O
recall O
and O
precision O
is O
evaluated O
in O
the O
context O
of O
a O
prior O
art O
search O
task O
for O
European O
patents O
. O

As O
a O
result O
of O
this O
evaluation O
it O
can O
be O
established O
that O
in O
general O
the O
proposed O
knowledge O
expansion O
techniques O
are O
particularly O
beneficial O
to O
recall O
and O
, O
with O
respect O
to O
optimizing O
field O
retrieval O
settings O
, O
further O
result O
in O
significant O
precision O
gains O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Bug O
localization O
is O
the O
process O
of O
identifying O
the O
elements O
of O
source O
code O
that O
require O
modification O
to O
fix O
the O
bug O
. O

By O
automating O
the O
task O
of O
bug O
localization O
efficiently O
, O
the O
cost O
of O
software O
can O
also O
be O
reduced O
. O

For O
performing O
bug O
localization O
, O
many O
Information O
Retrieval O
models O
have O
been O
used O
in O
past O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
bug O
localization O
has O
been O
performed O
using O
Pachinko O
Allocation O
Model O
( O
PAM O
PAM O
is O
also O
an O
IR O
model O
, O
which O
falls O
under O
the O
category O
of O
topic O
models O
and O
has O
not O
been O
used O
for O
locating O
bugs O
yet O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
proposed O
PAM O
based O
approach O
for O
bug O
localization O
at O
file O
level O
. O

The O
PAM O
based O
approach O
is O
compared O
with O
LDA O
based O
approach O
and O
it O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
PAM O
based O
bug O
localization O
performs O
better O
as O
compared O
to O
LDA O
based O
bug O
localization O
. O

For O
evaluating O
the O
performance O
of O
PAM O
and O
LDA O
based O
approaches O
, O
the O
datasets O
downloaded O
from O
two O
open O
source O
projects O
, O
i.e. O
Rhino O
and O
ModeShape O
, O
have O
been O
used O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
similarity O
models O
are O
a O
series O
of O
mathematical O
models O
for O
computing O
semantic O
similarity O
values O
among O
nodes O
in O
a O
semantic O
net O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
reveal O
the O
paradox O
in O
the O
applications O
of O
these O
semantic O
similarity O
models O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
is O
that O
these O
models O
rely O
on O
a O
common O
prerequisite O
the O
words O
of O
a O
user O
query O
must O
correspond O
to O
the O
nodes O
of O
a O
semantic O
net O
. O

In O
certain O
situations O
, O
this O
sort O
of O
correspondence O
can O
not O
be O
carried O
out O
, O
which O
invalidates O
the O
further O
working O
of O
these O
semantic O
similarity O
models O
. O

By O
means O
of O
two O
case O
studies O
, O
we O
analyze O
these O
issues O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
we O
discuss O
some O
possible O
solutions O
in O
order O
to O
address O
these O
issues O
. O

Conclusion O
and O
future O
works O
are O
drawn O
in O
the O
final O
section O
. O

. O

using O

. O

article O

DAML O
OIL O
ontology O
for O

System O
is O
offered O
. O

already O

ontologies O
for O

. O

on O

paper O
presents O

’s O
participation O
in O
the O
User O
- O
Centered O
Health O
Information O
Retrieval O
task O
( O

2 O
) O
at O
the O
CLEF O
eHealth O
2015 O

In O

we O
explored O
two O
different O
strategies O
to O

expansion O
, O
i.e. O

based O
on O
entity O
recognition O

] O
and O
the O
UMLS[3 O
and O
a O
second O

based O
on O
disease O
hypothesis O
generation O

self O
- O

resources O

diseases O
and O
conditions O
, O

from O

health O

. O

- O

was O

weighed O

- O

run O
which O
put O
emphasis O
on O

signs O
and O
symptoms O
recognized O
in O
the O
topic O
text O
by O

. O

This O
run O
achieved O
a O
P@10 O
score O
of O
0.262 O
and O
nDCG@10 O
of O
0.196 O
, O
respectively O
. O

a O

field O
, O

informatics O
draws O
on O

range O
of O
disciplines O
, O
such O
as O
computer O
science O
, O
information O
science O
, O
and O

and O

sciences O
. O

can O
provide O

into O
the O

of O

processes O
involved O
in O

in O

. O

represents O
one O
of O
the O
largest O
scale O
and O
most O
sophisticated O
industrial O
recommendation O
systems O
in O
existence O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
system O
at O
a O
high O
level O
and O
focus O
on O
the O

brought O
by O

. O

The O

to O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
new O
approach O
based O
on O
neural O
networks O
to O
solve O
the O
merging O
strategy O
problem O
for O
Cross O
- O
Lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O

In O
addition O
to O
language O
barrier O
issues O
in O
CLIR O
systems O
, O
how O
to O
merge O
a O
ranked O
list O
that O
contains O
documents O
in O
different O
languages O
from O
several O
text O
collections O
is O
also O
critical O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
merging O
strategy O
based O
on O
competitive O
learning O
to O
obtain O
a O
single O
ranking O
of O
documents O
merging O
the O
individual O
lists O
from O
the O
separate O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

The O
main O
contribution O
of O
the O
paper O
is O
to O
show O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
Learning O
Vector O
Quantization O
( O
LVQ O
) O
algorithm O
in O
solving O
the O
merging O
problem O
. O

In O
order O
to O
investigate O
the O
effects O
of O
varying O
the O
number O
of O
codebook O
vectors O
, O
we O
have O
carried O
out O
several O
experiments O
with O
different O
values O
for O
this O
parameter O
. O

The O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
LVQ O
algorithm O
is O
a O
good O
alternative O
merging O
strategy O
. O

We O
suggest O
partial O
logarithmic O
binning O
as O
the O
method O
of O
choice O
for O
uncovering O
the O
nature O
of O
many O
distributions O
encountered O
in O
information O
science O
( O
IS O
Logarithmic O
binning O
retrieves O
information O
and O
trends O
“ O
not O
visible O
” O
in O
noisy O
power O
- O
law O
tails O
. O

We O
also O
argue O
that O

the O
exponent O
from O
logarithmically O
binned O
data O
using O
a O
simple O
least O
square O
method O
is O
in O
some O
cases O
warranted O
in O
addition O
to O
methods O
such O
as O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
. O

We O
also O
show O
why O
often O
used O
cumulative O
distributions O
can O
make O
it O
difficult O
to O
distinguish O
noise O
from O
genuine O
features O
, O
and O
make O
it O
difficult O
to O
obtain O
an O
accurate O
power O
- O
law O
exponent O
of O
the O
underlying O
distribution O
. O

The O
treatment O
is O

- O

, O
aimed O
at O

with O
little O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Classical O
retrieval O
models O
support O
content O
- O
oriented O
searching O
for O
documents O
using O
a O
set O
of O
words O
as O
data O
model O
. O

However O
, O
in O
hypertext O
and O
database O
applications O
we O
want O
to O
consider O
the O
link O
structure O
and O
attribute O
values O
of O
documents O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
pure O
content O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
framework O
based O
on O
probabilistic O
logical O
retrieval O
for O
describing O
the O
retrieval O
function O
for O
a O
query O
which O
refers O
to O
the O
content O
of O
documents O
, O
to O
the O
hypertext O
structure O
of O
documents O
, O
and O
to O
the O
database O
attribute O
values O
of O
documents O
. O

The O
challenge O
is O
to O
find O
a O
retrieval O
function O
which O
yields O
welldefined O
retrieval O
weights O
for O
ranking O
the O
documents O
with O
respect O
to O
a O
combination O
of O
the O
query O
criteria O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
implementation O
and O
evaluation O
of O
our O
approach O
using O
HySpirit O
, O
a O
prototypical O
system O
of O
a O
probabilistic O
deductive O
database O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Finding O
opinionated O
blog O
posts O
is O
still O
an O
open O
problem O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
as O
exemplified O
by O
the O
recent O
TREC O
blog O
tracks O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
current O
solutions O
involve O
the O
use O
of O
external O
resources O
and O
manual O
efforts O
in O
identifying O
subjective O
features O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
and O
effective O
dictionary O
- O
based O
statistical O
approach O
, O
which O
automatically O
derives O
evidence O
for O
subjectivity O
from O
the O
blog O
collection O
itself O
, O
without O
requiring O
any O
manual O
effort O
. O

Our O
experiments O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
approach O
is O
capable O
of O
achieving O
remarkable O
and O
statistically O
significant O
improvements O
over O
robust O
baselines O
, O
including O
the O
best O
TREC O
baseline O
run O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
with O
relatively O
little O
computational O
costs O
, O
our O
proposed O
approach O
provides O
an O

which O
is O
as O
good O
as O
a O
computationally O
expensive O
approach O
using O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
techniques O
. O

. O

. O

, O

are O
alternations O
of O

common O
deep O
structure O
[ O

] O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
enormous O
growth O
of O
internet O
and O
its O
global O
use O
, O
users O
find O
it O
difficult O
to O
extract O
meaningful O
information O
from O
it O
. O

To O
overcome O
this O
problem O
, O
semantics O
methods O
for O
retrieval O
of O
required O
data O
are O
being O
studied O
. O

This O
research O
paper O
explores O
the O
possibility O
of O
extracting O
semantic O
based O
retrieval O
of O
information O
. O

First O
ontology O
was O
built O
which O
was O
published O
on O
the O
web O
. O

Then O
the O
ontology O
was O
loaded O
to O
MySQL O
data O
store O
. O

Using O
PHP O
language O
information O
from O
this O
ontology O
is O
retrieved O
using O
SPARQL O
. O

WAMP O
server O
which O
is O
a O
package O
comprising O
of O
Apache O
, O
MySQL O
and O
PHP O
is O
used O
for O
the O
process O
. O

This O
paper O
demonstrates O
the O
dominant O
nature O
of O
information O
retrieval O
from O
the O
web O
using O
semantic O
technologies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Content O
- O
oriented O
XML O
retrieval O
approaches O
aim O
at O
a O
more O
focused O
retrieval O
strategy O
: O
Instead O
of O

whole O
documents O
, O
document O
components O
that O
are O
exhaustive O
to O
the O
information O
need O
while O
at O
the O
same O
time O
being O
as O
specific O
as O
possible O
should O
be O
retrieved O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
show O
that O
the O
evaluation O
methods O
developed O
for O
standard O
retrieval O
must O
be O
modified O
in O
order O
to O
deal O
with O
the O
structure O
of O
XML O
documents O
. O

More O
precisely O
, O
the O
size O
and O
overlap O
of O
document O
components O
must O
be O
taken O
into O
account O
. O

For O
this O
purpose O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
effectiveness O
metric O
based O
on O
the O
definition O
of O
a O
concept O
space O
defined O
upon O
the O
notions O
of O
exhaustiveness O
and O
specificity O
of O
a O
search O
result O
. O

We O
compare O
the O
results O
of O
this O
new O
metric O
by O
the O
results O
obtained O
with O
the O
official O
metric O
used O
in O
INEX O
, O
the O
evaluation O
initiative O
for O
content O
- O
oriented O
XML O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
MUMIS O
project O
, O
which O
applies O
ontology O
based O
Information O
Extraction O
to O
improve O
the O
results O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O

archives O
. O

The O
domain O
specific O
ontology O
, O
the O
multilingual O
lexicons O
and O
the O
information O
passed O
between O
the O
different O
processing O
modules O
are O
all O
encoded O
in O

. O

The O

is O

use O
of O

cross O

algorithm O
that O
uses O
the O

from O

to O

integrated O
, O
more O
complete O
, O

of O

material O
. O

Ontology O
based O
reasoning O
and O

used O
to O

and O

annotations O
. O

The O

and O
have O
been O

on O
material O
from O
the O
European O
Championships O
Soccer O
2000 O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Over O
the O
last O
several O
decades O
, O
there O
have O
been O
numerous O
proposals O
for O
systems O
which O
can O
preserve O
the O
anonymity O
of O
the O
recipient O
of O
some O
data O
. O

Some O
have O
involved O
trusted O
third O
- O
parties O
or O
trusted O
hardware O
; O
others O
have O
been O
constructed O
on O
top O
of O
link O
- O
layer O

systems O
or O
mix O
- O
nets O
. O

In O

paper O
, O

evaluate O
a O

of O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O

) O

its O

. O

We O
expose O
a O

in O

system O
as O

: O
it O
fails O
to O
identify O
Byzantine O

. O

, O

security O
and O
performance O
trade O
- O
offs O
our O

require O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Automatic O
Speech O
Recognition O
is O
an O
area O
which O
requires O
a O
large O
amount O
of O
training O
data O
. O

Collecting O
such O
quantities O
of O
data O
involves O
significant O
time O
and O
cost O
owing O
to O
the O
tedious O
nature O
of O
collecting O
speech O
recordings O
and O
manual O
nature O
of O
transcribing O
it O
. O

For O
a O
low O
resourced O
language O
such O
as O
Sinhala O
, O
collecting O
a O
sufficient O
data O
set O
is O
a O
major O
problem O
. O

To O
address O
this O
issue O
we O
used O
the O
Active O
Learning O
technique O
from O
the O
Machine O
Learning O
paradigm O
which O
is O
applied O
to O
many O
tasks O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Our O
experiment O
using O
a O
simple O
Sinhala O
speech O
corpus O
shows O
that O
through O
the O
use O
of O
Active O
Learning O
, O
the O
amount O
of O
utterances O
that O
need O
to O
be O
transcribed O
can O
be O
reduced O
by O
some O
42 O
% O
to O
achieve O
the O
same O
accuracy O
as O
using O
the O
whole O
data O
set O
without O
such O
a O
strategy O
. O

This O
suggests O
that O
Active O
Learning O
techniques O
can O
be O
successfully O
applied O
to O
make O
optimal O
use O
of O
scarce O
resources O
for O
speech O
recognition O
for O
new O
languages O
. O

Mobile O
users O
have O
the O
capability O
of O
accessing O
information O
anywhere O
at O
anytime O
with O
the O
introduction O
of O
mobile O
web O
search O
. O

However O
, O
they O
still O
need O
to O
devote O
time O
and O
effort O
in O
order O
to O
retrieve O
relevant O
information O
in O
mobile O
devices O
. O

Conversely O
, O
context O
is O
proposed O
to O
reduce O
users O
time O
and O
effort O
. O

The O
recognition O
of O
context O
is O
supported O
by O
the O
availability O
of O
embedded O
sensors O
in O
mobile O
devices O
. O

In O
this O
study O
, O
the O
context O
acquisition O
and O
utilization O
for O
mobile O
information O
retrieval O
are O
proposed O
. O

The O
x201C;just O
- O
in O
- O
time&#x201D O
; O
approach O
is O
exploited O
in O
which O
the O
relevant O
information O
is O
retrieved O
without O
the O
user O
requesting O
it O
. O

This O
will O
reduce O
the O
mobile O
user O
's O
effort O
, O
time O
and O
interaction O
and O
present O
the O
relevant O
information O
to O
the O
user O
in O
the O
right O
time O
and O
at O
the O
right O
place O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
use O
of O
structured O
documents O
following O
XML O
representation O
allows O
us O
to O
create O
content O
and O
structure O
( O
CAS O
) O
queries O
which O
are O
more O
specific O
for O
the O
user O
’s O
needs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
are O
going O
to O
study O
how O
to O
enrich O
this O
kind O
of O
queries O
with O
the O
user O
feedback O
in O
order O
to O
get O
results O
closer O
to O
their O
needs O
. O

More O
formally O
, O
we O
are O
considering O
how O
to O
perform O
Relevance O
Feedback O
( O
RF O
) O
for O
CAS O
queries O
in O
XML O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Our O
approach O
maintains O
the O
same O
structural O
constraints O
but O
expands O
the O
content O
of O
the O
queries O
by O
adding O
new O
keywords O
to O
the O
original O
CAS O
query O
. O

These O
new O
terms O
are O
selected O
by O
considering O
their O
presence O
/ O
absence O
in O
the O
jugded O
units O
. O

This O
RF O
method O
is O
integrated O
in O
a O
XML O
- O
based O
search O
engine O
and O
evaluated O
with O
the O
INEX O
2006 O
and O
INEX O
2007 O
collections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
selection O
of O
documents O
relevant O
to O
a O
query O
. O

Inverted O
index O
is O
the O
conventional O
way O
to O
store O
the O
index O
of O
the O
collection O
. O

Because O
of O
the O
large O
amounts O
of O
data O
, O
compression O
techniques O
are O
commonly O
used O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
to O
reduce O
the O
size O
of O
the O
inverted O
index O
. O

We O
experimentally O
evaluate O
the O
result O
of O
the O
mapping O
of O
such O
techniques O
on O
the O
Compressed O
Sparse O
Row O
( O
CSR O
) O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
Our O
experimental O
results O
, O
using O
some O
of O
these O
compression O
techniques O
such O
Elais O
Gamma O
, O
Golomb O
, O
Interpolative O
, O
and O
fixed O
length O
Byte O
- O
Aligned O
, O
demonstrate O
that O
such O
techniques O
can O
easily O
be O
applied O
to O
compress O
the O
index O
in O
CSR O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
information O
retrieval O
, O
learning O
to O
rank O
constructs O
a O
machine O
- O
based O
ranking O
model O
which O
given O
a O
query O
, O
sorts O
the O
search O
results O
by O
their O
degree O
of O
relevance O
or O
importance O
to O
the O
query O
. O

Neural O
networks O
have O
been O
successfully O
applied O
to O
this O
problem O
, O
and O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
attention O
- O
based O
deep O
neural O
network O
which O
better O
incorporates O
different O
embeddings O
of O
the O
queries O
and O
search O
results O
with O
an O
attention O
- O
based O
mechanism O
. O

This O
model O
also O
applies O
a O
decoder O
mechanism O
to O
learn O
the O
ranks O
of O
the O
search O
results O
in O
a O
listwise O
fashion O
. O

The O
embeddings O
are O
trained O
with O
convolutional O
neural O
networks O
or O
the O
word2vec O
model O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
performance O
of O
this O
model O
with O
image O
retrieval O
and O
text O
querying O
data O
sets O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
approached O
the O
problem O
as O
learning O
how O
to O
order O
documents O
by O
estimated O
relevance O
with O
respect O
to O
a O
user O
query O
. O

Our O
support O
vector O
machines O
based O
classifier O
learns O
from O
the O
relevance O
judgments O
available O
with O
the O
standard O
test O
collections O
and O
generalizes O
to O
new O
, O
previously O
unseen O
queries O
. O

For O
this O
, O
we O
have O
designed O
a O
representation O
scheme O
, O
which O
is O
based O
on O
the O
discrete O
representation O
of O
the O
local O
( O
lw O
) O
and O
global O
( O
gw O
) O
weighting O
functions O
, O
thus O
is O
capable O
of O
reproducing O
and O
enhancing O
the O
properties O
of O
such O
popular O
ranking O
functions O
as O
tf.idf O
, O
BM25 O
or O
those O
based O
on O
language O
models O
. O

Our O
tests O
with O
the O
standard O
test O
collections O
have O
demonstrated O
the O
capability O
of O
our O
approach O
to O
achieve O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
best O
known O
scoring O
functions O
solely O
from O
the O
labeled O
examples O
and O
without O
taking O
advantage O
of O
knowing O
those O
functions O
or O

to O

- O
of O
- O

language O

semantic O
information O

of O
concepts O
and O
relations O

This O
paper O
presents O
UOWD O
- O
Sharif O
team O
’s O
approach O
for O
XML O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
approach O
is O
an O
extension O
of O
PLIR O
which O
is O
an O
experimental O
knowledge O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

This O
system O
like O

utilizes O
plausible O
inferences O
to O
first O
infer O
the O
relevance O
of O
sentences O
in O
XML O
documents O
and O
then O
propagates O
the O
relevance O
to O
the O
other O
textual O
units O
in O
the O
document O
tree O
. O

Two O
approaches O
have O
been O
used O
for O
propagation O
of O
confidence O
. O

The O
first O
approach O
labeled O
“ O
propagate O
- O
DS O
” O
first O
propagates O
the O
confidence O
from O
sentences O
to O
upper O
elements O
and O
then O
combines O
these O
evidences O
by O
applying O
Dempster O
- O
Shafer O
theory O
of O
evidence O
to O
estimate O
the O
confidence O
in O
that O
element O
. O

The O
second O
approach O

DS O
- O
propagate O
” O
first O
applies O
the O
Dempster O
- O
Shafer O
theory O
of O
evidence O
to O
combine O
the O
evidences O
and O
then O
propagates O
the O
combined O
confidence O
to O
the O
parent O
element O
. O

The O
second O
approach O
performs O
relatively O
better O
than O
the O
first O
approach O
. O

. O

Database O
technology O
offers O

and O

that O

, O

. O

- O

Application O
/ O

- O

model O
. O

- O

( O

) O

- O

. O

p O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

is O
considered O

to O

of O

/ O

c O
- O
means O

-DOCSTART- O

Personalization O
of O
web O
search O
is O
used O
for O
effective O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O

The O

has O

in O
Personalization O

The O

It O

no O

) O

for O

Retrieval O
in O
large O

document O
repositories O

at O
the O
same O
time O
a O
hard O
and O
crucial O
task O
. O

While O

type O
of O
information O
available O
in O
documents O
is O
usually O

, O

play O
a O

that O

with O
in O

. O

. O

in O

. O

Hence O
, O
only O

. O

. O

. O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
retrodirective O
transponder O
based O
on O
a O
novel O
compact O
phaseconjugating O
mixer O
with O
conversion O
gain O
has O
been O
developed O
. O

The O
active O
circuit O
uses O
one O
port O
for O
both O
incoming O
and O
outgoing O
signals O
, O
enabling O
a O
reduction O
of O
circuit O
size O
, O
and O
the O
balanced O
structure O
provides O
suppression O
of O
undesired O
signals O
. O

By O
using O
a O
modulated O
local O
oscillator O
, O
the O
circuit O
can O
modulate O
the O
received O
signal O
in O
order O
to O
retransmit O
local O
information O
to O
the O
remote O
site O
. O

A O
microstrip O
antenna O
is O
integrated O
with O
the O
phase O
conjugator O
and O
the O
whole O
system O
was O
fabricated O
on O
a O
single O
substrate O
, O
enabling O
a O
one O
- O
card O
system O
. O

A O
four O
- O
element O
prototype O
array O
with O
0 O
5 O
array O
spacing O
demonstrated O
excellent O
measured O
retrodirectivity O
. O

Additionally O
, O
a O
simplified O
binary O
- O
phase O
- O

- O

signal O
transmitted O
by O
the O
array O
is O
recovered O
successfully O
at O
the O
source O
location O
, O
demonstrating O
great O
potential O
for O
remote O
tagging O
and O
wireless O
sensor O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Text O
Categorization O
( O
TC O
also O
known O
as O
Text O
Classification O
, O
is O
the O
task O
of O
automatically O
classifying O
a O
set O
of O
text O
documents O
into O
different O
categories O
from O
a O
predefined O
set O
. O

If O
a O
document O
belongs O
to O
exactly O
one O
of O
the O
categories O
, O
it O
is O
a O
single O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
; O
otherwise O
, O
it O
is O
a O
multi O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
. O

TC O
uses O
several O
tools O
from O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Machine O
Learning O
( O
ML O
) O
and O
has O
received O
much O
attention O
in O
the O
last O
years O
from O
both O
researchers O
in O
the O
academia O
and O
industry O
developers O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
first O
categorize O
the O
documents O
using O
KNN O
based O
machine O
learning O
approach O
and O
then O
return O
the O
most O
relevant O
documents O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Language O
modeling O
approaches O
to O
information O
retrieval O
are O
attractive O
and O
promising O
because O
they O
connect O
the O
problem O
of O
retrieval O
with O
that O
of O
language O
model O
estimation O
, O
which O
has O
been O
studied O
extensively O
in O
other O
application O
areas O
such O
as O
speech O
recognition O
. O

The O
basic O
idea O
of O
these O
approaches O
is O
to O
estimate O
a O
language O
model O
for O
each O
document O
, O
and O
then O
rank O
documents O
by O
the O
likelihood O
of O
the O
query O
according O
to O
the O
estimated O
language O
model O
. O

A O
core O
problem O
in O
language O
model O
estimation O
is O
smoothing O
, O
which O
adjusts O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
estimator O
so O
as O
to O
correct O
the O
inaccuracy O
due O
to O
data O
sparseness O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
study O
the O
problem O
of O
language O
model O
smoothing O
and O
its O
influence O
on O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

We O
examine O
the O
sensitivity O
of O
retrieval O
performance O
to O
the O
smoothing O
parameters O
and O
compare O
several O
popular O
smoothing O
methods O
on O
different O
test O
collection O
. O

method O
or O
a O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
reports O
on O
recent O
work O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
that O
attempts O
to O
go O
beyond O
the O
overly O
simplified O
approach O
of O
representing O
documents O
and O
queries O
as O
bags O
of O
words O
. O

Simple O
models O
make O
it O
difficult O
to O
accurately O
model O
a O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
. O

The O
model O
presented O
in O
the O
paper O
is O
based O
on O
Markov O
random O
fields O
and O
allows O
almost O
arbitrary O
features O
to O
be O
encoded O
. O

This O
provides O
a O
powerful O
mechanism O
for O
modeling O
many O
of O
the O
implicit O
constraints O
a O
user O
has O
in O
mind O
when O

a O
query O
. O

Simple O
instantiations O
of O
the O
model O
that O
consider O
dependencies O
between O
the O
terms O
in O
a O
query O
have O
shown O
to O
significantly O
outperform O
bag O
of O
words O
models O
. O

Further O
extensions O
of O
the O
model O
are O
possible O
to O
incorporate O
even O
more O
complex O
constraints O
based O
other O
domain O
knowledge O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
describe O
what O
place O
our O
model O
has O
within O
the O
broader O

of O
artificial O
intelligence O
and O
propose O
several O

may O

We O
perform O
importance O
sampling O
for O
a O
randomized O
matrix O
multiplication O
algorithm O
by O
Drineas O
, O
Kannan O
, O
and O
Mahoney O
and O
derive O
probabilities O
that O
minimize O
the O
expected O
value O
( O
with O
regard O
to O
the O
distributions O
of O
the O
matrix O
elements O
) O
of O
the O
variance O
. O

We O
compare O
these O
optimized O
probabilities O
with O
uniform O
probabilities O
and O
derive O
conditions O
under O
which O
the O
actual O
variance O
of O
the O
optimized O
probabilities O
is O
lower O
. O

Numerical O
experiments O
with O

matching O
in O
information O
retrieval O

that O

optimized O
probabilities O

accurate O
matchings O
than O
the O
uniform O
probabilities O
and O
that O
they O
can O

. O

from O

, O

deals O
with O
existence O
. O

In O

, O

has O
been O
widely O
used O
in O

and O

, O

, O

. O

's O

to O

into O

Information O
Science O
for O
the O

of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Named O
Entity O
Recognition O
( O
NER O
) O
is O
the O
subtask O
of O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
which O
is O
the O
branch O
of O
artificial O
intelligence O
. O

It O
has O
many O
applications O
mainly O
in O
machine O
translation O
, O
text O
to O
speech O
synthesis O
, O
natural O
language O
understanding O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
Information O
retrieval O
, O
question O
answering O
etc O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
NER O
is O
to O
classify O
words O
into O
some O
predefined O
categories O
like O
location O
name O
, O
person O
name O
, O
organization O
name O
, O
date O
, O
time O
etc O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
the O
Hidden O
Markov O
Model O
( O
HMM O
) O
based O
approach O
of O
machine O
learning O
in O
detail O
to O
identify O
the O
named O
entities O
. O

The O
main O
idea O
behind O
the O
use O
of O
HMM O
model O
for O
building O
NER O
system O
is O
that O
it O
is O
language O
independent O
and O
we O
can O
apply O
this O
system O
for O
any O
language O
domain O
. O

In O
our O
NER O
system O
the O
states O
are O
not O
fixed O
means O
it O
is O
of O
dynamic O
in O
nature O
one O
can O
use O
it O
according O
to O
their O
interest O
. O

The O
corpus O
used O
by O
our O
NER O
system O
is O
also O
not O
domain O
specific O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

GeoFEM O
is O
a O
parallel O
nite O
element O
analysis O
system O
intended O
for O
multiphysics O
/ O
multi O
- O
scale O
problems O
and O
is O
being O
developed O
at O
RIST O
. O

Within O
\Earth O
Simulator O
" O
project O
, O
the O
GeoFEM O
group O
will O
deal O
with O
the O
modeling O
and O
simulation O
of O
solid O
earth O
eld O
phenomena O
, O
and O
the O
development O
of O
large O
- O
scale O
parallel O
software O
for O
the O
\Earth O
Simulator O
Since O
there O
are O
models O
which O
are O
not O
completely O
established O
in O
the O
solid O
earth O
eld O
, O
the O
simulation O
must O
be O
carried O
out O
on O
a O
trial O
and O
error O
basis O
. O

Therefore O
, O
a O
joint O
venture O
with O
the O
geoscience O
modeling O
research O
group O
is O
crucial O
for O
the O
development O
of O
a O
targeted O
simulation O
software O
system O
. O

This O
project O
is O
expected O
to O
be O
a O
breakthrough O
in O
bridging O
the O
geoscience O
and O
information O
science O
elds O
. O

When O
complete O
, O
this O
software O
system O
will O
be O
able O
to O
solve O
problems O
in O
the O
scale O
of O
100 O
million O
degree O
of O
freedoms O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
topic O
based O
approach O
lo O
language O
modelling O
for O
ad O
- O
hoc O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
Many O
smoothed O
estimators O
used O
for O
the O
multinomial O
query O
model O
in O
IR O
rely O
upon O
the O

background O

probabilities O
. O

In O

, O
that O
uses O
a O
more O

prior O
based O
on O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O
examines O
and O
extends O
the O
logical O
models O
of O
information O
retrieval O
in O
the O
context O
of O
probability O
theory O
. O

The O
fundamental O
notions O
of O
term O
weights O
and O
relevance O
are O
given O
probabilistic O
interpretations O
. O

A O
unified O
framework O
is O
developed O
for O
modeling O
the O
retrieval O
process O
with O
probabilistic O
inference O
. O

This O
new O
approach O
provides O
a O
common O
conceptual O
and O
mathematical O
basis O
for O
many O
retrieval O
models O
, O
such O
as O
the O
Boolean O
, O
fuzzy O
set O
, O
vector O
space O
, O
and O
conventional O
probabilistic O
models O
. O

Within O
this O
framework O
, O
the O
underlying O
assumptions O
employed O
by O
each O
model O
are O
identified O
, O
and O
the O
inherent O
relationships O
between O
these O
models O
are O
analyzed O
. O

Although O
this O
article O
is O
mainly O
a O
theoretical O
analysis O
of O
probabilistic O
inference O
for O
information O
retrieval O
, O
practical O
methods O
for O
estimating O
the O
required O
probabilities O
are O
provided O
by O
simple O
examples O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
majority O
of O
information O
in O
a O
company O
is O
often O
useless O
or O
not O
equally O
interesting O
to O
everybody O
. O

The O
set O
of O
techniques O
called O
Analytical O
Business O
Intelligence O
provides O
a O
valid O
way O
to O
tackle O
the O
needs O
of O
information O
classification O
and O
of O

extraction O
that O
naturally O
arises O
inside O

company O
. O

This O

a O

to O
make O

resources O
useful O
, O

and O

, O
through O

to O
reach O
a O

level O
of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Document O
representation O
is O
a O
crucial O
step O
in O
any O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
. O

Since O
most O
of O
the O
traditional O
methods O
do O
not O
consider O
much O
of O
semantic O
or O
syntactic O
information O
, O
the O
representation O
becomes O
insufficiently O
informative O
for O
an O
IR O
task O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
incorporating O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
in O
document O
representation O
for O
addressing O
this O
problem O
. O

Use O
is O
made O
of O
additional O
information O
about O
the O
sentences O
, O
viz O
i O
) O
syntactic O
links O
among O
the O
words O
found O
by O
the O
Link O
Parser O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
heuristically O
determined O
semantic O
attributes O
of O
the O
words O
. O

After O
mapping O
this O
information O
to O
the O
document O
level O
using O
Self O
- O
Organizing O
Map O
( O
SOM O
we O
use O
it O
for O
embellishing O
the O
document O
vectors O
constructed O
by O
the O
TFIDF O
method O
. O

The O
efficacy O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
established O
by O
showing O
that O
the O
document O
vectors O
( O
i O
) O
have O
higher O
mutual O
information O
content O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
achieve O
better O
class O
separation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
methods O
have O
been O
largely O
adopted O
to O
identify O
traceability O
links O
based O
on O
the O
textual O
similarity O
of O
software O
artifacts O
. O

However O
, O
noise O
due O
to O
word O
usage O
in O
software O
artifacts O
might O
negatively O
affect O
the O
recovery O
accuracy O
. O

We O
propose O
the O
use O
of O
smoothing O
filters O
to O
reduce O
the O
effect O
of O
noise O
in O
software O
artifacts O
and O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
traceability O
recovery O
methods O
. O

An O
empirical O
evaluation O
performed O
on O
two O
repositories O
indicates O
that O
the O
usage O
of O
a O
smoothing O
filter O
is O
able O
to O
significantly O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
and O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
. O

Such O
a O
result O
suggests O
that O
other O
than O
being O
used O
for O
traceability O
recovery O
the O
proposed O
filter O
can O
be O
used O
to O
improve O
performances O
of O
various O
other O
software O
engineering O
approaches O
based O
on O
textual O
analysis O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
experiments O
carried O
out O
for O
the O
robust O
word O
sense O
disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
) O
track O
of O
the O
CLEF O
2009 O
campaign O
. O

This O
track O
consists O
of O
a O
monolingual O
and O
bilingual O
task O
and O
addresses O
information O
retrieval O
utilizing O
word O
sense O
annotations O
. O

We O
took O
part O
in O
the O
monolingual O
task O
only O
. O

Our O
objective O
was O
twofold O
. O

On O
the O
one O
hand O
, O
we O
intended O
to O
increase O
the O
precision O
of O
WSD O
by O
a O
heuristic O
- O
based O
combination O
of O
the O
annotations O
of O
the O
two O
WSD O
systems O
. O

For O
this O
, O
we O
provide O
an O
extrinsic O
evaluation O
on O
different O
levels O
of O
word O
sense O
accuracy O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
we O
aimed O
at O
combining O
an O
often O
used O
probabilistic O
model O
, O
namely O
the O
Divergence O
From O
Randomness O
BM25 O
model O

( O
DFR O
BM25 O
with O
a O
monolingual O
translation O
- O
based O
model O
. O

Our O
best O
performing O
system O
with O
and O
without O
utilizing O
word O
senses O
ranked O
1st O
overall O
in O
the O
monolingual O
task O
. O

However O
, O
we O
could O
not O
observe O
any O
improvement O
by O
applying O
the O
sense O
annotations O
compared O
to O
the O
retrieval O
settings O
based O
on O
tokens O
or O
lemmas O
only O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
advent O
of O
internet O
, O
there O
has O
been O
tremendous O
surge O
in O
search O
for O
videos O
. O

Research O
suggests O
that O
users O
spend O
a O
lot O
of O
time O
browsing O
: O
viewing O
part O
of O
one O
video O
after O
another O
while O
watching O
only O
a O
few O
of O
the O
videos O
to O
its O
completion O
. O

This O
is O
termed O
as O
seek O
, O
a O
special O
form O
of O
browsing O
repeating O
partial O
viewing O
of O
the O
same O
video O
. O

This O
impacts O
the O
network O
bandwidth O
resulting O
in O
streaming O
issues O
with O
the O
browser O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
devise O
a O
system O
where O
the O
user O
would O
be O
able O
to O
view O
pre O
selected O
video O
sequence O
which O
would O
contain O
parts O
required O
by O
the O
user O
. O

This O
method O
of O
video O
browsing O
would O
be O
significant O
improvement O
over O
the O
traditional O
video O
browsing O
in O
terms O
of O
efficiency O
and O
user O
friendliness O
. O

— O
video O
processing O
, O
frames O
, O
visual O
recognition O
, O
image O
indexing O
, O
visual O
content O
tags O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
being O
challenged O
to O
managelarger O
and O
larger O
document O
collections O
. O

In O
an O
effort O
to O
providebetter O
retrieval O
performance O
on O
large O
collections O
, O
moresophisticated O
retrieval O
techniques O
have O
been O
developed O
that O
supportrich O
, O
structured O
queries O
. O

Structured O
queries O
are O
not O
amenable O
topreviously O
proposed O
optimization O
techniques O
. O

Optimizing O
execution O
, O
however O
, O
is O
even O
more O
important O
in O
the O
context O
of O
large O
documentcollections O
. O

We O
present O
a O
new O

query O
optimizationtechnique O
which O
we O
have O
implemented O
in O
an O
inference O
network O
- O
basedinformation O
retrieval O
system O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
queryevaluation O
time O
can O
be O
reduced O
by O
more O
than O
half O
with O
little O
impacton O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Cross O
- O
modal O
retrieval O
is O
a O
classic O
research O
topic O
in O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
traditional O
approaches O
study O
the O
problem O
as O
a O
pairwise O
similarity O
function O
problem O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
consider O
this O
problem O
from O
a O
new O
perspective O
as O
a O
listwise O
ranking O
problem O
and O
propose O
a O
general O
cross O
- O
modal O
ranking O
algorithm O
to O
optimize O
the O
listwise O
ranking O
loss O
with O
a O
low O
rank O
embedding O
, O
which O
we O
call O
Latent O
Semantic O
Cross O
- O
Modal O
Ranking O
( O
LSCMR O

The O
latent O
low O
- O
rank O
embedding O
space O
is O
discriminatively O
learned O
by O
structural O
large O
margin O
learning O
to O
optimize O
for O
certain O
ranking O
criteria O
directly O
. O

We O
evaluate O
LSCMR O
on O
the O
Wikipedia O
and O
NUS O
- O
WIDE O
dataset O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
this O
method O
obtains O
significant O
improvements O
over O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
. O

ngä O
aho O
whakamäori O
- O
ä O
- O
tuhi O

to O

head O
- O

to O
on O
- O
line O
web O
users O
. O

13,000 O

high O

a O
year O
now O
, O

has O
had O
the O
highest O
web O
traffic O

in O

. O

provided O

up O
- O
to O
- O

for O

contained O
in O

paper O
. O

. O

of O
ldquoenvironmentally O
friendlyrdquo O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
novel O
application O
of O
FPGAs O
for O
the O
acceleration O
of O
information O
retrieval O
algorithms O
, O
specifically O
, O
filtering O
streams O
/ O
collections O
of O
documents O
against O
topic O
profiles O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
FPGA O
acceleration O
can O
result O
in O
speed O
- O
ups O
of O
up O
to O
a O
factor O
20 O
for O
large O
profiles O
. O

describe O

to O

data O

of O

of O

to O

from O

Detection O

their O

in O

, O

to O

This O
paper O

a O
system O
for O
cross O
language O
information O
retrieval O
where O
selective O
term O
technique O
and O
query O
expansion O
will O
be O
combined O
to O
improve O
the O
retrieval O
of O
more O
relevant O
documents O
. O

The O
document O
and O
query O
processing O
is O
done O
using O
the O
techniques O
of O
tf O
- O
idf O
and O
cosine O
similarity O
for O
retrieval O
. O

Threshold O
value O
is O
decided O
to O

to O

. O

Graphical O
models O
have O
been O
applied O
to O
various O
information O
retrieval O
and O
natural O
language O
processing O
tasks O
in O
the O
recent O
literature O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
apply O
a O
probabilistic O
graphical O
model O
for O
answer O
ranking O
in O
question O
answering O
. O

This O
model O
estimates O
the O
joint O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
all O
answer O
candidates O
, O
from O
which O
the O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
an O
individual O
candidate O
can O
be O
inferred O
. O

The O
joint O
prediction O
model O
can O
estimate O
both O
the O
correctness O
of O
individual O
answers O
as O
well O
as O
their O
correlations O
, O
which O
enables O
a O
list O
of O
accurate O
and O
comprehensive O
answers O
. O

This O
model O
was O
compared O
with O
a O
logistic O
regression O
model O
which O
directly O
estimates O
the O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
each O
individual O
answer O
candidate O
. O

An O
extensive O
set O
of O
empirical O
results O
based O
on O
TREC O
questions O
demonstrates O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
joint O
model O
for O
answer O
ranking O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
combine O
the O
joint O
model O
with O
the O
logistic O
regression O
model O
to O
improve O
the O
efficiency O
and O
accuracy O
of O
answer O
ranking O
. O

A O
multimedia O
report O
is O
a O
multimedia O
presentation O
which O
integrates O
data O
returned O
by O
one O
or O
more O
queries O
to O
a O
multimedia O
database O
, O
thus O
extending O
the O
concept O
of O
report O
familiar O
in O
traditional O
structured O
databases O
. O

In O
such O
a O
scenario O
information O
retrieval O
consists O
in O
building O
a O
continuous O
presentation O
in O
which O
the O
retrieved O
data O
are O
located O
, O
connected O
, O
synchronized O
and O
coherently O
presented O
to O
a O
user O
. O

We O
discuss O
modelling O
of O
multimedia O
reports O
in O
terms O
of O
data O
co O
- O
ordination O
and O
synchronization O
, O
based O
on O
a O
synchronization O
model O
we O
have O
defined O
for O
specifying O
complex O
multimedia O
presentations O
. O

As O
in O
a O
report O
the O
user O
can O
browse O
the O
returned O
data O
without O
loosing O
consistency O
, O
in O
a O
multimedia O
report O
moving O
along O
the O
presentation O
time O
requires O
appropriate O
synchronization O
to O
be O
guaranteed O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
improvement O
of O
indirect O
matching O
, O
which O
is O
a O
fast O
CBMIR O
( O
content O
- O
based O
music O
information O
retrieval O
) O
framework O
proposed O
in O
our O
previous O
study O
. O

Indirect O
matching O
achieves O
fast O
retrieval O
by O
combining O
offline O
search O
with O
representative O
queries O
and O
online O
quick O
similarity O
estimation O
based O
on O
the O
results O
of O
the O
offline O
search O
. O

We O
have O
found O
that O
the O
retrieval O
accuracy O
of O
indirect O
matching O
decreases O
when O
representative O
queries O
have O
little O
variation O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
method O
for O
selecting O
representative O
queries O
having O
wide O
variation O
. O

To O
ensure O
wide O
variation O
between O
representative O
queries O
, O
the O
proposed O
method O
combines O
MDS O
( O
multi O
- O
dimensional O
scaling O
) O
and O
Ward O
's O
clustering O
. O

Experimental O
results O
have O
shown O
that O
the O
retrieval O
accuracy O
of O
indirect O
matching O
can O
be O
stabilized O
by O
the O
proposed O
method O
. O

paper O
focuses O
on O
the O
problem O
of O
ranking O
documents O
for O

Retrieval O
. O

that O

using O
some O

- O
related O
example O
texts O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
improve O
the O
final O
ranking O
of O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

Experimental O
results O
indicated O
that O
our O
approach O
could O
improve O
the O
MAP O
of O
some O
sets O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
using O
only O
two O
example O
texts O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
probabilistic O
approaches O
to O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
occurrence O
of O
a O
query O
term O
in O
a O
document O
contributes O
to O
the O
probability O
that O
the O
document O
will O
be O
judged O
relevant O
. O

It O
is O
typically O
assumed O
that O
the O
weight O
assigned O
to O
a O
query O
term O
should O
be O
based O
on O
the O
expected O
value O
of O
that O
contribution O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
show O
that O
the O
degree O
to O
which O
observable O
document O
features O
such O
as O
term O
frequencies O
are O
expected O
to O
< O
i O
> O
vary</i O
> O
is O
also O
important O
. O

By O
means O
of O
stochastic O
simulation O
, O
we O
show O
that O
increased O
variance O
results O
in O
degraded O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

We O
further O
show O
that O
by O
decreasing O
term O
weights O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
variance O
, O
this O
degradation O
can O
be O
reduced O
. O

Hence O
, O
probabilistic O
models O
of O
information O
retrieval O
must O
take O
into O
account O
not O
only O
the O
expected O
value O
of O
a O
query O
term O
's O
contribution O
but O
also O
the O
variance O
of O
document O
features O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Identifying O
the O
most O
influential O
documents O
in O
a O
corpus O
is O
an O
important O
problem O
in O
many O
fields O
, O
from O
information O
science O
and O
historiography O
to O
text O
summarization O
and O
news O
aggregation O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
traditional O
bibliometrics O
such O
as O
citations O
are O
often O
not O
available O
. O

We O
propose O
using O
changes O
in O
the O
thematic O
content O
of O
documents O
over O
time O
to O
measure O
the O
importance O
of O
individual O
documents O
within O
the O
collection O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
dynamic O
topic O
model O
for O
both O
quantifying O
and O
qualifying O
the O
impact O
of O
these O
documents O
. O

We O
validate O
the O
model O
by O
analyzing O
three O
large O
corpora O
of O
scientific O
articles O
. O

Our O
measurement O
of O
a O
document O
’s O
impact O
correlates O
significantly O
with O
its O
number O
of O
citations O
. O

This O
paper O
overviews O
soft O
clustering O
algorithms O
applied O
in O
the O
context O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
First O
, O
a O
motivation O
of O
the O
utility O
of O
soft O
clustering O
approaches O
in O
IR O
is O
discussed O
. O

Then O
, O
an O
outline O
of O
the O
two O
main O
flat O
soft O
approaches O
, O
namely O
probabilistic O
clustering O
and O
fuzzy O
clustering O
, O
is O
described O

Specifically O
, O
the O
expectation O
maximization O
and O
fuzzy O
c O
- O
means O
algorithms O
are O
introduced O
, O
and O
some O
of O
their O
extensions O
defined O
to O
overcome O
their O
main O
drawbacks O
when O
applied O

. O

, O
soft O

algorithms O

for O

of O
documents O
are O
introduced O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
number O
of O
users O
and O
the O
amount O
of O
information O
available O
has O
exploded O
since O
the O
advent O
of O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
Most O
of O
Web O
users O
use O
various O
search O
engines O
to O
get O
specific O
information O
. O

A O
key O
factor O
in O
the O
success O
of O
Web O
search O
engines O
are O
their O
ability O
to O
rapidly O
find O
good O
quality O
results O
to O
the O
queries O
that O
are O
based O
on O
specific O
terms O
. O

This O
paper O
aims O
at O
retrieving O
more O
relevant O
documents O
from O
a O
huge O
corpus O
based O
on O
the O
required O
information O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
text O
mining O
framework O
that O
consists O
of O
four O
distinct O
stages O
: O
1 O
. O

Text O
preprocessing O
2 O
. O

Dimensionality O
reduction O
using O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
3 O
. O

Clustering O
based O
on O
hybrid O
combination O
of O
particle O
swarm O
optimization O
( O
PSO O
) O
and O
k O
- O
means O
algorithm O
4 O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
process O
using O
simulated O
annealing O
( O
SA O
This O
framework O
provides O
more O
relevant O
documents O
to O
the O
user O
and O
reduces O
the O
irrelevant O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Search O
tools O
are O
essential O
for O
an O
information O
system O
. O

Being O
syntax O
based O
, O
the O
existing O
search O
engines O
have O
a O
number O
of O
limitations O
in O
particular O
their O
difficulty O
in O
returning O
relevant O
results O
. O

Typically O
these O
limitations O
are O
partly O
mitigated O
through O
use O
of O
various O
customised O
techniques O
in O
order O
to O
provide O
the O
best O
possible O
user O
experience O
. O

Unlike O
conventional O
search O
engines O
, O
a O
semantic O
web O
search O
engine O
attaches O
meanings O
to O
key O
words O
. O

One O
of O
the O
biggest O
challenges O
for O
such O
a O
semantic O
search O
engine O
is O
to O
maintain O
the O
standard O
of O
user O
experience O
while O
serving O
its O
purpose O
of O
finding O
relevant O
data O
with O
meanings O
. O

A O
semantic O
search O
tool O
needs O
to O
both O
link O
meanings O
to O
search O
keywords O
and O
be O
able O
to O
efficiently O
retrieve O
information O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
this O
work O
is O
to O
investigate O
the O
techniques O
that O
can O
be O
used O
for O
efficient O
information O
retrieval O
and O
effective O
user O
experience O
within O
the O
context O
of O
a O
semantic O
search O
engine O
. O

We O
propose O
two O
algorithms O
for O
query O
optimisation O
and O
ontology O
crawler O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

There O
is O
a O
great O
demand O
for O
highly O
accurate O
and O
timely O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
in O

and O

. O

To O

, O

Clinical O
Notes O
System O

) O

concept O
searching O
. O

with O
the O
both O

and O

Open O
- O
set O
recognition O

in O

is O

with O
identification O
or O

tasks O

may O
belong O
to O

classes O
. O

- O

of O

of O

, O

- O

. O

and O

- O

images O

for O

- O

. O

on O

of O

campaign O

best O

score O
of O
0.738 O
in O

of O
the O
mean O

precision O
, O

was O

to O
be O
0.742 O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Despite O
the O
widespread O
use O
of O
BM25 O
, O
there O
have O
been O
few O
studies O
examining O
its O
effectiveness O
on O
a O
document O
description O
over O
single O
and O
multiple O
field O
combinations O
. O

We O
determine O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
BM25 O
on O
various O
document O
fields O
. O

We O
find O
that O
BM25 O
models O
relevance O
on O
popularity O
fields O
such O
as O
anchor O
text O
and O
query O
click O
information O
no O
better O
than O
a O
linear O
function O
of O
the O
field O
attributes O
. O

We O
also O
find O
query O
click O
information O
to O
be O
the O
single O
most O
important O
field O
for O
retrieval O
. O

In O
response O
, O
we O
develop O
a O
machine O
learning O
approach O
to O
BM25-style O
retrieval O
that O
learns O
, O
using O
LambdaRank O
, O
from O
the O
input O
attributes O
of O
BM25 O
. O

Our O
model O
significantly O
improves O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
over O
BM25 O
and O
BM25F. O
Our O
data O
- O
driven O
approach O
is O
fast O
, O
effective O
, O
avoids O
the O
problem O
of O
parameter O
tuning O
, O
and O
can O
directly O
optimize O
for O
several O
common O
information O
retrieval O
measures O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
advantages O
of O
our O
model O
on O
a O
very O
large O
real O
- O
world O
Web O
data O
collection O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
method O
for O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
The O
main O
goal O
of O
this O
method O
is O
to O
enhance O
the O
core O
IR O
- O
process O
of O
finding O
relevant O
and O
only O
relevant O
documents O
in O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
. O

More O
precisely O
the O
method O
aims O
at O
increasing O
precision O
at O
top O
ranked O
documents O
. O

It O
is O
founded O
on O
previous O
works O
on O
graph O
matching O
and O
acknowledges O
the O
significance O
of O
structural O
similarity O
in O
making O
analogies O
. O

The O
method O
we O
propose O
is O
based O
on O
graph O
vertices O
comparison O
and O
involves O
recursive O
computation O
of O
similarity O
. O

It O
extends O
the O
principle O
stating O
that O
the O
resemblance O
of O
two O
vertices O
can O
be O
computed O
over O
the O
similarities O
of O
the O
vertices O
to O
which O
they O
are O
connected O
and O
takes O
into O
account O
the O
concept O
of O
similarity O
propagation O
within O
a O
graph O
. O

First O
results O
from O
conducted O
experiments O
show O
the O
feasibility O
and O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

Indeed O
, O
our O
method O
highly O
outperforms O
the O
vector O
- O
based O
cosine O
model O
and O
more O
than O
doubles O
the O
precision O
until O
top O
sixty O
returned O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Validation O
of O
Remote O
Sensing O
Content O
- O
Based O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
) O
systems O
requires O
innovative O
strategies O
to O
overcome O
the O
scarcity O
of O
labeled O
data O
. O

CBIR O
systems O
validation O
by O
means O
of O
precision O
/ O
recall O
measures O
based O
on O
either O
, O
user O
’s O
feedback O
or O
a O
- O
priori O
known O
categories O
, O
are O
hard O
to O
apply O
to O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
systems O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
apply O
a O
datadriven O
( O
unsupervised O
) O
quality O
assessment O
strategy O
analogous O
to O
the O
DAMA O
strategy O
applied O
for O
the O
validation O
of O
classification O
methods O
used O
in O
thematic O
mapping O
. O

The O
strategy O
is O
intended O
for O
quality O
assessment O
when O
little O
or O
no O
ground O
truth O
is O
available O
. O

The O
proposed O
strategy O
deals O
with O
the O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
validation O
problem O
by O
giving O
a O
quantitative O
and O
qualitative O
evidence O
of O
the O
relative O
( O
subjective O
) O
quality O
of O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
systems O
without O
a O
- O
priori O
knowledge O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Personalized O
information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
is O
critical O
to O
applications O
in O
the O
medical O
and O
healthcare O
domain O
where O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
retrieved O
information O
and O
obtaining O
it O
in O
a O
time O
critical O
situation O
are O
extremely O
important O
. O

Existing O
personalized O
information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
approaches O
in O
the O
medical O
and O
healthcare O
domain O
have O
improved O
in O
the O
last O
decade O
, O
but O
the O
centralized O
system O
design O
principle O
is O
impeding O
their O
ability O
to O
be O
flexible O
and O
adaptive O
to O
changing O
demands O
. O

These O
demands O
arise O
from O
the O
environment O
in O
which O
the O
approaches O
are O
used O
and O
from O
changing O
user O
requirements O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
our O
preliminary O
ideas O
regarding O
a O
new O
component O
- O
based O
design O

for O

information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
services O
. O

We O
believe O
this O
paper O
offers O
a O
new O
way O
of O
thinking O
about O
the O
retrieval O
of O
time O
critical O
, O
personalized O
information O
from O
medical O
information O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
to O
use O
MapReduce O
to O
quickly O
test O
new O
retrieval O
approaches O
on O
a O
cluster O
of O
machines O
by O
sequentially O
scanning O
all O
documents O
. O

We O
present O
a O
small O

study O
in O
which O
we O
use O
a O

of O
15 O
low O
cost O
machines O
to O
search O
a O

crawl O
of O
0.5 O
billion O
pages O

that O

scanning O
is O
a O

approach O
to O

- O

little O
effort O
. O

code O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
applies O
a O
fuzzy O
ontology O
framework O
to O
information O
retrieval O
system O
for O
enterprise O
management O
information O
system O
. O

The O
framework O
includes O
three O
parts O
: O
concepts O
, O
properties O
of O
concepts O
and O
values O
of O
properties O
, O
in O
which O
property O
's O
value O
can O
be O
either O
standard O
data O
type O
or O
linguistic O
values O
, O
i. O
e. O
fuzzy O
concepts O
. O

The O
fuzzy O
semantic O
query O
expansion O
is O
constructed O
by O
order O
relation O
, O
equivalence O
relation O
, O
inclusion O
relation O
and O
complement O
relation O
between O
fuzzy O
concepts O
defined O
in O
fuzzy O
linguistic O
variable O
ontology O
. O

The O
application O
to O
retrieve O
project O
information O
shows O
that O
the O
framework O
can O
overcome O
the O
localization O
of O
other O
fuzzy O
ontology O
's O
models O
, O
and O
this O
research O
facilitates O
the O
semantic O
retrieval O
of O
enterprise O
management O
information O
through O
fuzzy O
concepts O
on O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
increase O
of O
voice O
- O
based O
interaction O
has O
changed O
the O
way O
people O
seek O
information O
, O
making O
search O
more O
conversational O
. O

Development O
of O
effective O
conversational O
approaches O
to O
search O
requires O
better O
understanding O
of O
how O
people O
express O
information O
needs O
in O
dialogue O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
creation O
and O
examination O
of O
over O
32 O
K O
spoken O
utterances O
collected O
during O
34 O
hours O
of O
collaborative O
search O
tasks O
. O

The O
contribution O
of O
this O
work O
is O
three O
- O
fold O
. O

First O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
model O
of O
conversational O
information O
needs O
( O
CINs O
) O
based O
on O
a O
synthesis O
of O
relevant O
theories O
in O
Information O
Seeking O
and O
Retrieval O
. O

Second O
, O
we O
show O
several O
behavioural O
patterns O
of O
CINs O
based O
on O
the O
proposed O
model O
. O

Third O
, O
we O
identify O
effective O
feature O
groups O
that O
may O
be O
useful O
for O
detecting O
CINs O
categories O
from O
conversations O
. O

This O
paper O
concludes O
with O
a O
discussion O
of O
how O
these O
findings O
can O
facilitate O
advance O
of O
conversational O
search O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

One O
of O
the O
problems O
to O
solve O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
is O
the O
modelization O
of O
music O
style O
. O

The O
system O
could O
be O
trained O
to O
identify O
the O
main O
features O
that O
would O
characterize O
music O
genres O
or O
style O
so O
as O
to O
look O
for O
that O
kind O
of O
music O
over O
large O
musical O
corpus O
. O

So O
in O
this O
paper O
multimodal O
approach O
, O
pattern O
recognition O
approach O
and O
co O
- O
updating O
approach O
is O
been O
studied O
for O
identifying O
the O
style O
from O
different O
genre O
of O
the O
music O
. O

Considering O
the O
intuitive O
feelings O
of O
similarity O
from O
the O
listeners O
perspective O
, O
the O
focus O
on O
features O
that O
are O
computed O
using O
similarity O
metrics O
for O
melodies O
, O
harmonies O
, O
and O
audio O
signals O
for O
style O
identification O
. O

A O
multimodal O
approach O
mostly O
considered O
support O
vector O
machine O
as O
a O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
theory O
of O
concept O
( O
or O
Galois O
) O
lattices O
provides O
a O
natural O
and O
formal O
setting O
in O
which O
to O
discover O
and O
represent O
concept O
hierarchies O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
system O
, O
GALOIS O
, O
which O
is O
able O
to O
determine O
the O
concept O
lattice O
corresponding O
to O
a O
given O
set O
of O
objects O
. O

GALOIS O
is O
incremental O
and O
relatively O
efficient O
, O
the O
time O
complexity O
of O
each O
update O
ranging O
from O
O(n O
) O
to O
O(n2 O
) O
where O
n O
is O
the O
number O
of O
concepts O
in O
the O
lattice O
. O

Unlike O
most O
approaches O
to O
conceptual O
clustering O
, O
GALOIS O
represents O
and O
updates O
all O
possible O
classes O
in O
a O
restricted O
concept O
space O
. O

Therefore O
the O
concept O
hierarchies O
it O
finds O
are O
always O
justified O
and O
are O
not O
sensitive O
to O
object O
ordering O
. O

We O
experimentally O
demonstrate O
, O
using O
several O
machine O
learning O
data O
sets O
, O
that O
GALOIS O
can O
be O
successfully O
used O
for O
class O
discovery O
and O
class O
prediction O
. O

We O
also O
point O
out O
applications O
of O
GALOIS O
in O
fields O
related O
to O
machine O
learning O
( O
i.e O
information O
retrieval O
and O
databases O
) O
. O

administration O
is O
a O

to O

articles O
relevant O
to O
a O

problem O
case O

of O

- O

a O
( O

) O
nite O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Geographical O
entities O
often O
appears O
in O
very O
different O
forms O
in O
text O
collections O
, O
such O
as O
when O
a O
foreign O
name O
is O
used O
instead O
of O
the O
English O
one O
, O
or O
when O
the O
citation O
of O
some O
region O
or O
place O
omits O
the O
name O
of O
a O
larger O
geographical O
entity O
containing O
them O
. O

This O
is O
a O
known O
problem O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
use O
of O
an O
ontology O
like O
WordNet O
can O
help O
in O
addressing O
this O
issue O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
an O
automatic O
method O
to O
expand O
the O
geographical O
terms O
in O
queries O
by O
using O
the O
WordNet O
ontology O
and O
another O
method O
that O
expands O
the O
terms O
during O
the O
indexing O
phase O
. O

The O
proposed O
methods O
exploits O
the O
synonymy O
, O
meronymy O
and O
holonymy O
relationships O
provided O
by O
WordNet O
, O
together O
with O
some O
information O
extracted O
from O
the O
gloss O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Recent O
emerging O
technologies O
such O
as O
internetworking O
and O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
have O
signiicantly O
expanded O
the O
types O
of O
data O
available O
to O
an O
information O
management O
system O
. O

Textual O
data O
is O
the O
most O
prevalent O
of O
these O
data O
types O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
discuss O
an O
approach O
based O
on O
domain O
ontologies O
( O
expressed O
as O
E O
- O
R O
Models O
) O
and O
SQL O
for O
modeling O
and O
querying O
textual O
data O
as O
implemented O
in O
the O
InfoSleuth O
project O
at O
MCC O
. O

We O
identify O
the O
basic O
shortcomings O
of O
current O
approaches O
for O
textual O
data O
on O
the O
web O
a O
) O
lack O
of O
precision O
; O
and O
( O
b O
) O
lack O
of O
interoperation O
and O
discuss O
how O
our O
approach O
helps O
alleviate O
the O
above O
shortcomings O
. O

Techniques O
for O
mapping O
concepts O
in O
a O
domain O
ontology O
to O
the O
underlying O
textual O
data O
and O
for O
translation O
of O
queries O
expressed O
in O
SQL O
to O
the O
underlying O
information O
retrieval O
operations O
are O
presented O
. O

Limitations O
of O
current O
indexing O
technologies O
in O
supporting O
expressions O
translated O
from O
SQL O
are O
identiied O
and O
heuristic O
approaches O
are O
proposed O
to O
overcome O
the O
same O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Web O
is O
loaded O
with O
information O
and O
is O
getting O
overloaded O
with O
data O
each O
passing O
day O
. O

There O
needs O
to O
be O
efficient O
development O
in O
the O
area O
of O
information O
retrieval O
so O
the O
required O
data O
can O
be O
fetched O
accurately O
and O
efficiently O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
the O
two O
promising O
areas O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
and O
Web O
technologies O
which O
can O
be O
combined O
together O
to O
enable O
the O
enterprise O
to O
combine O
the O
unstructured O
and O
structured O
data O
in O
ways O
that O
was O
not O
handled O
efficiently O
by O
traditional O
tools O
. O

The O
better O
understanding O
of O
web O
information O
can O
be O
done O
by O
integrating O
NLP O
and O
Web O
portal O
. O

The O
paper O
also O
explores O
various O
techniques O
used O
both O
areas O
. O

Also O
the O
NLP O
frameworks O
which O
can O
be O
used O
for O
the O
future O
work O
in O
this O
area O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
key O
problem O
in O
Tor O
’s O
architecture O
is O
that O
it O
requires O
users O
to O
maintain O
a O
global O
view O
of O
the O
system O
, O
which O
will O
become O
costly O
as O
the O
size O
of O
the O
network O
increases O
. O

Several O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
approaches O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
order O
to O
alleviate O
the O
scalability O
concerns O
of O
the O
Tor O
network O
, O
but O
they O
are O
only O
able O
to O
provide O
heuristic O
security O
; O
in O
fact O
, O
the O
security O
community O
has O
been O
quite O
successful O
at O
breaking O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
systems O
using O
both O
passive O
and O
active O
attacks O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
explore O
new O
primitives O
for O
scalable O
anonymous O
communication O
, O
with O
a O
focus O
on O
providing O
provable O
security O
guarantees O
. O

First O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
approach O
for O
secure O
peer O
- O
topeer O
anonymous O
communication O
based O
on O
a O
reciprocal O
neighbor O
policy O
. O

Secondly O
, O
we O
propose O
PIR O
- O
Tor O
, O
a O
clientserver O
scalable O
architecture O
for O
anonymous O
communications O
based O
on O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
information O
structure O
( O
IS O
) O
model O
is O
used O
in O
information O
economics O
to O
evaluate O
the O
expected O
payoff O
from O
imperfect O
information O
and O
to O
recommend O
an O
optimal O
decision O
strategy O
. O

This O
paper O
applies O
the O
IS O
model O
to O
the O
Information O
Filtering O
( O
IF O
) O
problem O
. O

Using O
the O
suggested O
model O
, O
IF O
systems O
can O
be O
rank O
ordered O
, O
when O
the O
user O
payoff O
matrix O
is O
known O
. O

In O
some O
situations O
the O
ordering O
is O
“ O
strong O
that O
is O
, O
independent O
of O
the O
payoff O
matrix O
. O

The O
relation O
between O
the O
commonly O
used O
precision O
and O
recall O
performance O
measure O
and O
the O
IS O
model O
parameters O
is O
derived O
. O

The O
strong O
relation O
is O
translated O
into O
the O
recall O
precision O
plot O
, O
widely O
used O
in O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
community O
. O

It O
is O
proved O
that O
there O
is O
a O
relation O
between O
the O
precision O
and O
recall O
parameters O
for O
which O
systems O
can O
be O
rank O
ordered O
, O
using O
the O
Blackwell O
theorem O
, O
regardless O
of O
the O
user O
payoff O
matrix O
. O

Topic O
Areas O
Evaluation O
, O
Performance O
, O
Formal O
Models O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
, O
Nonnegative O
Matrix O
Factorization O
( O
NMF O
) O
has O
received O
considerable O
interest O
from O
the O
data O
mining O
and O
information O
retrieval O
fields O
. O

NMF O
has O
been O
successfully O
applied O
in O
document O
clustering O
, O
image O
representation O
, O
and O
other O
domains O
. O

This O
study O
proposes O
an O
online O
NMF O
( O
ONMF O
) O
algorithm O
to O
efficiently O
handle O
very O
large O
- O
scale O
and/or O
streaming O
datasets O
. O

Unlike O
conventional O
NMF O
solutions O
which O
require O
the O
entire O
data O
matrix O
to O
reside O
in O
the O
memory O
, O
our O
ONMF O
algorithm O
proceeds O
with O
one O
data O
point O
or O
one O
chunk O
of O
data O
points O
at O
a O
time O
. O

Experiments O
with O
one O
- O
pass O
and O
multi O
- O
pass O
ONMF O
on O
real O
datasets O
are O
presented O
. O

of O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
on O
- O
going O
effort O
to O
combine O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
( O
IE O
) O
technologies O
, O
to O
leverage O
the O
benefits O
provided O
by O
both O
approaches O
to O
add O
value O
for O
the O
end O
- O
user O
, O
as O
compared O
with O
IR O
or O
IE O
in O
isolation O
. O

The O
main O
aim O
of O
the O
combined O
system O
is O
to O
pool O
together O
information O
from O
multiple O
sources O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
results O
. O

On O
one O
hand O
, O
multiple O
mentions O
of O
the O
same O
event O
or O
related O
events O
should O
be O
presented O
in O
a O
coherent O
fashion O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
grouping O
related O
events O
should O
improve O
the O
system O
’s O
confidence O
in O
the O
discovered O
facts O
. O

We O
describe O
our O
approach O
and O
the O
results O
achieved O
in O
the O
project O
to O
date O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
forms O
the O
basis O
of O
many O
information O
management O
tasks O
. O

Information O
management O
itself O
has O
become O
an O
extremely O
important O
area O
as O
the O
amount O
of O
electronically O
available O
information O
increases O
dramatically O
. O

There O
are O
numerous O
methods O
of O
performing O
the O
IR O
task O
both O
by O
utilising O
different O
techniques O
and O
through O
using O
different O
representations O
of O
the O
information O
available O
to O
us O
. O

It O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
some O
algorithms O
outperform O
others O
on O
certain O
tasks O
. O

Combining O
the O
results O
produced O
by O
different O
algorithms O
has O
resulted O
in O
superior O
retrieval O
performance O
and O
this O
has O
become O
an O
important O
research O
area O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
probability O
- O
based O
fusion O
technique O
probFuse O
that O
shows O
initial O
promise O
in O
addressing O
this O
question O
. O

It O
also O
compares O
probFuse O
with O
the O
common O
CombMNZ O
data O
fusion O
technique O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

MIREX O
2005 O
is O
the O
second O
evaluation O
of O
algorithms O
related O
to O
music O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MIR O
This O
document O
describes O
our O
submission O
to O
the O
MIREX O
audio O
melody O
extraction O
contest O
addressing O
the O
task O
of O
identifying O
the O
melody O
pitch O
contour O
from O
polyphonic O
musical O
audio O
. O

We O
use O
mainly O
a O
data O
- O
driven O
approach O
implementing O
standard O
audio O
signal O
processing O
techniques O
like O
Fourier O
analysis O
, O
instantaneous O
frequency O
estimation O
and O
sinusoidal O
extraction O
. O

Nevertheless O
, O
some O
high O
level O
knowledge O
is O
applied O
. O

Examples O
of O
such O
knowledge O
include O
perceptually O
motivated O
methods O
( O
psychoacoustics O
, O
auditory O
stream O
segregation O
) O
as O
well O
as O
basic O
voice O
- O
leading O
principles O
. O

The O
result O
of O
the O
Mirex O
2005 O
evaluation O
proves O
that O
our O
algorithm O
performs O
best O
in O
respect O
of O
runtime O
and O
overall O
accuracy O
, O
a O
measure O
which O
combines O
voicing O
detection O
( O
discrimination O
between O
melody O
and O
non O
- O
melody O
parts O
) O
and O
pitch O
estimation O
. O

- O

in O

, O
with O
the O
challenges O
posed O
by O

retrieval O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
ability O
to O
accurately O
judge O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
between O
words O
is O
critical O
to O
the O
performance O
of O
several O
applications O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
. O

Therefore O
, O
in O

paper O
we O

that O
uses O
in O
one O

, O

provided O

project O
of O

French O
National O

for O
Scientific O
Research O
( O
CNRS O
) O
and O

the O

hand O
, O
a O
page O
counts O
based O
metric O
returned O
by O
a O

website O
whose O
content O
is O
generated O
by O
users O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
traditional O
commercial O
environment O
, O
business O
information O
retrieval O
is O
limited O
in O
searching O
scope O
and O
quality O
. O

As O
enterprise O
turns O
to O
electronic O
commerce O
( O
EC O
) O
environment O
, O
the O
quality O
of O
business O
information O
on O
supply O
and O
sale O
directly O
affects O
the O
level O
of O
enterprise O
operations O
. O

This O
paper O
analyses O
the O
problem O
of O
business O
information O
retrieval O
in O
EC O
environment O
, O
and O
proposes O
a O
Hopfield O
neural O
network O
based O
business O
information O
retrieval O
model O
using O
Internet O
information O
resources O
by O
means O
of O
Artificial O
Intelligence O
( O
AI O
) O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
theory O
. O

Through O
generating O
extended O
query O
terms O
by O
Hopfield O
neural O
network O
and O
ranking O
the O
results O
, O
the O
proposed O
model O
can O
expand O
the O
searching O
scope O
and O
increase O
the O
precision O
of O
retrieval O
, O
so O
as O
to O
provide O
valuable O
business O
information O
for O
enterprises O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
general O
- O
purpose O
methods O
for O
recognizing O
certain O
types O
of O
structure O
in O
HTML O
documents O
. O

The O
methods O
are O
implemented O
using O
WHIRL O
, O
a O
" O
soft O
" O

of O

. O

of O

. O

The O
models O
are O
superquadrics O
with O
global O
deformations O
. O

The O
recovered O
parameters O
serve O
for O
classification O
. O
