-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
is O
a O
crucial O
topic O
in O
the O
domain O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

According O
to O
major O
characteristics O
of O
music O
, O
Query O
- O
by O
- O
Humming O
system O
retrieves O
interesting O
music O
by O
finding O
melody O
that O
contains O
similar O
or O
equal O
melody O
to O
the O
humming O
query O
. O

Basing O
on O
the O
designed O
fuzzy O
inference O
model O
a O
novel O
Query O
- O
by O
- O
Humming O
/ O
Singing O
system O
is O
proposed O
to O
extract O
pitch O
contour O
information O
from O
WAV O
and O
MIDI O
files O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

To O
verify O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
presented O
work O
, O
the O
MIREX O
QBSH O
Database O
is O
employed O
as O
our O
experimental O
database O
and O
a O
large O
amount O
of O
human O
vocal O
data O
is O
used O
as O
query O
to O
test O
the O
robustness O
of O
MIR O
. O

Then O
, O
the O
Longest O
Common O
Subsequence O
( O
LCS O
) O
is O
served O
as O
an O
approximate O
matching O
algorithm O
to O
identify O
the O
most O
related O
top O
5 O
music O
as O
an O
evaluation O
standard O
for O
the O
system O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
system O
achieves O
85 O
% O
accuracy O
in O
the O
top O
5 O
retrievals O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
empirical O
nature O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
mandates O
strong O
experimental O
practices O
. O

The O
Cranfield O
/ O
TREC O
evaluation O
paradigm O
represents O
a O
keystone O
of O
such O
experimental O
practices O
. O

Within O
this O
paradigm O
, O
the O
generation O
of O
relevance O
judgments O
has O
been O
the O
subject O
of O
intense O
scientific O
investigation O
. O

This O
is O
because O
, O
on O
one O
hand O
, O
consistent O
, O
precise O
and O
numerous O
judgements O
are O
key O
to O
reduce O
evaluation O
uncertainty O
and O
test O
collection O
bias O
; O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
however O
, O
relevance O
judgements O
are O
costly O
to O
collect O
. O

The O
selection O
of O
which O
documents O
to O
judge O
for O
relevance O
( O
known O
as O
pooling O
) O
has O
therefore O
great O
impact O
in O
IR O
evaluation O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
contribute O
a O
set O
of O
8 O
novel O
pooling O
strategies O
based O
on O
retrieval O
fusion O
methods O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
choice O
of O
the O
pooling O
strategy O
has O
significant O
effects O
on O
the O
cost O
needed O
to O
obtain O
an O
unbiased O
test O
collection O
; O
we O
also O
identify O
the O
best O
performing O
pooling O
strategy O
according O
to O
three O
evaluation O
measure O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
rapid O
development O
of O
network O
technologies O
has O
seen O
the O
use O
of O
network O
as O
a O
media O
for O
file O
storage O
and O
sharing O
. O

Files O
stored O
on O
network O
are O
expected O
to O
be O
shared O
in O
a O
safe O
and O
effective O
manner O
. O

Most O
recent O
researches O
on O
secure O
network O
storage O
focus O
solely O
on O
security O
and O
give O
little O
concern O
to O
support O
for O
information O
retrieval O
and O
in O
turn O
information O
sharing O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
novel O
network O
storage O
model O
which O
integrates O
techniques O
in O
compression O
, O
encryption O
and O
information O
retrieval O
. O

It O
effectively O
satisfies O
the O
concern O
for O
both O
security O
and O
sharing O
. O

Its O
performance O
is O
also O
demonstrated O
via O
experiments O
on O
a O
prototype O
system O
. O

on O

analysis O
of O

, O

Positive O
design O
leads O
to O
positive O
change O
in O
our O
society O
. O

In O
most O
cases O
, O
discussions O
focus O
on O
those O
who O
receive O
the O
design O
. O

However O
, O
positive O
design O
may O
also O
have O
a O
positive O
, O
but O
often O
overlooked O
, O
effect O
on O
the O
designers O
themselves O
. O

Learning O
about O
difficulties O
others O
face O
and O
developing O
solutions O
is O
a O
benefit O
that O
can O
contribute O
to O
individual O
designers’ O
education O
and O
general O
sense O
of O
well O
- O
being O
. O

Having O
a O
broader O
understanding O
of O
alternative O
views O
and O
lifestyles O
makes O
one O
a O
better O
person O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
positive O
design O
may O
benefit O
the O
entire O
field O
of O
information O
science O
by O
improving O
its O
ability O
to O
renew O
itself O
and O
attract O
new O
, O
young O
talent O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Term O
weighting O
methods O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
give O
significant O
increases O
in O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

The O
presence O
of O
pronomial O
references O
in O
documents O
reduces O
the O
term O
frequencies O
of O
associated O
words O
with O
a O
consequent O
effect O
on O
term O
weights O
and O
information O
retrieval O
behaviour O
. O

This O
investigation O
explores O
the O
impact O
on O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
of O
broad O
coverage O
automatic O
pronoun O
resolution O
. O

Results O
indicate O
that O
this O
approach O
has O
potential O
to O
improve O
both O
precision O
at O
fixed O
cutoff O
levels O
and O
average O
precision O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Large O
collections O
of O
full O
- O
text O
documents O
are O
now O
commonly O
used O
in O
automated O
information O
retrieval O
. O

When O
the O
stored O
document O
texts O
are O
long O
, O
the O
retrieval O
of O
complete O
documents O
may O
not O
be O
in O
the O
users O
' O
best O
interest O
. O

In O
such O
circumstance O
, O
efficient O
and O
effective O
retrieval O
results O
may O
be O
obtained O
by O
using O
passage O
retrieval O
strategies O
designed O
to O
retrieve O
text O
excerpts O
of O
varying O
size O
in O
response O
to O
statements O
of O
user O
interest O
. O

New O
approaches O
are O
described O
in O
this O
study O
for O
implementing O
selective O
passage O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
and O
identifying O
text O
passages O
responsive O
to O
particular O
user O
needs O
. O

An O
automated O
encyclopedia O
search O
system O
is O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
usefulness O
of O
the O
proposed O
methods O
. O

, O

. O

project O

-DOCSTART- O

Starting O
from O
an O
unsolved O
problem O
of O
information O
retrieval O
this O
paper O
presents O
an O
ontology O
- O
based O
model O
for O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
. O

The O
model O
combines O
the O
methods O
and O
experiences O
of O
cognitive O
- O
to O
- O
interpret O
indexing O
languages O
with O
the O
strengths O
and O
possibilities O
of O
formal O
knowledge O
representation O
. O

The O
core O
component O
of O
the O
model O
uses O
inferences O
along O
the O
paths O
of O
typed O
relations O
between O
the O
entities O
of O
a O
knowledge O
representation O
for O
enabling O
the O
determination O
of O
hit O
quantities O
in O
the O
context O
of O
retrieval O
processes O
. O

The O
entities O
are O
arranged O
in O
aspect O
- O
oriented O
facets O
to O
ensure O
a O
consistent O
hierarchical O
structure O
. O

The O
possible O
consequences O
for O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
are O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O

. O

systems O
is O
presented O
which O
identifies O

components O
, O

and O

and O
a O
single O

data O

, O

. O

and O

-DOCSTART- O

Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
GIR O
) O
has O
become O
a O
very O
attractive O
area O
of O
research O
. O

GIR O
is O
a O
specialization O
of O
a O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O
which O
may O
index O
and O
search O
Web O
documents O
based O
on O
their O
spatial O
footprints O
. O

Research O
in O
this O
new O
field O
may O
be O
categorized O
into O
crawling O
spatial O
- O
related O
documents O
, O
modeling O
the O
geographic O
scope O
of O
a O
document O
, O
indexing O
these O
documents O
using O
textual O
and O
spatial O
features O
, O
and O
the O
building O
of O
spatially O
- O
enabled O
searching O
and O
ranking O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
method O
for O
modeling O
the O
geographic O
scope O
. O

The O
proposed O
model O
is O
based O
on O
both O
the O
statistics O
collected O
from O
the O
detected O
references O
; O
and O
the O
spatial O
distribution O
of O
the O
places O
involved O
in O
a O
given O
document O
. O

This O
model O
aims O
to O
simplify O
the O
indexing O
and O
searching O
processes O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
the O
number O
of O
spatial O
operations O
is O
reduced O
, O
as O
a O
consequence O
the O
overall O
performance O
is O
improved O
. O

A O
novel O
and O
complex O
form O
of O
information O
access O
is O
cross O
- O

: O

for O

written O
in O

. O

Although O

is O
not O
. O

during O

of O

a O

The O

and O

; O

. O

Lessons O
were O

stage O
of O
the O
process O

a O
much O
more O

view O
of O
what O
a O

- O

to O

a O

to O

ontology O
. O

in O

on O

. O

to O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

Previous O
works O
showed O
that O
the O
use O
of O
document O

like O

of O

a O

to O

, O

. O

has O
not O

how O
to O
define O
those O
text O
passages O
so O
that O
the O
system O
can O
improve O
the O
efficiently O
. O

paper O
reports O
on O
experiments O
with O
IR O
- O
n O
system O
, O
a O

system O

on O

of O
passages O

( O

) O

( O

n O

-DOCSTART- O

Text O
Categorization O
( O
TC O
also O
known O
as O
Text O
Classification O
, O
is O
the O
task O
of O
automatically O
classifying O
a O
set O
of O
text O
documents O
into O
different O
categories O
from O
a O
predefined O
set O
. O

If O
a O
document O
belongs O
to O
exactly O
one O
of O
the O
categories O
, O
it O
is O
a O
single O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
; O
otherwise O
, O
it O
is O
a O
multi O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
. O

TC O
uses O
several O
tools O
from O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Machine O
Learning O
( O
ML O
) O
and O
has O
received O
much O
attention O
in O
the O
last O
years O
from O
both O
researchers O
in O
the O
academia O
and O
industry O
developers O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
first O
categorize O
the O
documents O
using O
KNN O
based O
machine O
learning O
approach O
and O
then O
return O
the O
most O
relevant O
documents O
. O

- O

A O
common O
approach O
to O

the O
term O
mismatch O
between O
a O
user O
’s O
query O
and O
relevant O
documents O
is O
query O
expansion O
, O
which O
augments O
a O
user O
’s O
query O
with O
additional O
, O
related O
terms O
in O
order O
to O
increase O
coverage O
of O
relevant O
documents O
. O

The O
system O
proposed O
in O

paper O
presents O
an O

of O

term O
mismatch O

for O

. O

system O

, O

inter O
- O
document O
references O
( O

or O
citations O

uses O
those O

to O

the O
set O
of O
terms O

within O

. O

Preliminary O

of O
using O

in O

indicates O
that O
this O
approach O
can O
provide O
mild O
benefit O
to O
the O
perceived O
helpfulness O
of O
a O
user O
’s O
query O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Much O
work O
in O
information O
retrieval O
focuses O
on O
using O
a O
model O
of O
documents O
and O
queries O
to O
derive O
retrieval O
algorithms O
. O

Model O
based O
development O
is O
a O
useful O
alternative O
to O
heuristic O
development O
because O
in O
a O
model O
the O
assumptions O
are O
explicit O
and O
can O
be O
examined O
and O
refined O
independent O
of O
the O
particular O
retrieval O
algorithm O
. O

We O
explore O
the O
explicit O
assumptions O
underlying O
the O
na&#239;ve O
framework O
by O
performing O
computational O
analysis O
of O
actual O
corpora O
and O
queries O
to O
devise O
a O
generative O
document O
model O
that O
closely O
matches O
text O
. O

Our O
thesis O
is O
that O
a O
model O
so O
developed O
will O
be O
more O
accurate O
than O
existing O
models O
, O
and O
thus O
more O
useful O
in O
retrieval O
, O
as O
well O
as O
other O
applications O
. O

We O
test O
this O
by O
learning O
from O
a O
corpus O
the O
best O
document O
model O
. O

We O
find O
the O
learned O
model O
better O
predicts O
the O
existence O
of O
text O
data O
and O
has O
improved O
performance O
on O
certain O
IR O
tasks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Previous O
research O
has O
shown O
the O
words O
in O
natural O
language O
documents O
exist O
as O
a O
small O
world O
network O
. O

Thus O
it O
might O
be O
feasible O
to O
use O
extensive O
physics O
algorithms O
for O
extracting O
community O
structure O
. O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
method O
for O
semantically O
clustering O
a O
large O
collection O
of O
documents O
using O
small O
world O
communities O
. O

We O
combine O
specially O
modified O
physics O
algorithms O
with O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
. O

A O
term O
network O
is O
generated O
from O
the O
document O
collection O
, O
the O
terms O
are O
clustered O
into O
small O
world O
communities O
, O
and O
the O
semantic O
term O
clusters O
are O
used O
to O
generate O
overlapping O
document O
clusters O
. O

Clustering O
90 O
K O
documents O
took O
20 O
seconds O
, O
generating O
good O
quality O
community O
clusters O
in O
nearly O
linear O
running O
time O
, O
O(n O
log O

n O
) O
where O
n O
is O
the O
size O
of O
the O
lexicon O
in O
the O
document O
collection O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
novel O
similarity O
measure O
for O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
type O
large O
scale O
image O
retrieval O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
similarity O
function O
is O
learned O
in O
an O
unsupervised O
manner O
, O
requires O
no O
extra O
space O
over O
the O
standard O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
method O
and O
is O
more O
discriminative O
than O
both O
L2-based O
soft O
assignment O
and O
Hamming O
embedding O
. O

The O
novel O
similarity O
function O
achieves O
mean O
average O
precision O
that O
is O
superior O
to O
any O
result O
published O
in O
the O
literature O
on O
the O
standard O
Oxford O
5k O
, O
Oxford O
105k O
and O
Paris O
datasets O
/ O
protocols O
. O

We O
study O
the O
effect O
of O
a O
fine O
quantization O
and O
very O
large O
vocabularies O
( O
up O
to O
64 O
million O
words O
) O
and O
show O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
specific O
object O
retrieval O
increases O
with O
the O
size O
of O
the O
vocabulary O
. O

This O
observation O
is O
in O
contradiction O
with O
previously O
published O
results O
. O

We O
further O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
large O
vocabularies O
increase O
the O
speed O
of O
the O
tf O
- O
idf O
scoring O
step O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Aiming O
at O
the O
low O
conversion O
rate O
of O
the O
patent O

, O

paper O
puts O
forward O

about O
conversion O

-DOCSTART- O

Todays O
, O
The O
internet O
has O
become O
a O
source O
of O
multi O
- O
lingual O
content O
. O

Users O
are O
not O
aware O
of O
multiple O
languages O
, O
so O
the O
language O
diversity O
becomes O
a O
great O
barrier O
for O
world O
communication O
. O

Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
provides O
a O
solution O
for O
this O
language O
barrier O
, O
where O

user O
can O
search O
in O
his O
native O
language O
and O
get O
the O
relevant O
information O
in O
the O
required O
language O
. O

Currently O
, O
distributed O
word O
vector O
representation O
has O
a O
trend O
in O
various O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
task O
. O

These O
word O
vectors O
are O
used O
to O
identify O
similar O
contextual O
words O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
analyze O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
word O
vectors O
across O
the O
languages O
in O
Hindi O
- O
English O
CLIR O
. O

Skip O
- O
Gram O
Model O
( O
SGM O
) O
is O
used O
to O
learn O
bi O
- O
lingual O
word O
vectors O
from O
sentence O
aligned O
comparable O
corpus O
. O

IBM O
model O
is O
used O
to O
align O
the O
source O
language O
and O
target O
language O
words O
from O
sentence O
aligned O
comparable O
corpus O
. O

Best O

is O
selected O
with O
the O

of O
top O
- O
n O

and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O

for O

- O
based O

Discovery O
( O
ID O
ID O
is O
the O
synthesis O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Information O
Filtering O
, O
thus O
coping O
with O
dynamics O
from O
both O
elds O
. O

Agent O
technology O
, O
having O
a O
number O
of O
valuable O
properties O
to O
attack O
problems O
with O
dynamics O
, O
is O
used O
in O
ID O
, O

in O
a O

with O
three O
types O
of O
agents O
: O
user O
, O
broker O
, O
and O
source O
agents O
. O

Cooperation O
, O
which O
is O
the O
keyword O
for O
the O
agents O
to O
fullll O
ID O
tasks O
, O
is O
seen O
as O
negotiation O
, O
thus O

a O
very O
general O
and O
exible O
way O
to O
describe O
agents O
' O
interaction O
. O

The O
possibilities O
for O
ID O
agents O
to O
negotiate O
are O
investigated O
. O

background O

made O
about O
other O
issues O
concerning O
negotiation O
such O
as O

, O
strategies O
, O
and O

. O

, O

( O
IR O

( O

a O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
addresses O
an O
important O
problem O
related O
to O
the O
use O
of O
semantics O
in O
IR O
. O

It O
concerns O
the O
representation O
of O
document O
semantics O
and O
its O
proper O
use O
in O
retrieval O
. O

The O
approach O
we O
propose O
aims O
at O
representing O
the O
content O
of O
the O
document O
by O
the O
best O
semantic O
network O
called O
document O
semantic O
core O
in O
two O
main O
steps O
. O

During O
the O
first O
step O
concepts O
( O
words O
and O
phrases O
) O
are O
extracted O
from O
a O
document O
, O
driven O
by O
an O
external O
general O
- O
purpose O
ontology O
, O
namely O
WordNet O
. O

The O
second O
step O
a O
global O
disambiguation O
of O
the O
extracted O
concepts O
regarding O
to O
the O
document O
leads O
to O
build O
the O
best O
semantic O
network O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
selected O
concepts O
represent O
the O
nodes O
of O
the O
semantic O
network O
whereas O
similarity O
measure O
values O
between O
connected O
nodes O
weight O
the O
links O
. O

The O
resulting O
scored O
concepts O
are O
used O
for O
the O
document O
conceptual O
indexing O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
we O
propose O
a O
feature O
location O
approach O
that O
targets O
models O
as O
the O
feature O
realization O
artifacts O
. O

The O
approach O
combines O
Genetic O
Algorithms O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
. O

Given O
a O
model O
and O
a O
feature O
description O
, O
model O
fragments O
extracted O
from O
the O
model O
are O
evolved O
using O
genetic O
operations O
. O

Then O
, O
Formal O
Concept O
Analysis O
is O
used O
to O
cluster O
the O
model O
fragments O
based O
on O
their O
common O
attributes O
into O
feature O
realization O
candidates O
. O

Finally O
, O
Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis O
is O
used O
to O
rank O
the O
candidates O
based O
on O
the O
similarity O
with O
the O
feature O
description O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
the O
genetic O
algorithm O
evolves O
the O
population O
of O
model O
fragments O
to O
find O
the O
set O
of O
most O
suitable O
feature O
realizations O
. O

We O
have O
evaluated O
the O
approach O
with O
an O
industrial O
case O
study O
, O
locating O
features O
with O
precision O
and O
recall O
values O
around O
90 O
baseline O
obtains O
less O
than O
40 O

Finally O
, O
we O
provide O
recommendations O
on O
how O
to O
provide O
the O
input O
to O
the O
approach O
to O
improve O
the O
location O
of O
features O
over O
the O
models O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
number O
of O
users O
of O
an O
on O
- O
line O
shopping O
websites O
is O
continuously O
increasing O
. O

Such O
website O
often O
provides O
facility O
for O
the O
users O
to O
give O
comments O
and O
ratings O
to O
the O
products O
being O
sold O
on O
the O
websites O
. O

This O
information O
can O
be O
useful O
as O
the O
recommendation O
for O
other O
users O
in O
making O
their O
purchase O
decision O
. O

This O
paper O
investigates O
the O
problem O
of O
predicting O
rating O
based O
on O
users O
' O
comments O
. O

A O
classifier O
based O
on O
information O
retrieval O
model O
is O
proposed O
for O
the O
prediction O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
effect O
of O
integrating O
sentiment O
analysis O
for O
the O
rating O
prediction O
is O
also O
investigated O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
results O
, O
an O
improvement O
in O
prediction O
performance O
can O
be O
expected O
with O
sentiment O
analysis O
where O
an O
increase O
of O
54 O
% O
is O
achieved O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
combination O
of O
evidence O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
has O
been O
studied O
extensively O
in O
order O
to O
increase O
effectiveness O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
study O
the O

application O
of O
different O

approaches O
on O
a O
per O
- O
query O
basis O
for O

. O

Our O
methodology O
is O
based O
on O
the O

that O
not O

from O

. O

of O

is O
the O

of O
documents O
from O
the O
same O
domain O
. O

Our O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O

is O
possible O
to O

important O

in O

effectiveness O
by O
using O
simple O
statistical O
decision O

on O
a O
per O
- O
query O
basis O
. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

- O
hoc O
mono O
- O
lingual O

for O

is O

for O

- O
language O
environment O
. O

the O
knowledge O
is O
represented O
by O
some O
means O
/ O
method O
, O
it O
will O
be O
easy O
to O
retrieve O
the O
information O
. O

So O
, O
to O
represent O
knowledge O
ontology O
is O
a O
rich O
source O
, O
which O
may O
give O
better O
approach O
for O
information O

for O

. O

Cross O
- O
language O

has O

( O

years O
. O

; O

/ O

. O

- O

, O

in O
such O

as O

, O

, O

, O
and O

. O

Data O

is O

, O

work O
from O
areas O
such O
as O
database O
technology O
, O

, O

, O

, O
statistics O
, O

recognition O
, O

based O
systems O
, O
knowledge O

, O

, O
high O
performance O

and O

. O

A O
more O

of O

is O
as O
follows O
Data O
mining O
is O
the O
process O
of O
selection O
, O

and O

of O
large O

of O

with O

of O

the O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Approaches O
for O
extracting O
related O
words O
( O
terms O
) O
by O
co O
- O
occurrence O
work O
poorly O
sometimes O
. O

Two O
words O
frequently O
co O
- O
occurring O
in O
the O
same O
documents O
are O
considered O
related O
. O

However O
, O
they O
may O
not O
relate O
at O
all O
because O
they O
would O
have O
no O
common O
meanings O
nor O
similar O
semantics O
. O

We O
address O
this O
problem O
by O
considering O
the O
page O
designer O
’s O
intention O
and O
propose O
a O
new O
model O
to O
extract O
related O
words O
. O

Our O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
the O
idea O
that O
the O
web O
page O
designers O
usually O
make O
the O
correlative O
hyperlinks O
appear O
in O
close O
zone O
on O
the O
browser O
. O

We O
developed O
a O
browser O
- O
based O
crawler O
to O
collect O
“ O
geographically O
” O
near O
hyperlinks O
, O
then O
by O
clustering O
these O
hyperlinks O
based O
on O
their O
pixel O
coordinates O
, O
we O
extract O
related O
words O
which O
can O
well O
reflect O
the O
designer O
’s O
intention O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
can O
represent O
the O
intention O
of O
the O
web O
page O
designer O
in O
extremely O
high O
precision O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
experiments O
indicate O
that O
our O
extracting O
method O
can O
obtain O
related O
words O
in O
a O
high O
average O
precision O
. O

has O

in O

( O

) O

. O

Over O

. O

and O

yearg O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Advances O
in O
digital O
capture O
and O
storage O
technologies O
mean O
that O
it O
is O
now O
possible O
to O
capture O
and O
store O
one O
’s O
entire O
life O
experiences O
in O
a O
Human O
Digital O
Memory O
( O
HDM O

However O
, O
these O
vast O
personal O
archives O
are O
of O
little O
benefit O
if O
an O
individual O
can O
not O
locate O
and O
retrieve O
significant O
items O
from O
them O
. O

While O
potentially O
offering O
exciting O
opportunities O
to O
support O
a O
user O
in O
their O
activities O
by O
providing O
access O
to O
information O
stored O
from O
previous O
experiences O
, O
we O
believe O
that O
the O
features O
of O

datasets O
present O
new O

for O
information O
retrieval O
which O
must O
be O

if O

to O
be O

. O

Specifically O
we O
postulate O
that O
effective O
retrieval O
from O
HDMs O
must O
exploit O
the O
rich O
sources O
of O
context O
data O
which O
can O
be O
captured O
and O
associated O
with O
items O
stored O
within O

. O

User O
’s O
memories O
of O

stored O
within O
their O
memory O
archive O
will O
often O
be O
linked O
to O
these O
context O
features O
. O

We O
suggest O
how O
such O

metadata O
can O
be O
exploited O
within O
the O
retrieval O
process O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
investigate O
how O
retrieving O
information O
can O
be O
improved O
through O
task O
related O
indexing O
of O
documents O
based O
on O
ontologies O
. O

Different O
index O
types O
, O
varying O
from O
content­based O
keywords O
to O
structured O
task­based O
indexing O
ontologies O
are O
compared O
in O
an O
experiment O
that O
simulates O
the O
task O
of O
creating O
instructional O
material O
from O
a O
database O
of O
source O
material O
. O

To O
be O
able O
to O
judge O
the O
added O
value O
of O
task O
and O
ontology O
related O
indexes O
, O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
measures O
are O
extended O
with O
new O
measures O
reflecting O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
material O
produced O
with O
the O
retrieved O
information O
. O

The O
results O
of O
the O
experiment O
show O
that O
a O
structured O
task­based O
indexing O
ontology O
improves O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
product O
created O
from O
retrieved O
material O
only O
to O
some O
extent O
, O
but O
that O

. O

for O
a O

expressed O
in O

native O
language O
. O

While O

of O
relevant O
documents O
is O
slightly O
easier O
, O

the O

of O

and O

of O

to O

are O

- O

. O

for O

for O
a O
query O
expressed O
in O
a O
native O
language O
is O
presented O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

It O
uses O
insights O
from O
data O
mining O
and O

search O
for O

query O
and O

. O

It O

uses O

methods O
for O
the O

of O
documents O
in O
terms O
of O
relevance O
. O

Our O
approach O
compliments O
the O
search O
engine O
’s O
inbuilt O
methods O
for O
identifying O
and O
displaying O
the O
results O
of O
queries O
. O

A O
prototype O
has O
been O
developed O
for O

Tamil O
- O
English O
corpora O
. O

The O
initial O
results O
have O

that O
this O

is O
suitable O
for O
on O

of O
documents O
. O

To O
facilitate O
the O
search O
for O
relevant O
information O
across O
a O
setof O
online O
distributed O
collections O
, O
a O

information O
retrieval O
system O
typically O
represents O
each O
collection O
, O
centrally O
, O
by O
a O
set O
of O
vocabularies O
or O
sampled O
documents O
. O

Accurate O
retrieval O
is O
therefore O
related O
to O
how O
precise O
each O
representation O
reflects O
the O
underlying O
content O
stored O
in O
that O
collection O
. O

As O
collections O
evolve O
over O
time O
, O
collection O
representations O

also O
be O
updated O
to O
reflect O
any O
change O
, O
however O
, O

current O

not O

. O

examine O

of O
out O
- O
of O
- O
date O

on O

. O

Each O

evaluated O
on O

of O
forty O
- O
four O
dynamic O
collections O
over O
an O
eight O
- O
week O
period O
. O

Our O
findings O
show O
that O
out O
- O
of O
- O
date O
representations O
significantly O
degrade O
performance O
overtime O
, O
however O
, O
adopting O
a O
suitable O
update O
policy O
can O
minimise O
this O
problem O
. O

for O

of O

of O

information O

The O

with O

for O

of O

information O
from O
a O

of O
documents O
or O
corpuses O
. O

The O
quality O
of O
a O
system O
is O
measured O
by O
how O
useful O
it O
is O
to O
the O
typical O
users O
of O
the O
system O
. O

In O
the O
basic O
approach O
, O
a O
query O
is O
considered O
generated O
from O
an O
“ O
ideal O
” O
document O
that O
satisfies O
the O
information O
need O
. O

The O
system O
’s O
job O
is O
then O
to O
estimate O
the O
likelihood O
of O
each O
document O
in O
the O
collection O
being O
the O
ideal O
document O
and O
rank O

accordingly O
. O

The O
recent O

of O
related O
techniques O

new O

and O
estimation O
methods O
that O
are O
beyond O

of O

approaches O
. O

at O

near O

far O

. O

and O

, O
so O

to O

among O

. O

. O

, O

of O

to O

. O

However O

, O

. O

After O

of O

to O

, O

of O

too O
. O

, O

- O
sensitive O
risk O
minimum O

learning O
to O
rank O

data O

. O

, O

of O

- O

to O

. O

. O

is O
used O
in O
experiment O
. O

that O

- O

support O

learning O
to O

is O

than O

SVM O
on O
two O
rank O

data O
sets O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Requirements O
tracing O
is O
a O
central O
activity O
for O
software O
systems O
quality O
management O
. O

However O
, O
in O
large O
- O
scale O
evolving O
systems O
, O
maintaining O
traceability O
information O
manually O
can O
become O
a O
tedious O
task O
. O

To O
address O
this O
problem O
, O
several O
dynamic O
techniques O
were O
introduced O
to O
provide O
automatic O
traceability O
links O
generation O
. O

These O
techniques O
are O
usually O
based O
on O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
methods O
which O
link O
different O
artifacts O
based O
on O
their O
syntactic O
information O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
an O
ongoing O
experimental O
investigation O
of O
using O
semantics O
- O
enabled O
IR O
methods O
to O
generate O
traceability O
links O
. O

Our O
goal O
is O
to O
explore O
dynamic O
, O
accurate O
, O
and O
conceptually O
rich O
ways O
to O
generate O
and O
maintain O
traceability O
information O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
consider O
the O
problem O
of O
labeling O
a O
partially O
labeled O
graph O
. O

This O
setting O
may O
arise O
in O
a O
number O
of O
situations O
from O
survey O
sampling O
to O
information O
retrieval O
to O
pattern O
recognition O
in O
manifold O
settings O
. O

It O
is O
also O
of O
potential O
practical O
importance O
, O
when O
the O
data O
is O
abundant O
, O
but O
labeling O
is O
expensive O
or O
requires O
human O
assistance O
. O

Our O
approach O
develops O
a O
framework O
for O
regularization O
on O
such O
graphs O
. O

The O
algorithms O
are O
very O
simple O
and O
involve O
solving O
a O
single O
, O
usually O
sparse O
, O
system O
of O
linear O
equations O
. O

Using O
the O
notion O
of O
algorithmic O
stability O
, O
we O
derive O
bounds O
on O
the O
generalization O
error O
and O
relate O
it O
to O
structural O
invariants O
of O
the O
graph O
. O

Some O
experimental O
results O
testing O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
regularization O
algorithm O
and O
the O
usefulness O
of O
the O
generalization O
bound O
are O
presented O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
the O
task O
of O
text O
segmentation O
is O
approached O
from O
a O
topic O
modeling O
perspective O
. O

We O
investigate O
the O
use O
of O
latent O
Dirichlet O
allocation O
( O
LDA O
) O
topic O
model O
to O
segment O
a O
text O
into O
semantically O
coherent O
segments O
. O

A O
major O
benefit O
of O
the O
proposed O
approach O
is O
that O
along O
with O
the O
segment O
boundaries O
, O
it O
outputs O
the O
topic O
distribution O
associated O
with O
each O
segment O
. O

This O
information O
is O
of O
potential O
use O
in O
applications O
like O
segment O
retrieval O
and O
discourse O
analysis O
. O

The O
new O
approach O
outperforms O
a O
standard O
baseline O
method O
and O
yields O
significantly O
better O
performance O
than O
most O
of O
the O
available O
unsupervised O
methods O
on O
a O
benchmark O
dataset O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
construction O
of O
a O
single O
database O
private O
information O
retrieval O
system O
using O
fully O
homomorphic O
encryption O
. O

The O
construction O
results O
in O
a O
system O
with O
Ω(log2 O
n O
) O
communication O
complexity O
, O
and O
polylogarithmic O
computational O
overhead O
, O
in O
the O
size O
of O
the O
database O
. O

An O
improved O
construction O
is O
also O
proposed O
, O
which O
reduces O
the O
client O
’s O
communication O
overhead O
, O
and O
leaves O
open O
the O
possibility O
of O
reducing O
the O
total O
communication O
overhead O
. O

This O
results O
in O
a O
construction O
which O
has O
higher O
communication O
overhead O
than O
the O
current O
optimal O
system O
, O
but O
which O
is O
more O
computationally O
efficient O
. O

Rhetorical O
structure O
theory O
( O
RST O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
leading O
theories O
in O
computational O
linguistics O
. O

It O
improved O
the O
ability O
of O
extracting O
the O
semantic O
behind O
the O
processed O
text O
. O

Researches O
showed O
that O
different O
application O
( O
information O
retrieval O
, O
text O
summarization O
, O
text O
generation O
etc O
) O
have O
proved O
to O
give O
better O
result O
using O
RST O
. O

The O
applicability O
of O

to O
process O
and O
understand O
texts O
has O
been O
studied O
in O
several O
languages O
, O
but O
none O

. O

on O

in O

and O

the O
Arabic O
texts O

E O
cient O
and O
accurate O
information O
retrieval O
is O
a O

in O

. O

Since O

features O
for O

, O

are O

for O

- O

. O

Therefore O
, O

must O

for O

. O

, O

, O
and O
shape O
for O
Hong O
Kong O
's O
fashion O
, O

, O
and O

industry O
. O

Competitive O
learning O
is O
a O
stochastic O
and O
e O
cient O
clustering O
method O
which O
provides O
good O
cluster O
center O

for O

. O

and O

that O

algorithm O
works O
well O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Maintaining O
mobile O
agent O
availability O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
agent O
server O
crashes O
is O
a O
challenging O
issue O
since O
developers O
normally O
have O
no O
control O
over O
remote O
agent O
servers O
. O

A O
popular O
technique O
is O
that O
a O
mobile O
agent O
injects O
a O
replica O
into O
stable O
storage O
upon O
its O
arrival O
at O
each O
agent O
server O
. O

However O
, O
a O
server O
crash O
leaves O
the O
replica O
unavailable O
, O
for O
an O
unknown O
time O
period O
, O
until O
the O
agent O
server O
is O
back O
on O
- O
line O
. O

This O
paper O
uses O
exception O
handling O
to O
maintain O
the O
availability O
of O
mobile O
agents O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
agent O
server O
crash O
failures O
. O

Two O
exception O
handler O
designs O
are O
proposed O
. O

The O
first O
exists O
at O
the O
agent O
server O
that O
created O
the O
mobile O
agent O
. O

The O
second O
operates O
at O
the O
previous O
agent O
server O
visited O
by O
the O
mobile O
agent O
. O

Initial O
performance O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
although O
the O
second O
design O
is O
slower O
it O
offers O
the O
smaller O
trip O
time O
increase O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
agent O
server O
crashes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
production O
systems O
used O
by O
the O
subsea O
petroleum O
industry O
are O
knowledge O
and O
information O
intensive O
. O

Any O
problem O
needs O
to O
be O
solved O
quickly O
and O
efficiently O
avoiding O
decommissioning O
or O
waiting O
for O
the O
symptoms O
to O
be O
escalated O
. O

This O
requires O
precise O
information O
to O
be O
supplied O
on O
- O
time O
. O

For O
this O
reason O
we O
have O
proposed O
rule O
- O
based O
monitoring O
of O
device O
performance O
. O

However O
, O
covering O
all O
possible O
cases O
by O
rules O
is O
a O
labour O
- O
intensive O
and O
not O
trivial O
task O
. O

Therefore O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
scenario O
- O
driven O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
to O
complement O
rule O
- O
based O
monitoring O
. O

The O
main O
objective O
is O
to O
automatically O
formulate O
a O
query O
that O
is O
sent O
to O
a O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
information O
retrieval O
engine O
every O
time O
incomplete O
inference O
happens O
, O
i.e. O
when O
a O
specific O
case O
has O
no O
rules O
defined O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
supervised O
neural O
network O
has O
been O
used O
to O
classify O
pairs O
of O
terms O
as O
being O
multiwords O
or O
non O
- O
multiwords O
. O

Classification O
is O
based O
on O
the O
values O
yielded O
by O
different O
estimators O
, O
currently O
available O
in O
literature O
, O
used O
as O
inputs O
for O
the O
neural O
network O
. O

Lists O
of O
multiwords O
and O
nonmultiwords O
have O
been O
built O
to O
train O
the O
net O
. O

Afterward O
, O
many O
other O
pairs O
of O
terms O
have O
been O
classified O
using O
the O
trained O
net O
. O

Results O
obtained O
in O
this O
classification O
have O
been O
used O
to O
perform O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
detecting O
multiwords O
results O
in O
better O
performance O
of O
the O
IR O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
discussion O
takes O
the O
position O
that O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
fundamentally O
linguistic O
in O
nature O
in O
essence O
, O
the O
languages O
of O
document O
representation O
and O
searching O
are O
dialects O
of O
natural O
language O
. O

Because O
of O
this O
, O
the O
discipline O
of O
the O
Philosophy O
of O
Language O
should O
have O
some O
bearing O
on O
the O
problems O
of O
document O
representation O
and O
search O
query O
formulation O
. O

The O
philosophies O
of O
Austin O
, O
Searle O
, O
Grice O
and O
Wittgenstein O
are O
briefly O
examined O
and O
their O
relevance O
to O
information O
retrieval O
theory O
is O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

— O
Information O
Retrieval O
is O
a O
process O
made O
by O
a O
user O
to O
obtain O
relevant O
information O
which O
meets O
his O
needs O
using O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O
( O
IRS O
However O
the O
IRS O
shows O
some O
differences O
between O
user O
relevance O
and O
system O
relevance O
. O

These O
variations O
are O
primarily O
related O
to O
the O
imperfection O
of O
the O
indexing O
process O
( O
approach O
directly O
related O
to O
the O
IR O
) O
and O
specially O
the O
non O
consideration O
of O
the O
user O
profile O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
study O
about O
formalisms O
proposed O
in O
the O
literature O
and O
addresses O
some O
reflections O
to O
deal O
with O
problems O
arising O
from O
this O
survey O
, O
in O
order O
to O
satisfy O
the O
final O
user O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
process O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
apply O
a O
recent O
formalization O
of O
visualization O
as O
information O
retrieval O
to O
linear O
projections O
. O

We O
introduce O
a O
method O
that O
optimizes O
a O
linear O
projection O
for O
an O
information O
retrieval O
task O
: O
retrieving O
neighbors O
of O
input O
samples O
based O
on O
their O
low O
- O
dimensional O
visualization O
coordinates O
only O
. O

The O
simple O
linear O
projection O
makes O
the O
method O
easy O
to O
interpret O
, O
while O
the O
visualization O
task O
is O
made O
well O
- O
defined O
by O
the O
novel O
information O
retrieval O
criterion O
. O

The O
method O
has O
a O
further O
advantage O
: O
it O
projects O
input O
features O
, O
but O
the O
input O
neighborhoods O
it O
preserves O
can O
be O
given O
separately O
from O
the O
input O
features O
, O
e.g. O
by O
external O
data O
of O
sample O
similarities O
. O

Thus O
the O
visualization O
can O
reveal O
the O
relationship O
between O
data O
features O
and O
complicated O
data O
similarities O
. O

We O
further O
extend O
the O
method O
to O
kernel O
- O
based O
projections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Mathematical O
Morphology O
is O
a O
theory O
concerned O
with O
the O
processing O
and O
analysis O
of O
images O
or O
signals O
using O
filters O
and O
other O
operators O
that O
modify O
them O
. O

This O
paper O
studies O
how O
the O
original O
images O
and O
signals O
can O
be O
retrieved O
using O
fuzzy O
property O
- O
oriented O
concept O
lattices O
and O
fuzzy O
relation O
equations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Unified O
Medical O
Language O
System O
( O
UMLS O
) O
is O
an O
extensive O
collection O
of O
terms O
and O
concepts O
. O

The O
UMLS O
includes O
biomedical O
terms O
from O
standard O
classifications O
. O

The O
semantic O
network O
( O
SN O
) O
links O
the O
concepts O
, O
sometimes O
ambiguously O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
try O
, O
on O
one O
hand O
to O
describe O
the O
relationship O
between O
concepts O
more O
efficiently O
and O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
to O
find O
new O
relationships O
. O

Assuming O
that O
re O
- O
usability O
and O
automatic O
extraction O
of O
knowledge O
from O
existing O
thesaurus O
enables O
an O
improvement O
of O
the O
metatheasaurus O
, O
we O
cross O
the O
SN O
with O
linked O
concepts O
from O
the O
ADM O
( O
Assisted O
Medical O
Diagnosis O
Results O
are O
presented O
and O
our O
discussion O
concerns O
firstly O
the O
use O
of O
the O
SN O
only O
; O
secondly O
the O
improvement O
that O
allows O
pre O
- O
selection O
of O
linked O
concepts O
, O
and O
thirdly O
the O
possibility O
to O
coincide O
with O
other O
developments O
that O
improve O
the O
metathesaurus O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

BACKGROUND O
Millions O
of O
consumers O
perform O
health O
information O
retrieval O
( O
HIR O
) O
online O
. O

To O
better O
understand O
the O
consumers O
' O
perspective O
on O
HIR O
performance O
, O
we O
conducted O
an O
observation O
and O
interview O
study O
of O
97 O
health O
information O
consumers O
. O

METHODS O
Consumers O
were O
asked O
to O
perform O
HIR O
tasks O
and O
we O
recorded O
their O
view O
regarding O
performance O
using O
several O
differ O
- O
ent O
subjective O
measurements O
: O
finding O
the O
desired O
information O
, O
usefulness O
of O
the O
information O
found O
, O
satisfaction O
with O
the O
information O
, O
and O
intention O
to O
continue O
searching O
. O

Statistical O
analysis O
was O
applied O
to O
verify O
if O
the O
multiple O
subjective O
measurements O
were O
redundant O
. O

The O
measurements O
ranged O
from O
slight O
agreement O
to O
no O
agreement O
among O
them O
. O

A O
number O
of O
reasons O
were O
identified O
for O
this O
lack O
of O
agreement O
. O

Although O
related O
, O
the O
four O
subjective O
measurements O
of O
HIR O
performance O
are O
distinct O
from O
each O
other O
and O
carried O
different O
useful O
information O

-DOCSTART- O

Cutwidth O
minimization O
problem O
( O
CMP O
) O
consists O
of O
finding O
a O
linear O
layout O
of O
a O
graph O
such O
that O
the O
maximal O
number O
of O
cuts O
of O
a O
line O
separating O
consecutive O
vertices O
is O
minimized O
. O

CMP O
has O
significant O
applications O
in O
VLSI O
design O
, O
network O
communications O
, O
automatic O
graph O
drawings O
and O
information O
retrieval O
but O
it O
is O
proven O
to O
be O
a O
NP O
hard O
problem O
. O

Exact O
results O
of O
cutwidth O
are O
known O
for O
some O
classes O
of O
graphs O
but O
no O
algorithm O
has O
been O
proposed O
for O
the O
general O
graphs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
hybrid O
evolutionary O
algorithm O
( O
HEA O
) O
for O
CMP O
which O
uses O
the O
depth O
first O
search O
of O
graph O
to O
generate O
the O
initial O
population O
and O
incorporates O
the O
simulated O
annealing O
in O
the O
selection O
process O
. O

HEA O
achieves O
the O
known O
optimal O
cutwidth O
of O
all O
the O
standard O
graphs O
tested O
. O

We O
also O
conjecture O
the O
cutwidth O
of O
some O
circulant O
graphs O
and O
generalized O
Peterson O
graphs O
supported O
by O
our O
experimental O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
to O
report O
a O
work O
on O
evaluation O
of O
a O
knowledge O
based O
application O
that O
leads O
to O
the O
constitution O
of O
a O
benchmark O
such O
as O
those O
that O
exist O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
evaluations O
. O

This O
benchmark O
enables O
to O
perform O
quantitative O
evaluation O
by O
classic O
metrics O
such O
as O
precision O
and O
recall O
. O

We O
had O
also O
conducted O
a O
qualitative O
analysis O
that O
helps O
the O
elaboration O
of O
guidelines O
and O
methodological O
indications O
for O
ontology O
evaluation O
and O
enhancement O
. O

A O
Mongolian O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O
based O
on O
Solr O
is O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

The O
system O
implements O
the O
retrieval O
of O
Mongolian O
data O
store O
in O
our O
local O
machine O
. O

Firstly O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
built O
a O
Mongolian O
corpus O
with O
one O
million O
words O
, O
which O
has O
been O
corrected O
manually O
. O

Secondly O
, O
after O
being O
transcoded O
, O
theses O
data O
was O
represented O
by O
Latin O
characters O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
used O
Solr O
to O
build O
indexes O
and O
documents O
so O
that O
we O
do O
queries O
on O
millions O
of O
data O
within O
seconds O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Complex O
documents O
are O
used O
in O
many O
environments O
, O
e.g O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
Such O
documents O
contain O
subdocuments O
, O
which O
may O
contain O
further O
subdocuments O
, O
etc O
. O

Powerful O
tools O
are O
needed O
to O
facilitate O
their O
retrieval O
, O
restructuring O
, O
and O
analysis O
. O

Existing O
IR O
systems O
are O
poor O
in O
com O
plex O
document O
restructuring O
and O
data O
aggregation O
. O

However O
, O
in O
practice O
, O
IR O
system O
users O
would O
often O
want O
to O
obtain O
aggregation O
information O
on O
subdocuments O
of O
complex O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
address O
this O
problem O
and O
provide O
a O
truly O
declarative O
and O
powerful O
interface O
for O
the O
users O
. O

Our O
interface O
is O
based O
on O
the O
non O
- O
fkst O
- O
normal O
- O
form O
( O
NF2 O
) O
relational O
model O
. O

It O
allows O
intuitive O
and O
systematic O
modeling O
of O
complex O
documents O
. O

algebra O
- O

and O

- O

. O

Then O

. O

Incident O
reporting O
is O
becoming O
increasingly O
important O
in O
large O
organizations O
. O

Legislation O
is O
progressively O
being O
introduced O
to O
deal O
with O
this O
information O
. O

One O
example O
is O
the O
European O
Directive O
No O
. O
94/95/EC O
, O
which O
obliges O
airlines O
and O

bodies O
to O
collect O
and O

reports O
of O
incidents O
. O

Typically O

and O

and O

. O

However O

has O

that O

needs O
to O

in O

to O

with O

. O

of O
Case O

Reasoning O
and O
Information O

techniques O
in O
an O
integrated O
system O
. O

Preliminary O
results O
from O

are O
presented O
and O
are O
encouraging O
. O

Recently O
, O
various O
language O
model O
approaches O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
the O
information O
retrieval O
realm O
, O
with O
their O
promising O
performances O
in O
general O
document O
and O
Web O
page O
retrieval O
applications O
. O

Based O
on O
these O
achievements O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
investigate O
and O
discuss O
whether O
language O
model O
approaches O
can O
be O
adapted O
to O
content O
based O
image O
retrieval O
( O
CBIR O
based O
on O
the O
x0201C;bag O
of O
visual O
words&#x0201D O
; O
image O
representation O
. O

A O
critical O
element O
of O
language O
model O
estimation O
is O
smoothing O
, O
which O
adjusts O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
estimation O
to O
overcome O
the O
data O
sparseness O
problem O
. O

Therefore O
, O
we O
perform O

over O
different O

methods O
, O
strategies O
, O
and O
parameters O

to O
the O

. O

some O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
rank O
documents O
according O
to O
their O
relevance O
to O
users O
' O
input O
queries O
. O

State O
of O
the O
art O
commercial O
search O
engines O
( O
SEs O
) O
train O
ranking O
models O
and O
suggest O
query O
refinements O
by O
exploiting O
collective O
intelligence O
implicitly O
using O
global O
users O
' O
query O
logs O
. O

However O
, O
they O
do O
not O
provide O
an O
explicit O
channel O
for O
users O
to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
in O
the O
search O
process O
. O

By O
asking O
or O
discussing O
with O
other O
users O
on O
the O
fly O
, O
a O
user O
could O
find O
relevant O
information O
more O
conveniently O
and O
gain O
a O
better O
search O
experience O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
demo O
of O
novel O
Search O
Engine O
with O
a O
live O
Chat O
Channel O
( O
SECC O
SECC O
can O
group O
users O
automatically O
based O
on O
their O
input O
queries O
and O
allow O
them O
to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
in O
real O
time O
through O
a O
chat O
interface O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Searching O
for O
relevant O
information O
on O
the O
worldwide O
web O
is O
often O
a O
difficult O
and O
frustrating O
task O
. O

The O
information O
one O
is O
looking O
for O
, O
is O
hidden O
among O
thousands O
of O
documents O
returned O
by O
a O
search O
engine O
. O

One O
way O
of O
making O
search O
for O
relevant O
information O
easier O
, O
is O
to O
create O
better O
interfaces O
to O
the O
search O
engines O
; O
interfaces O
that O
facilitate O
quick O
and O
efficient O
browsing O
through O
the O
multitude O
of O
returned O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
FIRE O
a O
multimodal O
interface O
for O
information O
retrieval O
deployed O
in O
the O
Intelligent O
Room O
at O
the O
MIT O
AI O
Lab O
. O

FIRE O
differs O
from O
most O

interfaces O
for O
information O

in O
that O
it O
combines O
a O

of O

to O
improve O

process O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

) O

concepts O
, O
the O
answers O
provided O

. O

a O

used O
to O

information O

for O

system O
. O

have O
found O

is O

for O

to O
be O

and O

. O

and O

of O

from O
1989 O

in O
order O

how O
taxonomy O

have O
developed O
in O
this O
period O
. O

Based O
on O
62 O

most O

. O

. O

, O

amount O
of O

is O
available O
everywhere O
. O

Therefore O
, O

is O

important O
to O

this O
data O
in O
order O
to O
extract O
some O
useful O
information O
and O
to O
develop O
an O
algorithm O
based O
on O
this O
analysis O
. O

This O
can O
be O

data O
mining O
and O
machine O
learning O
. O

is O
an O

, O

is O
used O
to O
design O
algorithms O
based O
on O

between O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
performance O
of O
an O
IR O
system O
is O
deteriorated O
by O
factors O
including O
short O
and O
vague O
queries O
put O
up O
by O
the O
users O
, O
ever O
increasing O
volume O
of O
documents O
on O
the O
web O
, O
users O
not O
knowing O
their O
exact O
information O
need O
etc O
. O

Relevance O
feedback O
( O
RF O
) O
and O
web O
search O
document O
clustering O
are O
techniques O
to O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
. O

Relevance O
feedback O
provides O
a O
method O
to O
get O
more O
relevant O
search O
result O
from O
an O
IR O
system O
using O
documents O
that O
are O
marked O
relevant O
by O
the O
user O
as O
a O
feedback O
to O
reformulate O
query O
. O

This O
refined O
query O
is O
then O
used O
to O
retrieve O
the O
documents O
. O

In O
document O
clustering O
approach O
, O
the O
search O
result O
is O
divided O
into O
thematic O
groups O
where O
documents O
of O
one O
group O
are O
similar O
to O
each O
other O
and O
dissimilar O
to O
the O
documents O
of O
other O
groups O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
report O
on O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
relevance O
feedback O
technique O
as O
compared O
to O
document O
clustering O
in O
context O
of O
web O
information O
retrieval O
and O
why O
document O
clustering O
is O
the O
most O
preferred O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

It O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
the O
use O
of O
topic O
models O
for O
Information O
retrieval O
provides O
an O
increase O
in O
precision O
when O
used O
in O
the O
appropriate O
form O
. O

Latent O
Dirichlet O
Allocation O
( O
LDA O
) O
is O
a O
generative O
topic O
model O
that O
allows O
us O
to O
model O
documents O
using O
a O
Dirichlet O
prior O
. O

Using O
this O
topic O
model O
, O
we O
are O
able O
to O
obtain O
a O
fitted O
Dirichlet O
parameter O
that O
provides O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
for O
the O
document O
set O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
examine O
the O
sensitivity O
of O
LDA O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
Dirichlet O
parameter O
when O
used O
for O
Information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
compare O
the O
topic O
model O
computation O
times O
, O
storage O
requirements O
and O
retrieval O
precision O
of O
fitted O
LDA O
to O
LDA O
with O
a O
uniform O
Dirichlet O
prior O
. O

The O
results O
show O
there O
there O
is O
no O
significant O
benefit O
of O
using O
fitted O
LDA O
over O
the O
LDA O
with O
a O
constant O
Dirichlet O
parameter O
, O
hence O
showing O
that O
LDA O
is O
insensitive O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
Dirichlet O
parameter O
when O
used O
for O
Information O
retrieval O
. O

Abstract— O
To O
expand O
ontology O
meanings O
, O
an O
effective O
ontology O
mapping O
approach O
is O
needed O
to O
map O
related O
or O
similar O
knowledge O
from O
heterogeneous O
sources O
together O
. O

Especially O
, O
the O
mapping O
approach O
also O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
support O
image O
recognition O
in O
order O
to O
enhance O
its O
retrieval O
information O
. O

In O

paper O
, O

propose O
the O
ontology O
mapping O
with O
back O
propagation O
method O
to O
learn O
image O
objects O
, O
and O
link O
to O
their O
personal O
information O
to O
increase O
the O

of O
user O

. O

In O

, O

with O

information O

. O

the O

of O
overall O

can O
reach O

81.3 O
% O
. O

Mobile O
agents O
need O
to O
communicate O
and O
interact O
with O
each O
other O
to O
perform O
a O
global O
task O
. O

Coordination O
models O
deal O
with O
interactions O
between O
concurrent O
entities O
. O

A O
context O
- O
aware O
objective O
coordination O
model O
( O
COCM O
) O
is O
proposed O
for O
mobile O
agent O
applications O
. O

The O
context O
aware O
coordination O
model O
transfers O
interactions O
between O
agents O
from O
globally O
coupling O
interactions O
to O
locally O
uncoupling O
tuple O
space O
interactions O
. O

Programmable O
tuple O
space O
is O
introduced O
to O
solve O
the O
problems O
of O
context O
related O
coordination O
because O
of O
mobility O
and O
data O
heterogeneity O
in O
mobile O
agent O
systems O
. O

Furthermore O
a O
sample O
system O
on O
information O
retrieval O
in O
mobile O
agent O
applications O
is O
carried O
out O
to O
evaluate O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
proposed O
model O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
conventional O
boolean O
retrieval O
system O
does O
not O
provide O
ranked O
retrieval O
output O
because O
it O
can O
not O
compute O
similarity O
coefficients O
between O
queries O
and O
documents O
. O

Extended O
boolean O
models O
such O
as O
fuzzy O
set O
, O
Wailer O
- O
Kraft O
, O
Paice O
, O
P O
- O
Norm O
and O
Infinite O

- O
One O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
the O
past O
to O
support O
ranking O
facility O
for O
the O
boolean O
retrievats O
ystem O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
analyze O
the O
behaviourat O
aspects O
of O
the O
previous O
extended O
boolean O
models O
and O
address O
important O
mathematical O
properties O
to O
affect O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

We O
concentrate O
our O
description O
on O
evaluation O
formulas O
for O
AND O
and O
OR O
operations O
and O
query O
weights O
. O

Our O
analyses O
show O
that O
P O
- O
Nolm O
is O
the O
most O
suitable O
for O
achieving O
high O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

In O
this O
paper O

use O

metrics O
to O

the O
effect O
of O
a O
document O
sanitization O
process O
, O
measuring O
information O
loss O
and O
risk O
of O
disclosure O
. O

In O
order O
to O
sanitize O
the O
documents O
we O
have O
developed O
a O
semiautomatic O
anonymization O
process O
following O
the O
guidelines O
of O
Executive O
Order O
13526 O
( O
2009 O
) O
of O
the O
US O
Administration O
. O

It O
embodies O
two O
main O
steps O
i O
) O
identifying O
and O
anonymizing O
specific O
person O
names O
and O
data O
, O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
concept O
generalization O
based O
on O
WordNet O
categories O
, O
in O
order O
to O
identify O
words O
categorized O
as O
classified O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
manually O
revise O
the O
text O
from O
a O
contextual O
point O
of O
view O
to O
eliminate O
complete O
sentences O
, O
paragraphs O
and O
sections O
, O
where O
necessary O
. O

For O

INSPECTOR O
is O
a O
proprietary O
software O
system O
that O
is O
designed O
to O
be O
used O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
environment O
. O

Specifically O
, O
it O
is O
oriented O
toward O
the O
on O
- O
line O
retrieval O
of O
microfilmed O
documents O
through O
the O
indexing O
of O
certain O
key O
terms O
relating O
to O
the O
document O
itself O
. O

Items O
such O
as O
date O
, O
account O
number O
, O
name O
, O
customer O
name O
or O
number O
, O
purchase O
order O
number O
, O
etc O
. O
might O
be O
considered O
as O
key O
descriptive O
terms O
. O

Thus O
by O
indexing O
these O
elements O
on O
a O
randomly O
accessible O
disk O
drive O
, O
the O
location O
of O
the O
filmed O
image O
of O
< O
underline O
> O
all</underline O
> O
original O
documents O
pertaining O
to O
a O
particular O
descriptive O
term O
may O
be O
quickly O
located O
by O
the O
computer O
and O
the O
location O
displayed O
to O
the O
operator O
. O

Alternatively O
, O
if O
used O
in O
conjunction O
with O
the O
Eastman O
Kodak O
IC-5/PR-1 O
microfilm O
retrieval O
unit O
, O
the O
computer O
system O
will O
cause O
the O
film O
display O
unit O
to O
automatically O
advance O
to O
the O
correct O
frame(s O
keeping O
operator O
intervention O
to O
an O
absolute O
minimum O
. O

Key O
terms O
related O
to O
information O
searching O
and O

models O
are O
defined O
. O

A O
historic O

is O
provided O
to O

the O

of O
the O
four O
main O

that O
users O

with O
in O
their O
search O
process O
to O
offer O

the O
transition O
from O
manual O
information O
systems O
to O
computer O
- O
based O
information O

( O
IR O
) O
systems O
, O
as O
well O
as O
the O
transition O
from O
intermediary O
searching O
to O
end O
- O
user O
searching O
. O

Emphasis O
is O
placed O
on O
the O
review O
of O
different O
levels O
of O
information O
searching O
from O
search O
tactics O
/ O
moves O
, O
search O
strategies O
, O
and O
usage O
patterns O
, O
to O

models O
and O
associated O

in O

to O
task O
, O

knowledge O

. O

Search O

two O

, O

one O

process O
( O

) O

that O

process O
. O

In O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
queries O
in O
information O
retrieval O
can O
be O
improved O
through O
query O
expansion O
. O

This O
technique O
automatically O
introduces O
additional O
query O
terms O
that O
are O
statistically O
likely O
to O
match O
documents O
on O
the O
intended O
topic O
. O

However O
, O
query O
expansion O
techniques O
rely O
on O
fixed O
parameters O
. O

Our O
investigation O
of O
the O
effect O
of O
varying O
these O
parameters O
shows O
that O
the O
strategy O
of O
using O
fixed O
values O
is O
questionable O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
multiple O
- O
source O
information O
systems O
, O
attribute O
values O
are O
often O
assessed O
in O
linguistic O
terms O
belonging O
to O
different O
vocabularies O
. O

The O
request O
itself O
, O
which O
may O
include O
preferences O
, O
may O
be O
expressed O
using O
terms O
of O
another O
vocabulary O
, O
raising O
the O
problem O
of O
matching O
the O
query O
and O
the O
information O
in O
a O
semantic O
manner O
. O

The O
fuzzy O
pattern O
matching O
framework O
allows O
us O
to O
compute O
matching O
degrees O
between O
queries O
and O
data O
represented O
by O
fuzzy O
sets O
, O
even O
if O
they O
do O
not O
perfectly O
match O
. O

The O
qualitative O
pattern O
matching O
no O
longer O
requires O
a O
fuzzy O
set O
representation O
thanks O
to O
the O
use O
of O
ontologies O
for O
computing O
similarity O
degrees O
between O
terms O
. O

This O
allows O
us O
to O
deal O
with O
information O
querying O
in O
face O
of O
heterogeneous O
sources O
of O
information O
. O

This O
chapter O
presents O
this O
tool O
and O
its O
application O
to O
database O
and O
textual O
information O
retrieval O
on O
two O
examples O
. O

Post O
- O
war O
telecommunications O
network O
is O
completely O
damaged O
by O
aerial O
bombings O
as O
mostly O
towers O
and O
elevated O
structures O
are O
bombarded O
. O

This O
brings O
hindrances O
to O
the O
postwar O
information O
retrieval O
as O
it O
becomes O
extremely O
difficult O
to O

using O

. O

The O

( O

show O
me O

vector O
is O

and O
the O
most O
similar O

vectors O
from O
the O

are O
searched O
to O
display O

. O

this O
paper O
, O
we O
explore O
several O
statistical O
methods O
to O
find O
solutions O
to O
the O
problem O
of O

. O

Indeed O
, O

and O

new O

approach O
for O

translation O
derived O
from O

one O
, O
by O

a O
classical O
probability O
- O
possibility O
transformation O
of O

distributions O
, O
which O

certain O

in O

of O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
statistical O
machine O
translation O
( O
SMT O
) O
component O
of O
cross O
- O
lingual O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
systems O
is O
often O
regarded O
as O
black O
box O
that O
is O
optimized O
for O
translation O
quality O
independent O
from O
the O
retrieval O
task O
. O

In O
recent O
work O
[ O
10 O
SMT O
has O
been O
tuned O
for O
retrieval O
by O
training O
a O
reranker O
on O
$ O
k$-best O
translations O
ordered O
according O
to O
their O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
decomposable O
proxy O
for O
retrieval O
quality O
that O
obviates O
the O
need O
for O
costly O
intermediate O
retrieval O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
explore O
the O
full O
search O
space O
of O
the O
SMT O
decoder O
by O
directly O
optimizing O
decoder O
parameters O
under O
a O
retrieval O
- O
based O
objective O
. O

Experimental O
results O
for O
patent O
retrieval O
show O
our O
approach O
to O
be O
a O
promising O
alternative O
to O
the O
standard O
pipeline O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
new O
way O
of O
representing O
a O
symbolic O
picture O
by O
a O
two O
- O
dimensional O
string O
. O

A O
picture O
query O
can O
also O
be O
specified O
as O
a O
2-D O
string O
. O

The O
problem O
of O
pictorial O
information O
retrieval O
then O
becomes O
a O
problem O
of O
2-D O
subsequence O
matching O
. O

We O
present O
algorithms O
for O
encoding O
a O
symbolic O
picture O
into O
its O
2-D O
string O
representation O
, O
reconstructing O
a O
picture O
from O
its O
2-D O
string O
representation O
, O
and O
matching O
a O
2-D O
string O
with O
another O
2-D O
string O
. O

We O
also O
prove O
the O
necessary O
and O
sufficient O
conditions O
to O
characterize O
ambiguous O
pictures O
for O
reduced O
2-D O
strings O
as O
well O
as O
normal O
2-D O
strings O
. O

This O
approach O
thus O
allows O
an O
efficient O
and O
natural O
way O
to O
construct O
iconic O
indexes O
for O
pictures O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Emails O
, O
SMS O
, O
Chat O
transcripts O
and O
Social O
Network O
Messages O
play O
a O
vital O
role O
in O
present O
day‟s O
communication O
. O

These O
digitally O
communicated O
data O
sets O
are O
different O
from O
well O
typed O
English O
documents O
like O
books O
, O
news O
papers O
Etc O
in O
2 O
ways O
. O

One O
is O
the O
use O
of O
acronyms O
instead O
of O
typing O
full O
form O
of O
the O
term O
and O
another O
one O
is O
the O
existence O
of O
misspelled O
words O
. O

Because O
of O
these O
reasons O
, O
information O
retrieval O
methods O
used O
for O
analyzing O
well O
typed O
English O
documents O
may O
not O
be O
well O
suitable O
to O
analyze O
them O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
an O
information O
retrieval O
method O
to O
address O
the O
high O
recall O
requirements O
of O
retrieving O
information O
from O
digitally O
communicated O
data O
sets O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Research O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
has O
traditionally O
focused O
on O
serving O
the O
best O
results O
for O
a O
single O
query O
. O

Real O
users O
, O
however O
, O
often O
begin O
an O
interaction O
with O
a O
search O
engine O
with O
a O
sufficiently O
under O
- O
specified O
information O
need O
that O
they O
will O
need O
to O
reformulate O
before O
they O
find O
either O
the O
one O
thing O
or O
every O
thing O
they O
are O
looking O
for O
. O

We O
define O
a O
session O
as O
the O
sequence O
of O
queries O
and O
interactions O
that O
a O
user O
performs O
in O
service O
of O
an O
information O
need O
. O

The O
first O
workshop O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O

Over O
Query O
Sessions O
was O
held O
at O
ECIR O
2011 O

, O

the O

, O

, O
and O

IR O
system O
behavior O
over O
a O
session O
of O
reformulations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Three O
measures O
of O
effectiveness O
of O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
are O
formulated O
in O
terms O
of O
a O
user O
's O
estimate O
of O
the O
relevance O
of O
items O
output O
. O

In O
each O
instance O
the O
type O
of O
question O
logic O
allowed O
is O
postulated O
without O
specification O
of O
certain O
parameters O
which O
denote O
the O
weights O
attached O
to O
the O
question O
terms O
. O

The O
parameters O
are O
then O
determined O
to O
maximise O
the O
effectiveness O
. O

Their O
values O
depend O
on O
certain O
statistics O
of O
the O
data O
base O
. O

The O
search O
effectiveness O
is O
then O
optimum O
for O
the O
permitted O
form O
of O
question O
, O
the O
measure O
of O
output O
relevance O
, O
and O
for O
data O
bases O
of O
similar O
statistics O
. O

The O
techniques O
used O
are O
analogous O
to O
those O
used O
to O
define O
a O
matched O
filter O
and O
a O
Wiener O
root O
- O
meansquare O
filter O
. O

One O
of O
the O
core O
components O
in O

retrieval(IR O
) O

the O
document O
- O
term O
- O
weighting O
scheme O
. O

In O

, O

will O
propose O
a O

learning O
- O
based O
term O
- O

approach O
to O
improve O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
of O
vector O
space O
model O
in O

collections O
. O

We O
first O

simple O
learning O
system O
to O
weighting O
the O
index O
terms O
of O
documents O
. O

Then O

of O

. O

Our O

8 O

will O

that O
our O

outperforms O
classic O
tfidf O
weighting O
, O
about O
20%∼45 O
% O
. O

We O
observe O
through O

that O
an O

scheme O

. O

In O

of O

The O

of O

people O

on O

. O

Under O

how O

. O

and O
set O
how O
many O
times O
people O
obtain O
such O
information O
to O
be O
an O
observation O
item O
. O

In O
simulations O
, O
we O
show O
examples O
of O
observation O
for O
these O
items O
. O

The O
CiteSeer O
digital O
library O
stores O
and O
indexes O
research O
articles O
in O
Computer O
Science O
and O
related O
fields O
. O

Although O

is O
to O

search O
for O
scientific O
information O
, O
CiteSeer O
has O

, O

, O

. O

The O

in O

is O
done O
using O
automated O
techniques O
. O

Although O

accurate O
, O

still O

. O

Since O

of O

an O
approach O
to O

information O
from O
an O
external O

. O

The O

is O
a O
subset O
of O

, O
which O
is O

than O

. O

Our O

to O

new O
dataset O

to O

to O

) O

This O

of O
Probabilistic O
language O

. O

Through O
a O

Machine O

( O

) O

, O

. O

( O

) O

- O

column O
- O

. O

Supporting O

of O

and O

search O
in O
real O
- O
world O

spaces O
however O

than O
“ O
just O
” O
IR O
- O
on O
- O
DB O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
walk O
the O
reader O
through O

- O
strength O
solution O
to O
this O

application O
to O
a O

- O

. O

By O
treating O

search O
as O
first O
- O
class O
citizens O
of O

platform O
, O

of O

, O
this O
allows O
to O
model O
complex O
search O
engines O
without O
a O
need O
for O
programming O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Technology O
survey O
task O
deals O
with O
the O
retrieval O
of O
information O
that O
can O
best O
answer O
a O
scientific O
question O
. O

This O
task O
is O
more O
challenging O
in O
biomedical O
and O
chemistry O
domains O
due O
to O
diverse O
conventions O
applied O
for O
naming O
the O
entities O
. O

In O
order O
to O
address O
this O
challenge O
, O
the O
work O
reported O
here O
presents O
an O
ad O
- O
hoc O
retrieval O
task O
that O
has O
been O
evaluated O
during O
the O
TRECCHEM-2011 O
for O
its O
ability O
to O
support O
retrieval O
from O
the O

and O
chemistry O
literature O
. O

The O
core O
of O
the O
framework O
contains O
nearly O
1.3 O
million O

and O
full O
- O
text O
articles O
that O
were O
indexed O
with O
pre O
- O
selected O
biomedical O
concepts O
. O

Altogether O
, O
four O
runs O
were O
submitted O
based O
on O
different O
query O
formulation O
strategies O
and O
they O
exhibited O
competitive O
results O
. O

In O
this O

we O
present O

YaSemIR O
, O
a O

- O
source O
Semantic O

based O
on O
Lucene O
. O

It O
takes O
one O
or O
more O

in O

associated O
to O
each O

in O

format O
to O
index O
semantically O
a O
text O
collection O
. O

The O
terminology O
is O
used O
to O
annotate O
concepts O
in O
documents O
, O
while O
the O
ontology O
is O
used O
to O
exploit O
the O
taxonomic O
information O
in O
order O
to O
expand O
these O
with O
their O
subsumers O
. O

YaSemIR O
is O
a O

that O
may O
be O
configured O
to O
work O
with O
different O
ontologies O
, O
on O
various O

. O

- O
shot O
learning O
refers O
to O
understanding O
new O
concepts O
from O
only O
a O
few O
examples O
. O

We O
propose O
an O

- O

approach O
for O
this O
problem O
that O
is O
motivated O
by O

of O

all O
the O
available O
information O
in O
this O
low O
- O
data O
regime O
. O

We O
define O
a O
training O
objective O
that O
aims O
to O
extract O
as O
much O
information O

from O

training O
batch O
by O
effectively O
optimizing O
over O
all O
relative O
orderings O
of O

batch O
points O
simultaneously O
. O

In O

, O

view O

as O
a O
‘ O
query’ O
that O
ranks O

to O

and O

within O
the O

of O
structured O
prediction O
to O
optimize O
mean O
Average O
Precision O
over O
these O
rankings O
. O

Our O
method O
achieves O
impressive O
results O
on O
the O
standard O
few O
- O
shot O
classification O
benchmarks O
while O
is O
also O
capable O
of O
few O
- O
shot O
retrieval O
. O

. O

To O

- O

can O

services O
can O

built O
, O
and O
shallow O
MT O
can O

to O
provide O
useful O

. O

A O

of O

is O

. O

integrated O

and O
user O

to O
help O

quickly O

the O

of O

. O

Which O
is O
more O
important O
: O
the O
journey O
or O
the O
destination O
? O

Classical O
Interactive O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IIR O
) O
based O
on O
work O
- O
task O
scenarios O
usually O
puts O
the O
emphasis O
on O
the O
destination O
of O
the O
search O
( O
the O
results O
) O
with O
metrics O
such O
as O
precision O
and O
recall O
rather O
than O
the O
search O
journey O
. O

But O
social O
media O
, O
mobile O
devices O
and O
other O
pervasive O
technologies O
have O
made O
information O
accessible O
to O
people O
in O
leisure O
scenarios O
and O
open O
up O
casual O
- O
leisure O
search O
behaviours O
motivated O
by O
hedonistic O
need O
such O
as O
having O
fun O
, O
or O
relaxing O
instead O
of O
a O
well O
- O
defined O
information O
need O
. O

During O
search O
sessions O
users O
might O
find O
irrelevant O
information O
but O
they O
may O
keep O
exploring O
because O
the O
IR O
system O
satisfies O
their O
current O
leisure O
need O
. O

This O
research O
aims O
to O
understand O
better O
casual O
- O
leisure O
search O
behaviour O
and O
design O
new O
IR O
systems O
to O
support O
autotelic O
search O
experiences O
. O

The O

With O

ever O

number O

. O

, O

how O

to O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
number O
of O
scientific O
publications O
is O
constantly O
increasing O
, O
and O
the O
results O
published O
on O
Empirical O
Software O
Engineering O
are O
growing O
even O
faster O
. O

Some O
software O
engineering O
publishers O
have O
began O
to O
collaborate O
with O
research O
groups O
to O
make O
available O
repositories O
of O
software O
engineering O
empirical O
data O
. O

However O
, O
these O
initiatives O
are O
limited O
due O
to O
issues O
related O
to O
the O
available O
search O
tools O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
many O
researchers O
in O
the O
area O
have O
adopted O
a O
semi O
- O
automated O
approach O
for O
performing O
searches O
for O
systematic O
reviews O
as O
a O
mean O
to O
extract O
empirical O
evidence O
from O
published O
material O
. O

This O
makes O
this O
activity O
labor O
intensive O
and O
error O
prone O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
argue O
that O
the O
use O
of O
techniques O
from O
information O
retrieval O
, O
as O
well O
as O
text O
mining O

can O
support O
systematic O
reviews O
and O
improve O
the O
creation O
of O
repositories O
of O
SE O
empirical O
evidence O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
Concept O
Chain O
Queries O
( O
CCQ O
a O
special O
case O
of O
text O
mining O
in O
document O
collections O
focusing O
on O
detecting O
links O
between O
two O
topics O
across O
text O
documents O
. O

We O
interpret O
such O
a O
query O
as O
finding O
the O
most O
meaningful O
evidence O
trails O
across O
documents O
that O
connect O
these O
two O
topics O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
use O
link O
- O
analysis O
techniques O
over O
the O
extracted O
features O
provided O
by O
Information O
Extraction O
Engine O
for O
finding O
new O
knowledge O
. O

A O
graphical O
text O
representation O
and O
mining O
model O
is O
proposed O
which O
combines O
information O
retrieval O
, O
association O
mining O
and O
link O
analysis O
techniques O
. O

We O
present O
experiments O
on O
different O
datasets O
that O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
algorithm O
. O

Specifically O
, O
the O
algorithm O
generates O
ranked O
concept O
chains O
and O
evidence O
trails O
where O
the O
key O
terms O
representing O
significant O
relationships O
between O
topics O
are O
ranked O
high O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
amount O
of O
information O
on O
the O
Web O
is O
growing O
at O
an O
exponential O
rate O
. O

Information O
overload O
has O
brought O
a O
heavy O
burden O
for O
modern O
life O
. O

Keyword O
based O
search O
engines O
no O
long O
fill O
the O
needs O
of O
many O
people O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
an O
approach O
towards O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
by O
providing O
clustered O
Web O
pages O
and O
minded O
concepts O
based O
on O
results O
of O
search O
engines O
. O

Web O
page O
clustering O
is O
based O
on O
SVD O
( O
singular O
value O
decomposition O
concepts O
mining O
is O
implemented O
with O
a O
revision O
of O
Apriori O
algorithm O
. O

Experiments O
on O
three O
different O
kinds O
of O
keyword O
as O
queries O
to O
information O
retrieval O
have O
showed O
a O
promising O
result O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
scalable O
, O
parallel O
, O
relational O
- O
database O
driven O
information O
retrieval O
engine O
is O
described O
. O

To O
support O
portability O
across O
a O
wide O
- O
range O
of O
execution O
environments O
, O
including O
parallel O
multicomputers O
, O
all O
algorithms O
strictly O
adhere O
to O
the O
SQL-92 O
standard O
. O

By O
incorporating O
relevance O
feedback O
algorithms O
, O
accuracy O
was O
significantly O
enhanced O
over O
prior O
database O
- O
driven O
information O
retrieval O
efforts O
. O

Algorithmic O
modifications O
to O
our O
earlier O
prototype O
resulted O
in O
significantly O
enhanced O
scalability O
. O

Currently O
our O
information O
retrieval O
engine O
sustains O
near O
- O
linear O
speedups O
using O
a O
24-node O
parallel O
database O
machine O
. O

Experiments O
using O
the O
TREC O
data O
collections O
are O
presented O
to O
validate O
the O
described O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

-DOCSTART- O

The O

that O

to O

. O

The O

is O

large O

continuous O
speech O
recognizer O
which O
translates O
the O
query O
from O

text O
and O

it O
through O
an O
information O
retrieval O
engine O
to O

the O
set O
of O
relevant O
documents O
for O
that O
query O
. O

The O
system O
is O
designed O
for O
Spanish O
language O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
the O
system O
was O
evaluated O
using O
the O
test O
suites O
of O
CLEF O
, O
which O
is O
an O
evaluation O
forum O
similar O
to O
TREC O
. O

10 O
different O
speakers O
were O
recorded O
reading O
the O
queries O
. O

Results O
of O
different O
experiments O
are O
reported O
. O

Best O
results O
were O
obtained O
with O
a O
language O
model O
of O
60,000 O
words O
and O
medium O
length O
queries O
: O
loss O
of O
precision O
of O
23.79 O
compared O
to O
using O
perfect O
transcription O
of O
the O
queries O
) O
with O
a O
WER O
of O
18.4 O
Overall O
, O
these O
results O
are O
encouraging O
and O
provide O
a O
solid O
basis O
for O
the O
feasibility O
of O
building O

driven O

retrieval O
systems O
. O

IRiSS O

based O

an O

. O

IRiSS O

- O
in O
to O
the O
Visual O
Studio O
.NET O

development O
environment O
and O

to O
search O
a O
C O
project O
for O

of O
concepts O

as O
natural O
language O

. O

The O

of O

as O

list O
of O
software O
methods O
or O

, O
ordered O

the O
similarity O
to O

. O

A O

regular O

. O

existing O
“ O

” O

environment O

. O

of O

( O

) O

the O

by O

. O

of O

. O

only O

of O

, O

for O

, O

( O

) O

( O

) O

. O

Most O

path O

, O

hits O

. O

This O

that O

and O
structure O

. O

Content O
- O
Aware O

( O

) O

/ O
O O

. O

Extensive O

to O

[ O
11,14 O
] O
by O
a O

5 O
to O
200 O
on O
average O
. O

For O

, O

is O
over O
400 O
times O
faster O
than O
the O
DataGuide O
. O

The O
best O
results O
were O
achieved O
on O
large O

of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Ant O
World O
system O
facilitates O
collaborative O
information O
retrieval O
on O
the O
Internet O
, O
i.e. O
to O
make O
it O
easier O
to O
find O
useful O
information O
on O
the O
Internet O
. O

It O
asks O
users’ O
opinion O
on O
whether O
the O
documents O
they O
view O
are O
useful O
for O
their O
goals O
, O
and O
uses O
this O
feedback O
to O
guide O
other O
users O
in O
their O
searches O
. O

Our O
approach O
[ O
Z O
] O
is O
conceptually O
motivated O
by O
two O
important O
concepts O
from O
the O
domain O
of O
biology O
: O
neuronal O
networks O
and O
communication O
via O
pheromones O
. O

At O
the O
global O
level O
we O
enable O
the O
network O
to O
update O
its O
search O
information O
dynamically O
like O
a O
vast O
neuronal O
network O
, O
while O
at O
the O
local O
level O
the O
acquisition O
and O
deposition O
of O
link O
information O
is O
akin O
to O
pheromonic O
marking O
of O
sites O
and O
trails O
by O
insects O
. O

With O
this O
analogy O
in O
mind O
we O
will O
refer O
to O
the O
information O
about O
the O
value O
of O
links O
as O
Digital O
Information O
Pheromones O
( O
DIP O
The O
resulting O
network O
is O
continuously O
adaptive O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Users O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
( O
IRS O
) O
know O
and O
use O
many O
relationships O
between O
concepts O
a O
long O
time O
before O
these O
find O
their O
way O
into O
textbooks O
, O
printed O
thesauri O
, O
or O
classification O
schemes O
. O

We O
present O
here O
an O
IRS O
component O
called O
TEGEN O
, O
which O
taps O
this O
expertise O
by O
automatically O
drawing O
conclusions O
from O
actual O
search O
behavior O
about O
possible O
thesaurus O
entries O
. O

This O
is O
done O
during O
an O
iterative O
knowledge O
acquisition O
process O
: O
only O
after O
explicit O
or O
implicit O
confirmation O
by O
other O
users O
of O
the O
IRS O
during O
the O
knowledge O
verification O
process O
, O
the O
results O
are O
incorporated O
into O
a O
thesaurus O
. O

TEGEN O
is O
written O
in O
PASCAL O
using O
a O
knowledge O
- O
based O
programming O
method O
. O

It O
uses O
the O
relational O
database O
system O
IMF2 O
and O
is O
implemented O
at O
the O
Technical O
University O
of O
Munich O
and O
at O
the O
Leibniz O
Computer O
Center O
of O

Bavarian O
Academy O
of O
