. O


-DOCSTART- O

Temporal O
Information O
Retrieval O
is O
an O
emerging O
research O
area O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
immense O
amount O
of O
data O
in O
the O
WWW O
, O
and O
because O
the O
contents O
of O
documents O
are O
strongly O
time O
- O
dependent O
, O
it O
is O
very O
tough O
for O
the O
user O
to O
retrieve O
the O
relevant O
documents O
. O

Traditional O
Information O
Retrieval O
approaches O
based O
on O
topic O
similarity O
alone O
is O
not O
sufficient O
for O
the O
search O
in O
temporal O
document O
collections O
. O

The O
time O
dimension O
available O
in O
the O
documents O
should O
be O
incorporated O
with O
document O
ranking O
for O
efficient O
retrieval O
. O

This O
survey O
gives O
an O
introduction O
to O
Temporal O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
explores O
the O
different O
time O
- O
aware O
retrieval O
methods O
and O
temporal O
ranking O
methods O
for O
specific O
types O
of O
time O
- O
sensitive O
queries O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
interest O
for O
information O
retrieval O
has O
existed O
long O
before O
the O
Internet O
. O

Boolean O
retrieval O
is O
the O
most O
simple O
of O
these O
retrieval O
methods O
and O
relies O
on O
the O
use O
of O
Boolean O
operators O
. O

The O
terms O
in O
a O
query O
are O
linked O
together O
with O
AND O
, O
OR O
and O
NOT O
. O

This O
method O
is O
often O
used O
in O
search O
engines O
on O
the O
Internet O
because O
it O
is O
fast O
and O
can O
therefore O
be O
used O
online O
. O

This O
method O
has O
also O
its O
problems O
. O

The O
user O
has O
to O
have O
some O
knowledge O
to O
the O
search O
topic O
for O
the O
search O
to O
be O
efficient O
, O
e.g O
a O
wrong O
word O
in O
a O
query O
could O
rank O
a O
relevant O
document O
non O
relevant O
. O

The O
retrieved O
documents O
are O
all O
equally O
ranked O
with O
respect O
to O
relevance O
and O
the O
number O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
can O
only O
be O
changed O
by O
reformulating O
the O
query O
. O

We O
consider O
p O
- O
norm O
approach O
, O
Max O
score O
and O
wand O
exact O
optimization O
techniques O
for O
ranked O
keyword O
retrieval O
that O
can O
be O
adopted O
via O
low O
cost O
screening O
process O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Recommendation O
Systems O
apply O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
to O
select O
the O
online O
information O
relevant O
to O
a O
given O
user O
. O

Collaborative O
Filtering O
( O
CF O
) O
is O
currently O
most O
widely O
used O
approach O
to O
build O
Recommendation O
System O
. O

CF O
techniques O
uses O
the O
user’ O
behavior O
in O
form O
of O
user O
- O
item O
ratings O
as O
their O
information O
source O
for O
prediction O
. O

There O
are O
major O
challenges O
like O
sparsity O
of O
rating O
matrix O
and O
growing O
nature O
of O
data O
which O
is O
faced O
by O
CF O
algorithms O
. O

These O
challenges O
are O
been O
well O
taken O
care O
by O
Matrix O
Factorization O
( O
MF O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
attempt O
to O
present O
an O
overview O
on O
the O

of O
different O
MF O
model O
to O

of O

algorithms O
, O

can O

-DOCSTART- O

Existing O
work O
on O
indexing O
and O
retrieving O
documents O
from O
large O
on O
- O
line O
collections O
has O
had O
great O
success O
at O
treating O
both O
documents O
and O
queries O
as O
simple O
, O

collections O
of O
individual O
words O
( O
terms O
) O
with O
dependencies O
among O
these O
terms O
largely O
ignored O
. O

However O
, O
natural O
language O
text O
has O
a O
great O
deal O
of O
structure O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
at O
a O
scale O
close O
to O
that O
of O
the O
individual O
word O
, O
there O
are O
interactions O
and O
dependencies O
that O
many O

systems O
ignore O
. O

Those O

that O
do O
attempt O
to O
capture O
some O

dependencies O

so O
in O
rather O
indirect O
ways O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
semantic O
search O
system O
with O
the O
NLS O
( O
Natural O
Language O
Semantics O
) O
query O
parser O
and O
metadata O
tagging O
for O
unstructured O
data O
, O
which O
establishes O
high O
quality O
search O
, O
that O
is O
, O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
proposed O
system O
collects O
data O
from O
unstructured O
data O
sources O
and O
adds O
tags O
to O
the O
data O
as O
metadata O
. O

And O
, O
data O
with O
metadata O
becomes O
structured O
data O
with O
semantic O
information O
, O
which O
makes O
the O
data O
analysis O
much O
easier O
. O

And O
, O
the O
system O
parses O
the O
NLS O
input O
by O
the O
user O
to O
retrieve O
information O
from O
the O
search O
engine O
. O

Then O
, O
information O
result O
with O
search O
engine O
follows O
the O
common O
format O
that O
is O
easy O
to O
read O
and O
analyze O
. O

Besides O
, O
it O
will O
be O
clearly O
illustrated O
how O
much O
risk O
of O
the O
systems O
has O
been O
mitigated O
relative O
to O
the O
production O
of O
a O
full O
prototype O
systems O
. O

of O

factor O

sites O

target O
genes O

to O

of O
cellular O
process O
. O

either O

into O
first O
- O
hand O
gene O

could O

have O
limited O
accuracy O
due O
to O
the O

of O

. O

on O
well O
- O

-DOCSTART- O

Many O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
tasks O
, O
such O
as O
text O
search O
, O
text O
clustering O
or O
text O
categorization O
, O
have O
natural O
language O
documents O
as O
their O
first O
- O
class O
objects O
, O
in O
the O
sense O
that O
the O
algorithms O
that O
are O
meant O
to O
solve O
these O
tasks O
require O
explicit O
internal O
representations O
of O
the O
documents O
they O
need O
to O
deal O
with O
. O

In O
IR O
documents O
are O
usually O
given O
as O
extensional O
vectorial O
representation O
, O
in O
which O
the O
dimensions O

features O
) O
of O
the O
vector O
representing O
a O
document O
are O
the O
terms O
occurring O
in O
the O
document O
. O

The O
approach O
to O
term O
representation O
that O
the O
IR O
community O
has O
almost O
universally O
adopted O
is O
known O
as O
the O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
approach O
: O
a O
document O
dj O
is O
represented O
as O
a O
vector O
of O
term O
weights O
dj O
ω1j O
ωrj O
where O
r O
is O
the O
cardinality O
of O
the O
dictionary O
and O
0 O
ωkj O
1 O
represents O
the O
contribution O
of O
term O
tk O
to O
the O
specification O
of O
the O
semantics O
of O
dj O
This O
article O
analyses O
and O
compares O
many O
different O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
approaches O
. O

Background O
. O

Several O
researchers O
have O
proposed O
creating O
after O
- O
the O
- O
fact O
structure O
among O
software O
artifacts O
using O
trace O
recovery O
based O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

IR O
Due O
to O
significant O
variation O
points O
in O
previous O
studies O
, O
results O
are O
not O
easily O
aggregated O
. O

We O
aim O
at O
an O
overview O
picture O
of O
the O
outcome O
of O
previous O
evaluations O
. O

Based O
on O
a O
systematic O
mapping O
study O
, O
we O
perform O
a O
synthesis O
of O
published O
research O
. O

Our O
synthesis O
shows O
that O
there O
are O
no O
empirical O
evidence O
that O
any O
IR O
model O
outperforms O
another O
model O
consistently O
. O

We O
also O
display O
a O
strong O
dependency O
between O
the O
Precision O
and O
Recall O
( O
P O
- O
R O
) O
values O
and O
the O
input O
datasets O
. O

Finally O
, O
our O
mapping O
of O
P O
- O
R O
values O
on O
the O
possible O
output O
space O
highlights O
the O
difficulty O
of O
recovering O
accurate O
trace O
links O
using O
nai&#x0308;ve O
cut O
- O
off O
strategies O
. O

Conclusion O
. O

Based O
on O
our O
findings O
, O
we O
stress O
the O
need O
for O
empirical O
evaluations O
beyond O
the O
basic O
P O
- O
R O
' O
race O
' O
. O

A O
method O
to O
identify O
ontology O
components O
is O
presented O
in O

. O

The O

on O

Language O
Processing O
( O

) O

to O

concepts O
and O

among O

in O

field O
to O
build O
an O
ontology O
dedicated O
to O
information O

. O

Legal O

is O
performed O
are O

chosen O
as O

and O

. O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Word O
Sense O
Disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
) O
has O
become O
a O
popular O
method O
for O
solving O
the O
ambiguous O
meaning O
of O
the O
words O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
field O
area O
. O

Under O
the O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
community O
, O
WSD O
has O
been O
described O
as O
the O
task O
which O
able O
to O
select O
the O
appropriate O
meaning O
among O
the O
ambiguous O
meanings O
to O
a O
given O
word O
. O

Among O
three O
approaches O
, O
supervised O
based O
, O
unsupervised O
based O
and O
knowledge O
based O
approaches O
to O
WSD O
, O
this O
paper O
focuses O
on O
both O
supervised O
based O
and O
knowledge O
based O
approaches O
by O
proposing O
new O
Jaccard O
coefficient O
- O
based O
WSD O
algorithm O
to O
overcome O
the O
vocabulary O
miss O
match O
problem O
. O

WordNet O
and O
corpus O
external O
knowledge O
resources O
are O
utilized O
as O
the O
sense O
repositories O
by O
linking O
up O
with O
the O
new O
WSD O
algorithm O
to O
consider O
additional O
semantic O
for O
WSD O
. O

According O
to O
sample O
testing O
, O
IR O
system O
with O
new O
WSD O
algorithm O
attains O
more O
about O
20 O
percent O
of O
total O
accuracy O
rate O
than O
traditional O
IR O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Topic O
models O
are O
of O
broad O
interest O
. O

They O
can O
be O
used O
for O
query O
expansion O
and O
result O
structuring O
in O
information O
retrieval O
and O
as O
an O
important O
component O
in O
services O
such O
as O
recommender O
systems O
and O
user O
adaptive O
advertising O
. O

In O
large O
scale O
applications O
both O
the O
size O
of O
the O
database O
( O
number O
of O
documents O
) O
and O
the O
size O
of O
the O
vocabulary O
can O
be O
significant O
challenges O
. O

Here O
we O
discuss O
two O
mechanisms O
that O
can O
make O
scalable O
solutions O
possible O
in O
the O
face O
of O
large O
document O
databases O
and O
large O
vocabularies O
. O

The O
first O
issue O
is O
addressed O
by O
a O
parallel O
distributed O
implementation O
, O
while O
the O
vocabulary O
problem O
is O
reduced O
by O
use O
of O
large O
and O
carefully O
curated O
term O
set O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
proposed O
system O
and O
in O
the O
process O
break O
a O
previously O
claimed O
x2018;world O
record&#x2019 O
; O
announced O
April O
2010 O
both O
by O
speed O
and O
size O
of O
problem O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
use O
of O
a O
WordNet O
derived O
vocabulary O
can O
identify O
topics O
at O
par O
with O
a O
much O
larger O
case O
specific O
vocabulary O
. O

The O
ability O
to O
find O
relevant O
materials O
in O

document O
collections O
is O
a O
fundamental O
component O
of O
legal O
research O
. O

The O

of O

- O
readable O

has O
stimulated O

aimed O

of O

to O

. O

, O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
identification O
of O
noun O
compound O
as O
multi O
- O
word O
lexical O
units O
is O
very O
important O
task O
in O
natural O
language O
processing O
applications O
that O
require O
some O
degree O
of O
semantic O
interpretation O
such O
as O
, O
machine O
translation O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
text O
summarization O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
used O
the O
hybrid O
method O
for O
extracting O
the O
noun O
compound O
from O
Arabic O
corpus O
that O
is O
based O
on O
linguistic O
knowledge O
and O
statistical O
measures O
. O

For O
the O
candidate O
identification O
, O
we O
have O
used O
some O
linguistic O
analysis O
tools O
such O
as O
lemmatization O
and O
POS O
in O
order O
to O
filter O
the O
candidates O
and O
determine O
the O
variations O
. O

The O
association O
measures O
have O
been O
computed O
for O
each O
candidate O
to O
rank O
the O
candidates O
. O

After O
that O
, O
we O
have O
evaluated O
the O
association O
measures O
by O
using O
the O
n O
- O
best O
evaluation O
method O
. O

We O
reported O
the O
precision O
values O
for O
each O
association O
measure O
in O
each O
n O
- O
best O
list O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
showed O
that O
the O
log O
- O
likelihood O
ratio O
is O
the O
best O
association O
measure O
that O
achieved O
highest O
precision O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
design O
objectives O
and O
the O
mechanisms O
for O

those O
objectives O
are O
considered O
for O
each O
of O
three O
systems O
, O

In O

compared O
to O

how O
one O
system O

mechanisms O
may O
( O

) O

to O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
is O
an O
interdisciplinary O
research O
area O
that O
has O
grown O
out O
of O
the O
need O
to O
manage O
burgeoning O
collections O
of O
music O
in O
digital O
form O
. O

Its O
diverse O
disciplinary O
communities O
, O
exemplified O
by O
the O
recently O
established O
ISMIR O
conference O
series O
, O
have O
yet O
to O
articulate O
a O
common O
research O
agenda O
or O
agree O
on O
methodological O
principles O
and O
metrics O
of O
success O
. O

In O
order O
for O
MIR O
to O
succeed O
, O
researchers O
need O
to O
work O
with O
real O
user O
communities O
and O
develop O
research O
resources O
such O
as O
reference O
music O
collections O
so O
that O
the O
wide O
variety O
of O
techniques O
being O
developed O
in O
MIR O
can O
be O
meaningfully O
compared O
with O
one O
another O
. O

Out O
of O
these O
efforts O
, O
a O
common O
MIR O
practice O
can O
emerge O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
explore O
the O
limits O
of O
single O
- O
server O
computational O
private O
information O
retrieval O
( O
PIR O
) O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
preserving O
client O
access O
patterns O
leakage O
. O

We O
show O
that O
deployment O
of O
non O
- O
trivial O
single O
server O
PIR O
protocols O
on O
real O
hardware O
of O
the O
recent O
past O
would O
have O
been O
orders O
of O
magnitude O
less O
time O
- O
efficient O
than O
trivially O
transferring O
the O
entire O
database O
. O

We O
stress O
that O
these O
results O
are O
beyond O
existing O
knowledge O
of O
mere O
“ O
impracticality O
” O
under O
unfavorable O
assumptions O
. O

They O
rather O
reflect O
an O
inherent O
limitation O
with O
respect O
to O
modern O
hardware O
, O
likely O
the O
result O
of O
a O
communication O
- O
cost O
centric O
protocol O
design O
. O

We O
argue O
that O
this O
is O
likely O
to O
hold O
on O
non O
- O
specialized O
traditional O
hardware O
in O
the O
foreseeable O
future O
. O

We O
validate O
our O
reasoning O
in O
an O
experimental O
setup O
on O
modern O
off O
- O
the O
- O
shelf O
hardware O
. O

Ultimately O
, O
we O
hope O
our O
results O
will O
stimulate O
practical O
designs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Linked O
Open O
Data O
provides O
useful O
information O
on O
huge O
number O
of O
related O
entities O
gathered O
from O
numerous O
distributed O
data O
sources O
residing O
in O
the O
cloud O
. O

Searching O
for O
the O
required O
information O
in O
this O
big O
data O
is O
one O
of O
the O
key O
challenges O
, O
in O
the O
domain O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
where O
various O
studies O
have O
been O
conducted O
for O
multiple O
purposes O
. O

These O
studies O
highlighted O
three O
main O
challenges O
: O
querying O
ambiguity O
, O
information O
incompleteness O
, O
and O
visualization O
techniques O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
visualization O
approach O
which O
provides O
a O
more O
informative O
view O
and O
additional O
understanding O
of O
semantic O
data O
over O
DBpedia O
. O

We O
show O
that O
our O
proposed O
solution O
, O
considered O
as O
efficient O
for O
users O
, O
overcomes O
the O
other O
existing O
ones O
by O
hiding O
complexity O
, O
and O
by O
offering O
users O
the O
information O
of O
interest O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Predicting O
gender O
by O
names O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
interesting O
problems O
in O
the O
domain O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
expert O
finding O
task O
. O

In O
this O
research O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
machine O
learning O
approach O
for O
gender O
prediction O
task O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
feature O
, O
that O
is O
, O
combination O
of O
letters O
in O
names O
which O
gives O
86.54 O
% O
accuracy O
. O

Our O
data O
collection O
consists O
of O
3000 O
Urdu O
language O
names O
written O
using O
English O
Alphabets O
. O

This O
technique O
can O
be O
used O
to O
extract O
names O
from O
email O
addresses O
and O
hence O
is O
also O
valid O
for O
emails O
. O

To O
the O
best O
of O
our O
knowledge O
, O
it O
is O
the O
firstever O
attempt O
for O
predicting O
gender O
from O
Pakistani O
( O

) O
names O

using O
English O
alphabets O
. O

; O

; O

; O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
main O
obstacle O
in O
realizing O
semantic O
- O
based O
image O
retrieval O
is O
from O
the O
web O
that O
semantic O
description O
of O
an O
image O
is O
difficult O
to O
capture O
in O
low O
- O
level O
features O
. O

Text O
based O
keywords O
can O
be O
generated O
from O
web O
documents O
to O
capture O
semantic O
information O
for O
narrowing O
down O
the O
search O
space O
. O

We O
use O
an O
effective O
approach O
to O
integrate O
keywords O
, O
which O
is O
extracted O
from O
Web O
documents O
and O
low O
- O
level O
features O
such O
as O
color O
- O
texture O
features O
to O
take O
advantage O
of O
their O
complementing O
strengths O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
keywords O
can O
be O
replaced O
with O
low O
- O
level O
features O
for O
successful O
query O
refinement O
and O
improved O
precision O
of O
retrieval O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Conjunctive O
Boolean O
queries O
are O
a O
fundamental O
operation O
in O
web O
search O
engines O
. O

These O
queries O
can O
be O
reduced O
to O
the O
problem O
of O
intersecting O
ordered O
sets O
of O
integers O
, O
where O
each O
set O
represents O
the O
documents O
containing O
one O
of O
the O
query O
terms O
. O

But O
there O
is O
tension O
between O
the O
desire O
to O
store O
the O
lists O
effectively O
, O
in O
a O
compressed O
form O
, O
and O
the O
desire O
to O
carry O
out O
intersection O
operations O
efficiently O
, O
using O
non O
- O
sequential O
processing O
modes O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
evaluate O
intersection O
algorithms O
on O
compressed O
sets O
, O
comparing O
them O
to O
the O
best O
non O
- O
sequential O
arraybased O
intersection O
algorithms O
. O

By O
adding O
a O
simple O
, O
low O
- O
cost O
, O
auxiliary O
index O
, O
we O
show O
that O
compressed O
storage O
need O
not O
hinder O
efficient O
and O
high O
- O
speed O
intersec- O


-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
query O
optimisation O
uses O
semantic O
knowledge O
to O
transform O
a O
query O
into O
another O
form O
that O
can O
be O
executed O
in O
a O
more O
efficient O
manner O
but O
still O
yields O
the O
same O
result O
as O
the O
original O
query O
. O

Commonly O
this O
semantic O
knowledge O
is O
in O
the O
form O
of O
rules O
which O
are O
generated O
either O
during O
the O
query O
process O
itself O
or O
are O
constructed O
according O
to O
defined O
heuristics O
. O

Over O
a O
period O
of O
time O
the O
rule O
set O
may O
, O
therefore O
, O
become O
very O
large O
and O
the O
number O
of O
semantically O
equivalent O
queries O
which O
may O
be O
derived O
rises O
exponentially O
. O

The O
problem O
is O
to O
identify O
a O
near O
optimal O
alternative O
query O
in O
a O
time O
which O
is O
minimal O
and O
also O
short O
relative O
to O
the O
overall O
query O
execution O
time O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
of O
measuring O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
each O
rule O
and O
present O
a O
fast O
algorithm O
which O
selects O
the O
most O
cost O
effective O
transformations O
to O
yield O
a O
near O
optimal O
alternative O
query O
. O

Experiments O
carried O
out O
, O
on O
a O
large O
publicly O
available O
dataset O
, O
show O
worthwhile O
savings O
using O
the O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Cooperative O
search O
engine O
( O
CSE O
) O
is O
a O
distributed O
search O
engine O
, O
which O
can O
update O
index O
in O
very O
short O
time O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
fresh O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Although O
CSE O
's O
retrieval O
response O
time O
is O
longer O
than O
general O
centralized O
search O
engines O
, O
we O
develop O
some O
techniques O
to O
accelerate O
CSE O
's O
retrieval O
response O
time O
. O

As O
a O
routine O
work O
, O
CSE O
finds O
new O
documents O
and O
new O
words O
, O
and O
updates O
the O
index O
. O

In O
this O
daily O
update O
process O
, O
removed O
documents O
and O
words O
were O
not O
considered O
due O
to O
update O
processing O
speed O
. O

So O
we O
develop O
a O
new O
daily O
update O
process O
, O
differential O
update O
. O

Differential O
update O
considers O
added O
, O
modified O
and O
removed O
documents O
and O
words O
. O

We O
describe O
the O
behavior O
and O
evaluation O
of O
the O
differential O
update O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Arabic O
, O
the O
mother O
tongue O
of O
over O
300 O
million O
people O
around O
the O
world O
, O
is O
known O
as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
difficult O
languages O
in O
Automatic O
Natural O
Language O
processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
in O
general O
and O
information O
retrieval O
in O
particular O
. O

Hence O
, O
Arabic O
can O
not O
trust O
any O
web O
information O
retrieval O
system O
as O
reliable O
and O
relevant O
as O
Google O
search O
engine O
. O

In O
this O
context O
, O
we O
dared O
to O
focus O
all O
our O
researches O
to O
implement O
an O
Arabic O
web O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
entitled O
ARABIRS O
( O
ARABic O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O

Therefore O
, O
to O
launch O
such O
a O
process O
so O
long O
and O
hard O
, O
we O
will O
start O
with O
Indexing O
as O
one O
of O
the O
crucial O
steps O
of O
the O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

One O
critical O
aspect O
of O
an O
information O
system O
is O
indexing O
, O
that O
is O
, O
the O
representation O
of O
concepts O
to O
get O
a O
well O
formed O
data O
structure O
for O
search O
. O

Until O
recently O
, O
this O
task O
was O
accomplished O
by O
creating O
a O
bibliographic O
citation O
that O
references O
the O
original O
text O
. O

This O
approach O
allows O
a O
reduction O
in O
time O
and O
space O
bounds O
, O
although O
it O
does O
not O
facilitate O
the O
user O
from O
finding O
relevant O
information O
. O

In O
effect O
, O
it O
is O
the O
combination O
of O
the O
words O
and O
their O
semantic O
implications O
that O
contain O
the O
value O
of O
these O
concepts O
, O
which O
leads O
us O
to O
more O
sophisticated O
index O
representations O
, O
such O
as O
context O
- O
free O
grammars O
. O

This O
information O
is O
inherent O
in O
the O
document O
and O
query O
. O

So O
, O
matching O
becomes O
a O
possible O
mechanism O
to O
extract O
a O
common O
pattern O
from O
multiple O
data O
and O
we O
could O
use O
it O
for O
indexing O
and O
querying O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
workshop O
on O

took O
place O
at O

2014 O
in O

, O
Australia O

. O

of O

papers O

presentation O
. O

This O
allowed O
time O
for O
lively O
discussions O
among O
the O
participants O
. O

These O
showed O
the O
significant O
interest O
in O
the O
medical O
information O
retrieval O
domain O
and O
the O
many O
research O
challenges O
arising O
in O
this O
space O
which O
need O
to O
be O
addressed O
to O
give O
added O
value O
to O
the O

of O

ABSTRACT O
Text O
mining O
is O
an O
exciting O
research O
area O
that O
tries O
to O
discover O
useful O
information O
can O
be O
derived O
from O
this O
unstructured O
data O
by O
using O
techniques O
from O
machine O
learning O
, O
natural O
language O
processing O
( O
NLP O
data O
mining O
, O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
and O
knowledge O
management O
. O

Text O
mining O
involves O
the O
pre O
- O
processing O
techniques O
to O
harvest O
data O
and O
initial O
understanding O
of O
the O
patterns O
that O
exist O
in O
the O
data O
. O

The O
techniques O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
Categorization O
, O
Clustering O
and O
Summarization O
that O
are O
used O
to O
analyse O
these O
intermediate O
representations O
such O
as O
distribution O
analysis O
, O
association O
rules O
and O
visualisation O
of O
the O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Recent O
research O
and O
applications O
for O
evaluation O
and O
quality O
estimation O
of O
Machine O
Translation O
require O
statistical O
measures O
for O
comparing O
machine O
- O
predicted O
ranking O
against O
gold O
sets O
annotated O
by O
humans O
. O

Additional O
to O
the O
existing O
practice O
of O
measuring O
segment O
- O
level O
correlation O
with O
Kendall O
tau O
, O
we O
propose O
using O
ranking O
metrics O
from O
the O
research O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
such O
as O
Mean O
Reciprocal O
Rank O
, O
Normalized O
Discounted O
Cumulative O
Gain O
and O
Expected O
Reciprocal O
Rank O
. O

These O
reward O
systems O
that O
predict O
correctly O
the O
highest O
ranked O
items O
than O

one O

. O

tool O
” O

Query O

prediction O

, O

, O

coefficient O
, O

, O

. O

predictors O
that O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
perform O
well O
in O

runs O
. O

that O

current O
evaluation O
methodology O
is O
severely O
limited O
. O

Although O

can O
be O

to O

of O

single O
system O
, O
such O

is O
not O

a O
variety O
of O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
conclude O
that O
published O
results O
in O
the O
query O
difficulty O
area O
are O
generally O
not O
comparable O
, O
and O
recommend O
that O
prediction O
be O
evaluated O
against O
a O
spectrum O
of O
underlying O
search O
systems O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
a O

. O

Content O
Based O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
( O
CBIR O

suffer O

. O

are O
empowered O
when O
textual O
information O
is O
associated O
to O
the O
images O
in O
the O
collection O
and O
the O
CBIR O
is O
combined O
with O
a O
textual O
retrieval O
system O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
some O
experiments O
on O
applying O
text O
- O
based O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
on O
CBIR O
are O
reported O
. O

The O
results O
obtained O
show O
that O
these O
techniques O
may O
enhance O
the O
behavior O
of O
traditional O
fusion O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
our O
work O
in O
TREC O
2016 O
Clinical O
Decision O
Support O
Track O
. O

Among O
five O
submitted O
runs O
, O
two O
of O
them O
are O
based O
on O
summary O
topics O
and O
the O
others O
on O
note O
topics O
. O

In O
summary O
version O
run O
, O
we O
expand O
the O
original O
text O
with O
external O
data O
on O
web O
. O

Note O
topics O
are O
much O
longer O
than O
the O
summary O
, O
which O
contain O
a O
significant O
number O
of O
medical O
abbreviations O
as O
well O
as O
other O
linguistic O
jargon O
and O
style O
. O

An O
automatic O
method O
and O
a O
manual O
method O
are O
applied O
to O
process O
note O
topics O
. O

In O
the O
automatic O
method O
, O
we O
utilize O
KODA O
, O
a O
well O
- O
known O
knowledge O
drive O
annotator O
, O
to O
extract O
key O
information O
from O
the O
original O
text O
. O

In O
the O
manual O
one O
, O
we O
ask O
medical O
experts O
to O
diagnose O
and O
give O
their O
advice O
. O

For O
all O
of O
the O
five O
runs O
, O
we O
adopt O
Terrier O
search O
engine O
to O
implement O
various O
retrieval O
models O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
results O
combinations O
are O
applied O
to O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
our O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
evaluation O
has O
typically O
been O
performed O
over O
several O
dozen O
queries O
, O
each O
judged O
to O
near O
- O
completeness O
. O

There O
has O
been O
a O
great O
deal O
of O
recent O
work O
on O
evaluation O
over O
much O
smaller O
judgment O
sets O
: O
how O
to O
select O
the O
best O
set O
of O
documents O
to O
judge O
and O
how O
to O
estimate O
evaluation O
measures O
when O
few O
judgments O
are O
available O
. O

In O
light O
of O
this O
, O
it O
should O
be O
possible O
to O
evaluate O
over O
many O
more O
queries O
without O
much O
more O
total O
judging O
effort O
. O

The O
Million O
Query O
Track O
at O
TREC O
2007 O
used O
two O
document O
selection O
algorithms O
to O
acquire O
relevance O
judgments O
for O
more O
than O
1,800 O
queries O
. O

We O
present O
results O
of O
the O
track O
, O
along O
with O
deeper O
analysis O
: O
investigating O
tradeoffs O
between O
the O
number O
of O
queries O
and O
number O
of O
judgments O
shows O
that O
, O
up O
to O
a O
point O
, O
evaluation O
over O
more O
queries O
with O
fewer O
judgments O
is O
more O
cost O
- O
effective O
and O
as O
reliable O
as O
fewer O
queries O
with O
more O
judgments O
. O

Total O
assessor O
effort O
can O
be O
reduced O
by O
95 O
% O
with O
no O
appreciable O
increase O
in O
evaluation O
errors O
. O

recent O
years O
, O
quite O
a O

of O

to O

case O
- O

. O

patent O
and O

( O

) O
documents O
is O
quite O
critical O
in O
various O

and O
technology O
, O
marketing O
, O

right O

, O
business O
and O
so O
on O
. O

In O
the O
past O
, O
much O
of O
the O
focus O
for O
patent O
and O
IP O
retrieval O
has O
been O
from O
the O
database O
community O
, O
and O
not O
from O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
community O
. O

It O
is O
partly O
because O
the O
research O
and O
development O
in O
IR O
has O
tended O
to O
place O
emphasis O
on O
the O

systems O
, O
which O
are O
effective O
for O
any O
kinds O
of O
documents O
and O
any O
kinds O
of O

. O

It O
is O
partly O
because O
the O

of O

patents O
has O
highly O
specific O
characteristics O
both O

and O

of O
the O
text O
and O
has O
highly O
specialized O
ways O
of O
use O
by O
professional O
users O
. O

We O

to O

a O

technology O
for O

is O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Learning O
to O
rank O
has O
become O
a O
popular O
research O
topic O
in O
several O
areas O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
and O
machine O
learning O
. O

Pair O
- O
wise O
ranking O
, O
which O
learns O
all O
the O
order O
preferences O
between O
pairs O
of O
examples O
, O
is O
a O
typical O
method O
for O
solving O
the O
ranking O
problem O
. O

In O
pair O
- O
wise O
ranking O
, O
Rank O
SVM O
is O
a O
widely O
- O
used O
algorithm O
and O
has O
been O
successfully O
applied O
to O
the O
ranking O
problem O
in O
the O
previous O
work O
. O

However O
, O
Rank O
SVM O
suffers O
from O
the O
critical O
problem O
of O
long O
training O
time O
needed O
to O
deal O
with O
a O
huge O
number O
of O
pairs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
data O
selection O
technique O
, O
Pruned O
Rank O
SVM O
, O
that O
selects O
the O
most O
informative O
pairs O
before O
training O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
Pruned O
Rank O
SVM O
is O
on O
par O
with O
Rank O
SVM O
while O
using O
significantly O
fewer O
pairs O
. O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Bilingual O
parallel O
corpora O
are O
very O
important O
in O
various O
filed O
of O
natural O
language O
processing O
( O
NLP O

The O
quality O
of O
a O
Statistical O
Machine O
Translation O
( O
SMT O
) O
system O
strongly O
dependent O
upon O
the O
amount O
of O
training O
data O
. O

For O
low O
resource O
language O
pairs O
such O
as O
Persian O
- O
English O
, O
there O
are O
not O
enough O
parallel O
sentences O
to O
build O
an O
accurate O
SMT O
system O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
use O
the O
Wikipedia O
as O
a O
comparable O
corpus O
to O
extract O
Persian O
- O
English O
parallel O
sentences O
and O
eventually O
improve O
SMT O
system O
performance O
This O
new O
approach O
is O
also O
applicable O
to O
other O
low O
resource O
language O
pairs O
. O

In O
order O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarity O
score O
between O
two O
sentences O
, O
a O
novel O
bi O
- O
directional O
translation O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
proposed O
. O

A O
length O
penalty O
score O
is O
introduced O
to O
increase O
the O
accuracy O
of O
extracted O
corpus O
. O

Using O
extracted O
parallel O
sentences O
, O
the O
performance O
of O
existing O
Persian O
- O
English O
SMT O
is O
improved O
drastically O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
size O
of O
theWeb O
as O
well O
as O
user O
bases O
of O
search O
systems O
continue O
to O
grow O
exponentially O
. O

Consequently O
, O
providing O
subsecond O
query O
response O
times O
and O
high O
query O
throughput O
become O
quite O
challenging O
for O
large O
- O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Distributing O
different O
aspects O
of O
search O
( O
e.g O
crawling O
, O
indexing O
, O
and O
query O
processing O
) O
is O
essential O
to O
achieve O
scalability O
in O
large O
- O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
8th O
Workshop O
on O
Large O
- O
Scale O
Distributed O
Systems O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
LSDS O
- O
IR'10 O
) O
has O
provided O
a O
venue O
to O
discuss O
the O
current O
research O
challenges O
and O
identify O
new O
directions O
for O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
workshop O
contained O
two O
industry O
talks O
as O
well O
as O
six O
research O
paper O
presentations O
. O

The O
hot O
topics O
in O
this O
year O
's O
workshop O
were O
collection O
selection O
architectures O
, O
application O
of O
MapReduce O
to O

problems O
, O

search O
, O
geographically O
distributed O
web O
search O
, O
and O
optimization O
techniques O
for O
search O
efficiency O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
notion O
of O
ontology O
is O
introduced O
to O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
and O
semantic O
Web O
- O
oriented O
architecture O
of O
personalized O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
presented O
, O
and O
hierarchical O
tree O
model O
of O
local O
domain O
ontological O
repository O
of O
biomedical O
diseases O
system O
is O
constructed O
, O
in O
which O
the O
OWL O
language O
is O
used O
to O
detail O
annotate O
syntax O
and O
semantics O
of O
concepts O
, O
their O
attributes O
and O
relations O
among O
the O
concepts O
. O

Automatic O
acquirement O
of O
remote O
information O
on O
the O
Internet O
and O
pretreatment O
of O
local O
domain O
ontological O
repository O
are O
implemented O
by O
inference O
rules O
and O
information O
semantics O
- O
based O
intelligent O
clustering O
algorithm O
in O
the O
architecture O
, O
and O
preference O
database O
of O
doctors O
are O
managed O
logically O
according O
to O
their O
retrieval O
interests O
. O

Consequently O
, O
the O
system O
will O
meets O
the O
requirement O
of O
personalized O
intelligent O
information O
search O
for O
diseases O
diagnosis O
, O
and O
further O
improves O
recall O
and O
precision O
of O
information O
retrieval O
on O
biomedical O
diseases O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Modern O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
often O
employ O
document O
weighting O
models O
with O
many O
parameters O
that O
require O
to O
be O
appropriately O
set O
for O
effective O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

To O
obtain O
these O
parameter O
settings O
, O
quality O
training O
is O
usually O
required O
, O
where O
assessors O
have O
manually O
labelled O
the O
relevance O
of O
retrieved O
items O
for O
many O
queries O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O

A O

. O

- O

( O

MFSF O

a O

- O
bit O

For O

- O

MFSF O

. O

with O
datasets O
that O
are O
small O
, O
curated O
, O
homogeneous O
, O
and O
application O
- O
specific O
. O

However O
, O
the O
SW O
is O
large O
- O
scale O
, O
messy O
, O
and O
heterogeneous O
. O

We O
present O
a O
software O
project O
called O
WebQR O
in O
which O
we O
take O
a O
traditional O
KR O
application O
: O
Qualitative O
Reasoning O
, O
but O
implement O
it O
on O
top O
of O
the O
SW O
. O

We O
show O
that O
reimagining O
a O
traditional O
KR O
system O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
SW O
opens O
up O
many O
opportunities O
but O
presents O
several O
problems O
for O
application O
development O
as O
well O
. O

any O

long O

Microblogging O
sites O
are O
important O
sources O
of O
situational O
information O
during O
disaster O
situations O
. O

Hence O
it O
is O
important O
to O
design O
and O
evaluate O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
that O
retrieve O
information O
from O
microblogs O
during O
disaster O
situations O
. O

The O
primary O
contribution O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
develop O
a O
test O
collection O
for O
evaluating O
IR O
systems O
for O
microblog O
retrieval O
in O
disaster O
situations O
. O

The O
collection O
consists O
of O
about O
50,000 O
microblogs O
posted O
during O
the O
Nepal O
earthquake O
in O
April O
2015 O
, O
a O
set O
of O
five O
topics O
( O
information O
needs O
) O
that O
are O
practically O
important O
during O
a O
disaster O
, O
and O
the O
gold O
standard O
annotations O
of O
which O
microblogs O
are O
relevant O
to O
each O
topic O
. O

We O
also O
present O
some O
IR O
models O
that O
can O
be O
suitable O
in O
this O
evaluation O
setup O
, O
including O
a O
standard O
language O
model O
based O
retrieval O
, O
and O
word O
embedding O
based O
retrieval O
. O

We O
find O
that O
the O
term O
embedding O
based O
retrieval O
performs O
better O
for O
short O
, O
noisy O
microblogs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
human O
information O
retrieval O
system O
with O
face O
extraction O
and O
recognition O
function O
. O

A O
user O
watches O
the O
TV O
and O
if O
he O
encounters O
with O
interesting O
but O
unknown O
persons O
, O
he O
can O
specify O
them O
on O
the O
TV O
display O
by O
a O
mouse O
device O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
can O
extract O
and O
recognize O
the O
specified O
persons O
and O
retrieve O
their O
information O
from O
human O
information O
database O
via O
interet O
and O
output O
it O
on O
a O
display O
unit O
as O
well O
as O
through O
voice O
synthesizer O
. O

We O
used O
subspace O
methods O
for O
a O
face O
extraction O
and O
recognition O
. O

In O
face O
extraction O
, O
the O
sub O
- O
image O
within O
a O
scanning O
window O
is O
projected O
to O
facial O
subspace O
and O
it O
is O
regarded O
as O
the O
facial O
region O
, O
if O
the O
projection O
amount O
has O
a O
local O
peak O
. O

In O
face O
recognition O
, O
the O
facial O
subspace O
of O
individual O
person O
is O
constructed O
at O
first O
in O
an O
observation O
space O
using O
respective O
training O
data O
. O

Then O
an O
input O
facial O
region O
is O
projected O
to O
the O
individual O
subspace O
and O
classified O
into O
the O
person O
with O
the O
maximum O
projection O
amount O
. O

Nowadays O
, O
cross O
- O
lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
greatest O
challenges O
to O
deal O
with O
. O

Besides O
, O
one O

in O
the O
corpus O

to O
make O

to O
use O
in O
real O
situations O
some O

of O
IR O
such O
as O
the O
well O
- O
known O

model O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
have O
considered O
a O

reduction O
process O

on O
the O

of O
mid O
- O
frequency O
terms O
. O

Our O
approach O
enhances O
precision O
, O
but O
in O

to O
obtain O
a O
better O
recall O
, O

have O

an O

process O
based O
on O
the O
addition O
of O
co O
- O
ocurrence O
terms O
. O

By O
using O
this O
approach O
, O
we O
have O
obtained O
an O
improvement O
of O
40 O
% O
in O
the O
corpus O
of O
the O
BiEnEs O
WebCLEF O
2005 O
task O
. O

The O
obtained O
results O
in O
the O
current O
mixed O
monolingual O
task O
of O
the O
WebCLEF O
2006 O
have O
shown O
that O
the O
text O
enrichment O
must O
be O
done O
before O
the O
vocabulary O
reduction O
process O
in O
order O
to O
get O
the O
best O
performance O
. O

. O

. O

, O

. O

. O

input O

An O
algorithm O
for O
information O
retrieval O
is O
developed O
. O

It O
searches O
documents O
in O
a O
data O
set O
for O
those O
that O
are O
relevant O
to O
a O
user O
query O
. O

It O
applies O
the O
Golub O
Kahan O
bidiagonalization O
algorithm O
to O
the O
term O
document O
matrix O
, O
starting O
from O
the O
query O
vector O
. O

It O
is O
a O
further O
development O
of O
the O
vector O
space O
method O
, O
and O
needs O
less O
work O
and O
is O
more O
exible O
than O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
Numerical O
tests O
on O

small O
( O

( O

Times O
data O
from O

) O
data O
sets O
are O
reported O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Preferences O
have O
gained O
a O
tremendous O
impact O
on O
the O
personalization O
of O
user O
queries O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
an O
approach O
for O
preference O
elicitation O
in O
a O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
scenario O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
inductive O
preferences O
, O
which O
provide O
an O
intuitive O
means O
for O
stating O
preferences O
on O
actual O
result O
documents O
. O

Additionally O
, O
they O
do O
not O
demand O
further O
knowledge O
of O
the O
underlying O
retrieval O
system O
of O
the O
user O
. O

This O
work O
focuses O
on O
the O
user O
interaction O
of O
preference O
formulation O
and O
presents O
a O
prototype O
for O
a O
preference O
- O
based O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Medicine O
is O
a O
discipline O
that O
requires O
both O
judgment O
and O
action O
. O

Information O
science O
can O
help O
in O
several O
aspect O
. O

It O
can O
help O
the O
physician O
in O
collecting O
complete O
and O
relevant O
data O
. O

It O
can O
support O
the O
physician O
by O
providing O
access O
to O
the O
rapidly O
increasing O
sets O
of O
medical O
knowledge O
through O
different O
kinds O
of O
the O
data O
bases O
. O

It O
can O
facilitate O
the O
management O
of O
medical O
records O
which O
may O
be O
used O
for O
clinical O
follow O
- O
up O
of O
patients O
, O
clinical O
research O
, O
evaluation O
of O
medical O
action O
and O
education O
. O

In O
all O
these O
aspects O
, O
information O
science O
gives O
indirect O
help O
to O
medical O
decision O
. O

One O
of O
the O
main O
bottlenecks O
in O
the O
progress O
of O

Information O

( O
MIR O
) O

field O
is O
the O
limited O
access O
to O
common O
, O
large O
and O

audio O
databases O
that O
could O
serve O
for O
technology O
development O
and/or O

. O

aim O
of O
this O
paper O

to O
present O
in O
detail O
the O
ENST O
- O
Drums O
database O
, O

on O

and O
the O
recording O
process O
. O

This O
audiovisual O
database O
of O
drum O
performances O
by O
three O
professional O
drummers O
was O
recorded O
on O
8 O
audio O
channels O
and O
2 O

channels O
. O

The O

are O
fully O
annotated O
and O
will O
be O

for O

large O

, O
freely O

for O
research O

. O

large O

domains O
of O

and O

from O

. O

Day O
by O
day O
, O
the O
amount O
of O
digital O
data O
grows O
exponentially O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
these O
data O
come O
from O
heterogeneous O
content O
and O
structure O
resources O
. O

Both O
factors O
are O
the O
major O
handicap O
that O
limits O
the O
correct O
functioning O
of O
information O
systems O
. O

Being O
on O
the O
same O
wavelength O
, O
researchers O
have O
fixed O
as O
a O
challenge O
to O
reach O
targeted O
information O
retrieval O
which O
allows O
an O
easy O
access O
to O
the O
desired O
resource O
then O
return O
relevant O
and O
correct O
outcomes O
corresponding O
to O
a O
specific O
request O
. O

Therefore O
, O
semantic O
annotation O
is O
chosen O
as O
a O
paramount O
solution O
that O
may O
handle O
all O
these O
requirements O
, O
while O
ensuring O
a O
good O
understanding O
of O
document O
content O
then O
exploit O
and O
share O
it O
readily O
afterward O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
treat O
semantic O
annotation O
of O
documents O
using O
multi O
- O
ontologies O
, O
by O
stressing O
the O
effect O
of O
that O
on O
the O
relevance O
and O
the O
quality O
of O
semantic O
annotation O
results O
. O

We O
present O
a O
survey O
of O
different O
multi O
- O
ontologies O
based O
semantic O
annotation O
approaches O
and O
conclude O
with O
a O
synthesis O
of O
the O
study O
made O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
, O
document O
clustering O
has O
been O
receiving O
more O
and O
more O
attentions O
as O
an O
important O
and O
fundamental O
technique O
for O
unsupervised O
document O
organization O
, O
automatictopic O
extraction O
, O
and O
fast O
information O
retrieval O
or O
filtering O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
method O
for O
clustering O
documents O
using O
regularization O
. O

Unlike O
traditional O
globally O
regularized O
clustering O
methods O
, O
our O
method O
first O
construct O
a O
local O
regularized O
linear O
label O
predictor O
for O
each O
document O
vector O
, O
and O
then O
combine O
all O
those O
local O
regularizers O
with O
a O
global O
smoothness O
regularizer O
. O

So O
we O
call O
our O
algorithm O
< O
i O
> O
Clustering O
with O
Local O
and O
Global O
Regularization O
( O

We O
will O
show O
that O
the O
cluster O
memberships O
of O
the O
documents O
can O
be O
achieved O
by O
eigenvalue O
decomposition O
of O
a O
sparse O
symmetric O
matrix O
, O
which O
can O
be O
efficiently O
solved O
by O
iterative O
methods O
. O

Finally O
our O
experimental O
evaluations O
on O
several O
datasets O
are O
presented O
to O
show O
the O
superiorities O
of O
CLGR O
over O
traditional O
document O
clustering O
methods O
. O

of O

- O

( O

) O

to O
the O

. O

. O

. O

framework O
. O

An O
example O
process O

the O
task O
and O
some O
unresolved O
issues O
are O
discussed O
. O

 O
Legal O
texts O
usually O
have O
a O
complex O
structure O
and O

through O
them O
is O
a O
time O
- O
consuming O
and O

task O
. O

is O
essential O
to O
provide O

practitioners O

representation O
of O
the O
text O
. O

are O

which O
state O
the O
important O
issues O
present O
in O
the O
text O
, O
thus O
effectively O

. O

an O

for O
the O

of O

( O

from O

Documents O
FIRE O
2017 O
. O

proposed O
algorithm O
uses O
a O

step O

for O

from O

. O

I. O
Research O
Goals O
and O
Objectives O

The O
basic O
structure O
of O
the O
electrical O
power O
grid O
has O
remained O
unchanged O
for O
a O
hundred O
years O
. O

It O
has O
become O
increasingly O
clear O
, O
however O
, O
that O
the O
hierarchical O
, O
centrally O
- O
controlled O
grid O
of O
the O
twentieth O
century O
is O
ill O
- O
suited O
to O
the O
needs O
of O
the O
twenty O
- O
first O
. O

A O
future O
grid O
, O
in O
which O
modern O
sensors O
, O
communication O
links O
, O
and O
computational O
power O
are O
used O
to O
improve O
efficiency O
, O
stability O
, O
and O
flexibility O
, O
has O
become O
known O
as O
the O
“ O
smart O
grid O
Much O
of O
the O
hardware O
that O
will O
enable O
smart O
grids O
is O
in O
development O
or O
already O
exists O
smart O
” O
meters O
and O
appliances O
that O
respond O
to O
pricing O
signals O
, O
distributed O
wireless O
sensor O
networks O
, O
improved O
batteries O
for O
plug O
- O
in O
hybrid O
electric O
vehicles O
( O
PHEVs O
) O
that O
enable O
distributed O
storage O
, O
and O
so O
on O
. O

, O

, O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

An O
efficient O
immune O
query O
optimization O
algorithm O
for O
information O
retrieval O
is O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

The O
main O
characteristics O
of O
this O
algorithm O
are O
as O
follows O
: O

The O
genetic O
individual O
is O
a O
query O
, O
each O
gene O
corresponds O
to O
a O
weighted O
term O
, O
immune O
operator O
is O
used O
to O
avoid O
degeneracy O
, O
local O
search O
procedure O
based O
on O
the O
concept O
of O
neighborhood O
is O
used O
to O
speed O
up O
the O
abilities O
of O
finding O
better O
query O
vector O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
can O
efficiently O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
query O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
main O
area O
of O
work O
in O
computer O
music O
related O
to O
information O
systems O
is O
known O
as O
music O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MIR O
Databases O
containing O
musical O
information O
can O
be O
classified O
into O
two O
main O
groups O
: O
those O
containing O
audio O
data O
( O
digitized O
music O
) O
and O
those O
that O
file O
symbolic O
data O
( O
digital O
music O
scores O
The O
latter O
are O
much O
more O
abstract O
that O
the O
former O
ones O
and O
contain O
a O
lot O
of O
information O
already O
coded O
in O
terms O
of O
musical O
symbols O
, O
thus O
MIR O
algorithms O
are O
easier O
and O
more O
efficient O
when O
dealing O
with O
symbolic O
databases O
. O

The O
automatic O
extraction O
of O
the O
notes O
in O
a O
digital O
musical O
signal O
( O
automatic O
music O
transcription O
) O
permits O
applying O
symbolic O
processing O
algorithms O
to O
audio O
data O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
analize O
the O
performance O
of O
a O
neural O
approach O
and O
a O
well O
known O
non O
parametric O
algorithm O
, O
like O
nearest O
neighbours O
, O
when O
dealing O
with O
this O
problem O
using O
spectral O
pattern O
identification O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
novel O
way O
of O
examining O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
evaluation O
measures O
commonly O
used O
in O
information O
retrieval O
experiments O
. O

It O
validates O
several O
of O
the O
rules O
- O
of O
- O
thumb O
experimenters O
use O
, O
such O
as O
the O
number O
of O
queries O
needed O
for O
a O
good O
experiment O
is O
at O
least O
25 O
and O
50 O
is O
better O
, O
while O
challenging O
other O
beliefs O
, O
such O
as O
the O
common O
evaluation O
measures O
are O
equally O
reliable O
. O

As O
an O
example O
, O
we O
show O
that O
Precision O
at O
30 O
documents O
has O
about O
twice O
the O
average O
error O
rate O
as O
Average O
Precision O
has O
. O

These O
results O
can O
help O
information O
retrieval O
researchers O
design O
experiments O
that O
provide O
a O
desired O
level O
of O
confidence O
in O
their O
results O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
suggest O
researchers O
using O
Web O
measures O
such O
as O
Precision O
at O
10 O
documents O
will O
need O
to O
use O
many O
more O
than O
50 O
queries O
or O
will O
have O
to O
require O
two O
methods O
to O
have O
a O
very O
large O
difference O
in O
evaluation O
scores O
before O
concluding O
that O
the O
two O
methods O
are O
actually O
different O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Information O
Grid O
( O
InfoGrid O
) O
is O
a O
framework O
for O
building O
information O
access O
applications O
that O
provides O
a O
user O
interface O
design O
and O
an O
interaction O
model O
. O

It O
focuses O
on O
retrieval O
of O
application O
objects O
as O
its O
top O
level O
mechanism O
for O
accessing O
user O
information O
, O
documents O
, O
or O
services O
. O

We O
have O
embodied O
the O
InfoGrid O
design O
in O
an O
object O
- O
oriented O
application O
framework O
that O
supports O
rapid O
construction O
of O
applications O
. O

This O
application O
framework O
has O
been O
used O
to O
build O
a O
number O
of O
applications O
, O
some O
that O
are O
classically O
characterized O
as O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
considers O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
submitted O
to O
theMusic O
Information O
Retrieval O
Evaluation O
eXchange(MIREX O
) O

2011 O
“ O
AudioMelody O
Extraction O
” O
task O
. O

The O
proposed O
melody O
pitch O
extraction O
algorithm O
can O
be O
divided O
into O
three O
steps O
1 O
) O
a O
spectral O
analysis O
using O
variable O
length O
window O
2 O
) O
a O
pitch O
candidate O
estimation O
, O
and O
( O
3 O
) O
a O
pitch O
sequence O
identification O
. O

In O
the O
first O
step O
, O
the O
short O
- O
time O
Fourier O
transform O
( O
STFT O
) O
with O
variable O
length O
window O
is O
performed O
to O
be O
robust O
against O
dynamic O
variation O
of O
melody O
line O
. O

In O
the O
second O
step O
, O
melody O
pitch O
candidates O
of O
each O
frame O
are O
obtained O
from O
weights O
of O
a O
harmonic O
structure O
in O
the O
spectrum O
. O

In O
the O
third O
step O
, O
a O
single O
pitch O
sequence O
( O
melody O
line O
) O
is O
selected O
from O
the O
many O
possible O
pitch O
sequences O
based O
on O
the O
general O
properties O
of O
melody O
line O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Many O
inference O
problems O
are O
naturally O
formulated O
using O
hard O
and O
soft O
constraints O
over O
relational O
domains O
: O
the O
desired O
solution O
must O
satisfy O
the O
hard O
constraints O
, O
while O
optimizing O
the O
objectives O
expressed O
by O
the O
soft O
constraints O
. O

Existing O
techniques O
for O
solving O
such O
constraints O
rely O
on O
efficiently O
grounding O
a O
sufficient O
subset O
of O
constraints O
that O
is O
tractable O
to O
solve O
. O

We O
present O
an O
eager O
- O
lazy O
grounding O
algorithm O
that O
eagerly O
exploits O
proofs O
and O
lazily O
refutes O
counterexamples O
. O

We O
show O
that O
our O
algorithm O
achieves O
significant O
speedup O
over O
existing O
approaches O
without O
sacrificing O
soundness O
for O
real O
- O
world O
applications O
from O
information O
retrieval O
and O
program O
analysis O
. O

. O

state O

( O
FSM O

is O
needed O
in O
many O
natural O
language O
processing O
application O
such O
as O
: O
spelling O
normalization O
, O
stemming O
and O
stem O

Question O
answering O
systems O

in O
information O

systems O
( O
IR O
Most O

word O
removal O
techniques O
bases O
on O
a O

that O
contains O
a O

of O
stop O
- O
word O
, O
it O
is O
very O
expensive O
, O

takes O
too O
much O
time O
for O
searching O
process O
and O
required O
too O

to O

- O

. O

from O

, O
and O

that O

approximately O
to O
98 O
% O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
paper O
presents O
a O
research O
in O
Arabic O
Information O
Retrieval O

It O
surveys O
the O
impact O
of O
statistical O
and O

analysis O
of O
Arabic O
text O
in O
improving O
Arabic O
IR O

. O

We O
investigated O
the O
contributions O
of O
Stemming O
, O
Indexing O
, O
Query O
Expansion O
, O
Text O
Summarization O
( O
TS O
Text O
Translation O
, O
and O
Named O
Entity O
Recognition O
( O
NER O
) O
in O
enhancing O
the O
relevancy O
of O
Arabic O
IR O
. O

Our O
survey O
emphasizing O
on O
the O
quantitative O

measurements O
provided O
in O
the O
surveyed O
publications O
. O

The O
paper O
shows O
that O
the O

achieved O
significant O
enhancements O
especially O
in O
building O
accurate O
stemmers O
, O
with O
accuracy O
reaches O
97 O
and O
in O
measuring O
the O
impact O
of O
different O
indexing O
strategies O
. O

Query O
expansion O
and O
Text O
Translation O
showed O
positive O

. O

However O
, O
other O
tasks O
such O
as O
NER O
and O
TS O
still O
need O
more O
research O
to O
realize O

on O
Arabic O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O
provides O
an O
overview O
of O
studies O
that O
have O
used O
citation O
analysis O
in O
the O
field O
of O
humanities O
in O
the O
period O
1951 O
to O
2010 O
. O

The O
work O
is O
based O
on O
an O
exhaustive O
search O
in O
databases O
— O
particularly O
those O
in O
library O
and O
information O
science O
— O
and O
on O
citation O
chaining O
from O
papers O
on O
citation O
analysis O
. O

The O
results O
confirm O
that O
use O
of O
this O
technique O
in O
the O
humanities O
is O
limited O
, O
and O
although O
there O
was O
some O
growth O
in O
the O
1970s O
and O
1980s O
, O
it O
has O
stagnated O
in O
the O
past O
2 O
decades O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
work O
has O
been O
done O
by O
research O
staff O
, O
but O
almost O
one O
third O
involves O
library O
staff O
, O
and O
15 O
% O
has O
been O
done O
by O
students O
. O

The O
study O
also O
showed O
that O
less O
than O
one O
fourth O
of O
the O
works O
used O
a O
citation O
database O
such O
as O
the O
Arts O
Humanities O
Citation O
Index O
and O
that O
21 O
% O
of O
the O
works O
were O
in O
publications O
other O
than O
library O
and O
information O
science O
journals O
. O

The O
United O
States O
has O
the O
greatest O
output O
, O
and O
English O
is O
by O
far O
the O
most O
frequently O
used O
language O
, O
and O
13.9 O
% O
of O
the O
studies O
are O
in O
other O

. O

This O
poster O
describes O
a O
potential O
problem O
with O
a O
relatively O
well O
used O
measure O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
research O
: O
Kendall O
's O
Tau O
rank O
correlation O
coefficient O
. O

The O
coefficient O
is O
best O
known O
for O
its O
use O
in O

the O
similarity O
of O
test O
collections O
when O
ranking O
sets O
of O

. O

for O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Nepali O
is O
an O
inflectionally O
rich O
language O
. O

The O
unavailability O
of O
a O
stemmer O
, O
that O
effectively O
eliminates O
inflections O
, O
makes O
the O
task O
of O
searching O
, O
text O
mining O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
natural O
language O
processing O
in O
Nepali O
challenging O
. O

Stemming O
helps O
in O
mapping O
all O
variants O
of O
inflected O
words O
to O
their O
respective O
stems O
. O

Stemmers O
are O
widely O
used O
in O
Text O
Mining O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
systems O
to O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
such O
systems O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
new O
rule O
- O
based O
stemmer O
for O
Nepali O
language O
. O

We O
have O
composed O
128 O
suffix O
rules O
, O
which O
are O
executed O
in O
step O
- O
by O
- O
step O
and O
iterative O
manner O
to O
eliminate O
inflections O
. O

The O
proposed O
stemmer O
was O
tested O
on O
5000 O
Nepali O
words O
and O
the O
overall O
accuracy O
was O
around O
88.78 O
% O
. O

of O

for O
specific O
topics O
( O
for O
a O
given O
corpus O
) O
without O
a O
priori O

information O
. O

Information O
contained O
in O
the O

lead O
to O
new O
search O
formulations O
via O
automatic O
and/or O
user O

. O

This O

even O
being O

toward O
a O

. O

contains O

types O
of O

and O

information O
, O
which O
are O
difficult O
to O
extract O
, O

or O
trade O
- O
off O
in O
general O
video O

. O

on O

of O
different O

of O
information O

for O

from O

. O

A O

of O
different O

of O

are O

in O
most O

Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
despite O
being O
well O
studied O
, O
is O
computationally O
costly O
and O
arduous O
to O
scale O
. O

We O
explore O
lower O
- O
cost O
relaxations O
of O
information O
- O
theoretic O
PIR O
, O
based O
on O
dummy O
queries O
, O
sparse O
vectors O
, O
and O
compositions O
with O
an O

system O
. O

We O
prove O
the O

of O
each O
scheme O
using O
a O
flexible O
differentially O
private O
definition O
for O
private O
queries O
that O
can O
capture O
notions O
of O
imperfect O
privacy O
. O

We O
show O
that O
basic O
schemes O
are O
weak O
, O
but O
some O
of O

can O
be O
made O

by O
composing O

large O

systems O
. O

Measuring O
the O
information O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
of O
Web O
search O
engines O
can O
be O
expensive O
if O
human O
relevance O
judgments O
are O
required O
to O
evaluate O
search O
results O
. O

Using O
implicit O
user O
feedback O
for O
search O
engine O
evaluation O
provides O
a O
cost O
and O
time O
effective O
manner O
of O
addressing O
this O
problem O
. O

Web O
search O
engines O
can O
use O
< O
i O
> O
human O
evaluation</i O
> O
of O
search O
results O
without O
the O
expense O
of O
human O
evaluators O
. O

An O
additional O
advantage O
of O
this O
approach O
is O
the O
availability O
of O
real O
time O
data O
regarding O
system O
performance O
. O

Wecapture O
user O
relevance O
judgments O
actions O
such O
as O
print O
, O
save O
and O
bookmark O
, O
sending O
these O
actions O
and O
the O
corresponding O
document O
identifiers O
to O
a O
central O
server O
via O
a O
client O
application O
. O

We O
use O
this O
implicit O
feedback O
to O
calculate O
performance O
metrics O
, O
such O
as O
precision O
. O

We O
can O
calculate O
an O
overall O
system O
performance O
metric O
based O
on O
a O
collection O
of O
weighted O
metrics O
. O

This O

describes O
our O
Korean O
- O
Chinese O
cross O
- O
language O
information O

system O
for O
NTCIR-6 O
. O

Our O

uses O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
to O
perform O

translation O
. O

We O
expand O
our O
bilingual O
dictionary O
by O
extracting O
words O
and O
their O

from O
the O
Wikipedia O
site O
, O
an O

. O

resolve O
the O

of O

Western O
people O
's O

into O
Chinese O
, O

propose O
a O

method O
. O

We O
translate O
queries O
form O
Korean O
query O
to O
Chinese O
by O
using O
a O
co O
- O
occurrence O
method O
. O

When O

on O
the O
NTCIR-6 O
test O
set O
, O
the O
performance O
of O
our O
system O
achieves O

( O

) O
of O
0.1392 O
( O
relax O
score O
) O
for O
title O
query O
type O
and O
0.1274 O
( O
relax O
score O
) O
for O
description O
query O
type O
. O

In O
an O
era O
where O
highly O

Answering O
( O

) O
systems O
are O
being O
built O
using O
complex O

Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
algorithms O
, O
presenting O
the O
acquired O
answer O
to O
the O
user O
akin O
to O
a O
human O
answer O
is O
also O
crucial O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
an O
answer O
presentation O
strategy O
by O

in O
a O

which O
is O

the O

of O

question O
extracted O

. O

proved O
that O

is O
human O
- O

and O

for O

that O
70 O
% O
of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
) O
protocols O
aim O
at O
ensuring O
a O
user O
that O
he O
can O
retrieve O
some O
part O
Di O
of O
a O
distributed O
database O
D O
without O
revealing O
the O
index O
i O
to O
the O
server(s O

Most O
of O
known O
PIR O
protocols O
focus O
on O
decreasing O
the O
communication O
complexity O
between O
the O
client O
and O
the O
server(s O

Recently O
, O
the O
use O
of O
PIR O
codes O
by O
Fazeli O
et O
. O

al O
. O
also O
lead O
to O
a O
huge O
reduction O
of O
the O
storage O
overhead O
supported O
by O
the O
servers O
. O

However O
, O
only O
a O
few O
works O
address O
the O
issue O
of O
the O
computational O
complexity O
of O
the O
servers O
. O

In O

, O
we O
show O
that O
transversal O
designs O
and O
their O

provide O

low O

for O

, O
and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O
distinguishing O
- O
type O
attack O
to O
identify O
block O
ciphers O
. O

This O
attack O
utilises O
a O
multidisciplinary O
approach O
to O
the O
problem O
. O

It O
is O
grounded O
in O
a O
neural O
network O
, O
by O
means O
of O
a O
linguistic O
and O
an O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
, O
from O
patterns O
found O
on O
a O
set O
of O
cipher O
texts O
. O

This O
result O
is O
possible O
due O
to O
the O
existence O
of O
intrinsic O
properties O
in O
the O
mathematical O
basis O
of O
ciphers O
, O
which O
create O
signatures O
in O
the O
cipher O
texts O
. O

Experiments O
were O
performed O
on O
a O
set O
of O
cipher O
texts O
, O
which O
were O
encrypted O
by O
the O
finalist O
algorithms O
of O
AES O
contest O
: O
MARS O
, O
RC6 O
, O
Rijndael O
, O
Serpent O
and O
Two O
fish O
, O
with O
a O
unique O
128-bit O
key O
. O

The O
processes O
of O
clustering O
and O
classification O
were O
successful O
, O
allowing O
the O
formation O
of O
well O
- O
defined O
groups O
, O
where O
cipher O
texts O
encrypted O
by O
the O
same O
algorithm O
stayed O
close O
to O
each O
other O
, O
from O
a O
topological O
standpoint O
, O
which O
allow O
the O
identification O
of O
the O
cipher O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
extracts O
and O
organizes O
natural O
language O
information O
found O
in O
unstructured O
text O
. O

Many O
of O
the O
challenges O
faced O
by O
software O
engineers O
can O
be O
addressed O
using O
IR O
techniques O
on O
the O
unstructured O
text O
provided O
by O
source O
code O
and O
its O
associated O
documents O
. O

A O
survey O
of O
IR O
- O
based O
techniques O
applied O
to O
software O
engineering O
challenges O
during O
the O
initial O
development O
process O
is O
presented O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
the O
following O
problems O
are O
considered O
: O
requirements O
discovery O
, O
maintaining O
software O
repositories O
, O
establishing O
traceability O
links O
, O
efficient O
software O
reuse O
, O
and O
effective O
software O
metrics O
. O

These O
techniques O
highlight O
the O
bright O
future O
that O
IR O
brings O
to O
addressing O
SE O
problems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
: O
Common O
information O
- O
retrieval O
techniques O
either O
rely O
on O
a O
specific O
encoding O
of O
available O
information O
( O
e.g. O
fixed O
classification O
codes O
) O
or O
simple O
full O
- O
text O
analysis O
. O

Both O
approaches O
suffer O
from O
severe O
shortcomings O
. O

Using O
an O
ontology O
in O
order O
to O
explicate O
the O
vocabulary O
can O
help O
overcome O
some O
of O
these O
problems O
. O

When O
used O
for O
the O
description O
of O
available O
information O
as O
well O
as O
for O
query O
formulation O
an O
ontology O
serves O
as O
a O
common O
basis O
for O
matching O
queries O
against O
potential O
results O
on O
a O
semantic O
level O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

By O
and O
large O
, O
three O
classic O
framework O
models O
have O
been O
used O
in O
the O
process O
of O
retrieving O
information O
: O
Boolean O
, O
Vector O
Space O
and O
Probabilistic O
. O

Boolean O
model O
is O
a O
light O
weight O
model O
which O
matches O
the O
query O
with O
precise O
semantics O
. O

Because O
of O
its O
boolean O
nature O
, O
results O
may O
be O
tides O
, O
missing O
partial O
matching O
, O
while O
on O
the O
contrary O
, O
vector O
space O
model O
, O
considering O
term O
- O
frequency O
, O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
measures O
, O
achieves O
utmost O
relevancy O
in O
retrieving O
documents O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
implements O
and O
discusses O
the O
issues O
of O
information O
retrieval O
system O
with O
vector O
space O
model O
using O
MATLAB O
on O
Cranfield O
data O
collection O
of O
aerodynamics O
domain O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
consider O
optimization O
problems O
with O
polynomial O
inequality O
constraints O
in O
non O
- O
commuting O
variables O
. O

These O
non O
- O
commuting O
variables O
are O
viewed O
as O
operators O
acting O
on O
a O
Hilbert O
space O
whose O
dimension O
is O
not O
fixed O
, O
and O
the O
associated O
polynomial O
inequalities O
as O
semidefinite O
positivity O
constraints O
. O

Such O
problems O
arise O
naturally O
in O
quantum O
theory O
and O
quantum O
information O
science O
. O

To O
solve O
them O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
hierarchy O
of O
semidefinite O
programming O
relaxations O
which O
generates O
a O
monotone O
sequence O
of O
lower O
bounds O
on O
the O
global O
minimum O
of O
the O
original O
problem O
. O

In O
the O
case O
that O
the O
constraints O
defining O
our O
problem O
guarantee O
that O
the O
operators O
are O
bounded O
, O
we O
prove O
that O
our O
sequence O
of O
lower O
bounds O
converges O
to O
the O
global O
solution O
. O

We O
also O
introduce O
a O
criterion O
to O
detect O
whether O
the O
global O
optimum O
is O
reached O
at O
a O
given O
relaxation O
step O
and O
show O
how O
to O
extract O
a O
global O
optimizer O
from O
the O
solution O
of O
the O
corresponding O
semidefinite O
programming O
problem O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Arabic O
, O
the O
mother O
tongue O
of O
over O
300 O
million O
people O
around O
the O
world O
, O
is O
known O
as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
difficult O
languages O
in O
Automatic O
Natural O
Language O
processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
in O
general O
and O
information O
retrieval O
in O
particular O
. O

Hence O
, O
Arabic O
can O
not O
trust O
any O
web O
information O
retrieval O
system O
as O
reliable O
and O
relevant O
as O
Google O
search O
engine O
. O

In O
this O
context O
, O
we O
dared O
to O
focus O
all O
our O
researches O
to O
implement O
an O
Arabic O
web O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
entitled O
ARABIRS O
( O
ARABic O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O

Therefore O
, O
to O
launch O
such O
a O
process O
so O
long O
and O
hard O
, O
we O
will O
start O
with O
Indexing O
as O
one O
of O
the O
crucial O
steps O
of O
the O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
ITEM O
multilingual O
search O
engine O
. O

This O
search O
engine O
performs O
full O
lexical O
processing O
( O
morphological O
analysis O
, O
tagging O
and O
Word O
Sense O
Disambiguation O
) O
on O
documents O
and O
queries O
in O
order O
to O
provide O
language O
- O
neutral O
indexes O
for O
querying O
and O
retrieval O
. O

The O
indexing O
terms O
are O
the O
EuroWordNet O
/ O
ITEM O
InterLingual O
Index O
records O
that O
link O
wordnets O
in O
10 O
languages O
of O
the O
European O
Community O
( O
the O
search O
engine O
currently O
supports O
Spanish O
, O
English O
and O
Catalan O

The O
goal O
of O
this O
application O
is O
to O
provide O
a O
way O
of O
comparing O
in O
context O
the O
behavior O
of O
different O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
strategies O
for O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
and O
, O
in O
particular O
, O
different O
Word O
Sense O
Disambiguation O
strategies O
for O
query O
translation O
and O
conceptual O
indexing O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
approach O
in O
taking O
audio O
feature O
into O
account O
for O
better O
event O
recognition O
performance O
in O
recognizing O
complex O
events O
in O
real O
movies O
, O
since O
audio O
can O
provide O
strong O
evidence O
to O
certain O
events O
. O

In O
our O
method O
, O
local O
- O
space O
time O
feature O
and O
audio O
feature O
are O
firstly O
extracted O
from O
the O
video O
sequences O
and O
then O
an O
individual O
video O
sequence O
is O
represented O
as O
a O
SOFM O
density O
map O
; O
finally O
we O
integrate O
such O
density O
map O
with O
SVM O
for O
recognition O
events O
. O

To O
evaluate O
effectiveness O
of O
this O
method O
, O
this O
paper O
uses O
the O
public O
Hollywood O
dataset O
, O
in O
this O
dataset O
the O
shot O
sequences O
have O
been O
collected O
from O
32 O
different O
Hollywood O
movies O
and O
it O
includes O
8 O
event O
classes O
. O

The O
presented O
result O
justifies O
the O
proposed O
method O
explicitly O
, O
improve O
the O
average O
accuracy O
and O
average O
precision O
compared O
to O
other O
relative O
approaches O
2014 O
Elsevier O
B.V. O

All O
rights O
reserved O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
study O
of O
the O
“ O
real O
world O
” O

Web O
information O
searching O
behavior O
of O
206 O
college O
students O
over O
a O
10-month O
period O
showed O
that O
, O
contrary O
to O
expectations O
, O
the O
users O
adopted O
a O
more O
passive O
or O
browsing O
approach O
to O
Web O
information O
searching O
and O
became O
more O
eclectic O
in O
their O
selection O
of O
Web O
hosts O
as O
they O
gained O
experience O
. O

The O
study O
used O
a O
longitudinal O
transaction O
log O
analysis O
of O
the O
URLs O
accessed O
during O
5,431 O
user O
days O
of O
Web O
information O
searching O
to O
detect O
changes O
in O
information O
searching O
behavior O
associated O
with O
increased O
experience O
of O
using O
the O
Web O
. O

The O
findings O
have O
implications O
for O
the O
design O
of O
future O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
tools O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

User O
classification O
is O
a O
critical O
problem O
in O
modern O
library O
. O

But O
there O
has O
been O
little O
research O
into O
intelligent O
methods O
for O
improving O
the O
accuracy O
of O
user O
classification O
quality O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
HMM O
of O
library O
user O
classification O
( O
HMMLUC O
) O
to O
recognize O
the O
different O
type O
of O
library O
users O
. O

Using O
user O
previous O
behavior O
, O
HMMLUC O
learns O
a O
probabilistic O
model O
over O
the O
types O
of O
the O
user O
, O
and O
then O
applies O
this O
model O
at O
every O
step O
of O
the O
data O
entry O
process O
to O
improve O
user O
service O
quality O
. O

The O
experiment O
results O
proof O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
model O
is O
sound O
. O

The O
average O
precision O
ratio O
of O
the O
HMMLUC O
is O
91.2 O
, O
while O
the O
recall O
ratio O
is O
85.3 O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
academic O
research O
field O
of O
music O
information O
retrieval O
is O
expanding O
as O
rapidly O
as O
the O
MP3 O
collection O
of O
a O
stereotypical O
teenager O
. O

This O
could O
be O
no O
coincidence O
the O
benefit O
of O
an O
automated O
genre O
classifier O
increases O
when O
the O
music O
collection O
contains O
several O
thousand O
tracks O
. O

Of O
course O
, O
there O
are O
other O
applications O
of O
music O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Here O
we O
highlight O
a O
few O
that O
make O
use O
of O
a O
simple O
, O
visual O
, O
representation O
of O
an O
audio O
signal O
, O
based O
on O
three O
easy O
- O
to O
- O
calculate O
audio O
features O
. O

The O
applications O
range O
from O
simple O
navigation O
around O
consumer O
recordings O
of O
broadcasts O
, O
to O
a O
music O
video O
production O
planning O
tool O
, O
to O
a O
short O
term O
" O
Listen O
Again O
" O
eye O
- O
catching O
display O
. O

This O
document O
was O
originally O
published O
at O
the O
123rd O
Audio O
Engineering O
Society O
Convention O
, O
New O
York O
, O
USA O
, O
October O
2007 O

Additional O
key O
words O
: O


-DOCSTART- O

Accessing O
online O
information O
remains O
an O
inexact O
science O
. O

While O
valuable O
information O
can O
be O
found O
, O
typically O
many O
irrelevant O
documents O
are O
also O
retrieved O
and O
many O
relevant O
ones O
are O
missed O
. O

Terminology O
mismatches O
between O
the O
user O
's O
query O
and O
document O
contents O
is O
a O
main O
cause O
of O
retrieval O
failures O
. O

Expanding O
a O
user O
's O
query O
with O
related O
words O
can O
improve O
search O
performance O
, O
but O
the O
problem O
of O
identifying O
related O
words O
remains O
. O

This O
research O
uses O
corpus O
linguistics O
techniques O
to O
automatically O
discover O
word O
similarities O
directly O
from O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
untagged O
TREC O
database O
and O
to O
incorporates O
that O
information O
in O
the O
SMART O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

The O
similarities O
are O
calculated O
based O
on O
the O
contexts O
in O
which O
a O
set O
of O
target O
words O
appear O
. O

Using O
these O
similarities O
, O
user O
queries O
are O
automatically O
expanded O
, O
resulting O
in O
conceptual O
retrieval O
rather O
than O
requiring O
exact O
word O
matches O
between O
queries O
and O
documents O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
results O
and O
achievements O
of O
research O
in O
information O
retrieval O
have O
had O
little O
influence O
on O
the O
types O
of O
retrieval O
mechanism O
implemented O
in O
the O
large O
commercial O
on O
- O
line O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Commercial O
systems O
still O
use O
simple O
Boolean O
techniques O
while O
experiments O
have O
shown O
that O
other O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
those O
making O
use O
of O
relevance O
information O
, O
perform O
better O
. O

Reasons O
for O
this O
are O
suggested O
. O

A O
strategy O
is O
described O
for O
the O
implementation O
of O
high O
- O
powered O
techniques O
which O
overcomes O
this O
problem O
an O
intelligent O
terminal O
is O
used O
in O
conjunction O
with O
an O
existing O
commercial O
I. O
R. O
system O
. O

The O
added O
processing O
capability O
permits O
the O
implementation O
of O
more O
sophisticated O
retrieval O
techniques O
very O
cheaply O
. O

Retrieval O
methods O
that O
can O
be O
implemented O
on O
such O
a O
terminal O
used O
in O
this O
way O
are O
described O
. O

Particular O
emphasis O
is O
placed O
upon O
the O
practical O
implementation O
of O
a O
term O
weighting O
scheme O
based O
on O
relevance O
feedback O
information O
which O
generates O
a O
ranked O
list O
of O
documents O
in O
answer O
to O
a O
query O
. O

more O

. O

a O

of O

to O

in O

what O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
standard O
system O
- O
based O
evaluation O
paradigm O
has O
focused O
on O
assessing O
the O
performance O
of O
retrieval O
systems O
in O
serving O
the O
best O
results O
for O
a O
single O
query O
. O

Real O
users O
, O
however O
, O
often O
begin O
an O
interaction O
with O
a O
search O
engine O
with O
a O
sufficiently O
under O
- O
specified O
query O
that O
they O
will O
need O
to O
reformulate O
before O
they O
find O
what O
they O
are O
looking O
for O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
consider O
the O
problem O
of O
evaluating O
retrieval O
systems O
over O
test O
collections O
of O
multi O
- O
query O
sessions O
. O

We O
propose O
two O
families O
of O
measures O
: O
a O
model O
- O
free O
family O
that O
makes O
no O
assumption O
about O
the O
user O
's O
behavior O
over O
a O
session O
, O
and O
a O
model O
- O
based O
family O
with O
a O
simple O
model O
of O
user O
interactions O
over O
the O
session O
. O

In O
both O
cases O
we O
generalize O
traditional O
evaluation O
metrics O
such O
as O
average O
precision O
to O
multi O
- O
query O
session O
evaluation O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
behavior O
of O
the O
proposed O
metrics O
by O
using O
the O
new O
TREC O
2010 O
Session O
track O
collection O
and O
simulations O
over O
the O
TREC-9 O
Query O
track O
collection O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
expert O
systems O
for O
medical O
diagnosis O
have O
a O
major O
pitfall O
, O
in O
that O
it O
is O
difficult O
to O
adopt O
new O
knowledge O
, O
particularly O
from O
descriptive O
, O
incomplete O
and O
unstructured O
information O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
sounds O
a O
natural O
answer O
to O
these O
problems O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
information O
retrieval O
based O
approach O
to O
computer O
aided O
diagnosis O
in O
order O
to O
tackle O
this O
problem O
. O

Preliminary O
experimental O
results O
with O
traditional O
Chinese O
medicine O
expertise O
show O
that O
it O
can O
effectively O
help O
to O
diagnose O
based O
on O
the O
descriptive O
symptoms O
provided O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
standard O
criteria O
for O
evaluation O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
: O
effectiveness O
, O
efficiency O
, O
usability O
, O
satisfaction O
, O
cost O
- O
benefit O
seem O
as O
applicable O
to O
the O
interactive O
multimedia O
context O
as O
to O
the O
non O
- O

, O
text O
- O

in O

been O
developed O
. O

However O

, O

in O

are O
, O
for O
a O

almost O

for O

. O

of O
interactive O
multimedia O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
aspects O
of O
an O
information O
system O
being O
constructed O
for O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
in O

navigation O
applications O
. O

The O
system O
is O
based O
largely O
on O
digital O
nautical O
charts O
, O
and O
the O
construction O
of O
a O

of O
chart O
features O
and O
concepts O
related O
to O
the O
maritime O
navigation O
domain O
is O
described O
. O

This O

is O
used O
in O
formulating O
queries O
and O
sub O
- O
queries O
for O
disparate O
sources O
of O
information O
that O
supply O
information O
about O
navigation O
hazards O
, O
aids O
to O

, O
and O

. O

- O

. O
