edu O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
exploit O
user O
feedback O
by O
generating O
an O
optimal O
query O
with O
respect O
to O
a O
particular O
information O
need O
. O

Since O
obtaining O
an O
optimal O
query O
is O
an O
expensive O
process O
, O
the O
need O
for O
mechanisms O
to O
save O
and O
reuse O
past O
optimal O
queries O
for O
future O
queries O
is O
obvions O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
propose O
the O
use O
of O
a O
query O
base O
, O
a O
set O
of O
persistent O
past O
optimal O
queries O
, O
and O
investigate O
similarity O
measures O
between O
queries O
. O

The O
query O
base O
can O
be O
used O
either O
to O
answer O
user O
queries O
or O
to O
formulate O
optimal O
queries O
. O

We O
justify O
the O
former O
case O
analytically O
and O
the O
latter O
case O
by O
experiment O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
use O
game O
theory O
to O
analyze O
meta O
- O
learning O
algorithms O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
meta O
- O
learning O
is O
to O
determine O
which O
algorithm O
to O
apply O
on O
a O
given O
task O
. O

This O
is O
an O
instance O
of O
a O
more O
general O
problem O
that O
consists O
of O
allocating O
knowledge O
consumers O
to O
learning O
producers O
. O

Solving O
this O
general O
problem O
in O
the O
field O
of O
meta O
- O
learning O
yields O
solutions O
for O
related O
fields O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
and O
recommender O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

often O

in O

. O

that O

: O

up O

to O
the O

of O
previous O
experiences O
and O
cases O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
our O

to O
enhance O
literature O

based O
discovery O
with O

techniques O
. O

We O
propose O

of O

model O
and O

Concepts O
for O

model O
contributes O
to O
filter O
MEDLINE O
biomedical O
literature O
to O
the O
most O
relevant O
documents O
. O

concepts O
allows O
to O
quickly O
identifying O
candidate O
concepts O
that O
could O
potentially O
validate O
a O

. O

by O

's O
first O
discovery O
on O
fish O

and O

disease O
correlation O
. O

The O
obtained O
results O
show O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

Gardenfor O

Spaces[4 O

-DOCSTART- O

Data O
uncertainty O
is O
a O
main O
problem O
of O
information O
science O
to O
handle O
the O
data O
and O
information O
. O

Many O
theories O
handle O
the O
uncertainty O
problem O
. O

This O
paper O
analysed O
soft O
set O
reduction O
and O
described O
how O
a O
data O
set O
is O
converted O
into O
binary O
information O
system O
and O
also O
analysed O
how O
it O
is O
better O
to O
reduce O
the O
dimension O
of O
the O
data O
. O

Like O
rough O
set O
, O
fuzzy O
set O
etc O
are O
dealing O
with O
uncertainty O
. O

Soft O
set O
theory O
also O
do O
vital O
role O
to O
handle O
the O
uncertainty O
problem O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
study O
to O
understand O
the O
effect O
that O
negated O
terms O
( O
e.g O
no O
fever O
and O
family O
history O
( O
e.g O
family O
his- O
tory O
of O
diabetes O
have O
on O
searching O
clinical O
records O
. O

Our O
analysis O
is O
aimed O
at O
devising O
the O
most O
effective O
means O
of O
handling O
negation O
and O
family O
history O
. O

In O
doing O
so O
, O
we O
explicitly O
represent O
a O
clinical O
record O
according O
to O
its O
different O
content O
types O
: O
negated O
, O
family O
history O
and O
normal O
content O
; O
the O
retrieval O
model O
weights O
each O
of O
these O
separately O
. O

Empirical O
evaluation O
shows O
that O
overall O
the O
presence O
of O
negation O
harms O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
while O
family O
history O
has O
little O
effect O
. O

We O
show O
negation O
is O
best O
handled O
by O
weighting O
negated O
content O
( O
rather O
than O
the O
common O
practise O
of O
re- O
moving O
or O
replacing O
it O

However O
, O
we O
also O
show O
that O
many O
queries O
benefit O
from O
the O
inclusion O
of O
negated O
content O
and O
that O
negation O
is O
optimally O
handled O
on O
a O
per O
- O
query O
basis O
. O

Additional O
evaluation O
shows O
that O
adaptive O
handing O
of O
negated O
and O
family O
history O
content O
can O
have O
significant O
benefits O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O
is O
concerned O
with O
the O
design O
and O
implementation O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRS O
We O
show O
how O
theories O
and O
models O
from O
the O
domain O
of O
Human O
Computer O
Interaction O
( O
HCI O
) O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
the O
design O
of O
IRS O
. O

We O
first O
study O
the O
user O
’s O
tasks O
by O
modelling O
the O
mental O
activities O
of O
the O
user O
while O
accomplishing O
a O
task O
. O

Adopting O
a O
system O
perspective O
, O
we O
consider O
the O
processing O
tasks O
of O
an O
IRS O
and O
organize O
them O
in O
a O
design O
space O
. O

We O
then O
build O
upon O
the O
design O
space O
to O
consider O
the O
implications O
of O
such O
data O
processing O
and O
levels O
of O
abstraction O
on O
software O
design O
. O

Finally O
we O
present O
PAC O
- O
Amodeus O
, O
a O
software O
architecture O
model O
and O
illustrate O
the O
applicability O
of O
the O
approach O
with O
the O
implementation O
of O
an O
IRS O
: O
the O
TIAPRI O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

While O
there O
are O
now O
a O
number O
of O
languages O
and O
frameworks O
that O
enable O
computer O
- O
based O
systems O
to O
search O
stored O
data O
semantically O
, O
the O
optimal O
design O
for O
effective O
user O
interfaces O
for O
such O
systems O
is O
still O
unclear O
. O

Such O
interfaces O
should O
mask O
unnecessary O
query O
detail O
from O
users O
, O
yet O
still O
allow O
them O
to O
build O
queries O
of O
arbitrary O
complexity O
without O
significant O
restrictions O
. O

We O
developed O
a O
user O
interface O
supporting O
semantic O
query O
generation O
for O
SemanticOrganizer O
, O
a O
tool O
used O
by O
scientists O
and O
engineers O
at O
NASA O
to O
construct O
semantic O
networks O
of O
knowledge O
and O
data O
. O

Through O
this O
interface O
users O
can O
select O
node O
types O
, O
node O
attributes O
and O
node O
links O
to O
build O
ad O
- O
hoc O
semantic O
queries O
for O
searching O
the O
SemanticOrganizer O
network O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
GIR O
) O
system O
for O
answering O
geographic O
queries O
has O
to O
cope O
with O
various O
information O
needs O
, O
which O
have O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
contexts O
and O
implicit O
requirements O
. O

A O
user O
, O
for O
example O
, O
who O
is O
looking O
for O
a O
place O
to O
spend O
his O
or O
her O
holidays O
certainly O
has O
a O
different O
understanding O
of O
distance O
than O
a O
user O
looking O
for O
a O
bar O
in O
the O
city O

he O
or O
she O
lives O
in O
To O
get O
a O
better O
understanding O
of O
geographic O
information O
needs O
and O
their O
implications O
for O
GIR O
systems O

, O
we O
analysed O
real O
world O
( O
geographic O
) O
queries O
with O
regard O
to O
different O
facets O
of O
geographic O
references O
in O
queries O
. O

The O
results O
of O
this O
analysis O
are O
presented O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
the O
aim O
of O
which O
was O
a O
classification O
of O
the O
geographic O
aspects O
of O
information O
needs O
. O

We O
present O
empirical O
results O
and O
line O
out O
possible O
classification O
criteria O
, O
which O
could O
be O
helpful O
in O
designing O
GIR O
systems O
that O
are O
able O
to O
consider O
different O
semantics O
of O
geographic O
references O
in O
queries O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Experiments O
carried O
out O
within O
evaluation O
initiatives O
for O
information O
retrieval O
have O
been O
building O
a O
substantial O
resource O
for O
further O
detailed O
research O
. O

In O
this O
study O
, O
we O
present O
a O
comprehensive O
analysis O
of O
the O
data O
of O
the O
Cross O
Language O
Evaluation O
Forum O
( O
CLEF O
) O
from O
the O
years O
2000 O
to O
2004 O
. O

Features O
of O
the O
topics O
are O
related O
to O
the O
detailed O
results O
of O
more O
than O
100 O
runs O
. O

The O
analysis O
considers O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
systems O
for O
each O
individual O
topic O
. O

Named O
entities O
in O
topics O
revealed O
to O
be O
a O
major O
influencing O
factor O
on O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

They O
lead O
to O
a O
significant O
improvement O
of O
the O
retrieval O
quality O
in O
general O
and O
also O
for O
most O
systems O
and O
tasks O
. O

This O
knowledge O
, O
gained O
by O
data O
mining O
on O
the O
evaluation O
results O
, O
can O
be O
exploited O
for O
the O
improvement O
of O
retrieval O
systems O
as O
well O
as O
for O
the O
design O
of O
topics O
for O
future O
CLEF O
campaigns O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Informedia O
Digital O
Video O
Library O
Project O
at O
Carnegie O
Mellon O
University O
is O
creating O
large O
digital O
libraries O
of O
video O
and O
audio O
data O
available O
for O
full O
content O
retrieval O
by O
integrating O
natural O
language O
understanding O
, O
image O
processing O
, O
speech O
recognition O
and O
information O
retrieval O
. O

These O
digital O
video O
libraries O
allow O
users O
to O
explore O
multi O
- O
media O
data O
in O
depth O
as O
well O
as O
in O
breadth O
. O

The O
Informedia O
system O
automatically O
processes O
and O
indexes O
video O
and O
audio O
sources O
and O
allows O
selective O
retrieval O
of O
short O
video O
segments O
based O
on O
spoken O
queries O
. O

Interactive O
queries O
allow O
the O
user O
to O
retrieve O
stories O
of O
interest O
from O
all O
the O
sources O
that O
contained O
segments O
on O
a O
particular O
topic O
. O

Informedia O
will O
display O
representative O
icons O
for O
relevant O
segments O
, O
allowing O
the O
user O
to O
select O
interesting O
video O
paragraphs O
for O
playback O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
two O
Japanese O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
methods O
that O
enhance O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
by O
using O
relationships O
between O
words O
. O

The O
first O
method O
uses O
dependency O
relationships O
between O
words O
in O
a O
sentence O
, O
while O
the O
second O
method O
uses O
proximity O
relationships O
, O
in O
particular O
the O
ordered O
co O
- O
occurrence O
information O
of O
words O
in O
a O
sentence O
as O
an O
approximation O
to O
the O
dependency O
relationships O
between O
them O
. O

We O
construct O
these O
two O
methods O
on O
the O
Structured O
Index O
, O
which O
represents O
dependency O
relationships O
between O
words O
in O
a O
sentence O
as O
a O
set O
of O
binary O
trees O
. O

Structured O
Index O
is O
created O
by O
morphological O
analysis O
, O
dependency O
analysis O
, O
and O
compound O
noun O
analysis O
. O

We O
show O
the O
result O
of O
retrieval O
experiments O
using O
NTCIR–2 O
, O
and O
discuss O
the O
effect O
of O
using O
relationships O
between O
words O
on O
Japanese O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
TIPSTER O
collection O
is O
unusual O
because O
of O
both O
its O
size O
and O
detail O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
it O
describes O
a O
set O
of O
information O
needs O
, O
as O
opposed O
to O
traditional O
queries O
. O

These O
detailed O
representations O
of O
information O
need O
are O
an O
opportunity O
for O
research O
on O
different O
methods O
of O
formulating O
queries O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
several O
methods O
of O
constructing O
queries O
for O
the O
INQUERY O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O
and O
then O
evaluates O
those O
methods O
on O
the O
TIPSTER O
document O
collection O
. O

Both O
AdHoc O
and O
Routing O
query O
processing O
methods O
are O
evaluated O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
neural O
- O
network O
based O
selforganizing O
approach O
that O
enables O
visualization O
of O
the O
information O
retrieval O
while O
at O
the O
same O
time O
improving O
its O
precision O
. O

In O
computer O
experiments O
, O
two O
- O
dimensional O
documentary O
maps O
in O
which O
queries O
and O
documents O
were O
mapped O
in O
topological O
order O
according O
to O
their O
similarities O
were O
created O
. O

The O
ranking O
of O
the O
results O
retrieved O
using O
the O
maps O
was O
better O
than O
that O
of O
the O
results O
obtained O
using O
a O
conventional O
TFIDF O
method O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
the O
precision O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
was O
much O
higher O
than O
that O
of O
the O
conventional O
TFIDF O
method O
when O
the O
process O
was O
focused O
on O
retrieving O
highly O
relevant O
documents O
, O
suggesting O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
might O
be O
especially O
suited O
to O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
in O
which O
precision O
is O
more O
critical O
than O
recall O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
many O
applications O
involving O
multi O
- O
media O
data O
, O
the O
definition O
of O
similarity O
between O
items O
is O
integral O
to O
several O
key O
tasks O
, O
e.g O
nearest O
- O
neighbor O
retrieval O
, O
classification O
, O
and O
recommendation O
. O

Data O
in O
such O
regimes O
typically O
exhibits O
multiple O
modalities O
, O
such O
as O
acoustic O
and O
visual O
content O
of O
video O
. O

Integrating O
such O
heterogeneous O
data O
to O
form O
a O
holistic O
similarity O
space O
is O
therefore O
a O
key O
challenge O
to O
be O
overcome O
in O
many O
real O
- O
world O
applications O
. O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
multiple O
kernel O
learning O
technique O
for O
integrating O
heterogeneous O
data O
into O
a O
single O
, O
unified O
similarity O
space O
. O

Our O
algorithm O
learns O
an O
optimal O
ensemble O
of O
kernel O
transformations O
which O
conform O
to O
measurements O
of O
human O
perceptual O
similarity O
, O
as O
expressed O
by O
relative O
comparisons O
. O

To O
cope O
with O
the O
ubiquitous O
problems O
of O
subjectivity O
and O
inconsistency O
in O
multimedia O
similarity O
, O
we O
develop O
graph O
- O
based O
techniques O
to O
filter O
similarity O
measurements O
, O
resulting O
in O
a O
simplified O
and O
robust O
training O
procedure O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
participation O
of O
MRIM O
team O
in O
Task O
3 O
: O
Patient O
- O
Centered O
Information O
Retrieval O
- O
IRTask O
1 O
: O
Ad O
- O
hoc O
search O
of O
CLEF O
eHealth O
Evaluation O
lab O
2016 O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
task O
is O
to O
evaluate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
when O
searching O
for O
health O
content O
on O
the O
web O
. O

Our O
submission O
investigates O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
word O
embedding O
for O
query O
expansion O
in O
the O
health O
domain O
. O

We O
experiment O
two O
variants O
of O
query O
expansion O
method O
using O
word O
embedding O
. O

Our O
first O
run O
is O
a O
baseline O
system O
with O
default O
stopping O
and O
stemming O
. O

The O
other O
two O
runs O
expand O
the O
queries O
using O
two O
different O
word O

sources O
. O

Our O
three O
runs O
are O
conducted O
on O
Terrier O
platform O
using O
Dirichlet O
language O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

How O
useful O
are O
topic O
models O
based O
on O
song O
lyrics O
for O
applications O
in O
music O
information O
retrieval O
? O

Unsupervised O
topic O
models O
on O
text O
corpora O
are O
often O
difficult O
to O
interpret O
. O

Based O
on O
a O
large O
collection O
of O
lyrics O
, O
we O
investigate O
how O
well O
automatically O
generated O
topics O
are O
related O
to O
manual O
topic O
annotations O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
use O
the O
kurtosis O
metric O
to O
align O
unsupervised O
topics O
with O
a O
reference O
model O
of O
supervised O
topics O
. O

This O
metric O
is O
well O
- O
suited O
for O
topic O
assessments O
, O
as O
it O
turns O
out O
to O
be O
more O
strongly O
correlated O
with O
manual O
topic O
quality O
scores O
than O
existing O
measures O
for O
semantic O
coherence O
. O

We O
also O
show O
how O
it O
can O
be O
used O
for O
a O
detailed O
graphical O
topic O
quality O
assessment O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

An O
information O
theoretic O
approach O
to O
security O
and O
privacy O
called O
Secure O
And O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
SAPIR O
) O
is O
introduced O
. O

SAPIR O
is O
applied O
to O
distributed O
data O
storage O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
approach O
, O
random O
combinations O
of O
all O
contents O
are O
stored O
across O
the O
network O
. O

Our O
coding O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
Random O
Linear O
Fountain O
( O
RLF O
) O
codes O
. O

To O
retrieve O
a O
content O
, O
a O
group O
of O
servers O
collaborate O
with O
each O
other O
to O
form O
a O
Reconstruction O
Group O
( O
RG O
SAPIR O
achieves O
asymptotic O
perfect O
secrecy O
if O
at O
least O
one O
of O
the O
servers O
within O
an O
RG O
is O
not O
compromised O
. O

Further O
, O
a O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
) O
scheme O
based O
on O
random O
queries O
is O
proposed O
. O

The O
PIR O
approach O
ensures O
the O
users O
privately O
download O
their O
desired O
contents O
without O
the O
servers O
knowing O
about O
the O
requested O
contents O
indices O
. O

The O
proposed O
scheme O
is O
adaptive O
and O
can O
provide O
privacy O
against O
a O
significant O
number O
of O
colluding O
servers O
. O

We O
propose O
an O
online O
access O
panel O
to O
support O
the O
evaluation O
process O
of O
Interactive O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IIR O
) O
systems O
called O
IIRpanel O
. O

By O
maintaining O
an O
online O
access O
panel O
with O
users O
of O
IIR O
systems O
we O
assume O
that O
the O
recurring O
effort O
to O
recruit O
participants O
for O
web O
- O
based O
as O
well O
as O
for O
lab O
studies O
can O
be O
minimized O
. O

We O
target O
on O
using O
the O
online O
access O
panel O
not O
only O
for O
our O
own O
development O
processes O
but O
to O
open O
it O
for O
other O
interested O
researchers O
in O
the O
field O
of O
IIR O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
the O
concept O
of O
IIRpanel O
as O
well O
as O
first O
implementation O
details O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Internet O
of O
things O
has O
profoundly O
changed O
the O
way O
we O
imagine O
information O
science O
and O
architecture O
, O
and O
smart O
homes O
are O
an O
important O
part O
of O
this O
domain O
. O

Created O
a O
decade O
ago O
, O
the O
few O
existing O
prototypes O
use O
technologies O
of O
the O
day O
, O
forcing O
designers O
to O
create O
centralized O
and O
costly O
architectures O
that O
raise O
some O
issues O
concerning O
reliability O
, O
scalability O
, O
and O
ease O
of O
access O
which O
can O
not O
be O
tolerated O
in O
the O
context O
of O
assistance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
briefly O
introduce O
a O
new O
kind O
of O
architecture O
where O
the O
focus O
is O
placed O
on O
distribution O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
we O
respond O
to O
the O
first O
issue O
we O
encountered O
by O
proposing O
a O
lightweight O
and O
portable O
messaging O
protocol O
. O

After O
running O
several O
tests O
, O
we O
observed O
a O
maximized O
bandwidth O
, O
whereby O
no O
packets O
were O
lost O
and O
good O
encryption O
was O
obtained O
. O

These O
results O
tend O
to O
prove O
that O
our O
innovation O
may O
be O
employed O
in O
a O
real O
context O
of O
distribution O
with O
small O
entities O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
investigated O
two O
strategies O
for O
improving O
Information O
Retrieval O
thanks O
to O
incoming O
and O
outgoing O
citations O
. O

We O
first O
started O
from O
settings O
that O
worked O
last O
year O
and O
established O
a O
baseline O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
tried O
to O
rerank O
this O
run O
. O

The O
incoming O
citations’ O
strategy O
was O
to O
compute O
the O
number O
of O
incoming O
citations O
in O
PubMed O
Central O
, O
and O
to O
boost O
the O
score O
of O
the O
articles O
that O
were O
the O
most O
cited O
. O

The O
outgoing O
citations’ O
strategy O
was O
to O
promote O
the O
references O
of O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
no O
significant O
improvement O
from O
the O
baseline O
was O
observed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Dissemination O
applications O
are O
gaining O
increasing O
popularity O
due O
to O
dramatic O
improvements O
in O
communications O
bandwidth O
and O
ubiquity O
. O

The O
sheer O
volume O
of O
data O
available O
necessitates O
the O
use O
of O
selective O
approaches O
to O
dissemination O
in O
order O
to O
avoid O
overwhelming O
users O
with O
unnecessaryinformation O
. O

Existing O
mechanisms O
for O
selective O
dissemination O
typically O
rely O
on O
simple O
keyword O
matching O
or O
“ O
bag O
of O
words O
” O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
. O

The O
advent O
of O
XML O
as O
a O
standard O
for O
information O
exchangeand O
the O
development O
of O
query O
languages O
for O
XML O
data O
enables O
the O
development O
of O
more O
sophisticated O
filtering O
mechanisms O
that O
take O
structure O
information O
into O
account O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
several O
index O
organizations O
and O
search O
algorithms O
for O
performing O
efficient O
filtering O
of O
XML O
documents O
for O
large O
- O
scale O
information O
dissemination O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
these O
techniques O
and O
examine O
their O
performance O
across O
a O
range O
of O
document O
, O
workload O
, O
and O
scale O
scenarios O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
use O
of O
Vector O
Space O
Models O
( O
VSM O
) O
in O
the O
area O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
is O
an O
established O
practice O
, O
thanks O
to O
its O
very O
clean O
and O
solid O
formalism O
that O
allows O
us O
to O
easily O
represent O
objects O
in O
a O
vector O
space O
and O
to O
perform O
calculations O
on O
them O
. O

The O
goal O
of O
this O
work O
is O
to O
investigate O
the O
impact O
of O
VSM O
on O
Recommender O
Systems O
( O
RS O
) O
performance O
. O

Specifically O
, O
we O
will O
introduce O
two O
approaches O
: O
the O
first O
is O
based O
on O
a O
dimensionality O
reduction O
technique O
called O
Random O
Indexing O
, O
while O
the O
second O
extends O
the O
previous O
one O
by O
integrating O
a O
negation O
operator O
implemented O
in O
the O
Semantic O
Vectors O
open O
- O
source O
package O
. O

The O
results O
emerged O
from O
the O
experimental O
evaluation O
confirmed O
the O
predictive O
accuracy O
of O
the O
model O
. O

This O
work O
summarizes O
the O
results O
already O
presented O
in O
the O
RecSys O
2010 O
Doctoral O
Consortium O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Bug O
localization O
involves O
the O
use O
of O
information O
about O
a O
bug O
to O
assist O
in O
locating O
sections O
of O
code O
that O
must O
be O
modified O
to O
fix O
the O
bug O
. O

Such O
a O
task O
can O
involve O
a O
considerable O
amount O
of O
time O
and O
effort O
on O
the O
part O
of O
software O
developers O
and/or O
maintainers O
. O

Recently O
, O
several O
automated O
bug O
localization O
techniques O
based O
on O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
models O
have O
been O
developed O
to O
speed O
the O
process O
of O
bug O
localization O
. O

Another O
code O
analysis O
technique O
involves O
locating O
duplicated O
sections O
of O
code O
in O
software O
projects O
, O
called O
code O
clones O
. O

We O
examine O
the O
application O
of O
code O
clone O
location O
techniques O
in O
the O
context O
of O
bug O
localization O
. O

We O
attempt O
to O
determine O
the O
advantages O
of O
extending O
existing O
code O
clone O
location O
techniques O
through O
the O
inclusion O
of O
IR O
models O
in O
the O
analysis O
process O
. O

We O
also O
examine O
a O
technique O
for O
extending O
the O
use O
of O
bug O
logging O
repositories O
and O
version O
control O
systems O
by O
analyzing O
the O
two O
using O
IR O
techniques O
. O

Information O
that O
is O
available O
on O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
is O
already O
more O
vast O
than O
can O
be O
comprehensibly O
studied O
by O
individuals O
and O
is O
increasing O
at O
a O
staggering O
pace O
. O

Health O
consumerism O
is O
fuelled O
by O
knowledgeable O
patients O
. O

A O
key O
to O
health O
consumerism O
is O
locating O
reliable O
health O
information O
on O
the O
WWW O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
much O
health O
information O
on O
the O
web O
is O
of O
suspect O
quality O
. O

Differences O
between O
individual O
and O
clinician O
information O
seeking O
requirements O
are O
discussed O
. O

An O
agent O
- O
based O
health O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
is O
developed O
using O
validated O
existing O
technology O
. O

The O
agent O
system O
satisfies O
the O
health O
information O
requirements O
for O
individuals O
. O

A O
simulation O
of O
the O
system O
indicates O
a O
significant O
reduction O
in O
information O
overload O
and O
also O
high O
perceived O
reliability O
of O
information O
. O

ABSTRACT O

organized O

and O
Temporal O
Information O
Retrieval O
Task O
called O
“ O
NTCIR O

The O
focus O
of O
this O
task O
is O
on O
search O
with O
Geographic O
and O
Temporal O
constraints O
. O

This O
overview O
describes O
the O
data O
collections O
( O
Japanese O
and O
English O
news O
stories O
topic O
development O
, O
assessment O

and O

from O

NTCIR O

task O

with O

to O
find O
specific O
events O
in O

. O

( O

provided O

both O

and O

. O

The O
field O
of O
Information O
Science O
is O
constantly O
changing O
. O

Therefore O
, O
information O
scientists O
are O
required O
to O
regularly O
review O
and O
if O
necessary O
redefine O
its O
fundamental O
building O
blocks O
. O

This O
article O
is O
one O
of O
a O
group O
of O
four O
articles O
, O
which O
resulted O
from O
a O
Critical O
Delphi O

in O
2003 O
- O
2005 O
. O

The O
study O
, O
Knowledge O
Map O
of O
Information O
Science O
, O
was O
aimed O
at O
exploring O
the O
foundations O
of O
information O
science O
. O

The O
international O
panel O
was O

of O
57 O
leading O

from O
16 O
countries O
, O
who O
represent O
( O
almost O
) O
all O
the O
major O
subfields O
and O

of O
the O
field O
. O

, O
and O

and O
maps O

for O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
graph O
partitioning O
problem O
is O
as O
follows O
Given O
a O
graph O
G O
N O
E O
where O
N O
is O
a O
set O
of O
weighted O
nodes O
and O
E O
is O
a O
set O
of O
weighted O
edges O
and O
a O
positive O
integer O
p O
nd O
p O
subsets O
N O
N O
Np O
of O
N O
such O
that O
pi O

Ni O
N O
and O
Ni O

p O
i O
p O
where O
W O
i O
and O
W O
are O
the O
sums O
of O
the O
node O
weights O
in O
Ni O
and O
N O
respec O
tively O
the O
cut O
size O
i O
e O
the O
sum O
of O
weights O
of O
edges O
cross O
ing O
between O
subsets O
is O
minimized O

This O
problem O
is O
of O
interest O
in O
areas O
such O
as O
VLSI O
placement O
and O
routing O
and O
e O
cient O
parallel O
implementations O
of O
nite O
element O
methods O

In O
this O
survey O
we O
summarize O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
of O
sequential O
and O
parallel O
graph O
partitioning O
algorithms O


-DOCSTART- O

Text O
categorization O
is O
one O
of O
the O
important O
steps O
of O
many O
applications O
, O
e.g. O
Web O
page O
classification O
, O
indexing O
in O
search O
engine O
and O
information O
retrieval O
. O

When O
the O
number O
of O
documents O
available O
is O
huge O
, O
active O
learning O
could O
help O
relief O
the O
training O
time O
and O
cost O
. O

Moreover O
, O
active O
learning O
is O
able O
to O
filter O
out O
noisy O
samples O
for O
training O
and O
therefore O
may O
achieve O
better O
generalization O
capability O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
adopt O
the O
localized O
generalization O
error O
model O
to O
active O
learning O
for O
text O
categorization O
. O

In O
our O
approach O
, O
the O
samples O
yielding O
the O
highest O
generalization O
error O
for O
those O
unseen O
samples O
local O
to O
it O
is O
selected O
as O
the O
next O
training O
sample O
. O

The O
feature O
extraction O
from O
raw O
documents O
is O
also O
discussed O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
effective O
in O
reducing O
the O
number O
of O
training O
samples O
and O
achieves O
good O
generalization O
capability O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
conventional O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
documents O
in O
a O
collection O
are O
indexed O
before O
the O
retrieval O
process O
, O
and O
the O
document O
collection O
is O
generally O
static O
, O
organised O
and O
homogeneous O
. O

But O
, O
information O
on O
the O
Web O
is O
vast O
, O
dynamic O
, O
unorganised O
and O
heterogeneous O
. O

Current O
search O
engines O
and O
IR O
systems O
on O
the O
Web O
are O
based O
on O
the O
conventional O
indexing O
approach O
and O
have O
limitations O
including O
the O
need O
for O
frequent O
update O
of O
the O
index O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
non O
- O
indexing O
approach O
for O
information O
retrieval O
on O
the O
Web O
and O
show O
that O
the O
IR O
system O
based O
on O
this O
approach O
performs O
better O
than O
popular O
search O
engines O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

XML O
Information O
Retrieval O
is O
approach O
to O
identify O
the O
appropriate O
answer O
granularity O
and O
controlling O
to O
elements O
overlap O
. O

Recently O
, O
the O
demand O
for O
integrating O
Full O
Text O
Search O
and O
relational O
search O
has O
increased O
dramatically O
. O

The O
RDBMS O
implementation O
is O
generally O
much O
worse O
in O
the O
performance O
than O
the O
IR O
engine O
implementation O
. O

Especially O
, O
when O
a O
query O
is O
processed O
in O
the O
RDBMS O
, O
the O
number O
of O
join O
operation O
increases O
in O
proportion O
to O
the O
number O
of O
relationships O
in O
the O
query O
. O

In O
order O
to O
solve O
these O
problems O
, O
we O
propose O
in O
this O
paper O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
extend O
the O
inverted O
index O
for O
support O
query O
processing O
, O
namely O
Absolute O
Document O
XPath O
Indexing O
that O
allows O
supporting O
and O
reducing O
the O
length O
of O
time O
on O
Score O
Sharing O
scheme O
. O

In O
terms O
of O
processing O
time O
, O
our O
system O
required O
an O
average O
of O
one O
second O
per O
topic O
on O
INEX O
- O
IEEE O
and O
an O
average O
of O
ten O
seconds O
per O
topic O
on O
INEX O
- O
Wiki O
better O
than O
GPX O
system O
. O

Music O

inherits O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
an O
Agent O
Community O
based O
Peer O
- O
to O
- O
Peer O
information O
retrieval O
method O
called O
ACP2P O
method O
, O
which O
uses O
agent O
communities O
to O
manage O
and O
look O
up O
information O
related O
to O
users O
. O

An O
agent O
works O
as O
a O
delegate O
of O
its O
user O
and O
searches O
for O
information O
that O
the O
user O
wants O
by O
communicating O
with O
other O
agents O
. O

The O
communication O
between O
agents O
is O
carried O
out O
in O
a O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
computing O
architecture O
. O

In O
order O
to O
retrieve O
information O
related O
to O
a O
user O
query O
, O
an O
agent O
uses O
a O
content O
file O
, O
which O
consists O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
, O
and O
two O
histories O
a O
query O
/ O
retrieved O
document O
history(Q O
/ O
RDH O
) O
and O
a O
query O
/ O
sender O
agent O

history(Q O
/ O
SAH O

We O
implemented O
this O
method O
with O
Multi O
- O
Agents O
Kodama[1 O
and O
conducted O
preliminary O
experiments O
to O
test O
the O
hypothesis O
. O

The O
empirical O
results O
showed O
that O
the O
method O
was O
much O
more O
efficient O
than O
a O
naive O
method O
employing O
253;multicast&#253 O
; O
techniques O
only O
to O
look O
up O
a O
target O
agent O
. O

2-Poisson O
model O
for O

frequencies O

- O

. O

. O

Considerable O
performance O

( O
over O
simple O

collection O

) O
are O
demonstrated O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
explore O
some O
of O
the O
most O
important O
areas O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
Crosslingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
and O
Multilingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MLIR O
CLIR O
deals O
with O
asking O
questions O
in O
one O
language O
and O
retrieving O
documents O
in O
different O
language O
. O

MLIR O
deals O
with O
asking O
questions O
in O
one O
or O
more O
languages O
and O
retrieving O
documents O
in O
one O
or O
more O
different O
languages O
. O

With O
an O
increasingly O
globalized O
economy O
, O
the O
ability O
to O
find O
information O
in O
other O
languages O
is O
becoming O
a O
necessity O
. O

We O
also O
presented O
the O
evaluation O
initiatives O
of O
information O
retrieval O
domain O
. O

Finally O
we O
have O
presented O
the O
overall O
review O
of O
the O
research O
works O
in O
Indian O
and O
Foreign O
languages O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
addresses O
the O
problem O
of O
named O
entity O
recognition O
( O
NER O
) O
in O
travel O
- O
related O
search O
queries O
. O

NER O
is O
an O
important O
step O
toward O
a O
richer O
understanding O
of O
user O
- O
generated O
inputs O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

NER O
in O
queries O
is O
challenging O
due O
to O
minimal O
context O
and O
few O
structural O
clues O
. O

NER O
in O
restricted O
- O
domain O
queries O
is O
useful O
in O
vertical O
search O
applications O
, O
for O
example O
following O
query O
classification O
in O
general O
search O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
efficient O
machine O
learningbased O
solution O
for O
the O
high O
- O
quality O
extraction O
of O
semantic O
entities O
from O
query O
inputs O
in O
a O
restricted O
- O
domain O
information O
retrieval O
setting O
. O

We O
apply O
a O
conditional O
random O
field O
( O
CRF O
) O
sequence O
model O
to O
travel O
- O
domain O
search O
queries O
and O
achieve O
high O
- O
accuracy O
results O
. O

Our O
approach O
yields O
an O
overall O
F1 O
score O
of O
86.4 O
% O
on O
a O
heldout O
test O
set O
, O
outperforming O
a O
baseline O
score O
of O
82.0 O
% O
on O
a O
CRF O
with O
standard O
features O
. O

The O
resulting O
NER O
classifier O
is O
currently O
in O
use O
in O
a O
real O
- O
life O
travel O
search O
engine O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Kendall O
and O
AP O
rank O
correlation O
coefficients O
have O
become O
mainstream O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
research O
for O
comparing O
the O
rankings O
of O
systems O
produced O
by O
two O
different O
evaluation O
conditions O
, O
such O
as O
different O
effectiveness O
measures O
or O
pool O
depths O
. O

However O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
we O
focus O
on O
the O
expected O
rank O
correlation O
between O
the O
mean O
scores O
observed O
with O
a O
test O
collection O
and O
the O
true O
, O
unobservable O
means O
under O
the O
same O
conditions O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
propose O
statistical O
estimators O
of O
and O
AP O
correlations O
following O
both O
parametric O
and O
non O
- O
parametric O
approaches O
, O
and O
with O
special O
emphasis O
on O
small O
topic O
sets O
. O

Through O
large O
scale O
simulation O
with O
TREC O
data O
, O
we O
study O
the O
error O
and O
bias O
of O
the O
estimators O
. O

In O
general O
, O
such O
estimates O
of O
expected O
correlation O
with O
the O
true O
ranking O
may O
accompany O
the O
results O
reported O
from O
an O
evaluation O
experiment O
, O
as O
an O
easy O
to O
understand O
figure O
of O
reliability O
. O

All O
the O
results O
in O
this O
paper O
are O
fully O
reproducible O
with O
data O
and O
code O
available O
online O

( O
IT O
) O
that O
can O

a O
large O
amount O
of O
IT O
resources O

efficient O
and O

. O

Increasingly O
numerous O

plan O
to O

systems O
to O
the O

and O

. O

. O

and O

, O

can O

data O
. O

Analysis O
and O
simulation O
results O
demonstrate O
the O

and O
efficiency O
of O
our O
scheme O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
rapid O
growth O
of O
online O
social O
networks O
, O
massive O
information O
are O
produced O
and O
shared O
daily O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
in O
online O
social O
network O
is O
quite O
different O
with O
it O
in O
traditional O
web O
. O

Users O
in O
online O
social O
network O
often O
set O
their O
data O
to O
a O
limit O
range O
of O
audience O
, O
which O
put O
forward O
a O
requirement O
of O
access O
control O
in O
search O
engine O
. O

The O
access O
control O
issue O
is O
one O
of O
the O
main O
challenges O
since O
a O
generic O
model O
is O
still O
needed O
to O
characterize O
different O
access O
control O
strategies O
adopted O
in O
online O
social O
networks O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
analysis O
different O
social O
network O
structures O
, O
and O
then O
propose O
two O
access O
control O
models O
: O
K O
- O
step O
Model O
and O
Inheritance O
Model O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
the O
models O
are O
practically O
feasible O
in O
retrieval O
efficiency O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
ability O
to O
filter O
quantum O
states O
is O
a O
key O
capability O
in O
quantum O
information O
science O
and O
technology O
, O
where O
one O
- O
qubit O
filters O
, O
or O
polarizers O
, O
have O
found O
wide O
application O
. O

Filtering O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
entanglement O
requires O
extension O
to O
multi O
- O
qubit O
filters O
with O
qubit O
- O
qubit O
interactions O
. O

Such O
devices O
have O
many O
important O
applications O
to O
quantum O
technologies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Probability O
models O
have O
been O
used O
in O
cross O
- O
modal O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
recently O
by O
building O
conjunctive O
models O
bridging O

and O

components O
. O

studies O
have O
shown O
that O
cross O
- O
modal O
information O

system O
using O
the O
topic O
correlation O
model O
( O

) O
outperforms O
state O

-DOCSTART- O

Relevance O
judgment O
has O
traditionally O
been O
considered O
a O
personal O
and O
subjective O
matter O
. O

A O
user O
’s O
search O
and O
the O
search O
result O
are O
treated O
as O
an O
isolated O
event O
. O

To O
consider O
the O
collaborative O
nature O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
in O
a O
group O
/ O
organization O
or O
even O
societal O
context O
, O
this O
article O
proposes O
a O
method O
that O
measures O
relevance O
based O
on O
group O
/ O
peer O
consensus O
. O

The O
method O
can O
be O
used O
in O
IR O
experiments O
. O

In O
this O
method O
, O
the O
relevance O
of O
a O
document O
is O
decided O
by O
group O
consensus O
, O
or O
more O
specifically O
, O
by O
the O
number O
of O
users O
( O
or O
experiment O
participants O
) O
who O
retrieve O
it O
for O
the O
same O
search O
question O
. O

The O
more O
users O
who O
retrieve O
it O
, O
the O
more O
relevant O
the O
document O
will O
be O
considered O
. O

A O
user O
’s O
search O
performance O
can O
be O
measured O
by O
a O
relevance O
score O
based O
on O
this O
notion O
. O

The O
article O
reports O
the O
results O
of O
an O
experiment O
using O
this O
method O
to O
compare O
the O
search O
performance O
of O
different O
types O
of O
users O
. O

Related O
issues O
with O
the O
method O
and O
future O
directions O
are O
also O
discussed O
. O

This O
method O
comprehensively O
considers O
the O
frequency O
and O
the O
specific O
of O
the O
concept O
in O
one O
document O
and O
its O
corresponding O
domain O
ontology O
to O
construct O
the O
user O
profile O
, O
based O
on O
which O
, O
a O
fuzzy O
c O
- O
means O
clustering O
method O
is O
adopted O
to O
cluster O
the O
user O
’s O
interest O
domain O
, O
and O
a O
dynamic O
update O
policy O
is O
adopted O
to O
continuously O
consider O
the O
change O
of O
the O
users’ O
interest O
. O

The O
simulation O
result O
shows O
that O
along O
with O
the O
gradual O
perfection O
of O
the O
our O
user O
profile O
, O
our O
proposed O
system O
is O
better O
than O
traditional O
semantic O
based O
retrieval O
system O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
Recall O
Ratio O
and O
Precision O
Ratio O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Concept O
location O
, O
the O
problem O
of O
associating O
human O
oriented O
concepts O
with O
their O
counterpart O
solution O
domain O
concepts O
, O
is O
a O
fundamental O
problem O
that O
lies O
at O
the O
heart O
of O
software O
comprehension O
. O

Recent O
research O
has O
attempted O
to O

the O
impact O
of O
the O
concept O
location O
problem O
through O
the O
application O
of O

drawn O
from O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
community O
. O

Here O
we O
present O
a O
new O
approach O
based O
on O
a O
complimentary O

method O
which O
also O
has O
a O
sound O
basis O
in O

theory O
. O

We O
compare O
our O
approach O
to O
related O
work O
through O
an O
experiment O
and O
present O
our O
conclusions O

-DOCSTART- O

OntoQuest O
is O
a O
physician O
decision O
support O
system O
that O
mines O
the O
hospital O
data O
base O
for O
previous O
decisions O
made O
in O
cases O
similar O
to O
the O
current O
one O
. O

For O
example O
, O
OntoQuest O
displays O
a O
list O
of O
the O
medications O
prescribed O
to O
similar O
historical O
patients O
from O
which O
the O
physician O
may O
compare O
his O
choice O
of O
medication O
for O
the O
current O
patient O
. O

This O
information O
retrieval O
is O
accomplished O
using O
ontological O
queries O
. O

Unlike O
a O
regular O
database O
query O
, O
an O
ontological O
query O
is O
able O
to O
account O
for O
semantic O
similarity O
between O
patients O
. O

To O
implement O
the O
ontological O
query O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
for O
computing O
the O
ontological O
similarity O
between O
patients O
represented O
by O
sets O
of O
ICD-9 O
diagnoses O
. O

We O
have O
tested O
the O
OntoQuest O
prototype O
on O
a O
pilot O
data O
set O
of O
2077 O
patients O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
compare O
the O
OntoQuest O
performance O
to O
conventional O
database O
queries O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
OntoQuest O
can O
be O
extended O
to O
compare O
services O
, O
quality O
and O
outcomes O
among O
patient O
and O
provider O
groups O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
many O
diagnosis O
- O
and O
- O
repair O
domains O
, O
diagnostic O
reasoning O
can O
not O
be O
abstracted O
from O
repair O
actions O
, O
nor O
from O
actions O
necessary O
to O
obtain O
diagnostic O
information O
. O

We O
call O
these O
exploratory O
- O

domains O
. O

In O

2.0 O
, O
a O
consultation O
system O
for O
multiple O
trauma O
management O
, O
we O
have O
developed O
and O

for O

in O

which O
integrates O
diagnostic O
reasoning O
with O
planning O
and O
action O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
Goal O
- O
Directed O
Diagnosis O
( O
GDD O
the O
diagnostic O
reasoning O
component O
of O
this O
framework O
. O

Taking O
the O
view O
that O
a O
diagnosis O
is O
only O
worthwhile O
to O
the O
extent O
that O
it O
can O
affect O
subsequent O
decisions O
, O

focuses O
on O
the O
formation O
of O
appropriate O
goals O
for O
its O
complementary O
planner O
. O

Comments O

of O
Pennsylvania O
Department O
of O

and O

deploy O

models O
for O

- O
hoc O

the O
number O
of O
non O
- O
English O
documents O
is O
increasing O
dramatically O
on O
the O
web O
nowadays O
, O
the O
study O
and O
design O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
for O
these O
languages O
is O
very O
important O
. O

The O
Persian O
language O
is O
the O
official O
language O
of O
Iran O
, O
Afghanistan O
and O
Tajikistan O
and O
is O
also O
spoken O
in O

in O
the O
Middle O
East O
, O

amount O

on O

. O

. O

Probability O
( O

) O
calculation O
method O
for O

that O

probabilities O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
concern O
with O
the O
automatic O
generation O
of O
document O
temporal O
metadata O
, O
and O
how O
to O
exploit O
it O
in O
current O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Topic O
Detection O
systems O
. O

Specifically O
, O
we O
first O
propose O
a O
method O
to O
automatically O
detect O
the O
time O
references O
appearing O
in O
a O
document O
and O
to O
translate O
them O
into O
a O
formal O
time O
model O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
describe O
an O
algorithm O
that O
constructs O
the O
event O
- O
time O
period O
of O
a O
document O
starting O
from O
its O
extracted O
time O
references O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
demonstrate O
through O
a O
clustering O
experiment O
that O
such O
generated O
event O
- O
time O
periods O
are O
as O
accurate O
as O
regarding O
all O
the O
time O
references O
of O
the O
document O
. O

This O
greatly O
simplifies O
the O
representation O
of O
the O
document O
temporality O
and O
its O
management O
within O
IR O
and O
databases O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
which O
uses O
a O
rough O
concept O
clustering O
in O
conjunction O

Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis(LSA O
) O
to O
provide O
better O
document O
retrieval O
results O
matched O
to O
queries O
. O

The O
conceptual O
context O
defined O
in O
this O
article O
can O
be O
local O
, O
so O
no O
domain O
expert O
has O
to O
be O
involved O
in O
this O
approach O
. O

Our O
experiment O
consists O
of O
word O
clustering O
by O
similarity O
and O
rough O
concept O
recognition O
, O
associated O
to O
a O
basic O
LSA O
retrieval O
system O
. O

Our O
information O
retrieval O
process O
is O
illustrated O
through O
our O
experimentation O
model O
and O
results O
are O
compared O
in O
two O
different O
aspects O
. O

Experiment O
results O
show O
that O
retrieval O
performance O
benefit O
can O
be O
gained O
from O
this O
approach O
and O
further O
performance O
benefits O
can O
also O
be O
obtained O
according O
to O
the O
further O
work O
, O
which O
needs O
researching O
about O
parameter O
settings O
and O
algorithm O
development O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Learning O
to O
rank O
has O
attracted O
great O
attention O
recently O
in O
both O
information O
retrieval O
and O
machine O
learning O
communities O
. O

However O
, O
the O
lack O
of O
public O
dataset O
had O
stood O
in O
its O
way O
until O
the O
LETOR O
benchmark O
dataset O
( O
actually O
a O
group O
of O
three O
datasets O
) O
was O
released O
in O
the O
SIGIR O
2007 O
workshop O
on O
Learning O
to O
Rank O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
LR4IR O
2007 O

Since O
then O
, O
this O
dataset O
has O
been O
widely O
used O
in O
many O
learning O
to O
rank O
papers O
, O
and O
has O
greatly O
speeded O
up O
the O
corresponding O
research O
. O

Recently O
, O
we O
released O
the O
latest O
version O
, O
LETOR3.0 O
. O

LETOR3.0 O
makes O
a O
lot O
of O
improvement O
over O
previous O
two O
versions O
, O
and O
it O
is O
more O
useful O
and O
reliable O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
details O
of O
datasets O
in O
LETOR3.0 O
, O
including O
collection O
information O
, O
query O
sets O
and O
implementation O
of O
feature O
extraction O
. O

We O
also O
benchmark O
several O
widely O
used O
learning O
to O
rank O
methods O
on O
LETOR3.0 O
, O

results O
of O

methods O
, O
suggesting O
new O
directions O
for O
research O
, O
and O

baseline O
results O
for O
future O
study O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
extensive O
use O
of O
Multiword O
Expressions O
( O
MWE O
) O
in O
natural O
language O
texts O
prompts O
more O
detailed O
studies O
that O
aim O
for O
a O
more O
adequate O
treatment O
of O
these O
expressions O
. O

A O
MWE O
typically O
expresses O
concepts O
and O
ideas O
that O
usually O
can O
not O
be O
expressed O
by O
a O
single O
word O
. O

Intuitively O
, O
with O
the O
appropriate O
treatment O
of O
MWEs O
, O
the O
results O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
could O
be O
improved O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
apply O
techniques O
for O
the O
automatic O
extraction O
of O
MWEs O
from O
corpora O
to O
index O
them O
as O
a O
single O
unit O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
improvements O
on O
the O
retrieval O
of O
relevant O
documents O
when O
identifying O
MWEs O
and O
treating O
them O
as O
a O
single O
indexing O
unit O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
an O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
based O
on O
context O
distance O
and O
morphology O
. O

Context O
distance O
is O
a O
measure O
we O
use O
to O
assess O
the O
closeness O
of O
word O
meanings O
. O

This O
context O
distance O
model O
measures O
semantic O
distances O
between O
words O
using O
the O
local O
contexts O
of O
words O
within O
a O
single O
document O
as O
well O
as O
the O
lexical O
co O
- O
occurrence O
information O
in O
the O
set O
of O
documents O
to O
be O
retrieved O
. O

We O
also O
propose O
to O
integrate O
the O
context O
distance O
model O
with O
morphological O
analysis O
in O
determining O
word O
similarity O
so O
that O
the O
two O
can O
enhance O
each O
other O
. O

Using O
the O
standard O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
, O
we O
evaluated O
the O
proposed O
method O
on O
a O
subset O
of O
TREC-4 O
corpus O
( O
AP88 O
and O
AP90 O
collection O
, O
158,240 O
documents O
, O
49 O
queries O
Results O
show O
that O
this O
method O
improves O
the O
11-point O
average O
precision O
by O
8.6 O
% O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
is O
crucial O
in O
today O
’s O
Internet O
World O
. O

System O
should O
have O
complete O
knowledge O
to O
provide O
the O
information O
to O
the O
user O
based O
on O
their O
query O
. O

This O
paper O
explores O
the O
use O
of O
relations O
in O
information O
retrieval O
system O
for O
Tourism O
domain O
. O

A O
relation O
provides O
syntactic O
and O
semantic O
information O
between O
pair O
of O
concepts O
. O

Relation O
extraction O
captures O
the O
relationship O
between O
multiple O
concepts O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
concepts O
and O
binary O
relations O
have O
been O
identified O
for O
Tourism O
domain O
. O

It O
extracts O
the O
relation O
between O
the O
concepts O
. O

Our O
approach O
explores O
the O
new O
relationship O
even O
if O
it O
is O
not O
available O
. O

The O
extracted O
information O
gives O
meaningful O
and O
complete O
information O
. O

It O
also O
appends O
additional O
information O
into O
knowledge O
base O
. O

Keywords O
- O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Reasoning O
, O
Tourism O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
the O
participation O
of O
the O
Language O
Technologies O
Lab O
of O
INAOE O
at O
ImageCLEF O
2016 O
teaser O
1 O
: O
Text O
Illustration O
( O
TI O
The O
goal O
of O
the O
TI O
task O
consists O
in O
finding O
the O
best O
image O
that O
describes O
a O
given O
document O
query O
. O

For O
evaluating O
this O
task O
, O
there O
is O
a O
dataset O
containing O
web O
pages O
having O
text O
and O
images O
. O

We O
address O
the O
TI O
as O
a O
purely O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
task O
, O
for O
a O
given O
document O
query O
we O
search O
for O
the O
most O
similar O
web O
pages O
and O
use O
the O
associated O
images O
to O
them O
as O
illustrations O
. O

In O
this O
way O
, O
queries O
are O
used O
to O
retrieve O
related O
images O
from O
web O
pages O
, O
but O
the O
retrieval O
result O
are O
only O
the O
associated O
images O
. O

For O
this O
, O
we O
represent O
the O
web O
pages O
and O
queries O
using O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
text O
representations O
. O

Those O
representations O
incorporate O
information O
that O
allows O
us O
to O
exploit O
textual O
or O
semantic O
aspects O
. O

According O
to O
ImageCLEF O
2016 O
evaluation O
, O
the O
proposed O
approach O
holds O
the O
best O
performance O
for O
the O
TI O
task O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
search O
has O
been O
one O
of O
the O
major O
envisioned O
benefits O
of O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
since O
its O
emergence O
in O
the O
late O
90 O
’s O

Our O
demo O
shows O
a O

towards O
this O
goal O
. O

view O

as O

( O

like O

from O

executes O

against O
an O
ontologybased O
knowledge O

, O
and O
returns O
tuples O
of O
ontology O
values O
( O
resources O
) O
that O
satisfy O
the O
query O
[ O
2 O
While O
this O
conception O
of O

brings O
enormous O

already O
, O

The O

-DOCSTART- O

Utilising O
the O
Grid O
for O
conducting O
scientific O
research O
often O
involves O
a O
certain O
level O
of O
security O
risk O
, O
in O
particular O
when O
limited O
knowledge O
about O
the O
service O
provider O
is O
known O
before O
hand O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
our O
experience O
of O
integrating O
an O
Attack O
- O
Tolerant O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
ATIR O
) O
service O
with O
Taverna O
, O
a O
popular O
workflow O
tool O
among O
the O
UK O

- O
science O
community O
, O
to O
support O
secure O
information O
query O
in O
a O
biology O
context O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
system O
architecture O
that O
has O
been O
used O
for O
the O
integration O
and O
the O
corresponding O
implementation O
details O
. O

Performance O
studies O
show O
that O
the O
overhead O
of O
ATIR O
server O
side O
processing O
is O
trivial O
5 O
compared O
with O
the O
total O
processing O
time O
of O
the O
integrated O
Taverna O
. O

Our O
experimental O
results O
also O
show O
that O
the O
major O
processing O
overhead O
is O
caused O
by O
the O
Taverna O
enactor O
operations O
which O
consume O
no O
less O
than O
50 O
% O
of O
the O
total O
processing O
time O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
Privacy O
issues O
drawing O
more O
and O
more O
concerns O
, O
privacy O
protection O
techniques O
based O
on O
Computational O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CPIR O
) O
allow O
a O
user O
to O
retrieve O
data O
from O
a O
service O
provider O
without O
revealing O
the O
users O
query O
information O
. O

For O
large O
- O
scale O
applications O
, O
there O
exists O
a O
gap O
between O
privacy O
protection O
techniques O
and O
its O
feasibility O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
optimized O
CPIR O
- O
V O
based O
algorithm O
SCPIR O
- O
V O
for O
privacy O
protection O
nearest O
neighbor O
query O
which O
reduces O
the O
computational O
cost O
and O
communication O
cost O
efficiently O
. O

Inclusion O
relation O
among O
the O
candidate O
data O
sets O
of O
nearest O
neighbor O
points O
are O
utilized O
to O
compress O
the O
matrix O
where O
data O
are O
stored O
, O
and O
new O
data O
structures O
and O
query O
algorithms O
are O
designed O
. O

Compared O
to O
the O
existing O
work O
, O
the O
computation O
cost O
is O
reduced O
by O
2 O
- O
5 O
times O
and O
the O
communication O
cost O
by O
nearly O
2 O
times O
. O

This O
paper O
deals O
with O
Information O
Retrieval O
from O

- O

recordings O
. O

Such O
recordings O
are O
often O
quite O
long O
and O
users O
may O
want O
to O
find O
the O
exact O
starting O
points O
of O
relevant O
passages O
they O

for O
. O

In O

are O
automatically O
segmented O
into O

parts O
, O
on O

In O

of O

which O
decide O
on O
segment O
boundaries O
based O
on O
various O
features O
combined O
in O
a O
decision O
- O

model O
. O

Our O
experiments O
are O
carried O
out O
on O
the O
data O
used O
for O
the O
Search O
and O

Task O
and O
Similar O

in O
Social O
Speech O
Task O
of O
the O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
growth O
of O
available O
online O
collections O
of O
documents O
comes O
with O
a O
growth O
in O
users’ O
expectations O
for O
retrieval O
services O
. O

Contextual O
representations O
and O
interaction O
processes O
are O
becoming O
a O
real O
challenge O
to O
accurately O
navigate O
among O
large O
amounts O
of O
data O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
intuitive O
framework O
for O
the O
creation O
of O
multilevel O
interactive O
maps O
of O
multimedia O
content O
. O

Our O
framework O
allows O
the O
user O
to O
build O
interactive O
2D O
representations O
of O
multimedia O
documents O
. O

The O
visualization O
is O
based O
on O
a O
graph O
layout O
and O
filtering O
and O
generates O
maps O
through O
document O
clustering O
. O

Users O
may O
interactively O
modify O
the O
map O
according O
to O
their O
criteria O
of O
interests O
, O
defining O
their O
own O
viewpoints O
on O
the O
collection O
. O

They O
can O
then O
dig O
or O
surf O
depending O
on O
the O
interaction O
mode O
they O
choose O
. O

Those O
functionalities O
allow O
them O
to O
navigate O
, O
browse O
, O
and O
analyze O
quickly O
and O
precisely O

, O
allowing O
deep O
investigation O
of O
collections O
. O

For O
many O
decades O

in O
the O

( O

Processing O

its O
applications O
like O
Machine O
Translation O
, O

, O

Information O
Extraction O
and O
Information O
retrieval O
etc O
. O
have O
been O
posed O
with O
a O
challenging O
area O
of O

i.e. O
WSD O
( O
Word O
Sense O

) O
WSD O
can O

to O

of O

, O
with O

to O

in O

was O
used O
. O

Linguistics O
, O
has O
defined O
context O
as O
the O
passage O
, O
sentence O
or O
text O
in O
which O
the O
word O
appears O
that O
is O
used O
for O
ascertaining O
its O
meaning O
. O

Thus O
, O

is O
dependent O
on O
the O
POS O
( O
Part O
Of O
Speech O
) O
where O
the O
word O
is O
used O
e.g. O
Adverb O
, O
Adjective O
, O
Pronoun O
, O

and O
Noun O
. O

In O
the O
following O
study O

recommend O
a O
unique O
way O
of O
WSD O
based O
on O
Context O
through O

, O

algorithm O
that O
is O
knowledge O
based O
, O
map O
- O
reduce O
and O
soft O
sense O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Agent O
- O
Community O
- O
based O
Peer O
- O
to O
- O
Peer O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
ACP2P O
) O
method O
uses O
agent O
communities O
to O
manage O
and O
look O
up O
information O
of O
interest O
to O
users O
. O

An O
agent O
works O
as O
a O
delegate O
of O
its O
user O
and O
searches O
for O
information O
that O
the O
user O

with O
other O
agents O
. O

The O
communication O
between O
agents O
is O
carried O
out O
in O
a O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
computing O
architecture O
. O

The O
ACP2P O
is O
implemented O
using O
the O
Multi O
- O
Agent O
Kodama O
framework O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
how O
the O
ACP2P O
method O
works O
in O
an O
agent O
community O
network O
and O
show O
the O
experimental O
results O
to O
illustrate O
the O
validity O
of O
this O
approach O
. O

. O

In O

( O

) O

does O

provided O
such O

. O

In O

for O

of O

, O

for O

a O

. O

An O

shows O
that O

quite O
accurate O

. O

By O
analyzing O
explicit O
& O
amp O
; O
implicit O
feedback O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
can O
determine O

and O

's O

. O

In O

what O
is O

. O

. O

We O
extract O

from O

into O
account O

. O

Product O
Line O
has O
proven O
to O

for O

of O

products O

, O

. O

, O

and O

. O

code O
re O
- O
use O

. O

code O

, O

- O

-DOCSTART- O

Relevance O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
concepts O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
discusses O
various O
approaches O
for O
relevance O
calculation O
available O
in O
literature O
. O

In O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
relevance O
is O
how O
well O
a O
retrieved O
document O
or O
set O
of O
documents O
meets O
the O
information O
need O
. O

The O
paper O
summarizes O
, O
what O
relevance O
is O
and O
a O
survey O
of O
different O
methods O
of O
calculating O
relevance O
. O

Our O
goal O
is O
to O
study O
existing O
methods O
and O
to O
identify O
usefulness O
of O
existing O
methods O
for O
multilingual O
data O
and O
to O
understand O

Chinese O
is O
written O
without O
using O
spaces O
or O
other O
word O
delimiters O
. O

Although O
a O
text O
may O
be O
thought O
of O
as O
a O
corresponding O
sequence O
of O
words O
, O
there O
is O
considerable O
ambiguity O
in O
the O
placement O
of O
boundaries O
. O

Interpreting O
a O
text O
as O
a O
sequence O
of O
words O
is O
benecial O
for O
some O
information O
retrieval O
and O
storage O
tasks O
: O
for O
example O
, O
full O
- O
text O
search O
, O
word O
- O
based O
compression O
, O
and O
keyphrase O
extraction O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
scheme O
that O
infers O
appropriate O
positions O
for O
word O
boundaries O
using O
an O
adaptive O
language O
model O
that O
is O
standard O
in O
text O
compression O
. O

It O
is O
trained O
on O
a O
corpus O
of O
presegmented O
text O
, O
and O
when O
applied O
to O
new O
text O
, O
interpolates O
word O
boundaries O
so O
as O
to O
maximize O
the O
compression O
obtained O
. O

This O
simple O
and O
general O
method O
performs O
well O
with O
respect O
to O
specialized O
schemes O
for O
Chinese O
language O
segmentation O
. O

This O

the O

the O

measures O
such O

measure O
, O

measure O
that O
we O
tested O
. O

Similarity O
measure O
is O

for O

. O

and O

of O

for O

. O

Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O

) O
involves O
many O

of O
which O
the O
significant O
one O
is O
Word O
- O
sense O
disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
WSD O
includes O
the O
techniques O
of O
identifying O
a O
suitable O
meaning O
of O
words O
and O
sentences O
in O
a O
particular O
context O
by O
applying O
various O
computational O
procedures O
. O

WSD O
is O
an O
Artificial O
Intelligence O
problem O
that O
needs O
resolution O
for O
ambiguity O
of O
words O
. O

WSD O
is O
essential O
for O
many O

applications O
like O
Machine O
Translation O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
and O

others O
. O

The O

techniques O
are O

into O
knowledge O
- O
based O
approaches O
, O
Machine O
Learning O
based O
approaches O
and O

approaches O
. O

The O

systems O
is O

this O

and O

includes O

of O
different O

Automated O

retrieval O
relies O
heavily O
on O
statistical O

that O
emerge O
as O
terms O
are O
deposited O
to O
produce O

. O

This O

examines O
statistical O

expected O
of O
a O
pair O
of O
terms O
that O
are O

to O
each O
other O
. O

Guided O

process O
, O
we O
derive O
measures O
of O
how O
tightly O
two O
terms O
are O
semantically O
associated O
. O

Our O
main O
objective O
is O
to O
probe O
whether O
such O
measures O
yield O

. O

Specifically O

of O

is O

. O

This O
approach O
allows O

to O

of O

. O

practitioners O
, O
and O
students O
to O
present O
their O
original O
work O
, O
discuss O
, O
encourage O
and O
exchange O
new O
ideas O
, O
research O
results O
, O
and O
experiences O
on O
all O
aspects O
of O
Computer O
and O
Information O
Science O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Multiword O
units O
are O
groups O
of O
words O
that O
occur O
together O
more O
often O
than O
expected O
by O
chance O
in O
sub O
- O
languages O
. O

Président O
de O
la O
République O
, O
Coupe O
du O
monde O
and O
Traité O
de O
Maastricht O
are O
multiword O
units O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
most O
of O
the O
machine O
- O
readable O
dictionaries O
contain O
clearly O
insufficient O
information O
about O
multiword O
units O
. O

Therefore O
, O
their O
automatic O
extraction O
from O
corpora O
is O
an O
important O
issue O
not O
only O
for O
natural O
language O
processing O
but O
also O
for O
applications O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
and O
Machine O
Translation O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
extraction O
system O
based O
on O
a O
new O
association O
measure O
, O
the O
Mutual O
Expectation O
, O
and O
a O
new O
acquisition O
process O
based O
on O
an O
algorithm O
of O
local O
maxima O
, O
the O
LocalMax O
algorithm O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Term O
weighting O
is O
a O
crucial O
task O
in O
many O
Information O
Retrieval O
applications O
. O

Common O
approaches O
are O
based O
either O
on O
statistical O
or O
on O
natural O
language O
analysis O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
new O
algorithm O
that O
capitalizes O
from O
the O
advantages O
of O
both O
the O
strategies O
. O

In O
the O
proposed O
method O
, O
the O
weights O
are O
computed O
by O
a O
parametric O
function O
, O
called O
Context O
Function O
, O
that O
models O
the O
semantic O
influence O
exercised O
amongst O
the O
terms O
. O

The O
Context O
Function O
is O
learned O
by O
examples O
, O
so O
that O
its O
implementation O
is O
mostly O
automatic O
. O

The O
algorithm O
was O
successfully O
tested O
on O
a O
data O
set O
of O
crossword O
clues O
, O
which O
represent O
a O
case O
of O
Single O
- O
Word O
Question O
Answering O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
long O
- O
standing O
challenge O
in O
information O
retrieval O
is O
to O
disambiguate O
query O
words O
for O
more O
precise O
search O
results O
. O

However O
, O
two O
or O
more O
meanings O
of O
a O
word O
in O
a O
query O
, O
or O
polysemy O
, O
deteriorate O
the O
precision O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

There O
is O
a O
need O
for O
correct O
and O
effective O
information O
retrieval O
in O
many O
information O
systems O
such O
as O
health O
care O
and O
customer O
relationship O
management O
. O

This O
paper O
examines O
three O
topic O
language O
models O
that O
are O
mentioned O
in O
the O
literature O
for O
their O
ability O
to O
handle O
polysemy O
in O
query O
words O
. O

The O
three O
topic O
lanauge O
models O
are O
-- O
latent O
semantic O
analysis O
, O
probabilistic O
latent O
semantic O
analysis O
, O
and O
latent O
Dirichlet O
allocation O
. O

We O
review O
these O
models O
and O
compare O
their O
performance O
in O
query O
disambiguation O
. O

Our O
study O
provides O
guidance O
on O
the O
use O
of O
these O
models O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
combination O
of O
different O
text O
representations O
and O
search O
strategies O
has O
become O
a O
standard O
technique O
for O
improving O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

combination O
, O
for O
example O
, O
has O
been O
studied O
extensively O
in O
the O
TREC O
evaluations O
and O
is O
the O
basis O
of O
the O
“ O
meta O
- O
search O
” O
engines O
used O
on O
the O
Web O
. O

This O
paper O
examines O
the O
development O
of O
this O
technique O
, O
including O
both O
experimental O
results O
and O
the O
retrieval O
models O
that O
have O
been O
proposed O
as O
formal O
frameworks O
for O
combination O
. O

We O
show O
that O
combining O
approaches O
for O
information O
retrieval O
can O
be O
modeled O
as O
combining O
the O
outputs O
of O
multiple O
classifiers O
based O
on O
one O
or O
more O
representations O
, O
and O
that O
this O
simple O
model O
can O
provide O
explanations O
for O
many O
of O
the O
experimental O
results O
. O

We O
also O
show O
that O
this O
view O
of O
combination O
is O
very O
similar O
to O
the O
inference O
net O
model O
, O
and O
that O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
retrieval O
based O
on O
language O
models O
supports O
combination O
and O
can O
be O
integrated O
with O
the O
inference O
net O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Private O
information O
retrieval O
( O
PIR O
) O
is O
normally O
modeled O
as O
a O
game O
between O
two O
players O
: O
a O
user O
and O
a O
database O
. O

The O
user O
wants O
to O
retrieve O
some O
item O
from O
the O
database O
without O
the O
latter O
learning O
which O
item O
. O

Most O
current O
PIR O
protocols O
are O
ill O
- O
suited O
to O
provide O
PIR O
from O
a O
search O
engine O
or O
large O
database O
: O
i O
) O
their O
computational O
complexity O
is O
linear O
in O
the O
size O
of O
the O
database O
; O
ii O
) O
they O
assume O
active O
cooperation O
by O
the O
database O
server O
in O
the O
PIR O
protocol O
. O

If O
the O
database O
can O
not O
be O
assumed O
to O
cooperate O
, O
a O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
user O
community O
is O
a O
natural O
alternative O
to O
achieve O
some O
query O
anonymity O
: O
a O
user O
submits O
a O
query O
on O
behalf O
of O
another O
user O
in O
the O
community O
. O

A O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
PIR O
system O
is O
described O
in O
this O
paper O
which O
relies O
on O
an O
underlying O
combinatorial O
structure O
to O
reduce O
the O
required O
key O
material O
and O
increase O
availability O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
Corinna O
system O
which O
integrates O
a O
theoretical O
approach O
to O
dialogue O
modeling O
with O
text O
generation O
techniques O
to O
conduct O
cooperative O
dialogues O
in O
natural O
language O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
how O
the O
dialogue O
model O
COR O
can O
be O
augmented O
by O
adding O
discourse O
relations O
as O
an O
additional O
level O
of O
description O
which O
is O
particularly O
valuable O
for O
the O
generation O
of O
dialogue O
acts O
. O

this O
work O
a O

of O
somefizzy O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
give O
a O
technical O
description O
of O
the O
PRIME O
system O
prototype O
. O

PRIME O
allows O
us O
to O
provide O
an O
operational O
side O
to O
the O
theoretical O
work O
we O
have O
done O
in O
the O
“ O
Modelling O
and O
Multimedia O
Information O
Retrieval O
MRIM O
) O
team O
. O

PRIME O
is O
designed O
to O
provide O
a O
generic O
way O
to O
express O
the O
storing O
, O
manipulating O
and O
retrieval O
of O
multimedia O
data O
. O

These O
tasks O
are O
separated O
into O
two O
parts O
, O
namely O
the O
strict O
database O
tasks O
and O
the O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
. O

This O
paper O
focus O
on O
this O
generic O
part O
, O
and O
we O
address O
more O
specifically O
the O
problem O
of O
managing O
and O
retrieving O
images O
. O

We O
describe O
the O
implementation O
of O
a O
medical O
application O
managing O
Magnetic O
Resonance O
Images O
based O
on O
the O
generic O
core O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Structured O
InformationManager O
( O
SIM O
) O
is O
an O
electronic O
documentmanagement O
system O
designed O
to O
provide O
access O
to O
multigigabyte O
document O
collections O
. O

SIM O
was O
designed O
to O
provide O
both O
information O
retrieval O
and O
database O
capabilities O
. O

Central O
to O
achieving O
this O
goal O
was O
the O
incorporationwithin O
SIM O
of O
international O
documentmanagement O
standards O
including O
SGML O
and O
Z39.50 O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
SIM O
architecture O
and O
the O
techniques O
used O
to O
support O
these O
standards O
. O

It O
describes O
how O
a O
standard O
based O
approach O
can O
be O
used O
to O
support O
structured O
queries O
and O
presents O
the O
techniques O
used O
by O
SIM O
for O
query O
evaluation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
query O
- O
performance O
prediction O
task O
is O
to O
estimate O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
with O
no O
relevance O
judgments O
. O

retrieval O
prediction O
methods O
operate O
prior O
to O
retrieval O
time O
. O

Hence O
, O
these O
predictors O
are O
often O
based O
on O
analyzing O
the O
query O
and O
the O
corpus O
upon O
which O
retrieval O
is O
performed O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
em O
corpus O
- O
independent O
} O
approach O
to O
pre O
- O
retrieval O
prediction O
which O
relies O
on O
information O
extracted O
from O
Wikipedia O
. O

Specifically O
, O
we O
present O
Wikipedia O
- O
based O
features O
that O
can O
attest O
to O

of O

performed O

response O
to O
a O
query O
em O
regardless O
} O
of O
the O
corpus O
upon O
which O

. O

Empirical O

. O

As O

with O
state O
- O
of O
- O

quality O

better O
than O

of O

between O

Information O

1 O
, O
4 O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
novel O
ranking O
framework O
for O
content O
- O
based O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CBMIR O
The O
framework O
introduces O
relevance O
features O
and O
a O
new O
ranking O
scheme O
. O

Each O
relevance O
feature O
measures O
the O
relevance O
of O
an O
instance O
with O
respect O
to O
a O
profile O
of O
the O
targeted O
multimedia O
database O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
task O
of O
CBMIR O
can O
be O
done O
more O
effectively O
using O
the O
relevance O
features O
than O
the O
original O
features O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
additional O
performance O
gain O
is O
achieved O
by O
incorporating O
our O
new O
ranking O
scheme O
which O
modifies O
instance O
rankings O
based O
on O
the O
weighted O
average O
of O
relevance O
feature O
values O
. O

Experiments O
on O
image O
and O
music O
databases O
validate O
the O
efficacy O
and O
efficiency O
of O
the O
proposed O
framework O
2011 O
Elsevier O
Ltd. O

All O
rights O
reserved O
. O

This O
paper O
will O

the O

of O

of O

. O

paper O

summarize O
how O
to O
efficiently O
train O
an O
autoencoder O
in O
order O
to O
create O
meaningful O
and O
low O
- O
dimensional O
encodings O
of O
data O
. O

This O
paper O
will O
demonstrate O
how O
computing O
and O
storing O
the O
closest O

to O
an O
input O
query O
can O
help O

and O

of O
our O

. O

of O

by O
an O

- O

to O

our O

in O

ways O
. O

I O

and O

the O

search O
augmentation O
( O
GSA O
) O
approach O
, O
as O
well O
as O
the O
more O
well O
- O
known O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
- O
feedback O
( O

) O
adjustment O
. O

I O
find O
that O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Translation O
memories O
( O
TM O
) O
are O
widely O
used O
in O
the O
localization O
industry O
to O
improve O
consistency O
and O
speed O
of O
human O
translation O
. O

Several O
approaches O
have O
been O
presented O
to O
integrate O
the O
bilingual O
translation O
units O
of O
TMs O
into O
statistical O
machine O
translation O
( O
SMT O
We O
present O
an O
extension O
of O
these O
approaches O
to O
the O
integration O
of O
partial O
matches O
found O
in O
a O
large O
, O
monolingual O
corpus O
in O
the O
target O
language O
, O
using O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
techniques O
. O

We O
use O
locality O
- O
sensitive O
hashing O
( O
LSH O
) O
for O
efficient O
coarse O
- O
grained O
retrieval O
of O
match O
candidates O
, O
which O
are O
then O
filtered O
by O
finegrained O
fuzzy O
matching O
, O
and O
finally O
used O
to O
re O
- O
rank O
the O
n O
- O
best O
SMT O
output O
. O

We O
show O
consistent O
and O
significant O
improvements O
over O
a O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
SMT O
system O
, O
across O
different O
domains O
and O
language O
pairs O
on O
tens O
of O
millions O
of O
sentences O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
user O
- O
study O
showing O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
a O
linked O
- O
based O
, O
virtual O
integration O
infrastructure O
that O
gives O
users O
access O
to O
relevant O
online O
resources O
, O
and O
empowering O
users O
to O
design O
an O
information O
- O
seeking O
path O
that O
is O
specifically O
relevant O
to O
their O
context O
. O

IntegraL O
provides O

approach O
to O
improve O
and O
augment O
search O
functionality O
by O

generating O
context O
- O
focused O
“ O
anchors O
” O
for O
recognized O
elements O
of O
interest O
generated O
by O

services O
. O

paper O
includes O
a O
description O
of O
how O

’s O

supports O
users’ O
informationseeking O
behavior O
. O

study O
with O

measures O
of O

and O

World O
Wide O
Web O
( O

) O
is O
information O

environment O
. O

The O
access O
and O
document O
posted O
on O
WWW O
has O
rapidly O
grown O
since O
it O
was O
popularized O
in O
1990s O
. O

The O
abundance O
of O
information O
on O
WWW O
cause O
information O
overload O
problem O
, O
where O
users O
find O
hard O
to O
filter O
and O
select O
information O
return O
by O
the O
search O
system O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
growth O
of O
new O
inexperienced O
users O

new O
challenges O
for O
information O
retrieval O

. O

It O
has O

increasingly O
difficult O
for O

to O
find O
relevant O
documents O
that O
satisfying O
their O
information O
need O
. O

This O

is O

to O

that O
this O
category O
of O

is O

to O

his O
exact O

of O
information O
which O

to O
the O
use O
of O
inappropriate O
keywords O
or O

. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O

of O

user O

behavior O
on O
query O
formulation O
. O

is O

two O
categories O
; O
breadth O
and O
depth O

. O

The O
findings O
of O
this O
study O
show O
that O
breadth O
query O
strategy O
is O
the O
most O
popular O
strategy O
. O

logic O
has O
been O
recognized O
as O
a O
useful O

for O

. O

. O

. O

An O

is O

to O

of O

. O

( O

. O

for O

the O
first O
harmonic O

to O
low O
frequency O

. O

on O

( O

can O

-DOCSTART- O

the O
other O
based O
on O
selective O
combination O
of O
evidence O
within O
a O
relevance O
feedback O
situation O
. O

We O
discuss O
the O
difficulties O
involved O
in O
predicting O
good O
combinations O
of O
evidence O
for O
ad O
- O
hoc O
retrieval O
, O
and O
suggest O
the O
factors O
that O
may O
lead O
to O
the O
success O
or O
failure O
of O
combination O
. O

We O
also O
demonstrate O
how O
, O
in O
a O
relevance O
feedback O
situation O
, O
the O
relevance O
assessments O
can O
provide O
a O
good O
indication O
of O
how O
evidence O
should O
be O
selected O
for O
query O
term O
weighting O
. O

The O
use O
of O
relevance O
information O
to O
guide O
the O
combination O
process O
is O
shown O
to O
reduce O
the O
variability O
inherent O
in O
combination O
of O
evidence O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Arizona O

has O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

Geography O
Markup O
Language O
( O
GML O
) O
is O
becoming O
the O
de O
facto O
standard O
for O
electronic O
data O
exchange O
among O
the O
applications O
of O
Web O
and O
distributed O
geographic O
information O
systems O
. O

However O
, O
the O
conventional O
query O
languages O
( O
e. O
g. O
SQL O
and O
its O
extended O
versions O
) O
are O
not O
suitable O
for O
direct O
querying O
and O
updating O
of O
GML O
documents O
. O

Even O
the O
effective O
approaches O
working O
well O
with O
XML O
could O
not O
guarantee O
good O
results O
when O
applied O
to O
GML O
documents O
. O

XQuery O
is O
a O
powerful O
standard O
query O
language O
for O
XML O
. O

This O
study O
will O
investigate O
a O
query O
language O
specification O
to O
support O
spatial O
queries O
over O
GML O
documents O
by O
extending O
XQuery O
. O

The O
data O
model O
, O
algebra O
, O
and O
formal O
semantics O
as O
well O
as O
various O
spatial O
functions O
and O
operations O
of O
this O
proposed O
query O
language O
are O
presented O
in O
detail O
. O

by O
di O
erent O
databases O

are O
e O
ective O
e O
cient O
robust O
and O

, O

, O

as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
difficult O
languages O
in O
Automatic O

Language O
processing O
( O

) O
in O
general O
and O

retrieval O
in O

. O

, O

can O
not O
trust O

introduces O
a O

for O

of O
Things O
services O
. O

Based O
on O
a O
variety O
of O
data O
such O
as O
location O
data O
, O
ontology O
- O
backed O
search O
queries O
, O
in O
- O
and O

conditions O
the O

framework O
is O
intended O
to O
support O
users O
with O
helpful O
recommendations O
and O
information O
preceding O
a O
search O
for O
context O
- O
aware O
data O
. O

from O
artificial O
intelligence O
concepts O
, O

proposes O
user O
- O
readjusted O
answers O
on O
umpteen O
conditions O
. O

A O
number O
of O
potential O
Prometheus O

. O

and O
