. O


-DOCSTART- O

Two O
types O
of O
data O
are O
used O
in O
pattern O
recognition O
, O
object O
and O
relational O
data O
. O

Object O
data O
is O
the O
most O
common O
type O
of O
data O
and O
is O
in O
the O
form O
of O
the O
usual O
data O
set O
of O
feature O
vectors O
. O

Relational O
data O
is O
less O
common O
than O
object O
data O
and O
consists O
of O
the O
pairwise O
relations O
( O
similarities O
or O
dissimilarities O
) O
between O
each O
pair O
of O
implicit O
objects O
. O

Such O
a O
relation O
is O
usually O
stored O
in O
a O
relation O
matrix O
and O
no O
other O
knowledge O
is O
available O
about O
the O
objects O
being O
clustered O
. O

Because O
relational O
data O
is O
less O
common O
than O
object O
data O
, O
relational O
pattern O
recognition O
methods O
are O
not O
as O
well O
developed O
as O
their O
object O
counterparts O
, O
particularly O
in O
the O
area O
of O
robust O
clustering O
. O

However O
, O
relational O
methods O
are O
becoming O
a O
necessity O
as O
relational O
data O
becomes O
more O
and O
more O
common O
. O

For O
instance O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
data O
mining O
are O
all O
applications O
which O
could O
greatly O
benefit O
from O
pattern O
recognition O
methods O
that O
can O
deal O
with O
relational O
data O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
information O
explosion O
calls O
for O
adequate O
and O
efficient O
approaches O
to O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Integrated O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IIR O
) O
in O
grid O
computing O
environment O
is O
becoming O
more O
and O
more O
attractive O
for O
integration O
and O
share O
of O
heterogeneous O
resource O
to O
provide O
users O
integrated O
retrieval O
services O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
IIR O
service O
infrastructure O
on O
grid O
platform O
, O
GIIRS O
, O
which O
used O
Resource O
Description O
Framework O
( O
RDF O
) O
as O
data O
representation O
specification O
. O

And O
we O
designed O
a O
query O
mechanism O
to O
implement O
IIR O
of O
heterogeneous O
and O
semi O
- O
structured O
web O
data O
. O

The O
GIIRS O
can O
be O
easily O
deployed O
on O
grid O
platform O
and O
have O
feature O
of O
semantic O
interoperability O
. O

This O
report O
explores O
the O
intellectual O
processes O
entailed O
during O

seeking O
, O
as O

needs O
are O
generated O
and O

and O

. O

It O

of O

processing O
, O

a O
number O
of O
models O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
Popper O
’s O
model O
of O
the O
communication O
process O
between O
an O
individual O
and O
new O
information O
is O
explored O
and O

from O

of O

. O

” O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Conceptual O
Information O
Systems O
provide O
a O
multi O
- O
dimensional O
conceptually O
structured O
view O
on O
data O
stored O
in O
relational O
databases O
. O

On O
restricting O
the O
expressiveness O
of O
the O
retrieval O
language O
, O
they O
allow O
the O
visualization O
of O
sets O
of O
related O
queries O
in O
conceptual O
hierarchies O
, O
hence O
supporting O
the O
search O
of O
something O
one O
does O
not O
have O
a O
precise O
description O
but O
only O
a O
vague O
idea O
of O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
is O
considered O
as O
the O
process O
of O
nding O
speciic O
objects O
( O
documents O
etc O
out O
of O
a O
large O
set O
of O
objects O
which O
t O
to O
some O
description O
. O

In O
some O
data O
analysis O
and O
knowledge O
discovery O
applications O
, O
the O
dual O
task O
is O
of O
interest O
: O
The O
analyst O
needs O
to O
determine O
, O
for O
a O
subset O
of O
objects O
, O
a O
description O
for O
this O
subset O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
discuss O
how O
Conceptual O
Information O
Systems O
can O
be O
extended O
to O
support O
also O
the O
second O
task O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
a O
boom O
in O
the O
internet O
, O
social O
media O
text O
has O
been O
increasing O
day O
by O
day O
. O

Much O
of O
the O
user O
generated O
content O
on O
internet O
is O
written O
in O
a O
very O
informal O
way O
. O

Usually O
people O
tend O
to O
write O
text O
on O
social O
media O
using O
indigenous O
script O
. O

To O
understand O
a O
script O
different O
from O
ours O
is O
a O
difficult O
task O
. O

Moreover O
, O
nowadays O
queries O
received O
by O
the O
search O
engines O
are O
large O
number O
of O
transliterated O
text O
. O

Hence O
providing O
a O
common O
platform O
to O
deal O
with O
the O
problem O
of O
transliterated O
text O
becomes O
really O
important O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
our O
approach O
to O
handle O
labeling O
of O
queries O
as O
part O
of O
the O
FIRE2015 O
shared O
task O
on O
Mixed O
- O
Script O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Tokens O
in O
the O
query O
are O
labeled O
on O
basis O
of O
a O
hybrid O
approach O
which O
involves O
rule O
based O
and O
machine O
learning O
techniques O
. O

Each O
annotation O
has O
been O
dealt O
separately O
but O
sequentially O
. O

to O

, O

of O

Sciences O

. O

. O

, O

( O

. O

the O
quality O
of O

- O
like O

agents O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
first O
International O
Workshop O
on O

and O

Evolution O
( O
MALIR O
- O
SE O
) O
was O
held O
on O
the O
11th O
of O
November O
2013 O
. O

The O
workshop O
was O
held O
in O
conjunction O
with O
the O
28th O
IEEE O
/ O
ACM O
International O
Conference O
on O
Automated O
Software O
Engineering O
( O
ASE O
) O
in O
Silicon O
Valley O
, O
California O
, O
USA O
. O

The O
workshop O
brought O

and O
practitioners O
that O
were O

in O
leveraging O
machine O

and O

to O

tasks O
. O

During O
the O
workshop O
, O

on O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
partial O
success O
in O
inferring O
the O
characteristics O
of O
offenders O
from O
their O
criminal O
behaviour O
offender O
profiling O
has O
relied O
on O
limited O
data O
and O
subjective O
judgments O
. O

We O
therefore O
sought O
to O
determine O
if O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
and O
in O
particular O
Language O
Modelling O
could O
be O
applied O
directly O
to O
existing O
police O
digital O
records O
of O
criminal O
events O
to O
identify O
significant O
characteristics O
of O
offenders O
. O

The O
categories O
selected O
were O
gender O
and O
age O
group O
. O

Results O
showed O
that O
distinct O
differences O
in O
characteristics O
do O
exist O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Although O
many O
different O
visual O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
been O
proposed O
, O
few O
have O
been O
tested O
, O
and O
where O
testing O
has O
been O
performed O
results O
were O
often O
inconclusive O
. O

Further O
, O
there O
is O
very O
little O
evidence O
of O
benchmarking O
systems O
against O
a O
common O
standard O
. O

An O
approach O
for O
testing O
novel O
interfaces O
is O
proposed O
which O
uses O
bottom O
- O
up O
, O
stepwise O
testing O
to O
allow O
evaluation O
of O
a O
visualization O
, O
itself O
, O
rather O
than O
restricting O
evaluation O
to O
the O
system O
instantiating O
it O
. O

This O
approach O
not O
only O
makes O
it O
easier O
to O
control O
variables O
, O
but O
the O
tests O
are O
also O
easier O
to O
perform O
. O

The O
methodology O
will O
be O
presented O
through O
a O
case O
study O
, O
where O
a O
new O
visualization O
technique O
is O
compared O
to O
more O
traditional O
ways O
of O
presenting O
data O
. O

paper O
presents O
a O

both O

and O
query O
for O
semantic O
information O
portals O
to O
retrieve O
information O
based O
on O
Knowledge O
Base O
. O

our O

utilizes O
ontology O
query O
languages O
to O
let O
users O
browse O
freely O
, O
and O
a O

is O
proposed O
to O
facilitate O
users O
formulating O
ontology O
-based O
query O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Tokenization O
is O
the O
task O
of O
chopping O
it O
up O
into O
pieces O
, O
called O
tokens O
, O
perhaps O
at O
the O
same O
time O
throwing O
away O
certain O
characters O
, O
such O
as O
punctuation O
. O

A O
token O
is O
an O
instance O
of O
token O
a O
sequence O
of O
characters O
in O
some O
particular O
document O
that O
are O
grouped O
together O
as O
a O
useful O
semantic O
unit O
for O
processing O
. O

New O
software O
tool O
and O
algorithm O
to O
support O
the O
IRS O
at O
tokenization O
process O
are O
presented O
. O

Our O
proposed O
tool O
will O
filter O
out O
the O
three O
computer O
character O
Sequences O
: O
IP O
- O
Addresses O
, O
Web O
URLs O
, O
Date O
, O
and O
Email O
Addresses O
. O

Our O
tool O
will O
use O
the O
pattern O
matching O
algorithms O
and O
filtration O
methods O
. O

After O
this O
process O
, O
the O
IRS O
can O
start O
a O
new O
tokenization O
process O
on O
the O
new O
retrieved O
text O
which O
will O
be O
free O
of O
these O
sequences O
. O

Keywords O
— O
Information O
Retrieval O
; O
Tokenization O
; O
pattern O
matching O
; O
and O
Sequences O
Filtration O
. O

Two O
methods O
are O
given O
to O
improve O
weighting O
schemes O
by O
using O
relevance O
information O
of O
a O
set O
of O
queries O
. O

The O
first O
method O
is O
to O
estimate O
parameter O
values O
of O
two O
independence O
models O
in O
information O
retrieval O
8212 O
; O
the O
binary O
independence O
model O
and O
the O
non O
- O
binary O
independence O
model O
. O

The O
parameters O
estimated O
here O
are O
used O
to O
calculate O
optimal O
weights O
for O
terms O
in O
a O
different O
set O
of O
queries O
. O

Performance O
of O
this O
estimation O
is O
compared O
to O
the O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
method O
, O
the O
cosine O
measure O
, O
and O
the O
statistical O
similarity O
measure O
. O

The O
second O
method O
is O
to O
learn O
optimal O
weights O
of O
the O
non O
- O
binary O
independence O
model O
adaptively O
by O
a O
learning O
formula O
. O

Experiments O
are O
performed O
on O
three O
different O
document O
collections O
CISI O
, O
MEDLARS O
, O
and O
CRN4NUL O
for O
both O
methods O
, O
and O
results O
are O
reported O
. O

Both O
methods O
show O
improvements O
compared O
to O
the O
existing O
weighting O
schemes O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
second O
method O
gives O
slightly O
better O
performance O
than O
the O
first O
one O
, O
and O
has O
simpler O
implementation O
. O

The O
paper O
presents O
a O
GPS O
- O
based O
positioning O
method O
mainly O
used O
to O
field O
rescue O
. O

The O
position O
and O
orientation O
of O
the O
rescuer O
and O
the O
trapped O
are O
acquired O
using O
GPS O
chip O
and O
digital O
compass O
. O

Using O
the O
GPS O
data O
and O
compass O
data O
, O
the O
relative O
distance O
and O
orientation O
between O
them O
are O
calculated O
from O
the O
geometric O
relationships O
based O
on O
a O
series O
of O
formulas O
in O
Geographic O
Information O
Science O
( O
GIS O
Using O
this O
technology O
, O
we O
develop O
a O
solar O
- O
powered O
portable O
field O
- O
rescue O
device O
. O

The O
experiments O
prove O
that O
the O
device O
can O
do O
accurate O
coordination O
via O
wireless O
communication O
, O
helping O
rescuers O
to O
search O
the O
trapped O
more O
accurately O
and O
quickly O
. O

New O
general O
purpose O
ranking O
functions O
are O
discovered O
using O
genetic O
programming O
. O

The O
TREC O
WSJ O
collection O
was O
chosen O
as O
a O
training O
set O
. O

A O
baseline O
comparison O
function O
was O
chosen O
as O
the O
best O
of O
inner O
product O
, O
probability O
, O
cosine O
, O
and O
Okapi O
BM25 O
. O

An O
elitist O
genetic O
algorithm O
with O
a O
population O
size O

100 O
was O
run O
13 O
times O
for O
100 O
generations O
and O
the O
best O
performing O
algorithms O
chosen O
from O
these O
. O

The O
best O
learned O
functions O
, O
when O
evaluated O
against O
the O
best O
baseline O
function O
( O
BM25 O
demonstrate O
some O

performance O

, O

in O
mean O

precision O
as O
high O
as O
32 O
% O
observed O
on O
one O
TREC O
collection O
not O
used O
in O
training O
. O

In O
no O
test O
is O

shown O
to O
significantly O
outperform O
the O
best O
learned O
function O
. O

This O
paper O

effect O
of O
initial O
weight O
selection O
on O
feed O
- O

networks O

simple O
functions O
with O

- O

technique O
. O

We O
first O

of O

vector O
( O
in O

. O

of O

. O

is O

Initial O

paper O

in O
the O

. O

The O
data O
consists O
of O
the O
total O
of O
1,508 O
real O
user O
queries O
in O
English O
translated O
to O
Czech O
, O
German O
, O
and O
French O
. O

We O
describe O

and O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
genetic O
algorithm O
is O
described O
that O
models O
changing O
user O
interests O
in O
an O
on O
- O
line O
information O
retrieval O
support O
system O
. O

User O
interests O
are O
represented O
as O
a O
population O
of O
queries O
which O
are O
issued O
to O
a O
World O
- O
Wide O
Web O
search O
engine O
. O

User O
feedback O
on O
the O
queries O
and O
their O
results O
provides O
the O
fitness O
of O
each O
query O
. O

A O
single O
point O
crossover O
operator O
recombines O
query O
terms O
and O
two O
mutation O
operators O
replace O
query O
terms O
with O
randomly O
selected O
words O
and O
their O
synonyms O
, O
respectively O
. O

Initial O
user O
testing O
has O
shown O
that O
the O
GA O
approach O
is O
more O
effective O
in O
a O
simple O
learning O
task O
than O
a O
non O
- O
GA O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Code O
generation O
from O
hybrid O
system O
models O
, O
a O

approach O
for O
producing O
reliable O

systems O
, O
has O
been O

for O

. O

Information O
retrieval O
for O
geo O
- O
locatable O
places O
and O
services O
must O
be O
provided O
with O
the O
most O
according O
and O
personalized O
content O
to O
a O
user&#x02019;s O
information O
request O
, O
based O
this O
on O
his O
or O
her O
spatio O
- O
temporal O
situation O
. O

One O
initiative O
that O
describes O
a O
set O
of O
geo O
- O
locable O
services O
is O
the O
Chefmoz O
project O
, O
in O
which O
different O
restaurants O
from O
the O
entire O
world O
are O
semantically O
described O
; O
in O
this O
paper O
is O
presented O
an O

that O
takes O
advantage O
of O
the O
information O

in O

in O
order O
to O

for O
the O

and O

of O

. O

In O

to O
this O

a O

for O
the O
FOAF O

which O
describes O
the O

of O
a O
user O
was O
used O
. O

The O
precision O
and O
recall O
results O
for O
an O
experimental O
case O
are O
presented O
. O

Finally O
the O
conclusions O
and O

is O
mentioned O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Today O
, O
to O
effectively O
meet O
the O
needs O
of O
users O
, O
multilingual O
information O
retrieval O
is O
an O
important O
issue O
regarding O
to O
the O
continually O
increasing O
volume O
of O
information O
in O
various O
languages O
. O

This O
paper O
addresses O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
in O
a O
trilingual O
corpus O
: O

Arabic O
, O
French O
, O
English O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
is O
founded O
on O
a O
knowledge O
representation O
formalism O
, O
namely O
semantic O
graphs O
which O
supports O
a O
domain O
ontology O
. O

Documents O
and O
queries O
are O
also O
represented O
in O
this O
formalism O
. O

The O
domain O
ontology O
constitutes O
the O
kernel O
of O
the O
system O
and O
is O
used O
both O
for O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
mankind O
entered O
the O
21st O
century O
as O
a O
highly O
advanced O
information O
society O
. O

Fast O
progress O
in O
science O
combined O
with O
the O
emergence O
and O
expansion O
of O
information O
and O
telecommunication O
technologies O
has O
caused O
that O
information O
has O
become O
a O
main O
production O
resource O
of O
human O
. O

On O
the O
one O
hand O
, O
information O
is O
available O
for O
everybody O
, O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
an O
enormous O
increase O
in O
the O
amount O
of O
electronic O
documents O
makes O
accessing O
this O
information O
very O
difficult O
or O
even O
impossible O
. O

One O
of O
the O
possible O
ways O
out O
of O
this O
situation O
is O
to O
provide O
effective O
tools O
for O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
enable O
to O
find O
relevant O
information O
. O

The O
rest O
of O
the O
paper O
presents O
the O
main O
models O
of O
information O
retrieval O
in O
a O
repository O
of O
textual O
documents O
, O
describes O
the O
concept O
of O
association O
list O
and O
its O
use O
for O
improving O
the O
quality O
of O
retrieval O
. O

Moreover O
, O
it O
compares O
the O
models O
with O
an O
example O
of O
information O
retrieval O
in O
a O
repository O
of O
press O
notes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
I O
present O
my O
research O
goals O
and O
what O
I O
have O
obtained O
so O
far O
into O
my O
first O
year O
of O
PhD. O

In O
particular O
this O
paper O
is O
about O
a O
novel O
architecture O
for O
closed O
domain O
question O
answering O
and O
a O
possible O
application O
in O
the O
cultural O
heritage O
context O
. O

Unlike O
open O
domain O
question O
answering O
, O
which O
makes O
intensive O
use O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
, O
closed O
domain O
question O
answering O
systems O
might O
be O
built O
on O
top O
of O
a O
formal O
model O
with O
the O

to O
apply O
formal O
logics O
and O
reasoning O
. O

Natural O
language O
question O

poses O
some O

problems O
to O

. O

We O
investigate O
such O

and O

some O

based O
on O
AI O
techniques O
, O
picking O
the O
Cultural O
Heritage O
domain O
as O
a O
target O
application O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
major O
question O
raised O
in O
information O
retrieval O
on O
semi O
- O
structured O
documents O
relates O
to O
the O
manner O
of O
effectively O
handling O
the O
structure O
and O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
document O
for O
better O
answering O
the O
user O
's O
needs O
. O

These O
needs O
can O
be O
formulated O
by O
queries O
composed O
of O
only O
key O
words O
or O
key O
words O
and O
structural O
constraints O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
are O
interested O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O
semi O
- O
structured O
document O
like O
XML O
. O

For O
these O
purposes O
, O
we O
present O
a O
model O
for O
the O
semi O
- O
structured O
information O
retrieval O
, O
based O
on O
the O
possibilistic O
networks O
. O

The O
document O
elements O
and O
elements O
terms O
relations O
are O
modelled O
by O
measures O
of O
possibility O
and O
necessity O
. O

In O
this O
model O
, O
the O
user O
's O
query O
starts O
a O
process O
of O
propagation O
to O
recover O
documents O
or O
portions O
of O
documents O
necessarily O
or O
at O
least O
possibly O
relevant O
. O

An O
example O
of O
such O
a O
research O
is O
proposed O
in O
order O
to O
illustrate O
the O
presented O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Extracting O
singing O
melody O
from O
audio O
signals O
is O
one O
essential O
component O
for O
musical O
information O
retrieval O
. O

One O
can O
identify O
melody O
of O
different O
types O
of O
music O
easily O
even O
without O
professional O
training O
, O
but O
it O
is O
difficult O
for O
computer O
to O
achieve O
this O
goal O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
new O
feature O
which O
provides O
not O
only O
a O
convenient O
way O
to O
observe O
music O
but O
also O
a O
tool O
to O
extract O
singing O
melody O
. O

Also O
, O
we O
propose O
pitch O
likelihood O
, O
note O
and O
energy O
transition O
probabilities O
to O
perform O
Viterbi O
search O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
can O
extract O
singing O
melody O
accurately O
. O

Preservation O
( O
DP O
) O

of O

, O

. O

With O

core O
IT O
know O
- O
how O
that O
is O

that O
we O
are O

DP O
is O
not O

present O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
performs O
a O
profile O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
from O
printed O
document O
image O
collections O
. O

Keywords O
are O
valuable O
indexing O
tools O
and O
if O
they O
can O
be O
identified O
at O
the O
image O
level O
, O
extensive O
computation O
during O
recognition O
will O
be O
avoided O
. O

Printed O
documents O
can O
be O
scanned O
to O
produce O
document O
images O
. O

Instead O
of O
converting O
entire O
document O
images O
into O
text O
equivalent O
, O
word O
profiles O
are O
identified O
to O
match O
the O
word O
images O
in O
Bilingual O
document O
images.(English O
and O

Tamil O
During O
retrieval O
, O
the O
same O
profile O
could O
be O
extracted O
from O
the O
user O
specified O
word O
and O
can O
be O
matched O
with O
the O
word O
images O
in O
the O
document O
. O

This O
yields O
a O
faster O
result O
even O
in O
a O
quality O
- O
degraded O
document O
. O

This O
kind O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
Keyword O
Based O
Search O
) O
can O
be O
adapted O
in O
Digital O
Libraries O
, O
which O
employs O
digitized O
documents O
instead O
of O
text O
processing O
. O

This O
promotes O
efficient O
search O
in O
document O
images O
irrespective O
of O
the O
language O
. O

This O
position O
paper O
argues O
that O
a O
user O
perspective O
is O
needed O
to O
focus O
mid O
- O
term O
research O
in O
Cross O
- O
Language O

( O
CLIR O

for O

represent O

user O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Classical O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
methods O
often O
lose O
valuable O
information O
when O
aggregating O
weights O
, O
which O
may O
diminish O
the O
discriminating O
power O
between O
documents O
. O

To O
cope O
with O
this O
problem O
, O
the O
paper O
presents O
an O
approach O
for O
ranking O
documents O
in O
IR O
, O
based O
on O
a O
vector O
- O
based O
ordering O
technique O
already O
considered O
in O
fuzzy O
logic O
for O
multiple O
criteria O
analysis O
purpose O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
proposed O
approach O
uses O
a O
possibilistic O
framework O
for O
encoding O
the O
retrieval O
status O
values O
. O

The O
approach O
, O
applied O
to O
a O
benchmark O
collection O
, O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
improve O
IR O
precision O
w.r.t O
. O

classical O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
provides O
a O
set O
of O
criteria O
to O
evaluate O
the O
usability O
of O
trader O
user O
interfaces O
with O
respect O
to O
resource O
discovery O
. O

The O
criteria O
were O
identified O
because O
trader O
user O
interface O
developers O
sometimes O
make O
unrealistic O
assumptions O
about O
the O
information O
seeking O
behavior O
of O
their O
users O
, O
leading O
to O
interfaces O
that O
are O
difficult O
to O
use O
for O
resource O
discovery O
. O

This O
paper O
uses O
some O
insights O
from O
the O
cognitive O
aspects O
of O
the O
information O
science O
field O
to O
justify O
the O
usability O
criteria O
. O

The O
results O
of O
this O
paper O
are O
general O
enough O
to O
aid O
the O
developer O
of O
a O
user O
interface O
to O
any O
resource O
discovery O
tool O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Two O
methods O
defining O
a O
logic O
model O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
are O
introduced O
. O

The O
first O
one O
is O
based O
on O
the O
conditional O
logic O
as O
suggested O
by O
van O
Rijsbergen O
, O
while O
the O
second O
is O
based O
on O
the O
Nie O
's O
variations O
of O
the O
uncertainty O
principle O
of O
van O
Rijsbergen O
. O

A O
Hypercard O
based O
system O
has O
been O
also O
designed O
and O
implemented O
to O
support O
small O
- O
scale O
experiments O
. O

It O
has O
been O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
new O
model O
in O
comparison O
with O
the O
standard O
retrieval O
methods O
. O

Though O
we O
imposed O
some O
simplifying O
assumptions O
to O
the O
model O
in O
order O
to O
have O
a O
workable O
system O
, O
the O
experimental O
results O
allow O
us O
to O
claim O
that O
the O
new O
methods O
are O
comparable O
to O
the O
already O
existing O
ones O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Arabic O
IR O
( O
Information O
Retrieval O
) O
has O
recently O
become O
a O
focus O
of O
research O
and O
commercial O
development O
. O

Very O
few O
standards O
for O
evaluation O
of O
such O
tools O
are O
known O
and O
available O
. O

A O
concrete O
evaluation O
for O
Arabic O
IR O
systems O
is O
necessary O
for O
the O
advancement O
of O
this O
field O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
discuss O
available O
resources O
for O
testing O
Arabic O
IR O
systems O
and O
we O
propose O
a O
strategy O
to O
accelerate O
the O
development O
and O
the O
reliable O
evaluation O
of O
systems O
that O
can O
than O
be O
exploited O
by O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
users O
of O
varied O
interests O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
provide O
access O
to O
collections O
of O
thousands O
, O
or O
millions O
, O
of O
documents O
, O
from O
which O
, O
by O
providing O
an O
appropriate O
description O
, O
users O
can O
recover O
any O
one O
. O

Typically O
, O
users O
iteratively O
refine O
the O
descriptions O
they O
provide O
to O
satisfy O
their O
needs O
, O
and O
retrieval O
systems O
can O
utilize O
user O
feedback O
on O
selected O
documents O
to O
indicate O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
description O
at O
any O
stage O
. O

The O
style O
of O
description O
required O
from O
the O
user O
, O
and O
the O
way O
it O
is O
employed O
to O
search O
the O
document O
database O
, O
are O
consequences O
of O
the O
indexing O
method O
used O
for O
the O
collection O
. O

The O
index O
may O
take O
different O
forms O
, O
from O
storing O
keywords O
with O
links O
to O
individual O
documents O
, O
to O
clustering O
documents O
under O
related O
topics O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

I O
will O
consider O
the O
problem O
of O
helping O
user O
’s O
retrieve O
information O
from O
large O
diverse O
collections O
of O
textual O
materials O
such O
as O
bibliographic O
databases O
, O
electronic O
bulletin O
boards O
and O
online O
manuals O
, O
although O
I O
believe O
that O
many O
of O
my O
arguments O
apply O
to O
other O
interactive O
environments O
as O
well O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
like O
this O
must O
handle O
a O
heterogeneous O
population O
of O
users O
, O
and O
even O
a O
single O
user O
will O
have O
a O
range O
of O
information O
needs O
including O
very O
specific O
requests O
as O
well O
as O
more O
general O
and O
often O
ill O
- O
defined O
topical O
searches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
proliferation O
of O
camera O
phones O
, O
new O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
will O
emerge O
. O

The O
image O
of O
a O
scene O
captured O
by O
a O
camera O
phone O
can O
be O
a O
query O
to O
a O
remote O
server O
to O
identify O
the O
scene O
and O
return O
relevant O
information O
. O

But O
unconstrained O
scene O
identification O
is O
an O
open O
problem O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
discriminative O
measure O
to O
rank O
image O
patterns O
sampled O
from O
target O
scene O
classes O
. O

Support O
vector O
classifiers O

) O

in O

, O
or O

commonly O

. O

show O
that O

algorithm O
outperforms O
other O

detection O
methods O
and O
is O

of O

. O

can O

future O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Private O

( O

- O

: O

, O

server O
( O
as O

Nowadays O
, O
Web O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
Systems O
such O
as O

and O
Bing O
have O
become O

essential O
part O
of O
using O
the O
Internet O
. O

One O
of O
the O
main O
components O
of O
an O
IR O
system O
is O
the O
indexing O
module O
that O
builds O
an O
index O
file O
to O
speed O
up O
the O
searching O
process O
. O

In O
this O
research O
project O
we O
aimed O
to O
evaluate O
the O
improvements O
of O
IR O
efficiency O
that O
results O
from O
encoding O
the O
terms O
of O
the O
index O
using O
Huffman O
code O
. O

The O
results O
showed O
a O
reduction O
of O
terms O
size O
by O
40 O
% O
which O
reduces O
the O
overall O
index O
size O
, O
and O
consequently O
index O
transfer O
time O
. O

The O
results O
also O
showed O
a O
reduction O
of O
the O
number O
of O
comparisons O
needed O
to O
process O
each O
query O
by O
36 O
% O
using O
binary O
search O
. O

This O
approach O
reduces O
CPU O
- O
time O
used O
to O
process O
each O
query O
which O
increases O
the O
retrieval O
efficiency O
. O

Retrieving O
answer O
containing O
passages O
is O
a O
challenging O
task O
in O
Question O

. O

In O

paper O
, O
we O

using O
answer O

profiles O
. O

Our O
methodology O
includes O
two O
steps O
: O
estimation O
and O
ranking O
. O

In O

answer O

from O
question O
- O
answer O
sentence O

parallel O

. O

of O

: O

query O
word O
, O

answering O
sentence O

of O
translation O
. O

In O

are O
incorporated O
into O
the O
Language O
Modeling O
framework O
called O

Machine O
Translation O
models O
for O

. O

Using O
this O
framework O
a O
set O
of O
relevant O
passages O
are O
retrieved O
, O
given O
a O
question O
. O

We O
conducted O
experiments O
on O
FACTOID O
questions O
from O
TREC O
2002 O
to O
2006 O
QA O
tracks O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
showed O
significant O
improvements O
over O
different O

models O
including O
TFIDF O
, O
Okapi O
BM25 O
, O
Indri O
and O
KL O
- O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O

to O

within O

is O

findings O
are O
demonstrated O
on O
a O
large O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O

framework O
which O
uses O
trees O
over O
the O
vocabulary O
to O
capture O
similarities O
among O
terms O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
setting O
. O

This O
allows O
the O
retrieval O
of O
documents O
based O
not O
just O
on O
occurrences O
of O
specific O
query O
terms O
, O
but O
also O
on O
similarities O
between O
terms O
( O
an O
effect O
similar O
to O
query O
expansion O
Additionally O
our O
principled O
generative O
model O
exhibits O
an O
effect O
similar O
to O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
. O

We O
give O
encouraging O
experimental O
evidence O
of O
the O
superiority O
of O
the O
hierarchical O
Dirichlet O
tree O
compared O
to O
standard O
baselines O
. O

law O

. O

All O
evaluation O
processes O
were O
done O
on O
the O
COLIEE O
2017 O
training O
and O
test O
data O
set O
. O

The O
experimental O
result O
shows O
a O
very O
promising O
result O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Requirement O
tracing O
is O
an O
important O
activity O
for O
its O
helpfulness O
to O
effective O
system O
quality O
assurance O
, O
impact O
analyzing O
of O
changes O
and O
software O
maintenance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
automatic O
approach O
called O
LGRTL O
to O
recover O
traceability O
links O
between O
high O
- O
level O
requirements O
and O
low O
- O
level O
design O
elements O
. O

This O
approach O
treats O
the O
recovery O
process O
as O
Bayesian O
classification O
process O
. O

Meanwhile O
, O
we O
add O
a O
synonym O
process O
to O
the O
preprocessing O
phase O
, O
and O
improve O
the O
Bayesian O
model O
for O
performing O
better O
. O

To O
evaluate O
the O
validity O
of O
the O
method O
, O
we O
perform O
a O
case O
study O
and O
the O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
can O
enhance O
the O
effect O
to O
a O
certain O
extent O
. O

Keywords O
- O
automatic O
requirement O
traceability;Bayesian O

classifier;thesaurus;traceability O
links;information O
retrieval O

Music O
artist O
( O
i.e O
singer O
) O
recognition O
is O
a O
challenging O
task O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

The O
presence O
of O
different O
musical O
instruments O
, O
the O
diversity O
of O
music O
genres O
and O
singing O
techniques O
make O
the O

of O
artist O
- O

information O
from O
a O
song O
difficult O
. O

Many O
authors O
tried O
to O

this O
problem O
by O

features O
or O
hybrid O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O

propose O
new O
song O
- O

- O

that O
are O
built O
from O
frame O
- O
level O
MFCCs O
via O
so O
- O
called O

- O
vectors O
. O

report O

multiple O

such O
as O

- O
nearest O
neighbor O
, O
Discriminant O
Analysis O
and O
Naive O
Bayes O
using O
these O
new O
features O
. O

Our O
approach O
yields O
considerable O
improvements O
and O
outperforms O
existing O
methods O
. O

We O
could O
achieve O
an O
84.31 O
% O
accuracy O
using O
MFCC O
features O
on O
a O
20-classes O
artist O
recognition O
task O
. O

Interleaving O
is O
an O

technique O
for O
comparing O

relative O
quality O
of O
information O
retrieval O
functions O
by O
combining O
their O
result O
lists O
and O
tracking O
clicks O
. O

A O
sequence O
of O
such O
algorithms O
have O
been O
proposed O
, O
each O
being O
shown O
to O
address O
problems O
in O
earlier O

. O

process O

: O

for O

show O

algorithm O
can O
be O

solution O
to O
an O
optimization O
problem O
within O
those O
constraints O
. O

Our O

makes O
explicit O
the O
parameters O
of O

algorithm O
, O

about O
user O

. O

approach O
, O
using O

of O

. O

. O

- O

. O

Our O

- O

, O

. O

- O

. O

- O

by O

. O

The O

for O

. O

We O
briefly O

Search O
engines O
retrieve O
relevant O
information O
when O
users O
know O
exactly O
what O
they O
are O
looking O
for O
. O

The O
search O
is O
usually O
guided O
by O
relevant O
keywords O
provided O
by O
the O
user O
. O

But O
the O
key O
words O
provided O
might O
belong O
to O
different O
domains O
and O
the O
search O
may O
end O
up O
giving O
results O
on O
domains O
where O
the O
users O
are O
not O
interested O
on O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
information O
retrieval O
prototype O
by O
providing O
a O
personalized O
search O
interface O
. O

The O
interface O
is O
based O
on O
specific O
domain O
chosen O
by O
the O
user O
. O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
search O
is O
brought O
by O
fragmenting O
the O
search O
criterion O
into O
different O
parameters O
or O
the O
features O
of O
that O
domain O
. O

The O
user O
is O
assisted O
to O
enter O
only O
domain O
specific O
keywords O
. O

This O
helps O
to O
retrieve O
only O
the O
relevant O
information O
belonging O
to O
the O
chosen O
domain O
. O

The O
user O
is O
also O
given O
the O
choice O
to O
select O
more O
than O
one O
search O
criteria O
to O
refine O
the O
search O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Concept O
lattice O
, O
the O
core O
data O
structure O
in O
formal O
concept O
analysis O
, O
has O
been O
used O
widely O
in O
machine O
learning O
, O
data O
mining O
and O
knowledge O
discovery O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
etc O
. O

The O
main O
difficulty O
with O
concept O
lattice O
- O
based O
system O
comes O
from O
the O
lattice O
construction O
itself O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
parallel O
algorithm O
based O
on O
the O
closure O
search O
space O
partition O
for O
computing O
concepts O
is O
proposed O
. O

This O
algorithm O
divides O
the O
closure O
search O
space O
into O
several O
subspaces O
in O
accordance O
with O
criterions O
prescribed O
ahead O
and O
introduces O
an O
efficient O
scheme O
to O
recognize O
the O
valid O
ones O
, O
in O
which O
the O
searching O
for O
closures O
is O
bounded O
. O

An O
intermediate O
structure O
is O
employed O
to O
judge O
the O
validity O
of O
a O
subspace O
and O
compute O
closures O
more O
efficiently O
. O

Since O
the O
searching O
in O
subspaces O
are O
independent O
tasks O
, O
a O
parallel O
algorithm O
based O
on O
search O
space O
partition O
can O
be O
directly O
reached O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
conceptually O
fundamental O
in O
human O
communication O
as O
well O
as O
in O
man O
- O
computer O
communication O
. O

Computing O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
professionals O
have O
the O
opportunity O
to O
apply O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
within O
the O
second O
computer O
revolution O
to O
foster O
a O
new O
potential O
revolution O
in O
education O
, O
brought O
about O
by O
the O
advent O
of O
the O
personal O
computer O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Transliterated O
Search O
track O
has O
been O
organized O
for O
the O
third O
year O
in O
FIRE-2015 O
. O

The O
track O
had O
three O
subtasks O
. O

Subtask O
I O
was O
on O
language O
labeling O
of O
words O
in O
code O
- O
mixed O
text O
fragments O
; O
it O
was O
conducted O
for O
8 O
Indian O
languages O
: O
Bangla O
, O
Gujarati O
, O
Hindi O
, O
Kannada O
, O
Malayalam O
, O
Marathi O
, O
Tamil O
, O
Telugu O
, O
mixed O
with O
English O
. O

Subtask O
II O
was O
on O
ad O
- O
hoc O
retrieval O
of O
Hindi O
film O
lyrics O
, O
movie O
reviews O
and O
astrology O
documents O
, O
where O
both O
the O
queries O
and O
documents O
were O
either O
in O
Hindi O
written O
in O
Devanagari O
or O
in O
Roman O
transliterated O
form O
. O

Subtask O
III O
was O
on O
transliterated O
question O
answering O
where O
the O
documents O
as O
well O
as O
questions O
were O
in O
Bangla O
script O
or O
Roman O
transliterated O
Bangla O
. O

A O
total O
of O
24 O
runs O
were O
submitted O
by O
10 O
teams O
, O
of O
which O
14 O
runs O
were O
for O
subtask O

I O
and O
10 O
runs O
for O
subtask O
II O
. O

There O
were O
no O
participation O
for O
Subtask O
III O
. O

The O
overview O
presents O
a O
comprehensive O
report O
of O
the O
subtasks O
, O
datasets O
, O
runs O
submitted O
and O
performances O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
reports O
on O
the O
evaluation O
of O
a O
system O
that O
allows O
the O
use O
of O
spoken O
queries O
to O
retrieve O
information O
from O
a O
textual O
document O
collection O
. O

First O
, O
a O
large O
vocabulary O
continuous O
speech O
recognizer O
transcribes O
the O
spoken O
query O
into O
text O
. O

Then O
, O
an O
information O
retrieval O
engine O
retrieves O
the O
documents O
relevant O
to O
that O
query O
. O

The O
system O
works O
for O
Spanish O
language O
. O

In O
order O
to O
increase O
performance O
, O
we O
proposed O
a O
two O
- O
pass O
approach O
based O
on O
dynamic O
adaptation O
of O
language O
models O
. O

The O
system O
was O
evaluated O
using O
a O
standard O
IR O
test O
suite O
from O
CLEF O
. O

Spoken O
queries O
were O
recorded O
by O
10 O
di O
erent O
speakers O
. O

Results O
showed O
that O
the O
proposed O
approach O
outperforms O
the O
baseline O
system O
: O
a O
relative O
gain O
in O
retrieval O
precision O
of O
5.74 O
with O
a O
language O
model O
of O
60,000 O
words O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
approach O
based O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
for O
extracting O
and O
representing O
the O
unstructured O
information O
in O
large O
software O
systems O
such O
that O
it O
can O
be O
automatically O
combined O
with O
analysis O
of O
program O
dependencies O
and O
execution O
traces O
to O
define O
new O
techniques O
for O
feature O
location O
, O
impact O
analysis O
, O
and O
software O
measurement O
tasks O
. O

We O
expect O
that O
these O
new O
techniques O
will O
contribute O
directly O
to O
the O
improvement O
of O
design O
of O
incremental O
changes O
and O
thus O
increased O
software O
quality O
and O
reduction O
of O
software O
maintenance O
costs O
. O

The O
presented O
results O
are O
based O
on O
the O
author O
's O
doctoral O
dissertation O
[ O
23 O
] O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
address O
the O
issue O
of O
exploiting O
the O
synergy O
between O
different O
modalities O
to O
facilitate O
Internet O
information O
retrieval O
. O

It O
is O
well O
- O
known O
that O
information O
typically O
exists O
jointly O
in O
different O
modalities O
, O
and O
this O
is O
true O
for O
information O
in O
the O
Internet O
. O

We O
intend O
to O
demonstrate O
that O
exploiting O
the O
synergy O
between O
the O
different O
modalities O
of O
the O
information O
may O
enhance O
the O
information O
retrieval O
efficiency O
and O
effectiveness O
. O

Specifically O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
exploiting O
the O
cognitive O
synergy O
between O
text O
and O
imagery O
modalities O
. O

Machine O
learning O
techniques O
are O
used O
to O
explicitly O
exploit O
this O
synergy O
in O
order O
to O
address O
the O
effective O
retrieval O
of O
the O
multimedia O
information O
represented O
in O
the O
two O
modalities O
. O

We O
will O
demonstrate O
the O
proposed O
methodology O
through O
experimental O
data O
. O

, O

of O

. O

Then O

agents O

system O
and O
the O

system O
has O
also O

to O
establish O
primitive O
components O
of O
the O
above O
novel O
functions[1,2,3,4 O

. O

and O

are O

underrepresented O
in O
both O
the O
academic O
and O
professional O
environments O
of O
the O
information O
sciences O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
there O
is O
much O
evidence O
that O
women O
experience O
a O
cumulative O
disadvantage O
, O
in O
computer O
terms O
, O
that O
begins O
early O
in O
life O
in O
the O
grade O
schools O
and O
continues O
through O
the O
college O
and O
corporate O
experience O
. O

A O
qualitative O
survey O
– O
based O
approach O
was O
conducted O
in O
the O
study O
of O
111 O
regional O
corporations O
. O

It O
focuses O
on O
the O
ongoing O
strategies O
employed O
for O
the O
integration O
and O
retention O
of O
women O
in O
the O

systems O
discipline O
at O
Robert O
Morris O
University O
, O
with O
an O
outlook O
and O
survey O
of O
the O

environment O
of O
Pittsburgh O
and O
Southwestern O
Pennsylvania O
, O
and O
the O
gender O
effects O
of O
a O
decline O
in O
the O

and O

dimensions O
of O
the O
discipline O
in O
the O

years O
of O
the O


-DOCSTART- O

Machine O
learning O
techniques O
have O
been O
considered O
a O
very O
promising O
solution O
to O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
is O
based O
on O
the O
ranking O
of O
the O
relevance O
of O
samples O
to O
a O
query O
input O
. O

However O
, O
the O
connotation O
of O
labeling O
in O
ranking O
is O
quite O
different O
from O
that O
in O
classification O
. O

Specifically O
, O
the O
labeling O
of O
samples O
for O
ranking O
is O
usually O
incomplete O
, O
i.e. O
only O
a O
part O
of O
samples O
are O
labeled O
. O

In O
order O
to O
remedy O
this O
methodological O
gap O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
hybrid O
learning O
framework O
, O
called O
fuzzy O
- O
label O
learning O
, O
which O
consists O
of O
two O
layers O
. O

First O
, O
we O
utilize O
a O
label O
- O
propagation O
algorithm O
to O
estimate O
those O
labels O
of O
unlabeled O
samples O
by O
their O
neighborhoods O
. O

Second O
, O
we O
adopt O
RankBoost O
on O
the O
samples O
with O
fuzzy O
labels O
. O

Experiments O
with O
five O
- O
fold O
cross O
- O
validation O
using O
the O
Letor O
benchmark O
datasets O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
hybrid O
learning O
framework O
can O
definitively O
improve O
the O
search O
performance O
achieved O
by O
the O
RankBoost O
algorithm O
for O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
field O
has O
acknowledged O
the O
need O
for O

scientific O
evaluations O

some O
time O
now O
. O

Several O

and O

, O

and O

to O

, O
out O
of O
which O
the O
annual O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
Evaluation O
eXchange O
emerged O
. O

The O
community O
as O
a O
whole O
has O
enormously O
gained O
from O
this O
evaluation O
forum O
, O
but O
very O
little O
attention O
has O
been O
paid O
to O
reliability O
and O
correctness O
issues O
. O

From O
the O

of O
the O
analysis O
of O
experimental O

, O
this O
paper O
presents O
a O

of O
past O

- O

work O

of O
Text O

, O

that O
the O

to O

of O

cycle O
, O

out O
directions O
for O

proposals O

line O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
hybridisation O
of O
different O
classification O
and O
mining O
techniques O
coming O
from O
different O
areas O
such O
as O
the O
numeric O
and O
the O
symbolic O
worlds O
can O
produce O
a O
significant O
enhancement O
of O
the O
overall O
classification O
and O
retrieval O
performance O
in O
a O
Data O
Mining O
or O
Information O
Retrieval O
context O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
an O
experimental O
methodology O
to O
match O
an O
explicative O
structure O
issued O
from O
a O
symbolic O
classification O
to O
a O
numerical O
classification O
. O

The O
classification O
models O
used O
in O
the O
experiment O
are O
a O
boolean O
lattice O
on O
the O
symbolic O
side O
and O
a O
Kohonen O
Self O
Organising O
Map O
model O
( O
SOM O
) O
on O
the O
numerical O
side O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Context O
- O
aware O
information O
is O
widely O
available O
in O
various O
ways O
and O
is O
becoming O
more O
and O
more O
important O
for O
enhancing O
retrieval O
performance O
and O
recommendation O
results O
. O

The O
current O
main O
issue O
to O
cope O
with O
is O
not O
only O
recommending O
or O
retrieving O
the O
most O
relevant O
items O
and O
content O
, O
but O
defining O
them O
ad O
hoc O
. O

Other O
relevant O
issues O
include O
personalizing O
and O
adapting O
the O
information O
and O
the O
way O
it O
is O
displayed O
to O
the O
user O
's O
current O
situation O
and O
interests O
The O
workshop O
on O
Context O
- O
awareness O
in O
Retrieval O
and O
Recommendation O
is O
a O
forum O
for O
research O
on O
context O
- O
awareness O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
recommender O
systems O
and O
human O
computer O
interaction O
. O

The O
fourth O
iteration O
of O
the O
workshop O
was O
organized O
in O
conjunction O
to O
the O
36th O
European O
Conference O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O
Amsterdam O
, O
The O
Netherlands O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Text O
mining O
is O
the O
analysis O
of O
data O
contained O
in O
natural O
language O
text O
. O

Text O
mining O
works O
by O
transposing O
words O
and O
phrases O
in O
unstructured O
data O
into O
numerical O
values O
which O
can O
then O
be O
linked O
with O
structured O
data O
in O
a O
database O
and O
analyzed O
with O
traditional O
data O
mining O
techniques O
. O

Text O
information O
retrieval O
and O
data O
mining O
has O
thus O
become O
increasingly O
important O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
a O
survey O
of O
Text O
mining O
have O
been O
presented O
. O

Keyword O
: O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
and O
Indexing O
Techniques O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
proliferation O
of O
government O
information O
on O
local O
area O
networks O
and O
the O
Internet O
creates O
the O
problem O
of O
finding O
information O
that O
may O
be O
distributed O
among O
many O
disjoint O
text O
databases O
( O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
or O
federated O
search O
A O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
composed O
of O
three O
components O
: O
Resource O
representation O
, O
resource O
selection O
and O
result O
merging O
. O

Previous O
research O
suggested O
that O
the O
CORI O
algorithm O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
effective O
resource O
selection O
algorithms O
, O
but O
its O
effectiveness O
in O
environments O
containing O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
database O
sizes O
was O
not O
studied O
thoroughly O
. O

This O
paper O
shows O
that O
the O
CORI O
algorithm O
does O
not O
work O
well O
in O
environments O
with O
a O
skewed O
distribution O
of O
database O
sizes O
. O

We O
present O
a O
new O
resource O
selection O
algorithm O
based O
on O
estimating O
the O
distribution O
of O
relevant O
documents O
among O
the O
online O
databases O
. O

This O
new O
algorithm O
selects O
resources O
more O
accurately O
than O
the O
CORI O
algorithm O
, O
which O
can O
lead O
to O
improved O
document O
rankings O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Set O
expansion O
refers O
to O
expanding O
a O
given O
partial O
set O
of O
objects O
into O
a O
more O
complete O
set O
. O

A O
well O
- O
known O
example O
system O
that O
does O
set O
expansion O
using O
the O
web O
is O
Google O
Sets O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
method O
for O
expanding O
sets O
of O
named O
entities O
. O

The O
approach O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
semi O
- O
structured O
documents O
written O
in O
any O

and O

language O
. O

We O
present O
experimental O
results O
on O
36 O

sets O
in O
three O
languages O
, O
showing O
that O
our O
system O
is O
superior O
to O
Google O
Sets O
in O
terms O
of O
mean O
average O
precision O
. O

- O

- O

) O

Lab O

Technology O
. O

The O

is O
based O
on O
a O
supervised O
method O
using O
an O

classifier O
. O

Multi O
- O
resources O
including O
words O
in O
the O
surrounding O
context O
, O
the O
partof O
- O
speech O
of O
neighboring O
words O
, O
collocations O
and O

relations O
are O
used O
. O

The O
final O

- O
avg O

score O
achieves O
81.9 O
% O
on O
the O
test O
set O
, O
the O
best O
one O
among O
participating O
runs O
. O

Retrieval O
( O

) O
technology O

to O
search O
relevant O
and O
necessary O
documents O
from O

. O

In O

context O
of O
e O
- O

, O

can O

to O
find O

related O
to O
a O

between O
one O
verse O
to O

others O
. O

of O

Participation O
is O
today O
central O
to O
many O
kinds O
of O
research O
and O
design O
practice O
in O
information O
studies O
and O
beyond O
. O

From O

to O

to O

, O

remains O
both O

in O
its O

. O

Intuitions O
about O
participation O
are O
confirmed O
by O
some O

, O
but O
scandalized O
by O
others O
, O
and O
it O
is O
difficult O
to O

. O

that O

distinctions O
and O

of O

role O
of O

. O

We O
derive O
7 O
dimensions O
of O
participations O
from O
the O
literature O
on O
participation O
and O
exemplify O
those O
dimensions O
using O
a O

of O
102 O
cases O
of O
contemporary O

that O
include O
uses O
of O

and O
new O
media O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
the O
IRT O
project O
( O
Internet O
Information O
Retrieval O
Tools O
) O
is O
described O
. O

The O
basic O
goal O
of O
IRT O
is O
to O
advise O
users O
of O
Internet O
search O
engines O
in O
retrieving O
information O
from O
the O
free O
public O
access O
part O
of O
the O
Internet O
. O

In O
achieving O
this O
, O
IRT O
has O
developed O
a O
model O
to O
evaluate O
search O
engines O
. O

This O
model O
is O
described O
in O
here O
. O

Evaluation O
criteria O
refer O
to O
functionality O
: O
search O
options O
, O
presentation O
characteristics O
and O
indexing O
characteristics O
( O
which O
elements O
of O
a O
Web O
document O
are O
indexed O

Also O
evaluated O
is O
the O
consistency O
of O
retrieval O
through O
search O
engines O
. O

This O
model O
has O
been O
tested O
in O
the O
period O
October O
December O
1998 O
on O
six O
of O
the O
major O
search O
engines O
. O

We O
found O
many O
differences O
among O
Internet O
indexes O
in O
their O
functionality O
, O
as O
well O
as O
in O
their O
consistency O
and O
reliability O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Ohio O
State O
's O
school O
year O
is O
divided O
into O
four O
quarters O
, O
each O
ten O
weeks O
long O
. O

It O
is O
possible O
to O
schedule O
classes O
to O
meet O
three O
, O
four O
, O
or O
five O
hours O
per O
week O

The O
latter O
with O
50 O
class O
meetings O
is O
similar O
to O
a O
three O
semester O
hour O
course O
Most O
students O
attend O
classes O
for O
three O
of O
the O
four O
quarters O
. O

Because O
the O
amount O
of O
material O
covered O
in O
a O
programming O
class O
is O
proportional O
to O
the O
number O
and O
quality O
of O
programs O
completed O
, O
we O
have O
chosen O
a O
two O
quarter O
sequence O
, O
each O
course O
meeting O
three O
days O
a O
week O
. O

The O
students O
receive O
four O
quarter O
hours O
credit O
( O
one O
hour O
of O
laboratory O
credit O
) O
for O
each O
course O
. O

The O
students O
in O
this O
sequence O
are O
mostly O
computer O
and O
information O
science O
majors O
, O
but O
there O
are O
also O
many O
mathematics O
and O
some O
science O
and O
engineering O
majors O
. O

There O
are O
other O
courses O
for O
administrative O
science O
, O
engineering O
and O
other O
non O
- O
technical O
students O
. O

All O
the O
introductory O
courses O
are O
taught O
by O
graduate O
students O
under O
the O
supervision O
of O
a O
faculty O
member O
. O

With O
the O
frequent O
occurrence O
of O
various O
types O
of O
emergencies O
, O
construct O
an O
emergency O
GIS O
system O
has O
become O
a O

system O
project O
. O

A O

number O
of O

data O
accumulated O
is O

in O

systems O
, O
and O

are O

different O

. O

How O
to O

in O

, O
and O

- O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O

propose O
an O
emergency O

system O

on O
GML O
and O
multi O
- O
source O
spatial O
data O
. O

In O
which O
, O
GML O
is O
a O
simple O
and O
effective O
way O
to O
solve O
multi O
- O
source O
, O
multi O
- O
level O
, O
multi O
- O
dimensional O
geospatial O
information O
interoperability O
. O

Ontology O
- O
based O
semantic O
information O
retrieval O
technology O
can O
improve O
the O
recall O
and O
precision O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
GIS O
client O
can O
dynamically O
and O
transparently O
read O
the O
feature O
level O
of O
spatial O
data O
by O
using O
the O
WFS O
service O
, O
and O
get O
the O
results O
returned O
in O
GML O
format O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Lake O

Zone O

, O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
normalized O
recall O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
popular O
evaluation O
measures O
for O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
an O
overview O
of O
its O
development O
is O
given O
. O

It O
is O
then O
shown O
that O
the O
normalized O
recall O
is O
closely O
related O
to O
other O
measures O
such O
as O
the O
CRE O
- O
measure O
and O
the O
expected O
search O
length O
. O

Some O
implications O
are O
analysed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
offer O
an O
attractive O
alternative O
to O
construction O
of O
a O
topic O
tracking O
system O
from O
scratch O
. O

The O
freely O
available O
PRISE O
vector O
space O
text O
retrieval O
system O
was O
applied O
to O
the O
TDT-2 O
topic O
tracking O
task O
. O

A O
simple O
version O
of O
the O
Rocchio O
formula O
was O
used O
for O
profile O
formulation O
and O
a O
retrieval O
status O
value O
threshold O
was O
used O
in O
conjunction O
with O
a O
temporal O
cutoff O
to O
make O

decisions O
. O

The O
results O
indicate O
that O

produced O

, O

with O

that O

. O

would O
be O
compatible O
with O
our O
approach O
. O

This O

a O
method O
to O
directly O

's O
needs O
during O
the O

of O

. O

The O

with O
a O

editor O
in O

to O
find O
similar O
documents O
to O

. O

Suggested O

of O

code O

. O

These O
segments O
are O
subsequently O
used O
to O
calculate O
similarity O
with O
the O
new O
document O
using O
an O
optimal O
matching O
algorithm O
. O

We O

- O

- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O

) O

. O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
for O
CBIR O
system O
, O
all O
the O
image O
feature O
descriptors O
including O
color O
descriptors O
, O
texture O
descriptors O
and O
shape O
descriptors O
are O
used O
to O
represent O
low O
- O
level O
image O
features O
. O

Implementation O
of O
one O
feature O
descriptor O
does O
n't O
give O
sufficient O
retrieval O
accuracy O
. O

For O
combining O
of O
different O
types O
of O
features O
, O
there O
is O
a O
need O
to O
train O
these O
features O
with O
different O
weights O
to O
achieve O
good O
results O
. O

A O
real O
coded O
chromosome O
genetic O
algorithm O
( O
GA O
) O
and O
anyone O
performance O
evaluation O
parameter O
of O
CBIR O
like O
precision O
or O
recall O
are O
used O
as O
fitness O
function O
to O
optimize O
feature O
weights O
. O

Meanwhile O
, O
a O
real O
coded O
chromosome O
corresponding O
to O
higher O
precision O
as O
fitness O
function O
is O
used O
to O
select O
optimum O
weights O
of O
features O
. O

The O
optimal O
weights O
of O
features O
computed O
by O
GA O
have O
improved O
significantly O
all O
the O
evaluation O
measures O
including O
average O
precision O
and O
average O
recall O
for O
the O
combined O
features O
method O
. O

this O

’s O

aims O
to O
1 O
) O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
probabilistic O
topic O
model O
for O
analyzing O
and O
extracting O
contentrelated O
annotations O
from O
noisy O
annotated O
discrete O
data O
such O
as O
web O
pages O
stored O
in O
social O
bookmarking O
services O
. O

In O
these O
services O
, O
since O
users O
can O
attach O
annotations O
freely O
, O
some O
annotations O
do O
not O
describe O
the O
semantics O
of O
the O
content O
, O
thus O
they O
are O
noisy O
, O
i.e. O
not O
content O
- O
related O
. O

The O
extraction O
of O
content O
- O
related O
annotations O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
preprocessing O
step O
in O
machine O
learning O
tasks O
such O
as O
text O
classification O
and O
image O
recognition O
, O
or O
can O
improve O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

The O
proposed O
model O
is O
a O
generative O
model O
for O
content O
and O
annotations O
, O
in O
which O
the O
annotations O
are O
assumed O
to O
originate O
either O
from O
topics O
that O
generated O
the O
content O
or O
from O
a O
general O
distribution O
unrelated O
to O
the O
content O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
by O
using O
synthetic O
data O
and O
real O
social O
annotation O
data O
for O
text O
and O
images O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
we O
attempted O
to O
develop O
the O
techniques O
for O
co O
operative O
client O
cache O
and O
transparent O
proxy O
cache O
managers O
for O
effective O
information O
retrieval O
. O

As O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
has O
grown O
exponentially O
in O
last O
two O
decades O
, O
every O
day O
the O
search O
engines O
process O
billions O
of O
queries O
. O

The O
web O
users O
and O
web O
applications O
are O
growing O
in O
number O
and O
this O
will O
lead O
to O
increase O
in O
latency O
, O
network O
congestion O
and O
server O
overloading O
. O

When O
caching O
is O
used O
, O
the O
request O
for O
content O
need O
not O
make O
multiple O
trips O
back O
and O
forth O
to O
the O
clients O
and O
the O
where O
the O
content O
is O
stored O
. O

Proxy O
server O
caches O
and O
personalized O
client O
caches O
are O
suggested O
to O
overcome O
these O
problems O
. O

The O
simulation O
results O
show O
that O
our O
proposed O
hybrid O
replacement O
algorithm O
performs O
better O
than O
other O
algorithms O
like O
LRU O
, O
LFU O
and O
FIFO O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O
information O
retrieval O
method O
based O
on O
speech O
recognition O
results O
. O

Nowadays O
, O
there O
is O
huge O
speech O
data O
like O
news O
speech O
in O
TV O
and O
Radio O
broadcasts O
, O
etc O
. O

However O
, O
it O
is O
not O
easy O
to O
retrieve O
necessary O
information O
from O
these O
data O
because O
extra O
informations O
for O
retrieval O
are O
not O
attached O
to O
most O
of O
these O
data O
. O

To O
solve O
the O
problems O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
a O
Fuzzy O
retrieval O
method O
based O
on O
speech O
recognition O
results O
is O
proposed O
. O

As O
speech O
data O
is O
converted O
into O
the O
character O
data O
and O
character O
- O
based O
query O
is O
retrieved O
on O
the O
character O
data O
, O
the O
query O
can O
be O
quickly O
retrieved O
. O

It O
is O
necessary O
to O
consider O
the O
speech O
recognition O
error O
at O
the O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
two O
techniques O
considering O
the O
the O
speech O
recognition O
errors O
; O
the O
first O
technique O
is O
based O
on O
the O
phoneme O
error O
tendency O
in O
the O
speech O
recognition O
results O
and O
the O
second O
technique O
is O
based O
on O
the O
phoneme O
spectral O
distance O
. O

This O
paper O
shows O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
Fuzzy O
retrieval O
through O
evaluation O
experiments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
work O
deals O
with O
the O
implementation O
of O
a O
logical O
model O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Specifically O
, O
we O
present O
algorithms O
for O
document O
ranking O
within O
the O
Belief O
Revision O
framework O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
logical O
model O
that O
stands O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
our O
proposal O
can O
be O
efficiently O
implemented O
within O
realistic O
systems O
. O

Besides O
the O
inherent O
advantages O
introduced O
by O
logic O
, O
the O
expressiveness O
is O
extended O
with O
respect O
to O
classical O
systems O
because O
documents O
are O
represented O
as O
unrestricted O
propositional O
formulas O
. O

As O
well O
as O
representing O
classical O
vectors O
, O
the O
model O
can O
deal O
with O
partial O
descriptions O
of O
documents O
. O

Scenarios O
that O
can O
benefit O
from O
these O
more O
expressive O
representations O
are O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
context O
of O
MIR O
/ O
MDL O
evaluation O
, O
a O
key O
component O
for O

be O
the O

to O

of O

. O

This O

a O

path O
towards O
this O
goal O
by O
following O
the O

principles O
of O

. O

to O

data O
collection O
for O

. O

that O
would O

for O
MIR O
/ O
MDL O
development O
and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
an O
incremental O
method O
that O
can O
be O
used O
by O
an O
intelligent O
system O
to O
learn O
better O
descriptions O
of O
a O
thematic O
context O
. O

The O
method O
starts O
with O
a O
small O
number O
of O
terms O
selected O
from O
a O
simple O
description O
of O
the O
topic O
under O
analysis O
and O
uses O
this O
description O
as O
the O
initial O
search O
context O
. O

Using O
these O
terms O
, O
a O
set O
of O
queries O
are O
built O
and O
submitted O
to O
a O
search O
engine O
. O

New O
documents O
and O
terms O
are O
used O
to O
refine O
the O
learned O
vocabulary O
. O

Evaluations O
performed O
on O
a O
large O
number O
of O
topics O
indicate O
that O
the O
learned O
vocabulary O
is O
much O
more O
effective O
than O
the O
original O
one O
at O
the O
time O
of O
constructing O
queries O
to O
retrieve O
relevant O
material O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
the O
machine O
learning O
of O
formal O
word O
sense O
, O
learned O
in O
interaction O
with O
human O
users O
using O
a O
new O
form O
of O
Relational O
Reinforcement O
Learning O
. O

The O
envisaged O
main O
application O
area O
of O
our O
framework O
is O
humanmachine O
communication O
, O
where O
a O
software O
agent O
or O
robot O
needs O
to O
understand O
concepts O
used O
by O
human O
users O
( O
e.g O
in O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
, O
HCI O
or O
Information O
Retrieval O

In O
contrast O
to O
traditional O
approaches O
to O
the O
machine O
learning O
and O
disambiguation O
of O
word O
meaning O
, O
our O
framework O
focuses O
on O
the O
interactive O
learning O
of O
concepts O
in O
a O
dialogue O
with O
the O
user O
and O
on O
the O
integration O
of O
rich O
formal O
background O
knowledge O
and O
dynamically O
adapted O
policy O
constraints O
in O
the O
learning O
process O
, O
which O
makes O
our O
approach O
suitable O
for O
dynamic O
interaction O
environments O
with O
varying O
word O
usage O
contexts O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
IMIRSEL O
( O
International O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
Evaluation O
Laboratory O
) O
project O
provides O
an O
unprecedented O
platform O
for O
evaluating O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
and O
Music O
Digital O
Library O
( O
MDL O
) O
techniques O
, O
by O
bringing O
together O
large O
corpora O
and O
significant O
computational O
resources O
with O
the O
necessary O
rights O
management O
and O
technical O
infrastructure O
to O
support O
a O
variety O
of O
MIR O
/ O
MDL O
research O
areas O
. O

The O
standardized O
research O
collection O
being O
deployed O
represents O
a O
large O
and O
diverse O
corpus O
of O
musical O
examples O
, O
which O
we O
are O
hosting O
in O
our O
secure O
environment O
for O
use O
in O
evaluating O
MIR O
/ O
MDL O
algorithms O
. O

Grid O
services O
and O
NCSA O
's O
D2 O
K O
machine O
learning O
environment O
provide O
a O
powerful O
, O
highperformance O
, O
and O
secure O
framework O
for O
designing O
, O
optimising O
, O
and O
executing O
complex O
MIR O
/ O
MDL O
evaluation O
applications O
. O

IMIRSEL O
provides O
a O
community O
resource O
for O
researchers O
who O
would O
otherwise O
not O
be O
able O
to O
afford O
the O
content O

and O
computational O
resources O
to O
carry O
out O
large O
- O
scale O
MIR O
/ O

evaluations O
. O

behavior O
of O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
content O
- O
based O
retrieval O
of O
Western O
music O
has O
received O
increasing O
attention O
recently O
. O

Much O
of O
this O
research O
deals O
with O
monophonic O
music O
. O

Polyphonic O
music O
is O
more O
common O
, O
but O
also O
more O
difficult O
to O
represent O
. O

Music O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
must O
extract O
viable O
features O
before O
they O
can O
define O
similarity O
measures O
. O

We O
summarize O
and O
categorize O
representation O
features O
that O
have O
been O
used O
for O
polyphonic O
retrieval O
with O
the O
aim O
of O
laying O
standardized O
groundwork O
for O
future O
feature O
extraction O
research O
. O

Comparisons O
with O
and O
extensions O
to O
monophonic O
approaches O
are O
given O
, O
and O
a O
new O
feature O
, O
an O
extension O
of O
duration O
- O
independent O
pitch O
slices O
, O
is O
proposed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
PageRank O
algorithm O
is O
used O
in O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
to O
calculate O
a O
single O
list O
of O
popularity O
scores O
for O
each O
page O
in O
the O
Web O
. O

These O
popularity O
scores O
are O
used O
to O
rank O
query O
results O
when O
presented O
to O
the O
user O
. O

By O
using O
the O
structure O
of O
the O
entire O
Web O
to O
calculate O
one O
score O
per O
document O
, O
we O
are O
calculating O
a O
general O
popularity O
score O
, O
not O
particular O
to O
any O
community O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
PageRank O
scores O
are O
more O
suited O
to O
general O
queries O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
more O
general O
form O
of O
PageRank O
, O
using O
Web O
multi O
- O
resolution O
community O
- O
based O
popularity O
scores O
, O
where O
each O
document O
obtains O
a O
popularity O
score O
dependent O
on O
a O
given O
Web O
community O
. O

When O
a O
query O
is O
related O
to O
a O
specific O
community O
, O
we O
choose O
the O
associated O
set O
of O
popularity O
scores O
and O
order O
the O
query O
results O
accordingly O
. O

Using O
Web O
- O
community O
based O
popularity O
scores O
, O
we O
achieved O
an O
11 O
% O
increase O
in O
precision O
over O
PageRank O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
is O
, O
and O
always O
has O
been O
, O
an O
elusive O
concept O
; O
nevertheless O
many O
philosophers O
, O
mathematicians O
, O
logicians O
and O
computer O
scientists O
have O
felt O
that O
it O
is O
fundamental O
. O

Many O
attempts O
have O
been O
made O
to O
derive O
some O
sensible O
and O
intuitively O
acceptable O
definition O
of O
information O
; O
until O
now O
, O
none O
of O
these O
have O
succeeded O
. O

Authors O
such O
as O
Dretske O
[ O
4 O
Barwise O
, O
and O
Devlin O
claimed O
that O
the O
notion O
of O
information O
starts O
from O
the O
position O
that O
given O
an O
ontology O
of O
objects O
individuated O
by O
a O
cognitive O
agent O
, O
it O
makes O
sense O
to O
speak O
of O
the O
information O
an O
object O
( O
e.g O
a O
text O
, O
an O
image O
, O
a O
video O
) O
contains O
about O
another O
object O
( O
e.g O
the O
query O
This O
phenomenon O
is O
captured O
by O
the O
flow O
of O
information O
between O
objects O
. O

Its O
exploitation O
is O
the O
task O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Many O
advanced O
models O
have O
been O
developed O
for O
information O
retrieval O
over O
the O
last O
years O
. O

These O
models O
are O
built O
on O
various O
artificial O
intelligence O
paradigms O
to O
improve O
the O
precision O
of O
the O
retrieval O
. O

Most O
of O
them O
exploit O
some O
form O
of O
term O
co O
- O
occurrences O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
quality O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
compare O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
of O
five O
of O
these O
models O
: O
the O
Extended O
Boolean O
model O
, O
the O
Generalized O
Vector O
Space O
model O
, O
the O
Frequent O
Set O
model O
, O
the O
Rough O
Set O
model O
and O
a O
Genetic O
- O
Based O
model O
. O

These O
models O
are O
tested O
on O
three O
sub O
- O
collections O
from O
TREC O

( O
Text O
REtrieval O
Conference O
We O
analyze O
the O
specificity O
of O
the O
models O
regarding O
the O
form O
of O
co O
- O
occurrences O
introduced O
and O
report O
on O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
and O
the O
scalability O
of O
each O
model O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Surf O
Canyon O
has O
developed O
real O
- O
time O
implicit O
personalization O
technology O
for O
web O
search O
and O
implemented O
the O
technology O
in O
a O
browser O
extension O
that O
can O
dynamically O
modify O
search O
engine O
results O
pages O
( O

Google O
, O
Yahoo O
and O
Live O
Search O
A O
combination O
of O
explicit O
( O
queries O
, O
reformulations O
) O
and O
implicit O
( O
clickthroughs O
, O
skips O
, O
page O
reads O
, O
etc O
user O
signals O
are O
used O
to O
construct O
a O
model O
of O
instantaneous O
user O
intent O
. O

This O
user O
intent O
model O
is O
combined O
with O
the O
initial O
search O
result O
rankings O
in O
order O
to O
present O
recommended O
search O
results O
to O
the O
user O
as O
well O
as O
to O
reorder O
subsequent O
search O
engine O
results O
pages O
after O
the O
initial O
page O
. O

This O
paper O
will O
use O
data O
from O
the O
first O
three O
months O
of O
Surf O
Canyon O
usage O
to O
show O
that O
a O
user O
intent O
model O
built O
from O
implicit O
user O
signals O
can O
dramatically O
improve O
the O
relevancy O
of O
search O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
an O
analysis O
of O
the O
associations O
between O
emotion O
categories O
and O
audio O
features O
automatically O
extracted O
from O
raw O
audio O
data O
. O

This O
work O
is O
based O
on O
110 O
excerpts O
from O
film O
soundtracks O
evaluated O
by O
116 O
listeners O
. O

This O
data O
is O
annotated O
with O
5 O
basic O
emotions O
( O
fear O
, O
anger O
, O
happiness O
, O
sadness O
, O
tenderness O
) O
on O
a O
7 O
points O
scale O
. O

Exploiting O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
techniques O
, O
we O
extract O
audio O
features O
of O
different O
kind O
: O
timbral O
, O
rhythmic O
and O
tonal O
. O

Among O
others O
we O
also O
compute O
estimations O
of O
dissonance O
, O
mode O
, O
onset O
rate O
and O
loudness O
. O

We O
study O
statistical O
relations O
between O
audio O
descriptors O
and O
emotion O
categories O
confirming O
results O
from O
psychological O
studies O
. O

We O
also O
use O
machine O
- O
learning O
techniques O
to O
model O
the O
emotion O
ratings O
. O

We O
create O
regression O
models O
based O
on O
the O
Support O
Vector O
Regression O
algorithm O
that O
can O
estimate O
the O
ratings O
with O
a O
correlation O
of O
0.65 O
in O
average O
. O

of O

, O

to O

and O

to O

into O
how O

arrive O

. O

To O
address O

, O

propose O
requiring O

to O
provide O

specific O

of O

underlying O

. O

resources O
, O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

Exhaustive O
evaluation O
of O
ranked O
queries O
can O
be O
expensive O
, O
particularly O
when O
only O
a O
small O
subset O
of O
the O
overall O
ranking O
is O
required O
, O
or O
when O
queries O
contain O
common O
terms O
. O

This O
concern O
gives O
rise O
to O
techniques O
for O
dynamic O
query O
pruning O
, O
that O
is O
, O
methods O
for O
eliminating O
redundant O
parts O
of O
the O
usual O
exhaustive O
evaluation O
, O
yet O
still O
generating O
a O
demonstrably O
" O
good O
enough O
" O
set O
of O
answers O
to O
the O
query O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
propose O
new O
pruning O
methods O
that O
make O
use O
of O
impact O
- O
sorted O
indexes O
. O

Compared O
to O
exhaustive O
evaluation O
, O
the O
new O
methods O
reduce O
the O
amount O
of O
computation O
performed O
, O
reduce O
the O
amount O
of O
memory O
required O
for O
accumulators O
, O
reduce O
the O
amount O
of O
data O
transferred O
from O
disk O
, O
and O
at O
the O
same O
time O
allow O
performance O
guarantees O
in O
terms O
of O
precision O
and O
mean O
average O
precision O
. O

These O
strong O
claims O
are O
backed O
by O
experiments O
using O
the O
TREC O
Terabyte O
collection O
and O
queries O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Search O
Engines O
and O
Classified O
Directories O
have O
become O
essential O
tools O
for O
locating O
information O
on O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
. O

A O
consequence O
of O
increasing O
demand O
, O
as O
the O
volume O
of O
information O
on O
the O
Web O
has O
expanded O
, O
has O
been O
a O
vast O
growth O
in O
the O
number O
of O
tools O
available O
. O

Each O
one O
claims O
to O
be O
more O
comprehensive O
, O
more O
accurate O
and O
more O
intuitive O
to O
use O
than O
the O
last O
. O

This O
paper O
attempts O
to O
organise O
the O
available O
tools O
into O
a O
number O
of O
categories O
, O
according O
to O
their O
information O
acquisition O
and O
retrieval O
methods O
, O
with O
the O
intention O
of O
exposing O
the O
strengths O
and O
weaknesses O
of O
the O
various O
approaches O
. O

The O
importance O
and O
implications O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
are O
discussed O
. O

Description O
of O
the O
evolution O
of O
automated O
tools O
enables O
an O
insight O
into O
the O
aims O
of O
recent O
and O
future O
implementations O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
interactive O
searching O
environments O
, O
robust O
linguistic O
techniques O
can O
provide O
sophisticated O
search O
assistance O
with O
a O
reasonable O
tolerance O
to O
errors O
, O
because O
users O
can O
easily O
select O
relevant O
items O
and O
dismiss O
the O
noisy O
bits O
. O

The O
general O
idea O
is O
that O
the O
combination O
of O
Language O
Engineering O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
can O
be O
used O
to O
suggest O
complex O
terms O
or O

of O

to O
the O
user O
, O
facilitating O
query O
formulation O
and O
refinement O
when O
the O
information O
need O
is O
not O
completely O
defined O
a O
priori O
or O
when O

user O
is O
not O

in O

. O

, O

that O

from O
the O
collection O
, O
and O
related O
to O
the O
initial O
query O
terms O
, O

users O
to O
filter O
and O
structure O
relevant O
information O
according O
to O
the O
persons O
, O
locations O
or O
other O
entities O
involved O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
information O
systems O
design O
and O
development O
methodologies O
tend O
to O
overly O
focus O
on O
the O
technical O
details O
of O
the O
system O
such O
as O
memory O
management O
, O
system O
internals O
, O
algorithms O
and O
modules O
. O

It O
is O
not O
unusual O
for O
system O
designers O
and O
developers O
to O
often O
completely O
omit O
from O
the O
thought O
process O
the O
human O
element O
. O

This O
article O
offers O
a O
new O
information O
systems O
perspective O
particularly O
for O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
with O
a O
focus O
on O
human O
computer O
interaction O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
hybrid O
case O
- O
based O
reasoning O
( O
CBR O
) O
and O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
, O
called O
SPIRE O
, O
that O
both O
retrieves O
documents O
from O
a O
full O
- O
text O
document O
corpus O
and O
from O
within O
individual O
documents O
, O
and O
locates O
passages O
likely O
to O
contain O
information O
about O
important O
problem O
- O
solving O
features O
of O
cases O
. O

SPIRE O
uses O
two O
case O
- O
bases O
, O
one O
containing O
past O
precedents O
, O
and O
one O
containing O
excerpts O
from O
past O
case O
texts O
. O

Both O
are O
used O
by O

to O
automatically O
generate O

, O
which O
are O
then O
run O
by O

INQUERY O
full O
- O
text O

engine O
on O
a O
large O
text O
collection O
in O
the O
case O
of O
document O
retrieval O
and O
on O
individual O
text O
documents O
for O
passage O
retrieval O
. O

between O

of O

. O

. O

. O

of O

. O

of O

, O
are O
promising O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Most O
recent O
document O
standards O
like O
XML O
rely O
on O
structured O
representations O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
current O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
been O
developed O
for O
flat O
document O
representations O
and O
can O
not O
be O
easily O
extended O
to O
cope O
with O
more O
complex O
document O
types O
. O

The O
design O
of O
such O
systems O
is O
still O
an O
open O
problem O
. O

We O
present O
a O
new O
model O
for O
structured O
document O
retrieval O
which O
allows O
computing O
scores O
of O
document O
parts O
. O

This O
model O
is O
based O
on O
Bayesian O
networks O
whose O
conditional O
probabilities O
are O
learnt O
from O
a O
labelled O
collection O
of O
structured O
documents O
— O
which O
is O
composed O
of O
documents O
, O
queries O
and O
their O
associated O
assessments O
. O

Training O
these O
models O
is O
a O
complex O
machine O
learning O
task O
and O
is O
not O
standard O
. O

This O
is O
the O
focus O
of O
the O
paper O
: O
we O
propose O
here O
to O
train O
the O
structured O
Bayesian O
Network O
model O
using O
a O
cross O
- O
entropy O
training O
criterion O
. O

Results O
are O
presented O
on O
the O
INEX O
corpus O
of O
XML O
documents O
. O

of O

users O
, O

. O

of O

. O

First O

to O

from O
this O
field O

, O

about O

we O

for O

2011 O
. O

metrics O

to O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Precision O
at O
k O
documents O
retrieved O
( O
P@k O
a O
common O
measure O
of O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
, O
is O
the O
fraction O
of O
relevant O
documents O
in O
the O
first O
k O
returned O
by O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
in O
response O
to O
a O
query O
. O

It O
has O
been O
observed O
that O
P@k O
increases O
with O
collection O
size O
, O
all O
other O
variables O
being O
equal O
. O

An O
explanation O
for O
this O
increase O
derives O
from O
the O
probability O
ranking O
principle O
: O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
score O
documents O
by O
likelihood O
of O
relevance O
and O
return O
the O
documents O
in O
decreasing O
order O
of O
score O
. O

In O
a O
larger O
collection O
there O
are O
more O
high O
- O
scoring O
documents O
and O
therefore O
the O
average O
score O
of O
the O
first O
k O
will O
be O
higher O
, O
resulting O
in O
higher O
P@k O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
logical O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
treats O
retrieval O
as O
uncertain O
inference O
. O

In O
advanced O
applications O
, O
we O
have O
to O
deal O
with O
a O
multi O
- O
step O
inference O
process O
involving O
different O
system O
components O
: O
information O
needs O
, O
search O
activities O
, O
queries O
, O
query O
intermediaries O
, O
databases O
and O
documents O
. O

In O
order O
to O
provide O
a O
better O
system O
support O
for O
satisfying O
a O
user O
's O
information O
need O
, O
these O
components O
should O
be O
changed O
into O
active O
objects O
( O
agents O
) O
with O
high O
- O
level O
functions O
. O

Especially O
, O
we O
describe O
diierent O
levels O
of O
search O
activities O
( O
moves O
, O
tactics O
, O
stratagems O
and O
strategies O
) O
as O
well O
as O
diierent O
types O
of O
documents O
( O
data O
only O
, O
objects O
with O
IR O
methods O
, O
active O
objects O
, O
communicating O
objects O
) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

One O
of O
the O
main O
problems O
facing O
human O
analysts O
dealing O
with O
large O
amounts O
of O
dynamic O
data O
is O
that O
important O
information O
may O
not O
be O
assessed O
in O
time O
to O
aid O
the O
decision O
making O
process O
. O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
distributed O
processing O
framework O
called O
Intelligent O
Foraging O
, O
Gathering O
and O
Matching O
( O
I O
- O
FGM O
) O
that O
addresses O
this O
problem O
by O
concentrating O
on O
resource O
allocation O
and O
adapting O
to O
computational O
needs O
in O
real O
- O
time O
. O

It O
serves O
as O
an O
umbrella O
framework O
in O
which O
the O
various O
tools O
and O
techniques O
available O
in O
information O
retrieval O
can O
be O
used O
effectively O
and O
efficiently O
. O

We O
implement O
a O
prototype O
of O
I O
- O
FGM O
and O
validate O
it O
through O
both O
empirical O
studies O
and O
theoretical O
performance O
analysis O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

SIM O
, O
the O
Structured O
Information O
Manager O
, O
is O
an O
information O

system O
which O
is O
designed O
to O
manage O
multi O
- O

of O
documents O

, O

, O
and O
other O
forms O
of O

, O
