natively O
in O
SGML O
, O
XML O
, O
MARC O
, O
RTF O
, O
and O
ASCII O
formats O
. O

It O
is O
a O
fully O
- O
fledged O
system O
that O
provides O
integrated O
support O
for O
efficient O
ranked O
full O
text O
, O
boolean O
, O
and O
structural O
querying O
via O
a O
robust O
database O
server O
capable O
of O
practically O
managing O
multi O
- O
gigabyte O
document O
collections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Coverage O
is O
an O
important O
criterion O
when O
evaluating O
information O
systems O
. O

This O
exploratory O
study O
investigates O
this O
issue O
by O
submitting O
the O
same O
query O
to O
different O
databases O
relevant O
to O
the O
query O
topic O
. O

Data O
were O
retrieved O
from O
three O
databases O
: O
ACM O
Digital O
Library O
, O
Web O
of O
Science O
( O
with O
the O
Proceedings O
Citation O
Index O
) O
and O
Scopus O
. O

The O
search O
phrase O
was O
“ O
information O
retrieval O
publication O
years O
were O
between O
2013 O
and O
2016 O
. O

Altogether O
8,699 O
items O
were O
retrieved O
, O
out O
of O
which O
5,306 O
( O
61 O
items O
were O

database O
only O
, O
and O
only O
977 O
( O
11 O
items O
were O
located O
in O
all O
three O
databases O
. O

These O
977 O
items O
were O
further O
analyzed O
: O
citation O
counts O
retrieved O
from O
the O
three O
databases O
were O
compared O
. O

Citations O
were O
also O
compared O
to O
altmetric O
data O
of O
these O
publications O
, O
collected O
from O
Mendeley O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
method O
based O
on O
estimating O
for O
domains O
of O
the O
query O
using O
hierarchic O
structures O
of O
Web O
directories O
. O

To O
get O
the O
most O
appropriate O
translation O
of O
the O
queries O
, O
we O
utilize O
the O
Web O
directories O
written O
in O
many O
different O
languages O
as O
multilingual O
corpus O
for O
disambiguating O
translation O
of O
the O
query O
and O
for O
estimating O
the O
domain O
of O
search O
results O
using O
hierarchic O
structures O
of O
Web O
directories O
. O

From O
experimental O
evaluations O
, O
we O
found O
that O
there O
is O
an O
advantage O
in O
retrieval O
accuracy O
using O
our O
proposal O
for O
disambiguating O
translation O
in O
CLIR O
system O
. O

We O
found O
that O
it O
is O
effective O
to O
restrict O
to O
target O
fields O
of O
the O
query O
using O
lower O
level O
merged O
categories O
in O
order O
to O
acquire O
suited O
translation O
of O
the O
query O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Considering O
search O
process O
in O
the O
evaluation O
of O
interactive O
information O
retrieval O
is O
a O
challenging O
issue O
. O

This O
paper O
explores O
tempo O
of O
search O
actions O
( O
query O
, O
click O
, O
and O
judgement O
) O
to O
measure O
people O
’s O
search O
process O
and O
performance O
. O

When O
we O
analyze O
how O
people O
consume O
their O
search O
resource O
( O
i.e O
a O
total O
number O
of O
search O
actions O
taken O
to O
complete O
a O
task O
) O
over O
the O
time O
, O
it O
was O
observed O
that O
there O
was O
a O
different O
pattern O
in O
successful O
sessions O
and O
unsuccessful O
sessions O
. O

Successful O
sessions O
tend O
to O
have O
a O
regular O
tempo O
in O
search O
actions O
while O
poor O
sessions O
tend O
to O
have O
uneven O
distribution O
of O
resource O
usage O
. O

The O
resource O
consumption O
graph O
also O
allows O
us O
to O
observe O
where O
in O
the O
search O
process O
was O
affected O
by O
experimental O
conditions O
. O

Therefore O
, O
this O
paper O
suggests O
that O
tempo O
of O
search O
actions O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
model O
successful O
search O
sessions O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
report O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
creation O
of O
a O
new O
face O
image O
data O
set O
, O
an O
effort O
undertaken O
as O
part O
of O
the O
MASKS O
( O
Maintaining O
Anonymity O
by O

Key O
Statistics O
) O
Project O
. O

This O
set O
of O
high O
- O
quality O
, O

controlled O
images O
were O
taken O
from O
April O
until O
December O
2006 O
at O
the O
GRASP O
( O
General O
Robotics O
, O
Automation O
, O

and O

) O
Laboratory O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Re O
- O
ranking O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
aims O
to O
elevate O
relevant O
feedbacks O
and O
depress O
negative O
ones O
in O
initial O
retrieval O
result O
list O
. O

Compared O
to O
relevance O
feedback O
- O
based O
re O
- O
ranking O
method O
widely O
adopted O
in O
the O
literature O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O
method O
to O
well O
use O
three O
features O
in O
known O
negative O
feedbacks O
to O
identify O
and O
depress O
unknown O
negative O
feedbacks O
. O

The O
features O
include O
: O
1 O
) O
the O
minor O
( O
lower O
- O
weighted O
) O
terms O
in O
negative O
feedbacks O
; O
2 O
) O
hierarchical O
distance O
( O
HD O
) O
among O
feedbacks O
in O
a O
hierarchical O
clustering O
tree O
; O
3 O
) O
obstinateness O
strength O
of O
negative O
feedbacks O
. O

We O
evaluate O
the O
method O
on O
the O
TDT4 O
corpus O
, O
which O
is O
made O
up O
of O
news O
topics O
and O
their O
relevant O
stories O
. O

And O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
new O
scheme O
substantially O
outperforms O
its O
counterparts O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Nowadays O
, O
increasingly O
, O
documents O
are O
marked O
- O
up O
using O
XML O
, O
the O
format O
standard O
for O
structured O
documents O
. O

In O
contrast O
to O
HTML O
, O
which O
is O
mainly O
layoutoriented O
, O
XML O
follows O
the O
fundamental O
concept O
of O
separating O
the O
logical O
structure O
of O
a O
document O
from O
its O
layout O
. O

This O
document O
logical O
structure O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
allow O
a O
focused O
access O
to O
documents O
, O
where O
the O
aim O
is O
to O
return O
the O
most O
relevant O
fragments O
within O
documents O
as O
answers O
to O
queries O
, O
instead O
of O
whole O
documents O
. O

This O
article O
describes O
approaches O
developed O
to O
query O
, O
represent O
, O
and O
rank O
XML O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
experiment O
system O
framework O
that O
enables O
researchers O
to O
design O
and O
conduct O
task O
- O
based O
experiments O
for O
Interactive O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IIR O

The O
primary O
focus O
is O
on O
multidimensional O
logging O
to O
obtain O
rich O
behavioral O
data O
from O
participants O
. O

We O
summarize O
initial O
experiences O
and O
highlight O
the O
benefits O
of O

data O
logging O
within O
the O
system O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
formal O
model O
of O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
that O
does O
not O
rely O
on O
either O
query O
translation O
or O
document O
translation O
. O

Our O
approach O
leverages O
recent O
advances O
in O
language O
modeling O
to O
directly O
estimate O
an O
accurate O
topic O
model O
in O
the O
target O
language O
, O
starting O
with O
a O
query O
in O
the O
source O
language O
. O

The O
model O
integrates O
popular O
techniques O
of O
disambiguation O
and O
query O
expansion O
in O
a O
unified O
formal O
framework O
. O

We O
describe O
how O
the O
topic O
model O
can O
be O
estimated O
with O
either O
a O
parallel O
corpus O
or O
a O
dictionary O
. O

We O
test O
the O
framework O
by O
constructing O
Chinese O
topic O
models O
from O
English O
queries O
and O
using O
them O
in O
the O
CLIR O
task O
of O
TREC9 O
. O

The O
model O
achieves O
performance O
around O
95 O
% O
of O
the O
strong O
mono O
- O
lingual O
baseline O
in O
terms O
of O
average O
precision O
. O

In O
initial O
precision O
, O
our O
model O
outperforms O
the O
mono O
- O
lingual O
baseline O
by O
20 O

The O
main O
contribution O
of O
this O
work O
is O
the O
unified O
formal O
model O
which O
integrates O
techniques O
that O
are O
essential O
for O
effective O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

An O
information O
retrieval O
system O
that O
captures O
both O
visual O
and O
textual O
contents O
from O
paper O
documents O
can O
derive O
maximal O
benefits O
from O
DAR O
techniques O
while O
demanding O
little O
human O
assistance O
to O
achieve O
its O
goals O
. O

This O
article O
discusses O
technical O
problems O
, O
along O
with O
solution O
methods O
, O
and O
their O
integration O
into O
a O
well O
- O
performing O
system O
. O

The O
focus O
of O
the O
discussion O
is O
very O
difficult O
applications O
, O
for O
example O
, O
Chinese O
and O
Japanese O
documents O
. O

Solution O
methods O
are O
also O
highlighted O
, O
with O
the O
emphasis O
placed O
upon O
some O
new O

, O

window O
- O
based O

using O

, O

for O

, O
and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
area O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
deals O
with O
problems O
of O
storage O
and O
retrieval O
within O
a O
huge O
collection O
of O
text O
documents O
. O

In O
IR O
models O
, O
the O
semantics O
of O
a O
document O
is O
usually O
characterized O
using O
a O
set O
of O
terms O
. O

A O
common O
need O
to O
various O
IR O
models O
is O
an O
efficient O
term O
retrieval O
provided O
via O
a O
term O
index O
. O

Existing O
approaches O
of O
term O
indexing O
, O
e. O
g. O
the O
inverted O
list O
, O
support O
efficiently O
only O
simple O
queries O
asking O
for O
a O
term O
occurrence O
. O

In O
practice O
, O
we O
would O
like O
to O
exploit O
some O
more O
sophisticated O
querying O
mechanisms O
, O
in O
particular O
queries O
based O
on O
regular O
expressions O
. O

In O
this O
article O
we O
propose O
a O
multidimensional O
approach O
of O
term O
indexing O
providing O
efficient O
term O
retrieval O
and O
supporting O
regular O
expression O
queries O
. O

Since O
the O
term O
lengths O
are O
usually O
different O
, O
we O
also O
introduce O
an O
improvement O
based O
on O
a O
new O
data O
structure O
, O
called O
BUB O
- O
forest O
, O
providing O
even O
more O
efficient O
term O
retrieval O
. O

the O

years O
Blog O
Search O

. O

. O

Collections O

Browsing O

. O

Recent O

. O

This O

. O

In O

. O

We O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
used O
a O
custom O
designed O
tactor O
suit O
to O
provide O
full O
body O

feedback O
across O
the O

arm O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O

in O

world O
. O

We O

to O

reach O

. O

We O
present O

that O

of O

. O

Our O

presented O
here O
show O

, O

, O

with O

of O
tactors O
. O

With O

to O

system O
, O

performance O
results O
can O
be O
obtained O
. O

Comments O
University O

-DOCSTART- O

At O
Georgia O
Tech O
, O
we O
investigated O
the O
eeectiveness O
of O
a O
visualization O
scheme O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
. O

Displayed O
like O
a O
bar O
- O
graph O
, O
the O
visualization O
tool O
shows O
the O
distribution O
of O
query O
words O
in O
the O
set O
of O
documents O
retrieved O
in O
response O
to O
a O
query O
. O

We O
found O
that O
end O
- O
users O
use O
the O
visualization O
for O
two O
purposes O
: O
to O
gain O
speciic O
information O
about O
individual O
documents O
such O
as O
the O
distribution O
of O
diierent O
query O
words O
in O
that O
document O
. O

to O
gain O
aggregate O
information O
about O
the O
query O
result O
in O
general O
such O
as O
getting O
a O
sense O
of O
the O
direction O
of O
the O
query O
results O
. O

In O
general O
they O
used O
the O
visualization O
tool O
as O
much O
as O
the O
title O
and O
full O
text O
in O
the O
process O
of O
deciding O
if O
a O
document O
addresses O
the O
given O
search O
topic O
. O

In O
structured O
post O
- O
session O
interviews O
with O
searchers O
, O
we O
also O
obtained O
information O
about O
what O
the O
searcher O
liked O
, O
what O
was O
frustrating O
to O
them O
, O
and O
what O
they O
wanted O
in O
the O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

At O
present O
, O
Vietnamese O
knowledge O
base O
( O
vnKB O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
focuses O
of O
Vietnamese O
researchers O
because O
of O
its O
applications O
in O
wide O
areas O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
Machine O
Translation O
( O
MT O
) O
etc O
. O

There O
have O
been O
several O
separate O
projects O
developing O
vnKB O
in O
various O
domains O
. O

The O
training O
in O
vnBK O
is O
the O
most O
difficulty O
because O
of O
quantity O
and O
quality O
of O
training O
data O
, O
and O
lacking O
of O
available O
Vietnamese O
corpus O
with O
acceptable O
quality O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
an O
approach O
, O
which O
first O
extracts O
semantic O
information O
from O
Vietnamese O
Wikipedia O
( O
vnWK O
then O
trains O
the O
proposed O
vnKB O
by O
applying O
support O
vector O
machine O
( O
SVM O
) O
technique O
. O

The O
experimentation O
of O
the O
proposed O
approach O
shows O
that O
it O
is O
a O
potential O
solution O
because O
of O
its O
good O
results O
and O
proves O
that O
it O
can O
provide O
more O
valuable O
benefits O
when O
applying O
to O
our O
Vietnamese O
Semantic O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
goal O
of O
a O
typical O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
to O
satisfy O
a O
user O
's O
information O
need O
e.g O
by O
providing O
an O
answer O
or O
information O
" O
nugget O
while O
the O
actual O
search O
space O
of O
a O
typical O
information O
retrieval O
system O
consists O
of O
documents O
i.e O
collections O
of O
nuggets O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
characterize O
this O
relationship O
between O
nuggets O
and O
documents O
and O
discuss O
applications O
to O
system O
evaluation O

In O
particular O
, O
for O
the O
problem O
of O
test O
collection O
construction O
for O
IR O
system O
evaluation O
, O
we O
demonstrate O
a O
highly O
efficient O
algorithm O
for O
simultaneously O
obtaining O
both O
relevant O
< O
i O
> O
documents</i O
> O
and O
relevant O
< O
i O
> O

information</i O

Our O
technique O
exploits O
the O
mutually O
reinforcing O
relationship O
between O
relevant O
documents O
and O
relevant O
information O
, O
yielding O
document O
- O
based O
test O
collections O
whose O
efficiency O
and O
efficacy O
exceed O
those O
of O
typical O
Cranfield O
- O
style O
test O
collections O
, O
while O
also O
generating O
sets O
of O
highly O
relevant O
information O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
study O
investigates O
the O
use O
of O
genetic O
algorithms O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
method O
is O
shown O
to O
be O
applicable O
to O
three O
well O
- O
known O
documents O
collections O
, O
where O
more O
relevant O
documents O
are O
presented O
to O
users O
in O
the O
genetic O
modification O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
new O
fitness O
function O
for O
approximate O
information O
retrieval O
which O
is O
very O
fast O
and O
very O
flexible O
, O
than O
cosine O
similarity O
fitness O
function O
. O

Keywords O
— O
Cosine O
similarity O
, O
Fitness O
function O
, O
Genetic O
Algorithm O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Query O
learning O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
the O
design O
and O
implementation O
of O
a O
system O
for O
logic O
- O
baaed O
multimedia O
retrieval O
. O

As O
highlevel O
logic O
for O
retrieval O
of O
hypermedia O
documents O
, O
we O
have O
developed O
a O
probabilistic O
object O
- O
oriented O
logic O
( O
POOL O
) O
which O
supports O
aggregated O
objects O
, O
different O
kinds O
of O
propositions O
( O
terms O
, O
classifications O
and O
attributes O
) O
and O
even O
rules O
as O
being O
contained O
in O
objects O
. O

Based O
on O
a O
probabilistic O
four O
- O
valued O
logic O
, O
POOL O
uses O
an O
implicit O
open O
world O
assumption O
, O
allows O
for O
closed O
world O
assumptions O
and O
is O
able O
to O
deal O
with O
inconsistent O
knowledge O
. O

POOL O
programs O
and O
queries O
are O
translated O
into O
probabilistic O
Datalog O
programs O
which O
can O
be O
interpreted O
by O
the O
HySpirit O
inference O
engine O
. O

For O
storing O
the O
multimedia O
data O
, O
we O
have O
developed O
a O
new O
basic O
IR O
system O
which O
yields O
physical O
data O
abstraction O
. O

The O
overall O
architecture O
and O
the O
flexibility O
of O
each O
layer O
supports O
logic O
- O
based O
methods O
for O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Social O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
SIR O
) O
exploits O
the O
user O
's O
social O
data O
in O
order O
to O
refine O
the O
retrieval O
, O
for O
instance O
in O
the O
case O
where O
users O
with O
different O
backgrounds O
may O
express O
different O
information O
needs O
as O
a O
same O
textual O
query O
. O

However O
, O
this O
additional O
source O
of O
information O
is O
not O
supported O
by O
the O
classical O
IR O
process O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
approach O
to O
generate O
the O
user O
profile O
from O
his O
social O
data O
. O

This O
generated O
profile O
is O
integrated O
within O
a O
SIR O
model O
allowing O
to O
personalize O
the O
list O
of O
documents O
returned O
to O
the O
user O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
methods O
represent O
query O
results O
in O
a O
ranked O
, O
one O
dimensional O
list O
without O
revealing O
connections O
among O
documents O
and O
document O
groups O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
model O
of O
document O
representation O
and O
extend O
the O
notion O
of O
similarity O
to O
consider O
document O
length O
and O
word O
synonyms O
to O
organize O
documents O
into O
topically O
relevant O
groups O
. O

Matches O
to O
a O
user O
query O
are O
presented O
in O
an O
intuitive O
, O
interactive O
map O
that O
facilitates O
browsing O
information O
and O
finding O
the O
most O
relevant O
matches O
within O
the O
overall O
landscape O
of O
results O
. O

Current O
research O
is O
aimed O
at O
finding O
the O
best O
metric O
to O
group O
documents O
, O
and O
in O
defining O
the O
visual O
model O
. O

Our O
system O
, O
named O
GIST O
, O
is O
built O
using O
the O
PREFUSE O
toolkit O
for O
graphical O
display O
[ O
1 O
] O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
clinical O
documents O
stored O
in O
a O
textual O
and O
unstructured O
manner O
represent O
a O
precious O
source O
of O
information O
that O
can O
be O
gathered O
by O
exploiting O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
. O

Classification O
algorithms O
can O
be O
used O
for O
organizing O
this O
huge O
amount O
of O
data O
, O
but O
are O
usually O
tested O
on O
standardized O
corpora O
, O
which O
significantly O
differ O
from O
actual O
clinical O
documents O
that O
can O
be O
found O
in O
a O
modern O
hospital O
. O

The O
result O
is O
that O
observed O
performance O
are O
different O
from O
expected O
ones O
. O

Given O
such O
differences O
, O
it O
is O
unclear O
how O
should O
be O
the O
“ O
right O
” O
training O
set O
, O
and O
how O
its O
characteristics O
affects O
the O
classification O
performance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
the O
results O
of O
an O
experimental O
analysis O
, O
conducted O
on O
actual O
clinical O
documents O
from O
a O
medical O
Department O
, O
which O
aims O
to O
evaluate O
the O
impact O
of O
differently O
sized O
and O
assembled O
training O
sets O
on O
well O
- O
known O
classification O
techniques O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
in O
this O
paper O
a O
combination O
of O
Machine O
Learning O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
and O
stochastic O
language O
modelling O
in O
a O
hierarchical O
system O
that O
extracts O
surface O
information O
from O
text O
. O

At O
the O
lowest O
level O
of O
this O
hierarchy O
, O
documents O
and O
paragraphs O
are O
successively O
routed O
with O
IR O
techniques O
. O

At O
the O
top O
level O
, O
a O
stochastic O
language O
model O
extracts O
the O
most O
relevant O
phrases O
, O
and O
labels O
the O
type O
of O
information O
they O
contain O
. O

The O
approach O
and O
preliminary O
results O
are O
demonstrated O
on O
a O
subset O
of O
the O
MUC-6 O
Scenario O
Templates O
task O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Until O
now O
the O
growing O
volume O
of O
heterogeneous O
and O
distributed O
information O
on O
the O
WWW O
makes O
increasingly O
difficult O
for O
the O
existing O
tools O
to O
retrieve O
relevant O
information O
. O

To O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
these O
tools O
, O
we O
suggest O
to O
handle O
two O
aspects O
of O
the O
problem O
: O
One O
concerns O
a O
better O
representation O
and O
description O
of O
WWW O
pages O
, O
we O
introduce O
here O
a O
new O
concept O
of O
" O
WWW O
documents O
and O
we O
describe O
them O
thanks O
to O
metadata O
. O

We O
'll O
use O
the O
Dublin O
Core O
semantics O
and O
the O
XML O
syntax O
to O
represent O
these O
metadata O
. O

We O
'll O
suggest O
how O
this O
concept O
can O
improve O
information O
retrieval O
on O
the O
WWW O
and O
reduce O
the O
network O
load O
generated O
by O
robots O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
flexible O
architecture O
based O
on O
two O
kinds O
of O
robots O
generalists O
" O
and O
" O
specialists O
" O
that O
collect O
and O
organize O
these O
metadata O
, O
in O
order O
to O
localize O
the O
resources O
on O
the O
WWW O
. O

They O
will O
contribute O
to O
the O
overall O
auto O
- O
organizing O
information O
process O
by O
exchanging O
their O
indices O
. O

- O

that O

4.1 O
( O

this O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
investigate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
both O
the O
standard O
evaluation O
measures O
and O
the O
opinion O
component O
for O
topical O
opinion O
retrieval O
. O

We O
analyze O
how O
relevance O
is O
affected O
by O
opinions O
by O
perturbing O
relevance O
ranking O
by O
the O
outcomes O
of O
opinion O
- O
only O
classifiers O
built O
by O
Monte O
Carlo O
sampling O
. O

Topical O
opinion O
rankings O
are O
obtained O
by O
either O
re O
- O
ranking O
or O
filtering O
the O
documents O
of O
a O
first O
- O
pass O
retrieval O
of O
topic O
relevance O

The O
proposed O
approach O
establishes O
the O
correlation O
between O
the O
accuracy O
and O
the O
precision O
of O
the O
classifier O
and O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
topical O
opinion O
retrieval O
. O

Among O
other O
results O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
assess O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
opinion O
component O
by O
comparing O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
relevance O
baseline O
with O
the O
topical O
opinion O
ranking O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Opinion O
research O
has O
been O
paid O
much O
attention O
by O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
community O
, O
and O
opinion O
holder O
extraction O
research O
is O
important O
for O
discriminating O
between O
opinions O
that O
are O
viewed O
from O
different O
perspectives O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
experience O
of O
participation O
in O
the O
NTCIR-6 O
Opinion O
Analysis O
Pilot O
Task O
by O

on O
opinion O
extraction O
results O
in O
Japanese O
and O
English O
. O

Our O
approach O
to O
opinion O
holder O
extraction O
was O
based O
on O
the O
discrimination O
between O
author O
and O
authority O
viewpoints O
in O
opinionated O
sentences O
, O
and O
the O
evaluation O
results O
were O
fair O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
Japanese O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
plethora O
of O
web O
services O
available O
on O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
presents O
a O
great O
opportunity O
to O
users O
. O

It O
also O
gives O
rises O
to O
a O
great O
challenge O
: O
to O
enable O
discovery O
, O
reuse O
and O
interoperation O
of O
web O
services O
and O
software O
components O
on O
the O
web O
. O

To O
support O
programmatic O
service O
discovery O
, O
we O
have O
developed O
a O
suite O
of O
methods O
that O
utilize O
both O
the O
semantics O
of O
natural O
language O
descriptions O
and O
identifiers O
in O
WSDL O
( O
Web O
Service O
Description O
Language O
) O
descriptions O
and O
the O
structures O
of O
their O
operations O
, O
messages O
and O
types O
to O
assess O
the O
similarity O
of O
two O
WSDL O
services O
. O

service O
discovery O

that O

semantic O
and O
structure O

assessments O
enable O
a O
substantially O
more O
precise O
service O
- O
discovery O
process O
. O

In O
present O
scenario O
, O
with O
the O
unprecedented O
development O
of O
electronics O
and O
tremendous O
growth O
of O
the O
Internet O
, O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
has O
become O
common O
and O
popular O
source O
of O
information O
for O
varied O
category O
of O
users O
. O

Web O
search O
engines O
provide O
interface O
between O
users O
and O
web O
to O
extract O
the O
desired O
information O
from O
WWW O
. O

The O
user O
possess O
query O
to O
search O
engine O
and O
in O
response O
the O
search O
engine O
return O
useful O
information O
. O

It O
is O
observed O
that O
typical O
search O
engines O
return O
the O
same O
result O
for O
the O
query O
submitted O
by O
different O
users O
irrespective O
of O
specific O
user O
need O
. O

Generally O
, O
each O
user O
has O
specific O
information O
requirement O
. O

It O
is O
always O
desirable O
that O
search O
result O
should O
satisfy O
the O
exact O
user O
requirement O
. O

We O
have O
proposed O
approaches O
to O
make O
the O
search O
adapting O
to O
satisfy O
the O
user O
need O
. O

The O
approaches O
discussed O
here O
are O
based O
on O
ontology O
and O
dynamic O
user O
profile O
. O

. O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
decade O
has O
seen O
a O
great O
deal O
of O
progress O
in O
the O
development O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
we O
still O
lack O
a O
systematic O
understanding O
of O
the O
behavior O
of O
the O
systems O
and O
their O
relationship O
with O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
completely O
new O
approach O
towards O
the O
understanding O
of O
the O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Recently O
, O
it O
has O
been O
observed O
that O
retrieval O
systems O
in O
TREC O
6 O
show O
some O
remarkable O
patterns O
in O
retrieving O
relevant O
documents O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
TREC O
6 O
observations O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
geometric O
linear O
model O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
then O
apply O
the O
model O
to O
predict O
the O
number O
of O
relevant O
documents O
by O
the O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
model O
is O
also O
scalable O
to O
a O
much O
larger O
data O
set O
. O

Although O
the O
model O
is O
developed O
based O
on O
the O
TREC O
6 O
routing O
test O
data O
, O
I O
believe O
it O
can O
be O
readily O
applicable O
to O
other O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
Appendix O
, O
we O
explained O
a O
simple O
and O
efficient O
way O
of O
making O
a O
better O
system O
from O
the O
existing O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Vannevar O
Bush O
's O
1945 O
article O
set O
a O
goal O
of O
fast O
access O
to O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
world O
's O
libraries O
which O
looks O
like O
it O
will O
be O
achieved O
by O
2010 O
, O
sixty O
- O
five O
years O
later O
. O

Thus O
, O
its O
history O
is O
comparable O
to O
that O
of O
a O
person O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
had O
its O
schoolboy O
phase O
of O
research O
in O
the O
1950s O
and O
early O
1960s O
; O
it O
then O
struggled O
for O
adoption O
in O
the O
1970s O
but O
has O
, O
in O
the O
1980s O
and O
1990s O
, O
reached O
acceptance O
as O
free O
- O
text O
search O
systems O
are O
used O
routinely O
. O

The O
tension O
between O
statistical O
and O
intellectual O
content O
analysis O
seemed O
to O
be O
moving O
towards O
purelyg O
statistical O
methods O
; O
now O
, O
on O
the O
Web O
, O
manual O
linking O
is O
coming O
back O
. O

As O
we O
have O
learned O
how O
to O
handle O
text O
, O
information O
retrieval O
is O
moving O
on O
, O
to O
projects O
in O
sound O
and O
image O
retrieval O
, O
along O
with O
electronic O
provision O
of O
much O
of O
what O
is O
now O
in O
libraries O
. O

We O
can O
look O
forward O
to O
completion O
of O
Bush O
's O
dream O
, O
within O
a O
single O
lifespan O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Internet O
has O
marked O
this O
era O
as O
the O
information O
age O
. O

There O
is O
no O
precedent O
in O
the O
amazing O
amount O
of O
information O
, O
especially O
network O
news O
, O
that O
can O
be O
accessed O
by O
Internet O
users O
these O
days O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
the O
problem O
of O
seeking O
information O
in O
online O
news O
articles O
is O
not O
the O
lack O
of O
them O
but O
being O
overwhelmed O
by O
them O
. O

This O
brings O
huge O
challenges O
in O
processing O
online O
news O
feeds O
, O
e.g O
how O
to O
determine O
which O
news O
article O
is O
important O
, O
how O
to O
determine O
the O
quality O
of O
each O
news O
article O
, O
and O
how O
to O
filter O
irrelevant O
and O
redundant O
information O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
for O
filtering O
redundant O
and O
less O
- O
informative O
RSS O
news O
articles O
that O
solves O
the O
problem O
of O
excessive O
number O
of O
news O
feeds O
observed O
in O
RSS O
news O
aggregators O
. O

Our O
filtering O
approach O
measures O
similarity O
among O
RSS O
news O
entries O
by O
using O
the O
fuzzy O
- O
set O
information O
retrieval O
model O
and O
a O
fuzzy O
equivalent O
relation O
for O
computing O
word O
/ O
sentence O
similarity O
to O
detect O
redundant O
and O
less O
- O
informative O
news O
articles O

-DOCSTART- O

Object O
detection O
from O
still O
images O
has O
been O
among O
the O
most O
active O
and O
challenging O
area O
in O
computer O
vision O
recently O
. O

In O
contrast O
, O
fully O
supervised O
object O
detection O
from O
video O
has O
rarely O
been O
investigated O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
algorithm O
to O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
object O
detection O
from O
video O
. O

Our O
proposed O
method O
is O
based O
on O
an O
empirical O
property O
that O
the O
trajectory O
of O
an O
object O
is O
important O
for O
detection O
in O
videos O
. O

We O
use O
object O
trajectory O
to O
filter O
outliers O
, O
determine O
probable O
location O
of O
object O
and O
correct O
detection O
errors O
. O

We O
compare O
our O
method O
with O
baseline O
method O
which O
regard O
video O
frames O
as O
still O
images O
directly O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
our O
method O
outperform O
the O
compared O
baseline O
in O
terms O
of O
average O
precision O
while O
inducing O
moderate O
computation O
overhead O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Most O
clustering O
methods O
for O
information O
retrieval O
application O
do O
not O
work O
efficiently O
when O
dealing O
with O
complicated O
data O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
compare O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Topic O
Mapsbased O
method O
with O
the O
Clustering O
- O
based O
method O
. O

An O
experimental O
test O
was O
carried O
out O
using O
20 O
volunteer O
to O
evaluate O
and O
compare O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Topic O
Maps O
- O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
and O
Clustering O
- O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
in O
security O
domain O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
a O
Topic O
Maps O
- O
based O
method O
provides O
both O
better O
recall O
/ O
precision O
and O
shorter O
search O
time O
/ O
search O
steps O
. O

This O

. O

. O

This O
work O
presents O
an O
information O
retrieval O
architecture O
developed O
for O
the O
Santa O
Catarina O
State O
Telemedicine O
System O
. O

This O
architecture O
employs O
DICOM O
Structured O
Reporting O
, O
controlled O
vocabularies O
for O
data O
catalogization O
and O
a O
specially O
developed O
search O
engine O
for O
data O
indexing O
and O
storing O
. O

Results O
of O
our O
case O
study O
show O
that O
searches O
can O
be O
performed O
much O
faster O
with O
the O
proposed O
search O
mechanism O
and O
that O
the O
precision O
of O
results O
is O
acceptable O
in O
most O
cases O
. O

In O
some O

, O
irrelevant O
items O
within O
the O
15 O
first O
results O
were O
identified O
. O

This O
occurred O

because O
search O
terms O
found O
in O
the O
additional O
free O
text O
observations O
inserted O
into O

were O
treated O

the O

as O
formally O

of O

DICOM O

associated O
to O

in O

findings O
reports O
were O
not O
taken O
into O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Abstract O
We O
cast O
the O
ranking O
problem O
as O
( O
1 O
) O
multiple O
classification O

Mc O
2 O
) O
multiple O
ordinal O
classification O
, O
which O
lead O
to O
computationally O
tractable O
learning O
algorithms O
for O
relevance O
ranking O
in O
Web O
search O
. O

We O
consider O
the O
DCG O
criterion O
( O
discounted O
cumulative O
gain O
a O
standard O
quality O
measure O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Our O
approach O
is O
motivated O
by O
the O
fact O
that O
perfect O
classifications O
result O
in O
perfect O
DCG O
scores O
and O
the O
DCG O
errors O
are O
bounded O
by O
classification O
errors O
. O

We O
propose O
using O
the O
Expected O
Relevance O
to O
convert O
class O
probabilities O
into O
ranking O
scores O
. O

The O
class O
probabilities O
are O
learned O
using O
a O
gradient O
boosting O
tree O
algorithm O
. O

Evaluations O
on O
large O
- O
scale O
datasets O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
can O
improve O
LambdaRank O
[ O
5 O
] O
and O
the O
regressions O
- O
based O
ranker O
[ O
6 O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
( O
normalized O
) O
DCG O
scores O
. O

An O
efficient O
implementation O
of O
the O
boosting O
tree O
algorithm O
is O
also O
presented O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Determining O
semantic O
similarity O
between O
words O
, O
concepts O
and O
phrases O
is O
important O
in O
many O
areas O
within O
Artificial O
Intelligence O
. O

This O
includes O
the O
general O
areas O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
data O
mining O
, O
and O
natural O
language O
processing O
. O

Existing O
approaches O
have O
primarily O
focused O
on O
noun O
to O
noun O
synonym O
comparison O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
technique O
for O
the O
comparison O
of O
general O
expressions O
that O
combines O
web O
searching O
with O
Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis O
. O

This O
technique O
is O
more O
general O
than O
previous O
approaches O
, O
as O
it O
is O
able O
to O
match O
similarities O
between O
multiword O
expressions O
, O
abbreviations O
, O
and O
alpha O
- O
numeric O
phrases O
. O

Consequently O
, O
it O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
more O
complex O
comparison O
problems O
such O
as O
ontology O
alignment O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Efficient O
and O
intelligent O
music O
information O
retrieval O
is O
a O
very O
important O
topic O
of O
the O
21st O
century O
. O

With O
the O
ultimate O
goal O
of O
building O
personal O
music O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
this O
paper O
studies O
the O
problem O
of O
identifying O
" O
similar O
" O
artists O
using O
both O
lyrics O
and O
acoustic O
data O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
clustering O
algorithm O
that O
integrates O
features O
from O
both O
sources O
to O
perform O
bimodal O
learning O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
tested O
on O
a O
data O
set O
consisting O
of O
570 O
songs O
from O
53 O
albums O
of O
41 O
artists O
using O
artist O
similarity O
provided O
by O
All O
Music O
Guide O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
accuracy O
of O
artist O
similarity O
classifiers O
can O
be O
significantly O
improved O
and O
that O
artist O
similarity O
can O
be O
efficiently O
identified O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
natural O
language O
processing O
morphological O
analyzer O
, O
morphological O
generator O
and O
morphological O
parser O
is O
the O
essential O
common O
tool O
used O
in O
developing O
language O
software O
. O

Morphological O
analyzer O
is O
a O
computer O
program O
which O
provides O
the O
grammatical O
information O
of O
a O
word O
. O

Morphological O
generator O
, O
by O
giving O
/ O
providing O
the O
root O
word O
and O
grammatical O
information O
, O
it O
generates O
all O
word O
forms O
of O
that O
word O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
morphological O
parsing O
is O
the O
process O
of O
determining O
the O
morphemes O
from O
given O
word O
? O

In O
this O
article O
I O
surveys O
the O
different O
work O
have O
done O
about O
Odia O
morphology O
. O

Morphology O
, O
Morphological O
Analyzer O
, O
Morphological O
Generator O
, O
Morphological O
Parser O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Stemmer O
, O
IE O
, O
Spell O
Checker O
, O
Machine O
Translation O
, O
Question O
Answering O
System O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Publications O
in O
the O
life O
sciences O
are O
characterized O
by O
a O
large O
technical O
vocabulary O
, O
with O
many O
lexical O
and O
semantic O
variations O
for O
expressing O
the O
same O
concept O
. O

Towards O
addressing O
the O
problem O
of O
relevance O
in O
biomedical O
literature O
search O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
deep O
learning O
model O
for O
the O
relevance O
of O
a O
document O

’s O
text O
to O
a O
keyword O
style O
query O
. O

Limited O
by O
a O
relatively O
small O
amount O
of O
training O
data O
, O
the O
model O
uses O
pre O
- O
trained O
word O
embeddings O
. O

With O
these O
, O
the O
model O
first O
computes O
a O
variable O
- O
length O
Delta O
matrix O
between O
the O
query O
and O
document O
, O
representing O
a O
difference O
between O
the O
two O
texts O
, O
which O
is O
then O
passed O
through O
a O
deep O
convolution O
stage O
followed O
by O
a O
deep O
feed O
- O
forward O
network O
to O
compute O
a O
relevance O
score O
. O

This O
results O
in O
a O
fast O
model O
suitable O
for O
use O
in O
an O
online O
search O
engine O
. O

The O
model O
is O
robust O
and O
outperforms O
comparable O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
deep O
learning O
approaches O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Access O
methods O
are O
a O
fundamental O
tool O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

However O
, O
most O
of O
these O
methods O
suffer O
the O
problem O
known O
as O
the O
curse O
of O
dimensionality O
when O
they O
are O
applied O
to O
objects O
with O
very O
high O
dimensionality O
representation O
spaces O
, O
such O
as O
text O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
introduce O
a O
new O
parallel O
access O
method O
that O
uses O
several O
graphs O
as O
distributed O
index O
structure O
and O
a O
kNN O
search O
algorithm O
. O

Two O
parallel O
versions O
of O
the O
search O
method O
are O
presented O
, O
one O
based O
on O
master O
– O
slave O
scheme O
and O
the O
other O
based O
on O
a O
pipeline O
. O

A O
thorough O
experimental O
analysis O
on O
different O
datasets O
shows O
that O
our O
method O
can O
process O
efficiently O
large O
flows O
of O
queries O
, O
compete O
with O
other O
parallel O
algorithms O
and O
obtain O
at O
the O
same O
time O
very O
high O
quality O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
concept O
can O
be O
linguistically O
expressed O
in O
various O
syntactic O
constructions O
. O

Such O
syntactic O
variations O
spoil O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
incorporating O
dependencies O
between O
words O
into O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
information O
retrieval O
method O
for O
normalizing O
syntactic O
variations O
via O
predicate O
- O
argument O
structures O
. O

We O
conduct O
experiments O
on O
standard O
test O
collections O
and O
show O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

Our O
proposed O
method O
significantly O
outperforms O
a O
baseline O
method O
based O
on O
word O
dependencies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
aim O
of O
an O
opinion O
finding O
system O
is O
not O
just O
to O
retrieve O
relevant O
documents O
, O
but O
to O
also O
retrieve O
documents O
that O
express O
an O
opinion O
towards O
the O
query O
target O
entity O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
way O
to O
use O
and O
integrate O
an O
opinion O
- O
identification O
toolkit O
, O
OpinionFinder O
, O
into O
the O
retrieval O
process O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
, O
such O
that O
opinionated O
, O
relevant O
documents O
are O
retrieved O
in O
response O
to O
a O
query O
. O

In O
our O
experiments O
, O
we O
vary O
the O
number O
of O
top O
- O
ranked O
documents O
that O
must O
be O
parsed O
in O
response O
to O
a O
query O
, O
and O
investigate O
the O
effect O
on O
opinion O
retrieval O
performance O
and O
required O
parsing O
time O
. O

We O
find O
that O
opinion O
finding O
retrieval O
performance O
is O
improved O
by O
integrating O
OpinionFinder O
into O
the O
retrieval O
system O
, O
and O
that O
retrieval O
performance O
grows O
as O
more O
posts O
are O
parsed O
by O
OpinionFinder O
. O

However O
, O
the O
benefit O
eventually O
tails O
off O
at O
a O
deep O
rank O
, O
suggesting O
that O
an O
optimal O
setting O
for O
the O
system O
has O
been O
achieved O
. O

Disambiguation O
is O
the O
aim O
of O
most O
translation O
techniques O
used O
in O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
new O
method O
for O
query O
translation O
which O
only O
needs O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
and O
a O

corpus O
. O

Unlike O
the O
traditional O
statistical O
approach O
, O
our O
method O
uses O
co O
- O
occurrences O
between O
pairs O
of O
terms O
as O
statistical O
measure O
. O

By O
adding O
up O
all O
the O
weights O
of O
a O
k O
- O
complete O
subgraph O
, O
we O
can O
compare O
different O
combinations O
of O
target O
terms O
. O

The O
output O
of O
our O
method O
is O
in O
the O
form O
of O
probability O
distribution O
. O

Then O
the O
result O
is O
converted O
to O
the O
query O
in O
the O
target O
language O
. O

The O
method O
is O
easy O
to O
implement O
, O
and O
experiment O
shows O
it O
performs O
well O
. O

Capturing O
semantics O
in O
a O
computable O
way O
is O
desirable O
for O
many O
applications O
, O
such O
as O

retrieval O
, O
document O
clustering O
or O

, O

. O

Embedding O

- O
step O
. O

Different O

to O

. O

a O

- O

- O
shelf O

own O
Ariadne O

. O

that O

to O

into O

the O

from O
the O

to O

which O

. O

to O

ranking O
. O

246 O

. O

Automatic O

, O

, O

to O

Baseline O

for O

are O

to O

of O

collection O
. O

The O
integrated O
management O
of O

that O

of O

( O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Among O
the O
pure O
sciences O
, O
mathematics O
has O
had O
the O
most O
important O
impact O
on O
the O
rest O
of O
human O
knowledge O
, O
because O
it O
has O
provided O
a O
powerful O
basis O
for O
human O
reasoning O
. O

Mathematics O
is O
building O
block O
for O
all O
disciplines O
. O

Information O
Science O
( O
IS O
as O
an O
emerging O
discipline O
, O
is O
included O
in O
this O
principle O
. O

Some O
mathematical O
formulae O
have O
been O
frequently O
used O
in O
IS O
, O
ranging O
from O
theoretical O

in O

( O

, O

, O

; O

, O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Locating O
digital O
documents O
in O
modern O
organisations O
with O
the O
aid O
of O
metadata O
is O
a O
challenging O
area O
of O
research O
in O
document O
management O
systems O
. O

In O
order O
to O
investigate O
this O
, O
we O
have O
built O
an O
AWOCADO O
( O
adaptive O
workflow O
controller O
and O

) O
prototype O
system O
. O

AWOCADO O
provides O
a O
framework O
for O
defining O
and O
managing O
document O
attributes O
as O
well O
as O
looking O
up O
documents O
by O
using O
their O
attributes O
. O

An O
evaluation O
study O
was O
conducted O
to O
observe O
information O
retrieval O
using O
metadata O
in O
our O
system O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
apply O
Semantic O
Web O
technologies O
to O
the O
field O
of O
e O
-learning O
. O

Today O
, O
the O
resources O
available O
on O
the O
web O
increases O
significantly O
. O

Information O
Systems O
Research O
existing O
does O
not O
allow O
users O
to O
return O
documents O
that O
meet O
their O
exact O
needs O
expressed O
by O
a O
query O
on O
a O
document O
collection O
. O

To O
optimize O
information O
retrieval O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
approach O
based O
on O
the O
use O
of O
domain O
ontology O
for O
indexing O
a O
database O
and O
use O
semantic O
links O
between O
documents O
or O
fragments O
of O
documents O
collection O
, O
to O
allow O
the O
inference O
of O
all O
relevant O
documents O
. O

This O
ontology O
, O
in O
OWL O
format O
facilitate O
the O
management O
of O
learning O
resources O
. O

The O
development O
environment O
is O
used O
protected O
ontology O
. O

We O
describe O
how O
to O
semantically O
index O
the O
e O
- O
learning O
resources O
through O
semantic O
annotations O
. O

To O
test O
the O
prototype O
, O
we O
use O
language O
SeRQL O
middleware O
Sesame O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Recently O
direct O
optimization O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
measures O
has O
become O
a O
new O
trend O
in O
learning O
to O
rank O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
general O
framework O
for O
direct O
optimization O
of O
IR O
measures O
, O
which O
enjoys O
several O
theoretical O
advantages O
. O

The O
general O
framework O
, O
which O
can O
be O
used O
to O
optimize O
most O
IR O
measures O
, O
addresses O
the O
task O
by O
approximating O
the O
IR O
measures O
and O
optimizing O
the O
approximated O
surrogate O
functions O
. O

Theoretical O
analysis O
shows O
that O
a O
high O
approximation O
accuracy O
can O
be O
achieved O
by O
the O
framework O
. O

We O
take O
average O
precision O
( O
AP O
) O
and O
normalized O
discounted O
cumulated O
gains O
( O
NDCG O
) O
as O
examples O
to O
demonstrate O
how O
to O
realize O
the O
proposed O
framework O
. O

Experiments O
on O
benchmark O
datasets O
show O
that O
the O
algorithms O
deduced O
from O
our O
framework O
are O
very O
effective O
when O
compared O
to O
existing O
methods O
. O

The O
empirical O
results O
also O
agree O
well O
with O
the O
theoretical O
results O
obtained O
in O
the O
paper O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
methods O
employed O
to O
solve O
the O
Author O
Profiling O
task O
at O

. O

The O
main O
goal O
was O
to O

the O
use O
of O
features O
derived O
from O
Information O
Retrieval O
to O
identify O
the O

of O

author O
of O
a O

. O

This O

the O

, O

classification O

employed O
, O
and O
how O
the O

. O

Also O
, O
I O

of O

to O

of O
other O
groups O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

3D O
coordinate O
transformation O
is O
usually O
encountered O
issue O
in O
geodesy O
, O
photogrammetry O
, O
geographical O
information O
science O
( O
GIS O
) O
and O
computer O
vision O
. O

This O
paper O
simplifies O
the O
mathematical O
model O
of O
3D O
similarity O
transformation O
by O
optimization O
process O
, O
which O
finally O
only O
has O
the O
parameter O
of O
rotation O
matrix O
. O

According O
to O
the O
orthogonality O
of O
rotation O
matrix O
, O
the O
paper O
uses O
Rodrigues O
matrix O
to O
represent O
it O
, O
instead O
of O
classical O
rotation O
angle O
form O
. O

Making O
full O
use O
of O
the O
properties O
of O
Rodrigues O
matrix O
, O
we O
carry O
out O
the O
linearization O
of O
observation O
equations O
; O
further O
get O
the O
least O
squares O
solution O
of O
the O
model O
parameters O
. O

The O
case O
study O
shows O
that O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
is O
valid O
and O
fast O
, O
regardless O
of O
whether O
rotation O
angles O
are O
large O
or O
small O
, O
and O
almost O
does O
not O
depends O
on O
the O
initial O
values O
of O
the O
parameter O
. O

maps O
are O

for O

of O

- O
scale O

, O

for O

. O

The O

( O

held O
as O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
finding O
the O
appropriate O
translation O
of O
the O
source O
language O
query O
has O
always O
been O
a O
difficult O
problem O
to O
solve O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
technique O
towards O
solving O
this O
problem O
with O
the O
help O
of O
multilingual O
word O
clusters O
obtained O
from O
multilingual O
word O
embeddings O
. O

We O
use O
word O
embeddings O
of O
the O
languages O
projected O
to O
a O
common O
vector O
space O
on O
which O
a O
community O
- O
detection O
algorithm O
is O
applied O
to O
find O
clusters O
such O
that O
words O
that O
represent O
the O
same O
concept O
from O
different O
languages O
fall O
in O
the O
same O
group O
. O

We O
utilize O
these O
multilingual O
word O
clusters O
to O
perform O
query O
translation O
for O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
for O
three O
languages O
English O
, O
Hindi O
and O
Bengali O
. O

We O
have O
experimented O
with O
the O
FIRE O
2012 O
and O
Wikipedia O
datasets O
and O
have O
shown O
improvements O
over O
several O
standard O
methods O
like O
dictionarybased O
method O
, O
a O
transliteration O
- O
based O
model O
and O
Google O
Translate O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
technology O
is O
widely O
used O
for O
file O
sharing O
. O

In O
the O
past O
decade O
a O
number O
of O
prototype O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
been O
developed O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
none O
of O
these O
has O
seen O
widespread O
real O
- O
world O
adoption O
and O
thus O
, O
in O
contrast O
with O
file O
sharing O
, O
information O
retrieval O
is O
still O
dominated O
by O
centralized O
solutions O
. O

In O
this O
article O
we O
provide O
an O
overview O
of O
the O
key O
challenges O
for O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
information O
retrieval O
and O
the O
work O
done O
so O
far O
. O

We O
want O
to O
stimulate O
and O
inspire O
further O
research O
to O
overcome O
these O
challenges O
. O

This O
will O
open O
the O
door O
to O
the O
development O
and O
large O
- O
scale O
deployment O
of O
real O
- O
world O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
that O
rival O
existing O
centralized O
client O
- O
server O
solutions O
in O
terms O
of O
scalability O
, O
performance O
, O
user O
satisfaction O
, O
and O
freedom O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
new O
XML O
- O
based O
query O
language O
for O
XML O
documents O
denoted O
XRL O
. O

This O
language O
expresses O
database O
conditions O
concerning O
the O
attributes O
and O
the O
structure O
of O
documents O
, O
as O
well O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
conditions O
over O
their O
contents O
and O
their O
relevance O
. O

XRL O
queries O
can O
be O
stored O
into O
a O
XML O
repository O
and O
manipulated O
as O
any O
other O
XML O
document O
. O

In O
order O
to O
illustrate O
the O
usefulness O
of O
this O
language O
, O
we O
also O
describe O
some O
general O
guidelines O
of O
its O
current O
implementation O
, O
and O
present O
an O
example O
application O
. O

This O
application O
consists O
in O
a O
subscription O
/ O
notification O
service O
of O
news O
articles O
, O
which O
are O
periodically O
retrieved O
from O
a O
digital O
library O
of O
newspapers O
according O
to O
the O
preferences O
of O
each O
user O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O
proposes O
a O
term O
weighting O
scheme O
for O
measuring O
query O
- O
document O
similarity O
that O
attempts O
to O
explicitly O
model O
the O
dependency O
between O
separate O
occurrences O
of O
a O
term O
in O
a O
document O
. O

The O
assumption O
is O
that O
, O
if O
a O
term O
appears O
once O
in O
a O
document O
, O
it O
is O
more O
likely O
to O
appear O
again O
in O
the O
same O
document O
. O

Thus O
, O
as O
the O
term O
appears O
again O
and O
again O
, O
the O
information O
content O
of O
the O
subsequent O
occurrences O
decreases O
gradually O
, O
since O
they O
are O
more O
predictable O
. O

We O
introduce O
a O
parameterized O
decay O
function O
to O
model O
this O
assumption O
, O
where O
the O
initial O
contribution O
of O
the O
term O
can O
be O
determined O
using O
any O
reasonable O
term O
discrimination O
factor O
. O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
model O
is O
evaluated O
on O
a O
number O
of O
recent O
web O
test O
collections O
of O
varying O
nature O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
model O
significantly O
outperforms O
a O
number O
of O
well O
known O
retrieval O
models O
including O
a O
recently O
proposed O
strong O
Term O
Frequency O
and O
Inverse O
Document O
Frequency O
( O
TF O
- O
IDF O
) O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
expansion O
of O
the O
Internet O
, O
searching O
for O
information O
goes O
beyond O
the O
boundary O
of O
physical O
libraries O
. O

Millions O
of O
documents O
of O
various O
media O
types O
, O
such O
as O
text O
, O
image O
, O
video O
, O
audio O
, O
graphics O
, O
and O
animation O
, O
are O
available O
around O
the O
world O
and O
linked O
by O
the O
Internet O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
of O
search O
engines O
for O
media O
types O
other O
than O
text O
lags O
far O
behind O
their O
text O
counterparts O
. O

To O
address O
this O
situation O
, O
we O
have O
developed O
the O
Multimedia O
Analysis O
and O
Retrieval O
System O
( O
MARS O
This O
paper O
reports O
some O
of O
the O
progress O
made O
over O
the O
years O
towards O
exploring O
information O
retrieval O
beyond O
the O
text O
domain O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
the O
following O
aspects O
of O
MARS O
are O
addressed O
in O
the O
paper O
: O
visual O
feature O
extraction O
, O
retrieval O
models O
, O
query O
reformulation O
techniques O
, O
e O
cient O
execution O
speed O
performance O
and O
user O
interface O
considerations O
. O

Extensive O
experimental O
results O
are O
reported O
to O
validate O
the O
proposed O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
case O
- O
study O
of O
automatic O
construction O
of O
a O
hypertext O
from O
a O
large O
full O
- O
text O
document O
. O

The O
document O
we O
used O
as O
input O
of O
the O
automatic O
authoring O
process O
is O
a O
well O
- O
known O
textbook O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O

( O
IR O
We O
explain O
in O
detail O
the O
steps O
performed O
to O
transform O
the O
textbook O
into O
a O
hyper O
- O
textbook O
. O

A O
hyper O
- O
textbook O
is O
the O
hypertextual O
equivalent O
of O
a O
textbook O
, O
in O
the O
same O
way O
as O
a O
hyperbook O
is O
the O
hypertextual O
equivalent O
of O
a O
book O
. O

A O
hyper O
- O
textbook O
is O
designed O
to O
be O
used O
both O
as O
a O
self O
instruction O
manual O
and O
as O
a O
reference O
source O
. O

Moreover O
, O
it O
can O
be O
printed O
out O
into O
its O
textual O
form O
in O
total O
or O
only O
partially O
for O
easy O
consultation O
without O
a O
computer O
. O

The O
hyper O
- O
textbook O
is O
written O
in O
HTML O
and O
can O
be O
accessed O
and O
navigated O
on O
using O
a O
common O
WWW O
browser O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Given O
a O
set O
of O
n O
points O
and O
hyperrectangles O
in O
d O
dimensional O
space O
the O
batched O
range O
searching O
problem O
is O
to O
determine O
which O
points O
each O
hyperrectangle O
contains O
We O
present O
two O
parallel O
algorithms O
for O
this O
problem O
on O
a O
p O
n O
pn O
mesh O
connected O
paral O
lel O
computer O
one O
average O
case O
e O
cient O
algorithm O
based O
on O
cell O
division O
and O
one O
worst O
case O
e O
cient O
divide O
and O
conquer O
algo O
rithm O
Besides O
the O
asymptotic O
analysis O
of O
their O
running O
times O
we O
present O
an O
experimental O
evaluation O
of O
the O
algorithms O


-DOCSTART- O

Cross O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
between O
languages O
of O
the O
same O
origin O
is O
an O
interesting O
topic O
of O
research O
. O

The O
similarity O
of O
the O
writing O
systems O
used O
for O
these O
languages O
can O
be O
used O
effectively O
to O
not O
only O
improve O
CLIR O
, O
but O
to O
overcome O
the O
problems O
of O
textual O
variations O
, O
textual O
errors O
, O
and O
even O
the O
lack O
of O
linguistic O
resources O
like O
stemmers O
to O
an O
extent O
. O

We O
have O
conducted O
CLIR O
experiments O
between O
three O
languages O
which O
use O
writing O
systems O
( O
scripts O
) O
of O
Brahmi O
- O
origin O
, O
namely O
Hindi O
, O
Bengali O
and O
Marathi O
. O

We O
found O
significant O
improvements O
for O
all O
the O
six O
language O
pairs O
using O
a O
method O
for O
fuzzy O
text O
search O
based O
on O
Surface O
Similarity O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
report O
these O
results O
and O
compare O
them O
with O
a O
baseline O
CLIR O
system O
and O
a O
CLIR O
system O
that O
uses O
Scaled O
Edit O
Distance O
( O
SED O
) O
for O
fuzzy O
string O
matching O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
increase O
of O
digital O
image O
acquisition O
devices O
, O
combined O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
the O
Web O
, O
requires O
the O
definition O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
models O
and O
systems O
providing O
fast O
access O
to O
images O
searched O
by O
users O

Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
identify O
content O
bearing O
words O
, O
and O
possibly O
also O
assign O
weights O
, O
as O
part O
of O
the O
process O
of O

requests O
. O

optimal O
retrieval O
ee O
- O
ciency O
, O

is O

that O
this O
be O
done O
automatically O
. O

the O

- O

of O
words O
in O

of O

as O
an O

of O
a O
word O
's O
bearing O
content O
. O

This O
approach O
is O
exible O
in O
the O
sense O
that O
it O
is O
sensitive O
to O
context O
: O
a O
term O
may O
be O
assessed O
as O
content O
- O
bearing O
within O
one O
collection O
, O
but O
not O
another O
. O

Our O
approach O
, O
being O
numerical O
, O
may O
also O
be O
of O
value O
in O
assigning O
weights O
to O
terms O
in O
requests O
. O

in O
three O

. O

This O
paper O
evaluates O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
of O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
in O
realistic O
environments O
. O

We O
find O
that O
when O
a O
large O
number O
of O
collections O
are O
available O
, O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
is O
significantly O
worse O
than O
that O
of O
centralized O
systems O
, O
mainly O
because O
typical O
queries O
are O
not O
adequate O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
choosing O
the O
right O
collections O
. O

We O
propose O
two O
techniques O
to O
address O
the O
problem O
. O

One O
is O
to O
use O
phrase O
information O
in O
the O
collection O
selection O
index O
and O
the O
other O
is O
query O
expansion O
. O

Both O
techniques O
enhance O
the O
discriminatory O
power O
of O
typical O
queries O
for O
choosing O
the O
right O
collections O
and O
hence O
significantly O
improve O
retrieval O
results O
. O

Query O
expansion O
, O
in O
particular O
, O
brings O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
searching O
a O
large O
set O
of O
distributed O
collections O
close O
to O
that O
of O
searching O
a O
centralized O
collection O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Textual O
information O
is O
becoming O
increasingly O
available O
in O
electronic O
forms O
. O

Users O
need O
tools O
to O
sift O
through O
non O
- O
relevant O
information O
and O
retrieve O
only O
those O
pieces O
relevant O
to O
their O
needs O
. O

The O
traditional O
methods O
such O
as O
Boolean O
operators O
and O
key O
terms O
have O
somehow O
reached O
their O
limitations O
. O

An O
emerging O

is O
to O
combine O
the O
traditional O
information O

. O

This O
paper O

the O

of O

traditional O
information O

systems O
with O
knowledge O
- O
based O

to O
automatically O
expand O

language O
queries O
. O

Two O
types O
of O
knowledge O
- O
bases O
, O
a O
domain O
- O
specific O
and O
a O
general O
world O
knowledge O
, O
are O
used O
in O
the O
expansion O
process O
. O

Experiments O
are O
also O
conducted O
using O
different O
search O
strategies O
and O
various O
combinations O
of O
the O
knowledge O
- O
bases O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
an O
increase O
in O
retrieval O
performance O
can O
be O
obtained O
using O
certain O
knowledge O
- O
based O
approaches O
. O

he O
complexity O
of O
human O
language O
makes O

cult O
. O

( O

fi O

: O
character O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
conceptual O
model O
for O
semantic O
search O
and O
implement O
it O
in O
security O
access O
control O
. O

The O
model O
provides O
security O
access O
control O
to O
extend O
the O
search O
capabilities O
. O

The O
scalable O
model O
can O
integrate O
other O
ontology O
providing O
the O
general O
ontology O
as O
the O
transformation O
interface O
. O

We O
combine O
text O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
with O
semantic O
inference O
in O
the O
model O
. O

So O
it O
can O
not O
only O
search O
the O
resources O
and O
the O
relationships O
between O
them O
according O
to O
the O
user O
’s O
privileges O
, O
but O
also O
locate O
the O
exact O
resource O
using O
text O
IR O
. O

We O
build O
a O
security O
ontology O
based O
on O
Role O
- O
Based O
Access O
Control O
( O
RBAC O
) O
policy O
. O

A O
semantic O
search O
system O
Onto O
- O
SSSE O
is O
implemented O
based O
on O
the O
model O
. O

The O
system O
can O
perform O
some O
complex O
queries O
using O
ontology O
reasoning O
, O
especially O
about O
association O
queries O
such O
as O
the O
relationships O
between O
resources O
. O

The O
evaluation O
shows O
that O
the O
new O
system O
performs O
better O
than O
exiting O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Problem O
: O
Traditional O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
based O
on O
the O
“ O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
” O
paradigm O
can O
not O
capture O
the O
semantic O
content O
of O
documents O
. O

While O
these O
systems O
are O
relatively O
robust O
and O
have O
high O
recall O
, O
they O
suffer O
from O
very O
poor O
precision O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
it O
is O
impossible O
with O
current O
technology O
to O
build O
a O
practical O
information O
access O
system O
that O
fully O
analyzes O
and O
understands O
unrestricted O
natural O
language O
. O

Existing O
natural O
language O
systems O
, O
despite O
their O
high O
precision O
, O
have O
low O
recall O
and O
lack O
robustness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
large O
number O
of O
potential O
applications O
from O
bridging O
web O
data O
with O
knowledge O
bases O
have O
led O
to O
an O
increase O
in O
the O
entity O
linking O
research O
. O

Entity O

is O
the O
task O
to O
link O
entity O
mentions O
in O
text O
with O
their O
corresponding O
entities O
in O
a O

base O
. O

Potential O
applications O
include O
information O
extraction O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
knowledge O
base O
population O
. O

However O
, O
this O
task O
is O
challenging O
due O
to O
name O
variations O
and O
entity O
ambiguity O
. O

In O

, O

of O
entity O

, O
and O
future O
directions O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
simple O
unsupervised O
learning O
algorithm O
for O
recognizing O
synonyms O
, O
based O
on O
statistical O
data O
acquired O
by O
querying O
a O
Web O
search O
engine O
. O

The O
algorithm O
, O
called O
PMI O
- O
IR O
, O
uses O
Pointwise O
Mutual O
Information O
( O
PMI O
) O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
to O
measure O
the O
similarity O
of O
pairs O
of O
words O
. O

PMI O
- O
IR O
is O
empirically O
evaluated O
using O
80 O
synonym O
test O
questions O
from O
the O
Test O
of O
English O
as O
a O
Foreign O
Language O
( O
TOEFL O
) O
and O
50 O
synonym O
test O
questions O
from O
a O
collection O
of O
tests O
for O
students O
of O
English O
as O
a O
Second O
Language O
( O
ESL O

On O
both O
tests O
, O
the O
algorithm O
obtains O
a O
score O
of O
74 O
PMI O
- O
IR O
is O
contrasted O
with O
Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis O
( O
LSA O
which O
achieves O
a O
score O
of O
64 O
% O
on O
the O
same O
80 O
TOEFL O
questions O
. O

The O
paper O
discusses O
potential O
applications O
of O
the O
new O
unsupervised O
learning O
algorithm O
and O
some O
implications O
of O
the O
results O
for O
LSA O
and O
LSI O
( O
Latent O

Indexing O
) O
. O

a O

on O
Audio O
Cover O
Song O
in O

Information O

in O

. O

The O
system O
uses O
as O
feature O

a O

identified O
by O

trained O
with O

- O

data O
, O
and O

a O

between O
two O

sequence O
pair O
using O

Dynamic O
Time O
Warping O
algorithm O
to O
find O
the O
minimum O
alignment O
cost O
. O

The O

behind O

system O
is O
that O
cover O
songs O
largely O
preserve O
harmonic O
content O
even O
if O

vary O
in O
other O

such O

, O

, O

, O
and/or O

. O

The O
ever O
- O
increasing O
information O
on O
the O
web O
with O
its O

and O

needs O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
which O
serves O

’s O
ambiguous O
, O
ill O
- O
formed O
, O

result O
in O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Mass O
estimation O
, O
an O
alternative O
to O
density O
estimation O
, O
has O
been O
shown O
recently O
to O
be O
an O
effective O
base O

mechanism O
for O
three O
data O

tasks O
of O

, O
information O
retrieval O
and O

. O

This O
paper O
advances O
this O
work O

two O

. O

First O
, O
we O
generalise O
the O
previously O
proposed O
one O
- O
dimensional O

estimation O
to O
multidimensional O

estimation O
, O
and O
significantly O
reduce O
the O
time O
complexity O
to O
O O
x03C8;h O
) O
from O
O O
x03C8;<sup O
> O
h</sup O
making O
it O
feasible O
for O
a O
full O
range O
of O
generic O
problems O
. O

Second O
, O
we O
introduce O
the O
first O

method O
based O
on O
mass O
- O
it O
is O
unique O
because O
it O
does O
not O
employ O
any O
distance O
or O
density O
measure O
. O

The O

of O

model O
enables O
different O
parts O
of O
a O

to O

and O

without O

. O

The O

i O
) O

can O
identify O
arbitrary O
- O
shape O
clusters O
ii O
) O

it O
is O
significantly O
faster O
than O
existing O
density O
- O
based O
or O
distance O
- O
based O
methods O
; O
and O
( O
iii O
) O
it O
is O
noise O
- O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
in O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
using O
the O
general O
search O
engines O
is O
still O
a O
difficult O
and O
time O
- O
consuming O
task O
, O
which O
creates O
a O
demand O
of O
new O
information O
search O
and O
retrieval O
techniques O
. O

An O
intelligent O
retrieval O
system O
model O
based O
on O
multi O
- O
agent O
is O
proposed O
which O
assists O
the O
user O
in O
finding O
interesting O
information O
in O
the O
WWW O
. O

This O
model O
searches O
through O
the O
popular O
and O
special O
Web O
search O
engines O
, O
filters O
their O
result O
, O
and O
lists O
to O
the O
user O
a O
reduced O
number O
of O
information O
with O
high O
probability O
of O
being O
relevant O
to O
him O
. O

This O
filtering O
is O
implemented O
by O
the O
agent O
analyzing O
the O
user O
's O
behavior O
on O
the O
Web O
based O
on O
user O
's O
search O
intent O
and O
preferences O
. O

The O
design O
, O
the O
architecture O
, O
the O
functional O
components O
and O
the O
workflow O
of O
the O
model O
are O
elaborated O
. O

The O
model O
is O
helpful O
to O
solve O
the O
shortcomings O
effectively O
of O
low O
precision O
and O
relevant O
document O
ranking O
behind O
in O
general O
search O
engine O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Approach O
based O
on O
clustering O
will O
be O
described O
in O
our O
paper O
. O

Basic O
version O
of O
our O
system O
was O
given O
in O
[ O
5 O
] O
allows O
us O
to O
expand O
query O
through O
special O
index O
. O

Hierarchical O
agglomerative O
clustering O
of O
the O
whole O
document O
collection O
generates O
the O
index O
. O

Retrieving O
of O
topic O
development O
is O
specific O
problem O
. O

Standard O
methods O
of O
IR O
does O
not O
allow O
us O
such O
kind O
of O
queries O
for O
appropriate O
solution O
of O
information O
problem O
. O

The O
goal O
of O
presented O
method O
is O
to O
find O
list O
of O
documents O
that O
are O
bearing O
on O
topic O
, O
represented O
by O
user O
- O
selected O
document O
, O
sorted O
with O
respect O
to O
historical O
development O
of O
the O
topic O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Clustering O
is O
a O
data O
mining O
technique O
for O
the O
analysis O
of O
data O
in O
various O
areas O
such O
as O
pattern O
recognition O
, O
image O
processing O
, O
information O
science O
, O
bioinformatics O
etc O
. O

Hierarchical O
clustering O
techniques O
form O
the O
clusters O
based O
on O
top O
- O
down O
and O
bottom O
- O
up O
approaches O
. O

Hierarchical O
agglomerative O
clustering O
is O
a O
bottom O
- O
up O
clustering O
method O
. O

Ant O
based O
clustering O
methods O
form O
clusters O
by O
picking O
and O
dropping O
the O
objects O
according O
to O
surroundings O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
an O
agglomerative O
clustering O
algorithm O
, O
AGG_ANTS O
based O
on O
ant O
colonies O
. O

AGG_ANTS O
clusters O
the O
objects O
by O
moving O
ants O
on O
the O
grid O
and O
merging O
their O
loads O
according O
to O
similarity O
resulting O
in O
bigger O
clusters O
. O

It O
avoids O
the O
calculation O
of O
similarity O
in O
the O
surrounding O
and O
pick O
/ O
drop O
of O
objects O
again O
and O
again O
resulting O
in O
a O
more O
efficient O
algorithm O
. O

article O
reports O
the O
results O
of O
Chinese O
Text O
Retrieval O
( O
CHTR O
) O
tasks O
in O
NTCIR O
Workshop O
2 O
and O
the O
future O
plan O
of O
NTCIR O
workshop O
. O

CHTR O
tasks O
fall O
into O
two O
categories O
: O
Chinese O
- O
Chinese O
IR O
( O
CHIR O
) O
and O
English O
- O
Chinese O
IR O
( O
ECIR O

The O
definitions O
, O
schedules O
, O
test O
collection O
( O
CIRB010 O
search O
results O
, O
evaluation O
, O
and O
initial O
analyses O
of O
search O
results O
of O
CHIR O
and O
ECIR O
are O
discussed O
in O
this O
article O
. O

The O
new O
plan O
of O

towards O

) O

also O
described O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Similar O
Web O
pages O
are O
easily O
found O
on O
Internet O
. O

The O
redundancy O
of O
information O
severely O
slows O
down O
internet O
applications O
such O
as O
crawl O
module O
of O
search O
engine O
, O
and O
could O
lead O
to O
waste O
of O
storage O
in O
the O
indexing O
procedure O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
proposed O
a O
content O
- O
based O
approach O
for O
detecting O
webpage O
duplications O
. O

The O
algorithm O
contains O
three O
parts O
: O
i O
) O
pre O
- O
processing O
, O
excluding O
HTML O
tags O
and O
unrelated O
information O
; O
ii O
) O
use O
a O
query O
- O
combined O
fuzzy O
set O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
to O
find O
out O
the O
correlation O
between O
every O
two O
documents O
; O
iii O
) O
a O
threshold O
is O
set O
and O
duplicate O
webpages O
are O
eliminated O
. O

Original O
algorithm O
of O
duplication O
detection O
is O
revised O
and O
focused O
mainly O
on O
performance O
optimization O
. O

Testing O
results O
shows O
that O
the O
performance O
is O
greatly O
improved O
with O
an O
acceptable O
sacrifice O
on O
quality O
. O

For O
many O

applications O
, O

need O
to O

. O

However O
, O

. O

On O

. O

On O

to O

to O

algorithms O
. O

in O

, O

a O

on O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O

on O

retrieval O
objects O
. O

It O
is O
used O
to O
gain O
further O
insights O
concerning O
the O
behaviour O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
as O
well O
as O
for O
teaching O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Science O
. O

The O
main O
issue O
of O
MIMOR O
is O
the O
exploitation O
of O
users’ O
relevance O
feedback O
in O
order O
to O
optimise O
the O
fusion O
of O
several O
retrieval O
engines O
or O
resources O
. O

As O
yet O
, O
MIMOR O
has O
been O
applied O
to O
a O
domain O
specific O
collection O
, O
to O
a O
multilingual O
corpus O
, O
and O
to O
music O
data O
. O

Experiments O
within O
the O
CLEF O

framework O
and O
additional O
ones O
are O
discussed O
here O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Knowledge O
acquisition O
constitutes O
the O
bottleneck O
for O
the O
creation O
of O
legal O
expert O
systems O
. O

A O
certain O
degree O
of O
formalism O
of O
legal O
language O
is O
an O
inevitable O
prerequisite O
. O

Our O
prototype O
KONTERM O
deals O
with O
that O
problem O
by O
supporting O
the O
process O
of O
creating O
a O
selective O
thesaurus O
for O
a O
legal O
information O
system O
which O
can O
be O
used O
for O
automatic O
indexing O
and O
document O
classification O
. O

This O
selectivity O
is O
obtained O
by O
distinguishing O
between O
precise O
legal O
terms O
and O
words O
with O
fuzzy O
meanings O
. O

The O
resulting O
thesaurus O
can O
thus O
be O
seen O
as O
an O
important O
step O
to O
overcome O
the O
" O
untidiness O
" O
of O
natural O
language O
and O
to O
represent O
automatically O
the O
expert O
knowledge O
of O
a O
lawyer O
about O
legal O
terminology O
. O

Therefore O
, O
KONTERM O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
tool O
for O
the O
semi O
- O
automatic O
creation O
of O
a O
legal O
knowledge O
base O
. O

) O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Most O
people O
have O
great O
difficulty O
in O
recalling O
unrelated O
items O
. O

For O
example O
, O
in O
free O
recall O
experiments O
, O
lists O
of O
more O
than O
a O
few O
randomly O
selected O
words O
can O
not O
be O
accurately O
repeated O
. O

Here O
we O
introduce O
a O
phenomenological O
model O
of O
memory O
retrieval O
inspired O
by O
theories O
of O
neuronal O
population O
coding O
of O
information O
. O

The O
model O
predicts O
nontrivial O
scaling O
behaviors O
for O
the O
mean O
and O
standard O
deviation O
of O
the O
number O
of O
recalled O
words O
for O
lists O
of O
increasing O
length O
. O

Our O
results O
suggest O
that O
associative O
information O
retrieval O
is O
a O
dominating O
factor O
that O
limits O
the O
number O
of O
recalled O
items O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
similarity O
measures O
play O
vital O
roles O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

) O
and O

Language O
Processing O
( O

Despite O
the O

of O
semantic O
similarity O
measures O
in O
various O

, O
strongly O

between O
two O

a O
challenging O
task O
. O

Here O
, O
three O

measures O
have O
been O
proposed O

that O
uses O
the O
information O
available O
on O

web O
to O
measure O

between O

and O

. O

The O

method O
exploits O
page O

and O
text O

returned O
by O
a O
web O
search O
engine O
. O

We O
develop O
indirect O
associations O
of O
words O
, O
in O
addition O
to O
direct O
for O
estimating O
their O
similarity O
. O

Evaluation O
results O
on O
different O
data O
sets O
shows O
that O
our O
methods O
outperform O
several O
competing O
methods O
. O

- O

-DOCSTART- O

Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis O
( O
LSA O
) O
is O
a O
widely O
used O
Information O
Retrieval O
method O
based O
on O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
assumption O
. O

However O
, O
according O
to O
general O
conception O
, O
syntax O
plays O
a O
role O
in O
representing O
meaning O
of O
sentences O
. O

Thus O
, O
enhancing O
LSA O
with O
part O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
( O
POS O
) O
information O
to O
capture O
the O
context O
of O
word O
occurrences O
appears O
to O
be O
theoretically O
feasible O
extension O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
tested O
empirically O
on O
a O
automatic O
essay O
grading O
system O
using O
LSA O
for O
document O
similarity O
comparisons O
. O

A O
comparison O
on O
several O
POS O
- O
enhanced O
LSA O
models O
is O
reported O
. O

Our O
findings O
show O
that O
the O
addition O
of O
contextual O
information O
in O
the O
form O
of O
POS O
tags O
can O
raise O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
LSA O
- O
based O
scoring O
models O
up O
to O
10.77 O
per O
cent O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Although O
context O
- O
independent O
word O
- O
based O
approaches O
remain O
popular O
for O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
, O
many O
recent O

have O
shown O
that O

insights O
from O
modern O

machine O

systems O

to O

in O
effectiveness O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
compare O

and O

phrase O
- O
based O
translation O
models O
for O
query O

. O

Both O
approaches O
yield O
significantly O
better O
results O
than O
either O
a O
token O
- O
based O
or O
a O
one O
- O
best O
translation O
baseline O
on O
standard O
test O

. O

The O
choice O
of O
model O
manifests O
interesting O
tradeoffs O
in O
terms O
of O
effectiveness O
, O
efficiency O
, O
and O
model O
compactness O
. O

medical O

sciences O
program O

. O

, O

has O

. O

Now O
a O
full O
- O
fledged O
4 O
years O
master O

exists O
. O

Students O
are O
taught O
skills O
to O
adequately O
and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
in O
this O
paper O
a O
multiagent O
possibilistic O
system O
for O
web O
information O
retrieval O
, O
called O
SARIPOD O
. O

This O
system O
is O
based O
on O
Hierarchical O
Small O
- O
Worlds O
( O
HSW O
) O
and O
Possibilistic O
Networks O
( O
PN O

The O
first O
HSW O
consists O
in O
structuring O
the O
" O
Google O
" O
search O
results O
in O
dense O
zones O
of O
web O
pages O
which O
strongly O
depend O
on O
each O
other O
. O

We O
thus O
reveal O
dense O
clouds O
of O
pages O
which O
" O
speak O
" O
more O
or O
less O
about O
the O
same O
subject O
and O
which O
all O
strongly O
answer O
the O
user O
’s O
query O
. O

The O
goal O
of O
the O
second O
HSW O
consists O
in O
considering O
the O
query O
as O
multiple O
in O
the O
sense O
that O
we O
do O
n’t O
seek O
only O
the O
keyword O
in O
the O
web O
pages O
but O
also O
its O
synonyms O
. O

The O
PN O
generates O
the O
mixing O
of O
these O
two O
HSW O
in O
order O
to O
organize O
the O
searched O
documents O
according O
to O
user O
’s O
preferences O
. O

rank O
for O

. O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

This O

Our O

Keyword O
- O
based O
retrieval O
matches O
search O
terms O
and O
documents O
via O
term O
co O
- O
occurrence O
. O

Such O
an O
approach O
does O
not O
allow O
matching O
based O
on O
the O
specific O
plant O
characteristic O
descriptions O
that O
are O
often O
used O
in O

. O

from O

. O

An O

users O
. O

The O

that O
this O
approach O

task O
- O

the O

of O
the O

Engagement O
Scale O
( O

in O

- O

was O
administered O
to O
users O
of O
a O
multimedia O

system O
in O
an O
experimental O
setting O
. O

Factor O
analysis O
examined O
the O
structure O
and O

of O
31 O
items O
. O

As O
in O
previous O
research O
, O
a O
six O
- O
factor O
solution O
was O
found O
. O

However O
, O
the O

of O

was O
reduced O
and O
one O
of O

sub O

( O

. O

These O

. O

in O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
bottleneck O
for O
dictionary O
- O
based O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
lack O
of O
comprehensive O
dictionaries O
, O
in O
particular O
for O
many O
different O
languages O
. O

We O
here O
introduce O
a O
methodology O
by O
which O
multilingual O
dictionaries O
( O
for O
Spanish O
and O
Swedish O
) O
emerge O
automatically O
from O
simple O
seed O

. O

These O

are O
automatically O
generated O
, O
by O

mapping O
, O
from O
( O
previously O
manually O
constructed O
) O
Portuguese O
and O
German O
as O
well O
as O
English O
sources O
. O

Lexical O
and O
semantic O
hypotheses O
are O
then O
validated O
and O
new O
ones O
iteratively O
generated O
by O
making O
use O
of O
co O
- O
occurrence O
patterns O
of O
hypothesized O
translation O
synonyms O
in O
parallel O
corpora O
. O

We O
evaluate O
these O
newly O
derived O
dictionaries O
on O
a O
large O
medical O
document O
collection O
within O
a O
cross O
- O
language O
retrieval O
setting O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Learning O
to O
rank O
plays O
a O
very O
important O
role O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Existing O
works O
mainly O
focus O
on O
applying O
one O
ranking O
model O
to O
all O
samples O
, O
which O
may O
not O
be O
suitable O
for O
the O
reality O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
new O
method O
for O
learning O
to O
rank O
based O
on O
query O
- O
level O
vector O
extraction O
is O
proposed O
, O
in O
which O
we O
assume O
that O
all O
samples O
can O
be O
divided O
into O
multiple O
parts O
, O
and O
each O
part O
is O
used O
to O
train O
one O
set O
of O
parameters O
for O
the O
model O
. O

Based O
on O
this O
assumption O
, O
we O
extracted O
query O
- O
level O
vector O
and O
proposed O
a O
dataset O
partition O
method O
based O
on O
k O
- O
means O
which O
is O
used O
to O
optimize O
the O
ListNet O
method O
and O
RankNet O
method O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
assumption O
is O
right O
and O
our O
method O
plays O
a O
very O
important O
role O
in O
improving O
the O
performance O
of O
ListNet O
and O
RankNet O
, O
and O
which O
is O
also O
easy O
to O
be O
extended O
to O
other O
learning O
to O
rank O
methods O
. O

advent O
of O

- O

< O
italic O
> O
structure</italic O
> O

. O

. O
