Our O
participation O
at O
ResPubliQA O
2010 O
was O
based O
on O
applying O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
engine O
of O
high O
performance O
and O
a O
validation O
step O
for O
removing O
incorrect O
answers O
. O

The O
IR O
engine O
received O
additional O
information O
from O
the O
analysis O
of O
questions O
, O
what O
produces O
a O
slight O
improvement O
in O
results O
. O

However O
, O
the O
validation O
module O
discarded O
sometimes O
too O
much O
correct O
answers O
, O
contributing O
to O
reduce O
the O
overall O
performance O
. O

These O
errors O
were O
due O
to O
the O
application O
of O
too O
strict O
constraints O
. O

Therefore O
, O
future O
work O
must O
be O
focused O
on O
reducing O
the O
amount O
of O
false O
negatives O
returned O
by O
the O
validation O
module O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
we O
observed O
that O
IR O
ranking O
offers O
important O
information O
for O
selecting O
the O
final O
answer O
, O
but O
better O
results O
could O
be O
obtained O
if O
additional O
sources O
of O
information O
were O
also O
considered O
. O

This O
paper O

a O

to O

. O

. O

The O

an O

parameter O
that O
explicitly O
models O
which O

from O
the O
relevant O
documents O
( O
the O
important O
terms O
and O
which O
are O
not O
( O
the O
unimportant O
terms O

new O
language O
modeling O
approach O
is O
shown O
to O
explain O
a O
number O
of O
practical O
facts O
of O
today O
's O
information O

systems O

variables O
. O

are O
being O
made O
with O
quantum O
optics O
intensively O
. O

- O
variable O
( O
CV O
) O
approach O
attracts O
much O
interest O
because O
of O
relative O

to O
realize O
the O
experiments O
. O

was O

approach[1 O
and O

-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
evaluate O
user O
queries O
and O
retrieve O
/ O
rank O
documents O
based O
on O
matching O
keywords O
in O
user O
queries O
with O
words O
in O
documents O
. O

These O
exact O
word O
- O
matching O
and O
ranking O
approaches O
ignore O
too O
many O
relevant O
documents O
that O
do O
not O
contain O
the O
exact O
keywords O
as O
specified O
in O
a O
user O
query O
. O

Instead O
of O
considering O
these O
traditional O
approaches O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
retrieve O
documents O
using O
a O
fuzzy O
set O
IR O
model O
and O
rank O
retrieved O
documents O
for O
any O
vague O
query O
using O
the O
" O
vagueness O
score O
" O
of O
the O
documents O
based O
on O
the O
word O
senses O
as O
defined O
in O
WordNet O
. O

Using O
the O
vagueness O
scores O
, O
we O
rank O
the O
most O
highest O
" O
relevant O
" O
documents O
of O
a O
vague O
query O
qas O
the O
ones O
that O
best O
cover O
the O
different O
possible O
senses O
of O
keywords O
in O
q. O

The O
proposed O
word O
- O
sense O
ranking O
method O
enhances O
the O
existing O
ranking O
approaches O
on O
ordering O
retrieved O
documents O
for O
vague O
queries O
and O
thus O
provides O
a O
more O
reliable O
and O

An O
effective O
retrieval O
of O
the O
most O
relevant O
documents O
from O
the O
Web O
is O
difficult O
due O
to O
the O
large O
amount O
of O
information O
in O
all O
types O
of O
formats O
. O

Researches O
have O
been O
conducted O
on O
ways O
to O
improve O
the O
efficiency O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
. O

To O
arrive O
to O
suitable O
solutions O
in O
IR O
systems O
, O
machines O
need O
additional O
semantic O
information O
that O
helps O
in O
understanding O
Web O
documents O
. O

This O
is O
made O
true O
by O
an O
intelligent O
web O
called O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
, O
which O
offers O
users O
the O
ability O
to O
work O
on O
shared O
meaningful O
knowledge O
representations O
on O
the O
web O
. O

Semantic O
Web O
makes O
the O
Web O
content O
meaningful O
to O
computers O
and O
it O
intends O
to O
support O
machine O
- O
processing O
capabilities O
. O

Using O
Semantic O
Web O
is O
a O
way O
to O
increase O
the O
precision O
of O
IR O
systems O
. O

This O
paper O
focuses O
on O
the O
various O
Semantic O
- O
based O
approaches O
in O
Web O
mining O
research O
. O

to O
- O

( O

) O

. O

seems O
to O

large O
- O

, O

of O

. O

. O

. O

The O
bulk O
of O
clinical O
data O
is O

. O

About O
80 O

. O

has O

from O
" O

" O

a O

. O

" O

" O

. O

to O
Chinese O
information O

retrieval(CIR O

for O

to O

and O

within O
a O

. O

It O
has O

that O

important O
role O
for O

. O

This O

presents O
OBIRE O
, O
a O

network O
for O

information O

. O

To O

of O
OBIRE O
in O

, O

. O

For O

of O

to O

of O

( O

is O

Theory O
, O

to O

. O

Principle O
( O

captures O

between O

absolute O
way O
via O
x201C;quantum O
interference&#x201D O
; O
by O
considering O
a O
single O
vector O
i.e O
one O
- O

subspace O
. O

The O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
methodology O
for O
automatically O
indexing O
a O
large O
corpus O
of O
broadcast O
baseball O
games O
using O
an O
unsupervised O
content O
- O
based O
approach O
. O

The O
method O
relies O
on O
the O
learning O
of O
a O
grounded O
language O
model O
which O
maps O
query O
terms O
to O
the O
non O
- O
linguistic O
context O
to O
which O
they O
refer O
. O

Grounded O
language O
models O
are O
learned O
from O
a O
large O
, O
unlabeled O
corpus O
of O
video O
events O
. O

Events O
are O
represented O
using O
a O
codebook O
of O
automatically O
discovered O
temporal O
patterns O
of O
low O
level O
features O
extracted O
from O
the O
raw O
video O
. O

These O
patterns O
are O
associated O
with O
words O
extracted O
from O
the O
closed O
captioning O
text O
using O
a O
generalization O
of O
Latent O
Dirichlet O
Allocation O
. O

We O
evaluate O
the O
benefit O
of O
the O
grounded O
language O
model O
by O
extending O
a O
traditional O
language O
model O
based O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Experimental O
results O
indicate O
that O
using O
a O
grounded O
language O
model O
nearly O
doubles O
performance O
on O
a O
held O
out O
test O
set O

Given O
the O
conversion O
method O
proposed O
, O
our O
experimental O
results O
using O
TREC O
data O
indicate O
that O
system O
- O
oriented O
measures O
of O
overall O
retrieval O
performance O
( O
such O
as O
average O
precision O
) O
yield O
good O
metasearch O
algorithms O
whose O
performance O
equals O
or O
exceeds O
that O
of O
benchmark O
techniques O
such O
as O
CombMNZ O
and O
Condorcet O
. O

Textual O
data O
is O
at O
the O
forefront O
of O
information O
management O
problems O
today O
. O

Thousands O
of O
pages O
of O
text O
data O
, O
in O

, O
are O
produced O
daily O
: O

, O

, O

reviews O
, O

forums O
, O
academic O
articles O
, O
and O
business O
reports O
. O

Computational O
linguistics O
interventions O
have O
also O
increased O
, O
as O
we O
rely O
more O
and O
more O
on O
automated O
language O

, O

, O

, O
and O

. O

Managing O
, O

, O

both O

. O

Data O
scale O
issues O
are O
not O
only O

for O

-DOCSTART- O

Disambiguating O
named O
entities O
in O
natural O
language O
texts O
maps O
ambiguous O
names O
to O
canonical O
entities O
registered O
in O
a O
knowledge O
base O
such O
as O
DBpedia O
, O
Freebase O
, O
or O
YAGO O
. O

Knowing O
the O
specific O
entity O
is O
an O
important O
asset O
for O
several O
other O
tasks O
, O
e.g. O
entity O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
or O
higher O
- O
level O
information O
extraction O
. O

Our O
approach O
to O
named O
entity O
disambiguation O
makes O
use O
of O
several O
ingredients O
: O
the O
prior O
probability O
of O
an O
entity O
being O
mentioned O
, O
the O
similarity O
between O
the O
context O
of O
the O
mention O
in O
the O
text O
and O
an O
entity O
, O
as O
well O
as O
the O
coherence O
among O
the O
entities O
. O

Extending O
this O
method O
, O
we O
present O
a O
novel O
and O
highly O
efficient O
measure O
to O
compute O
the O
semantic O
coherence O
between O
entities O
. O

This O
measure O
is O
especially O
powerful O
for O
long O
- O
tail O
entities O
or O
such O
entities O
that O
are O
not O
yet O
present O
in O
the O
knowledge O
base O
. O

Reliably O
identifying O
names O
in O
the O
input O
text O
that O
are O
not O
part O
of O
the O
knowledge O
base O
is O
the O
current O
focus O
of O
our O
work O
. O

This O
paper O
deals O
with O
Salton O
's O
systems O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
his O
model O
, O
only O
the O
correspondence O
between O
requests O
and O
objects O
( O
documents O
or O
document O
descriptions O
) O
is O
described O
. O

The O
request O
language O
is O
treated O
as O
a O
partially O
ordered O
set O
which O
may O
have O
a O
lattice O
structure O
or O
even O
Boolean O
algebra O
structure O
. O

Those O
structures O
have O
influence O
in O
simplicity O
or O
retrieval O
methods O
and O
in O
mathematical O
pictoriality O
of O
some O
important O
properties O
of O
information O
systems O
like O
simplicity O
or O
selectivity O
. O

This O
paper O
investigates O
such O
problems O
and O
presents O
a O
method O
of O
designing O
artificial O
attributes O
and O
their O
values O
. O

representation O
has O
been O
the O

issue O
in O
the O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O

However O
, O

( O

) O

data O

on O

, O

not O

to O

document O

of O

terms O
in O
different O
positions O
. O

This O

term O
weighting O
method O

information O
gain O
of O
terms O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
relationship O
between O
information O
and O
complexity O
is O
analyzed O
using O
a O
detailed O
literature O
analysis O
. O

Complexity O
is O
a O
multifaceted O
concept O
, O
with O
no O
single O
agreed O
definition O
. O

There O
are O
numerous O
approaches O
to O
defining O
and O
measuring O
complexity O
and O
organization O
, O
all O
involving O
the O
idea O
of O
information O
. O

Conceptions O
of O
complexity O
, O
order O
, O
organization O
, O
and O
“ O
interesting O
order O
” O
are O
inextricably O
intertwined O
with O
those O
of O
information O
. O

Shannon O
’s O
formalism O
captures O
information O
’s O
unpredictable O
creative O
contributions O
to O
organized O
complexity O
; O
a O
full O
understanding O
of O
information O
’s O
relation O
to O
structure O
and O
order O
is O
still O
lacking O
. O

Conceptual O
investigations O
of O
this O
topic O
should O
enrich O
the O
theoretical O
basis O
of O
the O
information O
science O
discipline O
, O
and O
create O
fruitful O
links O
with O
other O
disciplines O
that O
study O
the O
concepts O
of O
information O
and O
complexity O
. O

We O
deal O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
with O
the O
< O
i O
> O
short O
queries</i O
containing O
one O
or O

words O
) O
problem O
. O

Short O
queries O
have O
no O
sufficient O
information O
to O
express O
their O
semantics O
in O
a O
non O
ambiguous O
way O
. O

Pseudo O
- O

( O

) O

for O

is O

in O
many O
Information O

( O
IR O
) O
tasks O
. O

However O
, O
this O
approach O
does O
not O
work O
well O
in O
the O
case O
of O
very O
short O
queries O
. O

Therefore O
, O
we O
present O
instead O
of O
PRF O
a O
semantic O
query O

based O
on O
Wikipedia O
. O

This O
method O
expands O
short O
queries O
by O
semantically O
related O
terms O
extracted O
from O
Wikipedia O
. O

Our O
experiments O
on O
cultural O
heritage O
corpora O
show O
significant O
improvement O
in O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

The O

, O
which O
is O
the O

of O

techniques O
to O
emergency O
context O
, O
is O

for O

, O

conditions O

patients O
. O

for O

, O

. O

. O

, O

and O

of O

. O

( O

) O

. O

of O

( O
Physical O
Performance O
and O
Contextual O
Evaluation O
) O
can O
be O

with O

inherited O
from O
physical O
and O

respectively O
. O

The O

model O
( O
Decontextualized O
Evaluation O
) O
is O
more O
typical O
of O

and O

to O
a O

of O

of O

subsystems O
of O
an O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
information O
plays O
an O
inevitable O
role O
in O
the O
handling O
systems O
of O
numerical O
data O
existing O
today O
. O

The O
amount O
of O
information O
handled O
by O
various O
organizations O
in O
the O
world O
today O
is O
high O
and O
its O
management O
without O
the O
computer O
is O
no O
longer O
imaginable O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
a O
research O
area O
in O
computer O
science O
whose O
goal O
is O
to O
facilitate O
access O
to O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
in O
electronic O
form O
( O
corpus O
) O
and O
allow O
a O
user O
to O
find O
the O
relevant O
ones O
for O
him O
, O
that O
is O
to O
say O
, O
those O
whose O
content O
best O
matches O
the O
information O
needs O
of O
the O
user O
. O

We O
propose O
in O
this O
paper O
a O
system O
called O
x201C;Neuro O
- O
RI&#x201D O
; O
putting O
into O
practice O
our O
model O
of O
information O
retrieval O
based O
on O
neural O
networks O
with O
neighborhood O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
scalable O
arrow O
detection O
technique O
for O
biomedical O
images O
to O
support O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
under O
the O
purview O
of O
content O
- O
based O
image O
retrieval O
( O
CBIR O
) O
and O
text O
information O
retrieval O
( O
TIR O
The O
idea O
primarily O
follows O
the O
criteria O
based O
on O
the O
geometric O
properties O
of O
the O
arrow O
, O
where O
we O
introduce O
signatures O
from O
key O
points O
associated O
with O
it O
. O

To O
handle O
this O
, O
images O
are O
first O
binarized O
via O
a O
fuzzy O
binarization O
tool O
and O
several O
regions O
of O
interest O
are O
labeled O
accordingly O
. O

Each O
region O
is O
used O
to O
generate O
signatures O
and O
then O
compared O
with O
the O
theoretical O
ones O
to O
check O
their O
similarity O
. O

Our O
validation O
over O
biomedical O
images O
shows O
the O
advantage O
of O
the O
technique O
over O
the O
most O
prominent O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Each O
day O
significant O
numbers O
of O
people O
worldwide O
have O
their O
tist O
experience O
in O
interactive O
information O
retrieval O
using O
the O
technologies O
of O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
on O
the O
Internet O
and O
many O
others O
return O
to O
try O
again O
. O

Surfing O
the O
web O
can O
be O
great O
entertainment O
, O
and O
even O
often O
a O
source O
of O
useful O
information O
. O

Certainly O
the O
ability O
to O
connect O
to O
known O
sites O
, O
such O
as O
company O
home O
pages O
, O
weather O
reports O
, O
etc O
. O
can O

. O

But O

to O
actually O

the O
web O
for O
a O
specific O
piece O
of O
information O
can O
often O
be O
very O
frustrating O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
web O
began O
its O
existence O
around O
1989 O
with O
a O
proposal O
called O
‘ O
Information O
Management O
: O
A O
proposal’ O
by O
Tim O
Berners O
- O
Lee O
, O
a O
researcher O
at O
CERN O
the O
European O
organization O
for O
nuclear O
research O
in O
Switzerland O
. O

The O
proposal O
envisaged O
a O
network O
of O
remote O
documents O
linked O
physically O
using O
the O
internet O
and O
logically O
using O
hypertext O
. O

The O
proposal O
was O
called O
the O
‘ O
World O
Wide O
Web O

In O
response O
to O

) O

to O

of O
common O

methods O
. O

Firstly O
, O
two O
human O
perception O
customs O
are O
introduced O
, O
which O
have O
important O
relations O
to O
shape O
retrieval O
. O

Secondly O
, O
these O
two O
customs O
are O
properly O
modeled O
by O
morphological O
operations O
. O

Finally O
, O

proposed O
PMMS O
is O
applied O
to O
improve O
the O

performances O
of O
a O
popular O
shape O

method O
named O
Inner O
- O
Distance O
Shape O
Contexts O
( O
IDSC O
and O
then O

Locally O
Constrained O
Diffusion O
Process O
( O
LCDP O
) O
method O
is O
exploited O
to O
further O
enhance O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

This O
combination O
achieves O
a O
retrieval O
rate O
of O
98.56 O
% O
on O
MPEG-7 O
dataset O
. O

We O
also O
conduct O
the O
experiments O
on O
Swedish O
Leaf O
dataset O
, O
the O
ETH-80 O
dataset O
and O
the O
Natural O

dataset O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
obtained O
from O
four O

demonstrate O
clearly O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
representation O
of O
sequences O
based O
on O
the O
structural O
information O
of O
the O
sequences O
. O

A O
sequence O
is O
represented O
by O
a O
set O
of O
rules O
, O
which O
are O
derived O
from O
its O
subsequences O
. O

There O
are O
two O
types O
of O
subsequences O
of O
interest O
. O

One O
is O
called O
frequent O
pattern O
, O
which O
is O
a O
subsequence O
appearing O
often O
enough O
in O
the O
sequence O
. O

The O
other O
is O
called O
correlative O
pattern O
, O
which O
is O
a O
subsequence O
composed O
of O
highly O
correlated O
elements O
. O

The O
rules O
derived O
from O
the O
frequent O
patterns O
are O
called O
frequent O
rules O
, O
while O
the O
ones O
derived O
from O
the O
correlative O
patterns O
are O
called O
correlative O
rules O
. O

By O
considering O
music O
objects O
as O
sequences O
, O
we O
represent O
each O
of O
them O
as O
a O
set O
of O
rules O
and O
design O
a O
similarity O
function O
for O
effective O
music O
retrieval O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
approaches O
outperform O
the O
approaches O
based O
on O
the O
Markovmodel O
on O
the O
average O
precision O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
2-server O
Private O

( O
PIR O
) O
scheme O
allows O

to O

the O
ith O

- O
bit O

servers O
, O
while O
not O
revealing O
any O
information O
about O
i O
to O
either O
server O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
construct O
a O
2-server O
PIR O
scheme O
with O
total O
communication O
cost O
n O
< O
sup O
> O
O&#8730;(log O
log O
n O
log O
n O
sup O

This O
improves O
over O
current O
2-server O
protocols O
which O
all O
require O
937;(n O
< O
sup>1/3</sup O
communication O
. O

Our O
construction O
circumvents O
the O
n O
< O
sup>1/3</sup O
> O
barrier O
of O
Razborov O
and O
Yekhanin O
which O
holds O
for O
the O
restricted O
model O
of O
bilinear O
group O
- O
based O
schemes O
( O
covering O
all O
previous O
2-server O
schemes O
The O
improvement O

from O

the O

of O
servers O
in O

, O
based O
on O

. O

This O

( O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
applied O
an O
intelligent O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
technique O
to O
devise O
an O
algorithm O
identifying O
and O
rating O
adult O
images O
. O

Given O
a O
query O
, O
ten O
most O
similar O
images O
are O
retrieved O
from O
an O
adult O
image O
database O
and O
a O
non O
- O
adult O
image O
database O
in O
which O
we O
store O
existing O
images O
of O
each O
class O
. O

If O
majority O
of O
the O
retrieved O
are O
adult O
images O
, O
then O
the O
query O
is O
determined O
to O
be O
an O
adult O
image O
. O

Otherwise O
, O
it O
is O
determined O
to O
be O
a O
non O
- O
adult O
class O
. O

Our O
experiment O
shows O
99 O
% O
true O
positives O
with O
23 O
% O
false O
positives O
with O
a O
database O
containing O
1,300 O
non O
- O
adult O
images O
, O
and O
93.5 O
% O
correct O
detections O
with O
8.4 O
% O
false O
positives O
when O
experimented O
with O
a O
database O
containing O
12,000 O
non O
- O
adult O
images O
. O

9,900 O
adult O
images O
are O
used O
for O
both O
experiments O
. O

We O
also O
present O
an O
adult O
image O
rating O
algorithm O
which O
produces O
results O
that O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
reference O
for O
rating O
images O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O

discuss O
a O
hybrid O
approach O
combining O
Case O
- O
Based O
Reasoning O
( O
CBR O
) O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
for O
the O
retrieval O
of O
full O
- O
text O
documents O
. O

Our O
hybrid O
CBR O
- O
IR O
approach O
takes O
as O
input O
a O
standard O
symbolic O
representation O
of O
a O
problem O
case O
and O
retrieves O
texts O
of O
relevant O
cases O
from O
a O
document O
collection O
dramatically O
larger O
than O
the O
case O
base O
available O
to O
the O
CBR O
system O
. O

Our O
system O
works O
by O
first O
performing O
a O
standard O
HYPO O
- O
style O
CBR O
analysis O
and O
then O
using O
the O
texts O
associated O
with O
certain O
important O
classes O
of O
cases O
found O
in O
this O
analysis O
to O
“ O
seed O
” O
a O
modified O
version O
of O
INQUERY O
's O
relevance O
feedback O
mechanism O
in O
order O
to O
generate O
a O
query O
composed O
of O
individual O
terms O
or O
pairs O
of O
terms O
. O

Our O
approach O
provides O
two O
benefits O
: O
it O
extends O
the O
reach O
of O
CBR O
( O
for O
retrieval O
purposes O
) O
to O
much O
larger O
corpora O
, O
and O
it O
enables O
the O
injection O
of O
knowledge O
- O
based O
techniques O
into O
traditional O
IR O
. O

We O
describe O
our O
CBR O
- O
IR O
approach O
and O
report O
on O
on O
- O
going O
experiments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
statistical O
framework O
for O
high O
- O
level O
feature O
extraction O
that O
uses O
SIFT O
Gaussian O
mixture O
models O
( O

) O
and O

models O
. O

SIFT O
features O
were O

from O
all O

image O
frames O
and O

by O
a O

. O

In O

used O
mel O
- O

cepstral O
coefficients O
and O
ergodic O
hidden O
Markov O
models O
to O
detect O
high O
- O
level O
features O
in O
audio O
streams O
. O

The O
best O
result O

by O
using O

GMMs O
in O
terms O
of O
mean O
average O

on O

2009 O

was O
0.150 O
and O
was O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
highly O
robust O
audio O
- O
fingerprint O
( O
AFP O
We O
call O
this O
AFP O
the O
Spectral O
Entropy O
Signature O
( O
SES O
To O
extract O
the O
SES O
of O
a O
song O
, O
Shannon O
’s O
entropy O
is O
determined O
from O
the O
spectral O
coefficients O
of O
each O
one O
of O
the O
first O
24 O
critical O
bands O
according O
to O
the O
Bark O
scale O
; O
entropy O
values O
are O
then O
binary O
coded O
to O
obtain O
a O
very O
compact O
AFP O
of O
only O
0.13 O
kbps O
. O

To O
put O
the O
SES O
in O
context O
we O
compared O
it O
with O
a O
spectral O
flatness O
signature O
( O
SFS O
) O
and O
a O
Time O
domain O
Entropy O
Signature O
( O
TES O
The O
SES O
, O
TES O
and O
SFS O
were O
determined O
for O
every O
song O
in O
an O
assorted O
genre O
collection O
of O
4 O
000 O
elements O
. O

Four O
hundred O
songs O
were O
severely O
degraded O
and O
searched O
for O
using O
excerpts O
of O
five O
seconds O
. O

The O
SES O
showed O
higher O
robustness O
than O
both O
the O
TES O
and O
the O
SFS O
for O
the O
degradations O
of O
white O
noise O
addition O
, O
equalization O
, O
lossy O
compression O
, O
re O
- O
recording O
in O
a O
noisy O
environment O
, O
low O
pass O
filtering O
, O
time O
- O
shifting O
and O
cropping O
. O

EDICS O
: O
AUD O
- O
CONT O
Index O
Terms O
Audio O
- O
Fingerprint O
, O
Entropy O
, O
Music O
Information O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
widespread O
of O
the O
Internet O
, O
great O
research O
interests O
are O
being O
shown O
in O
Chinese O
language O
information O
retrieval O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

The O
absence O
of O
word O
boundaries O
in O
Chinese O
language O
makes O
Chinese O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
different O
to O
European O
IR O
. O

In O
order O
to O
apply O
traditional O
IR O
approaches O
to O
Chinese O
language O
, O
sentences O
have O
to O
be O
segmented O
into O
words O
first O
. O

Word O
segmentation O
is O
playing O
a O
key O
role O
in O
Chinese O
IR O
. O

As O
word O
segmentation O
is O
not O
straightforward O
and O
the O
results O
are O
sometime O
ambiguous O
, O
n O
- O
grams O
are O
used O
as O
an O
alternative O
. O

Several O
experimental O
studies O
have O
been O
conducted O
to O
compare O
words O
and O
n O
- O
grams O
, O
word O
segmentation O
and O
its O
effect O
on O
information O
retrieval O
. O

These O
studies O
show O
that O
using O
either O
words O
or O
n O
- O
grams O
leads O
to O
comparable O
performances O
. O

Higher O
word O
segmentation O
accuracy O
does O
not O
necessarily O
result O
in O
better O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
suffix O
tree O
based O
approach O
for O
Chinese O
information O
retrieval O
without O
word O
segmentation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Variation O
in O
performances O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
, O
which O
merges O
results O
from O
a O
number O
of O
retrieval O
schemes O
possessing O
equal O
and O
unequal O
weights O
, O
is O
studied O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

Weight O
of O
the O
retrieval O
schemes O
for O
a O
particular O
document O
is O
derived O
from O
the O
relevance O
scores O
of O
that O
corresponding O
document O
. O

Since O
, O
the O
relevance O
scores O
are O
varying O
from O
document O
to O
document O
and O
corpus O
to O
corpus O
, O
the O
method O
proposed O
is O
dynamic O
. O

A O
number O
of O
weight O
calculation O
methods O
, O
which O
are O
using O
the O
error O
value O
for O
computation O
purpose O
, O
are O
discussed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
weight O
calculation O
is O
tested O
over O
three O
benchmark O
test O
collections O
viz O
ADI O
, O
CISI O
and O
MED O
. O

It O
has O
been O
identified O
that O
the O
methods O
discussed O
in O
this O
paper O
retrieve O
articles O
effectively O
and O
they O
are O
independent O
of O
history O
or O
any O
training O
data O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Abbreviations O
are O
commonly O
found O
instances O
of O
synonymy O
in O
Biomedical O
journal O
papers O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
that O
index O
paragraphs O
rather O
than O
full O
- O
text O
articles O
are O
more O
susceptible O
to O
term O
variation O
of O
this O
kind O
, O
since O
abbreviations O
are O
typically O
only O
defined O
once O
at O
the O
beginning O
of O
the O
text O
. O

One O
solution O
to O
this O
problem O
is O
to O
expand O
the O
user O
query O
automatically O
with O
all O
possible O
abbreviation O
instances O
for O
each O
query O
term O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
compare O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
two O
abbreviation O
expansion O
techniques O
on O
the O
TREC O
2006 O
Genomics O
Track O
queries O
and O
collection O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
for O
highly O
ambiguous O
abbreviations O
the O
query O
collocation O
effect O
is O
n’t O
strong O
enough O
to O
deter O
the O
retrieval O
of O
erroneous O
passages O
. O

We O
conclude O
that O
full O
- O
text O
abbreviation O
resolution O
prior O
to O
passage O
indexing O
is O
the O
most O
appropriate O
approach O
to O
this O
problem O
. O

this O
paper O
, O

adopt O
two O
methods O

NTCIR-5 O

- O
English O

. O

- O

( O

) O

to O

only O

, O

, O
and O
foreign O

as O


-DOCSTART- O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
decade O
has O
seen O
a O
great O
deal O
of O
progress O
in O
the O
development O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
we O
still O
lack O
a O
systematic O
understanding O
of O
the O
behavior O
of O
the O
systems O
and O
their O
relationship O
with O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
completely O
new O
approach O
towards O
the O
understanding O
of O
the O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Recently O
, O
it O
has O
been O
observed O
that O
retrieval O
systems O
in O
TREC O
6 O
show O
some O
remarkable O
patterns O
in O
retrieving O
relevant O
documents O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
TREC O
6 O
observations O
, O
we O
introduce O
a O
geometric O
linear O
model O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
then O
apply O
the O
model O
to O
predict O
the O
number O
of O
relevant O
documents O
by O
the O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
model O
is O
also O
scalable O
to O
a O
much O
larger O
data O
set O
. O

Although O
the O
model O
is O
developed O
based O
on O
the O
TREC O
6 O
routing O
test O
data O
, O
I O
believe O
it O
can O
be O
readily O
applicable O
to O
other O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
Appendix O
, O
we O
explained O
a O
simple O
and O
efficient O
way O
of O
making O
a O
better O
system O
from O
the O
existing O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
difficulty O
of O
a O
user O
query O
can O
affect O
the O
performance O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
. O

This O
work O
presents O
a O
formal O
model O
for O
quantifying O
and O
reasoning O
about O
query O
difficulty O
as O
follows O
: O

Query O
difficulty O
is O
considered O
to O
be O
a O
subjective O
belief O
, O
which O
is O
formulated O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
various O
types O
of O
evidence O
. O

This O
allows O
us O
to O
define O
a O
belief O
model O
and O
a O
set O
of O
operators O
for O
combining O
evidence O
of O
query O
difficulty O
. O

The O
belief O
model O
uses O
subjective O
logic O
, O
a O
type O
of O
probabilistic O
logic O
for O
modeling O
uncertainties O
. O

An O
application O
of O
this O
model O
with O
semantic O
and O
pragmatic O
evidence O
about O
150 O
TREC O
queries O
illustrates O
the O
potential O
flexibility O
of O
this O
framework O
in O
expressing O
and O
combining O
evidence O
. O

To O
our O
knowledge O
, O
this O
is O
the O
first O
application O
of O
subjective O
logic O
to O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Supervised O
training O
of O
deep O
neural O
nets O
typically O
relies O
on O
minimizing O
cross O
- O
entropy O
. O

However O
, O
in O
many O
domains O
, O
we O
are O
interested O
in O
performing O
well O
on O
metrics O
specific O
to O
the O
application O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
direct O
loss O
minimization O
approach O
to O
train O
deep O
neural O
networks O
, O
which O
provably O
minimizes O
the O
application O
- O
specific O
loss O
function O
. O

This O
is O
often O
non O
- O
trivial O
, O
since O
these O
functions O
are O
neither O
smooth O
nor O
decomposable O
and O
thus O
are O
not O
amenable O
to O
optimization O
with O
standard O
gradient O
- O
based O
methods O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
in O
the O
context O
of O
maximizing O
average O
precision O
for O
ranking O
problems O
. O

Towards O
this O
goal O
, O
we O
develop O
a O
novel O
dynamic O
programming O
algorithm O
that O
can O
efficiently O
compute O
the O
weight O
updates O
. O

Our O
approach O
proves O
superior O
to O
a O
variety O
of O
baselines O
in O
the O
context O
of O
action O
classification O
and O
object O
detection O
, O
especially O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
label O
noise O
. O

Sentiment O
Analysis O
has O
become O
an O
indispensible O
part O
of O
product O
reviews O
in O
present O
scenario O
. O

Sentiment O
Analysis O
is O
a O
very O
well O
studied O
field O
, O
but O
the O
scale O
remains O
limited O
to O
not O
more O
than O
a O
few O
hundred O
researchers O
. O

The O
problem O
of O
analyzing O
the O
overall O
sentiment O
of O
a O
document O
using O
Machine O
learning O
techniques O
has O
been O
considered O
. O

Results O
have O
been O
improved O
using O
multiple O
kernel O
approach O
and O
compared O
with O
previously O
used O
techniques O
.. O

The O
present O
research O
is O
a O
comparison O
and O
extension O
of O
the O
work O
proposed O
by O
Mullen O
and O
Collier O
( O
2003 O

The O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
feature O
Extraction O
phase O
and O
a O
learning O
phase O
; O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
which O
the O
overall O
sentiment O
of O
the O
document O
is O
analyzed O
. O

The O
present O
work O
uses O
the O
movie O
review O
data O
set O
used O
by O
Pang O
( O

The O
approach O
significantly O
outperforms O
the O
previous O
methods O
attaining O
90 O
% O
and O
92 O
% O
accuracy O
using O
5 O
fold O
cross O
validation O
10 O
fold O
cross O
validation O
respectively O
. O

, O

Retrieving O
finer O
grained O
text O
units O
such O
as O
passages O
or O
sentences O
as O
answers O
for O
non O
- O
factoid O
Web O
queries O
is O
becoming O
increasingly O
important O
for O
applications O
such O
as O
mobile O
Web O
search O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O

introduce O

answer O
sentence O
retrieval O
task O
for O
non O
- O

Web O

how O
this O

can O
be O
effectively O

under O

learning O
to O
rank O

. O

We O
design O
two O
types O
of O
features O
, O

semantic O
and O

, O

traditional O
text O

. O

to O

state O
- O
of O
- O

- O

, O

an O
answer O
- O

of O

. O

Results O

that O

previously O

and O

not O
sufficient O
for O

non O
- O

queries O
, O
but O
with O

and O
context O
features O
, O
we O
can O
significantly O
outperform O
the O
baseline O
methods O
. O

Privacy O
remains O
a O
major O
concern O
when O
using O
search O
engines O
to O
find O
for O
information O
on O
the O
web O
due O
to O
the O
fact O
that O
search O
engines O
own O
massive O
resources O
in O
preserving O
search O
logs O
of O
each O
user O
and O
organizations O
. O

However O
, O
many O
of O
the O
present O
query O
search O
privacy O
practices O
require O
the O
very O
same O
search O
engine O
and O
third O
party O
to O
collaborate O
, O
making O
privacy O
even O
more O
difficult O
. O

Therefore O
, O
as O
a O
contribution O
, O
we O
present O
a O
heuristic O
, O
permutation O
of O
web O
search O
query O
types O
, O
a O
noncryptographic O
heuristic O
that O
works O
by O
formation O
of O
obfuscated O
search O
queries O
via O
permutation O
of O
query O
keyword O
categories O
. O

Preliminary O
results O
from O
this O
study O
show O
that O
web O
search O
query O
and O
specific O
user O
intent O
privacy O
might O
be O
achievable O
from O
the O
user O
side O
without O
involvement O
of O
the O
search O
engine O
or O
other O
third O
parties O
by O
the O
permutation O
of O
web O
search O
query O
types O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Multivariate O
loss O
functions O
are O
extensively O
employed O
in O
several O
prediction O
tasks O
arising O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Often O
, O
the O
goal O
in O
the O
tasks O
is O
to O
minimize O
expected O
loss O
when O
retrieving O
relevant O
items O
from O
a O
presented O
set O
of O
items O
, O
where O
the O
expectation O
is O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
joint O
distribution O
over O
item O
sets O
. O

Our O
key O
result O
is O
that O
for O
most O
multivariate O
losses O
, O
the O
expected O
loss O
is O
provably O
optimized O
by O
sorting O
the O
items O
by O
the O
conditional O
probability O
of O
label O
being O
positive O
and O
then O
selecting O
top O
k O
items O
. O

Such O
a O
result O
was O
previously O
known O
only O
for O
the O
F O
-measure O
. O

Leveraging O
on O
the O
optimality O
characterization O
, O
we O
give O
an O
algorithm O
for O
estimating O
optimal O
predictions O
in O
practice O
with O
runtime O
quadratic O
in O
size O
of O
item O
sets O
for O
many O
losses O
. O

We O
provide O
empirical O
results O
on O
benchmark O
datasets O
, O
comparing O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
to O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
for O
optimizing O
multivariate O
losses O
. O

context O
of O

Reuse O

to O

code O

been O

. O

is O
required O
in O

to O
find O
how O
to O
match O
classical O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O

code O

information O
. O

theories O
in O
the O
software O
development O
process O
, O
in O
terms O
of O
documentation O
standardization O
may O

when O

. O

. O

We O
study O
the O
problem O
of O
efficient O
dissemination O
of O
textual O
information O
over O
wide O
- O
area O
networks O
. O

Our O
dissemination O
architecture O
utilises O
middle O
- O
agents O
and O
sophisticated O
matching O
algorithms O
. O

The O
data O
model O
and O
query O
language O
is O
based O
on O
the O
well O
- O
known O
Boolean O
model O
from O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
main O
focus O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
the O
problem O
of O
matching O
incoming O
documents O
with O
submitted O
user O
profiles O
. O

We O
present O
four O
efficient O
main O
memory O
algorithms O
for O
this O
problem O
and O
compare O
them O
experimentally O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Voice O
separation O
is O
an O
important O
component O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
an O
HMM O
which O
can O
be O
used O
to O
separate O
music O
performance O
data O
in O
the O
form O
of O
MIDI O
into O
monophonic O
voices O
. O

It O
works O
on O
two O
basic O
principles O
: O
that O
consecutive O
notes O
within O
a O
single O
voice O
will O
tend O
to O
occur O
on O
similar O
pitches O
, O
and O
that O
there O
are O
short O
( O
if O
any O
) O
temporal O
gaps O
between O
them O
. O

We O
also O
present O
an O
incremental O
algorithm O
which O
can O
perform O
inference O
on O
the O
model O
efficiently O
. O

We O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
achieves O
a O
significant O
improvement O
over O
existing O
approaches O
, O
when O
run O
on O
a O
corpus O
of O
78 O
compositions O
by O
J. O
S. O
Bach O
, O
each O
of O
which O
has O
been O
separated O
into O
the O
gold O
standard O
voices O
suggested O
by O
the O
original O
score O
. O

We O
also O
show O
that O
it O
can O
be O
used O
to O
perform O
voice O
separation O
on O
live O
MIDI O
data O
without O
an O
appreciable O
loss O
in O
accuracy O
. O

The O
code O
for O
the O
model O
described O
here O
is O
available O
at O
https O
github.com O
/ O
apmcleod O
/ O
voice- O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
our O
information O
retrieval O
system O
participated O
in O
CLIR O
task O
of O
NTCIR3 O
and O
reports O
the O
results O
with O
some O
observations O
. O

Most O
previous O
information O
retrieval O
models O
assume O
that O
terms O
of O
queries O
and O
documents O
are O
statistically O
independent O
from O
each O
another O
. O

However O
, O
independence O
assumption O
is O
obviously O
and O
openly O
understood O
to O
be O
wrong O
. O

We O
presented O
two O
method O
of O
incorporating O
the O
term O
dependences O
in O
probabilistic O
retrieval O
model O
to O
compensate O
the O
weakness O
of O
the O
linked O
dependence O
assumption O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Learning O
systems O
often O
describe O
a O
target O
class O
as O
a O
disjunction O
of O
conjunctions O
of O
conditions O
. O

Recent O
work O
has O
noted O
that O
small O
disjuncts O
, O
i.e O
those O
supported O
by O
few O
training O
examples O
, O
typically O
have O
poor O
predictive O
accuracy O
. O

One O
model O
of O
this O
accuracy O
is O
provided O
by O
the O
Bayes O
- O
Laplace O
formula O
based O
on O
the O
number O
of O
training O
examples O
covered O
by O
the O
disjunct O
and O
the O
number O
of O
them O
belonging O
to O
the O
target O
class O
. O

However O
, O
experiments O
show O
that O
small O
disjuncts O
associated O
with O
target O
classes O
of O
different O
relative O
frequencies O
tend O
to O
have O
different O
error O
rates O
. O

This O
note O
defines O
the O
context O
of O
a O
disjunct O
as O
the O
set O
of O
training O
examples O
that O
fail O
to O
satisfy O
at O
most O
one O
of O
its O
conditions O
. O

An O
empirical O
adaptation O
of O
the O
Bayes O
- O
Laplace O
formula O
is O
presented O
that O
also O
makes O
use O
of O
the O
relative O
frequency O
of O
the O
target O
class O
in O
this O
context O
. O

Trials O
are O
reported O
comparing O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
original O
formula O
and O
the O
adaptation O
in O
six O
learning O
tasks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
explores O
the O
idea O
that O
a O
concept O
lattice O
is O
an O
information O
channel O
between O
objects O
and O
attributes O
. O

For O
this O
purpose O
we O
study O
the O
behaviour O
of O
incidences O
in O
L O
- O
formal O
contexts O
where O
L O
is O
the O
range O
of O
an O
information O
- O
theoretic O
entropy O
function O
. O

Examples O
of O
such O
data O
abound O
in O
machine O
learning O
and O
data O
mining O
, O
e.g. O
confusion O
matrices O
of O
multi O
- O
class O
classifiers O
or O
document O
- O
term O
matrices O
. O

We O
use O
a O
wellmotivated O

-DOCSTART- O

Non O
- O
negative O
Matrix O
Factorization O
( O
NMF O
) O
has O
become O
increasingly O
popular O
in O
many O
applications O
that O
require O
data O
mining O
techniques O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
, O
computer O
vision O
, O
and O
pattern O
recognition O
. O

NMF O
aims O
at O
approximating O
the O
original O
data O
matrix O
in O
a O
high O
dimensional O
space O
with O
the O
product O
of O
two O
non O
- O
negative O
matrices O
in O
a O
lower O
dimensional O
space O
. O

In O
many O
applications O
with O
high O
dimensional O
data O
such O
as O
text O
, O
data O
often O
have O
a O
global O
geometric O
structure O
, O
which O
typically O
may O
not O
be O
directly O
derived O
from O
the O
local O
information O
. O

But O
the O
existing O
literature O
of O
NMF O
completely O
ignores O
this O
problem O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
matrix O
factorization O
algorithm O
called O
Coordinate O
Ranking O
regularized O
NMF O
( O
CR O
- O
NMF O
) O
in O
order O
to O
address O
this O
problem O
. O

The O
idea O
of O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
is O
to O
combine O
NMF O
and O
manifold O
ranking O
to O
encode O
both O
local O
and O
global O
geometric O
structures O
of O
the O
data O
. O

Experimental O
results O
on O
two O
real O
- O
world O
datasets O
demonstrate O
the O
superiority O
of O
this O
algorithm O
. O

is O

increasingly O
important O
. O

The O
most O
recent O
conferences O
of O

( O

a O
large O

about O

. O

are O
being O

for O
storing O
large O
bodies O
of O
text O
, O
and O
lexical O
databases O
are O

to O
be O
shared O
and O
analyzed O
. O

This O
panel O
will O
discuss O
some O
of O

recent O

in O
this O

, O

the O
bearing O
they O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Machine O
has O

of O
our O
society O
. O

Using O
the O
ATM O
however O
can O
often O
be O
a O

experience O
. O

How O
often O
have O
some O
of O
us O
experienced O
the O
people O
in O
the O
queue O
in O
front O
of O
you O
reinserting O
their O
card O
for O
another O
transaction O
. O

Why O
does O
this O
happen O
? O

Is O
there O
a O
design O
flaw O
in O
the O
user O
interface O
? O

It O
seems O
that O
many O

navigation O

not O

or O

as O

. O

of O

ATM O
menu O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
the O
detailed O
information O
of O
NLP O
- O
NITMZ O
system O
on O
the O
participation O
of O
DPIL O
shared O
task O
at O
Forum O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
Evaluation O
( O
FIRE O
2016 O

The O
main O
aim O
of O
DPIL O
shared O
task O
is O
to O
detect O
paraphrases O
in O
Indian O
Languages O
. O

Paraphrase O
detection O
is O
an O
important O
part O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Document O
Summarization O
, O
Question O
Answering O
, O
Plagiarism O
Detection O
etc O
. O

In O
our O
approach O
, O
we O
used O
language O
independent O
feature O
- O
set O
to O
detect O
paraphrases O
in O
Indian O
languages O
. O

Features O
are O
mainly O
based O
on O
lexical O
based O
similarity O
. O

Our O
system O
’s O
three O
features O
are O
: O
Jaccard O
Similarity O
, O
length O
normalized O
Edit O
Distance O
and O
Cosine O
Similarity O
. O

Finally O
, O
these O
feature O
- O
set O
are O
trained O
using O
Probabilistic O
Neural O
Network O
( O
PNN O
) O
to O
detect O
the O
paraphrases O
. O

With O
our O
feature O
- O
set O
, O
we O
achieved O
88.13 O
% O
average O
accuracy O
in O
Sub O
- O
Task O
1 O
and O
71.98 O
% O
average O
accuracy O
in O
Sub O
- O
Task O
2 O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Simulation O
and O
analysis O
have O
shown O
that O
selective O
search O
can O
reduce O
the O
cost O
of O
large O
- O
scale O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
. O

By O
partitioning O
the O
collection O
into O
small O
topical O
shards O
, O
and O
then O
using O
a O
resource O
ranking O
algorithm O
to O
choose O
a O
subset O
of O
shards O
to O
search O
for O
each O
query O
, O
fewer O
postings O
are O
evaluated O
. O

Here O
we O
extend O
the O
study O
of O
selective O
search O
using O
a O
fine O
- O
grained O
simulation O
investigating O
: O
selective O
search O
efficiency O
in O
a O
parallel O
query O
processing O
environment O
; O
the O
difference O
in O
efficiency O
when O
term O
- O
based O
and O
sample O
- O
based O
resource O
selection O
algorithms O
are O
used O
; O
and O
the O
effect O
of O
two O
policies O
for O
assigning O
index O
shards O
to O
machines O
. O

Results O
obtained O
for O
two O
large O
datasets O
and O
four O
large O
query O
logs O
confirm O
that O
selective O
search O
is O
significantly O
more O
efficient O
than O
conventional O
distributed O
search O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
show O
that O
selective O
search O
is O
capable O
of O
both O
higher O
throughput O
and O
lower O
latency O
in O
a O
parallel O
environment O
than O
is O
exhaustive O
search O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
generic O
and O
domain O
independent O
opinion O
relevance O
model O
for O
a O
Social O
Network O
user O
. O

The O
Social O
Opinion O
Relevance O
Model O
( O
SORM O
) O
is O
able O
to O
estimate O
an O
opinion O
's O
relevance O
based O
on O
twelve O
different O
parameters O
. O

Compared O
to O
other O
models O
, O

's O
main O
distinction O
is O
its O
ability O
to O
provide O
customized O
results O
according O
to O
whom O
the O
opinion O
relevance O
is O
being O
estimated O
for O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
lack O
of O
opinion O
relevance O
corpuses O
able O
to O
properly O
test O
our O
model O
, O
we O
have O
created O
a O
new O
one O
called O
Social O
Opinion O
Relevance O
Corpus O
( O
SORC O
Using O

, O
we O
carried O
out O
some O
experiments O
on O
the O
Electronic O
Games O
domain O
that O
illustrate O
the O
importance O
of O
the O
customizing O
the O
opinion O
relevance O
in O
order O
to O
achieve O
better O
results O
on O
typical O
Information O
Retrieval O
metrics O
, O
such O
as O
NDCG O
, O
QMeasure O
and O
MAP O
. O

We O
also O
performed O
a O
statistical O
significance O
test O
that O
reinforces O
and O
corroborates O
the O
advantages O
that O
SORM O
offers O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Due O
to O
data O
overload O
and O
time O
- O
critical O
nature O
of O
information O
need O
, O
automatic O
summarization O
of O
documents O
plays O
a O
significant O
role O
in O
information O
retrieval O
and O
text O
data O
mining O
. O

This O
paper O
discusses O
the O
design O
of O
a O
multi O
- O
document O
summarizer O
that O
uses O
Katz O
's O
K O
- O
mixture O
model O
for O
term O
distribution O
. O

The O
model O
helps O
in O
ranking O
the O
sentences O
by O
a O
modified O
term O
weight O
assignment O
. O

The O
system O
has O
been O
evaluated O
against O
the O
frequently O
occurring O
sentences O
in O
the O
summaries O
generated O
by O
a O
set O
of O
human O
subjects O
. O

Our O
system O
outperforms O
other O
auto O
- O
summarizers O
at O
different O
extraction O
levels O
of O
summarization O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
ideal O
summary O
, O
and O
is O
close O
to O
the O
ideal O
summary O
at O
40 O
% O
extraction O
level O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Visual O
Information O
Retrieval O
presents O
many O
challenges O
for O
the O
computer O
vision O
community O
. O

The O
terabytes O
of O
visual O
information O
stored O
in O
digital O
image O
and O
video O
libraries O
will O
remain O
inaccessible O
if O

of O

and O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
; O
we O
present O
techniques O
for O
content O
based O
image O
retrieval O
using O
higher O
level O

information O
. O

The O
content O
is O
represented O
and O
queried O
using O
attributed O
relational O
graphs O
, O
with O
colour O
attributes O
and O
relaxation O
labeling O
techniques O
. O

We O
present O
retrieval O
examples O
using O
both O
synthetic O
and O
real O
images O
of O
national O
jags O
. O

This O
, O
although O
a O
simplistic O
problem O
, O
highlights O
the O
shortcomings O
, O
and O
diflculties O
associated O
with O
content O
based O
retrieval O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Nowadays O
, O
many O
factors O
support O
a O
growing O
production O
of O
information O
. O

In O
modern O
large O
environments O
, O
for O
the O
user O
's O
point O
of O
view O
, O
it O
is O
desirable O
to O
have O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRS O
) O
that O
retrieve O
documents O
according O
to O
their O
relevance O
levels O
. O

Relevance O
levels O
have O
been O
studied O
in O
some O
previous O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
works O
while O
some O
others O
( O
few O
) O
IR O
research O
works O
tackled O
the O
questions O
of O
IRS O
e O
ectiveness O
and O
collections O
size O
. O

These O
latter O
works O
used O
standard O
IR O
measures O
on O
collections O
of O
increasing O
size O
to O
analyze O
IRS O
e O
ectiveness O
scalability O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
bring O
together O
these O
two O
issues O
in O
IR O
( O
multigraded O
relevance O
and O
scalability O
) O
by O
designing O
some O
new O
metrics O
for O
evaluating O
the O
ability O
of O
IRS O
to O
rank O
documents O
according O
to O
their O
relevance O
levels O
when O
collection O
size O
increases O
. O

This O
poster O
presents O
results O
for O
two O
approaches O
using O
Genetic O
Programming O
( O
GP O
) O
to O
overcome O
the O
problem O
of O
term O
mismatch O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O

We O
use O
automatic O
query O

techniques O
which O
add O
terms O
to O
a O
user O

initial O
query O
in O

that O
these O
words O
better O
describe O
the O
information O
need O
and O
ultimately O
return O
more O
relevant O
documents O
to O
the O
user O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
particular O
form O
of O
fuzzy O
- O
fingerprints O
— O
their O
construction O
, O
their O
interpretation O
, O
and O
their O
use O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Though O
the O
concept O
of O
fingerprinting O
in O
general O
is O
not O
new O
, O
the O
way O
of O
using O
them O
within O
a O
similarity O
search O
as O
described O
here O
is O
: O
Instead O
of O
computing O
the O
similarity O
between O
two O
fingerprints O
in O
order O
to O
access O
the O
similarity O
between O
the O
associated O
objects O
, O
simply O
the O
event O
of O
a O
fingerprint O
collision O
is O
used O
for O
a O
similarity O
assessment O
. O

The O
main O
impact O
of O
this O
approach O
is O
the O
small O
number O
of O
comparisons O
necessary O
to O
conduct O
a O
similarity O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Distributed O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
DDOS O
) O
attacks O
have O
emerged O
as O
a O
prevalent O
way O
to O
take O
down O
web O
sites O
and O
have O
imposed O
financial O
losses O
to O
companies O
. O

The O
CSI O
/ O
FBI O
survey O
( O
CSI O
2001 O
) O
shows O
that O
36 O
% O
of O
respondents O
in O
the O
last O
12-months O
period O
have O
detected O
denial O
of O
service O
, O
which O
imposed O
more O
than O
$ O
4.2 O
million O
financial O
losses O
. O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
DDOS O
defenses O
depends O
on O
many O
factors O
such O
that O
the O
nature O
of O
the O
network O
’s O
topology O
, O
the O
specific O
attack O
scenario O
, O
and O
various O
characteristics O
of O
the O
network O
routers O
. O

However O
, O
little O
research O
has O
focused O
on O
the O
tradeoffs O
inherent O
in O
this O
complex O
system O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
develop O
a O
computational O
testbed O
to O
study O
security O
policies O
and O
the O
associated O
technologies O
that O
provide O
defenses O
against O
DDOS O
attacks O
. O

We O
will O
then O
use O
this O
framework O
to O
evaluate O
various O
policies O
and O
technologies O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
draw O
on O
research O
in O
the O
areas O
of O
computer O
science O
, O
information O
science O
, O
organizational O
theory O
and O
social O
networks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
navigation O
structure O
of O
Web O
sites O
can O
be O
regarded O
as O
metadata O
that O
can O
be O
used O
for O
interesting O
applications O
in O
User O
Interface O
( O

) O
design O
and O
Human O
- O
Computer O
Interaction O
( O
HCI O
as O
well O
as O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
tasks O
. O

However O
, O

currently O
is O
no O

format O
for O
site O
metadata O
, O
which O

hard O
for O

in O

- O

, O

. O

We O

for O

metadata O
that O
is O

on O
top O
of O
an O

format O
and O
thus O
could O
be O
deployed O
with O
little O
overhead O
by O
publishers O
as O
well O
as O
consumers O
. O

Making O
site O
metadata O
available O
as O
machine O
- O
readable O
data O
can O
be O
used O
for O
improving O
user O
interfaces O
( O

about O
the O

of O

they O
are O

( O

to O

for O
better O
ranking O
and O

of O
the O
results O
) O
. O

Indexing O
is O
a O
crucial O
technique O
for O
dealing O
with O
the O
massive O
amount O
of O
data O
present O
on O
the O
web O
. O

Indexing O
can O
be O
performed O
based O
on O
words O
or O
on O
phrases O
. O

Our O
approach O
aims O
to O
efficiently O
index O
web O
documents O
by O
employing O
a O
hybrid O
technique O
in O
which O

are O
indexed O
in O
such O
a O
way O
that O
knowledge O
available O
in O
the O
Wikipedia O
and O
in O
meta O
- O
content O
is O
efficiently O
used O
. O

Our O
preliminary O
experiments O
on O
the O
TREC O
dataset O
have O
shown O
that O
our O
indexing O
scheme O
is O
a O
robust O
and O
efficient O
method O
for O
both O
indexing O
and O
for O
retrieving O
relevant O
web O
pages O
. O

We O
ranked O
term O
queries O
in O
different O
ways O
, O
depending O
if O
they O
were O
found O
in O
Wikipedia O
pages O
or O
not O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
our O
preliminary O
algorithm O
and O
experiments O
for O
the O
ad O
- O
hoc O
and O
diversity O
tasks O
of O
the O
TREC O
2011 O
Web O
track O
. O

We O
ran O

on O
the O

( O

million O
web O

) O
from O

. O

: O

, O

, O

Information O
exists O
on O
the O
Web O
in O
a O
number O
of O
languages O
. O

This O
situation O
has O
given O
rise O
to O
new O
line O
of O
research O
called O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
treating O
the O
problem O
of O
finding O
a O
document O
written O
in O
one O
language O
via O
a O
query O
written O
in O
another O
language O
. O

One O
of O
the O
important O
resources O
needed O
for O
this O
problem O
is O
set O
of O
bilingual O
dictionaries O
for O
producing O
queries O
in O
new O
languages O
. O

The O
two O
most O
important O
aspects O
of O
these O
bilingual O
dictionaries O
for O
CLIR O
are O
the O
coverage O
that O
the O
dictionary O
provides O
for O
domain O
- O
independent O
corpora O
, O
and O
the O
adequacy O
of O
the O
translations O
provided O
for O
finding O
relevant O
documents O
in O
the O
second O
language O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
number O
of O
evaluations O
of O
these O
aspects O
for O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
, O
available O
through O
the O
ELRA O
. O

These O
evaluations O
are O
run O
against O
large O
corpora O
used O
in O
the O
TREC O
information O
retrieval O
trials O
. O

Diversified O
retrieval O
and O
online O
learning O
are O
two O
core O
research O
areas O
in O
the O
design O
of O
modern O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
the O
linear O
submodular O
bandits O
problem O
, O
which O
is O
an O
online O
learning O
setting O
for O
optimizing O
a O
general O
class O
of O
feature O
- O
rich O
submodular O
utility O
models O
for O
diversified O
retrieval O
. O

We O
present O
an O
algorithm O
, O
called O
LSBGREEDY O
, O
and O
prove O
that O
it O
efficiently O
converges O
to O
a O
near O
- O
optimal O
model O
. O

As O
a O

study O
, O
we O
applied O
our O
approach O
to O
the O

of O

small O
sets O
of O
news O

selected O
from O
tens O
of O
thousands O
of O
available O
articles O
each O
day O
. O

In O
a O
live O
user O
study O
, O
we O
found O
that O
LSBGREEDY O
significantly O
outperforms O
existing O
online O
learning O
approaches O
. O

this O

the O
< O
i O
> O

Information O
Retrieval O
Group</i O
> O
at O

Universidad O
Aut&#243;noma O
de O
Madrid O
( O
Spain O
) O
to O
tackle O
the O
Identifying O
Ratings O

( O

2 O
) O
task O
of O
the O
CAMRa O
2011 O
Challenge O
. O

The O

- O

, O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

Being O
able O
to O
resolve O
word O
senses O
could O
improve O
precision O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
machine O
translation O
or O
other O
natural O
language O
applications O
. O

However O
, O
automatic O
disambiguation O
rarely O
provides O
benefits O
in O
proportion O
to O
its O
costs O
. O

In O
this O
study O
we O
have O
tried O
to O
determine O
the O
dominant O
or O
‘ O
most O
frequent’ O
sense O
of O
an O
ambiguous O
word O
. O

By O
identifying O
this O
, O
future O
applications O
could O
statistically O
choose O
a O
‘ O
correct’ O
word O
sense O
the O
majority O
of O
the O
time O
without O
computation O
. O

We O
investigated O
several O
ambiguous O
nouns O
and O
the O
frequency O
of O
their O
cooccurring O
synonyms O
from O
Roget O
’s O
thesaurus O
using O
the O
British O
National O
Corpus O
. O

This O
indicates O
the O
likelihood O
of O
the O
possible O
word O
senses O
. O

The O
results O
have O
been O
evaluated O
with O
some O
success O
against O
varying O
lexical O
resources O
including O
WordNet O
and O
the O
Concise O
Oxford O
Dictionary O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
are O
two O
main O
approaches O
to O
the O
representation O
of O
meaning O
in O
Computational O
Linguistics O
: O
a O
symbolic O
approach O
and O
a O

approach O
. O

This O
paper O
considers O
the O

of O
how O

might O
be O
combined O
. O

The O
proposal O
is O
to O
adapt O
a O
method O
from O
the O
Cognitive O
Science O
literature O
, O
in O
which O
symbolic O
and O
connectionist O
representations O
are O
combined O
using O
tensor O
products O
. O

Possible O
applications O
of O
this O
method O
for O
language O
processing O
are O
described O
. O

Finally O
, O
a O
potentially O
fruitful O
link O
between O
Quantum O
Mechanics O
, O
Computational O
Linguistics O
, O
and O
other O
related O
areas O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Machine O
Learning O
, O
is O
proposed O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
math O
- O
aware O
search O
engine O
that O
is O
capable O
of O
handling O
both O
textual O
keywords O
as O
well O
as O
mathematical O
expressions O
. O

Our O
math O
feature O
extraction O
and O
representation O
framework O
captures O
the O
semantics O
of O
math O
expressions O
via O
a O
Finite O
State O
Machine O
model O
. O

We O
adapt O
the O
passive O
aggressive O
online O
learning O
binary O
classifier O
as O
the O
ranking O
model O
. O

We O
benchmarked O
our O
approach O
against O
three O
classical O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
strategies O
on O
math O
documents O
crawled O
from O
< O
i O
> O
Math O

Overflow</i O
a O
well O
- O
known O
online O
math O
question O
answering O
system O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
proposed O
approach O
can O
perform O
better O
than O

The O
Vector O
Space O
Basis O
Change O
( O
VSBC O
) O

operator O

for O
change O
of O
basis O

is O
parameterized O
by O
a O

matrix O
. O

If O

the O
vector O
space O
basis O
, O
then O
each O
vector O
com­ O
ponent O
changes O

on O
this O
matrix O
. O

The O
strategy O
of O

has O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
effective O
in O
separating O
relevant O
documents O
and O
irrelevant O
ones O
. O

Recently O
, O
using O
this O
strategy O
, O
some O
feedback O
algorithms O
have O
been O
de­ O
veloped O
. O

To O
build O
a O

matrix O

optimization O
methods O
have O
been O
used O
. O

In O

paper O
, O

transition O
matrix O
. O

we O

feedback O
algorithm O
. O

Experimental O
results O
on O

collection O

that O
our O
proposed O
method O
is O
effective O
and O
generally O

to O
known O

based O
models O
. O

also O
show O
that O
our O
proposed O
method O
gives O
a O
statistically O

improvement O
over O
these O
models O
. O

is O
not O
a O
trivial O
task O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
objective O
criterion O
and O
the O
associated O
algorithm O
OKM O
that O
generalizes O
the O
k O
- O
means O
algorithm O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
overlapping O
clustering O
is O
a O
good O
alternative O
and O
indicate O
that O
OKM O
outperforms O
other O
existing O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
theoretic O
framework O
for O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
is O
introduced O
which O
guarantees O
optimal O
retrieval O
eeectiveness O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
a O
Ranking O
Principle O
for O
Distributed O
Multimedia O
- O
Documents O
( O
RPDM O
) O
is O
described O
together O
with O
an O
algorithm O
that O
satisses O
this O
principle O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
RPDM O
is O
shown O
to O
be O
a O
generalization O
of O
the O
Probability O
Ranking O
principle O
( O
PRP O
) O
which O
guarantees O
optimal O
retrieval O
eeectiveness O
in O
the O
case O
of O
text O
document O
retrieval O
. O

The O
PRP O
justiies O
theoretically O
the O
relevance O
ranking O
adopted O
by O
modern O
search O
engines O
. O

In O
contrast O
to O
the O
classical O
PRP O
, O
the O
new O
RPDM O
takes O
into O
account O
transmission O
and O
inspection O
time O
, O
and O
most O
importantly O
, O
aspectual O
recall O
rather O
than O
simple O
recall O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
term O
frequency O
normalisation O
parameter O
sensitivity O
is O
an O
important O
issue O
in O
the O
probabilistic O
model O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

A O
high O
parameter O
sensitivity O
indicates O
that O
a O
slight O
change O
of O
the O
parameter O
value O
may O
considerably O
affect O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

Therefore O
, O
a O
weighting O
model O
with O
a O
high O
parameter O
sensitivity O
is O
not O
robust O
enough O
to O
provide O
a O
consistent O
retrieval O
performance O
across O
different O
collections O
and O
queries O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
suggest O
that O
the O
parameter O
sensitivity O
is O
due O
to O
the O
fact O
that O
the O
query O
term O
weights O
are O
not O
adequate O
enough O
to O
allow O
informative O
query O
terms O
to O
differ O
from O
non O
- O
informative O
ones O
. O

We O
show O
that O
query O
term O
reweighing O
, O
which O
is O
part O
of O
the O
relevance O
feedback O
process O
, O
can O
be O
successfully O
used O
to O
reduce O
the O
parameter O
sensitivity O
. O

Experiments O
on O
five O
Text O
REtrieval O
Conference O
( O
TREC O
) O
collections O
show O
that O
the O
parameter O
sensitivity O
does O
remarkably O
decrease O
when O
query O
terms O
are O
reweighed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Bilinear O
models O
are O
widely O
used O
in O
signal O
processing O
, O
control O
theory O
and O
in O
many O
other O
information O
sciences O
. O

Although O

's O

order O

of O

. O

) O

of O

, O

the O

geometry O
to O
get O
the O
best O

and O

. O

understanding O
the O

of O

, O

their O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Due O
to O
the O
historical O
and O
cultural O
reasons O
, O
English O
phases O
, O
especially O
the O
proper O
nouns O
and O
new O
words O
, O
frequently O
appear O
in O
Web O
pages O
written O
primarily O
in O
Asian O
languages O
such O
as O
Chinese O
and O
Korean O
. O

Although O
these O
English O
terms O
and O
their O
equivalences O
in O
the O
Asian O
languages O
refer O
to O
the O
same O
concept O
, O
they O
are O
erroneously O
treated O
as O
independent O
index O
units O
in O
traditional O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
This O
paper O

the O
degree O
to O
which O
the O
problem O
arises O
in O
IR O
and O
suggests O
a O
novel O
technique O
to O
solve O
it O
. O

Our O
method O
firstly O
extracts O
an O
English O
phrase O
from O
Asian O
language O
Web O
pages O
, O
and O
then O
unifies O
the O
extracted O
phrase O
and O
its O
equivalence(s O
) O
in O
the O
language O
as O
one O
index O
unit O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
high O
precision O
of O
our O
conceptual O
unification O
approach O
greatly O
improves O
the O
IR O
performance O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Web O
Service O
discovery O
and O
selection O
deal O
with O
the O
retrieval O
of O
the O
most O
suitable O
Web O
Service O
, O
given O
a O
required O
functionality O
. O

Addressing O
an O
effective O
solution O
remains O
difficult O
when O
only O
functional O
descriptions O
of O
services O
are O
available O
. O

In O

paper O
, O

propose O
a O

by O
applying O
Case O
- O
based O
Reasoning O
, O
in O
which O
the O
resemblance O
between O
a O
pair O
of O
cases O
is O
quantified O
through O
a O
similarity O
function O
. O

We O
show O
the O
feasibility O
of O
applying O
Case O
- O
based O
Reasoning O
for O

Service O

and O
selection O

by O
introducing O
a O
novel O
case O
representation O
, O
learning O
heuristics O
and O
three O
different O

functions O
. O

We O
also O

our O
proposal O
with O
a O
dataset O
of O
62 O
real O
- O
life O
Web O
Services O
, O
achieving O
competitive O
values O
in O
terms O
of O
well O
- O
known O
Information O
Retrieval O
metrics O
. O

This O

-DOCSTART- O

Soft O
set O
theory O
was O
initiated O
by O
Molodtsov O
in O
1999 O
. O

In O
the O
past O
years O
, O
this O
theory O
had O
been O
applied O
to O
many O
branches O
of O
mathematics O
, O
information O
science O
and O
computer O
science O
. O

In O
2003 O
, O
Maji O
et O
al O
. O
introduced O
some O
operations O
of O
soft O
sets O
and O
gave O
some O
operational O
rules O
. O

Recently O
, O
some O
of O
these O
operational O
rules O
are O
pointed O
out O
to O
be O
not O
true O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
Ali O
et O
al O
in O
their O
paper O
, O
introduced O
and O
discussed O
some O
new O
operations O
of O
soft O
sets O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
further O
investigate O
these O
operational O
rules O
given O
by O
Maji O
et O
al O
. O
and O
Ali O
et O
al O

We O
obtain O
some O
sufficient O
- O
necessary O
conditions O
such O
that O
corresponding O
operational O
rules O
hold O
and O
give O
correct O
forms O
for O
some O
operational O
rules O
. O

These O
results O
will O
be O
help O
for O
us O
to O
use O
rightly O
operational O
rules O
of O
soft O
sets O
in O
research O
and O
application O
of O
soft O
set O
theory O
. O

Keywords O
— O
Soft O
sets O
, O
union O
, O
intersection O
, O
complement O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Collecting O
data O
from O
the O
web O
is O
essential O
for O
research O
in O
social O
science O
, O
like O
digital O
marketing O
and O
applied O
economics O
, O
and O
for O
data O
research O
areas O
like O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Big O
Data O
. O

However O
, O
most O
of O
current O
methods O
for O
automatically O
collecting O
web O
data O
do O
not O
take O
into O
account O
principles O
of O
data O
protection O
policies O
. O

Therefore O
, O
it O
is O
crucial O
to O
realize O
a O
method O
that O
complies O
with O
legal O
, O
ethical O
, O
and O
license O
policies O
established O
by O
governments O
and O
associations O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
general O
framework O
for O
automatically O
collecting O
data O
from O
social O
networks O
which O
is O
able O
to O
preserve O
data O
privacy O
. O

We O
propose O
an O
ontology O
to O
capture O
the O
nature O
of O
social O
network O
data O
, O
and O
a O
procedure O
for O
translating O
web O
data O
into O
an O
OWL O
2 O
ontology O
. O

Then O
we O
propose O
to O
use O
Semantic O
Web O
Technologies O
for O
formally O
expressing O
legal O
and O
ethical O
policies O
that O
regulate O
web O
data O
collection O
and O
mechanisms O
for O
being O
compliant O
with O
those O
policies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Networking O
: O
Suppose O
you O
need O
to O
multicast O
a O
message O
from O
one O
source O
node O
to O
many O
other O
machines O
on O
the O
network O
. O

Along O
what O
paths O
should O
the O
message O
be O
sent O
, O
and O
how O
can O

1.INTRODUCTION O
Research O
in O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
has O
expanded O
to O
take O
a O
broader O
perspective O
of O
the O
information O
seeking O
process O
to O
explicitly O
include O
users O
, O
tasks O
, O
and O
contexts O
in O
a O
dynamic O
setting O
rather O
than O
treating O
information O
search O
as O
static O
or O
as O
a O
sequence O
of O
unrelated O
events O
. O

The O
traditional O
Cranfield O
/ O
TREC O
IR O
system O
evaluation O
paradigm O
, O
using O
document O
relevance O
as O
a O
criterion O
, O
and O
evaluating O
single O
search O
results O
, O
is O
not O
appropriate O
for O
many O
circumstances O
considered O
in O
current O
research O
. O

Several O
alternatives O
to O
relevance O
have O
been O
proposed O
, O
including O
utility O
, O
and O
satisfaction O
. O

We O
suggest O
an O
evaluation O
model O
and O
methodology O
grounded O
in O
the O
nature O
of O
information O
seeking O
and O
centered O
on O
usefulness O
. O

We O
believe O
this O
model O
has O
broad O
applicability O
in O
current O
IR O
research O
. O

CMAC O
is O
one O
useful O
learning O
technique O
that O
was O
developed O
two O
decades O
ago O
but O
yet O
lacks O
adequate O
theoretical O
foundation O
. O

Most O
past O
studies O
focused O
on O
development O
of O
algorithms O
, O
improvement O
of O
the O
CMAC O
structure O
, O
and O
applications O
. O

Given O
a O
learning O
problem O
, O
very O
little O
about O
the O
CMAC O
learning O
behavior O
such O
as O
the O
convergence O
characteristics O
, O
effects O
of O
hash O
mapping O
, O
effects O
of O
memory O
size O
, O
the O
error O
bound O
, O
etc O
. O

can O
be O
analyzed O
or O
predicted O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
CMAC O
technique O
with O
mathematical O
formulation O
and O
use O
the O
formulation O
to O
study O
the O
CMAC O
convergence O
properties O
. O

Both O
information O
retrieval O
and O
learning O
rules O
are O
described O
by O
algebraic O
equations O
in O
matrix O
form O
. O

Convergence O
characteristics O
and O
learning O
behaviors O
for O
the O
CMAC O
with O
and O
without O
hash O
mapping O
are O
investigated O
with O
the O
use O
of O
these O
equations O
and O
eigenvalues O
of O
some O
derived O
matrices O
. O

The O
formulation O
and O
results O
provide O
a O
foundation O
for O
further O
investigation O
of O
this O
technique O
. O

The O
probabilistic O
theory O
of O
information O
retrieval O
involves O
the O
construction O
of O
mathematical O
models O
based O
on O
statistical O
assumptions O
of O
various O
sorts O
. O

One O
of O

in O
this O
kind O
of O
theory O
construction O

the O
assumptions O
laid O
down O
may O
be O
inconsistent O
with O
the O
data O
to O
which O

. O

Another O

may O
not O

assumptions O
on O
which O
the O
derived O
modelling O
equations O
or O

are O

based O
. O

Both O
kinds O
of O
error O
have O
been O
made O
repeatedly O
in O

on O
probabilistic O

. O

that O
the O

of O
certain O

IR O

the O
so O
- O
called O
‘ O
binary O

model O
, O
has O
been O

. O

- O

- O
box O

- O

. O

It O

a O

of O

of O
the O
state O
- O

- O

- O

. O

It O

- O

- O

of O

. O

Five O
categories O
are O
identified O
: O
use O
of O
loose O
analogies O
and O

between O
concepts O
in O
quantum O
physics O
and O
library O
/ O
information O
science O
; O
use O
of O
quantum O
concepts O
and O
formalisms O
in O
information O

; O

of O

concepts O
and O

in O

and O

have O

in O
information O

less O

. O

. O

and O

Solid O
state O
disks O
( O
SSDs O
) O
can O
potentially O
eliminate O
the O
I O
/ O
O O
bottleneck O
for O
many O
conventional O
applications O
. O

However O
, O
they O
have O
a O
very O
unique O
characteristic O
of O
erase O
- O
before O
- O
write O
, O
which O
probably O
makes O
existing O
index O
maintenance O
methods O
inapplicable O
to O
SSDs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
Hybrid O
Merge O
, O
a O
new O
online O
index O
maintenance O
strategy O
for O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
which O
applies O
SSDs O
instead O
of O
hard O
disk O
drives O
( O
HDDs O
) O
to O
store O
inverted O
indexes O
. O

We O
analyze O
the O
existing O
indexing O
methods O
through O
experiments O
, O
and O
design O
a O
new O
merge O
- O
based O
indexing O
method O
with O
no O
random O
writes O
. O

We O
try O
to O
take O
the O
full O
advantage O
of O
the O
SSD O
's O
fast O
random O
reads O
to O
overcome O
the O
defects O
of O
existing O
methods O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
improves O
indexing O
and O
query O
performance O
with O
extremely O
low O
write O
traffic O
compare O
to O
existing O
approaches O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
is O
concerned O
with O
the O
problem O
of O
question O
search O
. O

In O
question O
search O
, O
given O
a O
question O
as O
query O
, O
we O
are O
to O
return O
questions O
semantically O
equivalent O
or O
close O
to O
the O
queried O
question O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
conduct O
question O
search O
by O
identifying O
question O
topic O
and O
question O
focus O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
we O
first O
summarize O
questions O
in O
a O
data O
structure O
consisting O
of O
question O
topic O
and O
question O
focus O
. O

Then O
we O
model O
question O
topic O
and O
question O
focus O
in O
a O
language O
modeling O
framework O
for O
search O
. O

We O
also O
propose O
to O
use O
the O
MDLbased O
tree O
cut O
model O
for O
identifying O
question O
topic O
and O
question O
focus O
automatically O
. O

Experimental O
results O
indicate O
that O
our O
approach O
of O
identifying O
question O
topic O
and O
question O
focus O
for O
search O
significantly O
outperforms O
the O
baseline O
methods O
such O
as O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
( O
VSM O
) O
and O
Language O
Model O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
LMIR O
) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
CRM O
( O
Customer O
Relationship O
Management O
) O
contains O
3 O
modules O
, O
Marketing O
, O
Sales O
, O
and O
Support O
, O
which O
rely O
on O
the O
customer O
relationship O
and O
profiling O
information O
. O

While O
the O
information O
contained O
in O
those O
3 O
modules O
is O
input O
by O
operator O
, O
it O
will O
be O
prudent O
to O
gather O
much O
more O
information O
from O
the O
Internet O
. O

We O
can O
find O
relationship O
between O
customers O
and O
find O
their O
profile O
from O
the O
Internet O
. O

This O
information O
can O
be O
used O
to O
enrich O
and O
direct O
the O
CRM O
to O
perform O
better O
in O
supporting O
the O
business O
objectives O
. O

Gathering O
information O
from O
the O
Internet O
means O
that O
we O
need O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
that O
involve O
many O
sources O
from O
Internet O
, O
such O
as O
social O
media O
, O
net O
blog O
, O
and O
news O
. O

This O
research O
provides O
the O
model O
of O
data O
mining O
utilization O
in O
traditional O
CRM O
to O
become O
social O
CRM O
. O

This O
research O
contributes O
for O
CRM O
enhancement O
where O
customer O
centric O
application O
becomes O
automated O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Simple O
representations O
of O
documents O
based O
on O
the O
occurrences O
of O
terms O
are O
ubiquitous O
in O
areas O
like O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
and O
also O
frequent O
in O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
propose O
a O
logical O
- O
probabilistic O
approach O
to O
the O
analysis O
of O
natural O
language O
text O
based O
in O
the O
concept O
of O
Uncertain O
Conditional O
, O
on O
top O
of O
a O
formulation O
of O
lexical O
measurements O
inspired O
in O
the O
theoretical O
concept O
of O
ideal O
quantum O
measurements O
. O

The O
proposed O
concept O
can O
be O
used O
for O
generating O
topic O
- O
specific O
representations O
of O
text O
, O
aiming O
to O
match O
in O
a O
simple O
way O
the O
perception O
of O
a O
user O
with O
a O
pre O
- O
established O
idea O
of O
what O
the O
usage O
of O
terms O
in O
the O
text O
should O
be O
. O

A O
simple O
example O
is O
developed O
with O
two O
versions O
of O
a O
text O
in O
two O
languages O
, O
showing O
how O
regularities O
in O

use O
of O
terms O
are O

and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Data O
fusion O
is O
the O
process O
of O
combining O
the O
output O
of O
a O
number O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
algorithms O
into O
a O
single O
result O
set O
, O
to O
achieve O
greater O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

ProbFuse O
is O
a O
data O
fusion O
algorithm O
that O
uses O
the O
history O
of O
the O
underlying O
IR O
algorithms O
to O
estimate O
the O
probability O
that O
subsequent O
result O
sets O
include O
relevant O
documents O
in O
particular O
positions O
. O

It O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
out O
- O
perform O
CombMNZ O
, O
the O
standard O
data O
fusion O
algorithm O
against O
which O
to O
compare O
performance O
, O
in O
a O
number O
of O
previous O
experiments O
. O

This O
paper O
builds O
upon O
this O
previous O
work O
and O
applies O
probFuse O
to O
the O
much O
larger O
Web O
Track O
document O
collection O
from O
the O
2004 O
Text O
REtreival O
Conference O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
probFuse O
is O
compared O
against O
that O
of O
CombMNZ O
using O
a O
number O
of O
evaluation O
measures O
and O
is O
shown O
to O
achieve O
substantial O
performance O
improvements O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Discriminative O
models O
have O
been O
preferred O
over O
generative O
models O
in O
many O
machine O
learning O
problems O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
owing O
to O
some O
of O
their O
attractive O
theoretical O
properties O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
explore O
the O
applicability O
of O
discriminative O
classifiers O
for O
IR O
. O

We O
have O
compared O
the O
performance O
of O
two O
popular O
discriminative O
models O
, O
namely O
the O
maximum O
entropy O
model O
and O
support O
vector O
machines O
with O
that O
of O
language O
modeling O
, O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
generative O
model O
for O
IR O
. O

Our O
experiments O
on O
ad O
- O
hoc O
retrieval O
indicate O
that O
although O
maximum O
entropy O
is O
significantly O
worse O
than O
language O
models O
, O
support O
vector O
machines O
are O
on O
par O
with O
language O
models O
. O

We O
argue O
that O
the O
main O
reason O
to O
prefer O
SVMs O
over O
language O
models O
is O
their O
ability O
to O
learn O
arbitrary O
features O
automatically O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
our O
experiments O
on O
the O
home O
- O
page O
finding O
task O
of O
TREC-10 O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
characteristics O
of O
different O
corpora O
influence O
the O
success O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
NLP O
methods O
. O

How O
to O
best O
characterise O
a O
corpus O
is O
still O
an O
unexplored O
research O
area O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
use O
a O
model O
that O
has O
so O
far O
been O
applied O
for O
user O
profiling O
in O
Information O
Filtering O
, O
to O
profile O
the O
corpora O
of O
the O
TIPSTER O
collection O
. O

Each O
corpus O
profile O
is O
a O
network O
of O
terms O
that O
allows O
the O
extraction O
of O
a O
series O
of O
statistical O
features O
. O

These O
features O
can O
be O
used O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarity O
between O
the O
corpora O
in O
TIPSTER O
. O

This O
is O
part O
of O
ongoing O
work O
that O
aims O
at O
providing O
a O
corpus O
profiling O
service O
that O
will O
map O
corpora O
to O
their O
features O
and O
to O
the O
corresponding O
experimental O
results O
of O
various O
models O
and O
techniques O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
method O
for O
measuring O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
of O
texts O
, O
using O
corpus O
- O
based O
and O
knowledge O
- O
based O
measures O
of O
similarity O
. O

Previous O
work O
on O
this O
problem O
has O
focused O
mainly O
on O
either O
large O
documents O
( O
e.g. O
text O
classification O
, O
information O
retrieval O
) O
or O
individual O
words O
( O
e.g. O
synonymy O
tests O

Given O
that O
a O
large O
fraction O
of O
the O
information O
available O
today O
, O
on O
the O
Web O
and O
elsewhere O
, O
consists O
of O
short O
text O
snippets O
( O
e.g. O
abstracts O
of O
scientific O
documents O
, O
imagine O
captions O
, O
product O
descriptions O
in O
this O
paper O
we O
focus O
on O
measuring O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
of O
short O
texts O
. O

Through O
experiments O
performed O
on O
a O
paraphrase O
data O
set O
, O
we O
show O
that O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
method O
outperforms O
methods O
based O
on O
simple O
lexical O
matching O
, O
resulting O
in O
up O
to O
13 O
% O
error O
rate O
reduction O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
traditional O
vector O
- O
based O
similarity O
metric O
. O

of O

( O

RetrievAl O
for O

- O

, O
to O

to O
