-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
growing O
amount O
of O
on O
- O
line O
information O
and O
its O
dynamic O
nature O
, O
users O
' O
burden O
of O
retrieving O
information O
has O
become O
heavier O
and O
existing O
passive O
working O
is O
too O
inefficient O
to O
meet O
users O
' O
needs O
. O

An O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
model O
based O
on O
multi O
- O
agent O
paradigm O
and O
conceptual O
graphs O
is O
proposed O
. O

The O
model O
( O
IIR O
agent O
) O
has O
two O
layers O
of O
group O
agent O
and O
personal O
agent O
. O

Subagents O
of O
the O
IIR O
agent O
are O
also O
identified O
so O
that O
they O
can O
be O
designed O
and O
implemented O
separately O
. O

The O
system O
represents O
queries O
and O
documents O
in O
conceptual O
graph O
( O
CG O
which O
brings O
semantic O
in O
some O
functions O
, O
such O
as O
intelligent O
search O
, O
auto O
- O
notification O
, O
navigation O
guide O
and O
personal O
information O
management O
. O

CG O
- O
based O
model O
improves O
ranking O
of O
documents O
returned O
from O
WWW O
search O
engines O
and O
makes O
passive O
working O
mode O
more O
efficient O


-DOCSTART- O

During O
unexpected O
events O
such O
as O
natural O
disasters O
, O
individuals O
rely O
on O
the O
information O
generated O
by O
news O
outlets O
to O
form O
their O
understanding O
of O
these O
events O
. O

This O
information O
, O
while O
often O
voluminous O
, O
is O
frequently O
degraded O
by O
the O
inclusion O
of O
unimportant O
, O
duplicate O
, O
or O
wrong O
information O
. O

It O
is O
important O
to O
be O
able O
to O
present O
users O
with O
only O
the O
novel O
, O
important O
information O
about O
these O
events O
as O
they O
develop O
. O

We O
present O
the O
problem O
of O
updating O
users O
about O
time O
critical O
news O
events O
, O
and O
focus O
on O
the O
task O
of O
deciding O
which O
information O
to O
select O
for O
updating O
users O
as O
an O
event O
develops O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
solution O
to O
this O
problem O
which O
incorporates O
techniques O
from O
information O
retrieval O
and O
multi O
- O
document O
summarization O
and O
evaluate O
this O
approach O
on O
a O
set O
of O
historic O
events O
using O
a O
large O
stream O
of O
news O
documents O
. O

We O
also O
introduce O
an O
evaluation O
method O
which O
is O
significantly O
less O
expensive O
than O
traditional O
approaches O
to O
temporal O
summarization O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
case O
study O
of O
the O
development O
of O
an O
interface O
to O
a O
novel O

retrieval O
: O
searching O
for O
texts O
written O
in O
foreign O
languages O
based O
on O
native O
language O
queries O
. O

Although O
the O
underlying O
technology O
for O
achieving O
such O
a O
search O
is O
relatively O
well O
understood O
, O
the O
appropriate O
interface O
design O
is O
not O
. O

A O
study O
involving O
users O
( O
with O
such O
searching O
needs O
) O
from O
the O
start O
of O
the O
design O
process O
is O
described O
covering O
initial O
examination O
of O
user O
needs O
and O
tasks O
; O
preliminary O
design O
and O
testing O
of O
interface O
components O
; O
building O
, O
testing O
, O
and O
further O
refining O
an O
interface O
; O
before O
finally O
conducting O
usability O
tests O
of O
the O
system O
. O

Lessons O
are O
learned O
at O
every O
stage O
of O
the O
process O
leading O
to O
a O
much O
more O
informed O
view O
of O
how O
such O
an O
interface O
should O
be O
built O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Newspapers O
, O
travel O
narratives O
, O
blogs O
, O
books O
and O
the O
Internet O
hold O
a O
huge O
amount O
of O
geographic O
information O
that O
can O
be O
extracted O
in O
order O
to O
provide O
visual O
exploration O
. O

Also O
, O
the O
understanding O
of O
place O
references O
involves O
knowledge O
of O
the O
document O
context O
. O

In O
this O
way O
, O
the O
study O
of O
tools O
for O
disambiguation O
is O
needed O
. O

For O
the O
automatic O
annotation O
of O
time O
and O
location O
, O
both O
shared O
world O
knowledge O
and O
document O
context O
needs O
to O
be O
captured O
. O

This O
paper O
is O
centered O
on O
analyzing O
online O
unstructured O
documents O
: O
travel O
narratives O
and O
online O
newspapers O
. O

Our O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
the O
exploration O
of O
tools O
able O
to O
make O
automatically O
the O
disambiguation O
of O
placenames O
. O

In O
this O
case O
, O
we O
have O
used O
a O
Geoparsing O
Web O
Service O
to O
extract O
geographic O
coordinates O
from O
the O
online O
unstructured O
documents O
. O

Once O
geographic O
coordinates O
are O
extracted O
by O
using O
eXtensible O
Markup O
Language O
( O
XML O
) O
we O
draw O
the O
geo O
- O
positions O
and O
link O
documents O
into O
a O
map O
image O
in O
order O
to O
visualize O
textual O
information O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Recent O
advances O
in O
commercial O
conversational O
services O
that O
allow O
naturally O
spoken O
and O
typed O
interaction O
, O
particularly O
for O
well O
- O
formulated O
questions O
and O
commands O
, O
have O
increased O
the O
need O
for O
more O
human O
- O
centric O
interactions O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
First O
International O
Workshop O
on O
Conversational O
Approaches O
to O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CAIR`17 O
) O
brings O
together O

and O

to O
create O
a O
forum O
for O
research O
on O
conversational O
approaches O
to O
search O
. O

A O
specific O
focus O
is O
on O
techniques O
that O
support O
complex O
and O
multi O
- O
turn O
user O
- O
machine O
dialogues O
for O
information O
access O
and O
retrieval O
, O
and O
multi O
- O
model O
interfaces O
for O
interacting O
with O
such O
systems O
. O

We O
invite O
submissions O
addressing O
all O
modalities O
of O
conversation O
, O
including O
speech O
- O
based O
, O
text O
- O
based O
, O
and O

. O

We O
also O

of O

- O

( O

) O

can O

of O

, O
and O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
k O
nearest O
neighbor O
( O
kNN O
) O
search O
on O
road O
networks O
is O
an O
important O
function O
in O
web O
mapping O
services O
. O

These O
services O
are O
now O
dealing O
with O
rapidly O
arriving O
queries O
, O
that O
are O
issued O
by O
a O
massive O
amount O
of O
users O
. O

While O
overlay O
graph O
- O
based O
indices O
can O
answer O
shortest O
path O
queries O
efficiently O
, O
there O
have O
been O
no O
studies O
on O
utilizing O
such O
indices O
to O
answer O
kNN O
queries O
efficiently O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
fill O
this O
research O
gap O
and O
present O
two O
efficient O
kNN O
search O
solutions O
on O
overlay O
graph O
- O
based O
indices O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
solutions O
offer O
very O
low O
query O
latency O
( O
0.1 O
ms O
) O
and O
require O
only O
small O
index O
sizes O
, O
even O
for O
10-million O
- O
node O
networks O
. O

Matching O
is O
the O

and O

problem O
, O

the O

that O

aspects O

of O

. O

In O
this O
domain O

or O

strings O
called O
“ O
Pattern O
” O
is O
to O
be O
searched O
within O
a O
well O
- O
built O
string O
or O
“ O
Text O

matching O
strategies O
or O

provide O
key O

in O

. O

Activity O
recognition O
in O
smart O
environments O
and O
healthcare O
systems O
is O
gaining O
increasing O
interest O
. O

Several O
approaches O
are O
proposed O
to O
recognize O
activities O
namely O
intrusive O
and O
non O
- O
intrusive O
approaches O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
new O
fully O
non O
- O
intrusive O
approach O
for O
recognition O
of O
Activities O
of O
Daily O
Living O
( O
ADLs O
) O
in O
smart O
environments O
. O

Our O
approach O
treats O
the O
activity O
recognition O
process O
as O
an O
information O
retrieval O
problem O
in O
which O
ADLs O
are O
represented O
as O
hierarchical O
models O
, O
and O
patterns O
associated O
to O
these O
ADLs O
models O
are O
generated O
. O

A O
search O
process O
for O
these O
patterns O
is O
applied O
on O
the O
sequences O
of O
activities O
recorded O
when O
users O
perform O
their O
daily O
activities O
. O

We O
show O
through O
experiments O
on O
real O
datasets O
recorded O
in O
real O
smart O
home O
how O
our O
approach O
accurately O
recognizes O
activities O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Optical O
music O
recognition O
( O
OMR O
) O
serves O
as O
one O
of O
the O
key O
technologies O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
by O
mining O
symbolic O
knowledge O
directly O
from O
images O
of O
scores O
. O

A O
fullfledged O
OMR O
system O
encompasses O
both O
image O
recognition O
and O
music O
interpretation O
to O
convert O
image O
data O
to O
symbolic O
representations O
. O

This O
process O
has O
proved O
to O
be O
remarkably O
challenging O
, O
so O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
OMR O
systems O
still O
leave O
much O
to O
be O
desired O
. O

The O
development O
of O
deep O
learning O
in O
recent O
years O
has O
brought O
great O
success O
in O
different O
domains O
, O
e.g. O
object O
recognition O
and O
scene O
understanding O
, O
and O
aroused O
researcher O
’s O
interest O
to O
address O
unsolved O
problems O
with O
this O
new O
tool O
. O

Other O
work O
has O
introduced O
the O
first O
attempts O
of O
using O
deep O
learning O
to O
address O
OMR O
, O
but O
the O
models O
apply O
more O
appropriately O
to O
text O
than O
music O
scores O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
hybrid O
model O
that O
combines O
the O
power O
of O
Hidden O
Markov O
Models O
( O
HMM O
) O
and O
Recurrent O
Neural O
Networks O
( O
RNN O
) O
for O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
score O
recognition O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
an O
information O
filtering O
system O
for O
documents O
by O
a O
user O
profile O
using O
latent O
semantics O
obtained O
by O
singular O
value O
decomposition O
( O
SVD O
) O
and O
independent O
component O
analysis O
( O
ICA O
In O
information O
filtering O
systems O
, O
it O
is O
useful O
to O
analyze O
the O
latent O
semantics O
of O
documents O
. O

ICA O
is O
one O
method O
to O
analyze O
the O
latent O
semantics O
. O

We O
assume O
that O
topics O
are O
independent O
of O
each O
other O
. O

Hence O
, O
when O
ICA O
is O
applied O
to O
documents O
, O
we O
obtain O
the O
topics O
included O
in O
the O
documents O
. O

By O
using O
SVD O
remove O
noises O
before O
applying O
ICA O
, O
we O
can O
improve O
the O
accuracy O
of O
topic O
extraction O
. O

By O
representation O
of O
the O
documents O
with O
those O
topics O
, O
we O
improve O
recommendations O
by O
the O
user O
profile O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
we O
construct O
a O
user O
profile O
with O
a O
genetic O
algorithm O
( O
GA O
) O
and O
evaluate O
it O
by O
11-point O
average O
precision O
. O

We O
carried O
out O
an O
experiment O
using O
a O
test O
collection O
to O
confirm O
the O
advantages O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
is O
largely O
based O
on O
descriptors O
computed O
from O
audio O
signals O
, O
and O
in O
many O
practical O
applications O
they O
are O
to O
be O
computed O
on O
music O
corpora O
containing O
audio O
files O
encoded O
in O
a O
variety O
of O
lossy O
formats O
. O

Such O
encodings O
distort O
the O
original O
signal O
and O
therefore O
may O
affect O
the O
computation O
of O
descriptors O
. O

This O
raises O
the O
question O
of O
the O
robustness O
of O
these O
descriptors O
across O
various O
audio O
encodings O
. O

We O
examine O
this O
assumption O
for O
the O
case O
of O
MFCCs O
and O
chroma O
features O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
analyze O
their O
robustness O
to O
sampling O
rate O
, O
codec O
, O
bitrate O
, O
frame O
size O
and O
music O
genre O
. O

Using O
two O
different O
audio O
analysis O
tools O
over O
a O
diverse O
collection O
of O
music O
tracks O
, O
we O
compute O
several O
statistics O
to O
quantify O
the O
robustness O
of O
the O
resulting O
descriptors O
, O
and O
then O
estimate O
the O
practical O
effects O
for O
a O
sample O
task O
like O
genre O
classification O
. O

The O
paper O
proposes O
an O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
based O
on O
the O
use O
of O
a O
structure O
( O
ontology O
) O
both O
for O
document O
( O
resp O
. O

query O
) O
indexing O
and O
query O
evaluating O
. O

The O
conceptual O
structure O
is O
hierarchical O
and O
it O
encodes O
the O
knowledge O
of O
the O
topical O
domain O
of O
the O
considered O
documents O
. O

It O
is O
formally O
represented O
as O
a O
tree O
. O

In O
this O
approach O
, O
the O
query O
evaluation O
is O
based O
on O
the O
comparison O
of O
minimal O
sub O
- O
trees O
containing O
the O

of O

to O

. O

The O

the O

of O
a O

of O

of O
the O
query O
tree O
in O

document O
tree O
. O

Experiments O
undertaken O
on O
MuchMore O
benchmark O
showed O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
approach O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Though O
lattice O
- O
based O
information O
representation O
has O
the O
advantage O
of O
providing O
efficient O
visual O
interface O
over O
textual O
display O
, O
the O
complexity O
of O
a O
lattice O
may O
grow O
rapidly O
with O
the O
size O
of O
the O
database O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
formally O
draw O
the O
analogy O
between O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
and O
Concept O
Lattice O
, O
from O
which O
we O
introduce O
the O
notion O
of O
Term O
- O
Document O
Lattice O
as O
a O
model O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
then O
propose O
to O
use O
the O
idea O
of O
quotient O
lattice O
to O
reduce O
the O
complexity O
of O
a O
Term O
- O
Document O
Lattice O
. O

The O
equivalence O
relation O
required O
to O
construct O
the O
quotient O
lattice O
is O
obtained O
by O
performing O
a O
Singular O
Value O
Decomposition O
on O
the O
original O
term O
- O
document O
matrix O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
extended O
vector O
space O
model O
, O
each O
document O
vector O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
subvectors O
representing O
the O
multiple O
concepts O
or O
concept O
classes O
present O
in O
the O
document O
. O

Typical O
information O
concepts O
, O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
usual O
content O
terms O
or O
descriptors O
, O
include O
author O
names O
, O
bibliographic O
links O
italic O
> O
etc O
italic O
> O

The O
extended O
vector O
space O
model O
is O
known O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

However O
, O
a O
major O
impediment O
to O
the O
use O
of O
the O
extended O
model O
is O
the O
construction O
of O
an O
extended O
query O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
method O
for O
automatically O
extending O
a O
query O
containing O
only O
content O
terms O
( O
a O
single O
concept O
class O
) O
to O
a O
representation O
containing O
multiple O
concept O
classes O
. O

No O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
involved O
. O

Experiments O
using O
the O
CACM O
collection O
resulted O
in O
an O
average O
precision O
34 O
% O
better O
than O
that O
obtained O
using O
the O
standard O
single O
- O
concept O
term O
vector O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

There O
has O
recently O
been O
an O
upsurge O
of O
interest O
in O
document O
genres O
the O
fusion O
of O
form O
and O
function O
that O
makes O
a O
document O
instantly O
recognizable O
to O
its O
community O
of O
users O
. O

The O
utility O
of O

identification O
is O
now O
accepted O
as O
a O
premise O
, O
but O
many O
interesting O
and O
challenging O
questions O
remain O
. O

The O
papers O
assembled O
here O
create O
a O
truly O
interdisciplinary O
body O
of O
work O
, O
drawing O
on O
literary O
and O
communication O
theories O
, O
library O
and O
information O
science O
, O
natural O
language O
processing O
, O
writing O
, O
and O
machine O
learning O
, O

others O
. O

One O
of O
the O
most O
challenging O
aspects O
of O
research O
in O

is O
to O
create O
a O
rigorous O
yet O

of O

document O

will O
reflect O

and O
properties O
, O

well O

their O
communicative O
role O
as O
embedded O
in O
a O
particular O

of O
discourse O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
our O
English O
- O
Chinese O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
system O
. O

We O
focus O
our O
attention O
on O
finding O
effective O
translation O
equivalents O
between O

and O
Chinese O
, O
and O

the O

. O

. O

of O
different O
entities O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
tagging O
of O
Named O
Entities O
( O
NE O
the O
names O
of O
particular O
things O
or O
classes O
and O
numeric O
expressions O
, O
is O
regarded O
as O
an O
important O
component O
technology O
for O
many O

applications O
. O

These O
applications O
include O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
from O
which O
it O
was O
born O
, O
QuestionAnswering O
, O
Summarization O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

However O
, O
up O
to O
now O
, O
the O
number O
of O
NE O
types O
has O
been O
quite O
limited O
, O
7 O
in O
MUC O
, O
8 O
in O
IREX O
and O
5 O
in O
the O
ACE O
program O
. O

Many O
more O
kinds O
of O
things O
have O
proper O
names O
or O
proper O
classes O
of O
expressions O
, O
and O
also O

-DOCSTART- O

Mobile O
navigation O
is O
a O
frequently O
used O
application O
, O
especially O
with O
the O
increasing O
proliferation O
of O
online O

data O
. O

However O
, O
the O
origin O
and O
destination O
are O
often O
private O
information O
closely O
tied O
to O
a O
user O
’s O
personal O
life O
. O

Sharing O
thosewith O
an O
onlinemap O
provider O
greatly O
increases O
the O

of O

user O
being O
profiled O
. O

to O

and O

. O

Information O

( O

) O
techniques O
without O
disclosing O
the O
origin O
or O
the O
destination O
. O

We O
analyze O
the O
cost O
associated O
with O
this O
approach O
and O
propose O
a O
practical O
solution O
with O
the O
assumption O
of O
a O
semi O
- O
honest O
third O
party O
to O
improve O
the O
efficiency O
. O

The O
proposed O

solution O
only O
introduces O
encryption O
overhead O
over O
the O
plain O
scenario O
where O
the O
path O
is O
returned O
by O
knowing O
the O
origin O
and O
destination O

Variability O
of O
semantic O
expression O
is O
a O
fundamental O
phenomenon O
of O
a O
natural O
language O
where O
same O
meaning O
can O
be O
expressed O
by O
different O
texts O
. O

Natural O
Language O
Processing O
applications O
like O
Question O
Answering O
, O
Summarization O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
etc O
. O

often O
demand O
a O
generic O
framework O
to O
capture O
major O
semantic O
inferences O
in O
order O
to O
deal O
with O
the O
challenges O
created O
by O
this O
phenomenon O
. O

Textual O
Entailment O
can O
provide O
such O
framework O
. O

Textual O
Entailment O
can O
be O
defined O
as O
the O
phenomenon O
of O
inferring O
a O
text O
from O
another O
. O

Entailment O
is O
a O
directional O
relation O
between O
two O
texts O
. O

This O
relation O
holds O
when O
the O
truth O
of O
one O
text O
fragment O
follows O
from O
the O
truth O
of O
the O
other O
. O

Conventionally O
, O
the O
entailing O
fragment O
is O
called O
as O
text O
and O
entailed O
one O
is O
called O
as O
hypothesis O
. O

Textual O
entailment O
is O
classically O
defined O
as O
: O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
MUMIS O
project O
, O
which O

ontology O
based O

of O

Retrieval O
in O

. O

It O
makes O
use O
of O
a O

specific O
ontology O
, O
multilingual O

and O

algorithms O
to O
automatically O
create O
a O

of O
sources O
. O

The O

is O

of O

algorithm O
that O

to O

an O
integrated O
, O
more O
complete O
, O
annotation O
of O
the O
material O
. O

This O

and O
unification O
process O
uses O
ontology O
based O
reasoning O
and O
scenarios O
which O
are O

from O

sources O
. O

The O

and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O

the O

problem O
of O

process O
. O

solution O
called O
EIL O
( O

) O

of O

selling O

services O
. O

EIL O
leverages O
structured O
and O
unstructured O
data O
using O
novel O
architecture O
and O
special O
purpose O

. O

Our O

to O

around O

( O

a O
sale O
and O

concept O

. O

We O
experimentally O

for O

in O

. O

currently O

in O

of O

units O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
techniques O
play O
a O
critical O
role O
in O
the O
development O
of O
the O
information O
systems O
. O

Different O
searches O
have O
focused O
on O
the O
way O
of O
improving O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

Query O
expansion O
via O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
a O
good O
technique O
that O
proved O
to O
be O
a O
good O
way O
to O
improve O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
investigate O
new O
methods O
to O
improve O
the O
query O
reformulation O
process O
. O

A O
two O
step O
process O
is O
employed O
to O
reformulate O
query O
. O

In O
a O
preliminary O
step O
, O
a O
local O
set O
of O
documents O
is O
built O
from O
the O
retrieved O
result O
. O

In O
a O
second O
step O
, O
a O
co O
- O
occurrence O
analysis O
is O
performed O
on O
the O
local O
document O
set O
to O
deduce O
the O
terms O
to O
be O
used O
for O
the O
query O
expansion O
. O

To O
build O
the O
local O
set O
we O
use O
firstly O
a O
content O
- O
based O
analysis O
. O

It O
is O
a O
similarity O
study O
between O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
and O
the O
query O
. O

The O
second O
method O
combines O
content O
and O
hypertext O
analyses O
to O
achieve O
the O
local O
set O
construction O
. O

The O
TREC O
frame O
is O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
proposed O
processes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
evaluation O
is O
an O
important O
but O
difficult O
part O
of O
information O
retrieval O
system O
design O
and O
experimentation O
, O
evaluation O
questions O
have O
been O
the O
subject O
of O
much O
research O
. O

An O
“ O
evaluation O
study O
” O
is O
an O
investigation O
into O
some O
aspect O
of O
evaluation O
. O

These O
types O
of O
studies O
typically O
experiment O
on O
ranked O
results O
from O
actual O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
most O
often O
those O
that O
were O
submitted O
to O
TREC O
tracks O
. O

We O
argue O
that O
the O
standard O
of O
evidence O
in O
these O
types O
of O
studies O
should O
be O
increased O
to O
the O
level O
required O
of O
text O
retrieval O
studies O
, O
by O
testing O
on O
multiple O
data O
sets O
, O
multiple O
subsets O
of O
data O
, O
and O
comparison O
to O
baselines O
using O
hypothesis O
testing O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
that O
baseline O
performance O
on O
the O
standard O
data O
sets O
is O
quite O
high O
, O
necessitating O
strong O
evidence O
to O
support O
claims O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Query O
expansion O
adds O
related O
words O
to O
a O
user O
query O
in O
order O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
results O
. O

It O
’s O
an O
important O
step O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Most O
of O
current O
query O
expansion O
methods O
pay O
attention O
to O
specific O
expansion O
strategies O
or O
algorithms O
, O
while O
neglecting O
the O
query O
itself O
. O

In O
reaction O
to O
the O
phenomenon O
, O
a O
multistrategy O
query O
expansion O
method O
based O
on O
semantics O
was O
proposed O
. O

This O
method O
started O
by O
analyzing O
the O
semantic O
structure O
of O
user O
query O
, O
and O
adopted O
corresponding O
strategy O
to O
select O
expansion O
terms O
. O

The O
expansion O
words O
are O
derived O
from O
three O
parts O
: O
WordNet O
, O
massive O
web O
page O
set O
and O
search O
engine O
performance O
evaluation O
data O
, O
which O
were O
merged O
semantically O
in O
each O
expansion O
algorithm O
later O
. O

The O
experiment O
showed O
this O
method O
can O
improve O
retrieval O
results O
to O
some O
extent O
. O

Subject O
Categories O
and O
Descriptors O
H.3.3 O

[ O
Information O
Search O
and O
Retrieval O
Query O
Formulation O
: O
I.2.7 O
[ O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
] O

General O
Terms O
: O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Query O
Expansion O

topics O
with O
a O
real O
- O
world O
impact O
for O

users O
, O
advertisers O
and O
publishers O
. O

The O
AIRWeb O
workshop O
will O
bring O
researchers O
and O
practitioners O
in O
these O
areas O
together O
, O
to O
present O
and O
discuss O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
techniques O
as O
well O
as O
real O
- O
world O

. O

Given O

engine O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
large O
amount O
of O
data O
is O
present O
on O
the O
web O
. O

It O
contains O
huge O
number O
of O
web O
pages O
and O
to O
find O
suitable O
information O
from O
them O
is O
very O
cumbersome O
task O
. O

There O
is O
need O
to O
organize O
data O
in O
formal O
manner O
so O
that O
user O
can O
easily O
access O
and O
use O
them O
. O

To O
retrieve O
information O
from O
documents O
, O
we O
have O
many O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
. O

Current O
IR O
techniques O
are O
not O
so O
advanced O
that O
they O
can O
be O
able O
to O
exploit O
semantic O
knowledge O
within O
documents O
and O
give O
precise O
results O
. O

IR O
technology O
is O
major O
factor O
responsible O
for O
handling O
annotations O
in O
Semantic O
Web O
( O
SW O
) O
languages O
and O
in O
the O
present O
paper O
knowledgeable O
representation O
languages O
used O
for O
retrieving O
information O
are O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traceability O
Link O
Recovery O
( O
TLR O
) O
is O
an O
important O
software O
engineering O
task O
in O
which O
a O
stakeholder O
establishes O
links O
between O
related O
items O
in O
two O
sets O
of O
software O
artifacts O
. O

Most O
existing O
approaches O
leverage O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
, O
and O
formulate O
the O
TLR O
task O
as O
a O
retrieval O
problem O
, O
where O
pairs O
of O
similar O
artifacts O
are O
retrieved O
and O
presented O
to O
a O
user O
. O

These O
approaches O
still O
require O
significant O
human O
effort O
, O
as O
a O
stakeholder O
needs O
to O
manually O
inspect O
the O
list O
of O
recommendations O
and O
decide O
which O
ones O
are O
true O
links O
and O
which O
ones O
are O
false O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
aim O
to O
automate O
TLR O
by O
re O
- O
imagining O
it O
as O
a O
binary O
classification O
problem O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
our O
machine O
learning O
classification O
approach O
is O
able O
to O
automatically O
classify O
each O
link O
in O
the O
set O
of O
all O
potential O
links O
as O
either O
valid O
or O
invalid O
, O
therefore O
circumventing O
the O
substantial O
human O
effort O
required O
by O
existing O
techniques O
. O

This O
paper O
discusses O
the O
importance O
of O
part O
- O
order O
- O
preservation O
in O
shape O
matching O
. O

A O
part O
descriptor O
is O
introduced O
that O
supports O
both O
preserving O
and O

the O
order O
of O
parts O
. O

The O
evaluation O
shows O
that O
retrieval O
results O
are O
improved O
by O
almost O
38 O
% O
if O
the O
original O
ordering O
is O
preserved O
. O

a O

to O

for O

of O
a O
system O
which O

multi O
- O

processing O
when O
specific O
domain O

is O
required O
. O

The O
system O
is O
based O
on O
a O
multilingual O
ontology O
, O
which O
can O
improve O
both O
translation O
and O
retrieval O
accuracy O
and O
effectiveness O
. O

The O
proposed O
framework O
allows O
mapping O
data O
and O
metadata O
among O
language O
- O

ontologies O
in O
the O
Cultural O
Heritage O
( O
CH O
) O

. O

The O

of O

resources O
, O
as O

by O
recent O

like O

and O

is O
closely O

to O
the O

of O

which O
enable O
the O

of O
multilingual O
complexity O
. O

between O

systems O
can O
be O
achieved O
only O
by O
means O
of O
an O
accurate O
multi O
- O

processing O
, O
which O
leads O
to O
a O
more O
effective O
information O
extraction O
and O
semantic O
search O
and O
an O
improved O
translation O
quality O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

SCALIR O
is O
a O
legal O
information O
retrieval O
system O
which O
uses O
a O
combination O
of O
symbolic O
and O
connectionist O
artificial O
intelligence O
techniques O
. O

Traditional O
systems O
used O
for O
automating O
legal O
research O
have O
many O
difficulties O
which O
make O
them O
8220;brittle&#8221 O
SCALIR O
is O
an O
attempt O
to O
rectify O
many O
of O
these O
problems O
. O

SCALIR O
's O
hybrid O
nature O
is O
especially O
appropriate O
for O
the O
legal O
domain O
, O
which O
requires O
both O
logical O
and O
associative O
inferences O
. O

The O
system O
also O
benefits O
from O
a O
unique O
direct O
- O
manipulation O
style O
interface O
and O
the O
ability O
to O
improve O
its O
performance O
based O
on O
user O
feedback O
. O

users O

in O

( O
IIR O
) O
may O
be O
a O

resource O
to O
enable O

of O

systems O
in O

in O

that O

, O

, O

to O

. O

of O

users O
in O

framework O
. O

It O
identifies O
several O

due O
to O

of O

and O

and O

program O
for O
user O

from O

to O

several O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Quickly O
understanding O
the O
content O
of O
a O
data O
source O
is O
very O
useful O
in O
several O
contexts O
. O

In O
a O
Peer O
Data O
Management O
System O
( O
PDMS O
peers O
can O
be O
semantically O
clustered O
, O
each O
cluster O
being O
represented O
by O
a O
schema O
obtained O
by O
merging O
the O
local O
schemas O
of O
the O
peers O
in O
this O
cluster O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
process O
for O
summarizing O
schemas O
of O
peers O
participating O
in O
a O
PDMS O
. O

We O
assume O
that O
all O
the O
schemas O
are O
represented O
by O
ontologies O
and O
we O
propose O
a O
summarization O
algorithm O
which O
produces O
a O
summary O
containing O
the O
maximum O
number O
of O
relevant O
concepts O
and O
the O
minimum O
number O
of O
non O
- O
relevant O
concepts O
of O
the O
initial O
ontology O
. O

The O
relevance O
of O
a O
concept O
is O
determined O
using O
the O
notions O
of O
centrality O
and O
frequency O
. O

Since O
several O
possible O
candidate O
summaries O
can O
be O
identified O
during O
the O
summarization O
process O
, O
classical O
Information O
Retrieval O
metrics O
are O
employed O
to O
determine O
the O
best O
summary O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Relevance O
feedback O
has O
a O
history O
in O
information O
retrieval O
that O
dates O
back O
well O
over O
thirty O
years O
( O
c.f O
SL96 O
Relevance O
feedback O
is O
typically O
used O
for O
query O
expansion O
during O
short O
- O
term O
modeling O
of O
a O
user O
’s O
immediate O
information O
need O
and O
for O
user O
profiling O
during O
long O
- O
term O
modeling O
of O
a O
user O
’s O
persistent O
interests O
and O
preferences O
. O

Traditional O
relevance O
feedback O
methods O
require O
that O
users O
explicitly O
give O
feedback O
by O
, O
for O
example O
, O
specifying O
keywords O
, O
selecting O
and O
marking O
documents O
, O
or O
answering O
questions O
about O
their O
interests O
. O

Such O
relevance O
feedback O
methods O
force O
users O
to O
engage O
in O
additional O
activities O
beyond O
their O
normal O
searching O
behavior O
. O

Since O
the O
cost O
to O
the O
user O
is O
high O
and O
the O
benefits O
are O
not O
always O
apparent O
, O
it O
can O
be O
difficult O
to O
collect O
the O
necessary O
data O
and O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
explicit O
techniques O
can O
be O
limited O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

To O
help O
expedite O
the O
process O
of O
constructing O
use O
case O
diagrams O
, O
a O
widely O
used O
notation O
in O
software O
engineering O
, O
we O
attempt O
to O
develop O
a O
generator O
system O
that O
can O
extract O
use O
case O
diagrams O
automatically O
from O

of O
a O
software O
requirements O
specification O
. O

The O
use O
of O
natural O
language O
processing O
techniques O
can O
greatly O
assist O
this O
process O
, O
one O
of O
which O
is O
to O
use O
syntax O
- O
driven O
semantic O
analysis O
. O

Semantic O
analysis O
can O
provide O
output O
in O
the O
form O
of O
semantic O
representations O
that O
can O
be O
used O
to O
extract O
appropriate O
use O
case O
elements O
. O

A O
set O
of O
rules O
have O
been O
developed O
to O
extract O
information O
about O
the O
elements O
of O
use O
case O
diagrams O
contained O
in O
the O
semantic O
representation O
. O

Our O
tests O
show O
that O
the O
system O
is O
able O
to O
automatically O
construct O
use O
case O
diagrams O
for O
a O
wide O
variety O
of O
linguistic O
variations O
. O

In O
a O
test O
using O
real O
- O
world O
cases O
, O
an O
average O
precision O
of O
0.7375 O
and O
recall O
of O
0.691 O
is O
obtained O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

An O
Evidence O
- O
based O
approach O
is O
using O
a O
best O
available O
evidence O
for O
making O
a O
judicious O
decision O
about O
a O
given O
set O
of O
problem O
. O

Evidence O
- O
based O
approach O
is O
an O
integration O
of O
individually O
gained O
expertise O
with O
the O
best O
possible O
evidence O
available O
from O
a O
systematic O
research O
. O

It O
started O
in O
medicine O
as O
evidence O
- O
based O
medicine O
( O
EBM O
) O
and O
is O
now O
being O
used O
in O
other O
fields O
such O
as O
nursing O
, O
psychology O
, O
education O
, O
library O
and O
information O
science O
also O
. O

Its O
basic O
principles O
are O
that O
all O
practical O
decisions O
made O
should O
1 O
) O
be O
based O
on O
research O
studies O
and O
2 O
) O
that O
these O
research O
studies O
are O
selected O
and O
interpreted O
according O
to O
some O
specific O
norms O
characteristic O
for O
Evidence O
Based O
Practice O
[ O
EBP O
Software O
draws O
its O
roots O
from O
EBM O
and O
does O
Evidence O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
performance O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O

Answering O
system O
is O
not O
satisfactory O
from O

. O

In O

to O

- O

. O

Our O
study O
shows O
: O
1 O
) O
query O
reformulation O
should O
be O
a O
necessary O
step O
to O
achieve O
a O
better O
retrieval O
performance O
; O
2 O
) O
The O
techniques O
for O

are O
also O

in O
sentence O
level O
retrieval O
, O
and O
single O
sentence O
will O
be O
the O
appropriate O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

System O
combination O
is O
an O
effective O
strategy O
to O
boost O
retrieval O
performance O
, O
especially O
in O
complex O
applications O
such O
as O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
where O
the O
aspects O
of O
translation O
and O
retrieval O
have O
to O
be O

jointly O
. O

We O
focus O
on O
machine O
learning O
- O
based O
approaches O
to O
CLIR O
that O
need O
large O
sets O
of O
relevance O
- O
ranked O
data O
to O
train O
high O
- O
dimensional O
models O
. O

We O
compare O
these O
models O
under O
various O
measures O
of O
orthogonality O
, O
and O
present O

experimental O
evaluation O
on O
two O
different O
domains O
( O
patents O
, O
Wikipedia O
) O
and O
two O
different O
language O
pairs O
( O
Japanese O
- O
English O
, O
German O
- O
English O

We O
show O
that O
gains O
of O
over O
10 O
points O
in O
MAP O
/ O
NDCG O
can O
be O
achieved O
over O
the O
best O
single O
model O
by O
a O
linear O
combination O
of O
the O
models O
that O
contribute O
the O
most O

information O
, O
rather O
than O
by O

the O
models O
with O
the O
best O

retrieval O
performance O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Arabic O
, O
the O
mother O
tongue O
of O
over O
300 O
million O
people O
around O
the O
world O
, O
is O
known O
as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
difficult O
languages O
in O
Automatic O
Natural O
Language O
processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
in O
general O
and O
information O
retrieval O
in O
particular O
. O

Hence O
, O
Arabic O
can O
not O
trust O
any O
web O
information O
retrieval O
system O
as O
reliable O
and O
relevant O
as O

In O
this O
work O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
to O
identify O
the O
raga O
of O
a O
Carnatic O
music O
signal O
. O

Raga O
is O
analogous O
to O
melody O
in O
Western O
music O
but O
is O
much O
richer O
and O
stronger O
in O
its O
representation O
. O

The O
main O
motive O
behind O
Raga O
identification O
is O
that O
it O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
good O
basis O
for O
music O
information O
retrieval O
of O
Carnatic O
music O
songs O
or O
Film O
songs O
based O
on O
Carnatic O
music O
. O

The O
input O
polyphonic O
music O
signal O
is O
analyzed O
and O
made O
to O
pass O
through O
a O
signal O
separation O
algorithm O
to O
separate O
the O
instrument O
and O
the O
vocal O
signal O
. O

After O
extracting O
the O
vocal O
signal O
we O
segment O
the O
vocal O
signal O
using O
our O
proposed O
segmentation O
algorithm O
. O

Using O
our O
proposed O
singer O
identification O
algorithm O
we O
determine O
the O
singer O
to O
know O
the O
fundamental O
frequency O
of O
the O
singer O
. O

The O
frequency O
components O
of O
the O
signal O
are O
then O
determined O
and O
we O
map O
these O
frequency O
components O
into O
the O
swara O
sequence O
and O
thereby O
determine O
the O
Raga O
of O
the O
particular O
song O
, O
which O
could O
be O
used O
to O
index O
the O
songs O
and O
further O
for O
retrieval O
based O
on O
the O
Raga O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
an O
important O
application O
area O
of O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
where O
one O
encounters O
the O
genuine O
challenge O
of O
processing O
large O
quantities O
of O
unrestricted O

language O
text O
. O

While O

to O
apply O
NLP O
techniques O
to O
IR O
, O
very O
few O
NLP O
techniques O
have O
been O

on O
a O
document O
collection O
larger O
than O
several O
megabytes O
. O

Many O
NLP O
techniques O
are O
simply O
not O
efficient O
enough O
, O
and O
not O
robust O
enough O
, O
to O

a O
large O

of O

. O

on O

of O
such O

technique O
to O
enhance O
document O

. O

of O
using O

provided O
by O
the O
parser O
to O
supplement O
single O
words O
for O
indexing O
is O
evaluated O
with O
a O
250 O
megabytes O
document O
collection O
. O

The O
experiment O
’s O

results O
show O
that O

single O
words O
with O
syntactic O
phrases O
for O

and O
significantly O

retrieval O
performance O
. O

. O

It O
improves O
query O
translation O
in O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
, O
leading O
to O
significantly O
higher O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
on O

collections O
. O

alone O
is O
insuficient O
for O
eficient O

Retrieval O
( O
ZR O
Previous O

- O

. O

to O

a O
tailor O
- O
made O
hypertext O

in O

to O
each O

's O

. O

There O
are O
so O
many O

of O

’s O

- O

. O

terms O

. O

very O
wide O
for O

. O

a O

of O

. O

to O

This O

. O

what O

was O

. O

( O

) O

area O
of O
focus O

. O

. O

The O
Information O
Retrieval O
involves O
the O
development O
of O
computer O
systems O
for O
the O
storage O
and O
retrieval O
of O
textual O
information O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
based O
on O
prioritized O
fuzzy O
information O
and O
triangular O
uninorms O
, O
for O
dealing O
with O
such O
a O
problem O
. O

The O
advantage O
of O
this O
method O
with O
respect O
to O
related O
works O
is O
the O
use O
of O
the O
fuzzy O

weighting O
information O

the O
expression O
of O
information O
needs O
and O
the O
ability O
of O
trade O
off O
between O
criteria O
with O
different O
priority O
levels O
, O

uninorms O
are O
used O
to O
deal O
with O
the O
criteria O
priority O
in O
the O
process O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
hybrid O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
procedure O
that O
builds O
on O
two O
well O
- O
known O
IR O
approaches O
: O
data O
fusion O
and O
query O
expansion O
via O
relevance O
feedback O
. O

This O
IR O
procedure O
is O
designed O
to O
exploit O
the O
strengths O
of O
data O
fusion O
and O
relevance O
feedback O
and O
to O
avoid O
some O
weaknesses O
of O
these O
approaches O
. O

We O
show O
that O
our O
IR O
procedure O
is O
built O
on O
postulates O
that O
can O
be O
justified O
analytically O
and O
empirically O
. O

Additionally O
, O
we O
offer O
an O
empirical O
investigation O
of O
the O
procedure O
, O
showing O
that O
it O
is O
superior O
to O
relevance O
feedback O
on O
some O
dimensions O
and O
comparable O
on O
other O
dimensions O
. O

The O
empirical O
investigation O
also O
verifies O
the O
conditions O
under O
which O
the O
use O
of O
our O
IR O
procedure O
could O
be O
beneficial O
. O

Neural O
learning O
has O
been O
used O
with O
e6ectiveness O
in O
natural O
language O
processing O
tasks O
. O

Particularly O
, O
the O
Widrow O
– O
Ho6 O
and O
the O
Kivinen O
– O
Warmuth O
exponentiated O
gradient O
( O
based O
on O

learning O
rules O
) O
algorithms O
have O
been O

in O

, O

the O
results O
obtained O
by O
the O
well O
- O
known O
Rocchio O
’s O

. O

The O
high O
performance O
of O
competitive O
learning O
algorithms O
, O
recently O
applied O
to O
solve O
information O
retrieval O
problems O
, O
leads O
us O
to O
use O

in O
the O
speci O
= O
c O
text O
categorization O
tasks O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O

categorization O
system O
based O
on O
neural O
learning O
, O
using O

, O
both O
in O
Spanish O
and O

. O

The O
method O
we O
suggest O
is O
based O
on O
using O
the O
LVQ O
algorithm O
to O
build O
a O
classi O
= O
er O
that O
learns O
the O
training O
multilingual O
collection O
. O

We O
have O
performed O
experiments O
with O
the O
four O
algorithm O
which O
show O
that O
the O
ideas O

In O
social O
media O
communication O
, O
code O
switching O
has O
become O
quite O
a O
common O
phenomenon O
especially O
for O
multilingual O
speakers O
. O

Automatic O
language O
identification O
becomes O
both O
a O
necessary O
and O
challenging O
task O
in O
such O
an O
environment O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
CRF O
based O
system O
with O
voting O
approach O
for O
code O
- O
mixed O
query O
word O
labeling O
at O
word O
- O
level O
as O
part O
of O
our O
participation O
in O
the O
shared O
task O
on O
Mixed O
Script O
Information O
Retrieval O
at O
Forum O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
Evaluation O
( O
FIRE O
) O
in O
2015 O
. O

Our O
method O
uses O
character O
n O
- O
gram O
, O
simple O
lexical O
features O
and O
special O
character O
features O
, O
and O
therefore O
, O
can O
easily O
be O
replicated O
across O
languages O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
the O
system O
was O
evaluated O
against O
the O
test O
sets O
provided O
by O
the O
FIRE O
2015 O
shared O
task O
on O
mixed O
script O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
encouraging O
performance O
across O
the O
language O
pairs O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
analyzes O
the O
computational O
complexity O
of O
finding O
relevant O
documents O
on O
the O
Web O
. O

Given O
a O
search O
query O
that O
has O
n O
significant O
terms O
, O
relevant O
documents O
retrieved O
by O
search O
engines O
will O
contain O
at O
least O
a O
number O
k O
of O
the O
significant O
terms O
. O

The O
threshold O
k O
chosen O
will O
depend O
on O
the O
collection O
of O
documents O
and O
is O
determined O
experimentally O
upon O
formation O
of O
the O
collection O
. O

Algorithms O
are O
then O
provided O
to O
compute O
a O
similarity O
ranking O
. O

The O
fundamental O
analysis O
is O
based O
on O
combinatorial O
theory O
and O
theorems O
providing O
bounds O
on O
the O
runtime O
complexity O
of O
the O
algorithms O
are O
proven O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
ever O
increasing O
amounts O
of O
information O
stored O
on O
the O
Web O
or O
archived O
within O
computing O
systems O
, O
high O
performance O
data O
processing O
architectures O
are O
required O
to O
process O
this O
data O
in O
real O
time O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
the O
work O
presented O
in O
this O
paper O
is O
the O
development O
of O
a O
hardware O
text O
mining O
IP O
- O
Core O
for O
use O
in O
FPGA O
based O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
the O
development O
of O
our O
text O
processing O
hardware O
pipeline O
, O
with O
the O
addition O
of O
a O
complex O
word O
stemming O
and O
loadable O
stop O
list O
stages O
. O

The O

of O

is O
then O
compared O
to O
our O
initial O
prototype O
and O
an O
equivalent O
software O
implementation O
using O
the O
Lucene O
software O
library O


-DOCSTART- O

Measuring O
similarity O
between O
objects O
is O
a O
fundamental O
task O
in O
domains O
such O
as O
data O
mining O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
so O
on O
. O

Link O
- O
based O
similarity O
measures O
have O
attracted O
the O
attention O
of O
many O
researchers O
and O
have O
been O
widely O
applied O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

However O
, O
most O
previous O
works O
mainly O
focus O
on O
introducing O
new O
link O
- O
based O
measures O
, O
and O
seldom O
provide O
theoretical O
as O
well O
as O
experimental O
comparisons O
with O
other O
measures O
. O

Thus O
, O
selecting O
the O
suitable O
measure O
in O
different O
situations O
and O
applications O
is O
difficult O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
comprehensive O
analysis O
and O
critical O
comparison O
of O
various O
link O
- O
based O
similarity O
measures O
and O
algorithms O
are O
presented O
. O

Their O
strengths O
and O
weaknesses O
are O
discussed O
. O

Their O
actual O
runtime O
performances O
are O
also O
compared O
via O
experiments O
on O
benchmark O
data O
sets O
. O

Some O
novel O
and O
useful O
guidelines O
for O
users O
to O
choose O
the O
appropriate O
link O
- O
based O
measure O
for O
their O
applications O
are O
discovered O
. O

Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
despite O
being O
well O
studied O
, O
is O
computationally O
costly O
and O
arduous O
to O
scale O
. O

We O
explore O
lower O
- O
cost O
relaxations O
of O
information O
- O
theoretic O
PIR O
, O
based O
on O
dummy O
queries O
, O
sparse O
vectors O
, O
and O
compositions O
with O
an O
anonymity O
system O
. O

We O
prove O
the O
security O
of O
each O
scheme O
using O
a O
flexible O
differentially O
private O
definition O
for O
private O
queries O
that O
can O
capture O
notions O
of O
imperfect O
privacy O
. O

We O
show O
that O
basic O
schemes O
are O
weak O
, O
but O
some O
of O
them O
can O
be O
made O
arbitrarily O
safe O
by O
composing O
them O
with O
large O
anonymity O
systems O
. O

Recognition O
concept O
came O
from O
NER O
system O
. O

In O

name O
specifics O

are O
detected O
from O
documents O
like O
name O
of O
city O
, O
state O
, O
Country O
, O
organization O
, O
person O
, O
location O
, O
sport O
, O
river O
, O
quantity O
etc O
. O

Whereas O

Recognition O
detects O
all O
the O

presents O
in O
a O
documents O
to O
help O
the O
improvement O
of O

of O
some O

tasks O
like O
Question O

, O
Auto O

. O

to O

and O

our O
own O

set O
to O

This O
paper O
describes O
our O

in O

for O

classification O
task O
of O

2013 O
. O

Our O
system O
leveraged O
on O
a O

of O
components O
previously O
developed O
for O
a O

message O
polarity O
classifier O
. O

Following O
a O

approach O
, O
a O
Logistic O
Regression O
classifier O
is O
trained O
from O
annotated O
data O
. O

A O

language O
model O
is O
used O
to O
represent O

in O
terms O
of O
a O
vocabulary O
consisting O
only O

the O
most O

with O

features O
weighted O
using O
a O

from O

. O

is O
enriched O
with O
another O

more O

, O
representation O
of O
the O
words O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
extract O
features O
to O
capture O
the O
use O
of O
informal O
and O
affective O
language O
. O

Our O
approach O
ranked O
in O
the O
top O
three O
for O
all O
the O
metrics O
, O
showing O
that O
the O
strategies O
for O
Twitter O

are O
useful O
for O
the O
task O
of O

for O
Reputation O

. O

problem O
in O

the O

between O
two O

melodies O
; O

are O
several O

that O
have O
been O

, O
among O
others O
, O

Mongeau O
- O

measure O
. O

- O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
, O
domain O
- O
driven O
data O
mining O
( O
D3 O
M O
) O
has O
received O
extensive O
attention O
in O
data O
mining O
. O

Unlike O
the O
traditional O
data O
- O
driven O
data O
mining O
, O
D3 O
M O
tends O
to O
discover O
actionable O
knowledge O
by O
tightly O
integrating O
the O
data O
mining O
methods O
with O
the O
domain O
- O
specific O
business O
processes O
. O

However O
, O
in O
most O
cases O
, O
the O
domain O
specific O
actionable O
knowledge O
can O
not O
be O
discovered O
without O
the O
support O
of O
domain O
knowledge O
, O
mainly O
provided O
by O
human O
experts O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
human O
- O
machine O
- O
cooperated O
interactive O
knowledge O
discovery O
process O
is O
widely O
applied O
in O
realworld O
applications O
. O

Active O
learning O
can O
integrate O
the O
automated O
learning O
algorithm O
with O
the O
domain O
experts O
. O

The O
main O
aim O
of O
the O
paper O
is O
to O
get O
the O
information O
from O
domain O
experts O
to O
the O
generalized O
queries O
with O
do O
n’t O
care O
attribute O
using O
data O
mining O
with O
addition O
off O
Active O
Learning O
with O
Generalized O
Queries O
Algorithm O
. O

We O

) O

: O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O

( O
QA O
) O

. O

in O

task O

and O

. O

In O

( O
LM O
) O

to O

, O

higher O
order O
< O
i O
> O
n O
- O
grams</i O
> O

the O
new O
class O
- O
based O
model O
. O

We O
report O
our O
experiments O
on O
the O

from O

track O
. O

The O

that O

methods O
investigated O
here O

the O
mean O
average O
precision O
of O
sentence O
retrieval O

23.62 O
% O
to O
29.91 O
% O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
method O
to O
generate O
labels O
for O

and O

the O
search O
results O
returned O
by O

engines O
. O

It O
has O
applied O
statistical O
techniques O
to O
measure O
the O
quantities O
of O
co O
- O
occurrence O
keywords O
for O
forming O
the O
label O
matrix O
of O

, O

algorithm O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
fundamental O
difference O
between O
standard O
information O
retrieval O
and O
XML O
retrieval O
is O
the O
unit O
of O
retrieval O
. O

In O
traditional O
IR O
, O
the O
unit O
of O
retrieval O
is O
fixed O
: O
it O
is O
the O
complete O
document O
. O

In O
XML O
retrieval O
, O
every O
XML O
element O
in O
a O
document O
is O
a O
retrievable O
unit O
. O

This O
makes O
XML O
retrieval O
more O
difficult O
: O
besides O
being O
relevant O
, O
a O
retrieved O
unit O
should O
be O
neither O
too O
large O
nor O
too O
small O
. O

The O
research O
presented O
here O
, O
a O
comparative O
analysis O
of O
two O
approaches O
to O
XML O
retrieval O
, O
aims O
to O
shed O
light O
on O
which O
XML O
elements O
should O
be O
retrieved O
. O

The O
experimental O
evaluation O
uses O
data O
from O
the O
Initiative O
for O
the O
Evaluation O
of O
XML O
retrieval O
( O
INEX O
2002 O
) O
. O

. O

Thai O
Intelligent O
Tutor O
with O

Retrieval O
( O

) O

a O

- O
component O

tutor O
system O
. O

TITIR O
borrows O
interesting O
ideas O

many O
fields O

natural O
language O
processing O

information O
retrieval O

system O

. O

is O

system O
to O

appropriate O
contents O
for O

student O
by O

their O

into O
account O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Introduction O

In O
the O
last O
years O
several O
approaches O
have O
been O
defined O
to O
soften O
the O
classical O
Boolean O
Information O
Retrieval O
model O
, O
These O
approaches O
were O
formalized O
within O
different O
mathematical O
framework O
with O
the O
following O
aims O
:- O
to O
improve O
the O
description O
of O
documents O
' O
information O
content O
; O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
new O
approach O
for O
parallel O
string O
matching O
. O

Some O
known O
parallel O
string O
matching O
algorithms O
are O
considered O
based O
on O
duels O
by O
witness O
which O
focuses O
on O
the O
strengths O
and O
weaknesses O
of O
the O
currently O
known O
methods O
. O

This O
has O
applications O
such O
as O
string O
databases O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
computational O
biology O
. O

The O
new O
‘ O
divide O
and O
conquer’ O
approach O
has O
been O
introduced O
for O
parallel O
string O
matching O
, O
called O
the O
W O
- O
period O
, O
which O
is O
used O
for O
parallel O
preprocessing O
of O
the O
pattern O
and O
has O
optimal O
implementations O
in O
a O
various O
models O
of O
computation O
. O

The O
idea O
, O
common O
for O
every O
parallel O
string O
matching O
algorithm O
is O
slightly O
different O
from O
sequential O
ones O
as O
Knuth O
- O
Morris O
- O
Pratt O
or O
Boyer O
- O
Moore O
algorithm O
. O

[ O
Abstract O
] O

of O

on O

. O

( O

) O

of O

( O

. O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
evolution O
of O

, O
users O
are O
looking O
for O
documents O
that O
are O

on O

. O

The O
growth O
in O
volume O
of O

information O
affects O
the O
performance O
of O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
any O

system O
, O

are O
document O
representation O

as O

. O

Most O
of O

, O

, O
bag O
of O

. O

an O

structure O
for O

using O
Terrier O
3.5 O
, O
a O
well O
- O
known O
open O
source O
for O
information O

. O

In O

experiments O
, O

used O
FIRE O
2011 O
English O
data O
set O
. O

of O
corpus O
, O

to O
create O
index O
structure O
has O
also O
increased O
linearly O
. O

When O

structure O

for O

from O

94.73 O
when O

. O

This O

. O

The O

of O

for O

scores O
( O

) O

is O

. O

Both O

. O

We O

that O

. O

A O

- O

- O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

For O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
web O
search O
engines O
it O
is O
important O
to O
keep O
the O
delay O
between O

a O

and O

within O

range O
for O

end O
user O
. O

How O
to O

remains O

. O

One O

reduce O

is O
by O

search O
results O
for O

and O

. O

In O

in O
large O
- O

peer O
- O

networks O

simulating O
such O
networks O
with O
increasing O
levels O
of O
realism O
. O

We O
find O
that O
cache O
hit O
ratios O
of O
at O
least O
thirty O
- O
three O
percent O
are O
attainable O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
efficient O

- O
to O
- O
peer O

system O

that O

state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
content O

. O

PeerSearch O
avoids O

of O
existing O
systems O

indexing O
, O
index O
flooding O
, O

. O

It O

avoids O
the O
non O
- O
determinism O
that O
exhibited O
by O
heuristic O
- O
based O
approaches O
. O

PeerSearch O
achieves O
both O
efficiency O
and O
determinism O
through O
an O
elegant O
combination O
of O
index O
placement O
and O
query O
routing O
. O

Given O
a O
query O
, O
PeerSearch O
only O
needs O
to O
search O
a O
small O
number O
of O
nodes O
to O
identify O
matching O
documents O
. O

, O

- O

have O

used O
( O

- O

) O

. O

Implementing O

system O

components O

for O

, O
component O

, O
implementation O

, O
analysis O
and O
visualization O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
report O
presents O
algorithms O
for O
finding O
large O
matchings O
in O
the O
streaming O
model O
. O

In O
this O
model O
, O
applicable O
when O
dealing O
with O
massive O
graphs O
, O
edges O
are O
streamed O
- O
in O
in O
some O
arbitrary O
order O
rather O
than O
residing O
in O
randomly O
accessible O
memory O
. O

For O
ε O
0 O
, O
we O
achieve O
a O
1/(1+ε O
) O
approximation O
for O
maximum O
cardinality O
matching O
and O
a O
1/(2+ε O
) O
approximation O
to O
maximum O
weighted O
matching O
. O

Both O
algorithms O
use O
a O
constant O
number O
of O
passes O
. O

Comments O
University O
of O
Pennsylvania O
Department O
of O
Computer O
and O
Information O
Science O
Technical O
Report O

No O
. O
MSCIS-04 O
- O
19 O
. O

This O
technical O
report O
is O
available O
at O
ScholarlyCommons O
: O
http O
repository.upenn.edu/cis_reports/21 O
Finding O
Matchings O
in O
the O
Streaming O

The O
concept O
of O
using O
a O
relational O
database O
to O
perform O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
search O
functions O
is O
well O
established O
. O

Prior O
work O
demonstrates O
the O
capability O
to O
perform O
common O
functions O
and O
advanced O
ranking O
algorithms O
using O
standard O
, O
unchanged O
SQL O
. O

The O
previous O
work O
does O
not O
address O
the O
preprocessing O
of O
unstructured O
text O
within O
the O
relational O
model O
. O

In O
fact O
, O
the O
parsing O
of O
the O
unstructured O
data O
into O
a O
structured O
data O
set O
was O
done O
outside O
of O
the O
database O
, O
usually O
using O
sequential O
programming O
languages O
such O
as O
C. O

This O
work O
proves O
that O
IR O
preprocessing O
does O
not O
require O
proprietary O
application O
code O
to O
build O
the O
framework O
necessary O
for O
searching O
document O
databases O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
the O
resulting O
environment O
is O
relational O
and O
integrates O
with O
other O
data O
sources O
within O
an O
organization O
. O

In O
this O
contribution O
we O
investigate O
the O
use O
of O
description O
logics O
( O
DLs O
) O
for O
information O
retrieval O
in O
a O
multiagent O
scenario O
. O

We O
first O
describe O
two O
advanced O
DLs O
and O
present O
the O
relevant O
reasoning O
services O
provided O
for O
information O
retrieval O
, O
in O
particular O
instance O
retrieval O
, O
instance O
checking O
and O
example O
- O
based O
instance O
retrieval O
. O

Complete O
and O
sound O
algorithms O
exist O
for O
each O
of O
these O
tasks O
in O
both O
DLs O
, O
but O
it O
is O
shown O
that O
a O
combined O
DL O
is O
undecidable O
. O

In O
order O
to O
make O
use O
of O
knowledge O
bases O
which O
use O
different O
DLs O
, O
a O
broker O
- O
based O
multiagent O
information O
retrieval O
scheme O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
main O
idea O
is O
to O
pose O
transformed O
queries O
to O
individual O
agents O
and O
combine O
the O
answers O
to O
obtain O
a O
correct O
but O
not O
necessarily O
complete O
result O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
illustrated O
with O
detailed O
examples O
. O

Video O
summarization O
, O
which O
has O
a O

area O

cases O
. O

of O

gradients O
as O
feature O
extractor O
and O
optical O
flow O

motion O
descriptor O
. O

Above O
these O
, O
a O
template O
matching O
algorithm O
implemented O
in O
a O
shrinkable O
and O

to O

for O
periodicity O
and O
thereby O
extract O
patterns O
. O

is O
built O
up O
on O
the O
validation O
of O
these O

with O
a O
correlation O
based O
search O
- O
through O
subsystem O
. O

Text O
mining O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
tools O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Text O
clustering O
is O
the O
process O
of O
classifying O
documents O
into O
predefined O
categories O
according O
to O
their O
content O
. O

Existing O
supervised O
learning O
algorithms O
to O
automatically O
classify O
text O
requires O
sufficient O
documentation O
to O
learn O
exactly O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
Niching O
memetic O
algorithm O
and O
Genetic O
algorithm O
( O
GA O
) O
is O
presented O
in O
which O
feature O
selection O
an O
integral O
part O
of O
the O
global O
clustering O
search O
procedure O
that O
attempts O
to O
overcome O
the O
problem O
of O
finding O
optimal O
solutions O
at O
the O
local O
less O
promising O
in O
both O
clustering O
and O
feature O
selection O
. O

The O
concept O
of O
confusion O
matrix O
is O
then O
used O
for O
derivative O
works O
, O
and O
finally O
, O
hybrid O
GA O
is O
included O
for O
the O
final O
classification O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
benefits O
by O
using O
the O
proposed O
method O
which O
evaluates O
F O
- O
measure O
, O

> O

Similarity O
measures O
have O
been O
used O
widely O
in O
information O
retrieval O
research O
. O

Most O
research O
has O
been O
done O
on O
query O
- O
document O
or O
document O
- O
document O
similarity O
without O
much O
attention O
to O
the O
user O
's O
perception O
of O
similarity O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
information O
need O
. O

In O
this O
study O
, O
we O
collect O
user O
preference O
judgements O
of O
web O
document O
similarity O
in O
order O
to O
investigate O
1 O
) O
the O
correlation O
between O
similarity O
measures O
and O
users O
' O
perception O
of O
similarity O
2 O
) O
the O
correlation O
between O
the O
web O
document O
features O
plus O
document O
- O
query O
features O
and O
users O
' O
similarity O
judgements O
. O

We O
analyze O
the O
performance O
of O
various O
similarity O
methods O
at O
predicting O
user O
preferences O
, O
in O
both O
unsupervised O
and O
supervised O
settings O
. O

We O
show O
that O

approach O
using O
many O
features O
is O

to O
predict O
user O
preferences O
close O
to O
the O
level O
of O
agreement O
between O
users O
, O
and O
moreover O
achieve O
a O
15 O
% O
improvement O
in O
AUC O
over O
an O
unsupervised O
approach O
. O

study O
on O

of O

as O
follows O
1 O
) O

the O
query O
result O

but O

is O

2 O
) O

The O
return O

can&#x02019;t O
satisfy O

search O
needs O
3 O
) O

A O

number O

are O
returned O

make O
user O
difficult O
to O
distinguish O

. O

, O
experiment O

, O
and O
it O
achieves O
a O

the O

and O

. O

rdered O
, O

trees O
are O

for O

- O

- O

We O
put O
forward O
a O
novel O

method O
, O
which O
is O
referred O
to O
Collective O
Matrix O
Factorization O
Hashing O
( O
CMFH O
CMFH O
learns O
unified O
hash O
codes O
by O
collective O
matrix O
factorization O
with O

factor O
model O
from O
different O
modalities O

one O
instance O
, O

can O

cross O
- O
view O
search O

search O

by O

multiple O
view O
information O
sources O
. O

We O
also O
prove O
that O
CMFH O
, O
a O
similarity O
- O
preserving O
hashing O
learning O
method O
, O

upper O
and O
lower O

. O

- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
on O
three O
different O
datasets O
. O

in O
recent O
years O
. O

One O
of O
the O
major O
remaining O
reasons O
that O
CLIR O
does O
not O
perform O
as O
well O
as O
monolingual O
retrieval O
is O
the O
presence O
of O
out O
of O
vocabulary O
( O
OOV O
) O
terms O
. O

Previous O
work O
has O
either O
relied O
on O
manual O
intervention O
or O
has O
only O
been O
partially O
successful O
in O
solving O
this O
problem O
. O

We O
use O
a O
method O
that O
extends O
earlier O
work O
in O
this O
area O
by O
augmenting O
this O
with O
statistical O
analysis O
, O
and O
corpus O
- O
based O
translation O
disambiguation O
to O
dynamically O
discover O
translations O
of O
OOV O
terms O
. O

The O
method O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
both O
Chinese O
- O
English O
and O
English O
- O
Chinese O
CLIR O
, O
correctly O
extracting O
translations O
of O
OOV O
terms O
from O
the O
Web O
automatically O
, O
and O
thus O
is O
a O
significant O
improvement O
on O
earlier O
work O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
report O
describes O
the O
methods O
that O
our O
Information O
Retrieval O
Group O
at O
Purdue O
University O
used O
for O
the O
TREC O
Microblog O
2011 O
track O
. O

The O
first O
method O
is O
the O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
, O
a O
traditional O
algorithm O
to O
reformulate O
the O
query O
by O
adding O
expanded O
terms O
to O
the O
query O
. O

The O
second O
method O
is O
the O
affinity O
propagation O
, O
a O
non O
parametric O
clustering O
algorithm O
that O
can O
group O
the O
top O
tweets O
according O
to O
their O
similarities O
. O

The O
final O
score O
of O
a O
tweet O
is O
based O
on O
its O
relevance O
score O
and O
the O
relevance O
score O
of O
its O
representative O
in O
the O
group O
. O

We O
found O
that O
query O
expansion O
is O
a O
very O
useful O
technique O
for O
microblog O
retrieval O
, O
while O
affinity O
propagation O
could O
achieve O
a O
comparable O
performance O
when O
combining O
with O
other O
techniques O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
discusses O
possibilities O
of O
extending O
functions O
in O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
. O

The O
standard O
usage O
of O
IR O
systems O
( O
described O
for O
example O
in O
[ O
Po98 O
concentrates O
on O

some O

such O
as O
papers O
, O
books O
etc O
or O
descriptions O
how O
and O
where O

is O

to O
obtain O
these O

documents O
. O

Users O
often O
do O
not O
need O
complete O
informatio O
n O
, O
but O
they O

to O
know O
where O

find O

. O

In O

usually O

manipulate O
with O
the O

documents O
, O
but O
we O

of O

about O

. O

This O
knowledge O
( O
identification O
and O
kind O
of O
document O
, O
main O
keywords O
characterising O
the O
document O
, O
etc O
is O

( O
or O

information O

In O
[ O
Fr92 O
Po92 O
Po98 O
several O
models O
and O
query O
languages O
are O
described O
, O
which O
provide O
for O
users O

some O

. O

of O

( O

, O

etc O

usually O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
agent O
- O

approach O
to O
resource O
description O
and O
selection O
in O
a O

retrieval O
( O
IR O

In O

learns O
from O
its O
experience O
through O
its O
interactions O
with O
other O
agents O
their O
capabilities O
and O
qualifications O
. O

Based O
on O
a O

framework O
, O

methodology O
allows O

to O
profile O

in O

and O
a O
neighborhood O
profile O
, O
which O
together O

. O

, O

in O

) O
on O

. O

Information O
Retrieval O
has O
received O
increasing O
attention O
from O
both O
the O
industrial O
and O
the O
research O
communities O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

Many O
audio O
extraction O
techniques O
providing O
content O
- O
based O
music O
information O
have O
been O
developed O
, O
sparking O
the O
need O
for O

storage O
and O

facilities O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
to O
satisfy O
this O
need O
by O
extending O
technology O
from O
business O
- O
oriented O
data O
warehouses O
to O
so O
- O
called O

warehouses O
that O
integrate O
a O
large O
variety O
of O
music O
- O
related O
information O
, O
including O
both O
low O
- O
level O
features O
and O

- O

. O

Music O

thus O
help O
to O

“ O
semantic O
gap O
” O
by O

integrated O
querying O
of O

. O

must O

to O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
process O
of O
evaluating O
a O
user O
's O
query O
, O
or O
information O
need O
, O
against O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
( O
books O
, O
journal O
articles O
, O
web O
pages O
, O
etc O
to O
determine O
which O
of O
the O
documents O
satisses O
the O
query O
. O

With O
the O
advent O
of O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
, O
there O
is O
suddenly O
a O
need O
to O
query O
enormous O
sets O
of O
documents O
both O
eeciently O
and O
accurately O
. O

In O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
documents O
are O
represented O
by O
sparse O
vectors O
each O
component O
of O
which O
corresponds O
to O
a O
term O
, O
usually O
a O
word O
, O
in O
the O
documents O
set O
. O

In O
the O
simplest O
case O
, O
the O
components O
of O
these O
vectors O
are O
the O
raw O
frequency O
counts O
of O
each O
term O
in O
each O
document O
. O

More O
sophisticated O
term O
weighting O
schemes O
are O
used O
to O
improve O
information O
retrieval O
accuracy O
. O

We O
study O
a O
speciic O
term O
weighting O
scheme O
( O
log O
- O
entropy O
weighting O
) O
to O
determine O
its O
eeectiveness O
on O
diierent O
aspects O
of O
retrieval O
. O

New O
approaches O
to O
term O
weighting O
are O
also O
examined O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
workshop O
experience O
and O
some O
of O
our O
technical O
work O
. O

Using O
content O
- O
specific O
models O
to O
guide O
information O
retrieval O
can O
provide O

interfaces O
to O
end O
- O
users O
in O

, O

results O
and O
present O
a O
novel O
interface O
for O

among O
the O
milestone O
events O
of O
a O
situation O
. O

maps O

. O

. O

in O

skill O

. O

. O

( O

. O

of O
- O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
one O
wants O
to O
download O
a O
file O
from O
a O
database O
without O
revealing O
to O
the O
database O
which O
file O
is O
being O
downloaded O
. O

Much O
attention O
has O
been O
paid O
to O
the O
case O
of O
the O
database O
being O
encoded O
across O
several O
servers O
, O
subsets O
of O
which O
can O
collude O
to O
attempt O
to O
deduce O
the O
requested O
file O
. O

With O
the O
goal O
of O
studying O
the O
achievable O
PIR O
rates O
in O
realistic O
scenarios O
, O
we O
generalize O
results O
for O
coded O
data O
from O
the O
case O
of O
all O
subsets O
of O
servers O
of O
size O
t O
colluding O
, O
to O
arbitrary O
subsets O
of O
the O
servers O
. O

We O
investigate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
previous O
strategies O
in O
this O
new O
scenario O
, O
and O
present O
new O
results O
in O
the O
case O
where O
the O
servers O
are O
partitioned O
into O
disjoint O
colluding O
groups O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
hybrid O
method O
to O
turn O
off O
- O
the O
- O
shelf O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
into O
future O
event O
predictors O
. O

Given O
a O
query O
, O
a O
time O
series O
model O
is O
trained O
on O
the O
publication O
dates O
of O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
to O
capture O
trends O
and O
periodicity O
of O
the O
associated O
events O
. O

The O
periodicity O
of O
historic O
data O
is O
used O
to O
estimate O
a O
probabilistic O
model O
to O
predict O
future O
bursts O
. O

Finally O
, O
a O
hybrid O
model O
is O
obtained O
by O
intertwining O
the O
probabilistic O
and O
the O
time O
- O
series O
model O
. O

Our O
empirical O
results O
on O
the O
New O
York O
Times O
corpus O
show O
that O
autocorrelation O
functions O
of O
time O
- O
series O
suffice O
to O
classify O
queries O
accurately O
and O
that O
our O
hybrid O
models O
lead O
to O
more O
accurate O
future O
event O
predictions O
than O
baseline O
competitors O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

, O

] O
over O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
[ O
5 O
] O
to O
autonomous O
agents O
exploring O
dynamic O
document O
networks O
[ O
3 O
An O
information O
retrieving O
agent O
not O
only O
faces O
the O
problem O
of O
acquiring O
information O
but O
also O
of O
selecting O
the O
interesting O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Histogram O
construction O
or O
sequence O
segmentation O
is O
a O
basic O
task O
with O
applications O
in O
database O
systems O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
knowledge O
management O
. O

Its O
aim O
is O
to O
approximate O
a O
sequence O
by O
line O
segments O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
the O
quadratic O
algorithm O
that O
derives O
an O
optimal O
histogram O
for O
Euclidean O
error O
lacks O
the O
desired O
scalability O
. O

Therefore O
, O
sophisticated O
approximation O
algorithms O
have O
been O
recently O
proposed O
, O
while O
several O
simple O
heuristics O
are O
used O
in O
practice O
. O

Still O
, O
these O
solutions O
fail O
to O
resolve O
the O
efficiency O
- O
quality O
tradeoff O
in O
a O
satisfactory O
manner O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
take O
a O
fresh O
view O
on O
the O
problem O
. O

We O
propose O
conceptually O
clear O
and O
scalable O
algorithms O
that O
efficiently O
derive O
high O
- O
quality O
histograms O
. O

We O
experimentally O
demonstrate O
that O
existing O
approximation O
schemes O
fail O
to O
deliver O
the O
desired O
efficiency O
and O
conventional O
heuristics O
do O
not O
fare O
well O
on O
the O
side O
of O
quality O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
our O
schemes O
match O
or O
exceed O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
former O
and O
the O
efficiency O
of O
the O
latter O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Thomas O
Kuhn O
’s O
ideas O
, O
particularly O
of O
paradigm O
, O
are O
used O
with O
some O
frequency O
in O
information O
science O
. O

The O
usages O
of O
paradigm O
and O
the O
problematic O
nature O
of O
Kuhn O
’s O
thought O
are O
explored O
. O

Alternatives O
to O
Kuhn O
are O
suggested O
as O
a O
way O
out O
of O
the O
confusion O
his O
thought O
leads O
to O
. O

Résumé O
Les O
idées O
de O
Thomas O
Kuhn O
, O
plus O
particulièrement O
le O
paradigme O
, O
sont O
utilisées O
assez O
fréquemment O
en O
science O
de O
l’information O
. O

Les O
utilisations O

du O
paradigme O
et O
la O
nature O
problématique O
de O
la O
pensée O
de O
Kuhn O
sont O

. O

Afin O
de O
contrer O
la O
confusion O
entourant O
la O
pensée O
de O
Kuhn O
, O
des O
alternatives O
sont O
proposées O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Time O
is O
an O
important O
dimension O
of O
any O
information O
space O
. O

It O
can O
be O
very O
useful O
for O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
such O
as O
document O
exploration O
, O
similarity O
search O
, O
summarization O
, O
and O
clustering O
. O

Traditionally O
, O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
do O
not O
take O
full O
advantage O
of O
all O
the O
temporal O
information O
embedded O
in O
documents O
to O
provide O
alternative O
search O
features O
and O
user O
experience O
. O

However O
, O
in O
the O
last O
few O
years O
there O
has O
been O
exciting O
work O
on O
analyzing O
and O
exploiting O
temporal O
information O
for O
the O
presentation O
, O
organization O
, O
and O
in O
particular O
the O
exploration O
of O
search O
results O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
review O
the O
current O
research O
trends O
and O
present O
a O
number O
of O
interesting O
applications O
along O
with O
open O
problems O
. O

The O
goal O
is O
to O
discuss O
interesting O
areas O
and O
future O
work O
for O
this O
exciting O
field O
of O
information O
management O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
novel O
RTPD O
/ O
MACSC O
model O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
tunes O
the O
cache O
size O
adoptively O
on O
the O
fly O
. O

It O
combines O
the O
extant O
MACSC O
( O
model O
for O
adaptive O
cache O
size O
control O
) O
and O
the O
novel O
RTPD O
( O
real O
- O
time O
traffic O
pattern O
detection O
) O
capability O
. O

Similar O
to O
its O
MACSC O
predecessor O
, O
the O
new O
RTPD O
/ O
MACSC O
tuner O
maintains O
the O
given O
cache O
hit O
ratio O
consistently O
and O
persistently O
. O

It O
, O
however O
, O
differs O
from O
its O
predecessor O
because O
it O
adapts O
itself O
to O
compensate O
for O
the O
ill O
effects O
on O
the O
cache O
hit O
ratio O
by O
the O
Internet O
traffic O
, O
which O
embeds O
various O
patterns O
over O
time O
. O

The O
automatic O
adaptation O
( O
self O
- O
tuning O
) O
capability O
in O
response O
to O
traffic O
pattern O
changes O
detected O
by O
the O
RTPD O
is O
called O
self O
- O
reconfiguration O
in O
the O
RTPD O
/ O
MACSC O
context O

Based O
on O
a O
new O
framework O
for O
capturing O
dynamic O
areas O
of O
interest O
in O
eye O
- O
tracking O
, O
we O
model O
the O
user O
search O
process O
as O
a O
Markov O
- O
chain O
. O

The O
analysis O
indicates O

system O

and O
yields O
parameter O
estimates O
for O
the O
Interactive O
Probability O
Ranking O
Principle O
( O

) O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
querying O
hypermedia O
documents O
on O
the O
Web O
based O
on O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
browsing O
, O
and O
database O
techniques O
so O
as O
to O
provide O
maximum O
exibility O
to O
the O
user O
. O

We O
present O
a O
model O
based O
on O
object O
representation O
where O
an O
identity O
does O
not O
correspond O
to O
a O
source O
HTML O
page O
but O
to O
a O
fragment O
of O
it O
. O

A O

is O
identiied O
using O
the O
explicit O
structure O
provided O
by O
the O
HTML O
tags O
as O
well O
as O
the O
implicit O

extracted O

. O

Our O

provides O

to O
diierent O
heterogeneous O
components O
( O
text O
, O
image O
, O
audio O
, O
video O
, O
etc O
of O
a O
given O
document O
, O
and O
to O
their O
relationships O
( O
implicit O
or O
explicit O
through O
hyperlinks O
Our O
language O
expresses O
browsing O
and O
restructuring O
based O
on O
IR O
techniques O
in O
a O
uniied O
framework O
. O

All O
these O
are O
integral O
components O
of O
the O
AKIRA O
system O
, O
currently O
under O
development O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
is O
devoted O
to O
the O
interactive O
visualization O
of O
search O
results O
obtained O
by O
the O
search O
engine O
using O
the O
concept O
lattices O
. O

We O
provide O
a O
tool O
in O
which O
the O
process O
is O
realized O
from O
the O
query O
input O
, O
the O
creation O
of O
the O
concept O
lattice O
and O
then O
its O
visualization O
. O

The O
concept O
lattices O
are O
created O
using O
Formal O
Concept O
Analysis O
which O
hierarchically O
organizes O
the O
results O
in O
the O
form O
of O
clusters O
of O
particular O
objects O
composed O
of O
the O
documents O
with O
the O
shared O
attributes O
. O

The O
resulted O
concept O
lattice O
is O
able O
to O
provide O
a O
structured O
view O
on O
the O
domain O
of O
query O
to O
the O
user O
. O

This O
work O
uses O
Generalized O
One O
- O
Sided O
Concept O
Lattice O
( O
GOSCL O
) O
for O
building O
a O
hierarchy O
of O
concepts O
. O

This O
model O
is O
able O
to O
create O
concept O
lattice O
from O
input O
data O
tables O
that O
contain O
different O
types O
of O
attributes O
representing O
fuzzy O
sets O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
concept O
lattice O
is O
then O
shown O
as O
an O
interactive O
graph O
on O
which O
reductions O
can O
be O
applied O
, O
increasing O
the O
clarity O
of O
the O
output O
visualization O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
issues O
surrounding O
the O
planning O
and O
design O
of O
GermanFrameNet O
( O
GFN O
a O
counterpart O
to O
the O
English O
- O
based O
FrameNet O
project O
. O

The O
goals O
of O
GFN O
are O
( O
a O
) O
to O
create O
lexical O
entries O
for O
German O
nouns O
, O
verbs O
, O
and O
adjectives O
that O
correspond O
to O
existing O
FrameNet O
entries O
, O
and O
( O
b O
) O
to O
link O
the O
parallel O
lexicon O
fragments O
by O
means O
of O
common O
semantic O
frames O
and O
numerical O
indexing O
mechanisms O
. O

GFN O
will O
take O
a O
fine O
- O
grained O
approach O
towards O
polysemy O
that O
seeks O
to O
split O
word O
senses O
based O
on O
the O
semantic O
frames O
that O
underlie O
their O
analysis O
. O

The O
parallel O
lexicon O
fragments O
represent O
an O
important O
step O
towards O
capturing O
valuable O
information O
about O
the O
different O
syntactic O
realizations O
of O
frame O
semantic O
concepts O
across O
languages O
, O
which O
is O
relevant O
for O
information O
retrieval O
, O
machine O
translation O
, O
and O
language O
generation O
. O
