This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O
approach O
for O
Indonesian O
medicinal O
plant O
image O
retrieval O
by O
combining O
leaf O
image O
and O
text O
features O
. O

Fuzzy O
Local O
Binary O
Patterns O
were O
used O
to O
extract O
texture O
features O
based O
on O
leaf O
image O
of O
medicinal O
plants O
. O

To O
improve O
the O
image O
similarity O
, O
we O
proposed O
Probabiistic O
Neural O
Network O
to O
calculate O
the O
weight O
of O
image O
features O
. O

The O
text O
features O
were O
extracted O
from O
medicinal O
plant O
documents O
in O
Indonesian O
language O
. O

Experiments O
result O
show O
that O
combining O
image O
and O
texture O
features O
in O
medicinal O
plant O
image O
retrieval O
improves O
the O
performance O
. O

The O
Average O
Precision O
( O
AVP O
) O
has O
increased O
from O
0.3138 O
to O
0.7081 O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Due O
to O
the O
increasing O
number O
of O
available O
biomedical O
data O
repositories O
, O
providing O
a O
comprehensive O
and O
intuitive O
access O
to O
information O
is O
still O
a O
demanding O
task O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
present O
an O
interactive O
data O
exploration O
system O
that O
retrieves O
relevant O
information O
by O
propagating O
the O
user O
's O
interest O
within O
a O
network O
. O

The O
developed O
techniques O
have O
been O
applied O
to O
two O
different O
retrieval O
tasks O
useful O
for O
biomedical O
research O
: O
the O
prioritization O
of O
proteins O
related O
to O
a O
disease O
of O
interest O
and O
the O
search O
of O
publications O
in O
the O
literature O
. O

The O
method O
relies O
on O
a O
network O
of O
biomedical O
entities O
, O
scoring O
of O
entities O
of O
interest O
by O
the O
user O
, O
and O
score O
propagation O
. O

The O
assessment O
of O
the O
relevance O
of O
the O
retrieved O
information O
confirmed O
a O
high O
accuracy O
of O
the O
presented O
algorithms O
for O
both O
the O
domains O
considered O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Ranking O
is O
the O
key O
problem O
for O
information O
retrieval O
and O
other O
text O
applications O
. O

Recently O
, O
the O
ranking O
methods O
based O
on O
machine O
learning O
approaches O
, O
called O
learning O
to O
rank O
, O
become O
the O
focus O
for O
researchers O
and O
practitioners O
. O

The O
main O
idea O
of O
these O
methods O
is O
to O
apply O
the O
various O
existing O
and O
effective O
algorithms O
on O
machine O
learning O
to O
ranking O
. O

However O
, O
as O
a O
learning O
problem O
, O
ranking O
is O
different O
from O
other O
classical O
ones O
such O
as O
classification O
and O
regression O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
investigate O
the O
important O
papers O
in O
this O
direction O
; O
the O
cons O
and O
pros O
of O
the O
recent O
- O
proposed O
framework O
and O
algorithms O
for O
ranking O
are O
analyzed O
, O
and O
the O
relationships O
among O
them O
are O
discussed O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
promising O
directions O
in O
practice O
are O
also O
pointed O
out O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
our O
participation O
in O
TREC2004 O
, O
we O
test O
Terrier O
, O
a O
modular O
and O
scalable O
Information O
Retrieval O
framework O
, O
in O
three O
tracks O
. O

For O
the O
mixed O
query O
task O
of O
the O
Web O
track O
, O
we O
employ O
a O
decision O
mechanism O
for O
selecting O
appropriate O
retrieval O
approaches O
on O
a O
per O
- O
query O
basis O
. O

For O
the O
robust O
track O
, O
in O
order O
to O
cope O
with O
the O
poorlyperforming O
queries O
, O
we O
use O
two O
pre O
- O
retrieval O
performance O
predictors O
and O
a O
weighting O
function O
recommender O
mechanism O
. O

We O
also O
test O
a O
new O
training O
approach O
for O
the O
automatic O
tuning O
of O
the O
term O
frequency O
normalisation O
parameters O
. O

In O
the O
Terabyte O
track O
, O
we O
employ O
a O
distributed O
version O
of O
Terrier O
and O
test O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
using O
the O
anchor O
text O
, O
query O
expansion O
and O
selecting O
an O
optimal O
weighting O
model O
for O
each O
query O
. O

Overall O
, O
in O
all O
three O
tracks O
we O
participated O
, O
Terrier O
and O
the O
tested O
Divergence O
From O
Randomness O
models O
were O
shown O
to O
be O
stable O
and O
effective O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Previous O
applications O
of O
the O
Markov O
random O
field O
model O
for O
information O
retrieval O
have O
used O
manually O
chosen O
features O
. O

However O
, O
it O
is O
often O
difficult O
or O
impossible O
to O
know O
i O
> O
a O
priori</i O

the O
best O
set O
of O
features O
to O
use O
for O
a O
given O
task O
or O
data O
set O
. O

Therefore O
, O
there O
is O
a O
need O
to O
develop O
automatic O
feature O
selection O
techniques O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
a O
greedy O
procedure O
for O
automatically O
selecting O
features O
to O
use O
within O
the O
Markov O
random O
field O
model O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
also O
propose O
a O
novel O
, O
robust O
method O
for O
describing O
classes O
of O
textual O
information O
retrieval O
features O
. O

Experimental O
results O
, O
evaluated O
on O
standard O
TREC O
test O
collections O
, O
show O
that O
our O
feature O
selection O
algorithm O
produces O
models O
that O
are O
either O
significantly O
more O
effective O
than O
, O
or O
equally O
effective O
as O
, O
models O
with O
manually O
selected O
features O
, O
such O
as O
those O
used O
in O
the O
past O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

When O
the O
disaster O
occurs O
, O
the O
social O
network O
site O
such O
as O
Twitter O
is O
increasingly O
being O
used O
for O

direct O

operations O
. O

This O
article O

the O
methods O
we O
used O
in O
the O
Fire2017 O
. O

We O
regarded O
the O
distinction O
of O
need O
- O
tweets O
and O
availability O
- O
tweets O
as O
classification O
tasks O
, O
and O
the O
logistic O
regression O
and O
Support O
Vector O
Machine O
are O
used O
to O

of O

. O

and O

regard O

as O
an O
information O

task O
, O
using O
the O

model O
to O
complete O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
will O
present O
a O
MIR O
( O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
) O
system O
using O
natural O
language O
as O
input O
for O
human O
- O
oriented O
queries O
to O
large O
- O
scale O
music O
collections O
, O
applicable O
in O
web O
databases O
, O
cd O
- O
chargers O
for O
cars O
, O
or O
mobile O
services O
. O

The O
outlined O
system O
is O
a O
full O
- O
fledged O
architecture O
combining O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
approaches O
from O
the O
fields O
of O
natural O
language O
understanding O
including O
phonetic O
matching O
, O
automatic O
analysis O
of O
audio O
data O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
meta O
tag O
construction O
, O
content O
- O
based O
classification O
of O
audio O
and O
music O
ontologies O
as O
a O
backbone O
for O
the O
representation O
of O
musical O
knowledge O
. O

On O
top O
of O
this O
architecture O
different O
prototypes O
for O
industrial O
applications O
are O
described O
including O
first O
results O
of O

- O

field O

. O

This O
work O

been O

German O
Research O
Center O
for O
AI O
and O
the O
authors O
spin O
- O
off O
company O
, O

-DOCSTART- O

Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
despite O
being O
well O
studied O
, O
is O
computationally O
costly O
and O
arduous O
to O
scale O
. O

We O
explore O
lower O
- O
cost O
relaxations O
of O
information O
- O
theoretic O
PIR O
, O
based O
on O
dummy O
queries O
, O
sparse O
vectors O
, O
and O
compositions O
with O
an O
anonymity O
system O
. O

We O
prove O
the O
security O
of O
each O
scheme O
using O
a O
flexible O
differentially O
private O
definition O
for O
private O
queries O
that O
can O
capture O
notions O
of O
imperfect O
privacy O
. O

We O
show O
that O
basic O
schemes O
are O
weak O
, O
but O
some O
of O
them O
can O
be O
made O
arbitrarily O
safe O
by O
composing O
them O
with O
large O
anonymity O
systems O
. O

Extracting O
valuable O
information O
from O

code O

was O

of O
many O
research O
papers O
. O

Such O
information O
can O
be O

for O
document O
traceability O
, O
concept O
or O
feature O
extraction O
, O
etc O
. O

In O
this O

, O

used O
an O

Retrieval O
( O

) O
technique O
: O

( O

) O
for O
the O
automatic O
extraction O
of O
source O
code O
concepts O
for O
the O

of O
test O
cases’ O
reduction O
. O

We O
used O
and O
updated O
the O
open O
source O
FLAT O
Eclipse O
add O
on O
to O
try O
several O
code O

. O

The O

to O
check O

best O

to O
extract O
code O
concepts O
that O
can O

of O

cases’ O

or O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Automatic O
data O
extraction O
from O
Web O
pages O
is O
a O
challenging O
yet O
significant O
problem O
in O
the O
fields O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Data O
Mining O
. O

The O
problem O
arises O
particularly O
on O
the O
World O
- O
Wide O
Web O
, O
because O
search O
engines O
wrap O
up O
the O
results O
of O
user O
queries O
on O
web O
response O
pages O
. O

These O
response O
pages O
are O
often O
decorated O
with O
side O
bars O
, O
branding O
banners O
and O
advertisements O
. O

Automatic O
data O
extraction O
therefore O
has O
to O
deal O
with O
extracting O
relevant O
data O
from O
these O
pages O

Though O
many O
automated O
and O
manual O
text O
analysis O
solutions O
to O
this O
problem O
exist O
, O
most O
of O
them O
are O
heavily O
dependent O
on O
the O
specifics O
of O
HTML O
and O
they O
have O
to O
be O
changed O
according O
to O
the O
changes O
in O
markup O
language O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
, O
a O
novel O
and O
language O
independent O
technique O
to O
solve O
the O
data O
extraction O
problem O
using O
a O
combined O
approach O
that O
make O
use O
of O
features O
of O
DOM O
tree O
and O
also O
the O
visual O
features O
of O
html O
elements O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Usability O
is O
a O
combination O
of O
factors O
that O
affect O
the O
user O
’s O
experience O
with O
a O
system O
. O

These O
factors O
include O
but O
are O
not O
limited O
to O
: O
the O
ease O
of O
learning O
, O
the O
efficiency O
of O
use O
, O
memorability O
of O
a O
system O
( O
e.g. O
how O
effective O
a O
returning O
user O
can O
perform O
an O
old O
task O
without O
re O
- O
learning O
the O
system O
error O
prevention O
( O
i.e. O
how O
effective O
a O
system O
prevents O
problems O
from O
occurring O
in O
the O
first O
place O
and O
aesthetic O
and O
minimalist O
design O
. O

A O
problem O
with O
many O
of O
today O
’s O
online O
systems O
is O
that O
they O
do O
no O
meet O
the O

of O

. O

to O

can O
further O

. O

It O
has O
been O
recognized O
that O

words O
extracted O
from O
natural O
language O

are O
not O
always O
useful O
for O

of O
information O

. O

Associated O
or O

, O
and O

have O

. O

area O
of O

reviewed O
in O

for O

in O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

MIREX O
( O
MapReduce O
Information O
Retrieval O
Experiments O
) O
is O
a O
software O
library O
initially O
developed O
by O
the O
Database O
Group O
of O
the O
University O
of O
Twente O
for O
running O
large O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
experiments O
on O
clusters O
of O
machines O
. O

MIREX O
has O
been O
tested O
on O
web O
crawls O
of O
up O
to O
half O
a O
billion O
web O
pages O
, O
totaling O
about O
12.5 O
TB O
of O
data O
uncompressed O
. O

MIREX O
shows O
that O
the O
execution O
of O
test O
queries O
by O
a O
brute O
force O
linear O
scan O
of O
pages O
, O
is O
a O
viable O
alternative O
to O
running O
the O
test O
queries O
on O
a O
search O
engine O
's O
inverted O
index O
. O

MIREX O
is O
open O
source O
and O
available O
for O
others O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
exponential O
growth O
of O
documents O
available O
to O
us O
on O
the O
web O
, O
the O
requirement O
for O
an O
effective O
technique O
to O
retrieve O
the O
most O
relevant O
document O
matching O
a O
given O
search O
query O
has O
become O
critical O
. O

The O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
deals O
with O
the O
problem O
of O
document O
similarity O
to O
retrieve O
desired O
information O
from O
a O
large O
amount O
of O
data O
. O

Various O
models O
and O
similarity O
measures O
have O
been O
proposed O
to O
determine O
the O
extent O
of O
similarity O
between O
two O
objects O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
summarize O
the O
entire O
process O
, O
looking O
into O
some O
of O
the O
most O
well O
- O
known O
algorithms O
and O
approaches O
to O
match O
a O
query O
text O
against O
a O
set O
of O
indexed O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
review O
summarizes O
the O
main O
topics O
covered O
by O

presentations O
given O
at O

RIAO O
2007 O
Conference O
. O

The O
theme O
of O
this O
year O
's O
conference O
Large O
- O
scale O
Semantic O
Access O
to O
Content O
( O
Text O
, O
Image O
, O
Video O
and O
Sound O
encompasses O
two O
current O
, O
and O
recurring O
, O
challenges O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
: O
inclusion O
of O
semantics O
in O
retrieval O
and O
adaptation O
to O
different O
types O
of O
media O
. O

The O
use O
of O
the O
term O
" O
large O
- O
scale O
" O
underlines O
the O
need O
for O
scalable O
methods O
in O

- O

. O

2007 O
, O

, O
presented O
a O

of O
current O

in O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Conceptual O
graphs O
allow O
for O
powerful O
and O
computationally O
affordable O
representation O
of O
the O
semantic O
contents O
of O
natural O
language O
texts O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
method O
of O
comparison O
( O
approximate O
matching O
) O
of O
conceptual O
graphs O
. O

The O
method O
takes O
into O
account O
synonymy O
and O
subtype O
/ O
supertype O
relationships O
between O
the O
concepts O
and O
relations O
used O
in O
the O
conceptual O
graphs O
, O
thus O
allowing O
for O
greater O
flexibility O
of O
approximate O
matching O
. O

The O
method O
also O
allows O
the O
user O
to O
choose O
the O
desirable O
aspect O
of O
similarity O
in O
the O
cases O
when O
the O
two O
graphs O
can O
be O
generalized O
in O
different O
ways O
. O

The O
algorithm O
and O
examples O
of O
its O
application O
are O
presented O
. O

The O
results O
are O
potentially O
useful O
in O
a O
range O
of O
tasks O
requiring O
approximate O
semantic O
or O
another O
structural O
matching O
among O
them O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
text O
mining O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

While O
a O
number O
of O
commercial O
patent O
retrieval O
systems O
and O
services O
have O
long O
been O
operated O
, O
patent O
retrieval O
has O
not O
been O
paid O
much O
attention O
in O
the O
information O
retrieval O
community O
. O

One O
of O
the O
reasons O
is O
the O
lack O
of O
test O
collection O
targeting O
patent O
information O
. O

Although O
TREC O
test O
collection O
includes O
patent O
documents O
, O
the O
proportion O
of O
those O
documents O
is O
significantly O
small O
. O

Because O
patent O
documents O
are O
associated O
with O
a O
number O
of O
interesting O
characteristics O
from O
a O
scientific O
point O
of O
view O
, O
such O
as O
document O
length O
, O
document O
structures O
, O
and O
classifications O
, O
it O
is O
important O
to O
provide O
a O
test O
collection O
consisting O
of O
patent O
documents O
and O
promote O
research O
and O
development O
on O
patent O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O

) O

Forum O

is O
the O

of O
deciding O
whether O
two O
given O
text O
fragments O
have O
the O
same O
meaning O
. O

Our O

is O
for O
Malayalam O
language O

makes O

of O
the O
cosine O

measure O
, O
an O
existing O
state O
of O
the O
art O
method O
for O
determining O
the O
similarity O
between O
sentences O
. O

The O

were O
done O

the O

data O

the O

showed O
that O
the O

was O

to O

performance O
comparable O
to O

employing O
more O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
Content O
- O
based O

Retrieval O
Sys- O
tems O
( O

) O

characteristics O
, O
this O
is O

primary O
characteristics O

, O

, O

. O

. O

. O

moti- O

for O

. O

mental O

is O

to O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
majority O
of O
research O
into O
Collaborative O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CIR O
) O
has O
assumed O
a O
uniformity O
of O
information O
access O
and O
visibility O
between O
collaborators O
. O

However O
in O
a O

of O
real O
world O
scenarios O
, O

is O
not O
uniform O
between O
all O

in O
a O
team O
e.g. O
security O
, O
health O
etc O
. O

This O
can O
be O
referred O
to O
as O
Multi O
- O
Level O
Collaborative O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MLCIR O
To O
the O
best O
of O
our O
knowledge O
, O
there O
has O
not O
yet O
been O
any O
systematic O
investigation O
of O
the O
effect O
of O
MLCIR O
on O
search O
outcomes O
. O

To O
address O
this O
shortcoming O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
the O
results O
of O
a O
simulated O
evaluation O
conducted O
over O
4 O
different O
non O
- O
uniform O
information O
access O
scenarios O
and O
3 O
different O
collaborative O
search O
strategies O
. O

Results O
indicate O
that O
there O
is O
some O
tolerance O
to O
removing O
access O
to O
the O
collection O
and O
that O
there O
may O
not O
always O
be O
a O
negative O
impact O
on O
performance O
. O

We O
also O
highlight O
how O
different O
access O
scenarios O
and O
search O
strategies O
impact O
on O
search O
outcomes O
. O

' O

A O
new O
means O
of O
evaluating O
the O
cluster O
hypothesis O
is O
introduced O
and O
the O
results O
of O
such O

are O

for O
four O

. O

of O

- O

of O

documents O

are O

. O

These O

indicate O
that O
while O

of O

the O
palrwise O

. O

However O
, O

of O

in O

to O
a O
query O
usually O
results O
in O
a O
poorer O
performance O
than O

of O

documents O
from O

. O

out O
- O
of O
- O

. O

and O

- O

. O

on O

a O
story O
- O
based O

- O

. O

to O

a O

- O
based O
LM O
. O

Experiments O
were O
carried O
out O
for O
a O
European O
Portuguese O
BN O
transcription O
system O
. O

Preliminary O
results O
yield O
a O
relative O
reduction O
of O
65.2 O
% O
in O
OOV O
and O
6.6 O
% O
in O
WER O
. O

of O

with O

. O

Tree O
structures O
play O
an O
important O
role O
in O
computer O
science O
. O

For O
instance O
, O
the O
binary O
tree O
is O
a O
fundamental O
data O
structure O
for O
rapidly O
storing O
sorted O
data O
and O
rapidly O
retrieving O
stored O
data O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
establish O
the O
structures O
of O
k O
- O
noncrossing O
trees O
and O
k O
- O
proper O
trees O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
relations O
between O
these O
structures O
and O
k O
- O
ary O
trees O
are O
also O
constructed O
. O

It O
exposes O
that O
such O
structures O
may O
be O
employed O
as O
efficient O
data O
structures O
for O
computer O
and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
reviews O
and O
compares O
theories O
of O
fuzzy O
sets O
and O
rough O
sets O
applying O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Vagueness O
and O
uncertainty O
have O
attracted O
the O
attention O
of O
philosophers O
and O
logicians O
for O
many O
years O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
synthetically O
present O
the O
rough O
set O
and O
fuzzy O
set O
approach O
to O
the O
modeling O
of O
flexibility O
with O
respect O
to O
vagueness O
and O
uncertainty O
in O
the O
specification O
of O
users’ O
information O
needs O
. O

The O
two O
theories O
model O
different O
types O
of O
uncertainty O
.The O

rough O
set O
theory O
takes O
into O
consideration O
the O
indiscernibility O
between O
objects O
; O
typically O
characterized O
by O
an O
equivalence O
relation O
. O

Rough O
sets O
are O
the O
results O
of O
approximating O
crisp O
sets O
using O
equivalence O
classes O
. O

The O
fuzzy O
set O
theory O
deals O
with O
the O
ill O
- O
definition O
of O
the O
boundary O
of O
a O
class O
through O
a O
continuous O
generalization O
of O
set O
characteristic O
functions O
. O

The O
indiscernibility O
between O
objects O
is O
not O
used O
in O
fuzzy O
set O
theory O
. O

So O
the O
membership O
relation O
is O
best O
theory O
for O
categorization O
of O
two O
theories O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
term O
relevance O
weighting O
method O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
produce O
optimal O
information O
retrieval O
queries O
under O
well O
- O
defined O
conditions O
. O

The O
parameters O
needed O
to O
generate O
the O
term O
relevance O
factors O
can O
not O
unfortunately O
be O
estimated O
accurately O
in O
practice O
; O
futhermore O
, O
in O
realistic O
test O
situations O
, O
it O
appears O
difficult O
to O
obtain O
improved O
retrieval O
results O
using O
the O
term O
relevance O
weights O
over O
much O
simpler O
term O
weighting O
systems O
such O
as O
, O
for O
example O
, O
the O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
weights O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
in O
this O
study O
that O
the O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
weights O
and O
the O
term O
relevance O
weights O
are O
closely O
related O
over O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
the O
frequency O
spectrum O
. O

Methods O
are O
introduced O
for O
estimating O
the O
term O
relevance O
weights O
, O
and O
experimental O
results O
are O
given O
comparing O
the O
inverse O
document O
frequency O
with O
the O
estimated O
term O
relevance O
weights O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
attracting O
significant O
attention O
due O
to O
the O
exponential O
growth O
of O
the O
amount O
of O
information O
available O
in O
digital O
format O
. O

The O
proliferation O
of O
information O
retrieval O
objects O
, O
including O
algorithms O
, O
methods O
, O
technologies O
, O
and O
tools O
, O
makes O
it O
difficult O
to O
assess O
their O
capabilities O
and O
features O
and O
to O
understand O
the O
relationships O
that O
exist O
among O
them O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
terminology O
is O
often O
confusing O
and O
misleading O
, O
as O
different O
terms O
are O
used O
to O
denote O
the O
same O
, O
or O
similar O
, O
tasks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
opposed O
to O
traditional O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
which O
views O
whole O
documents O
as O
atomic O
units O
of O
retrieval O
, O
XML O
IR O
processes O
XML O
elements O
as O
possible O
units O
of O
retrieval O
. O

Many O
open O
issues O
appear O
when O
considering O
Relevance O
Feedback O
( O
RF O
) O
in O
XML O
documents O
. O

They O
are O
mainly O
related O
to O
the O
form O
of O
XML O
documents O
that O
mix O
content O
and O
structure O
and O
to O
the O
new O
granularity O
of O
information O
processed O
by O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRS O
Most O
of O
the O
RF O
approaches O
proposed O
in O
XML O
retrieval O
are O
simple O
adaptations O
of O
traditional O
RF O
to O
the O
new O
granularity O
of O
information O
. O

They O
enrich O
queries O
by O
adding O
terms O
extracted O
from O
relevant O
elements O
instead O
of O
terms O
extracted O
from O
whole O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
extend O
the O
initial O
query O
by O
adding O
both O
content O
and O
structural O
constraints O
. O

Experiments O
are O
carried O
out O
with O
the O
INEX O
evaluation O
campaign O
and O
results O
show O
the O
interest O
of O
our O
method O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
unsupervised O
method O
for O
discovering O
inference O
rules O
from O
text O
, O
such O
as O
“ O
X O
is O
author O
of O
Y O
X O
wrote O
Y O
X O
solved O
Y O
X O
found O
a O
solution O
to O
Y O
and O
“ O
X O

caused O
Y O
Y O
is O
triggered O
by O
X O
Inference O
rules O
are O
extremely O
important O
in O
many O
fields O
such O
as O
natural O
language O
processing O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
artificial O
intelligence O
in O
general O
. O

Our O
algorithm O
is O
based O
on O
an O
extended O
version O
of O
Harris’ O
Distributional O
Hypothesis O
, O
which O
states O
that O
words O
that O
occurred O
in O
the O
same O
contexts O
tend O
to O
be O
similar O
. O

Instead O
of O
using O
this O
hypothesis O
on O
words O
, O
we O
apply O
it O
to O
paths O
in O
the O
dependency O
trees O
of O
a O
parsed O
corpus O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
adaptation O
technique O
for O
search O
engines O
to O
better O
support O
information O
- O
seeking O
activities O
that O
include O
both O
lookup O
and O
exploratory O
tasks O
. O

Building O
on O
previous O
findings O
, O
we O
describe O
( O
1 O
) O
a O
classifier O
that O
recognizes O
task O
type O
( O
lookup O
vs. O
exploratory O
) O
as O
a O
user O
is O
searching O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
a O
reinforcement O
learning O
based O
search O
engine O
that O
adapts O
accordingly O
the O
balance O
of O
exploration O
/ O
exploitation O
in O
ranking O
the O
documents O
. O

This O
allows O
supporting O
both O
task O
types O
surreptitiously O
without O
changing O
the O
familiar O
list O
- O
based O
interface O
. O

Search O
results O
include O
more O
diverse O
results O
when O
users O
are O
exploring O
and O
more O
precise O
results O
for O
lookup O
tasks O
. O

Users O
found O
more O
useful O
results O
in O
exploratory O
tasks O
when O
compared O
to O
a O
base O
- O
line O
system O
, O
which O
is O
specifically O
tuned O
for O
lookup O
tasks O
. O

of O

of O

as O

through O

to O

' O
work O

illustrates O
that O

of O
the O

of O

of O
the O

of O
a O

plays O
a O
strong O

in O
ambiguity O
's O

of O

. O

to O

of O

. O

to O

, O

in O

, O

for O
the O
processes O
' O
impact O
( O
or O
lack O
of O
it O
) O
on O
effectiveness O
. O

Query O
disambiguation O
is O
considered O
as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
methods O
in O
improving O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
the O
present O
paper O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
query O
terms O
disambiguation O
via O
, O
a O
combined O
statistical O
method O
both O
before O
and O
after O
translation O
, O
in O
order O
to O
avoid O
source O
language O
ambiguity O
as O
well O
as O
incorrect O
selection O
of O
target O
translations O
. O

By O
combining O
query O
expansion O
with O
dictionary O
- O
based O
translation O
and O
statistics O
- O
based O
disambiguation O
, O
in O
order O
to O
overcome O
query O
terms O
ambiguity O
, O
information O
retrieval O
should O
become O
much O
more O
efficient O
. O

Thus O
, O
query O
expansion O
techniques O
through O
relevance O
feedback O
were O
performed O
prior O
to O
either O
the O
first O
or O
the O
second O
disambiguation O
processes O
. O

We O
tested O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
combined O
method O
, O
by O
an O
application O
to O
a O
French O
- O
English O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Experiments O
involving O
TREC O
data O
collection O
revealed O
the O
proposed O
disambiguation O
and O
expansion O
methods O
to O
be O
highly O
effective O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
are O
traditionally O
developed O
using O
the O
objective O
relevance O
approach O
based O
on O
the O
“ O
best O
match O
” O
principle O
assuming O
that O
users O
can O
specify O
their O
needs O
in O
queries O
and O
that O
the O
documents O
retrieved O
are O
relevant O
to O
them O
. O

This O
paper O
advocates O
a O
subjective O
relevance O
( O
SR O
) O
approach O
to O
value O
- O
add O
objective O
relevance O
and O
address O
its O
limitations O
by O
considering O
relevance O
in O
terms O
of O
users’ O
needs O
and O
contexts O
. O

A O
pilot O
study O
was O
conducted O
to O
elicit O
features O
on O
SR O
from O
experts O
and O
novices O
. O

Elicited O
features O
were O
then O
analyzed O
using O
characteristics O
of O
SR O
types O
and O
stages O
in O
information O
seeking O
to O
inform O
the O
design O
of O
an O
IR O
interface O
supporting O
SR O
. O

The O
paper O
presents O
initial O
work O
towards O
the O
design O
and O
development O
of O
user O
- O
centered O
IR O
systems O
that O
prompt O
features O
supporting O
the O
four O
main O
types O
of O
SR O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
method O
of O
creating O
a O
web O
document O
representation O
using O
a O
web O
ontology O
concepts O
instead O
of O
‘ O
bag O
- O
ofwords O

However O
, O
since O
the O
web O
domain O
has O
a O
very O
small O
vocabulary O
, O
we O
are O
unable O

transform O
all O
or O

of O

of O

into O
web O
ontology O
concepts O
. O

This O
particular O
problem O
is O
solved O
by O
creating O
an O
extended O
part O
of O
the O
web O
ontology O
with O
words O
obtained O
from O
an O
external O

knowledgebase O
. O

The O
promising O
outcome O
as O
the O

of O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
and O
Information O

( O

) O
fields O
being O
merged O
together O
convinces O
us O
to O
create O
the O

ontology O
using O
NLP O
technique O
. O

The O
concepts O
of O
information O
increment O
and O
demand O
information O
value O
in O
supply O
chains O
are O
defined O
, O
and O
then O
the O
measurement O
methods O
of O
them O
are O
established O
basing O
on O
the O
theory O
of O
information O
science O
. O

The O
mechanism O
of O
demand O
information O
influencing O
the O

process O
and O
the O
wholesaler O
's O
expected O

is O
clarified O
by O
building O
a O
supply O
chain O
ordering O
model O
. O

The O
relationship O
between O
information O
increment O
and O
information O
value O
is O
studied O
, O
when O
assuming O
the O
demands O
are O
uniformly O
and O
normally O
distributed O
. O

The O
results O
of O
the O
analysis O
and O
the O

experiment O
prove O
that O
there O
is O
a O
positive O
correlation O
between O

and O
information O

, O
and O

increment O
can O

the O
information O

's O

. O

The O

suggest O
that O

is O

to O

an O

system O
for O

in O

chains O
to O
increase O
their O
benefits O
by O
improving O
the O
quality O
of O
decision O
information O
. O

to O

of O

Recent O
developments O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
diversity O
are O
based O
on O
the O
consideration O
of O
a O
space O
of O
information O
need O
aspects O
, O
a O
notion O
which O
takes O
different O
forms O
in O
the O
literature O
. O

The O
choice O
of O
a O
suitable O
aspect O
space O
for O
diversification O
is O
a O
critical O
issue O
when O
designing O

strategy O
, O
which O
has O
not O
been O
explicitly O

to O
some O
depth O

. O

This O
paper O

to O

of O
the O
aspect O
space O
which O
may O
help O
the O
system O
designer O
in O

in O
selecting O
and O
configuring O
this O
space O
, O
and O
diagnosing O
malfunctions O
of O
the O

algorithms O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
identify O
the O
mutual O
information O
between O
aspects O
and O
documents O
as O
a O
meaningful O
magnitude O
, O
in O
terms O
of O
which O
anomalous O
cases O
can O
be O
characterized O
. O

We O
further O
seek O
to O
discern O
favorable O
cases O
through O
a O
combination O
of O
theoretic O
and O
empirical O
analysis O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Separating O
singing O
voice O
from O
music O
accompaniment O
is O
very O
useful O
in O
many O
applications O
, O
such O
as O
lyrics O
recognition O
and O
alignment O
, O
singer O
identification O
, O
and O
music O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Although O
speech O
separation O
has O
been O
extensively O
studied O
for O
decades O
, O
singing O
voice O
separation O
has O
been O
little O
investigated O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
system O
to O
separate O
singing O
voice O
from O
music O
accompaniment O
for O
monaural O
recordings O
. O

Our O
system O
consists O
of O
three O
stages O
. O

The O
singing O
voice O
detection O
stage O
partitions O
and O
classifies O
an O
input O
into O
vocal O
and O
nonvocal O
portions O
. O

For O
vocal O
portions O
, O
the O
predominant O
pitch O
detection O
stage O
detects O
the O
pitch O
of O
the O
singing O
voice O
and O
then O
the O
separation O
stage O
uses O
the O
detected O
pitch O
to O
group O
the O
time O
- O
frequency O
segments O
of O
the O
singing O
voice O
. O

Quantitative O
results O
show O
that O
the O
system O
performs O
the O
separation O
task O
successfully O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
study O
, O
we O
present O
the O
analysis O
of O
the O

of O
a O

Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
, O

a O

network O
versus O

access O
network O
. O

The O

show O
that O

of O
a O

network O
improves O

performance O
, O
especially O
in O
a O

system O
because O
the O
switched O
network O
prevents O

of O

network O
, O
particularly O

a O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
a O
study O
of O
Turkish O
- O
English O
cross O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O

) O
system O
. O

One O
of O

is O
to O
access O
to O
bi O
- O
lingual O

. O

So O
, O

- O

. O

We O
have O

that O
has O
1801 O

. O

The O

, O

. O

Latent O

( O

) O

to O

to O

. O

After O

have O

of O

( O

) O
to O

of O

based O

on O
Turkish O
- O
English O
parallel O

. O

Our O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
, O
LSI O
based O

outperforms O
the O
non O
- O
LSI O
based O
retrieval O
where O
their O

successes O
are O
% O
69 O
and O
% O
26 O
respectively O
. O

( O

This O

for O

. O

Data O

incorporated O

helps O
to O

. O

- O

. O

The O

in O
Google O
Cloud O
using O

Engine O

performance O

, O

and O

, O
to O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Previous O
research O
on O
stemming O
has O
shown O
both O
positive O
and O
negative O
effects O
on O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
experiment O
in O
which O
several O
linguistic O
and O
non O
- O
linguistic O
stemmers O
are O
evaluated O
on O
a O
Dutch O
test O
collection O
. O

Experiments O
especially O
focus O
on O
the O
measurement O
of O
Recall O
. O

Results O
show O
that O
linguistic O
stemming O
restricted O
to O
inflection O
yields O
a O
significant O
improvement O
over O
full O
linguistic O
and O
non O
- O
linguistic O
stemming O
, O
both O
in O
average O
Precision O
and O
R O
- O
Recall O
. O

Best O
results O
are O
obtained O
with O
a O
linguistic O
stemmer O
which O
is O
enhanced O
with O
compound O
analysis O
. O

This O
version O
has O
a O
significantly O
better O
Recall O
than O
a O
system O
without O
stemming O
, O
without O
a O
significant O
deterioration O
of O
Precision O
. O

Peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
( O

) O
networks O
have O

as O
a O

to O
build O

. O

The O

paradigm O
holds O
many O
promises O
, O
e.g. O
scalability O
, O
failure O
resilience O
and O
increased O
autonomy O
of O
nodes O
. O

For O
these O
reasons O
P2P O
seems O
also O
to O
be O
an O
interesting O
architectural O

for O

scale O
information O

systems O
. O

However O
, O

methods O

are O
still O
mostly O
limited O
to O
simple O
keyword O
queries O
and O
the O
use O
of O
advanced O
retrieval O
models O
is O
in O
its O
infancy O
. O

- O

. O

) O

. O

data O
’s O

usage O

, O
Knowledge O
Organisation O

/ O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
is O
a O
mine O
of O
information O
for O
most O
people O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
huge O
amount O
of O
‎information O
and O
documents O
available O
on O
the O
internet O
, O
the O
process O
‎of O
retrieving O
documents O
that O
are O
most O
relevant O
to O
user O
needs O
become O
a O
tremendous O
problem O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
‎that O
, O
the O
time O
needed O
for O
retrieving O
what O
a O
user O
searches O
for O
‎increases O
dramatically O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
island O
genetic O
algorithm O
( O
IGA O
) O
is O
applied O
to O
achieve O
parallelism O
and O
speed O
up O
the O
web O
information O
retrieval O
‎process O

To O
retrieve O
pages O
most O
relevant O
to O
user O
needs O
, O
four O
different O
islands O
are O
developed O
. O

Each O
island O
has O
different O
selection O
method O
, O
and O
different O
‎fitness O
function O
. O

These O
islands O
are O
executed O
‎independently O
on O
different O
servers O
to O
achieve O
the O
parallel O
‎behavior O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
results O
obtained O
by O
the O
four O
islands O
are O
combined O
and O
passed O
to O
a O
decision O
making O
phase O
to O
choose O
the O
documents O
most O
relevant O
to O
user O
query O
. O

Cosine O
similarity O
measure O
is O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
proposed O
technique O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Today O
, O
XML O
is O
used O
in O
three O
different O
ways O
. O

First O
, O
XML O
is O
used O
as O
a O
markup O
language O
, O
where O
documents O
are O
considered O
to O
be O
trees O
( O
with O
the O
occasional O
hyper O
link O
added O
) O
which O
represent O
the O
document O
structure O
. O

Secondly O
, O
XML O
is O
used O
as O
an O
interchange O
format O
for O
structured O
data O
. O

Here O
, O
a O
document O
is O
considered O
as O
a O
set O
of O
fields O
, O
each O
of O
which O
has O
a O
specific O
data O
type O
. O

The O
third O
aspect O
is O
to O
use O
XML O
to O
represent O
text O
, O
where O
a O
document O
consists O
of O
words O
which O
can O
be O
stemmed O
and O
phrases O
and O
the O
like O
. O

Obviously O
, O
a O
single O
XML O
document O
may O
represent O
more O
than O
one O
of O
these O
aspects O
, O
so O
for O
querying O
XML O
we O
need O
a O
query O
language O
which O
takes O
into O
account O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Collaborative O
filtering O
as O
a O
classical O
method O
of O
information O
retrieval O
has O
been O
widely O
used O
in O
helping O
people O
to O
deal O
with O
information O
overload O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
introduce O
the O
concept O
of O
local O
user O
similarity O
and O
global O
user O
similarity O
, O
based O
on O
surprisal O
- O
based O
vector O
similarity O
and O
the O
application O
of O
the O
concept O
of O
maximin O
distance O
in O
graph O
theory O
. O

Surprisal O
- O
based O
vector O
similarity O
expresses O
the O
relationship O
between O
any O
two O
users O
based O
on O
the O
quantities O
of O
information O
( O
called O
surprisal O
) O
contained O
in O
their O
ratings O
. O

Global O
user O
similarity O
defines O
two O
users O
being O
similar O
if O
they O
can O
be O
connected O
through O
their O
locally O
similar O
neighbors O
. O

Based O
on O
both O
of O
Local O
User O
Similarity O
and O
Global O
User O
Similarity O
, O
we O
develop O
a O
collaborative O
filtering O
framework O
called O
LS&GS O
. O

An O
empirical O
study O
using O
the O
MovieLens O
dataset O
shows O
that O
our O
proposed O
framework O
outperforms O
other O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
collaborative O
filtering O
algorithms O
. O

An O
efficient O
variant O
of O
an O
optimal O
algorithm O
is O
presented O
, O
which O
, O
in O
the O
context O
of O
a O
large O
dynamic O
fulltext O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O

data O
that O
has O
been O
compressed O
by O
an O
on O
- O

- O
fly O
compression O
method O
based O
on O
LZ77 O
, O
into O
a O
more O
compact O
form O
, O
without O
changing O
the O
decoding O
procedure O
. O

The O
algorithm O
accelerates O
a O
known O
technique O
based O
on O
a O
reduction O
to O
a O
graph O
- O
theoretic O
problem O
, O
by O
reducing O
the O
size O
of O
the O
graph O
, O
without O
affecting O
the O
optimality O
of O
the O
solution O
. O

The O
new O
method O
can O
thus O
effectively O
improve O
any O
dictionary O
compression O
scheme O
using O
a O
static O
encoding O
method O
. O

of O

, O
items O
/ O
parts O
information O
are O
embodied O
in O
product O
nomenclatures O
. O

They O
may O
change O
due O
the O
variety O
of O
production O
growth O
in O
conditions O
which O
the O
codification O
of O
parts O
used O
can O
remain O
unchanged O
. O

Also O
, O
can O
occur O
in O
nomenclature O
, O
various O
items O
/ O
parts O
with O
incomplete O
information O
. O

This O

can O
generate O
a O
number O
of O
issues O
related O
to O
the O
assessment O
inventory O
and O
flows O
of O
equipment O
. O

can O

the O

in O

. O

. O

A O
novel O
information O
structure O
and O
its O
use O
for O
query O
expansion O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
information O
structure O
, O
called O
a O
similarity O
thesaurus O
, O
consists O
of O
term O
- O
term O
similarities O
that O
are O
based O
on O
how O
the O
terms O
of O
a O
collection O
\are O
indexed O
" O
by O
the O
documents O
. O

It O
reeects O
domain O
knowledge O
about O
the O
collection O
and O
is O
used O
to O
select O
and O
weight O
additional O
query O
terms O
when O
expanding O
a O
query O
. O

This O
is O
in O
contrast O
to O
conventional O
query O
expansion O
methods O
as O
the O
similarity O
between O
candidate O
terms O
and O
the O
concept O
of O
the O
entire O
query O
is O
taken O
into O
account O
. O

Experiments O
on O
the O
TREC O
collection O
show O
that O
the O
retrieval O
eeectiveness O
is O
considerably O
higher O
when O
this O
method O
is O
applied O
. O

The O
hope O
is O
that O
this O
concept O
- O
based O
query O
expansion O
can O
also O
be O
used O
to O
produce O
better O
results O
in O
large O
- O
scale O
operational O
IR O
environments O
. O

a O

scheme O

data O
to O
send O

is O

which O

a O

function O
performs O
satisfactorily O

to O

of O

( O

) O

( O

) O

In O

Learning O
techniques O
of O

to O
the O

of O

and O

text O
with O
respect O
to O
an O
information O
extraction O
task O
. O

Specifically O
, O

probability O
models O
are O
used O
. O

Like O
IR O
systems O
, O
they O
use O
little O
semantics O
, O
are O
fully O
trainable O
and O
do O
not O
require O
any O
knowledge O
representation O
of O
the O
domain O
. O

Unlike O

documents O
are O
considered O
as O
a O
dynamic O

of O
words O
. O

Furthermore O

information O
is O

included O
in O
the O
representation O
. O

Models O
are O
evaluated O
on O
a O
sub O
- O
task O
of O
the O
MUC6 O
Scenario O
Template O
corpus O
. O

information O
is O
introduced O
into O
the O
representation O
, O
an O
increase O
in O
performances O
is O
observed O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
paper O
we O
deal O
with O
automatic O
detection O
of O
anchoring O
segments O
in O
a O
collection O
of O
TV O
programmes O
. O

The O
anchoring O
segments O
are O
intended O
to O
be O
further O
used O
as O
a O
basis O
for O
subsequent O
hyperlinking O
to O
another O
related O
video O
segments O
. O

The O
anchoring O
segments O
are O
therefore O
supposed O
to O
be O
fetching O
for O
the O
users O
of O
the O
collection O
. O

Using O
the O
hyperlinks O
, O
the O
users O
can O
easily O
navigate O
through O
the O
collection O
and O
find O
more O
information O
about O
the O
topic O
of O
their O
interest O
. O

We O
present O
two O
approaches O
, O
one O
based O
on O
metadata O
, O
the O
second O
one O
based O
on O
frequencies O
of O
proper O
names O
and O
numbers O
contained O
in O
the O
segments O
. O

Both O
approaches O
proved O
to O
be O
helpful O
for O
different O
aspects O
of O
anchoring O
problem O
: O
the O
segments O
which O
contain O
a O
large O
number O
of O
proper O
names O
and O
numbers O
are O
interesting O
for O
the O
users O
, O
while O
the O
segments O
most O
similar O
to O
the O
video O
description O
are O
highly O
informative O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
the O
use O
of O
local O
context O
as O
a O
way O
to O
semantic O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
our O
model O
, O
rather O
than O
trying O
to O
formalize O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
documents O
among O
which O
the O
search O
is O
done O
( O
e.g. O
by O
formally O
annotating O
them O
we O
try O
to O
automatically O
build O
a O
representation O
of O
the O
context O
in O
which O
the O
search O
is O
done O
. O

We O
consider O
that O
search O
is O
always O
done O
as O
part O
of O
an O
activity O
, O
and O
that O
the O
search O
context O
is O
determined O
by O
the O
activity O
that O
is O
carried O
out O
at O
a O
particular O
moment O
. O

Many O
activities O
that O
a O
person O
is O
engaged O
in O
are O
carried O
out O
with O
the O
help O
of O
a O
computer O
, O
and O
leave O
a O
digital O
trace O
in O
the O
files O
that O
are O
created O
in O
connection O
to O
it O
. O

We O
take O
these O
files O
, O
and O
the O
structural O
relations O
between O
the O
directories O
in O
which O
they O
are O
stored O
, O
as O
a O
starting O
point O
for O
the O
representation O
of O
context O
. O

amenable O
to O

, O

in O

. O

operations O
are O

to O

retrieval O
and O

systems O
. O

tional O
linguistics O

) O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
novel O
Probabilistic O
Latent O
Semantic O
Analysis O
- O
based O
( O
PLSA O
- O
based O
) O
aspect O
model O
and O
turn O
cross O
- O
media O
retrieval O
into O
two O
parts O
of O
multi O
- O
modal O
integration O
and O
correlation O
propagation O
. O

We O
first O
use O
multivariate O
Gaussian O
distributions O
to O
model O
continuous O
quantity O
in O
PLSA O
, O
avoiding O
information O
loss O
between O
feature O
- O
instance O
versus O
real O
- O
world O
matching O
. O

Multi O
- O
modal O
correlations O
are O
learned O
in O
an O
asymmetrical O
manner O
, O
giving O
a O
better O
control O
of O
the O
respective O
influence O
of O
each O
modality O
in O
the O
latent O
space O
. O

Then O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
propagation O
pattern O
to O
refine O
multi O
- O
modal O
correlations O
by O
efficiently O
taking O
the O
complementary O
from O
multi O
- O
modalities O
. O

Experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
our O
method O
is O
accurate O
and O
robust O
for O
cross O
- O
media O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
more O
and O
more O
collections O
of O
data O
are O
becoming O
available O
on O
the O
web O
to O
everyone O
, O
non O
expert O
users O
demand O
easy O
ways O
to O
retrieve O
data O
from O
these O
collections O
. O

One O
solution O
is O
the O
so O
called O
Visual O
Query O
Systems O
( O
VQS O
) O
where O
queries O
are O
represented O
visually O
and O
users O
do O
not O
have O
to O
understand O
query O
languages O
such O
as O
SQL O
or O
XQuery O
. O

In O
1996 O
, O
a O
paper O
by O
Catarci O
reviewed O
the O
Visual O
Query O
Systems O
available O
until O
that O
year O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
review O
VQSs O
from O
1997 O
until O
now O
and O
try O
to O
determine O
whether O
they O
have O
been O
the O
solution O
for O
non O
expert O
users O
. O

The O
short O
answer O
is O
no O
because O
very O
few O
systems O
have O
in O
fact O
been O
used O
in O
real O
environments O
or O
as O
commercial O
tools O
. O

We O
have O
also O
gathered O
basic O
features O
of O
VQSs O
such O
as O
the O
visual O
representation O
adopted O
to O
present O
the O
reality O
of O
interest O
or O
the O
visual O
representation O
adopted O
to O
express O
queries O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
objective O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
present O
a O
textual O
similarity O
model O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
based O
on O
the O
Distributional O
Semantic O
( O
DS O
) O
model O
. O

This O
model O
is O
an O
extension O
of O
the O
standard O
Vector O
Space O
model O
, O
which O
further O
takes O
into O
account O
the O
co O
- O
frequencies O
between O
the O
terms O
in O
a O
given O
reference O
corpus O
, O
that O
are O
considered O
to O
provide O
a O
distributional O
representation O
of O
the O
" O
semantics O
" O
of O
the O
terms O
. O

Practical O
retrieval O
experiments O
using O
DSbased O
similarity O
models O
have O
been O
conducted O
in O
the O
framework O
of O
the O
AMARYLLIS O
evaluation O
campaign O
. O

The O
results O
obtained O
are O
presented O
, O
and O
indicate O
significant O
improvement O
of O
the O
performance O
in O
comparison O
with O
the O
standard O
approach O
. O

similarity O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Distributional O
Semantics O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Paraphrasing O
means O
expressing O
or O
conveying O
the O
same O
meaning O
or O
essence O
of O
a O
sentence O
or O
text O
using O
different O
words O
or O
rearrangement O
of O
words O
. O

Paraphrase O
detection O
is O
a O
challenge O
, O
especially O
in O
Indian O
languages O
like O
Hindi O
, O
because O
it O
is O
very O
essential O
to O
understand O
the O
semantics O
of O
the O
language O
. O

Detecting O
paraphrases O
is O
very O
relevant O
in O
real O
life O
because O
it O
has O
a O
lot O
of O
importance O
in O
applications O
like O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Extraction O
and O
Text O
Summarization O
. O

This O
paper O
focuses O
on O
using O
Machine O
Learning O
classification O
techniques O
for O
detecting O
paraphrases O
in O
Hindi O
language O
for O
the O
DPIL O
Task O
in O
Fire O
2016 O
. O

A O
feature O
vector O
based O
approach O
has O
been O
used O
for O
detecting O
paraphrases O
. O

The O
task O
involves O
checking O
whether O
a O
given O
pair O
of O
sentences O
conveys O
the O
same O
information O
and O
meaning O
even O
if O
they O
are O
written O
in O
different O
forms O
. O

Given O
a O
pair O
of O
sentences O
in O
Hindi O
, O
the O
proposed O
technique O
labels O
whether O
the O
pair O
of O
sentences O
are O
Paraphrases O
( O
P O
Semi O
- O
Paraphrases O
( O
SP O
) O
or O
Not O
Paraphrases O
( O
NP O
) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
basic O
classification O
techniques O
for O
organizing O
information O
are O
thesauri O
, O
taxonomy O
and O
faceted O
classification O
. O

Topic O
map O
is O
relatively O
a O
new O
entrant O
to O
this O
information O
space O
. O

Topic O
map O
standard O
describes O
how O
complex O
relationships O
between O
abstract O
concepts O
and O
real O
world O
resources O
can O
be O
represented O
using O
XML O
syntax O
. O

This O
paper O
explores O
how O
topic O
map O
incorporates O
the O
traditional O
techniques O
and O
what O
are O
its O
advantages O
and O
disadvantages O
in O
several O
dimensions O
such O
as O
content O
management O
, O
indexing O
, O
knowledge O
representation O
, O
constraint O
specification O
and O
query O
languages O
in O
the O
context O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
constructs O
of O
topic O
maps O
are O
illustrated O
with O
a O
use O
- O
case O
implemented O
in O
XTM O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
anomaly O
detection O
in O
streaming O
communication O
data O
. O

We O
first O
build O
a O
stochastic O
model O
for O
the O
system O
based O
on O
temporal O
communication O
patterns O
across O
each O
edge O
, O
which O
we O
call O
the O
REWARDS O
( O
REneWal O
theory O
Approach O
for O
Real O
- O
time O
Data O
Streams O
) O
model O
. O

We O
then O
define O
a O
measure O
of O
anomaly O
for O
an O
arbitrary O
subgraph O
based O
on O
the O
likelihood O
of O
its O
recent O
activity O
given O
past O
behavior O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
develop O
an O
algorithm O
to O
efficiently O
identify O
subgraphs O
with O
the O
most O
anomalous O
activity O
. O

Although O
our O
work O
has O
until O
now O
focused O
on O
the O
cybersecurity O
domain O
, O
the O
model O
we O
present O
is O
more O
broadly O
applicable O
to O
information O
retrieval O
in O
data O
streams O
and O
information O
networks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Although O
recently O
crowd O
sourcing O
has O
become O
popular O
, O
the O
reliability O
of O
crowdsourced O
results O
has O
been O
questioned O
because O
of O
workers O
' O
varied O
degrees O
of O
attention O
, O
skill O
, O
and O
accuracy O
. O

Therefore O
, O
understanding O
the O
factors O
that O
affect O
the O
reliability O
of O
crowd O
sourcing O
is O
crucial O
. O

Using O
crowdsourcing O
has O
recently O
proposed O
as O
an O
alternative O
to O
create O
relevance O
judgments O
for O
the O
evaluation O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
as O
traditional O
methods O
are O
expensive O
and O
scale O
poorly O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
study O
is O
to O
measure O
selected O
cognitive O
ability O
( O
general O
reasoning O
skill O
) O
of O
crowdsourced O
workers O
, O
and O
investigate O
the O
effect O
that O
this O
characteristic O
has O
upon O
judgment O
reliability O
, O
as O
measured O
against O
a O
human O
gold O
standard O
. O

A O
significant O
correlation O
was O
found O
between O
judgment O
reliability O
and O
measured O
general O
reasoning O
skill O
. O

Our O
findings O
show O
that O
general O
reasoning O
skill O
influences O
the O
accuracy O
of O
crowdsourced O
workers O
who O
create O
the O
relevance O
judgments O
set O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
an O
important O
linguistic O
resource O
, O
collocation O
represents O
a O
significant O
relation O
between O
words O
. O

Automatic O
collocation O
extraction O
is O
very O
important O
for O
many O
natural O
language O
processing O
applications O
, O
such O
as O
word O
sense O
disambiguation O
, O
machine O
translation O
and O
information O
retrieval O
etc O
. O

While O
traditional O
collocation O
extraction O
approaches O
use O
only O
one O
single O
statistical O
measure O
, O
they O
may O
not O
be O
optimal O
in O
that O
they O
can O
not O
take O
advantage O
of O
multiple O
statistical O
measures O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
logistic O
linear O
regression O
model O
( O
LLRM O
) O
that O
combines O
five O
classical O
lexical O
association O
measures O
: O
x O
< O
sup>2</sup>-test O
, O
t O
- O
test O
, O
co O
- O
occurrence O
frequency O
, O
log O
- O
likelihood O
ratio O
and O
mutual O
information O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
leads O
to O
a O
significant O
performance O
improvement O
in O
comparison O
with O
individual O
basic O
methods O
in O
both O
precision O
and O
recall O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
design O
and O
development O
of O
personal O
information O
assistant O
( O
PIA O
a O
system O
aiming O
to O
meet O
individual O
needs O
of O
the O
searchers O
. O

The O
system O
’s O
goal O
is O
to O
provide O
more O
up O
- O
to O
- O
date O
and O
relevant O
information O
to O
users O
with O
respect O
to O
their O
needs O
and O
interests O
. O

The O
main O
component O
of O
the O
system O
is O
a O
profile O
learner O
for O
capturing O
temporal O
user O
needs O
, O
based O
on O
implicit O
feedback O
gathering O
techniques O
. O

It O
monitors O
the O
system O
usage O
, O
the O
documents O
viewed O
and O
other O
user O
actions O
in O
order O
to O
infer O
users’ O
changing O
needs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
in O
this O
article O
a O
summary O
of O
the O
main O
research O
results O
in O
the O
last O
years O
in O
the O
area O
of O
Web O
Information O
Retrieval O
produced O
by O
two O
Brazilian O
groups O
, O
from O
the O
Federal O
University O
of O
Amazon O
as O
and O
the O
Federal O
University O
of O
Minas O
Gerais O
. O

The O
two O
groups O
have O
worked O
in O
several O
common O
research O
projects O
in O
the O
last O
five O
years O
. O

The O
research O
results O
described O
here O
are O
concentrated O
in O
three O
main O
topics O
related O
to O
Web O
research O
: O
information O
retrieval O
models O
for O
Web O
search O
, O
efficiency O
issues O
in O
Web O
search O
, O
and O
noise O
removal O
. O

The O
results O
obtained O
by O
the O
two O
groups O
in O
the O
last O
years O
represent O
significant O
contributions O
to O
improve O
both O
the O
quality O
and O
the O
efficiency O
of O
Web O
search O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
our O
formal O
runs O
, O
we O
have O
experimented O
with O
hybrid O
- O
term O
indexing O
and O
bigram O
indexing O
because O
hybrid O
- O
term O
indexing O
is O
a O
more O
distinct O
type O
of O
indexing O
strategy O
for O
better O
pooling O
and O
because O
bigram O
indexing O
usually O
gives O
robust O
( O
near O
) O
good O
results O
. O

We O
have O
also O
used O
our O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
( O
PRF O
) O
methods O
. O

In O
the O
informal O
runs O
, O
we O
have O
experimented O
with O
our O
previous O
re O
- O
ranking O
strategy O
, O
called O
title O
re O
- O
ranking O
. O

This O
strategy O
rewards O
documents O
which O
title O
terms O
match O
with O
the O
terms O
in O
the O
title O
query O
. O

Title O
re O
- O
ranking O
is O
able O
to O
improve O
the O
effectiveness O
performance O
for O
both O
short O
and O
long O
queries O
when O
bigram O
indexing O
is O
used O
. O

For O
formal O
runs O
, O
our O
best O
relax O
MAP O
achieved O
was O
36 O
% O
and O
51 O
% O
using O
PRF O
, O
for O
title O
queries O
and O
long O
queries O
respectively O
. O

For O
informal O
runs O
, O
our O
best O
relax O
MAP O
achieved O
was O
43 O
% O
for O
title O
queries O
and O
50 O
% O
for O
long O
queries O
using O
both O
PRF O
and O
merging O
retrieval O

. O

of O

language O
documents O

given O

. O

describe O

that O
use O
past O

of O

documents O

that O
they O
can O
learn O
good O

strategies O
. O

learned O
by O
our O
methods O
are O
consistently O
superior O
to O
those O
learned O
by O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
challenging O
problem O
in O
machine O
learning O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
computer O
vision O
research O
is O
how O
to O
recover O
a O
low O
- O
rank O
representation O
of O
the O
given O
data O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
outliers O
and O
missing O
entries O
. O

The O
L1-norm O
low O
- O
rank O
matrix O
factorization O
( O
LRMF O
) O
has O
been O
a O
popular O
approach O
to O
solving O
this O
problem O
. O

However O
, O
L1-norm O
LRMF O
is O
difficult O
to O
achieve O
due O
to O
its O
non O
- O
convexity O
and O
non O
- O
smoothness O
, O
and O
existing O
methods O
are O
often O
inefficient O
and O
fail O
to O
converge O
to O
a O
desired O
solution O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
cyclic O
weighted O
median O
( O
CWM O
) O
method O
, O
which O
is O
intrinsically O
a O
coordinate O
decent O
algorithm O
, O
for O
L1-norm O
LRMF O
. O

The O
CWM O
method O
minimizes O
the O
objective O
by O
solving O
a O
sequence O
of O
scalar O
minimization O
sub O
- O
problems O
, O
each O
of O
which O
is O
convex O
and O
can O
be O
easily O
solved O
by O
the O
weighted O
median O
filter O
. O

The O
extensive O
experimental O
results O
validate O
that O
the O
CWM O
method O
outperforms O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
arts O
in O
terms O
of O
both O
accuracy O
and O
computational O
efficiency O
. O

data O
base O
design O
and O
description O
using O
the O
model O
and O
the O
diagramatic O
technique O
is O
given O
. O

The O
implications O
on O
data O
integrity O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
data O
manipulation O
are O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
survey O
of O

techniques O
for O

code O
security O
, O

of O
systems O
which O
use O
them O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
the O
problem O
domain O
is O

: O

hosts O
from O

code O
; O

of O

The O

We O

presenting O

of O
a O

, O

, O

also O

our O
Swedish O

with O
this O

. O

. O

that O
at O
40 O
percent O

/ O

rate O

answer O

. O

Proper O
names O
are O
problematic O
for O
cross O
language O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Standard O
bilingual O
dictionaries O
typically O
have O
poor O
coverage O
of O
proper O
names O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
IR O
tasks O
involving O
news O
corpora O
, O
like O
TDT O
and O
TREC O
cross O
language O
IR O
, O
have O
proper O
names O
at O
their O
core O
. O

In O

of O

one O

2002 O
( O
Arabic O
- O
English O
) O
cross O

track O
, O
by O

that O
performance O
degrades O
a O
tremendous O
amount O
when O
the O
bilingual O
lexicons O
do O
not O
have O
proper O
names O
. O

We O
then O
examine O
several O

of O

English O
to O

( O

) O

the O

of O
the O
TREC O
2002 O
cross O
language O
IR O
task O
. O

We O
support O

conclusion O
that O
a O
combination O
of O
static O
translation O
resources O
plus O
transliteration O
provides O
a O
successful O
solution O
. O

, O

of O

. O

However O

- O

. O

presented O

of O
these O

to O
improve O
biomedical O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

IR O

, O

. O

In O
the O
work O
at O
hand O
, O
we O
combine O
a O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
) O
protocol O
with O
Somewhat O
Homomorphic O
Encryption O
( O
SHE O
) O
and O
use O
Searchable O
Encryption O
( O
SE O
) O
with O
the O
objective O
to O
provide O
security O
and O
confidentiality O
features O
for O
a O
third O
party O
cloud O
security O
audit O
. O

During O
the O
auditing O
process O
, O
a O
third O
party O
auditor O
will O
act O
on O
behalf O
of O
a O
cloud O
service O
user O
to O
validate O
the O
security O
requirements O
performed O
by O
a O
cloud O
service O
provider O
. O

Our O
concrete O
contribution O
consists O
of O
developing O
a O
PIR O
protocol O
which O
is O
proceeding O
directly O
on O
a O
log O
database O
of O
encrypted O
data O
and O
allowing O
to O
retrieve O
a O
sum O
or O
a O
product O
of O
multiple O
encrypted O
elements O
. O

Subsequently O
, O
we O
concretely O
apply O
our O
new O
form O
of O
PIR O
protocol O
to O
a O
cloud O
audit O
use O
case O
where O
searchable O
encryption O
is O
employed O
to O
allow O
additional O
confidentiality O
requirements O
to O
the O
privacy O
of O
the O
user O
. O

Exemplarily O
we O
are O
considering O
and O

an O
audit O
of O
client O
accesses O
to O
a O
controlled O
resource O

by O
a O

service O
provider O
. O

Most O
search O
engines O
have O
to O
face O
the O
dynamic O
nature O
of O
the O
web O
, O
and O
it O
becomes O
a O
big O
problem O
that O
how O
to O
offer O
near O
real O
- O
time O
query O
service O
while O
the O
underlying O
document O
collection O
increases O
dramatically O
every O
day O
. O

As O
a O

, O
the O
online O
indexing O
approaches O
become O
one O
of O

of O

. O

In O

, O

- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
arts O
. O

We O
then O

an O

on O
selected O
strategies O
. O

A O
new O

is O
introduced O
in O
this O
paper O
to O
characterize O
the O
dynamic O
performance O
when O

with O
online O
indexing O
concurrently O
. O

Evaluation O
results O

the O
performance O
differences O
among O
strategies O
and O
indicate O
the O
future O
improvements O
on O
update O
and O
query O
performance O
. O

have O

to O

reults O

Professor O
Varian O
has O

, O

organization O
, O

is O

textbooks O
which O
have O
been O

into O
9 O

We O
review O
here O

) O

Corporation O

( O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
World O
Wide O
Web O
is O
a O
rich O
source O
of O
digital O
information O
. O

Web O
search O
engines O
allow O
users O
to O
locate O
resources O
on O
the O
Internet O
thus O
helping O
them O
to O
satisfy O
their O
information O
needs O
. O

The O
advent O
of O
the O
Wireless O
Application O
Protocol O
( O
WAP O
) O
has O
made O
wireless O
Internet O
access O
possible O
. O

However O
, O
WAP O
users O
do O
not O
have O
access O
to O
the O
same O
quality O
of O
online O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
as O
' O
wired O
' O
users O
. O

We O
present O
a O
system O
, O
named O
WapSearch O
, O
that O
enables O
WAP O
enabled O
mobile O
phones O
and O
PDAs O
to O
search O
for O
and O
browse O
Internet O
content O
written O
in O
HTML O
. O

The O
WapSearch O
system O
is O
based O
around O
an O
HTML O
/ O
WML O
conversion O
tool O
and O
a O
popular O
Web O
search O
engine O
and O
employs O
a O
novel O
document O
navigation O
functionality O
designed O
to O
aid O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
process O
on O
these O
devices O
. O

In O
short O
, O
we O
support O
sophisticated O
document O
browsing O
by O
bypassing O
the O
( O
typically O
small O
) O
cache O
memory O
of O
the O
client O
device O
, O
instead O
exploiting O
the O
server O
's O
much O
greater O
memory O
and O
processing O
capabilities O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Artificial O
intelligence O
models O
may O
be O
used O
to O
improve O
performance O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
and O
the O
genetic O
algorithms O
( O
GAs O
) O
are O
an O
example O
of O
such O
a O
model O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
application O
of O
GAs O
as O
a O
relevance O
feedback O
method O
aiming O
to O
improve O
the O
document O
representation O
and O
indexing O
. O

In O
this O
particular O
form O
of O
GAs O
, O
various O
document O
descriptions O
compete O
with O
each O
other O
and O
a O
better O
collection O
indexing O
is O
sought O
through O
reproduction O
, O
crossover O
and O
mutation O
operations O
. O

In O
this O
paradigm O
, O
we O
are O
searching O
for O
the O
optimal O
balance O
between O
two O
genetic O
parameters O
: O
the O
population O
size O
and O
the O
number O
of O
generations O
. O

We O
try O
to O
discover O
the O
optimal O
parameter O
choice O
both O
by O
experiments O
using O
the O
CACM O
and O
CISI O
collections O
, O
and O
by O
a O
theoretical O
analysis O
providing O
explanation O
of O
the O
experimental O
results O
. O

The O
general O
conclusion O
tends O
to O
be O
that O
larger O
populations O
have O
better O
chance O
of O
significantly O
improving O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Data O
citation O
has O
a O
profound O
impact O
on O
the O
reproducibility O
of O
science O
, O
a O
hot O
topic O
in O
many O
disciplines O
such O
as O
as O
astronomy O
, O
biology O
, O
physics O
, O
computer O
science O
and O
more O
. O

Lately O
, O
several O
authoritative O
journals O
have O
been O
requesting O
the O
sharing O
of O
data O
and O
the O
provision O
of O
validation O
methodologies O
for O
experiments O
( O
e.g O
Nature O
Scientific O
Data O
and O
Nature O
Physics O
these O
publications O
and O
the O
publishing O
industry O
in O
general O
see O
data O
citation O
as O
the O
means O
to O
provide O
new O
, O
reliable O
and O
usable O
means O
for O
sharing O
and O
referring O
to O
scientific O
data O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
of O
data O
citation O
and O
we O
discuss O
open O
issues O
and O
research O
directions O
with O
a O
specific O
focus O
on O
reproducibility O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
investigate O
reproducibility O
issues O
by O
using O
experimental O
evaluation O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
as O
a O
test O
case O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
massive O
grow O
of O
the O
modern O
information O
retrieval O
system O
( O
IRS O
especially O
in O
natural O
languages O
becomes O
more O
difficult O
. O

The O
search O
in O
Arabic O
languages O
, O
as O
natural O
language O
, O
is O
not O
good O
enough O
yet O
. O

This O
paper O
will O
try O
to O
build O
similar O
thesaurus O
based O
on O
Arabic O
language O
in O
two O
mechanisms O
, O
the O
first O
one O
is O
full O
word O
mechanisms O
and O
the O
other O
is O
stemmed O
mechanisms O
, O
and O
then O
to O
compare O
between O
them O
. O

The O
comparison O
made O
by O
this O
study O
proves O
that O
the O
similar O
thesaurus O
using O
stemmed O
mechanisms O
get O
more O
better O
results O
than O
using O
traditional O
in O
the O
same O
mechanisms O
and O
similar O
thesaurus O
improved O
more O
the O
recall O
and O
precision O
than O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
system O
at O
recall O
and O
precision O
levels O
. O

of O

. O

to O

for O

. O

of O

applied O
in O

. O

for O

. O

- O

as O
a O

of O
term O
dependency O
between O

. O

of O
vertex O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
way O
of O
estimating O
term O
weights O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
using O
term O
co O
- O
occurrence O
as O
a O
measure O
of O
dependency O
between O
terms O
. O

We O
use O
the O
random O
walk O
graph O
- O
based O
ranking O
algorithm O
on O
a O
graph O
that O
encodes O
terms O
and O
co O
- O
occurrence O
dependencies O
in O
text O
, O
from O
which O
we O
derive O
term O
weights O
that O
represent O
a O
quantification O
of O
how O
a O
term O
contributes O
to O
its O
context O
. O

Evaluation O
on O
two O

collections O
and O
350 O
topics O
shows O
that O
the O
random O
walk O
- O
based O
term O
weights O

at O
least O
comparably O
to O
the O
traditional O
tf O
- O
idf O
term O
weighting O
, O
while O
they O
outperform O
it O
when O
the O
distance O
between O
co O
- O
occurring O
terms O
is O
between O
6 O
and O
30 O
terms O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
in O
structured O
documents O
( O
and O
particularly O
XML O
) O
requires O
the O
user O
to O
have O
a O
good O
knowledge O
of O
the O
document O
structure O
and O
of O
some O
query O
language O
. O

This O
article O
discusses O
the O
advantages O
that O
could O
be O
brought O
by O
a O
system O
allowing O
natural O
language O
queries O
, O
and O
presents O
a O
technique O
to O
translate O
such O
requests O
into O
a O
formal O

language O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
report O
on O
our O
participation O
in O
the O
JRS O
Data O
- O
Mining O
Challenge O
. O

The O
approach O
used O
by O
our O
system O
is O
a O
lazylearning O
one O
, O
based O
on O
a O
simple O
k O
- O
nearest O
- O
neighbors O
technique O
. O

We O
more O
specifically O
addressed O
this O
challenge O
as O
an O
opportunity O
to O
test O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
inspired O
techniques O
in O
such O
a O
data O
- O
mining O
framework O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
tested O
different O
similarity O
measures O
, O
including O
one O
called O
vectorization O
that O
we O
have O
proposed O
and O
tested O
in O
IR O
and O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
frameworks O
. O

The O
resulting O
system O
is O
simple O
and O
efficient O
while O
offering O
good O
performance O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Dual O
- O
wing O
harmoniums O
is O
a O
promising O
technique O
for O
modeling O
the O
relationship O
between O
heterogeneous O
data O
sources O
, O
like O
associated O
text O
and O
images O
or O
genetic O
variations O
and O
observed O
traits O
. O

Unsatisfied O
with O
contrastive O
divergence O
( O
CD O
) O
and O
maximum O
likelihood O
learning O
, O
we O
implemented O
Bayesian O
learning O
in O
DWH O
using O
brief O
Langevin O
MCMC O
approach O
. O

We O
proposed O
three O
different O
types O
of O
priors O
for O
both O
information O
retrieval O
and O
quatitative O
trait O
loci O
( O
QTL O
) O
mapping O
and O
examined O
the O
results O
. O

Bayesian O
learning O
and O
different O
priors O
are O
evaluated O
by O
classification O
and O
retrieval O
task O
for O
TRECVID’03 O
video O
clips O
and O
cross O
validation O
of O
predicting O
morphological O
shapes O
of O
two O
Drosophila O
species O
. O

Experiments O
shows O
that O
Bayesian O
learning O
gives O
close O
to O
CD O
accuracy O
and O
average O
precision O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
but O
fails O
on O
QTL O
prediction O
. O

We O
discussed O
possible O
causes O
and O
future O
directions O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
many O
fields O
, O
for O
example O
in O
business O
, O
engineering O
, O
and O
law O
there O
is O
interest O
in O
the O
search O
and O
the O
classification O
of O
text O
documents O
in O
large O
databases O
. O

To O
information O
retrieval O
purposes O
there O
exist O
methods O
. O

They O
are O
mainly O
based O
on O
keywords O
. O

In O
cases O
where O
keywords O
are O
lacking O
the O
information O
retrieval O
is O
problematic O
. O

One O
approach O
is O
to O
use O
the O
whole O
text O
document O
as O
a O
search O
key O
. O

Neural O
networks O
offer O
an O
adaptive O
tool O
for O
this O
purpose O
. O

This O
paper O
suggests O
a O
new O
adaptive O
approach O
to O
the O
problem O
of O
clustering O
and O
search O
in O
large O
text O
document O
databases O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
a O
multilevel O
one O
based O
on O
word O
, O
sentence O
, O
and O
paragraph O
level O
maps O
. O

Here O
only O
the O
word O
map O
level O
is O
reported O
. O

The O
reported O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
smart O
encoding O
, O
on O
Self O
- O
Organizing O
Maps O
, O
and O
on O
document O
histograms O
. O

The O
results O
are O
very O
promising O
. O

Query O
terms O
are O
used O
for O
document O
retrieval O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Query O
reweighting O
techniques O
can O
be O

to O
improve O
the O

of O
information O

systems O
. O

In O

a O

for O
document O

based O
on O
neural O
networks O
for O
dealing O
with O
document O
retrieval O
based O
on O
the O
user O
’s O
relevant O

. O

The O
proposed O
query O

method O
uses O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
for O
representing O
documents O
and O

and O

techniques O
to O
let O
the O
vector O
formed O
by O
the O

of O
the O

terms O
as O
close O
as O

to O
the O
“ O
cluster O
center O
vector O
” O
formed O
by O
document O
vectors O
of O
relevant O
feedback O
documents O
. O

The O
proposed O
query O
reweighting O
method O
can O
increase O
the O
precision O

and O
the O
recall O
rate O
of O
information O

systems O
for O

with O

. O

This O
article O
describes O
and O

various O
information O

models O
used O
to O
search O

in O

, O
either O

of O

( O

This O

) O

. O

of O

( O

This O

is O

for O

[ O
21 O

allows O

of O
- O

. O

This O
work O
proposes O
to O
adapt O
an O
existing O
general O

model O
for O
the O
task O
of O

that O
are O
subsequently O

to O

to O

. O

In O

that O

on O

itself O

to O

We O
propose O

to O

are O

parameter O

of O

. O

The O

for O

score O
and O

for O

score O
. O

We O

using O
syntax O
- O
based O
features O
. O

Our O
experiments O
show O

of O
1 O
- O
2.5 O
in O
terms O
of O

score O
over O
the O

with O

non O
- O

. O

We O
show O
that O

are O

both O
to O

integration O
of O

and O

- O

for O

query O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

One O
of O
the O
major O
problems O
of O
modern O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
is O
the O
vocabulary O
Problem O
that O
concerns O
with O
the O
discrepancies O
between O
terms O
used O
for O
describing O
documents O
and O
the O
terms O
used O
by O
the O
researcher O
to O
describe O
their O
information O
need O
. O

We O
have O
implemented O
an O
automatic O
thesurs O
, O
the O
system O
was O
built O
using O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
( O
VSM O

In O
this O
model O
, O
we O
used O
Cosine O
measure O
similarity O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
use O
selected O
242 O
Arabic O
abstract O
documents O
. O

All O
these O
abstracts O
involve O
computer O
science O
and O
information O
system O
. O

The O
main O
goal O
of O
this O
paper O

to O

and O
build O
automatic O

term O
- O

that O
can O

or O

improve O

and O

get O

for O

user O
's O

. O

study O
concluded O
that O

similarl O
thesaurus O
improved O

recall O
and O
precision O
more O
than O
traditional O

system O
in O

of O

and O

level O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
a O
fuzzy O
- O
based O
recommendation O
method O
is O
presented O
. O

Its O
main O
goal O
is O
to O
improve O
the O
recommendation O

high O

. O

model O

. O

of O

several O

which O
show O
that O

method O
is O

to O

user O
’s O
needs O
and O

maximum O
effectiveness O
if O

component O
methods O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Content O
based O
image O
retrieval O
system O
is O
the O
technique O
which O
uses O
visual O
contents O
to O
search O
images O
from O
large O
scale O
image O
databases O
according O
to O
the O
user O
’s O
interest O
. O

The O
term O
content O
refers O
to O
color O
, O
shape O
, O
texture O
that O
can O
be O
derived O
from O
the O
image O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
an O
image O
retrieval O
system O
using O
artificial O
neural O
network O
( O
ANN O
) O
in O
MATLAB O
with O
the O
help O
of O
Gabor O
filter O
features O
is O
contemplated O
. O

In O
the O
proposed O
system O
, O
mean O
and O
standard O
deviation O
of O
the O
images O
are O
calculated O
later O
to O
the O
filtering O
process O
of O
the O
images O
using O
Gabor O
filter O
. O

Using O
the O
neural O
network O
classifier O
the O
system O
is O
trained O
and O
tested O
and O
classifies O
the O
images O
from O
a O
vast O
database O
relevant O
to O
the O
requirement O
. O

A O
database O
having O
1000 O
images O
spread O
across O
ten O
categories O
is O
taken O
for O
the O
implementation O
purpose O
. O

Net O
average O
precision O
and O
recall O
values O
are O
computed O
for O
the O
database O
query O
. O

The O
obtained O
results O
show O
the O
performance O
improvement O
with O
higher O
precision O
and O
recall O
values O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
retrieval O
method O
using O
textual O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
vector O
space O
model O
, O
for O
images O
. O

Many O
image O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
proposed O
. O

However O
, O
these O
systems O
are O
mainly O
based O
on O
pattern O
recognition O
techniques O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
features O
of O
images O
are O
also O
based O
on O
these O
recognition O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
color O
histogram O
, O
and O
shape O
of O
the O
object O
in O
images O
. O

Generally O
, O
these O
systems O
do O
not O
consider O
weight O
of O
features O
, O
which O
means O
how O
important O
these O
features O
are O
, O
which O
are O
generally O
used O
in O
textual O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
considering O
weight O
, O
such O
as O
TFIDF O
, O
to O
identify O
the O
importance O
degree O
of O
features O
. O

Using O
our O
proposed O
method O
, O
the O
system O
can O
retrieve O
intuitively O
similar O
retrieval O
target O
images O
to O
user O
's O
query O
images O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
paper O
summarizes O

properties O
of O

retrieval O
and O

both O

practice O
and O
research O
findings O
, O

that O

techniques O
can O
be O
effective O
. O

It O
then O

the O

and O

the O
user O
’s O

to O
search O
full O
text O
directly O
( O
rather O
than O
e.g. O

and O

to O

- O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
four O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
models O
for O
contentbased O
music O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CBMIR O
) O
and O
carefully O
evaluate O
them O
on O
network O
load O
, O
retrieval O
time O
, O
system O
update O
and O
robustness O
qualitatively O
and O
quantitatively O
. O

And O
we O
bring O
forward O
an O
algorithm O
to O
improve O
the O
speed O
of O
CBP2PMIR O
and O
a O
simple O
but O
effective O
method O
to O
filter O
out O
the O
replica O
in O
the O
final O
results O
. O

And O
we O
present O
the O
architecture O
of O
QUIND O
, O
a O
content O
- O
based O
peer O
- O
topeer O
music O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O
which O
can O
implement O
CBMIR O
. O

QUIND O
combines O
content O
- O
based O
music O
information O
retrieval O
technologies O
and O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
environments O
, O
and O
has O
strong O
robustness O
and O
good O
expansibility O
. O

Music O
stored O
and O
shared O
on O
each O
PC O
makes O
up O
of O
the O
whole O
available O
music O
resource O
. O

When O
a O
user O
puts O
forward O
a O
music O
request O
, O
e.g. O
a O
song O
or O
a O
melody O
, O
QUIND O
can O
retrieve O
a O
lot O
of O
similar O
music O
quickly O
and O
accurately O
according O
to O
the O
content O
of O
music O
. O

After O
the O
user O
selects O
his O
favorite O
ones O
, O
he O
can O
download O
and O
enjoy O
them O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Communication O
and O
collaboration O
with O
other O
people O
is O
a O
major O
theme O
in O
the O
information O
seeking O
process O
. O

Collaborative O
querying O
addresses O
this O
issue O
by O
sharing O
other O
users’ O
search O
experiences O
to O
help O
users O
formulate O
appropriate O
queries O
to O
a O
search O
engine O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
a O
collaborative O
querying O
system O
that O
helps O
users O
with O
query O
formulation O
by O
finding O
previously O
submitted O
similar O
queries O
through O
mining O
web O
logs O
. O

The O
system O
operates O
by O
clustering O
and O
recommending O
related O
queries O
to O
users O
using O
a O
hybrid O
query O
similarity O
identification O
approach O
. O

The O
system O
employs O
a O
graph O
- O
based O
approach O
to O
visualize O
the O
query O
recommendations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Whenever O
digital O
libraries O
or O
knowledge O
management O
systems O
are O
to O
be O
automatically O
filled O
with O
web O
pages O
from O
the O
internet O
, O
document O
classification O
of O
the O
web O
pages O
is O
one O
of O
the O
major O
challenges O
. O

We O
present O
an O
approach O
which O
uses O
HTML O
tags O
in O
order O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
hypertext O
document O
classification O
. O

Our O
approach O
uses O
weighting O
of O
HTML O
tags O
for O
separating O
relevant O
information O
in O
hypertext O
documents O
from O
the O
noise O
. O

We O
have O
evaluated O
our O
approach O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
a O
document O
classification O
algorithm O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
our O
weighting O
approach O
yields O
a O
classification O
which O
is O
approximately O
35 O
% O
better O
than O
a O
classification O
without O
the O
use O
of O
the O
HTML O
tagging O
information O
. O

language O
models O
have O
been O
proposed O
recently O
for O

. O

paper O
extends O
the O

to O

resource O
selection O
, O
ad O
- O
hoc O

of O

from O

. O

is O
designed O
primarily O
for O

, O
where O
it O
is O

to O

that O

are O

and O
can O

the O

kind O

. O

as O

prior O

- O
of O
- O

- O

in O

. O

Desktop O
Search O
, O
the O
search O
across O
local O
storage O
such O
as O
a O
personal O
computer O
, O
is O
a O
common O
practice O
among O

users O
. O

There O
has O
been O
much O

in O
Web O
- O
related O

, O

Search O

. O

of O

is O
different O

. O
