filesystem O
. O

describe O

in O

to O
provide O
“ O
more O

” O

. O

for O

Search O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Session O
search O
is O
an O
information O
retrieval O
task O
that O
involves O
a O
sequence O
of O
queries O
for O
a O
complex O
information O
need O
. O

It O
is O
characterized O
by O
rich O
user O
- O
system O
interactions O
and O
temporal O
dependency O
between O
queries O
and O
between O
consecutive O
user O
behaviors O
. O

Recent O
efforts O
have O
been O
made O
in O
modeling O
session O
search O
using O
the O
Partially O
Observable O
Markov O
Decision O
Process O
( O
POMDP O
To O
best O
utilize O
the O
POMDP O
model O
, O
it O
is O
crucial O
to O
find O
suitable O
definitions O
for O
its O
fundamental O
elements O
States O
, O
Actions O
and O
Rewards O
. O

This O
paper O
investigates O
the O
best O
ways O
to O
design O
the O
states O
, O
actions O
, O
and O
rewards O
within O
a O
POMDP O
framework O
. O

We O
lay O
out O
available O
design O
options O
of O
these O
major O
components O
based O
on O
a O
variety O
of O
related O
work O
and O
experiment O
on O
combinations O
of O
these O
options O
over O
the O
TREC O
2012 O
2013 O
Session O
datasets O
. O

We O
report O
our O
findings O
based O
on O
two O
evaluation O
aspects O
, O
retrieval O
accuracy O
and O
efficiency O
, O
and O
recommend O
practical O
design O
choices O
for O
using O
POMDP O
in O
session O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Overview O
and O
Phase O

The O
IFRI O
database O
with O
15 O
years O
of O
time O
series O
data O
about O
forests O
worldwide O
, O
together O
with O
the O
SES O
ontological O
framework O
that O
Elinor O
Ostrom O
is O
pioneering O
offers O
a O
rich O
application O
for O
computer O
and O
information O
science O
research O
investigation O
in O
two O
areas O
. O

The O
first O
investigates O
the O
in O
- O
situ O
archive O
as O
a O
software O
framework O
that O
brings O
archive O
functionality O
to O
the O

. O

- O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
to O
identify O
and O
transcript O
the O
note O
of O
a O
Carnatic O
music O
signal O
. O

The O
main O
motive O
behind O
note O
transcription O
is O
that O
, O
it O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
good O
basis O
for O
music O
note O
information O
retrieval O
of O
Carnatic O
music O
songs O
or O
Film O
songs O
based O
on O
Carnatic O
music O
. O

The O
input O
monophonic O
music O
signal O
is O
analysed O
and O
made O
to O
pass O
through O
a O
signal O
frequency O
extracting O
algorithm O
. O

The O
frequency O
components O
of O
the O
signal O
are O
then O
mapped O
into O
the O
swara O
sequence O
, O
which O
could O
be O
used O
to O
determine O
the O
Raga O
of O
the O
particular O
song O
and O
can O
be O
used O
in O
Carnatic O
music O
training O
institutes O
to O
verify O
the O
correctness O
of O
the O
Carnatic O
music O
note O
. O

Terms O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Parallel O
corpus O
is O
an O
indispensable O
resource O
for O
translation O
model O
training O
in O
statistical O
machine O
translation O
( O
SMT O
Instead O
of O
collecting O
more O
and O
more O
parallel O
training O
corpora O
, O
this O
paper O
aims O
to O
improve O
SMT O
performance O
by O
exploiting O
full O
potential O
of O
the O
existing O
parallel O
corpora O
. O

Two O
kinds O
of O
methods O
are O
proposed O
: O
offline O
data O
optimization O
and O
online O
model O
optimization O
. O

The O
offline O
method O
adapts O
the O
training O
data O
by O
redistributing O
the O
weight O
of O
each O
training O
sentence O
pairs O
. O

The O
online O
method O
adapts O
the O
translation O
model O
by O
redistributing O
the O
weight O
of O
each O
predefined O
submodels O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
model O
is O
used O
for O
the O
weighting O
scheme O
in O
both O
methods O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
without O
using O
any O
additional O
resource O
, O
both O
methods O
can O
improve O
SMT O
performance O
significantly O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Search O
engines O
process O
queries O
conjunctively O
to O
restrict O
the O
size O
of O
the O
answer O
set O
. O

Further O
, O
it O
is O
not O
rare O
to O
observe O
a O
mismatch O
between O
the O
vocabulary O
used O
in O
the O
text O
of O
Web O
pages O
and O
the O
terms O
used O
to O
compose O
the O
Web O
queries O
. O

The O
combination O
of O
these O
two O
features O
might O
lead O
to O
irrelevant O
query O
results O
, O
particularly O
in O
the O
case O
of O
more O
specific O
queries O
composed O
of O
three O
or O
more O
terms O
. O

To O
deal O
with O
this O
problem O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
technique O
for O
automatically O
structuring O
Web O
queries O
as O
a O
set O
of O
smaller O
subqueries O
. O

To O
select O
representative O
subqueries O
we O
use O
information O
on O
their O
distributions O
in O
the O
document O
collection O
. O

This O
can O
be O
adequately O
modeled O
using O
the O
concept O
of O
maximal O
termsets O
derived O
from O
the O
formalism O
of O
association O
rules O
theory O
. O

Experimentation O
shows O
that O
our O
technique O
leads O
to O
improved O
results O
. O

For O
the O
TREC-8 O
test O
collection O
, O
for O
instance O
, O
our O
technique O
led O
to O
gains O
in O
average O
precision O
of O
roughly O
28 O
% O
with O
regard O
to O
a O
BM25 O
ranking O
formula O
. O

Querying O
XML O
documents O
typically O
involves O
both O
tree O
- O
based O
navigation O
and O
pattern O
matching O
similar O
to O
that O
used O
in O
structured O
information O
retrieval O
domains O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
show O
that O
for O
good O
performance O
, O
a O
native O
XML O
query O
processing O
system O
should O
support O
query O
plans O
that O
mix O
these O
two O
processing O
paradigms O
. O

We O
describe O
our O
prototype O
native O
XML O
system O
, O
and O
report O
on O
experiments O
demonstrating O
that O
even O
for O
simple O

, O
there O
are O
a O
number O
of O
options O
for O
how O
to O
combine O
tree O
- O
based O
navigation O
and O
structural O
joins O
based O
on O
information O
retrieval O
- O
style O
inverted O
lists O
, O
and O
that O
these O
options O
can O
have O
widely O
varying O
performance O
. O

We O
present O
ways O
of O

using O
both O

in O

single O
system O
, O
and O
provide O

model O
for O

efficient O

of O
the O
techniques O
. O

Our O
preliminary O
experimental O
results O
prove O
the O
viability O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

We O
examine O
various O
computational O
accounts O
of O
aspects O
of O
music O
understanding O
. O

These O
accounts O
involve O
programs O
which O
can O
notate O
melodies O
based O
on O
pitch O
and O
duration O
information O
. O

It O
is O
argued O
that O
this O
task O
involves O
significant O
musical O
intelligence O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
it O
requires O
an O
understanding O
of O
basic O
metric O
and O
harmonic O
relations O
implicit O
in O
the O
melody O
. O

We O
deal O
only O
with O
single O
- O
voice O
, O
tonal O
melodies O
. O

While O
the O
task O
is O
a O
limited O
one O
, O
and O
the O
programs O
give O
only O
partial O
solutions O
to O
this O
task O
, O
we O
argue O
that O
this O
represents O
a O
first O
step O
towards O
a O
computational O
realization O
of O
significant O
aspects O
of O
musical O
intelligence O
. O

There O
are O
many O

concerning O

. O

retrieval O
( O

) O

to O
find O
solution O
to O
following O
problem O
. O

Server O
has O
a O
database O
of O
n O
records O
and O
client O
wants O
to O
retrieve O
w O
- O
th O
record O
without O
revealing O
w O
to O
the O
server O
. O

can O
be O
described O
for O

- O
server O

server O
case O
( O

of O
database O

and O

[ O
1 O

to O
handle O
some O
number O
of O
unsynchronized O
records O
. O

also O
allows O
some O
servers O
to O
collaborate O
without O
discovering O
w. O

Information O
Retrieval O
has O
become O
common O
- O
place O
with O
the O
advent O
of O
the O
Internet O
with O
most O
Internet O
users O
being O
familiar O
with O
the O
use O
of O
search O
engines O
such O
as O
Google O
, O
Yahoo O
, O
and O
the O
like O
. O

Indeed O
, O
with O
the O
amount O
of O
information O
on O
the O
Internet O
growing O
so O
rapidly O
, O
search O
engines O
are O
crucial O
in O
finding O
what O
we O
want O
. O

The O
problem O
is O
the O
interface O
used O
for O
performing O
such O
searches O
has O
changed O
very O
little O
from O
those O
proposed O
in O
the O
1950s O
, O
despite O
many O
alternative O
interfaces O
being O
proposed O
and O
developed O
by O
various O
researchers O
. O

Users O
still O
provide O
a O
list O
of O
keywords O
, O
and O
are O
presented O
with O
a O
list O
of O
pages O
that O
contain O
those O
keywords O
, O
and O
are O
faced O
with O
the O
task O
of O
scanning O
the O
result O
list O
one O
- O
byone O
for O
the O
information O
they O
seek O
. O

This O
paper O
enumerates O
some O
of O
the O
main O
alternatives O
to O
ranked O
list O
result O
displays O
, O
discusses O
their O
advantages O
and O
disadvantages O
, O
and O
discusses O
how O
researchers O
have O
evaluated O
their O
interfaces O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
translingual O
information O
retrieval O
( O
TIR O
ad O
hoc O
queries O
in O
any O
of O
a O
set O
of O
languages O
can O
be O
used O
to O
retrieve O
documents O
in O
any O
of O
a O
set O
of O
languages O
. O

Classical O
informationretrieval O
methods O
such O
as O
the O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
can O
not O
be O
applied O
to O
TIR O
because O
they O
base O
similarity O
on O
the O
overlap O
of O
terms O
between O
queries O
and O
documents|this O
is O
typically O
zero O
in O
TIR O
. O

The O
generalized O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
( O
GVSM O
) O
and O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
are O
two O
variations O
of O
the O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
that O
make O
comparisons O
outside O
of O
term O
space O
. O

For O
this O
reason O
, O
both O
can O
be O
and O
have O
been O
applied O
to O
TIR O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
report O
on O
a O
series O
of O
experiments O
comparing O
the O
performance O
of O
GVSM O
and O
LSI O
on O
monolingual O
and O
translingual O
retrieval O
tasks O
. O

We O
nd O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
both O
methods O
depends O
crucially O
on O
parameter O
settings O
, O
that O
LSI O
performs O
better O
, O
and O
that O
GVSM O
runs O
more O
quickly O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
whether O
implicitly O
or O
explicitly O
, O
queries O
and O
documents O
are O
often O
represented O
as O
vectors O
. O

However O
, O
it O
may O
be O
more O
beneficial O
to O
consider O
documents O
and/or O
queries O
as O
multidimensional O
objects O
. O

Our O
belief O
is O
this O
would O
allow O
building O
“ O
truly O
” O
interactive O
IR O
systems O
, O
i.e O
where O
interaction O
is O
fully O
incorporated O
in O
the O
IR O
framework O
. O

The O
probabilistic O
formalism O
of O
quantum O
physics O
represents O
events O
and O
densities O
as O
multidimensional O
objects O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
our O
first O
step O
towards O
building O
an O
interactive O
IR O
framework O
upon O
this O
formalism O
, O
by O
stating O
how O
the O
first O
interaction O
of O
the O
retrieval O
process O
, O
when O
the O
user O
types O
a O
query O
, O
can O
be O
formalised O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Manifold O
alignment O
has O
been O
found O
to O
be O
useful O
in O
many O
areas O
of O
machine O
learning O
and O
data O
mining O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
introduce O
a O
novel O
manifold O
alignment O
approach O
, O
which O
differs O
from O
“ O
semisupervised O
alignment O
” O
and O
“ O
Procrustes O
alignment O
” O
in O
that O
it O
does O
not O
require O
predetermining O
correspondences O
. O

Our O
approach O
learns O
a O
projection O
that O
maps O
data O
instances O
( O
from O
two O
different O
spaces O
) O
to O
a O
lower O
dimensional O
space O
simultaneously O
matching O
the O
local O
geometry O
and O
preserving O
the O
neighborhood O
relationship O
within O
each O
set O
. O

This O
approach O
also O
builds O
connections O
between O
spaces O
defined O
by O
different O
features O
and O
makes O
direct O
knowledge O
transfer O
possible O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
our O
algorithm O
is O
demonstrated O
and O
validated O
in O
a O
series O
of O
carefully O
designed O
experiments O
in O
information O
retrieval O
and O
bioinformatics O
. O

A O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
thesis O
discusses O
information O
retrieval O
from O
multimedia O
archives O
, O
focusing O
on O
documents O
containing O
visual O
material O
. O

We O
investigate O
search O
and O
retrieval O
in O
collections O
of O
images O
and O
video O
, O
where O
video O
is O
defined O
as O
a O
sequence O
of O
still O
images O
. O

No O
assumptions O
are O
made O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
content O
of O
the O
documents O
; O
we O
concentrate O
on O
retrieval O
from O
generic O
, O
heterogeneous O
multimedia O
collections O
. O

In O
this O
research O
area O
a O
user O
's O
query O
typically O
consists O
of O
one O
or O
more O
example O
images O
and O
the O
implicit O
request O
is O
Find O
images O
similar O
to O
this O
one O

In O
addition O
the O
query O
may O
contain O
a O
textual O
description O
of O
the O
information O
need O
. O

The O
research O
presented O
here O
addresses O
three O
issues O
within O
this O
area O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
tools O
can O
help O
intelligence O
and O
security O
agencies O
to O
retrieve O
and O
exploit O
relevant O
information O
from O
unstructured O
information O
sources O
and O
give O
them O
insight O
into O
the O
criminal O
behavior O
and O
networks O
, O
in O
order O
to O
fight O
crime O
more O
efficiently O
and O
effectively O
. O

This O
article O
aims O
at O
analysing O
off O
- O
the O
- O
shelf O
information O
extraction O
tools O
on O
their O
applicability O
and O
competency O
for O
such O
applications O
. O

The O
e O
- O
book O
reader O
revolution O
is O
here O
already O
. O

The O
questions O
we O
asked O
ourselves O
were O
: O
what O
are O
the O
reading O
preferences O
of O
information O
science O
students O
at O
the O
beginning O
of O
the O
second O
decade O
of O
the O
21 O
century O
? O

How O
do O
different O
variables O
such O
as O
relative O
advantage O
, O

and O
learning O
strategies O
affect O
students O
' O
reading O
preferences O
? O

The O
research O
was O
conducted O
in O
Israel O
during O
the O
first O
semester O
of O
the O
2015 O
academic O
year O
and O
encompassed O
177 O
LIS O

in O

Science O
Department O
in O
Israel O
. O

Three O

were O
used O
: O
personal O
details O
, O
relative O
advantage O
, O
and O
learning O
strategies O
, O
and O
two O
further O
questions O
that O
focus O
on O
reading O
habits O
. O

The O
study O
showed O
students O
' O
preferences O
of O
printed O
materials O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
it O
emphasizes O
the O
importance O
of O
personal O
variables O
that O
may O
affect O
students O
' O
will O
to O
read O
electronic O
materials O
: O
relative O
advantage O
and O
comprehension O
. O

Recently O
, O
the O
geolocalisation O
of O
tweets O
has O
become O
an O
important O
feature O
for O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
tasks O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
other O
domains O
, O
such O
as O
real O
- O
time O
event O
detection O
, O
topic O
detection O
or O
disaster O
and O
emergency O
analysis O
. O

However O
, O
the O
number O
of O
relevant O
geo O
- O
tagged O
tweets O
available O
remains O
insufficient O
to O
reliably O
perform O
such O
tasks O
. O

Thus O
, O
predicting O
the O
location O
of O
non O
- O
geotagged O
tweets O
is O
an O
important O
yet O
challenging O
task O
, O
which O
can O
increase O
the O
sample O
of O
geo O
- O
tagged O
data O
and O
help O
to O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
tasks O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
location O
inference O
method O
that O
utilises O
a O
ranking O
approach O
combined O
with O
a O
majority O
voting O
of O
tweets O
weighted O
based O
on O
the O
credibility O
of O
its O
source O
( O
Twitter O
user O
Using O
geo O
- O
tagged O
tweets O
from O
two O
cities O
, O
Chicago O
and O
New O
York O

( O
USA O
our O
experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
our O
method O
( O
statistically O
) O
significantly O
outperforms O
our O
baselines O
in O
terms O
of O
accuracy O
, O
and O
error O
distance O
, O
in O
both O
cities O
, O
with O
the O
cost O
of O
decrease O
in O
recall O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Summarization O
and O
Question O
Answering O
need O
accurate O
linguistic O
information O
with O
a O
much O
higher O
coverage O
than O

is O

This O
book O
is O
one O
of O
the O
Information O
Sciences O
series O
published O
by O
John O
Wiley O
and O
is O
meant O
for O
" O
Users O
, O
Managers O
, O
and O
Technologists O

The O
objective O
is O
to O
give O
a O
set O
of O
guidelines O
for O
implementing O
" O
complex O
" O
information O
systems O
. O

Complex O
information O
systems O
are O
defined O
as O
those O
" O
functioning O
within O
a O
multipurpose O
, O
multiuser O
environment O
whether O
they O
are O
relatively O
simple O
data O
banks O
, O
more O
involved O
accounting O
or O
banking O
/ O
credit O
systems O
, O
documentation O
systems O
, O
or O
middle O
or O
higher O
level O
management O
decision O
systems O

Though O
the O
definition O
includes O
" O
management O
decision O
systems O
the O
book O
focuses O
upon O
information O
storage O
and O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Four O
of O
the O
five O
case O
studies O
presented O
are O
on O
the O
computerization O
of O
documentation O
systems O
. O

No O
mention O
has O
been O
made O
of O
simulation O
, O
modelling O
, O
optimization O
packages O
, O
etc O
which O
are O
essential O
components O
of O
any O
information O
support O
system O
for O
managerial O
decision O
making O
, O
nor O
is O
the O
general O
problem O
of O
management O
information O
system O
design O
covered O
. O

Detecting O
the O
spatial O
objects O
is O
an O
important O
research O
agenda O
for O
geospatial O
information O
science O
. O

Appling O
object O
- O
oriented O
image O
classification O
to O
extract O
GIS O
features O
, O
which O
fulfills O
the O
needs O
of O
updating O
the O
geospatial O
databases O
with O
remote O
sensing O
imagery O
will O
greatly O
enhance O
the O
ongoing O
digital O
city O
construction O
and O
national O
condition O
monitoring O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
key O
technology O
for O
high O
spatial O
resolution O
image O
feature O
extraction O
. O

Utilizing O
object O
- O
oriented O
feature O
extraction O
and O
classification O
with O
ADS40 O
aerial O
imagery O
, O
various O
surface O
features O
are O
obtained O
satisfactorily O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
reports O
the O
use O
of O
a O
document O
distance O
- O
based O
approach O
to O
automatically O
expand O
the O
number O
of O
available O
relevance O
judgements O
when O
these O
are O
limited O
and O
reduced O
to O
only O
positive O
judgements O
. O

This O
may O
happen O
, O
for O
example O
, O
when O
the O
only O
available O
judgements O
are O
extracted O
from O
a O
list O
of O
references O
in O
a O
published O
review O
paper O
. O

We O
compare O
the O
results O
on O
two O
document O
sets O
: O
OHSUMED O
, O
based O
on O
medical O
research O
publications O
, O
and O
TREC-8 O
, O
based O
on O
news O
feeds O
. O

We O
show O
that O
evaluations O
based O
on O
these O
expanded O
relevance O
judgements O
are O
more O
reliable O
than O
those O
using O
only O
the O
initially O
available O
judgements O
, O
especially O
when O
the O
number O
of O
available O
judgements O
is O
very O
limited O
. O

This O
study O
analyzed O
citations O
in O
four O
journals O
, O
Annals O
of O
the O
Association O
of O
American O
Geographers O
, O
Cartography O
and O
Geographic O
Information O
Science O
, O
International O
Journal O
of O
Geographical O
Information O
Science O
, O
and O
Cartographic O
Journal O
, O
using O
Bradford O
’s O
Law O
of O
Scattering O
to O
identify O
three O
influence O
zones O
indicating O
core O
and O
peripheral O
titles O
in O
the O
study O
areas O
of O
GIS O
. O

Journals O
were O
ranked O
resulting O
in O
twenty O
- O
three O
core O
journals O
and O
187 O
secondary O
journals O
. O

for O
relevant O
indexing O
/ O
abstracting O
services O
are O
also O
given O
to O
describe O
access O
points O
and O
coverage O
. O

support O

in O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
associative O
Hopfield O
memory O
is O
a O
form O
of O
recurrent O
Artificial O
Neural O
Network O
( O
ANN O
) O
that O
can O
be O
used O
in O
applications O
such O
as O
pattern O
recognition O
, O
noise O
removal O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
combinatorial O
optimization O
problems O
. O

In O
general O
, O
ANNs O
are O
considered O
as O
intrinsically O
fault O
- O
tolerant O
. O

A O
study O
of O
the O
capability O
of O
this O
algorithm O
to O
tolerate O
transient O
faults O
such O
as O
bit O
- O
flips O
provoked O
by O
the O
radiation O
environment O
is O
presented O
. O

Two O
software O
versions O
of O
the O
Hopfield O
Neural O
Network O
( O
HNN O
one O
original O
and O
one O
fault O
- O
tolerant O
were O
implemented O
and O
executed O
by O
a O
LEON3 O
processor O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
the O
efficiency O
of O
the O
adopted O
strategy O
to O
tolerate O
faults O
that O
were O
injected O
at O
hardware O
level O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Evaluating O
the O
quality O
of O
ranking O
functions O
is O
a O
core O
task O
in O
web O
search O
and O
other O
information O
retrieval O
domains O
. O

Because O
query O
distributions O
and O
item O
relevance O
change O
over O
time O
, O
ranking O
models O
often O
can O
not O
be O
evaluated O
accurately O
on O
held O
- O
out O
training O
data O
. O

Instead O
, O
considerable O
effort O
is O
spent O
on O
manually O
labeling O
the O
relevance O
of O
query O
results O
for O
test O
queries O
in O
order O
to O
track O
ranking O
performance O
. O

We O
address O
the O
problem O
of O
estimating O
ranking O
performance O
as O
accurately O
as O
possible O
on O
a O
fixed O
labeling O
budget O
. O

Estimates O
are O
based O
on O
a O
set O
of O
most O
informative O
test O
queries O
selected O
by O
an O
active O
sampling O
distribution O
. O

Query O
labeling O
costs O
depend O
on O
the O
number O
of O
result O
items O
as O
well O
as O
item O
- O
specific O
attributes O
such O
as O
document O
length O
. O

We O
derive O
cost O
- O
optimal O
sampling O
distributions O
for O
the O
commonly O
used O
performance O
measures O
Discounted O
Cumulative O
Gain O
and O
Expected O
Reciprocal O
Rank O
. O

Experiments O
on O
web O
search O
engine O
data O
illustrate O
significant O
reductions O
in O
labeling O
costs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
important O
growth O
of O
available O
multimedia O
information O
shows O
the O
limits O
of O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
design O
of O
a O
metadata O
engine O
dedicated O
to O
retrieve O
annotated O
images O
using O
meta O
- O
information O
, O
and O
part O
of O
the O
more O
general O
MediaSys O
Image O
Search O
Engine O
. O

As O
a O
case O
study O
, O
we O
use O
medicinal O
plant O
images O
and O
their O
detailed O
description O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
flexible O
approach O
based O
on O
fuzzy O
concepts O
such O
as O
the O
fuzzy O
subset O
theory O
, O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Z39.50 O
Information O
Retrieval O
Protocol O
is O
a O
proposed O
ANSI O
standard O
for O
the O
retrieval O
of O
bibliographic O
information O
that O
originates O
from O
the O
library O
community O
in O
the O
United O
States O
. O

Unlike O
previous O
interlibrary O
loan O
protocols O
designed O
by O
the O
library O
community O
, O
Z39.50 O
is O
intended O
to O
be O
the O
basis O
of O
an O
end O
- O
user O
service O
. O

This O
paper O
provides O
a O
brief O
introduction O
to O
Z39.50 O
, O
then O
discusses O
the O
shortcomings O
of O
the O
protocol O
that O
were O
discovered O
as O
a O
result O
of O
implementation O
experience O
. O

Case O
- O
Based O
Reasoning O
( O
CBR O
) O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
are O
two O
historically O
disjoint O
technologies O
. O

This O
paper O
contends O
that O
the O
time O
has O
now O
come O
for O
CBR O
and O
IR O
to O
be O
conjoined O
in O
order O
to O
collaboratively O
solve O
many O
of O
the O
text O
retrieval O
problems O
faced O
by O
modern O
companies O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
it O
will O
be O
argued O
that O
the O
two O
technologies O
fundamentally O
differ O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
type O
of O
information O
retrieval O
queries O
they O
allow O
to O
be O
answered O
. O

An O
attempt O
will O
be O

to O
define O
what O
types O
of O
query O
remain O
problematic O
for O
both O
techniques O
, O
yet O
may O
benefit O
from O
a O
combined O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Prefix O
search O
is O
a O
fundamental O
operation O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
but O
it O
is O
difficult O
to O
implement O
in O
a O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
( O
P2P O
) O
network O
. O

Existing O
techniques O
for O
prefix O
search O
suffer O
from O
several O
problems O
: O
increased O
storage O
/ O
index O
costs O
, O
unbalanced O
load O
, O
fault O
tolerance O
, O
hot O
spot O
, O
and O
lack O
of O
some O
ranking O
mechanism O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
KISS O
( O
Keytokenbased O
Index O
and O
Search O
Scheme O

a O
simple O
and O
novel O
approach O
for O
prefix O
search O
to O
overcome O
the O
above O
problems O
. O

AP1000 O
. O

is O

on O
the O

problem O
, O
that O
of O

documents O
or O

to O

. O

of O

permits O
use O
of O
the O
AP1000 O
's O
DDV O
options O
for O
storing O
text O
bases O
, O
resulting O
in O
signi O
ca O
nt O
decreases O
in O
loading O
times O
. O

A O
new O

interface O
( O

) O

, O

, O

, O

whole O

from O

being O

. O

A O

of O

is O
being O
developed O
for O

base O
administration O

. O

Initial O
performance O

are O

, O

for O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
an O
important O
application O
area O
of O
natural O
- O
language O
processing O
where O
one O
encounters O
the O
genuine O
challenge O
of O
processing O
large O
quantities O
of O
unrestricted O
natural O
- O
language O
text O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
on O
the O
application O
of O
a O
few O
simple O
, O
yet O
robust O
and O
efficient O
nounphrase O
analysis O
techniques O
to O
create O
better O
indexing O
phrases O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
hybrid O
approach O
to O
the O
extraction O
of O
meaningful O
( O
continuous O
or O
discontinuous O
) O
subcompounds O
from O
complex O
noun O
phrases O
using O
both O
corpus O
statistics O
and O
linguistic O
heuristics O
. O

Results O
of O
experiments O
show O
that O
indexing O
based O
on O
such O
extracted O
subcompounds O
improves O
both O
recall O
and O
precision O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

The O
noun O
- O
phrase O
analysis O
techniques O
are O
also O
potentially O
useful O
for O
book O
indexing O
and O
automatic O
thesaurus O
extraction O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Random O
Forest O
( O
RF O
) O
classification O
algorithm O
is O
widely O
used O
in O
the O
area O
of O
information O
retrieval O
and O
became O
a O
basis O
for O
some O
extended O
branches O
of O
classification O
and/or O
regression O
algorithms O
. O

Cluster O
Forest O
( O
CF O
) O
represents O
a O
particular O
branch O
, O
and O
brings O
usually O
better O
results O
than O
individual O
clustering O
algorithms O
. O

This O
article O
describes O
a O
new O
ensemble O
clustering O
algorithm O
based O
on O
CF O
that O
internally O
uses O
a O
probabilistic O
model O
called O
Gaussian O
Mixture O
Model O
( O
GMM O
Finally O
, O
Expectation O
- O
maximization O
algorithm O
is O
used O
for O
estimation O
of O
GMM O
parameters O
. O

The O
proposed O
ensemble O
clustering O
algorithm O
will O
be O
compared O
with O
several O
different O
approaches O
and O
tested O
on O
eight O
datasets O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
discuss O
the O
integration O
of O
different O
GIR O
systems O
by O
means O
of O
a O
fuzzy O
Borda O
method O
for O
result O
fusion O
. O

Two O
of O
the O
systems O
, O
the O
one O
by O
the O
Universidad O
Politécnica O
de O
Valencia O
and O
the O
one O
of O
the O
Universidad O
of O
Jaén O
participated O
to O
the O
GeoCLEF O
task O
under O
the O
name O
TextMess O
. O

The O
proposed O
result O
fusion O
method O
takes O
as O
input O
the O
document O
lists O
returned O
by O
the O
different O
systems O
and O
returns O
a O
document O
list O
where O
the O
documents O
are O
ranked O
according O
to O
the O
fuzzy O
Borda O
voting O
scheme O
. O

The O
obtained O
results O
show O
that O
the O
fusion O
method O
allows O
to O
improve O
the O
results O
of O
the O
component O
systems O
, O
although O
the O
fusion O
is O
not O
optimal O
, O
because O
it O
is O
effective O
only O
if O
the O
components O
return O
a O
similar O
set O
of O
relevant O
documents O
. O

. O

( O

an O

/ O

of O

of O

only O

. O

. O

. O

configurations O
of O
corpus O
building O
and O
indexing O
on O
query O
results O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
tool O
designed O
to O
support O
large O
- O
scale O
studies O
of O

techniques O
in O

of O

the O

. O

We O
also O

to O

data O
such O
studies O
require O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
analyzes O
the O
properties O
, O
structures O
and O
limitations O
of O
vector O
- O
based O
models O
for O
information O
retrieval O
from O
the O
computational O
geometry O
point O
of O
view O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
that O
both O
the O
pseudo O
- O

and O
the O

vector O
space O
models O
can O
be O
viewed O
as O

cases O
of O
a O

model O
. O

More O

the O
necessary O
and O
sufficient O
conditions O
have O
been O
identified O
, O
under O
which O
ranking O
functions O
such O
as O
the O
inner O
- O
product O
, O
cosine O
, O
pseudo O
- O
cosine O
, O
Dice O
, O
covariance O
and O
product O
- O
moment O
correlation O
measures O
can O
be O
used O
to O

the O
documents O
. O

The O

of O
the O
solution O
region O
for O
acceptable O
ranking O
is O
analyzed O
and O
an O
algorithm O
for O
finding O
all O
the O
solution O
vectors O
is O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Schema O
matching O
is O
the O
task O
of O
finding O
semantic O
correspondences O
between O
elements O
of O
two O
schemas O
. O

It O
takes O
two O
schemas O
as O
input O
and O
returns O
a O
mapping O
that O
identifies O
corresponding O
elements O
in O
the O
two O
schemas O
. O

Schema O
matching O
is O
an O
important O
and O

step O
in O
many O

and O

translation O
and O

, O

as O

of O

, O

, O

mapping O
etc O
. O

In O
this O

, O
we O
describe O
different O
characteristics O
exhibited O
by O
matching O
element O
pairs O
at O
various O
levels O
in O
the O
XML O
schema O
and O
propose O
a O
system O
which O
uses O
these O
characteristics O
to O
perform O
the O
matching O
process O
. O

The O
novelty O
in O
the O
system O
is O
the O
architecture O
of O
the O
system O
which O
comprises O
of O
a O
linguistic O
matcher O
in O

with O
a O

of O
filters O
operating O
based O
on O
the O
level O
of O
the O
element O
pairs O
to O
be O
matched O
in O
the O
source O
and O
target O

schemas O
. O

— O

to O

recall O
, O

and O
recall O
- O

measures O
. O

Its O

to O

of O

. O

and O

of O

to O
one O
's O
research O
from O

-DOCSTART- O

Latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
extremely O
useful O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
but O
it O
is O
not O
an O
optimal O
representation O
for O
text O
classification O
. O

It O
always O
drops O
the O
text O
classification O
performance O
when O
being O
applied O
to O
the O
whole O
training O
set O
( O
global O
LSI O
) O
because O
this O
completely O
unsupervised O
method O
ignores O
class O
discrimination O
while O
only O
concentrating O
on O
representation O
. O

Some O
local O
LSI O
methods O
have O
been O
proposed O
to O
improve O
the O
classification O
by O
utilizing O
class O
discrimination O
information O
. O

However O
, O
their O
performance O
improvements O
over O
original O
term O
vectors O
are O
still O
very O
limited O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
local O
LSI O
method O
called O
" O
local O
relevancy O
weighted O
LSI O
" O
to O
improve O
text O
classification O
by O
performing O
a O
separate O
single O
value O
decomposition O
( O
SVD O
) O
on O
the O
transformed O
local O
region O
of O
each O
class O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
is O
much O
better O
than O
global O
LSI O
and O
traditional O
local O
LSI O
methods O
on O
classification O
within O
a O
much O
smaller O
LSI O
dimension O
. O

article O
presents O

of O

of O

. O

, O

The O

of O

links O
between O
software O
artefacts O
is O

important O
to O

and O

. O

This O
is O
confirmed O
by O
several O

link O

and O

plug O

in O
to O

software O

the O

between O
source O
code O
components O
being O
developed O
and O
the O

level O
artefacts O
they O
should O
be O
traced O
on O
. O

Such O
a O

suggests O
actions O
aiming O
at O

usage O
of O
identifiers O
and O
comments O
in O

code O
and O

and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O

study O

- O
language O
information O

a O

model O
trained O
on O
comparable O
corpora O
such O
as O

. O

The O

model O
( O

) O
creates O
an O

representation O
, O
which O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
translation O
resource O
in O
many O
different O
multilingual O
settings O
as O
comparable O
corpora O
are O
available O
for O
many O
language O
pairs O
. O

The O
probabilistic O
interlingual O
representation O
is O
incorporated O
in O
a O
statistical O
language O
model O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Experiments O
performed O
on O
the O
English O
and O
Dutch O
test O
datasets O
of O
the O
CLEF O
2001 O
- O
2003 O
CLIR O
campaigns O
show O
the O
competitive O
performance O
of O
our O
approach O
compared O
to O
cross O
- O
language O
retrieval O
methods O
that O
rely O
on O
pre O
- O
existing O
translation O
dictionaries O
that O
are O
hand O
- O
built O
or O
constructed O
based O
on O
parallel O
corpora O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
lack O
of O
semantic O
for O
information O
description O
and O
semantic O
support O
for O
the O
query O
processing O
, O
traditional O
Blog O
systems O
are O
unable O
to O
satisfying O
users O
in O
the O
performance O
of O
information O
organization O
and O
retrieval O
. O

Through O
analyzing O
the O
existing O
technologies O
in O

systems O
and O
focusing O
on O
semantic O
retrieval O
of O
Blog O
information O
resource O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
Blog O
information O
retrieval O
model O
based O
on O
semantic O
. O

In O
order O
to O
implement O
semantic O
description O
for O
Blog O
information O
resource O
, O
we O
design O
a O
Blog O
ontology O
and O
a O
domain O
subject O
classification O
ontology O
. O

With O
predefined O
rules O
, O
we O
put O
forward O
a O
class O
hierarchy O
tree O
generating O
algorithm O
, O
expand O
Blog O
classification O
item O
semantic O
retrieval O
, O
and O
finally O
implement O
semantic O
retrieval O
by O
SPARQL O
query O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Indexing O
allows O
converting O
raw O
document O
collection O
into O
easily O
searchable O
representation O
. O

Bigger O
scale O
indexing O
poses O
some O
challenges O
such O
as O
how O
to O
distribute O
indexing O
computation O
efficiently O
on O
a O
cluster O
of O
nodes O
. O

MapReduce O
framework O
can O
be O
an O
effective O
tool O
for O
parallelizing O
such O
tasks O
as O
inverted O
index O
construction O
. O

We O
propose O
SciPDFindexer O
, O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
system O
for O
scientific O
articles O
in O
PDF O
. O

For O
given O
large O
collection O
of O
scientific O
articles O
in O
PDF O
our O
system O
parses O
and O
extracts O
metadata O
from O
articles O
, O
and O
then O
indexes O
extracted O
content O
using O
our O
proposed O
scheme O
. O

Our O
contribution O
is O
the O
design O
of O
distributed O
IR O
system O
and O
indexing O
scheme O
that O
improve O
the O
overall O
indexing O
performance O
. O

, O
often O

“ O
query O

to O

- O

of O

, O
from O

input O
to O
retrieving O
pieces O
. O

We O
suggest O
a O

- O
bed O
needs O
to O
represent O
each O
data O
- O
processing O
stage O
, O
from O
initial O

of O
an O

, O
to O
the O

ranking O
of O
each O
piece O
in O

database O
compared O
to O
a O
particular O
query O
. O

Such O

- O
stage O
dataset O
would O
let O
each O

group O
concentrate O
on O
the O
portion O
of O

task O
most O

to O

, O

at O
the O
same O

and O

data O
for O
each O

of O
the O
system O
. O

to O

of O
all O
or O
part O
of O
this O
work O
for O
personal O
or O

use O
is O
granted O
without O

provided O
that O
copies O

not O

for O

advantage O

HTML O
anchors O
are O
often O
surrounded O
by O
text O
that O
seems O
to O
describe O
the O
destination O

appropriately O
. O

The O

a O

or O

< O
i O
> O

link O
- O
context</i O
> O
is O
used O
for O
a O

of O

with O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
. O

These O
tasks O
can O
benefit O
by O

in O
the O

" O
good O
" O

. O

. O

- O
context O

methods O
. O

We O

a O

of O

pages O

from O
more O
than O
10,000 O
different O
categories O
of O

ODP O
. O

is O
on O

the O
potential O

of O
using O
a O
Web O
page O
's O
tag O
tree O
structure O
, O
for O

link O
- O
contexts O
. O

We O
find O
that O
good O
link O
- O
context O
can O
be O
associated O
with O
tag O
tree O
hierarchy O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
climbing O
up O
the O
tag O
tree O
when O
the O
link O
- O
context O
provided O
by O
greater O
depths O
is O
too O
short O
can O
provide O
better O
performance O
than O
some O
of O
the O
traditional O
techniques O
. O

Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
is O
a O
technique O
used O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
as O
an O
effective O
tool O
in O
correlating O
and O
retrieving O
relevant O
documents O
. O

The O
authors O
presented O
a O
new O
philosophy O
for O
LSI O
analysis O
and O
evaluation O
based O
on O
the O
use O
of O
image O
processing O
tools O
. O

In O
this O
new O
approach O
the O
Term O
Document O
Matrix O
( O
TDM O
) O
generated O
in O

LSI O
process O
is O
visualized O
and O
treated O
as O
an O
image O
enabling O
techniques O
from O
image O
processing O
to O
be O
applied O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
novel O
extension O
to O
this O
work O
in O
which O
various O
features O
of O
the O
target O
databases O
can O
be O
used O
to O
predict O
, O
and O
pre O
- O
select O
, O
search O
criteria O
. O

This O
latest O
approach O
has O
been O
evaluated O
and O
validated O
by O
applying O
it O
to O
a O
range O
of O
sample O
databases O
. O

for O

assumes O
availability O

. O

For O

not O

. O

Empirical O

of O

existing O
approach O

on O
par O
if O
not O

of O

can O

. O

Document O
retrieval O
is O
the O
task O
of O
returning O
relevant O
textual O
resources O
for O
a O
given O
user O
query O
. O

In O
this O

, O

whether O
the O

analysis O
of O
the O
query O
and O
the O
documents O
, O

exploiting O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
techniques O
( O
e.g O

Linking O
, O

) O

resources O
( O
e.g O

, O

can O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
the O
traditional O
term O
- O
based O
similarity O
approach O
. O

experiments O
, O

on O
a O
recently O
released O
document O
collection O
, O
show O
that O

Average O
Precision O
( O
MAP O
) O
increases O
of O
3.5 O
percentage O
points O
when O

textual O
and O

analysis O
, O
thus O
suggesting O
that O
semantic O
content O
can O
effectively O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
. O

( O
IR O

61,000 O

a O
set O
of O
40 O
topics O
and O
their O
relevance O
judgements O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
a O
collection O
of O
nearly O
250,000 O
user O
profiles O
related O
to O
the O
NBA O
collection O
is O
available O
. O

Several O
baseline O
IR O
experiments O
report O
the O
effect O
of O
using O
video O
- O
associated O
metadata O
on O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

The O
results O
surprisingly O
show O
that O
searching O
the O
videos O
titles O
only O
performs O
significantly O
better O
than O
searching O
additional O
metadata O
text O
fields O
of O

videos O
such O
as O
the O
tags O
or O
the O

. O

Note O
onset O
detection O
and O
instrument O
recognition O
are O
two O
of O
the O
most O
investigated O
tasks O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
Various O
detection O
methods O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
previous O
research O
for O
western O
music O
, O
with O
less O
focus O
on O
other O
music O
cultures O
of O
the O
world O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
onset O
detection O
for O
percussion O
instruments O
in O
Beijing O
Opera O
, O
a O
major O
genre O
of O
Chinese O
traditional O
music O
. O

A O
dataset O
of O
individual O
audio O
samples O
of O
four O
primary O
percussion O
instruments O
is O
used O
to O
obtain O
the O
spectral O
bases O
for O
each O
instrument O
. O

With O
these O
bases O
, O
we O
separate O
the O
input O
percussion O
ensemble O
recordings O
into O
its O
spectral O
sources O
and O
their O
activations O
using O
a O
Non O
- O
negative O
Matrix O
Factorization O
( O
NMF O
) O
based O
algorithm O
. O

A O
simple O
onset O
detection O
conducted O
on O
each O
NMF O
activation O
presents O
satisfactory O
overall O
detection O
rates O
, O
and O
provides O
us O
valuable O
implications O
and O
suggestions O
for O
future O
development O
of O
drum O
transcription O
and O
percussion O
pattern O
analysis O
in O
Beijing O
Opera O
. O

One O
fundamental O
issue O
of O
learning O
to O
rank O
is O
the O
choice O
of O
loss O
function O
to O
be O
optimized O
. O

Although O
the O
evaluation O
measures O
used O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
are O
ideal O
ones O
, O
in O
many O
cases O
they O
ca O
n't O
be O
used O
directly O
because O
they O
do O
not O

the O
smooth O
property O
needed O
in O
conventional O
machine O

algorithms O
. O

this O
paper O

method O
named O

is O
proposed O
, O
which O
tries O
to O
use O
IR O
evaluation O
measure O
directly O
. O

It O
employs O
the O
clonal O
selection O
algorithm O
to O
learn O
an O
effective O
ranking O
function O
by O
combining O
various O
evidences O
in O
IR O
. O

results O
on O
the O

benchmarh O
datasets O
demonstrate O
that O

outperforms O
the O
baseline O
methods O
in O
terms O
of O
P@n O
, O
MAP O
and O
NDCG@n O
. O

Description O
Logics O
( O

) O
are O
suitable O
, O
well O
- O
known O
, O
logics O
for O
managing O
structured O
knowledge O
. O

They O
allow O
reasoning O
about O
individuals O
and O
well O
defined O
concepts O
, O

set O
of O
individuals O
with O

properties O
. O

The O

would O

. O

In O
particular O
, O
concepts O
becomes O
fuzzy O
and O
, O
thus O
, O
reasoning O
about O
imprecise O
concepts O
is O

. O

, O

it O
. O

are O
constructed O
autonomously O
and O
information O
relevant O
to O
a O
user O
is O
offered O
without O
explicit O
request O
. O

Query O
- O
free O
methods O
offer O
an O
apparently O
new O
approach O
for O
integrating O
knowledge O
- O
based O
applications O
with O
legacy O
databases O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
prototype O
system O
, O
F O
IXIT O
which O
integrates O
an O
expert O
diagnostic O
system O
with O
a O
preexisting O
full O
- O
text O
database O
of O
maintenance O
manuals O
. O

The O
reported O
results O
suggest O
that O
query O
- O
free O
information O
retrieval O
can O
liberate O
the O
user O
from O
burdensome O
information O
retrieval O
activities O
while O
incurring O
only O
modest O
system O
development O
costs O
and O
minimal O
run- O


-DOCSTART- O

Goal O
of O
conferences O
like O
TREC O
, O
TIPSTER O
, O
NTCIR O
, O
CLEF O
is O
to O
judge O
the O
performance O
of O
different O
algorithms O
. O

Most O
of O
these O
conferences O
have O
tracks O
that O
deal O
with O
new O
and O
innovative O
information O
retrieval O
problems O
, O
but O
none O
has O
tackled O
to O
work O
with O
Urdu O
data O
, O
primarily O
because O
of O
the O
lack O
of O
resources O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
baseline O
for O
Urdu O
IR O
evaluation O
along O
with O
resources O
necessary O
to O
do O
the O
task O
. O

The O
goal O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
explore O
the O
strategy O
for O
creation O
of O
the O
test O
reference O
collection O
for O
Urdu O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

A O
small O
test O
reference O
collection O
is O
presented O
composed O
of O
news O
articles O
from O
the O
Web O
along O
with O
some O
experiments O
to O
show O
its O
effectiveness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

of O

- O

in O

. O

In O

have O

of O
productive O
derivational O
morphology O
for O
single O
word O
term O

and O
the O

of O

for O

- O

. O

have O

. O

nd O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
require O
input O
corpora O
to O
be O
indexed O
. O

The O
advent O
of O
terabyte O
- O
scale O
Web O
corpora O
has O
reinvigorated O
the O
need O
for O
efficient O
indexing O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
investigate O
distributed O
indexing O
paradigms O
, O
in O
particular O
within O
the O
auspices O
of O
the O
MapReduce O
programming O
framework O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
describe O
two O
indexing O
approaches O
based O
on O
the O
original O
MapReduce O
paper O
, O
and O
compare O
these O
with O
a O
standard O
distributed O
IR O
system O
, O
the O
MapReduce O

strategy O
used O
by O
the O
Nutch O
IR O
platform O
, O
and O
a O
more O
advanced O
MapReduce O
indexing O
implementation O
that O
we O
propose O
. O

Experiments O
using O
the O
Hadoop O
MapReduce O
implementation O
and O
a O
large O
standard O
TREC O
corpus O
show O
our O
proposed O
MapReduce O
indexing O
implementation O
to O
be O
more O
efficient O
than O
those O
proposed O
in O
the O

paper O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Practical O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
must O
manage O
large O
volumes O
of O
data O
, O
often O
divided O
into O
several O
collections O
that O
may O
be O
held O
on O
separate O
machines O
. O

Techniques O
for O
locating O
matches O
to O
queries O
must O
therefore O
consider O
identiication O
of O
probable O
collections O
as O
well O
as O
identiication O
of O
documents O
that O
are O
probable O
answers O
. O

Furthermore O
the O
large O
amounts O
of O
data O
involved O
motivates O
the O
use O
of O
compression O
, O
but O
in O
a O
dynamic O
environment O
compression O
is O
problematic O
, O
because O
as O
new O
text O
is O
added O
the O
compression O
model O
slowly O
becomes O
inappropriate O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
solutions O
to O
both O
of O
these O
problems O
. O

We O
show O
that O
use O
of O
centralised O
blocked O
indexes O
can O
reduce O
overall O
query O
processing O
costs O
in O
a O
multi O
- O
collection O
environment O
, O
and O
that O
careful O
application O
of O
text O
compression O
techniques O
allow O
collections O
to O
grow O
by O
several O
orders O
of O
magnitude O
without O
recompres O
- O
sion O
becoming O
necessary O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
simple O
modification O
of O
Horn O
's O
circle O
drawing O
procedure O
yields O
a O
disk O
generator O
for O
a O
class O
of O
graphic O
devices O
capable O
of O
drawing O
rectangular O
areas O
. O

Another O
variation O
produces O
a O
disk O
a O
scan O
- O
line O
at O
a O
time O
allowing O
it O
to O
be O
drawn O
at O
the O
refresh O
rate O
of O
the O
display O
. O

The O
calculations O
involve O
only O
additions O
and O
binary O
shifts O
. O

In O
the O
context O
of O
the O
Scientific O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
this O

aims O
to O
observe O
dependences O
between O
user O
characteristics O
( O
the O
profile O
) O
and O
pertinent O
document O
characteristics O
( O
metadata O
We O
know O
and O
use O
the O
relation O
between O
the O
topic O
of O
the O
information O
need O
and O
the O
topic O
of O
the O
document O
, O
but O
we O
think O
other O
less O
intuitive O
dependences O
exist O
. O

We O
built O
possible O
assumption O
of O
dependences O
between O
a O

and O

. O

in O
a O
SRI O
will O
decrease O
the O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
the O
Private O
Digital O
Library O
( O
PDL O
) O
project O
that O
represents O
a O
service O
of O
the O
Corporate O
Digital O
Library O
( O
CDL O
) O
prototype O
. O

The O
main O
ideas O
underlying O
this O
project O
are O
the O
following O
. O

When O
a O
user O
is O
looking O
for O
documents O
that O
he O
already O
retrieved O
in O
the O
past O
, O
he O
has O
to O
repeat O
the O
search O
procedure O
and O
solve O
the O
same O
problems O
he O
encountered O
in O
the O
past O
access O
. O

On O
the O
contrary O
, O
consider O
the O
possibility O
for O
the O
user O
to O
store O
documents O
in O
a O
private O
library O
. O

In O
this O
case O
, O
he O
will O
have O
the O
chance O
to O
retrieve O
the O
documents O
of O
interest O
more O
easily O
and O
quickly O
. O

It O
may O
also O
be O
the O
case O
that O
the O
user O
has O
not O
a O
clear O
understanding O
of O
what O
he O
is O
looking O
for O
. O

Moreover O
, O
he O
might O
not O
know O
exactly O
the O
library O
content O
and O
organization O
. O

Thus O
, O
he O
needs O
for O
assistance O
to O
suggest O
him O
what O
to O
look O
for O
and O
how O
to O
query O
the O
system O
. O

A O
method O
to O
store O
and O
catalogue O
documents O
according O
to O
personal O
criteria O
might O
help O
to O
overcome O
these O
problems O
. O

There O
is O
an O
explosive O
growth O
of O
regulatory O
and O
related O
information O
now O
available O
online O
. O

This O
paper O
reviews O
the O
current O
state O
of O
practice O
in O
accessing O
patent O
- O
related O
documents O
in O
the O
form O
of O
patents O
, O
government O
regulations O
, O
court O
cases O
, O
scientific O
publications O
, O
etc O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
an O
ontology O
- O
based O
framework O
to O
retrieve O
documents O
from O
the O
multiple O
heterogeneous O
databases O
. O

A O
use O
case O
, O
erythropoietin O
, O
is O
developed O
to O
test O
the O

. O

A O

of O
135 O

and O
30 O
court O
cases O
closely O

to O
the O
use O
case O
is O
built O
. O

to O
improve O
the O

through O
the O
use O
of O
bio O
- O
ontologies O
for O
document O

in O
the O
two O
databases O
. O

The O
challenges O
faced O
with O
respect O
to O
the O

of O
these O
documents O
and O
future O
plans O
are O
briefly O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
boosting O
based O
algorithm O
for O
learning O
a O
bipartite O
ranking O
function O
( O
BRF O
) O
with O
partially O
labeled O
data O
. O

Until O
now O
different O
attempts O
had O
been O
made O
to O
build O
a O
BRF O
in O
a O
< O

i O
> O
transductive</i O
> O
setting O
, O
in O
which O
the O
test O
points O
are O
given O
to O
the O
methods O
in O
advance O
as O
unlabeled O
data O
. O

The O
proposed O
approach O
is O
a O
semi O
- O
supervised O
< O
i O
> O
inductive</i O
> O
ranking O
algorithm O
which O
, O
as O
opposed O
to O
transductive O
algorithms O
, O
is O
able O
to O
infer O
an O
ordering O
on O
new O
examples O
that O
were O
not O
used O
for O
its O
training O
. O

We O
evaluate O
our O
approach O
using O
the O
TREC-9 O
Ohsumed O
and O
the O
Reuters-21578 O
data O
collections O
, O
comparing O
against O
two O
semi O
- O
supervised O
classification O
algorithms O
for O
ROCArea O
( O
AUC O
uninterpolated O
average O
precision O
( O
AUP O
mean O
precision@50 O
( O
TP O
) O
and O
Precision O
- O
Recall O
( O
PR O
) O
curves O
. O

In O
the O
most O
interesting O
cases O
where O
there O
are O
an O
unbalanced O
number O
of O
irrelevant O
examples O
over O
relevant O
ones O
, O
we O
show O
our O
method O
to O
produce O
statistically O
significant O
improvements O
with O
respect O
to O
these O
ranking O
measures O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
reflect O
on O
ways O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
bio O
- O
medical O
information O
retrieval O
by O
drawing O
implicit O
negative O
feedback O
from O
negated O
information O

noisy O

language O
search O
queries O
. O

begin O
by O
studying O
the O
extent O
to O
which O
negations O
occur O
in O
clinical O
texts O
and O
quantify O
their O
detrimental O
effect O
on O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

, O

a O

of O

and O

that O

. O

Clinical O
Decision O
Support O
Track O

to O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O

. O

to O

by O
up O
to O

% O
. O

INTRODUCTION O

In O
recent O
years O
“ O
big O
data O
” O
has O
become O
something O
of O
a O
buzzword O
in O
business O
, O
computer O
science O
, O
information O
studies O
, O
information O
systems O
, O
statistics O
, O
and O
many O
other O
fields O
. O

As O
technology O
continues O
to O
advance O
, O
we O
constantly O
generate O
an O
ever O
- O
increasing O
amount O
of O
data O
. O

This O
growth O
does O
not O
differentiate O
between O
individuals O
and O
businesses O
, O
private O
or O
public O
sectors O
, O
institutions O
of O
learning O
and O
commercial O
entities O
. O

It O
is O
nigh O
universal O
and O
therefore O
warrants O
further O
study O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Stemming O
is O
a O
technique O
used O
to O
reduce O
inflected O
and O
derived O
words O
to O
their O
basic O
forms O
( O
stem O
or O
root O

It O
is O
a O
very O
important O
step O
of O
pre O
- O
processing O
in O
text O
mining O
, O
and O
generally O
used O
in O
many O
areas O
of O
research O
such O
as O
: O
Natural O
language O
Processing O
NLP O
, O
Text O
Categorization O
TC O
, O
Text O
Summarizing O
TS O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
IR O
, O
and O
other O
tasks O
in O
text O
mining O
. O

Stemming O
is O
frequently O
useful O
in O
text O
categorization O
to O
reduce O
the O
size O
of O
terms O
vocabulary O
, O
and O
in O
information O
retrieval O
to O
improve O
the O
search O
effectiveness O
and O
then O
gives O
us O
relevant O
results O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
multilingual O
stemmer O
based O
on O
the O
extraction O
of O
word O
root O
and O
in O
which O
we O
use O
the O
technique O
of O
n O
- O
grams O
. O

We O
validated O
our O
stemmer O
on O
three O
languages O
which O
are O
: O
Arabic O
, O
French O
and O
English O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
deal O
with O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
based O
on O
language O
model O
paradigm O
, O
which O
has O
been O
intensively O
investigated O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

We O
propose O
, O
implement O
, O
and O
evaluate O
an O
enrichment O
of O
language O
model O
employing O
syntactic O
dependency O
information O
acquired O
automatically O
from O
both O
documents O
and O
queries O
. O

By O
testing O
our O
model O
on O
the O
Czech O
test O
collection O
from O
Cross O
Language O
Evaluation O
Forum O
2007 O
Ad O
- O
Hoc O
track O
, O
we O
show O
positive O
contribution O
of O
using O
dependency O
syntax O
in O
this O
context O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Work O
on O
the O
statistical O
validity O
of O
experimental O
results O
in O
retrieval O
tests O
has O
concentrated O
on O
treating O
the O
topics O
as O
a O
sample O
from O
a O
population O
, O
but O
regarding O
the O
collection O
of O
documents O
as O
fixed O
. O

This O
paper O
raises O
the O
argument O
that O
we O
should O
also O
consider O
the O
documents O
as O
having O
been O
sampled O
from O
a O
population O
. O

It O
follows O
that O
we O
should O
regard O
a O
per O
- O
topic O
measurement O
as O
also O
having O
a O
per O
- O
topic O
noise O
or O
error O
associated O
with O
it O
, O
which O
may O
depend O
critically O
on O
the O
number O
of O
relevant O
documents O
for O
that O

As O
web O
is O

of O

on O

. O

The O

on O

is O

great O
need O
, O
the O
world O
is O
full O
of O
questions O

. O

engine O
results O

Social O
Information O
Retrieval O
can O
be O
interpreted O
as O
querying O
the O
private O
information O
spaces O
of O
others O
within O
one O
's O
social O
network O
. O

One O
of O
the O
crucial O
steps O
in O
such O
a O
search O
approach O
is O
to O
identify O
the O
set O
of O
potential O
information O
providers O
to O
route O
the O
query O
to O
. O

In O
this O

, O
we O
compare O
various O

mechanisms O
based O
on O
topic O
models O
( O

Dirichlet O
Allocation O
, O
LDA O
Explicit O

Analysis O
( O
ESA O
and O
traditional O
metrics O
like O

Frequency O
( O

) O
and O
Term O
Frequency O
- O
Inverse O

Frequency O
( O

- O
IDF O
) O
to O
identify O
expertise O
using O
a O
publicly O
available O
data O
collection O
with O
1 O
, O
400 O
scientific O
abstracts O
including O
author O
information O
, O
queries O
, O
and O
relevance O
judgments O
. O

The O
abstracts O
are O
interpreted O
as O
knowledge O
profile O
in O
a O
social O
information O
retrieval O
scenario O
. O

Our O
results O
suggest O
that O
both O
LDA O
and O
ESA O
can O
solve O
the O
routing O
problem O
, O
whereas O
the O
LDA O
- O
based O
approach O
and O
a O
new O

approach O
considering O
links O
between O
semantic O
concepts O
perform O
best O
on O
the O
tested O
dataset O
. O

< O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
report O
the O
results O
of O
an O
independent O
experimental O
evaluation O
of O
an O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
developed O
at O
the O
Illinois O
Institute O
of O
Technology O
( O
IIT O
The O
system O
, O
which O
is O
called O
the O

Advanced O
Information O
Retrieval O
Engine</i O

AIRE O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
tools O
and O
utilities O
providing O
indexing O
, O
extraction O
, O
searching O
and O
visualization O
. O

We O
evaluated O
AIRE O
on O
three O
data O
sets O
from O
the O
Text O
REtrieval O
Conference O
( O
TREC O
TREC O
8 O
, O
9 O
and O
10 O
. O

Overall O
, O
our O
results O
indicate O
that O
AIRE O
is O
a O
highly O
accurate O
IR O
system O
. O

Compared O
with O
results O
published O
by O
IIT O
, O
in O
our O
experiments O
AIRE O
consistently O
scored O
higher O
in O
recall O
. O

AIRE O
also O
scored O
higher O
in O
precision O
, O
but O
only O
for O
automatic O
tasks O
. O

In O
manual O
tasks O
, O
AIRE O
scored O
lower O
in O
precision O
in O
our O
experiments O
, O
but O
we O
attributed O
that O
to O
factors O
external O
to O
AIRE O
. O

Our O
final O
conclusion O
is O
that O
AIRE O
is O
a O
highly O
accurate O
IR O
system O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Distributed O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
DIR O
) O
is O
a O
generic O
area O
of O
research O
that O
brings O
together O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
resource O
selection O
and O
results O
aggregation O
, O
dealing O
with O
data O
that O
, O
for O
organizational O
or O
technical O
reasons O
, O
can O
not O
be O
managed O
centrally O
. O

Existing O
and O
potential O
applications O
of O
DIR O
methods O
vary O
from O
blog O
retrieval O
to O
aggregated O
search O
and O
from O
multimedia O
and O
multilingual O
retrieval O
to O
distributed O
Web O
search O
. O

In O
this O
tutorial O
we O
briefly O
discuss O
main O
DIR O
phases O
, O
that O
are O
resource O
description O
, O
resource O
selection O
, O
results O
merging O
and O
results O
presentation O
. O

The O
main O
focus O
is O
made O
on O
applications O
of O
DIR O
techniques O
: O
blog O
, O
expert O
and O
desktop O
search O
, O
aggregated O
search O
and O
personal O
meta O
- O
search O
, O
multimedia O
and O
multilingual O
retrieval O
. O

We O
also O
discuss O
a O
number O
of O
potential O
applications O
of O
DIR O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
distributed O
Web O
search O
, O
enterprise O
search O
and O
aggregated O
mobile O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
paper O
proposes O
a O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
over O
the O
Cayley O
- O
Klein O
Hyperbolic O
Geometry O
( O
referred O
to O
as O
Hyperbolic O
Information O
Retrieval O
HIR O
) O
using O
a O
similarity O
measure O
derived O
from O
the O
hyperbolic O
distance O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
that O
the O
proposed O
model O
is O
equivalent O
with O
the O
classical O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
using O
Cosine O
measure O
with O
normalized O
weighting O
scheme O
. O

It O
is O
also O
shown O
that O
the O
categoricity O
of O
the O
new O
retrieval O
system O
can O
be O
varied O
by O
only O
modifying O
the O
radius O
of O
the O
hyperbolic O
space O
and O
without O
using O
a O
different O
weighting O
scheme O
and O
similarity O
measure O
, O
which O
is O
not O
the O
case O
in O
the O
VSM O
, O
where O
the O
same O
effect O
can O
only O
be O
obtained O
by O
both O
changing O
the O
weighting O
scheme O
and O
similarity O
measure O
at O
the O
expense O
of O
a O
more O
costly O
computation O
. O

Experiments O
are O
also O
reported O
to O
demonstrate O
and O
support O
the O
ideas O
, O
and O
they O
show O
that O
categoricity O
in O
HIR O
can O
be O
varied O
more O
than O
O(n O
) O
faster O
, O
where O
n O
is O
the O
number O
of O
index O
terms O
, O
than O
in O
the O
VSM O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
normally O
have O
to O
work O
with O
rather O
heterogeneous O
sources O
, O
such O
as O
Web O
sites O
or O
documents O
from O
Optical O
Character O
Recognition O
tools O
. O

The O
correct O
conversion O
of O
these O
sources O
into O
flat O
text O
files O
is O
not O
a O
trivial O
task O
since O
noise O
may O
easily O
be O
introduced O
as O
a O
result O
of O
spelling O
or O
typeset O
errors O
. O

Interestingly O
, O
this O
is O
not O
a O
great O
drawback O
when O
the O
size O
of O
the O
corpus O
is O
sufficiently O
large O
, O
since O
redundancy O
helps O
to O
overcome O
noise O
problems O
. O

However O
, O
noise O
becomes O
a O
serious O
problem O
in O
restricted O
- O
domain O
Information O
Retrieval O
specially O
when O
the O
corpus O
is O
small O
and O
has O
little O
or O
no O
redundancy O
. O

This O
paper O
devises O
an O
approach O
which O
adds O
noise O
- O
tolerance O
to O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
. O

A O
set O
of O
experiments O
carried O
out O
in O
the O
agricultural O
domain O
proves O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
approach O
presented O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
gives O
an O
overview O
of O
tools O
and O
methods O
for O
CrossLanguage O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
that O
are O
developed O
within O
the O
Twenty O
- O
One O
project O
. O

The O
tools O
and O
methods O
are O
evaluated O
with O
the O
TREC O
CLIR O
task O
document O
collection O
using O
Dutch O
queries O
on O
the O
English O
document O
base O
. O

The O
main O
issue O
addressed O
here O
is O
an O
evaluation O
of O
two O
approaches O
to O
disambiguation O
. O

The O
underlying O
question O
is O
whether O
a O
lot O
of O
effort O
should O
be O
put O
in O
finding O
the O
correct O
translation O
for O
each O
query O
term O
before O
searching O
, O
or O
whether O
searching O
with O
more O
than O
one O
possible O
translation O
leads O
to O
better O
results O
? O

The O
experimental O
study O
suggests O
that O
the O
quality O
of O
search O
methods O
is O
more O
important O
than O
the O
quality O
of O
disambiguation O
methods O
. O

Good O
retrieval O
methods O
are O
able O
to O
disambiguate O
translated O
queries O
implicitly O
during O
searching O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

this O
note O
, O

discuss O
a O
very O
nice O
and O

application O
of O

- O

after O

really O
blossomed O

at O
the O
same O
time1 O
as O

of O

/ O

typically O

some O

) O

, O

who O
is O
listening O
in O
and O

to O
discover O
what O
they O
are O
saying O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
currently O
being O
developed O
to O
represent O
and O
manipulate O
complex O
multimedia O
objects O
. O

Such O
objects O
contain O
two O
types O
of O
components O
, O
i.e. O
structured O
components O
( O
e.g. O
of O
the O
type O
integer O
, O
real O
, O
fixed O
- O
length O
string O
, O
etc O
and O
unstructured O
components O
( O
e.g. O
text O
, O
images O
, O
sounds O
Relational O
database O
systems O
( O
RDBS O
) O
are O
often O
used O
to O
store O
structured O
data O
and O
retrieve O
it O
via O
exact O
matching O
, O
while O
unstructured O
data O
is O
organized O
into O
inverted O
files O
, O
and O
accessed O
by O
Information O
storage O
and O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRS O
utilizing O
indeterminate O
matching O
. O

The O
difficulty O
is O
how O
to O
fill O
the O
gap O
between O
the O
RDBs O
and O
inverted O
files O
, O
as O
well O
as O
the O
gap O
between O
the O
RDBMSs O
and O
IRSs O
based O
on O
inverted O
files O
. O

We O
describe O
an O
approach O
to O
integrating O
the O
two O
types O
of O
systems O
and O
the O
two O
different O
types O
of O
data O
. O

The O
debate O
on O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
ontology O
in O
solving O
semantic O
problems O
has O
increased O
recently O
in O
many O
domains O
of O
information O
technology O
. O

One O
side O
of O
the O
debate O
accepts O
the O
inclusion O
of O
ontology O
as O
a O
suitable O
solution O
. O

The O
other O
side O
of O
the O
debate O
argues O
that O
ontology O
is O
far O
from O
an O
ideal O
solution O
to O
the O
semantic O
problem O
. O

This O
article O
explores O
this O
debate O
in O
the O
area O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Several O
past O
approaches O
were O
explored O
and O
a O
new O
approach O
was O
investigated O
to O
test O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
a O
generic O
ontology O
such O
as O
WordNet O
in O
improving O
the O
performance O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
test O
and O
the O
analysis O
of O
the O
experiments O
suggest O
that O
WordNet O
is O
far O
from O
the O
ideal O
solution O
in O
solving O
semantic O
problems O
in O
the O
information O
retrieval O
. O

However O
, O
several O
observations O
have O
been O
made O
and O
reported O
in O
this O
article O
that O
allow O
research O
in O
ontology O
for O
the O
information O
retrieval O
to O
move O
towards O
the O
right O
direction O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
following O
paper O
describes O
a O
set O
of O
methods O
that O
is O
currently O
used O
in O
a O
study O
of O
the O
task O
performance O
process O
of O
patent O
engineers O
within O
the O
Swedish O
Patentand O
Registration O
Office O
( O
SPRO O

The O
focus O
of O
the O
study O
is O
to O
investigate O
the O
relationship O
between O
the O
user O
’s O
work O
- O
task O
and O
the O
information O
seeking O
and O
retrieval O
process O
. O

The O
study O
is O
performed O
within O
a O
real O
life O
work O
setting O
where O
patent O
engineers O
are O
performing O
real O
work O

. O

of O

environment O

controlled O
variables O
and O
design O
or O

information O
need O
. O

and O

process O
and O

requirements O
for O

systems O
design O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Speech O
recognition O
can O
be O
used O
in O
music O
retrieval O
systems O
to O
identify O
the O
words O
in O
users’ O
sung O
queries O
. O

Our O
aim O
was O
to O
determine O
which O
of O
several O
techniques O
is O
most O
suitable O
for O
retrieving O
songs O
given O
a O
sung O
query O
with O
words O
. O

We O
used O
Sphinx O
for O
speech O
recognition O
, O
and O
tested O
several O
retrieval O
techniques O
on O
the O
output O
of O
the O
recognition O
system O
. O

The O
most O
effective O
retrieval O
technique O
was O
a O
combination O
of O
Edit O
Distance O
and O
Okapi O
, O
which O
persistently O
retrieved O
the O
correct O
song O
at O
the O
top O
one O
ranked O
results O
given O
that O
the O
queries O
were O
at O
least O
50 O
% O
correct O
. O

However O
, O
techniques O
performed O
differently O
when O
the O
queries O
were O
split O
into O
four O
buckets O
with O
varying O
level O
of O
correctness O
in O
the O
range O
of O
0 O
to O
73 O
% O
. O

We O

retrieval O

Answering O
( O

) O

called O
trained O

language O
model O
. O

This O
model O
addresses O
the O
word O

problem O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
proposed O
model O
captures O
pairs O
of O
trigger O
and O
target O
words O
while O
training O
on O
a O
large O
corpus O
. O

The O

are O
extracted O
based O
on O
both O
unsupervised O
and O
supervised O
approaches O
while O
different O
notions O
of O
triggering O
are O
used O
. O

In O

study O
the O
impact O
of O
corpus O
size O
and O
domain O
for O
a O
supervised O
model O
. O

All O
notions O
of O

trained O
trigger O
model O
are O
finally O
used O
in O
a O
language O
model O
- O
based O
sentence O

framework O
. O

Our O

on O
TREC O
QA O
collection O
verify O
that O

model O
significantly O
improves O
the O
sentence O
retrieval O
performance O
compared O
to O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
translation O
model O
and O
class O
model O
which O
address O
the O
same O
problem O
. O

. O

’s O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
many O
web O
applications O
such O
as O
digital O
library O
, O
digital O
museum O
and O
so O
on O
. O

On O
the O
aspect O
of O
querying O
process O
, O
most O
of O
the O
existing O
IR O
systems O
are O
based O
on O
keyword O
query O
. O

This O
type O
of O
query O
requires O
users O
to O
describe O
their O
query O
request O
by O
using O
keywords O
. O

But O
, O
common O
users O
prefer O
using O
natural O
language O
to O
express O
their O
request O
. O

So O
, O
natural O
language O
- O
based O
( O
especially O
Chinese O
natural O
language O
- O
based O
) O
IR O
system O
is O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

At O
present O
, O
most O
traditional O
IR O
systems O
are O
single O
data O
source O
oriented O
and O
always O
centralized O
. O

Grid O
is O
chosen O
to O
enable O
the O
coordinated O
use O
of O
distributed O
resources O
. O

All O
the O
algorithms O
are O
encapsulated O
into O
services O
and O
are O
effectively O
shared O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Most O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
comprised O
of O
a O
focused O
set O
of O
domain O
- O
specific O
documents O
located O
within O
a O
single O
logical O
repository O
. O

A O
mechanism O
is O
developed O
by O
which O
user O
queries O
against O
such O
a O
system O
are O
used O
to O
generate O
a O
concept O
hierarchy O
pertinent O
to O
the O
domain O
. O

First O
, O
an O
algorithm O
is O
described O
which O
extracts O
terms O
from O
documents O
matching O
user O
queries O
, O
and O
then O
reduces O
this O
set O
of O
terms O
to O
a O
manageable O
length O
. O

The O
resulting O
terms O
are O
used O
to O
generate O
a O
feature O
vector O
for O
each O
query O
, O
and O
the O
queries O
are O
clustered O
using O
a O
Hierarchical O
Agglomerative O
Clustering O
( O
HAC O
) O
algorithm O
. O

The O
HAC O
algorithm O
generates O
a O
binary O
tree O
of O
clusters O
, O
which O
is O
not O
particularly O
amenable O
to O
use O
by O
humans O
and O
which O
is O
slow O
to O
search O
due O
to O
its O
depth O
, O
so O
a O
subsequent O
processing O
step O
applies O
min O
- O
max O
partitioning O
to O
form O
a O
shallower O
, O
bushier O
tree O
that O
is O
a O
more O
natural O
representation O
of O
the O
concept O
hierarchy O
inherent O
in O
the O
system O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
participation O
in O
the O

Information O
Retrieval O
, O

( O

) O

2010 O
. O

We O

. O

of O

between O

and O

( O

. O

In O

. O

. O

of O

- O
term O
co O
- O
occurrence O
measures O
proposed O
in O

, O

use O
the O

between O

in O

space O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

new O
web O
content O
structure O
based O
on O
visual O
representation O
is O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

Many O

applications O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
, O

extraction O
and O
automatic O
page O
adaptation O
can O
benefit O
from O
this O
structure O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
an O
automatic O
top O
- O
down O
, O
tag O
- O
tree O
independent O
approach O
to O
detect O
web O
content O
structure O
. O

It O
simulates O
how O
a O
user O
understands O
web O
layout O
structure O
based O
on O
his O
visual O
perception O
. O

Comparing O
to O
other O
existing O
techniques O
, O
our O
approach O
is O
independent O
to O
underlying O
documentation O
representation O
such O
as O
HTML O
and O
works O
well O
even O
when O
the O
HTML O
structure O
is O
far O
different O
from O
layout O
structure O
. O

Experiments O
show O
satisfactory O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O

Retrieval O
Model O
based O
on O

and O
necessity O
measures O
. O

relationship O

between O
terms O
, O

and O

. O

The O

a O

process O
to O
retrieve O
necessarily O
or O
at O
least O
possibly O
relevant O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Exploratory O
search O
is O
a O
complex O
, O
iterative O
information O
seeking O
activity O
that O
involves O
running O
multiple O
queries O
and O
finding O
and O
examining O
many O
documents O
. O

We O
designed O
a O
query O
preview O
control O
that O
visualizes O
the O
distribution O
of O
newly O
- O
retrieved O
and O
re O
- O
retrieved O
documents O
prior O
to O
running O
the O
query O
. O

When O
evaluating O
the O
preview O
control O
with O
a O
control O
condition O
, O
we O
found O
effects O
on O
both O
people O
's O
information O
seeking O
behavior O
and O
improved O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

People O
spent O
more O
time O
formulating O
a O
query O
and O
were O
more O
likely O
to O
explore O
search O
results O
more O
deeply O
, O
retrieved O
a O
more O
diverse O
set O
of O
documents O
, O
and O
found O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O

method O
for O

place O
references O
in O
text O
, O

linking O
character O
strings O
in O
documents O
to O
locations O
on O
the O
surface O
of O
the O
Earth O
. O

This O
is O
a O
fundamental O
task O
in O
the O
area O
of O
Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
supporting O
access O
through O
geography O

large O

. O

The O

method O
is O
an O
instance O
of O

learning O
, O
in O
which O
a O
first O
learner O
based O
on O
a O
Hidden O
Markov O
Model O
is O
used O
to O
annotate O
place O
references O
, O
and O
then O
a O
second O
learner O
implementing O
a O
regression O
through O
a O
Support O
Vector O
Machine O
is O
used O
to O
rank O
the O
possible O
disabiguations O
for O
the O
references O
that O
were O
initially O
annotated O
. O

The O
proposed O
method O
was O
evaluated O
through O
gold O
- O
standard O
document O
collections O
in O
three O
different O
languages O
, O
having O
place O
references O
annotated O
by O
humans O
. O

Results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
compares O
favorably O
against O
commercial O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
systems O
such O
as O
the O
Metacarta O
geo O
- O
tagger O
and O
Yahoo O
! O

Placemaker O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Nonlinear O
properties O
of O
quantum O
states O
, O
such O
as O
entropy O
or O
entanglement O
, O
quantify O
important O
physical O
resources O
and O
are O
frequently O
used O
in O
quantum O
- O
information O
science O
. O

They O
are O
usually O
calculated O
from O
a O
full O
description O
of O
a O
quantum O
state O
, O
even O
though O
they O
depend O
only O
on O
a O
small O
number O
of O
parameters O
that O
specify O
the O
state O
. O

Here O
we O
extract O
a O
nonlocal O
and O
a O
nonlinear O
quantity O
, O
namely O
, O
the O
Renyi O
entropy O
, O
from O
local O
measurements O
on O
two O
pairs O
of O
polarization O
- O
entangled O
photons O
. O

We O
also O
introduce O
a O
" O
phase O
marking O
" O
technique O
which O
allows O
the O
selection O
of O
uncorrupted O
outcomes O
even O
with O
nondeterministic O
sources O
of O
entangled O
photons O
. O

We O
use O
our O
experimental O
data O
to O
demonstrate O
the O
violation O
of O
entropic O
inequalities O
. O

They O
are O
examples O
of O
nonlinear O
entanglement O
witnesses O
and O
their O
power O
exceeds O
all O
linear O
tests O
for O
quantum O
entanglement O
based O
on O
all O
possible O
Bell O
- O
Clauser O
- O
Horne O
- O
Shimony O
- O
Holt O
inequalities O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

One O
of O
the O
bottlenecks O
in O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
for O
a O
given O
language O
is O
creating O
a O
lexicon O
that O
covers O
the O
language O
. O

The O
morphological O
lexicon O
provides O
two O
important O
pieces O
of O
information O
for O
NLP O
applications O
: O
1 O
) O
the O
normalization O
of O
a O
word O
, O
its O
lemmatization O
, O
which O
allows O
the O
application O
to O
recognize O
two O
variants O
of O
the O
same O
word O
; O
and O
2 O
) O
the O
part O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
roles O
that O
the O
word O
can O
play O
, O
which O
allows O
the O
application O
to O
parse O
the O
text O
, O
creating O
relations O
between O
the O
words O
in O
a O
text O
. O

Many O
NLP O
applications O
, O
e.g. O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Classification O
, O
Terminology O
Extraction O
, O
etc O
depend O
upon O
the O
normalization O
and O
parsing O
information O
found O
in O
lexicons O
. O

When O
words O
are O
not O
present O
in O
these O
lexicons O
, O
it O
is O
difficult O
to O
predict O
what O
their O
proper O
lemmatizations O
and O
parts O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
are O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
technique O
for O
updating O
a O
lexicon O
given O
an O
unknown O
word O
via O
induction O
of O
paradigms O
from O
an O
existing O
, O
but O
incomplete O
, O
lexicon O
and O
validation O
of O
the O
paradigm O
using O
corpus O
evidence O
. O

. O

- O

measure O
to O

translate O
the O
degree O
of O
satisfaction O
F~ O
into O
a O

, O

/ O

, O

, O

. O

growing O
interest O
of O

and O
by O
the O
development O

-DOCSTART- O

Husband O
- O

- O

Jamie O

will O
take O
up O
posts O
at O
the O
University O
of O
California O
, O
Berkeley O
this O
year O
. O

The O
moves O
will O
allow O
them O
to O
live O
and O
work O
in O
the O
same O
city O
; O
their O
labs O
are O
currently O
a O
two O
- O
hour O
drive O
apart O
. O

Cate O
, O
an O
assistant O
professor O
at O
the O
Massachusetts O
Institute O
of O
Technology O
, O
is O
moving O
to O
California O
in O
July O
. O

Doudna O
, O
who O
has O
a O
larger O
lab O
at O
Yale O
which O
will O
take O
longer O
to O
move O
will O
join O
him O
later O

We O
’re O
going O
to O
be O
bi O
- O
coastal O
for O
a O
little O
while O
Doudna O
says O
. O

At O
Berkeley O
both O
will O
maintain O
separate O

and O
projects O
. O

Cate O
works O
on O
protein O
- O
synthesis O
mechanisms O
, O

the O

of O
the O
ribosome O
at O
different O
states O
. O

Doudna O

catalytic O
RNAs O
and O

that O
interact O
with O
the O

. O

In O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
consolidation O
of O
the O
Internet O
and O
other O
computer O
networks O
, O
the O
need O
of O
sophisticated O
systems O
to O
retrieve O
information O
increased O
enormously O
. O

In O
these O
networks O
, O
information O
is O
distributed O
on O
several O
machines O
and O
sometimes O
in O
different O
formats O
. O

In O
this O
context O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
architecture O
that O
besides O
retrieving O
information O
can O
classify O
it O
according O
to O
some O
criteria O
. O

To O
implement O
the O
proposed O
architecture O
, O
we O
used O
some O
existing O
technologies O
such O
as O
mobile O
agents O
to O
transport O
information O
between O
data O
sources O
; O
the O
Naive O
Bayes O
model O
for O
classification O
; O
the O
Java O
language O
and O
the O
XML O
model O
for O
development O
and O
storage O
of O
the O
required O
information O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
objective O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
show O
what O
the O
current O
techniques O
in O
image O
processing O
, O
artificial O
intelligence O
, O
and O
computer O
graphics O
can O
do O
in O
computed O
tomography O
. O

More O
concretely O
, O
we O
wish O
to O
show O
that O
given O
the O
tomographic O
data O
what O
can O
be O
done O
in O
order O
to O
: O
a O
) O
improve O
the O
spatial O
resolution O
b O
) O
improve O
the O
visualisation O
of O
the O
data O
c O
) O
improve O
the O
identification O
of O
anatomic O
structures O

Thus O
, O
we O
shall O
not O
deal O
with O
different O
hardware O
, O
nor O
with O
various O
reconstruction O
algorithms O
. O

We O
shall O
assume O
that O
the O
data O
is O
given O
and O
ask O
what O
can O
be O
done O
from O
there O
on O
. O

Examples O
, O
documenting O
each O
of O
the O
above O
points O
, O
will O
be O
presented O
. O

Computer O
Sciences O
