-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
investigate O
the O
problem O
of O
automatic O
singer O
identification O
, O
detection O
and O
tracking O
in O
popular O
music O
recordings O
with O
one O
or O
multiple O
singers O
. O

This O
problem O
reflects O
an O
important O
issue O
in O
multimedia O
applications O
that O
require O
the O
transcription O
and O
indexing O
of O
music O
data O
to O
meet O
the O
increasing O
demand O
for O
content O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
major O
challenges O
for O
this O
study O
arise O
from O
the O
fact O
that O
a O
singer O
's O
voice O
tends O
to O
be O
arbitrarily O
altered O
from O
time O
to O
time O
and O
is O
inextricably O
intertwined O
with O
the O
signal O
of O
the O
background O
accompaniment O
. O

To O
determine O
who O
is O
singing O
, O
or O
whether O
or O
when O
a O
particular O
singer O
is O
present O
in O
a O
music O
recording O
, O
methods O
are O
presented O
for O
separating O
vocal O
from O
nonvocal O
regions O
, O
for O
isolating O
singers O
' O
vocal O
characteristics O
from O
background O
music O
, O
and O
for O
distinguishing O
singers O
from O
one O
another O
. O

Experimental O
evaluations O
conducted O
on O
a O
pop O
music O
database O
consisting O
of O
solo O
and O
duet O
tracks O
confirm O
the O
validity O
of O
the O
proposed O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
query O
translation O
of O
Out O
of O
Vocabulary O
( O
OOV O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
key O
factors O
that O
affect O
the O
performance O
of O
Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
Based O
on O
Wikipedia O
data O
structure O
and O
language O
features O
, O
the O
paper O
divides O
translation O
environment O
into O
target O
- O
existence O
and O
target O
- O
deficit O
environment O
. O

To O
overcome O
the O
difficulty O
of O
translation O
mining O
in O
the O
target O
- O
deficit O
environment O
, O
the O
frequency O
change O
information O
and O
adjacency O
information O
is O
used O
to O
realize O
the O
extraction O
of O
candidate O
units O
, O
and O
establish O
the O
strategy O
of O
mixed O
translation O
mining O
based O
on O
the O
frequency O
- O
distance O
model O
, O
surface O
pattern O
matching O
model O
and O
summary O
- O
score O
model O
. O

Search O
engine O
based O
OOV O
translation O
mining O
is O
taken O
as O
baseline O
to O
test O
the O
performance O
on O
TOP1 O
results O
. O

It O
is O
verified O
that O
the O
mixed O
translation O
mining O
method O
based O
on O
Wikipedia O
can O
achieve O
the O
precision O
rate O
of O
0.6279 O
, O
and O
the O
improvement O
is O
6.98 O
% O
better O
than O
the O
baseline O
. O

to O
the O
actual O
needs O
of O
marine O
remote O
sensing O
in O

, O

Remote O

. O

of O

basic O
principle O
, O
presents O
characteristics O
of O
marine O
remote O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
a O
method O
for O
proactive O
information O
retrieval O
targeted O
at O
retrieving O
relevant O
information O
during O
a O
writing O
task O
. O

In O
our O
method O
, O
the O
current O
task O
and O
the O
needs O
of O
the O
user O
are O
estimated O
, O
and O
the O
potential O
next O
steps O
are O
unobtrusively O
predicted O
based O
on O
the O
user O
’s O
past O
actions O
. O

We O
focus O
on O
the O
task O
of O
writing O
, O
in O
which O
the O
user O
is O
coalescing O
previously O
collected O
information O
into O
a O
text O
. O

Our O
proactive O
system O
automatically O
recommends O
the O
user O
relevant O
background O
information O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
incorporates O
text O
input O
prediction O
using O
a O
long O
short O
- O
term O
memory O
( O
LSTM O
) O
network O
. O

We O
present O
simulations O
, O
which O
show O
that O
the O
system O
is O
able O
to O
reach O
higher O
precision O
values O
in O
an O
exploratory O
search O
setting O
compared O
to O
both O
a O
baseline O
and O
a O
comparison O
system O
. O

This O
talk O
will O
present O
challenges O
involved O
in O
building O
a O
Web O
search O
engine O
and O
will O
touch O
on O
questions O
of O
system O
and O
algorithm O
design O
, O
in O
particular O
as O
they O
involve O
large O
scale O
data O
processing O
and O
data O
mining O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
position O
paper O
supports O
the O
idea O
of O
the O
information O
dialog O
between O
IR O
systems O
and O
users O
during O
an O
information O
search O
task O
. O

In O
order O
to O
satisfy O
the O
communication O
and O
interaction O
needs O
of O
humans O
, O
IR O
systems O
should O
explicitly O
support O
the O
cognitive O
abilities O
of O
the O
users O
. O

An O
information O
dialogue O
which O
does O
not O
only O
support O
an O
individual O
query O
but O
also O
the O
complete O
search O
process O
is O
necessary O
. O

Only O
in O
this O
way O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
satisfy O
an O
information O
need O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
make O
use O
of O
terms O
that O
are O
automatically O
extracted O
from O
documents O
; O
these O
terms O
are O
used O
to O
give O
information O
access O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
an O
approach O
to O
enrich O
semantically O
this O
extraction O
by O
adding O
knowledge O
from O
thesaurus O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
the O
methodology O
we O
promote O
in O
this O
paper O
aims O
at O
transforming O
a O
thesaurus O
into O
a O
domain O
ontology O
which O
will O
then O
be O
used O
to O
semantically O
index O
documents O
( O
indexes O
are O
concepts O
rather O
than O
terms O
We O
also O
propose O
techniques O
that O
implement O
this O
transformation O
as O
well O
as O
an O
evaluation O
in O
the O
field O
of O
the O
astronomy O
. O

IRISA O
participation O
to O
DeFT O
2012 O
information O
retrieval O
and O
machine O
learning O
for O
keyword O
generation O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
IRISA O
participation O
to O
the O
DeFT O
2012 O
text O
- O
mining O
challenge O
. O

It O
consisted O
in O
the O
automatic O
attribution O
or O
generation O
of O
keywords O
to O
scientific O
journal O
articles O
. O

Two O
tasks O
were O
proposed O
which O
led O
us O
to O
test O
two O
different O
strategies O
. O

For O
the O
first O
task O
, O
a O
list O
of O
keywords O
was O
provided O
. O

Based O
on O
that O
, O
our O
first O
strategy O
is O
to O
consider O
that O
as O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
problem O
in O
wich O
the O
keyword O
are O
the O
queries O
, O
which O
are O
attributed O
to O
the O
best O
ranked O
documents O
. O

This O
approach O
yielded O
very O
good O
results O
. O

For O
the O
second O
task O
, O
only O
the O
articles O
were O
known O
; O
for O
this O
task O
, O
our O
approach O
is O
chiefly O
based O
on O
a O
term O
extraction O
system O
whose O
results O
are O
reordered O
by O
machine O
learning O
. O

- O
CLÉS O

de O
mots O
- O
clés O
, O

de O
termes O
, O
Recherche O
d’information O
, O

, O
arbres O
de O
décision O
, O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
rising O
quantity O
of O
available O
information O
has O
constituted O
an O
enormous O
advance O
in O
our O
daily O
life O
. O

However O
, O
at O
the O
same O
time O
, O
some O
problems O
emerge O
as O
a O
result O
from O
the O
existing O
difficulty O
to O
distinguish O
the O
necessary O
information O
among O
the O
high O
quantity O
of O
unnecessary O
data O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
has O
become O
a O
capital O
task O
for O
retrieving O
the O
useful O
information O
. O

Firstly O
, O
it O
was O
mainly O
used O
for O
document O
retrieval O
, O
but O
lately O
, O
its O
use O
has O
been O
generalized O
for O
the O
retrieval O
of O
any O
kind O
of O
information O
, O
such O
as O
the O
information O
contained O
in O
a O
database O
, O
a O
web O
page O
, O
or O
any O
set O
of O
accumulated O
knowledge O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
the O
so O
- O
called O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
is O
widely O
used O
. O

Vector O
Space O
Model O
is O
based O
on O
the O
use O
of O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
COSIMIR O
- O
Modell O
( O
Cognitive O
Similarity O
learning O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
) O
presented O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
consists O
of O
of O
neural O
network O
based O
on O
the O
backpropagation O
algorithm O
. O

COSIMIR O
learns O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarity O
between O
query O
and O
document O
using O
users O
‘ O
judgements O
. O

Thus O
, O
it O
avoids O
the O
heuristic O
choice O
of O
a O
similarity O
function O
. O

COSIMIR O
intends O
to O
model O
the O
core O
of O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
process O
in O
a O
way O
cognitivly O
adaquate O
. O

Numerous O
IR O
systems O
are O
already O
based O
on O
neural O
networks O
, O
however O
, O
they O
resemble O
common O
IR O
models O
and O
do O
not O
exploit O
all O
possibilities O
of O
neural O
networks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

August O
2006 O
saw O
the O
third O
in O
a O
series O
of O
workshops O
held O
to O
discuss O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
in O
Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
held O
in O
conjunction O
with O
SIGIR'06 O
. O

The O
original O
call O
for O
papers O
for O
the O
workshop O
suggested O
the O
workshop O
should O

( O

) O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Most O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
use O
stopword O
lists O
and O
stemming O
algorithms O
. O

However O
, O
we O
have O
found O
that O
recognizing O
singular O
and O
plural O
nouns O
, O
verb O
forms O
, O
negation O
, O
and O
prepositions O
can O
produce O
dramatically O
different O
text O
classification O
results O
. O

We O
present O
results O
from O
text O
classification O
experiments O
that O
compare O
relevancy O
signatures O
, O
which O
use O
local O
linguistic O
context O
, O
with O
corresponding O
indexing O
terms O
that O
do O
not O
. O

In O
two O
different O
domains O
, O
relevancy O
signatures O
produced O
better O
results O
than O
the O
simple O
indexing O
terms O
. O

These O
experiments O
suggest O
that O
stopword O
lists O
and O
stemming O
algorithms O
may O
remove O
or O
conflate O
many O
words O
that O
could O
be O
used O
to O
create O
more O
effective O
indexing O
terms O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

When O

as O

performance O
under O

( O

Index O

Average O
Precision O

An O

so O
as O

on O

. O

- O

that O
is O
surprisingly O
effective O
x2013 O

> O

Empirical O
Min O
Bayes O
Risk</italic O
EMBR O

- O

- O

- O

. O

8 O

-DOCSTART- O

Collaborative O
filtering O
is O
a O
technique O
for O
recommending O
documents O
to O
users O
based O
on O
how O
similar O
their O
tastes O
are O
to O
other O
users O
. O

If O
two O
users O
tend O
to O
agree O
on O
what O
they O
like O
, O
the O
system O
will O
recommend O
the O
same O
documents O
to O
them O
. O

The O
generalized O
vector O
space O
model O
of O
information O
retrieval O
represents O
a O
document O
by O
a O
vector O
of O
its O
similarities O
to O
all O
other O
documents O
. O

The O
process O
of O
collaborative O
filtering O
is O
nearly O
identical O
to O
the O
process O
of O
retrieval O
using O
GVSM O
in O
a O
matrix O
of O
user O
ratings O
. O

Using O
this O
observation O
, O
a O
model O
for O
filtering O
collaboratively O
using O
document O
content O
is O
possible O
. O

( O

- O

- O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
distributed O
system O
enables O
multiple O
, O
simultaneous O
connections O
between O
clients O
and O
Inquery O
servers O
. O

The O
different O
components O
of O
the O
system O
communicate O
using O
a O
local O
area O
network O
. O

Each O
component O
may O
reside O
on O
a O
different O
host O
and O
operates O
independently O
of O
the O
others O
. O

In O
this O
section O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
functionality O
and O
interaction O
between O
the O
clients O
, O
the O
connection O
server O
, O
and O
the O
Inquery O
servers O
. O

The O
clients O
are O
lightweight O
processes O
that O
provide O
a O
user O
interface O
to O
the O
retrieval O
system O
. O

Clients O
interact O
with O
the O
distributed O
IR O
system O
by O
connecting O
to O
the O
connection O
server O
. O

The O
clients O
initiate O
all O
work O
in O
the O
system O
, O
but O
they O
perform O
very O
little O
computation O
. O

The O
clients O
can O
issue O
the O
entire O
range O
of O
IR O
commands O
but O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
inquery O
, O
document O
retrieval O
commands O
and O
query O
evaluation O
measurements O
. O

A O
client O
sends O
query O
commands O
to O
the O
connection O
server O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
in O
medical O
domain O
is O
now O
sharing O
major O
part O
of O

search O
. O

Now O
a O

’s O

the O

are O

information O
at O
their O

using O
internet O
. O

Electronic O
Medical O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O
( O
EMIRS O
) O
through O
search O
engines O
providing O
positive O
information O
to O
the O
user O
based O
on O
the O
fixed O
questionnaires O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
build O
a O
model O
for O
naïve O
users O
, O
who O
are O
having O
minimal O
knowledge O
to O
feedback O
the O
system O
by O

listed O
relevant O
questionnaire O
. O

Along O

, O

also O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

Visual O
attribute O
classification O
has O
been O
widely O
discussed O
due O
to O
its O
impact O
on O
lots O
of O
applications O
, O
such O
as O
face O
recognition O
, O
action O
recognition O
and O
scene O
representation O
. O

Recently O
, O
Convolutional O
Neural O
Networks O
( O
CNNs O
) O
have O
demonstrated O
promising O
performance O
in O
image O
recognition O
, O
object O
detection O
and O
many O
other O
computer O
vision O
areas O
. O

Such O
networks O
are O
able O
to O
automatically O
learn O
a O
hierarchy O
of O
discriminate O
features O
that O
richly O
describe O
image O
content O
. O

However O
, O
dimensions O
of O
features O
of O
CNNs O
are O
usually O
very O
large O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
visual O
attribute O
classification O
system O
based O
on O
feature O
selection O
and O
CNNs O
. O

Extensive O
experiments O
have O
been O
conducted O
using O
the O
Berkeley O
Attributes O
of O
People O
dataset O
. O

The O
best O
overall O
mean O
average O
precision O
( O
mAP O
) O
is O
about O
89.2 O
% O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

High O
quality O
relevance O
judgments O
are O
essential O
for O
the O
evaluation O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Traditional O
methods O
of O
collecting O
relevance O
judgments O
are O
based O
on O
collecting O
binary O
or O
graded O
nominal O
judgments O
, O
but O
such O
judgments O
are O
limited O
by O
factors O
such O
as O
inter O
- O
assessor O
disagreement O
and O
the O
arbitrariness O
of O
grades O
. O

Previous O
research O
has O
shown O
that O
it O
is O
easier O
for O
assessors O
to O
make O
pairwise O
preference O
judgments O
. O

However O
, O
unless O
the O
preferences O
collected O
are O
largely O
transitive O
, O
it O
is O
not O
clear O
how O
to O
combine O
them O
in O
order O
to O
obtain O
document O
relevance O
scores O
. O

Another O
difficulty O
is O
that O
the O
number O
of O
pairs O
that O
need O
to O
be O
assessed O
is O
quadratic O
in O
the O
number O
of O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
consider O
the O
problem O
of O
inferring O
document O
relevance O
scores O
from O
pairwise O
preference O
judgments O
by O
analogy O
to O
tournaments O
using O
the O
Elo O
rating O
system O
. O

We O
show O
how O
to O
combine O
a O
linear O
number O
of O
pairwise O
preference O
judgments O
from O
multiple O
assessors O
to O
compute O
relevance O
scores O
for O
every O
document O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
current O
topic O
modeling O
approaches O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
do O
not O
allow O
to O
explicitly O
model O
query O
- O
oriented O
latent O
topics O
. O

More O
, O
the O
semantic O
coherence O
of O
the O
topics O
has O
never O
been O
considered O
in O
this O
field O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
model O
- O
based O
feedback O
approach O
that O
learns O
Latent O
Dirichlet O
Allocation O
topic O
models O
on O
the O
top O
- O
ranked O
pseudo O
- O
relevant O
feedback O
, O
and O
we O
measure O
the O
semantic O
coherence O
of O
those O
topics O
. O

We O
perform O
a O
first O
experimental O
evaluation O
using O
two O
major O
TREC O
test O
collections O
. O

Results O
show O
that O
retrieval O
performances O
tend O
to O
be O
better O
when O
using O
topics O
with O
higher O
semantic O
coherence O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
2006 O
Miracle O
team O

’s O
approaches O
to O
the O
AdHoc O
and O
Geographical O
Information O
Retrieval O
tasks O
. O

A O
first O
set O
of O
runs O
was O
obtained O
using O
a O
set O
of O
basic O
components O
. O

Then O
, O
by O
putting O
together O
special O
combinations O
of O
these O
runs O
, O
an O
extended O
set O
was O
obtained O
. O

With O
respect O
to O
previous O
campaigns O
some O
improvements O
have O
been O
introduced O
in O
our O
system O
: O
an O
entity O
recognition O
prototype O
is O
integrated O
in O

scheme O
, O
and O
the O
performance O
of O
our O

and O

. O

For O

, O

using O
geo O
- O
entity O
and O
textual O

, O

different O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
rapid O
development O
of O
information O
technology O
offers O
people O
a O
broad O
information O
- O
sharing O
platform O
. O

We O
can O
get O
relevant O
information O
through O
information O
retrieval O
tools O
. O

In O
order O
to O
get O
higher O
search O
efficiency O
, O
the O
information O
retrieval O
technologies O
based O
on O
semantic O
grid O
are O
discussed O
. O

Based O
on O
analysis O
of O
the O
technologies O
of O
grid O
, O
semantic O
grid O
and O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
architecture O
of O
grid O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
brought O
out O
and O
a O
common O
model O
of O
grid O
information O
retrieval O
is O
established O
. O

The O
grid O
platform O
based O
on O
Globus O
toolkit O
is O
built O
which O
is O
made O
as O
the O
basic O
development O
platform O
of O
the O
system O
, O
the O
semantic O
grid O
information O
retrieval O
system O
under O
that O
platform O
is O
realized O
, O
and O
the O
designed O
model O
and O
algorithm O
are O
implemented O
and O
the O
specific O
experimental O
tests O
is O
realized O
. O

The O
result O
shows O
that O
the O
system O
has O
better O
retrieval O
recall O
factor O
and O
pertinency O
factor O
than O
the O
conventional O
retrieval O
methods O
, O
and O
the O
feasibility O
of O
system O
model O
is O
verified O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
needs O
to O
match O
relevant O
texts O
with O
a O
given O
query O
. O

Selecting O
appropriate O
parts O
is O
useful O
when O
documents O
are O
long O
, O
and O
only O
portions O
are O
interesting O
to O
the O
user O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
method O
that O
extensively O
uses O
natural O
language O
techniques O
for O
text O
segmentation O
based O
on O
topic O
change O
detection O
. O

The O
method O
requires O
a O
NLP O
- O
parser O
and O
a O
semantic O
representation O
in O
Roget O
- O
based O
vectors O
. O

We O
have O
run O
the O
experiment O
on O
French O
documents O
, O
for O
which O
we O
have O
the O
appropriate O
tools O
, O
but O
the O
method O
could O
be O
transposed O
to O
any O
other O
language O
with O
the O
same O
requirements O
. O

The O
article O
sketches O
an O
overview O
of O
the O
NL O
understanding O
environment O
functionalities O
, O
and O
the O
algorithms O
related O
to O
our O
text O
segmentation O
method O
. O

An O
experiment O
in O
text O
segmentation O
is O
also O
presented O
and O
its O
result O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
task O
is O
shown O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Relevant O
in O
Context O
retrieval O
task O
is O
document O
or O
article O
retrieval O
with O
a O
twist O
, O
where O
not O
only O
the O
relevant O
articles O
should O
be O
retrieved O
but O
also O
the O
relevant O
information O
within O
each O
article O
( O
captured O
by O
a O
set O
of O
XML O
elements O
) O
should O
be O
correctly O
identified O
. O

Our O
main O
research O
question O
is O
: O
how O
to O
evaluate O
the O
Relevant O
in O
Context O
task O
? O

We O
propose O
a O
generalized O
average O
precision O
measure O
that O
meets O
two O
main O
requirements O
: O
i O
) O
the O
score O
reflects O
the O
ranked O
list O
of O
articles O
inherent O
in O
the O
result O
list O
, O
and O
at O
the O
same O
time O
ii O
) O
the O
score O
also O
reflects O
how O
well O
the O
retrieved O
information O
per O
article O
( O
i.e O
the O
set O
of O
elements O
) O
corresponds O
to O
the O
relevant O
information O
. O

The O
resulting O
measure O
was O
used O
at O
INEX O
2006 O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

An O
information O
structure O
( O
IS O
) O
that O
is O
regarded O
as O
a O
formal O
description O
of O
a O
domain O
of O
discourse O
is O
proposed O
. O

This O
IS O
is O
aimed O
at O
increasing O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
how O
the O
retrieval O
algorithm O
can O
take O
into O
account O
the O
term O
dependencies O
that O
are O
provided O
by O

IS O
. O

Moreover O
, O

term O
dependencies O
can O
be O
used O
by O
an O
automatic O
indexing O
procedure O
in O
order O
to O
interpret O
polysemic O
terms O
. O

The O
theoretical O
framework O
of O
our O
IS O
has O
some O
favorable O
properties O
. O

As O
a O

construction O
and O
maintenance O
of O
such O
an O
IS O
is O
simpler O
than O
that O
of O
a O
thesaurus O
. O

Due O
to O
the O

increasing O
amount O
of O
available O

and O

for O
data O

and O

are O
essential O
. O

Distributed O
solutions O
naturally O
provide O
promising O
alternatives O
to O
standard O

approaches O
. O

With O
the O
computational O
power O
of O
thousands O

- O

- O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
article O
we O
investigate O
the O
expressions O
of O
collaborative O
activities O
within O
information O
seeking O
and O
retrieval O
processes O
( O
IS&R O
Generally O
, O
information O
seeking O
and O
retrieval O
is O
regarded O
as O
an O
individual O
and O
isolated O
process O
in O
IR O
research O
. O

We O
assume O
that O
an O
IS&R O
situation O
is O
not O
merely O
an O
individual O
effort O
, O
but O
inherently O
involves O
various O
collaborative O
activities O
. O

We O
present O
empirical O
results O
from O
a O
real O
- O
life O
and O
information O
- O
intensive O
setting O
within O
the O
patent O
domain O
, O
showing O
that O
the O
patent O
task O
performance O
process O
involves O
highly O
collaborative O
aspects O
throughout O
the O
stages O
of O
the O
information O
seeking O
and O
retrieval O
process O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
show O
that O
these O
activities O
may O
be O
categorized O
and O
related O
to O
different O
stages O
in O
an O
information O
seeking O
and O
retrieval O
process O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
assumption O
that O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
is O
purely O
individual O
needs O
to O
be O
reconsidered O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
also O
propose O
a O
refined O
IR O
framework O
involving O
collaborative O
aspects O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O

results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
performs O
accurate O
retrieval O
. O

This O
work O
is O
a O
step O
towards O
multilingual O
( O
English O
, O
Spanish O
, O
Arabic O
, O
Chinese O
( O
Simplified O
and O
Traditional O
Korean O
, O
and O
Japanese O
) O
search O
engine O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Query O
performance O
prediction O
aims O
to O
estimate O
the O
quality O
of O
answers O
that O
a O
search O
system O
will O
return O
in O
response O
to O
a O
particular O
query O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
family O
of O
pre O
- O
retrieval O
predictors O
based O
on O
information O
at O
both O
the O
collection O
and O
document O
level O
. O

retrieval O
predictors O
are O
important O
because O
they O
can O
be O
calculated O
from O
information O
that O
is O
available O
at O
indexing O
time O
; O
they O
are O
therefore O
more O
efficient O
than O
predictors O
that O
incorporate O
information O
obtained O
from O
actual O
search O
results O
. O

Experimental O
evaluation O
of O
our O
approach O
shows O
that O
the O
new O
predictors O
give O
more O
consistent O
performance O
than O
previously O
proposed O
pre O
- O
retrieval O
methods O
across O
a O
variety O
of O
data O
types O
and O
search O
tasks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
components O
are O
currently O
incorporated O
in O
several O
types O
of O
information O
systems O
, O
including O
bibliographic O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
data O
base O
management O
systems O
and O
question O
- O
answering O
systems O
. O

Some O
of O
the O
problems O
arising O
in O
the O
real O
- O
time O
environment O
in O
which O
these O
systems O
operate O
are O
briefly O
discussed O
. O

Certain O
recent O
advances O
in O
information O
retrieval O
research O
are O
then O
mentioned O
, O
including O
the O
formulation O
of O
new O
probabilistic O
retrieval O
models O
, O
and O
the O
development O
of O
automatic O
document O
analysis O
and O
Boolean O
query O
processing O
techniques O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Researchers O
are O
aware O
that O
context O
affects O
information O
retrieval O
in O
general O
. O

The O
health O
area O
is O
no O
exception O
and O
is O
particularly O
rich O
in O
terms O
of O
context O
. O

To O
understand O
how O
context O
is O
used O
in O
health O
information O
research O
, O
we O
collected O
a O
sample O
of O
health O
information O
research O
papers O
that O
use O
context O
features O
. O

Papers O
were O
analyzed O
and O
classified O
according O
to O
the O
type O
of O
context O
features O
and O
to O
the O
stage O
of O
the O
retrieval O
process O
into O
which O
they O
were O
incorporated O
. O

Further O
, O
we O
also O
identified O
the O
specific O
context O
features O
used O
in O
each O
category O
of O
features O
and O
each O
stage O
of O
the O
process O
. O

Results O
show O
a O
weaker O
use O
of O
interaction O
context O
features O
than O
we O
expected O
and O
, O
as O
supposed O
, O
a O
large O
use O
of O
collective O
features O
. O

A O
considerable O
number O
of O
papers O
use O
context O
to O
query O
related O
activities O
. O

We O
also O
found O
that O
research O
is O
mainly O
aimed O
at O
health O
professionals O
, O
suggesting O
a O
gap O
in O
health O
consumers O
research O
that O
should O
be O
explored O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
notion O
of O
theme O
plays O
a O
crucial O
role O
in O
topic O
- O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

We O
discuss O
how O
topics O
are O
related O
to O
works O
in O
linguistic O
and O
discourse O
theories O
, O
and O
according O
to O
which O
rules O
they O
can O
be O
derived O
from O
texts O
. O

Two O
experiments O
were O
devised O
: O
the O
first O
one O
to O
validate O
those O
rules O
with O
users O
, O
and O
the O
second O
to O
implement O
them O
with O
a O
collection O
of O
structured O
documents O
. O

In O
the O
first O
experiment O
, O
participants O
were O
asked O
either O
to O
choose O
between O
possible O
themes O
for O
an O
expression O
, O
or O
to O
find O
relevant O
themes O
in O
a O
short O
text O
. O

In O
the O
second O
experiment O
, O
a O
prototypal O
IRS O
was O
built O
to O
index O
the O
TEI O
Guidelines O
a O
collection O
of O
SGML O
documents O
. O

Results O
for O
both O
experiments O
show O
the O
need O
for O
a O
new O
, O
more O
flexible O
measure O
of O
theme O
representativity O
that O
allow O
different O
rankings O
according O
to O
user O
or O
query O
types O
. O

behaviour O

, O

, O
Kingdom O
of O

. O

In O
this O
study O
, O
data O
collected O
from O
150 O
teachers O
and O
students O
by O
administering O
questionnaires O
on O
their O
information O
seeking O
and O
requirements O
of O
the O
College O
of O
Engineering O
, O
indicates O
that O
guidance O
in O
the O
use O
of O
library O
resources O
and O
services O
is O
necessary O
to O
help O
teachers O
and O
students O
to O
meet O
their O
information O
requirements O
. O

Found O
that O
journals O
, O
textbooks O
and O
electronic O
information O
sources O
are O
the O
most O
popular O
sources O
of O
information O
for O
the O

work O
. O

Recommends O
that O
latest O

of O

and O

materials O
should O
add O
to O
the O

. O

that O

of O

and O
reference O

should O
be O
added O
and O

to O

of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Direction O
relations O
between O
extended O
spatial O
objects O
are O
important O
commonsense O
knowledge O
. O

Recently O
, O
Goyal O
and O
Egenhofer O
proposed O
a O
formal O
model O
, O
called O
Cardinal O
Direction O
Calculus O
( O
CDC O
for O
representing O
direction O
relations O
between O
connected O
plane O
regions O
. O

CDC O
is O
perhaps O
the O
most O
expressive O
qualitative O
calculus O
for O
directional O
information O
, O
and O
has O
attracted O
increasing O
interest O
from O
areas O
such O
as O
artificial O
intelligence O
, O
geographical O
information O
science O
, O
and O
image O
retrieval O
. O

Given O
a O
network O
of O
CDC O
constraints O
, O
the O
consistency O
problem O
is O
deciding O
if O
the O
network O
is O
realizable O
by O
connected O
regions O
in O
the O
real O
plane O
. O

This O
paper O
provides O
a O
cubic O
algorithm O
for O
checking O
consistency O
of O
basic O
CDC O
constraint O
networks O
. O

As O
one O
byproduct O
, O
we O
also O
show O
that O
any O
consistent O
network O
of O
CDC O
constraints O
has O
a O
canonical O
realization O
in O
digital O
plane O
. O

The O
cubic O
algorithm O
can O
also O
been O
adapted O
to O
cope O
with O
disconnected O
regions O
, O
in O
which O
case O
the O
current O
best O
algorithm O
is O
of O
time O
complexity O
O(n O
) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
important O
work O
of O
Supply O
Chain O
Management O
( O
SCM O
) O
on O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
. O

Ontology O
- O
based O
semantic O
retrieval O
is O
a O
hotspot O
of O
current O
research O
. O

In O
order O
to O
achieve O
fuzzy O
semantic O
retrieval O
, O
this O
paper O
applies O
a O
fuzzy O
ontology O
framework O
to O
information O
retrieval O
system O
in O
SCM O
. O

The O
framework O
includes O
three O
parts O
: O
concepts O
, O
properties O
of O
concepts O
and O
values O
of O
properties O
, O
in O
which O
propertypsilas O
value O
can O
be O
either O
standard O
data O
type O
or O
linguistic O
values O
of O
fuzzy O
concepts O
. O

The O
semantic O
query O
expansion O
is O
constructed O
by O
order O
relation O
, O
equivalence O
relation O
and O
inclusion O
relation O
between O
fuzzy O
concepts O
defined O
in O
fuzzy O
linguistic O
variable O
ontologies O
. O

The O
application O
to O
retrieve O
customer O
and O
product O
information O
in O
supply O
chain O
shows O
that O
the O
framework O
can O
overcome O
the O
localization O
of O
other O
fuzzy O
ontology O
models O
, O
and O
this O
research O
facilitates O
the O
semantic O
retrieval O
of O
information O
through O
fuzzy O
concepts O
on O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Statistical O
language O
models O
have O
recently O
been O
successfully O
applied O
to O
many O
information O
retrieval O
problems O
. O

A O
great O
deal O
of O
recent O
work O
has O
shown O
that O
statistical O
language O
models O
not O
only O
lead O
to O
superior O
empirical O
performance O
, O
but O
also O
facilitate O
parameter O
tuning O
and O
open O
up O
possibilities O
for O
modeling O
nontraditional O
retrieval O
problems O
. O

In O
general O
, O
statistical O
language O
models O
provide O
a O
principled O
way O
of O
modeling O
various O
kinds O
of O
retrieval O
problems O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
this O
survey O
is O
to O
systematically O
and O
critically O
review O
the O
existing O
work O
in O
applying O
statistical O
language O
models O
to O
information O
retrieval O
, O
summarize O
their O
contributions O
, O
and O
point O
out O
outstanding O
challenges O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
introduce O
AMusE O
, O
a O
music O
reasoning O
framework O
built O
using O
Abstract O
Data O
Types O
, O
describing O
some O
of O
the O
advantages O
of O
such O
an O
approach O
. O

We O
illustrate O
this O
with O
a O
particular O
set O
of O
tools O
capable O
of O
tapping O
into O
the O
framework O

’s O
capabilities O

: O
a O
score O
editor O
with O
the O
capability O
to O
edit O
some O
early O
music O
notations O
, O
and O
implementations O
of O
the O
SIA O
family O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
tools O
. O

Putting O
these O
together O
, O
we O
discuss O
how O
the O
framework O
enables O
the O
general O
- O
purpose O
pattern O
- O
matching O
tool O
to O
operate O
on O
very O
specialised O
forms O
of O
notation O
. O

We O
conclude O
with O
a O

of O
further O
work O
and O
the O
need O
for O
a O
more O
logic O
- O
based O
design O
and O

outward O
- O

deployment O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
investigates O
the O
number O
of O
expansion O
terms O
to O
use O
in O
automatic O
query O
expansion O
by O
examining O
the O
behavior O
of O
eight O
retrieval O
systems O
participating O
in O
the O
NRRC O
Reliable O
Information O
Access O
Workshop O
. O

The O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
current O
systems O
are O
able O
to O
obtain O
nearly O
all O
of O
the O
benefit O
of O
using O
a O
fixed O
number O
of O
expansion O
terms O
per O
topic O
, O
but O
significant O
additional O
improvement O
is O
possible O
if O
systems O
were O
able O
to O
accurately O
select O
the O
best O
number O
of O
expansion O
terms O
on O
a O
per O
topic O
basis O
. O

When O
optimizing O
average O
effectiveness O
as O
measured O
by O
mean O
average O
precision O
, O
using O
a O
fixed O
number O
of O
terms O
increases O
the O
score O
a O
large O
amount O
for O
a O
small O
number O
of O
topics O
but O
has O
little O
effect O
for O
most O
topics O
. O

The O
analysis O
further O
suggests O
that O
when O
a O
topic O
is O
helped O
by O
automatic O
feedback O
, O
the O
increase O
is O
from O
a O
set O
of O
terms O
that O
reinforce O
each O
other O
rather O
than O
from O
the O
system O
finding O
a O
single O
excellent O
term O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
take O
a O
critical O
look O
at O
the O
evaluation O
method O
of O
WebCLEF O
2007 O
. O

The O
suitability O
of O
the O
evaluation O
method O
can O
be O
seen O
from O
two O
sides O
, O
namely O
from O
a O
participating O
system O
and O
a O
non O
participating O
system O
. O

A O
participant O
has O
the O
advantage O
that O
the O
evaluation O
is O
partly O
based O
upon O
his O
output O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
will O
investigate O
if O
the O
size O
of O
the O
pool O
of O
snippets O
, O
the O
implementation O
of O
the O
evaluation O
method O
and O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
assessments O
is O
sufficient O
enough O
for O
reliable O
evaluation O
. O

Unfortunately O
we O
have O
to O
conclude O
that O
the O
evaluation O
is O
not O
suitable O
. O

Therefore O
some O
alternative O
evaluation O
methods O
will O
be O
discussed O
concluding O
in O
a O
recommendation O
to O
improve O
the O
evaluation O
of O
WebCLEF O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
poster O
session O
examines O
a O
probabilistic O
approach O
to O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
using O
a O
Logistic O
Regression O
algorithm O
for O
estimation O
of O
collection O
relevance O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
compared O
to O
other O
methods O
for O
distributed O
search O
using O
test O
collections O
developed O
for O
distributed O
search O
evaluation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
are O
commonly O
built O
on O
a O
feature O
extraction O
stage O
. O

For O
applications O
involving O
automatic O
classification O
( O
e.g. O
speech O
/ O
music O
discrimination O
, O
music O
genre O
or O
mood O
recognition O
traditional O
approaches O
will O
consider O
a O
large O
set O
of O
audio O
features O
to O
be O
extracted O
on O
a O
large O
dataset O
. O

In O
some O
cases O
, O
this O
will O
lead O
to O
computationally O
intensive O
systems O
and O
there O
is O
, O
therefore O
, O
a O
strong O
need O
for O
efficient O
feature O
extraction O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
new O
audio O
feature O
extraction O
software O
, O
YAAFE O
1 O
is O
presented O
and O
compared O
to O
widely O
used O
libraries O
. O

The O
main O
advantage O
of O
YAAFE O
is O
a O
significantly O
lower O
complexity O
due O
to O
the O
appropriate O
exploitation O
of O
redundancy O
in O
the O
feature O
calculation O
. O

YAAFE O
remains O
easy O
to O
configure O
and O
each O
feature O
can O
be O
parameterized O
independently O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
YAAFE O
framework O
and O
most O
of O
its O
core O
feature O
library O
are O
released O
in O
source O
code O
under O
the O
GNU O
Lesser O
General O
Public O
License O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
the O
second O
participation O
of O
the O
NLP&IR O
group O
at O
UNED O
in O
the O
MediaEval O
Genre O
Tagging O
Task O
. O

This O
categorization O
task O
was O
carried O
out O
applying O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
approach O
considering O
the O
video O
collection O
’s O
textual O
data O
and O
query O
expansion O
techniques O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
the O
combination O
of O
social O
tags O
and O
language O
models O
is O
useful O
to O
perform O
query O
expansion O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
proposed O
an O
ontology O
- O
based O
approach O
for O
reducing O
the O
ambiguity O
of O
bilingual O
translation O
. O

A O
metric O
based O
on O
the O
ontological O
chain O
for O
co O
- O
occurrence O
concept O
evaluation O
has O
also O
been O
proposed O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
ontology O
chain O
we O
can O
calculate O
the O
best O
translation O
of O
all O
possible O
translated O
terms O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
approach O
can O
effectively O
remove O
the O
irrelevant O
results O
and O
improve O
the O
precision O
. O

Key O
- O
words O
: O
Cross O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
; O
Ontology O
; O
Translation O
Ambiguity O
; O


-DOCSTART- O

Lexical O
ambiguity O
is O
a O
pervasive O
problem O
in O
natural O
language O
processing O
. O

However O
, O
little O
quantitative O
information O
is O
available O
about O
the O
extent O
of O
the O
problem O
or O
about O
the O
impact O
that O
it O
has O
on O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
report O
on O
an O
analysis O
of O
lexical O
ambiguity O
in O
information O
retrieval O
test O
collections O
and O
on O
experiments O
to O
determine O
the O
utility O
of O
word O
meanings O
for O
separating O
relevant O
from O
nonrelevant O
documents O
. O

The O
experiments O
show O
that O
there O
is O
considerable O
ambiguity O
even O
in O
a O
specialized O
database O
. O

Word O
senses O
provide O
a O
significant O
separation O
between O
relevant O
and O
nonrelevant O
documents O
, O
but O
several O
factors O
contribute O
to O
determining O
whether O
disambiguation O
will O
make O
an O
improvement O
in O
performance O
. O

For O
example O
, O
resolving O
lexical O
ambiguity O
was O
found O
to O
have O
little O
impact O
on O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
for O
documents O
that O
have O
many O
words O
in O
common O
with O
the O
query O
. O

Other O
uses O
of O
word O
sense O
disambiguation O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
context O
are O
discussed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
Voorhees O
/ O
Buckley O
swap O
method O
is O
useful O
for O
comparing O
the O
discrimination O
power O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Question O
Answering O
( O
QA O
) O
metrics O
. O

Given O
a O
test O
collection O
, O
a O
set O
of O
runs O
and O
an O
evaluation O
metric O
, O
it O
derives O
the O
swap O
rate O
, O
the O
chance O
of O
observing O
inconsistencies O
when O
two O
completely O
different O
topic O
sets O
are O
used O
for O
comparing O
a O
pair O
of O
runs O
. O

Recently O
, O
however O
, O
Sanderson O
and O
Zobel O
claimed O
that O
the O
method O
overestimates O
swap O
rates O
as O
it O
samples O
topics O
without O
replacement O
. O

The O
main O
question O
we O
address O
in O
this O
paper O
is O
whether O
sampling O
with O
and O
without O
replacement O
produce O
any O
different O
results O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
comparing O
the O
sensitivity O
of O
different O
metrics O
. O

Our O
IR O
and O
QA O
experiments O
show O
that O
the O
two O
methods O
do O
generally O
yield O
similar O
results O
, O
which O
suggests O
that O
the O
original O
Voorhees O
/ O
Buckley O
method O
is O
valid O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
introduce O
static O
index O
pruning O
methods O
that O
significantly O
reduce O
the O
index O
size O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
investigate O
uniform O
and O
term O
- O
based O
methods O
that O
each O
remove O
selected O
entries O
from O
the O
index O
and O
yet O
have O
only O
a O
minor O
effect O
on O
retrieval O
results O
. O

In O
uniform O
pruning O
, O
there O
is O
a O
fixed O
cutoff O
threshold O
, O
and O
all O
index O
entries O
whose O
contribution O
to O
relevance O
scores O
is O
bounded O
above O
by O
a O
given O
threshold O
are O
removed O
from O
the O
index O
. O

In O
term O
- O
based O
pruning O
, O
the O
cutoff O
threshold O
is O
determined O
for O
each O
term O
, O
and O
thus O
may O
vary O
from O
term O
to O
term O
. O

We O
give O
experimental O
evidence O
that O
for O
each O
level O
of O
compression O
, O
term O
- O
based O
pruning O
outperforms O
uniform O
pruning O
, O
under O
various O
measures O
of O
precision O
. O

We O
present O
theoretical O
and O
experimental O
evidence O
that O
under O
our O
term O
- O
based O
pruning O
scheme O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
prune O
the O
index O
greatly O
and O
still O
get O
retrieval O
results O
that O
are O
almost O
as O
good O
as O
those O
based O
on O
the O
full O
index O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
distinct O
property O
of O
personal O
information O
retrieval O
compared O
to O
other O
information O
retrieval O
processes O
is O
that O
the O
piece O
of O
information O
sought O
for O
is O
already O
known O
to O
the O
user O
. O

It O
is O
a O
process O
where O
the O
user O
has O
seen O
and O
possibly O
processed O
the O
item O
on O
an O
earlier O
occasion O
and O
now O
needs O
it O
again O
for O
some O
reason O
. O

The O
time O
span O
between O
dealing O
with O
the O
item O
and O
retrieving O
it O
again O
may O
vary O
from O
a O
few O
minutes O
to O
several O
years O
. O

To O
deal O
with O
the O
increasing O
amount O
and O
types O
of O
user O
items O
, O
personal O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
been O
developed O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
I O
will O
have O
a O
brief O
look O
at O
some O
desktop O
search O
engines O
and O
more O
closely O
look O
at O
Phlat O
, O
a O
personal O
information O
retrieval O
system O
that O
aims O
at O
using O
all O
imaginable O
information O
a O
user O
can O
remember O
regarding O
an O
item O
to O
find O
it O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Emotions O
are O
an O
integral O
component O
of O
all O
human O
activities O
, O
including O
human O
- O
computer O
interactions O
. O

This O
article O
reviews O
literature O
on O
the O
theories O
of O
emotions O
, O
methods O
for O
studying O
emotions O
, O
and O
their O
role O
in O
human O
information O
behaviour O
. O

It O
also O
examines O
current O
research O
on O
emotions O
in O
Library O
and O
Information O
Science O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Human O
- O
Computer O
Interaction O
, O
and O
outlines O
some O
of O
the O
challenges O
and O
directions O
for O
future O
work O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Textual O
queries O
, O
often O
short O
and O
ambiguous O
, O
can O
be O
insufficient O
when O
describing O
complex O
user O
information O
needs O
. O

Since O
users O
are O
reluctant O
or O
unable O
to O
provide O
long O
or O
precise O
descriptions O
, O
a O
possible O
solution O
to O
the O
low O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
relevance O
prediction O
capability O
is O
to O
exploit O
diverse O
sources O
of O
evidence O
which O
are O
available O
during O
the O
search O
process O
. O

One O
of O
the O
open O
problems O
of O
the O
combination O
of O
diverse O
sources O
of O
evidence O
is O
the O
need O
of O
a O
uniform O
formalism O
which O
seamlessly O
describes O
the O
sources O
and O
the O
document O
ranking O
function O
within O
a O
single O
model O
. O

To O
this O
end O
, O
this O
paper O
discusses O
an O
IR O
view O
which O
explicitly O
considers O
other O
sources O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
information O
need O
and O
the O
document O
, O
and O
proposes O
a O
methodology O
to O
exploit O
them O
to O
support O
feedback O
. O

The O
IR O
view O
is O
described O
using O
the O
Entity O
- O
Relationship O
( O
ER O
) O
model O
which O
allows O
us O
to O
view O
the O
sources O
as O
properties O
of O
entities O
e.g. O
of O
the O
entity O
information O
need O
, O
document O
, O
or O
user O
or O
of O
their O
relationships O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
area O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
dimension O
of O
document O
vectors O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
. O

Firstly O
, O
with O
higher O
dimensions O
index O
structures O
suffer O
the O
“ O
curse O
of O
dimensionality O
” O
and O
their O
efficiency O
rapidly O
decreases O
. O

Secondly O
, O
we O
may O
not O
use O
exact O
words O
when O
looking O
for O
a O
document O
, O
thus O
we O
miss O
some O
relevant O
documents O
. O

LSI O
( O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
) O
is O
a O
numerical O
method O
, O
which O
discovers O
latent O
semantic O
in O
documents O
by O
creating O
concepts O
from O
existing O
terms O
. O

However O
, O
it O
is O
hard O
to O
compute O
LSI O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
offer O
a O
replacement O
of O
LSI O
with O
a O
projection O
matrix O
created O
fromWordNet O
hierarchy O
and O
compare O
it O
with O
LSI O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Evaluating O
contributions O
from O
users O
of O
systems O
with O
large O
datasets O
is O
a O
challenge O
across O
many O
domains O
, O
from O
task O
assessment O
in O
crowdsourcing O
to O
document O
relevance O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
model O
for O
rewarding O
and O
evaluating O
users O
using O
retrospective O
validation O
, O
with O
only O
a O
small O
gold O
standard O
required O
to O
initiate O
the O
system O
. O

A O
simulation O
of O
the O
model O
shows O
that O
users O
are O
rewarded O
appropriately O
for O
high O
quality O
responses O
however O
analysis O
of O
data O
from O
an O
implementation O
of O
the O
model O
in O
a O
text O
annotation O
game O
indicates O
it O
may O
not O
be O
sophisticated O
enough O
to O
predict O
user O
performance O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
classical O
information O
retrieval O
system O
ranks O
documents O
according O
to O
distances O
between O
texts O
and O
a O
user O
query O
. O

The O
answer O
list O
is O
often O
so O
long O
that O
users O
can O
not O
examine O
all O
the O
documents O
retrieved O
whereas O
some O
relevant O
ones O
are O
badly O
ranked O
and O
thus O
never O
retrieved O
. O

To O
solve O
this O
problem O
, O
retrieved O
documents O
are O
automatically O
clustered O
. O

We O
describe O
an O
algorithm O
based O
on O
hierarchical O
and O
clustering O
methods O
. O

It O
classifies O
the O
set O
of O
documents O
retrieved O
by O
any O
IR O
- O
system O
. O

This O
method O
is O
evaluated O
over O
the O
TREC-7 O
corpora O
and O
queries O
. O

We O
show O
that O
it O
improves O
the O
results O
of O
the O
retrieval O
by O
providing O
users O
at O
least O
one O
high O
precision O
cluster O
. O

The O
impact O
of O
the O
number O
of O
clusters O
and O
the O
way O
to O
browse O
them O
to O
build O
a O
reordered O
list O
are O
examined O
. O

Over O
TREC O
corpora O
and O
queries O
, O
we O
show O
that O
the O
choice O
of O
the O
number O
of O
clusters O
according O
to O
the O
length O
of O
queries O
improves O
results O
compared O
with O
a O
prefixed O
number O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
growth O
of O
the O
Web O
has O
posed O
new O
challenges O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
Most O
of O
the O
current O
systems O
are O
based O
on O
traditional O
models O
, O
which O
have O
been O
developed O
for O
atomic O
and O
independents O
documents O
and O
are O
not O
adapted O
to O
the O
Web O
. O

A O
promising O
research O
orientation O
consists O
of O
studying O
the O
impact O
of O
the O
Web O
structure O
on O
indexing O
. O

The O
HyperDocument O
model O
presented O
in O
this O
article O
is O
based O
on O
essential O
aspects O
of O
information O
comprehension O
: O
content O
, O
composition O
and O
linear O
/ O
non O
- O
linear O
reading O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
talk O
provides O
an O
overview O
of O
research O
opportunities O
in O
adaptive O
search O
, O
with O
particular O
emphasis O
on O
web O
search O
and O
the O
consequent O
challenges O
of O
scale O
. O

Examples O
of O
adaptive O
search O
will O
be O
drawn O
from O
web O
search O
engines O
, O
and O
based O
in O
part O
on O
these O
examples O
, O
I O
will O
explore O
how O
adaption O
applies O
to O
search O
processes O
and O
search O
interfaces O
. O

The O
implications O
of O
web O
scale O
for O
research O
will O
be O
considered O
from O
various O
viewpoints O
: O
types O
of O
user O
, O
types O
of O
search O
, O
and O
search O
engine O
performance O
. O

Evaluation O
of O
adaptive O
web O
search O
remains O
a O
challenge O
, O
and O
I O
will O
briefly O
cover O
types O
of O
experiment O
, O
including O
access O
to O
collections O
and O
research O
tools O
. O

Some O
concluding O
remarks O
will O
be O
made O
on O
possible O
research O
directions O
and O
activities O
for O
the O
information O
retrieval O
research O
community O
. O

Second O
International O
Workshop O
on O
Adaptive O
Information O

, O
London O
, O
UK O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
addition O
to O
the O
frequency O
of O
terms O
in O
a O
document O
collection O
, O
the O
spatial O
distribution O
of O
terms O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
determining O
the O
relevance O
of O
documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
new O
approach O
for O
representing O
term O
positions O
in O
documents O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
approach O
allows O
us O
to O
efficiently O
apply O
term O
- O
positional O
information O
at O
query O
evaluation O
time O
. O

Two O
applications O
are O
investigated O
: O
a O
function O
- O
based O
ranking O
optimization O
representing O
a O
user O
- O
defined O
document O
region O
, O
and O
a O
query O
expansion O
technique O
based O
on O
overlapping O
the O
term O
distributions O
in O
the O
top O
- O
ranked O
documents O
. O

Experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
query O
translation O
using O
language O
resources O
and O
a O
concept O
base O
method O
for O
Cross O
- O
language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O

In O
the O
proposed O
method O
, O
queries O
are O
translated O
by O
multiple O
machine O
translation O
systems O
on O
the O
Language O
Grid O
. O

The O
queries O
are O
then O
expanded O
by O
using O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
to O
translate O
compound O
words O
or O
word O
phrases O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
documents O
related O
to O
the O
translated O
query O
are O
retrieved O
with O
a O
TFIDF O
term O
weighting O
model O
. O

The O
top O
100 O
retrieved O
documents O
are O
re O
- O
ranked O
by O
a O
specificity O
- O
considered O
concept O
base O
with O
the O
noun O
phrases O
and O
compound O
words O
extracted O
from O
the O
query O
. O

The O
reranked O
results O
are O
combined O
with O
the O
results O
retrieved O
by O
the O
probabilistic O
model O
. O

For O
evaluation O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
, O
we O
use O
the O
average O
precision O
of O
the O
non O
- O
interpolated O
recall O
and O
precision O
to O
compare O
our O
method O
with O
the O
NTCIR1 O
participation O
systems O
. O

The O
proposed O
method O
achieved O
the O
highest O
precision O
. O

Applying O

to O
a O

for O

by O

. O

Natural O

engines O
along O
with O

base O
( O

) O
to O
store O
rules O
and O
facts O
. O

High O
- O
Performance O
Linguistics O
( O
HPL O
) O
Scheme O
is O
an O
expert O
Knowledge O
base O
- O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
System O
( O
K O
- O
NLP O
) O
that O

predicate O
clauses O
. O

this O
paper O
focuses O
about O
knowledge O
representation O
module O
of O
the O
System O
. O

It O

- O

which O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
English O
written O
text O
, O
words O
are O
separated O
by O
spaces O
, O
but O
in O
written O
Chinese O
text O
, O
there O
are O
no O
such O
separators O
between O
words O
See O
Figure O
1 O

Thus O
, O
effective O
information O
retrieval O
of O
Chinese O
text O
first O
requires O
good O
word O
segmentation O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
investigate O
an O
efficient O
algorithm O
to O
discover O
the O
words O
and O
their O
occurrence O
probabilities O
from O
a O
corpus O
of O
unsegmented O
text O
without O
using O
a O
dictionary O
. O

Using O
the O
probabilities O
of O
the O
words O
, O
word O
segmentation O
is O
done O
according O
to O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
principle O
. O

Comparing O
the O
segmentation O
output O
by O
the O
algorithm O
with O
the O
correct O
segmentation O
, O
recall O
/ O
precision O
of O
65.65%/71.91 O
% O
is O
achieved O
. O

If O
some O
simple O
post O
- O
processing O
is O
performed O
, O
recall O
/ O
precision O
can O
be O
boosted O
up O
to O
97.72%/91.05 O
% O
. O

. O

Despite O

is O
among O

cient O
and O

in O

. O

Since O

- O

( O
CL O

For O

Retrieval O
, O
users O
are O
more O

about O
the O

of O
top O
ranking O
documents O
in O
most O

. O

In O

to O

of O

Key O
Terms O
to O

Key O

, O
finally O

of O
Local O
Key O

in O

and O

to O

. O

at O

10 O
and O
100 O
ranking O
documents O

By O
using O

Common O
Subsumers O
( O

) O
have O
been O

Description O
Logics O
( O
DL O
) O

between O
two O

. O

Since O

tool O
for O

of O

, O
information O

, O
to O

. O

The O
best O

algorithm O
for O
computing O

structural O
comparison O
on O

, O

DL O

is O

is O
ALEN O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
combination O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
RI O
) O
tools O
and O
structural O
recognition O
( O
SR O
) O
tools O
are O
used O
for O
the O
automatic O
construction O
of O
a O
generic O
model O
of O
documents O
. O

The O
automatic O
construction O
takes O
as O
input O
a O
structured O
database O
of O
the O
documents O
which O
is O
converted O
into O
SGML O
, O
giving O
a O
logical O
representation O
of O
their O
content O
. O

the O
RS O
tools O
are O
applied O
to O
the O
postscript O
representation O
of O
the O
documents O
to O
produce O
their O
physical O
characteristics O
. O

We O
have O
coosen O
bibliographic O
reference O
database O
to O
illustrate O
our O
proposals O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
a O
Distributed O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
, O
a O
user O
submits O
a O
query O
to O
a O
broker O
, O
which O
determines O
how O
to O
yield O
a O
given O
number O
of O
documents O
from O
all O
possible O
resource O
servers O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
multi O
- O
objective O
model O
for O
this O
resource O
selection O
task O
. O

In O
this O
model O
, O
four O
aspects O
are O
considered O
simultaneously O
in O
the O
choice O
of O
the O
resource O
: O
document O
’s O
relevance O
to O
the O
given O
query O
, O
time O
, O
monetary O
cost O
, O
and O
similarity O
between O
resources O
. O

An O
optimized O
solution O
is O
achieved O
by O
comparing O
the O
performances O
of O
all O
possible O
candidates O
. O

Some O
variations O
of O
the O
basic O
model O
are O
also O
given O
, O
which O
improve O
the O
basic O
model O
’s O
efficiency O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

1 O
University O
of O
Haifa O
, O
Haifa O
, O
Israel O
2 O
ITC O
- O
irst O
, O
Trento O
, O
Italy O
Abstract O
. O

Providing O
accurate O
personalized O
information O
services O
to O
the O
users O
requires O
knowing O
their O
interests O
and O
needs O
, O
as O
defined O
by O
their O
User O
Models O
( O
UMs O
Since O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
personalization O
depends O
on O
the O
richness O
of O
the O
UMs O
, O
services O
would O
benefit O
from O
enriching O
their O
UMs O
through O
importing O
and O
aggregating O
partial O
UMs O
built O
by O
other O
services O
from O
relatively O
similar O
domains O
. O

The O
obvious O
question O
is O
how O
to O
determine O
the O
similarity O
of O
domains O
? O

This O
paper O
proposes O
to O
compute O
inter O
- O
domain O
similarities O
by O
exploiting O
well O
- O
known O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
for O
comparing O
textual O
contents O
of O
the O
Web O
- O
sites O
, O
classified O
under O
the O
domain O
nodes O
in O
Web O
- O
directories O
. O

Initial O
experiments O
validate O
feasibility O
of O
the O
proposed O
approach O
and O
raise O
open O
research O
questions O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
is O
concerned O
with O
the O
use O
of O
linguistically O
motivated O
phrases O
as O
indexing O
terms O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
applications O
. O

Apart O
from O
the O
conventional O
noun O
phrases O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
use O
verb O
phrases O
as O
index O
terms O
for O
text O
classiication O
. O

Techniques O
for O
phrase O
matching O
through O
syntactic O
normalization O
and O
seman O
- O
tical O
matching O
are O
described O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
show O
how O
to O
perform O
syntactic O
normalization O
of O
phrases O
in O
order O
to O
enhance O
recall O
. O

Semantical O
normalization O
is O
based O
on O
lexico O
- O
semantical O
relations O
, O
taking O
into O
account O
certain O
properties O
of O
the O
classiication O
algorithms O
used O
. O

The O
ideas O
described O
here O
are O
being O
implemented O
in O
the O
Document O
Routing O
system O
DORO O
, O
in O
which O
statistical O
learning O
algorithms O
are O
applied O
to O
document O
proles O
consisting O
of O
phrases O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
rationale O
behind O
work O
in O
progress O
, O
rather O
than O
presenting O
nal O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
short O
paper O
we O
present O
three O
methods O
to O
valorise O
score O
relevance O
of O
some O
documents O
basing O
on O
their O
characteristics O
in O
order O
to O
enhance O
their O
ranking O
. O

Our O
framework O
is O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
dedicated O
to O
children O
. O

The O
valorisation O
methods O
aim O
to O
increase O
the O
relevance O
score O
of O
some O
documents O
by O
an O
additional O
value O
which O
is O
proportional O
to O
the O
number O
of O
multimedia O
objects O
included O
, O
the O
number O
of O
objects O
linked O
to O
the O
user O
particulars O
and O
the O
included O
topics O
. O

All O
of O
the O
three O
valorization O
methods O
use O
fuzzy O
rules O
to O
identify O
the O
valorization O
value O
. O

to O

. O

. O

participated O
in O

( O

) O
track O
of O

. O

Our O
speech O
retrieval O
system O
uses O
modern O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
methods O
in O
conjunction O
with O
in O
- O
house O
automatic O
speech O
recognition O
. O

The O
novel O
feature O
of O
our O
TREC-7 O
work O
is O
the O
use O
of O
document O
expansion O
to O
reduce O
the O
performance O
loss O
due O
to O
ASR O
errors O
. O

Results O
show O
that O
retrieval O
from O
automatic O
transcriptions O
of O
speech O
is O
quite O
competitive O
with O
doing O
retrieval O
from O
human O
transcriptions O
. O

Our O
experiments O
indicate O
that O
document O
expansion O
can O
be O
used O
to O
further O
improve O
retrieval O
from O
automatic O
transcripts O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
some O
analysis O
of O
document O
expansion O
in O
context O
of O
the O
TREC-7 O
SDR O
track O
task O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Marsyas O
is O
a O
software O
framework O
for O
building O
efficient O
complex O
audio O
processing O
systems O
and O
applications O
. O

Although O
originally O
designed O
for O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
tasks O
in O
the O
past O
few O
years O
it O
has O
been O
expanded O
to O
include O
any O
type O
of O
audio O
analysis O
or O
synthesis O
. O

Complex O
Audio O
processing O
systems O
are O
defined O
hierarchically O
through O
composition O
using O
implicit O
patching O
. O

Both O
the O
specification O
of O
the O
processing O
network O
and O
the O
control O
of O
it O
while O
data O
is O
flowing O
through O
can O
be O
performed O
at O
runtime O
without O
requiring O
recompilation O
. O

Compilation O
is O
required O
only O
when O
new O
processing O
objects O
need O
to O
be O
defined O
. O

Therefore O
the O
Marsyas O
runtime O
provides O
considerable O
functionality O
and O
flexibility O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
demonstrate O
how O
the O
Marsyas O
runtime O
can O
be O
accessed O
using O
a O
variety O
of O
different O
ways O
allowing O
non O
- O
trivial O
interactions O
with O
common O
software O
frameworks O
and O
environments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

augmented O

of O

as O
the O

format O
for O

structure O

-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
drastic O
increase O
of O
available O
information O
sources O
on O
the O
Internet O
, O
people O
with O
different O
backgrounds O
share O
the O
same O
problem O
: O
locating O
useful O
information O
for O
their O
actual O
needs O
. O

Search O
engines O
make O
this O
task O
easier O
only O
in O
certain O
ways O
; O
people O
still O
have O
to O
do O
the O
sifting O
process O
by O
themselves O
. O

At O
this O
point O
, O
automatic O
summarization O
can O
complement O
the O
task O
of O
search O
engines O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
consider O
a O
new O
summarization O
approach O
for O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
; O
i.e. O
structure O
- O
preserving O
and O
query O
- O
biased O
summarization O
. O

We O
evaluate O
this O
approach O
on O
Turkish O
Web O
documents O
using O
TREC O
- O
like O
topics O
defined O
for O
Turkish O
. O

The O
results O
of O
the O
task O
- O
based O
evaluation O
show O
that O
this O
approach O
has O
significant O
improvement O
over O
Google O
snippets O
and O
unstructured O
query O
- O
biased O
summaries O
in O
terms O
of O
f O
- O
measure O
using O
the O
relevance O
prediction O
approach O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Preparing O
the O
books O
to O
read O
every O
day O
is O
enjoyable O
for O
many O
people O
. O

However O
, O
there O
are O
still O
many O
people O
who O
also O
do O
n't O
like O
reading O
. O

This O
is O
a O
problem O
. O

But O
, O
when O
you O
can O
support O
others O
to O
start O
reading O
, O
it O
will O
be O
better O
. O

One O
of O
the O
books O
that O
can O
be O
recommended O
for O
new O
readers O
is O
topographic O
mapping O
covering O
the O
wider O
field O
of O
geospatial O
information O
science O
technology O
gist O
. O

This O
book O
is O
not O
kind O
of O
difficult O
book O
to O
read O
. O

It O
can O
be O
read O
and O
understand O
by O
the O
new O
readers O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
conceptual O
model O
and O
mathematical O
formalism O
of O
quantum O
theory O
are O
employed O
in O
creating O
a O
novel O
framework O
for O
modeling O
the O
computational O
search O
process O
addressing O
problematic O
issues O
that O
restrict O
information O
retrieval O
research O
. O

Mapping O
the O
mathematical O
formalism O
of O
search O
to O
that O
of O
quantum O
theory O
presents O
insightful O
perspectives O
about O
the O
nature O
of O
search O
. O

However O
, O
differences O
in O
operational O
semantics O
of O
quantum O
theory O
and O
search O
restrict O
the O
utility O
of O
the O
mapping O
. O

An O
approach O
is O
suggested O
for O
resolving O
these O
semantic O
differences O
aiming O
toward O
a O
sound O
mathematical O
and O
conceptual O
framework O
for O
search O
inspired O
by O
quantum O
theory O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Test O
collections O
are O
extensively O
used O
in O
the O
evaluation O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Crucial O
to O
their O
use O
is O
the O
degree O
to O
which O
results O
from O
them O
predict O
user O
effectiveness O
. O

At O
first O
, O
past O
studies O
did O
not O
substantiate O
a O
relationship O
between O
system O
and O
user O
effectiveness O
; O
more O
recently O
, O
however O
, O
correlations O
have O
begun O
to O
emerge O
. O

The O
results O
of O
this O
paper O
strengthen O
and O
extend O
those O
findings O
. O

We O
introduce O
a O
novel O
methodology O
for O
investigating O
the O
relationship O
, O
which O
shows O
great O
success O
in O
establishing O
a O
significant O
correlation O
between O
system O
and O
user O
effectiveness O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
that O
users O
behave O
differently O
and O
discern O
differences O
between O
pairs O
of O
systems O
that O
have O
a O
very O
small O
absolute O
difference O
in O
test O
collection O
effectiveness O
. O

Our O
results O
strengthen O
the O
use O
of O
test O
collections O
in O
IR O
evaluation O
, O
confirming O
that O
users O
' O
effectiveness O
can O
be O
predicted O
successfully O
. O

of O

( O

and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
prediction O
of O
query O
performance O
is O
an O
interesting O
and O
important O
issue O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
Current O
predictors O
involve O
the O
use O
of O
relevance O
scores O
, O
which O
are O
time O
- O
consuming O
to O
compute O
. O

Therefore O
, O
current O
predictors O
are O
not O
very O
suitable O
for O
practical O
applications O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
study O
six O
predictors O
of O
query O
performance O
, O
which O
can O
be O
generated O
prior O
to O
the O
retrieval O
process O
without O
the O
use O
of O
relevance O
scores O
. O

As O
a O
consequence O
, O
the O
cost O
of O
computing O
these O
predictors O
is O
marginal O
. O

The O
linear O
and O
non O
- O
parametric O
correlations O
of O
the O
proposed O
predictors O
with O
query O
performance O
are O
thoroughly O
assessed O
on O
the O
Text O
REtrieval O
Conference O
( O
TREC O
) O
disk4 O
and O
disk5 O
( O
minus O
CR O
) O
collection O
with O
the O
249 O
TREC O
topics O
that O
were O
used O
in O
the O
recent O
TREC2004 O
Robust O
Track O
. O

According O
to O
the O
results O
, O
some O
of O
the O
proposed O
predictors O
have O
significant O
correlation O
with O
query O
performance O
, O
showing O
that O
these O
predictors O
can O
be O
useful O
to O
infer O
query O
performance O
in O
practical O
applications O
. O

. O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

Document O
clustering O
is O
an O
important O
technology O
which O
helps O
users O
to O
organize O
the O
large O
amount O
of O
online O
information O
, O
especially O
after O
the O
rapid O
growth O
of O
the O
Web O
. O

This O
paper O
focuses O
on O
semantic O
document O
clustering O
method O
and O
its O
application O
in O
search O
engine O
. O

We O
proposed O
a O
multi O
- O
agent O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
to O
enhance O
the O
search O
process O
. O

The O
agents O
retrieve O
the O
results O
of O
Web O
search O
engine O
and O
organize O
the O
results O
by O
clustering O
them O
into O
different O
categories O
for O
a O
given O
query O
. O

We O
utilized O
WordNet O
ontology O
and O
several O
approaches O
to O
cluster O
results O
in O
appropriate O
category O
according O
to O
WordNet O
synsets O
. O

The O
experiment O
shows O
that O
semantic O
clustering O
work O
better O
than O
original O
clustering O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
a O
federated O
digital O
library O
system O
, O
it O
is O
too O
expensive O
to O
query O
every O
accessible O
library O
. O

Resource O
selection O
is O
the O
task O
to O
decide O
to O
which O
libraries O
a O
query O
should O
be O
routed O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
novel O
technique O
that O
is O
used O
in O
the O
MIND O
project O
. O

Our O
approach O
, O
decision O
- O
theoretic O
framework O
( O
DTF O
differs O
from O
existing O
algorithms O
like O
CORI O
in O
two O
ways O
: O

It O
computes O
a O
selection O
which O
minimises O
the O
overall O
costs O
( O
e.g. O
retrieval O
quality O
, O
time O
, O
money O
) O
of O
the O
distributed O
retrieval O
. O

And O
it O
allows O
for O
other O
data O
types O
beside O
text O
( O
e.g O
names O
, O
years O
, O
images O
whereas O
other O
resource O
selection O
techniques O
are O
restricted O
to O
text O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Transcription O
has O
been O
a O
core O
field O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
development O
in O
MIR O
is O
dependent O
on O
how O
efficiently O
and O
accurately O
the O
notes O
are O
extracted O
. O

Various O
methods O
have O
been O
used O
for O
Automatic O
Music O
Transcription O
. O

The O
most O
effective O
ones O
have O
been O
based O
on O
Spectral O
factorization O
technique O
for O
which O
Non O
- O
Negative O
Matrix O
Factorization O
has O
been O
profoundly O
used O
. O

Here O
we O
use O
a O
variant O
of O
NMF O
which O
is O
based O
on O
Accelerated O
Multiplicative O
Update O
with O
some O
predefined O
templates O
. O

The O
method O
provides O
good O
results O
on O
the O
Disklavier O
Dataset O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
method O
which O
exploits O
the O
semantic O
proximity O
of O
words O
in O
unrestricted O

language O

to O

. O

In O

functionality O
, O
the O
system O
represents O
the O
documents O
and O
the O
query O
in O
the O
form O
of O
semantically O
relatable O
sets O
( O
SRS O
which O
are O
a O
group O
of O
entities O
demanding O
semantic O
relations O
when O
the O
semantic O
representation O
of O
the O
sentence O
is O

produced O
. O

We O
also O
devise O
a O
method O
to O
augment O
the O
SRSs O
to O
further O

the O
performance O
. O

WordNet O
is O
used O
to O
deal O
with O
different O
forms O
of O
divergence O
between O
the O
query O
and O
the O
documents O
. O

a O

of O

on O

data O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
( O
semi O

detection O
of O
a O
user O
's O
system O

provides O

for O

task O
- O

- O

. O

of O

is O

for O

. O

from O

Wardens O

of O

which O
aims O
to O
demolish O
possible O
hidden O
information O
within O
a O
carrier O
media O
. O

enemy O
's O

is O
to O
disrupt O
the O
communication O
of O
hidden O
information O
, O
then O
the O

approach O
is O
definitely O
a O
better O
choice O
compared O
to O
passive O

consuming O

. O

Information O
Retrieval O
: O
Common O
information O
- O
retrieval O
techniques O
either O
rely O
on O
a O
specific O
encoding O
of O
available O
information O
( O

fixed O
classification O
codes O
) O

simple O
full O
- O
text O
analysis O
. O

Both O
approaches O
suffer O
from O
severe O
shortcomings O
. O

Using O
an O
ontology O
in O
order O
to O
explicate O
the O

can O
help O
overcome O
some O
of O

against O

. O

. O

IR O

Noun O
compounds O
are O
a O
frequently O
occurring O
yet O
highly O
ambiguous O
construction O
in O
natural O
language O
; O
their O
interpretation O
relies O
on O
extra O
- O
syntactic O
information O
. O

Several O
statistical O
methods O
for O
compound O
disambiguation O
have O
been O
reported O
in O
the O
literature O
; O
however O
, O
a O
striking O
feature O
of O

that O

derived O
from O
unambiguous O
compounds O
in O
training O
, O
meaning O
they O
are O
prone O
to O
the O
problem O
of O
sparse O
data O
. O

Other O

have O
overcome O
this O
difficulty O
somewhat O
by O
using O
manually O
crafted O
knowledge O
resources O
to O
collect O

on O
“ O
concepts O
” O
rather O
than O

tokens O
, O
but O
have O

domain O
- O
independence O
by O
doing O
so O
. O

We O
report O
here O
on O
work O
investigating O
the O
application O
of O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
[ O
4 O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
technique O
, O
to O
the O
task O
of O
noun O
compound O
disambiguation O
. O

We O
achieved O
an O
accuracy O
of O
84 O
indicating O
the O
potential O
of O
applying O
vectorbased O
distributional O
information O
measures O
to O
syntactic O
disambiguation O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
approach O
taken O
to O
the O
XML O

track O
at O

2008 O

group O

- O

algorithm O

context O

document O

. O

in O

. O

K O
- O
tree O
scales O
well O

large O
inputs O

to O

low O

. O

It O

efficiency O
and O
quality O
. O

classification O

a O
database O
of O
documents O

a O
user O
's O
query O
, O
how O
can O

locate O
those O
documents O
that O
meet O

user O
's O
information O
needs O
? O

no O

deenition O
of O

database O

the O

process O
. O

theory O

model O
, O
describe O

, O
and O
present O
some O
experimental O
results O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
performance O
of O

document O
re O

inverted O
lists O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

Session O
search O
is O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
task O
that O
performs O
document O
retrieval O
for O
a O
search O
session O
. O

During O
a O
session O
, O
a O
user O
constantly O
modifies O
queries O
in O
order O
to O
find O
relevant O
documents O
that O
fulfill O
the O
information O
need O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
query O
change O
retrieval O
model O
( O
QCM O
which O
utilizes O
syntactic O
editing O
changes O
between O
adjacent O
queries O
as O
well O
as O
the O
relationship O
between O
query O
change O
and O
previously O
retrieved O
documents O
to O
enhance O
session O
search O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
model O
session O
search O
as O
a O
Markov O
Decision O
Process O
( O
MDP O
We O
consider O
two O
agents O
in O
this O
MDP O
: O
the O
user O
agent O
and O
the O
search O
engine O
agent O
. O

The O
user O
agent O
's O
actions O
are O
query O
changes O
that O
we O
observe O
and O
the O
search O
agent O
's O
actions O
are O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
is O
highly O
effective O
and O
outperforms O
top O
session O
search O
systems O
in O
TREC O
2011 O
and O
2012 O
. O

This O

for O

planning O

. O

The O

negotiate O
with O

to O

distributed O
plan O
for O
satisfaction O
of O
each O
information O
need O
and O

also O
interfaces O
with O
local O
retrieval O
and O
data O
processing O
functions O
. O

The O

is O

as O

to O
enable O
automated O

of O
resources O
( O
information O
and O
capabilities O
) O

among O

agents O
. O

of O

“ O

” O

commitment O
protocol O
are O

an O

called O

for O

and O

of O
satellite O

data O
is O
presented O
. O

this O
paper O
, O

. O

's O

. O

global O

, O

Saliency O
Network O
. O

of O
structural O

. O

Finally O

to O

fragments O

global O

value O

. O

- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
on O

of O

average O
precision O
to O
.80 O
. O

counting O
algorithm O
can O
estimate O
the O
number O
of O
solutions O
in O
a O
database O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
analyze O
its O
behaviors O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
decoherence O
errors O
. O

We O
construct O
two O
counting O
circuits O
in O
which O
the O
order O
of O
commutative O
gates O
are O
altered O
and O
show O
that O
the O
behaviors O
of O
circuits O
are O
different O
when O
decoherence O
errors O
occur O
. O

On O
one O
circuit O
, O
almost O
correct O
number O
of O
solutions O
are O
obtained O
and O
on O
the O
other O
circuit O
, O
the O
estimated O
numbers O
of O
solutions O
are O
mostly O
distributed O
over O
the O
correct O
one O
and O
wrong O
counts O
zero O
and O
the O
number O
of O
elements O
. O

We O
analyze O
that O
these O
phenomena O
result O
from O
the O
rotation O
outside O
the O
Grover O
space O
due O
to O
decoherence O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Many O
search O
engines O
are O
term O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
models O
. O

The O
disadvantage O
of O
this O
type O
of O
model O
is O
that O
it O
does O
not O
consider O
word O
sense O
. O

If O
we O
can O
represent O
the O
meanings O
of O
the O
terms O
that O
a O
user O
inputs O
, O
the O
IR O
system O
can O
retrieve O
the O
information O
the O
user O
really O
wants O
; O
not O
simply O
match O
the O
terms O
. O

To O
represent O
word O
sense O
, O
we O
proposed O
conceptual O
fuzzy O
sets O
( O
CFSs O

A O
CFS O
is O
a O
framework O
that O
represents O
word O
concepts O
and O
that O
changes O
dynamically O
with O
fuzzy O
sets O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
experiment O
with O
concept O
retrieval O
for O
documents O
using O
conceptualized O
queries O
using O
CFSs O
. O

In O
our O
experiment O
, O
we O
evaluated O
our O
system O
on O
a O
large O
- O
scale O
corpus O
consisting O
of O
1 O
million O
newswire O
text O
data O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
showed O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
IR O
system O
was O
improved O
. O

It O
also O
indicated O
that O
generating O
conceptualized O
queries O
is O
effective O
in O
an O
IR O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

An O
important O
problem O
in O
signal O
analysis O
is O
to O
define O
a O
general O
purpose O
signal O
representation O
which O
is O
well O
adapted O
for O
developing O
pattern O
recognition O
algorithms O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
will O
show O
that O
such O
a O
representation O
can O
be O
defined O
from O
the O
position O
of O
the O
zero O
- O
crossings O
and O
the O
local O
energy O
values O
of O
a O
dyadic O
wavelet O
decomposition O
. O

This O
representation O
is O
experimentally O
complete O
and O
admits O
a O
simple O
distance O
for O
pattern O
matching O
applications O
. O

It O
provides O
a O
multiscale O
decomposition O
of O
the O
signal O
and O
at O
each O
scale O
characterizes O
the O
locations O
of O
abrupt O
changes O
in O
the O
signal O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
a O
stereo O
matching O
algorithm O
to O
illustrate O
the O
application O
of O
this O
representation O
to O
pattern O
matching O
. O

of O

why O
the O

of O
the O

Science O
( O
LIS O
) O
user O
studies O
and O

seeking O
behavior O
is O

inadequate O
and O
it O

of O
subjects O
, O
objects O
, O
and O
their O
relations O
according O
to O
a O

of O
‘ O

causation O
( O
affordances O
) O
is O
suggested O
as O
a O
substitute O
for O

causation O
. O

notion O

and O

large O
quantity O
of O

data O
is O
a O
highly O
challenging O
and O
growingly O
important O
problem O
for O
the O
computer O
science O
research O
community O
. O

Researchers O
in O
multimedia O
, O
databases O
, O
computer O
vision O
, O
machine O
learning O
, O
signal O
and O
image O
processing O
and O
statistics O
have O
worked O
on O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
for O
over O
a O
decade O
. O

A O
number O
of O
significant O
technological O
advances O
have O
been O
achieved O
in O
this O
field O
. O

Some O
of O
the O
techniques O
have O
been O
applied O
to O

areas O
such O
as O
art O
image O

, O

and O

, O

- O
scale O

and O

and O

of O

, O

content O
, O

, O

and O
