applications O
more O
generally O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Resource O
selection O
, O
also O
called O
server O
selection O
, O
collection O
selection O
or O
database O
selection O
, O
is O
a O
foundational O
problem O
in O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
( O
DIR O
This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
set O
- O
covering O
- O
based O
algorithm O
for O
resource O
selection O
in O
DIR O
, O
with O
consideration O
of O
overlapping O
extent O
between O
resources O
. O

Give O
different O
document O
with O
different O
weight O
according O
to O
its O
position O
in O
merged O
results O
for O
question O
Q. O
Only O
results O
that O
have O
not O
appeared O
in O
some O
earlier O
selected O
resource O
are O
focused O
on O
in O
later O
selected O
resources O
. O

The O
score O
of O
each O
resource O
is O
decided O
by O
the O
total O
weights O
of O
those O
merged O
results O
included O
in O
, O
and O
only O
the O
resource O
with O
max O
score O
is O
selected O
in O
each O
selecting O
step O
. O

So O
, O
the O
selecting O
order O
is O
the O
actual O
rank O
of O
selected O
resources O
which O
are O
used O
to O
search O
the O
question O
Q&#x02019 O
which O
is O
similar O
to O
question O
Q. O
The O
approach O
saves O
big O
searching O
time O
due O
to O
overlapping O
between O
databases O
and O
, O
at O
the O
same O
time O
, O
enhances O
user O
's O
recall O
rate O
and O
precision O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
is O
becoming O
one O
of O
the O
most O
preferred O
and O
widespread O
mediums O
of O
learning O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
most O
of O
the O
current O
Web O
- O
based O
learning O
systems O
are O
still O
delivering O
the O
same O
educational O
resources O
in O
the O
same O
way O
to O
learners O
with O
different O
profiles O
. O

A O
number O
of O
past O
efforts O
have O
dealt O
with O
e O
- O
learning O
personalization O
, O
generally O
, O
relying O
on O
explicit O
information O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
aim O
to O
compute O
on O
- O
line O
automatic O
recommendations O
to O
an O
active O
learner O
based O
on O
his O
/ O
her O
recent O
navigation O
history O
, O
as O
well O
as O
exploiting O
similarities O
and O
dissimilarities O
among O
user O
preferences O
and O
among O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
learning O
resources O
. O

First O
we O
start O
by O
mining O
learner O
profiles O
using O
Web O
usage O
mining O
techniques O
and O
content O
- O
based O
profiles O
using O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
use O
these O
profiles O
to O
compute O
relevant O
links O
to O
recommend O
for O
an O
active O
learner O
by O
applying O
a O
number O
of O
different O
recommendation O
strategies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
paper O
presents O
the O
use O
of O
semantically O
enhanced O
web O
services O
in O
the O
field O
of O
distributed O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
main O
idea O
of O
the O
approach O
is O
that O
a O
web O
service O
is O
used O
as O
an O
intelligent O
wrapper O
for O
an O
information O
resource O
( O
IR O
These O
autonomous O
IRs O
become O
available O
for O
querying O
within O
distributed O
information O
system O
with O
centralized O
mediator O
through O
IR O
registration O
. O

IR O
wrapper O
web O
services O
provide O
homogeneous O
semantically O
reinforced O
query O
interface O
for O
the O
mediator O

trough O
the O
use O
of O
machine O
- O
processable O
ontologies O
. O

The O
paper O
reports O
on O
the O
architectures O
of O
the O
mediator O
systems O
in O
two O
projects O
that O
exploit O
IR O
wrapper O
web O
service O
approach O
. O

The O
architecture O
of O
the O
IR O
wrapper O
web O
service O
, O
the O
generic O
wrapper O
and O
its O
bindings O
is O
then O
presented O
. O

The O
technique O
is O
evaluated O
by O
experiments O
with O
implemented O
tester O
for O
the O
web O
service O
which O
wraps O
“ O
University O
Entrant O
” O
IR O
of O
Zaporozhye O
State O
University O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
SHELLFBK O
system O
that O
participated O
in O
SemEval O
2015 O
Tasks O
9 O
, O
10 O
, O
and O
11 O
. O

Our O
system O
takes O
a O
supervised O
approach O
that O
builds O
on O
techniques O
from O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
algorithm O
populates O
an O
inverted O
index O
with O
pseudo O
- O
documents O
that O
encode O
dependency O
parse O
relationships O
extracted O
from O
the O
sentences O
in O
the O
training O
set O
. O

Each O
record O
stored O
in O
the O
index O
is O
annotated O
with O
the O
polarity O
and O
domain O
of O
the O
sentence O
it O
represents O
. O

When O
the O
polarity O
or O
domain O
of O
a O
new O
sentence O
has O
to O
be O
computed O
, O
the O
new O
sentence O
is O
converted O
to O
a O
query O
that O
is O
used O
to O
retrieve O
the O
most O
similar O
sentences O
from O
the O
training O
set O
. O

The O
retrieved O
instances O
are O
scored O
for O
relevance O
to O
the O
query O
. O

The O
most O
relevant O
training O
instant O
is O
used O
to O
assign O
a O
polarity O
and O
domain O
label O
to O
the O
new O
sentence O
. O

While O
the O
results O
on O
well O
- O
formed O
sentences O
are O
encouraging O
, O
the O
performance O
obtained O
on O
short O
texts O
like O
tweets O
demonstrate O
that O
more O
work O
is O
needed O
in O
this O
area O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
use O
of O
sampling O
, O
randomized O
algorithms O
, O
or O
training O
based O
on O
the O
unpredictable O
inputs O
of O
users O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
often O
leads O
to O
non O
- O
deterministic O
outputs O
. O

Evaluating O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
systems O
incorporating O
these O
methods O
can O
be O
challenging O
since O
each O
run O
may O
produce O
different O
effectiveness O
scores O
. O

Current O
IR O
evaluation O
techniques O
do O
not O
address O
this O
problem O
. O

Using O
the O
context O
of O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
as O
a O
case O
study O
for O
our O
investigation O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
solution O
based O
on O
multivariate O
linear O
modeling O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
approach O
provides O
a O
consistent O
and O
reliable O
method O
to O
compare O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
non O
- O
deterministic O
IR O
algorithms O
, O
and O
explain O
how O
statistics O
can O
safely O
be O
used O
to O
show O
that O
two O
IR O
algorithms O
have O
equivalent O
effectiveness O
. O

of O

P2P O

Retrieval O
( O

- O
IR O
) O
is O
a O
challenging O
and O
potentially O
very O
useful O
area O
of O
research O
. O

Its O
goal O
is O
to O
enable O
powerful O
, O

, O
massively O
distributed O
IR O
. O

A O
large O
fraction O
of O

is O
focused O
on O

. O

, O

feel O
that O

- O
IR O
needs O
to O
address O
the O
complicated O
combination O
of O
indexing O
structure O
and O
networking O
issues O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
I O
introduce O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
agent O
- O
based O
modeling O
in O
geospatial O
contexts O
. O

The O
novelty O
of O
the O
approach O
stems O
from O
introducing O
geospatial O
functionality O
as O
an O
exoskeletal O
wrapper O
around O
standard O
socio O
- O
communicative O
and O
goal O
- O
oriented O
agent O
- O
based O
AI O
. O

Operationally O
, O
I O
also O
introduce O
an O
integrated O
and O
symbiotic O
tight O
- O
coupling O
to O
motion O
capture O
and O
Geographic O
Information O
Systems O
, O
based O
on O
space O
- O
time O
Geographic O
Information O
Science O
. O

To O
prove O
the O
usefulness O
of O
the O
approach O
in O
simulation O
, O
I O
describe O
application O
of O
the O
model O
to O
a O
relatively O
well O
- O
understood O
( O
yet O
widely O
misrepresented O
) O
scenario O
involving O
crowd O
evacuation O
in O
constrained O
infrastructure O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
chapter O

study O
about O
methodology O
and O

to O
build O
ontologies O
and O
controlled O
vocabularies O
, O
compiled O

the O
analysis O
of O
a O

about O
methodologies O
for O
building O
ontologies O
and O
controlled O
vocabularies O
and O
the O
international O
standards O
for O
software O
engineering O
. O

theoretical O
and O

research O

was O
possible O
to O
build O
a O

overview O
which O
can O
help O

in O

of O

for O

The O
problem O
of O
private O
information O
retrieval O
with O
private O
side O
information O
( O
PIR O
- O
PSI O
) O
is O
recently O
introduced O
by O
Kadhe O
et O
al O
. O

In O
this O
problem O
, O
N O
replicated O
databases O
each O
store O
K O
messages O
, O
of O
which O
M O
are O
known O
to O
the O
user O
as O
side O
- O
information O
. O

The O
identity O
of O
these O
M O
messages O
is O
unknown O
to O
the O
databases O
. O

The O
user O
wishes O
to O
retrieve O
, O
as O
efficiently O
as O
possible O
, O
a O
new O
desired O
message O
without O
revealing O
any O
information O
about O
the O
joint O
indices O
of O
the O
desired O
and O
sideinformation O
messages O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
capacity O
of O
PIR O
- O
PSI O
is O
1 O
1 O
N O
1 O
N O
1 O
N O
1 O

Thus O
, O
the O
capacity O
of O
PIR O
- O
PSI O
with O
K O
messages O
, O
N O
databases O
and O
side O
- O
information O
of O
M O
messages O
is O
identical O
to O
the O
capacity O
of O
PIR O
with O
K O
M O
messages O
, O
N O
databases O
and O
no O
sideinformation O
, O
which O
was O
found O
previously O
by O
Sun O
and O
Jafar O
. O

The O
achievability O
and O
converse O
proofs O
are O
essentially O
inherited O
from O
the O
original O
work O
of O
Sun O
and O
Jafar O
. O

Comparative O
evaluation O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRSs O
) O
using O
publically O
available O
test O
collections O
has O
become O
an O
established O
practice O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O

By O
means O
of O
the O
popular O
Cranfield O
evaluation O
paradigm O
IR O
test O
collections O
enable O
researchers O
to O
compare O
new O
methods O
to O
existing O
approaches O
. O

An O
important O
area O
of O
IR O
research O
where O
this O
strategy O
has O
not O
been O
applied O
to O
date O
is O
Personalised O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
PIR O
which O
has O
generally O
relied O
on O
user O
- O
based O
evaluations O
. O

This O

describes O
a O
method O
that O
enables O
the O
creation O
of O

available O
extended O
test O
collections O
to O
allow O
repeatable O
laboratory O
- O
based O
evaluation O
of O

search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Kernel O
Canonical O
Correlation O
Analysis O
( O
KCCA O
) O
is O
a O
method O
of O
correlating O
linear O
relationship O
between O
two O
variables O
in O
a O
kernel O
defined O
feature O
space O
. O

A O
machine O
learning O
algorithm O
based O
on O
KCCA O
is O
studied O
for O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
apply O
the O
algorithm O
in O
Japanese O
– O
English O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
results O
are O
quite O
encouraging O
and O
are O
significantly O
better O
than O
those O
obtained O
by O
other O
state O
of O
the O
art O
methods O
. O

Computational O
complexity O
is O
an O
important O
issue O
when O
applying O
KCCA O
to O
large O
dataset O
as O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
experimentally O
evaluate O
several O
methods O
to O
alleviate O
the O
problem O
of O
applying O
KCCA O
to O
large O
datasets O
. O

We O
also O
investigate O
cross O
- O
language O
document O
classification O
using O
KCCA O
as O
well O
as O
other O
methods O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
it O
is O
feasible O
to O
use O
a O
classifier O
learned O
in O
one O
language O
to O
classify O
the O
documents O
in O
other O
languages O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Using O
linked O
data O
in O
real O
world O
applications O
is O
a O
hot O
topic O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
leveraged O
two O

in O
the O

of O

. O

BabelNet O
is O
used O
to O
automatically O
recognize O
and O
disambiguate O
concepts O
in O
a O
piece O
of O
unstructured O
text O
. O

After O
extracting O
all O
possible O
concepts O
, O
DBpedia O
is O
leveraged O
to O
reason O
about O
the O
type O
of O
each O
concept O
using O
SPARQL O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
deals O
with O
the O
easy O

to O
the O

, O

. O

A O

natural O
language O
queries O
asks O
for O
further O
information O
if O
necessary O
and O
produces O
an O

to O

. O

Most O

only O

. O

We O

Fast O

In O
Chinese O
the O
SVO O
( O
Subject O
- O
Verb O
- O
Object O
) O
construction O
is O
often O
appears O
in O
the O
query O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
SVO O
construction O
will O
be O
cut O
into O
several O
separate O
key O
words O
, O
if O
the O
traditional O
retrieval O
algorithm O
is O
used O
, O
it O
will O
degenerate O
to O
a O
normal O
Boolean O
Search O
, O
because O
the O
semantic O
meaning O
may O
be O
different O
when O
the O
order O
of O
the O
key O
words O
differs O
, O
thus O
the O
semantic O
implied O
in O
the O
SVO O
construction O
will O
not O
be O
exists O
, O
that O
is O
to O
say O
result O
of O
an O
text O
- O
retrieval O
algorithm O
will O
reflected O
by O
the O
order O
of O
the O
key O
words O
. O

For O
this O
question O
: O
taking O
the O
advantages O
of O
the O
structural O
features O
of O
forward O
and O
inverted O
index O
, O
the O
paper O
gives O
the O
definition O
of O
Query O
Step O
, O
Document O
Step O
, O
analyses O
their O
reflection O
on O
the O
retrieval O
, O
and O
proposed O
the O
pre O
- O
processing O
algorithm O
to O
form O
the O
new O
retrieval O
model O
based O
on O
VSM O
. O

Subsequently O
, O
The O
ontology O
and O
semantic O
web O
support O
was O
given O
, O
the O
procedure O
of O
translating O
user O
query O
into O
formal O
query O
for O
semantic O
search O
was O
also O
given O
in O
detail O
. O

of O
a O

- O
based O
cover O
song O
identification O
system O
which O
has O
been O

under O
an O

. O

The O

is O

the O

Lucene O

library O

-DOCSTART- O

BACKGROUND O
CISMeF O
is O
a O
French O
quality O
- O
controlled O
health O
gateway O
that O
uses O
the O
MeSH O
thesaurus O
. O

We O
introduced O
two O
new O
concepts O
, O
metaterms O
( O
medical O
specialty O
which O
has O
semantic O
links O
with O
one O
or O
more O
MeSH O
terms O
, O
subheadings O
and O
resource O
types O
) O
and O
resource O
types O
. O

OBJECTIVE O
Evaluate O
precision O
and O
recall O
of O
metaterms O
. O

METHODS O
We O
created O
16 O
pairs O
of O
queries O
. O

Each O
pair O
concerned O
the O
same O
topic O
, O
but O
one O
used O
metaterms O
and O
one O
MeSH O
terms O
. O

To O
assess O
precision O
, O
each O
document O
retrieved O
by O
the O
query O
was O
classified O
as O
irrelevant O
, O
partly O
relevant O
or O
fully O
relevant O
. O

The O
16 O
queries O
yielded O
943 O
documents O
for O
metaterm O
queries O
and O
139 O
for O
MeSH O
term O
queries O
. O

The O
recall O
of O
MeSH O
term O
queries O
was O
0.44 O
( O
compared O
to O
1 O
for O
metaterm O
queries O
) O
and O
the O
precision O
were O
identical O
for O
MeSH O
term O
and O
metaterm O
queries O
. O

Metaconcept O
such O
as O
CISMeF O
metaterms O
allows O
a O
better O
recall O
with O
a O
similar O
precision O
that O
MeSH O
terms O
in O
a O
quality O
controlled O
health O
gateway O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
method O
for O
recognizing O
such O
event O
causalities O
as O
“ O
smoke O
cigarettes O
die O
of O
lung O
cancer O
” O
using O
background O
knowledge O
taken O
from O
web O
texts O
as O
well O
as O
original O
sentences O
from O
which O
candidates O
for O
the O
causalities O
were O
extracted O
. O

We O
retrieve O
texts O
related O
to O
our O
event O
causality O
candidates O
from O
four O
billion O
web O
pages O
by O
three O
distinct O
methods O
, O
including O
a O
why O
- O
question O
answering O
system O
, O
and O
feed O
them O
to O
our O
multi O
- O
column O
convolutional O
neural O
networks O
. O

This O
allows O
us O
to O
identify O
the O
useful O
background O
knowledge O
scattered O
in O
web O
texts O
and O
effectively O
exploit O
the O
identified O
knowledge O
to O
recognize O
event O
causalities O
. O

We O
empirically O
show O
that O
the O
combination O
of O
our O
neural O
network O
architecture O
and O
background O
knowledge O
significantly O
improves O
average O
precision O
, O
while O
the O
previous O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
method O
gains O
just O
a O
small O
benefit O
from O
such O
background O
knowledge O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
our O
work O
is O
the O

language O

system O
for O

input O
and O

output O
. O

Overall O
, O

system O
consists O
of O
three O
phases O
: O
input O
analysis O
, O
information O
and O
knowledge O
management O
and O
output O
generation O
. O

is O

for O

old O
Mexican O

documents O
. O

In O
this O
paper O

designed O

of O

phases O
. O

Arabic O
, O
the O
mother O
tongue O
of O
over O
300 O
million O
people O
around O
the O
world O
, O
is O
known O
as O
one O
of O
the O
most O
difficult O
languages O
in O

processing O
( O

) O
in O

and O

, O

not O

and O

as O

engine O
. O

to O

ARABIRS O
( O

, O

will O
start O
with O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
goal O
of O
the O
FID O
/ O
LD O
Workshop O
on O
Linguistics O
and O
Information O
Science O
was O
to O

to O

that O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
latent O
class O
structure O
is O
modified O
by O
requiring O
the O
number O
of O
latent O
classes O
to O
be O
equal O
to O
the O
number O
of O
keywords O
. O

This O
modification O
changes O
the O
latent O
structure O
to O
one O
that O
consists O
of O
matrices O
that O
are O
both O
symmetric O
and O
positive O
definite O
, O
therefore O
making O
a O
8220;computer O
solution&#8221 O
; O
both O
possible O
and O
practical O
. O

The O
modified O
latent O
structure O
is O
derived O
, O
the O
numerical O
analysis O
considerations O
for O
a O
computer O
solution O
are O
presented O
, O
and O
an O
example O
illustrates O
the O
use O
of O
the O
latent O
class O
structure O
in O
both O
file O
organization O
and O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Many O
extensions O
to O
text O
- O
based O
, O
data O
- O
intensive O
knowledge O
management O
approaches O
, O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
or O
Data O
Mining O
, O
focus O
on O
integrating O
the O
impressive O
recent O
advances O
in O
language O
technology O
. O

For O
this O
, O
they O
need O
fast O
, O
robust O
parsers O
that O
deliver O
linguistic O
data O
which O
is O
meaningful O
for O
the O
subsequent O
processing O
stages O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
such O
a O
parsing O
system O
. O

Its O
output O
is O
a O
hierarchical O
structure O
of O
syntactic O
relations O
, O
functional O
dependency O
structures O
. O

Posted O
at O
the O
Zurich O
Open O
Repository O
and O
Archive O
, O
University O
of O
Zurich O
ZORA O
URL O
: O
https O
doi.org/10.5167/uzh-19099 O

Originally O
published O
at O
: O
Schneider O
, O
G O
( O
2003 O

and O
using O
trace O
- O
free O
functional O
dependencies O
from O
the O
penn O
treebank O
to O
reduce O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
language O
model O
, O
namely O
, O
a O
dependency O
structure O
language O
model O
, O
for O
information O
retrieval O
to O
compensate O
for O
the O
weakness O
of O
bigram O
and O
trigram O
language O
models O
. O

The O
dependency O
structure O
language O
model O
is O
based O
on O
the O
Chow O
Expansion O
theory O
and O
the O
dependency O
parse O
tree O
generated O
by O
a O
dependency O
parser O
. O

So O
, O
long O
- O
distance O
dependencies O
can O
be O
handled O
by O
the O
dependency O
structure O
language O
model O
. O

We O
carried O
out O
some O
experiments O
to O
verify O
the O
proposed O
model O
. O

In O
our O
experiments O
, O
the O
dependency O
structure O
model O
gives O
a O
better O
performance O
than O
recently O
proposed O
language O
models O
, O
and O
the O
dependency O
structure O
is O
more O
effective O
than O
bigram O
in O
language O
modeling O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

of O

of O

in O
information O
science O
. O
